Nah, Austin dies. He has to. Until I see him around, I will be reminded of that day when my dearest cried and felt guilty for something she shouldn't have. Rather, I would have been happy if she had 'accidentally' stabbed Valerie.
But well, thanks to that day, I now know whom I have to get rid of this time. And just like the previous three times, I know I won't get caught this time as well.
Just wait for me~
—-------**---------
[Third Person POV:]
Austin returned to his room after his chat with Valerie.
He took a bath and changed into more comfortable clothes.
Sebastian informed him that there was still some work left, which Austin needed to finish before the weekends.
Austin had to return to the capital as well, so there was very little time remaining.
'Hmm…let's see…' When he was with Valerie he received one notification from the system.
[Due to the host's recent action, two new progress meters have appeared that will directly affect the overall progress.]
[Combat: 12/100]
[Next reward at 20]
[Romance: 21/100]
[Ding!]
[You have been rewarded for crossing the first threshold in Romance!]
[Next reward at 40]
[Overall: 18.5/100]
[Next reward at 20]
…
Austin raised his brows and mentally tapped on the reward tab.
[Ding!]
[Heart felt chocolates: 1 box]
[Things whispered to every chocolate piece would be heard by the one who eats them.]
Austin smiled seeing the box in his hand.
This was brilliant and quite romantic, something that would have easily become quite popular back on Earth.
'Hmm…let's see…' He sat at the edge of the bed and picked the first one…and before he knew it, he was already done with the twentieth one.
Looking at each one of them marked with a hollow circle, Austin chuckled,
'Guess I am natural at this…'
Deciding to give this box to Valerie later, he went to his office first to finish the work.
….
*Click*
Austin was provided a separate office in the dorms since, as a Prince, he had to fulfill some duties as well.
The office wasn't too big, nor were any decorative items that could signify that royalty works here.
Just a working table, three shelves for books and documents, and a single couch nearby on which Sebastian was previously sat.
"Can I get some tea, Sebas?"
"Right away, sir." Sebastian went to prepare the beverage.
Austin sat on his usual seat and looked at his pending work.
Although Austin was quite intelligent and well-versed in management, he was given work related to sorting out names according to their wages and some other miscellaneous stuff.
Why? Because he was still perceived as an immature child.
"*Scoff*"
Seeing his young master scoffing while looking at the documents, Sebastian felt a little sad,
"Young master…I talked to Your Majesty, and he said you would be given the duty to arrange the security personnel in the near future."
"Security…for whom? Cattles?" Austin asked, his tone bleeding with mockery. And this mockery was aimed at no one but himself.
Well, Austin didn't feel much about this whole partial behavior but still wasting his time over sorting names was frustrating.
He was aware of who was behind this. The being who doesn't want Austin to get involved with the management or any important thing, and also to annoy Austin so when he returns home, he can make a joke of himself.
Austin heaved a sigh and silently began to finish the remaining lists one after another. However, now he didn't remain so elegant with his handwriting nor paid much attention. He was well aware that no one was gonna give a single F about these lists so why should he take it seriously?
It took three hours and two cups of tea before Austin was done with his work.
*CRACK*
Going on his toes, and his fingers interlaced, Austin stretched his body and heard the satisfying popping sound.
"Haah…" Exhaling a satisfied breath, he heard the butler softly chiding,
"It's inappropriate to do that, sir."
Austin shrugged, "Well, that's the most human thing."
Sebastian raised his brows, "Cracking bones?"
Austin smilingly shook his head, "No, being inappropriate."
—------**-------
A/N:- Should I increase the word count? Tell me…oh well, I will. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 14: Chapter 13- Dinner?
chapters.content:
Chapter 14: Chapter 13- Dinner?
It was around dinner time, and Austin had already told Valerie that he wouldn't be able to join her, given he had work.
However, since he finished early, he took the box of chocolates and was advancing towards the common hall.
Thanks to Sebastian he doesn't need to worry about proper arrangements of the documents since the butler said he would take care of it.
Austin was making his way through the corridor, advancing towards the main building where the common hall was located.
However, en route, he was stopped by a face which he didn't want to see,
"Austin!"
"Hey, Rhea." She was just leaving the main building and nearly crashed into him.
Naturally, until he could, he had to maintain a facade with everyone; that's why he didn't outright ignore her.
However, now that he exchanged greetings, he was about to leave when suddenly the pink head asked, "Chocolates? Can I take one?"
She extended her hand but Austin instantly retracted the box and told her, "It's a gift for Val." He smilingly said.
Rhea's eyes widened slowly, "Oh…I am so sorry. You know how much I love sweet things. Anyways, I am very happy to see you two getting along."
Austin glanced behind her before he smiled again and this time, in a warmer tone, he said, "Well it's all because of you that I was able to realize my feelings for her."
They exchanged a few more words before Austin took his leave.
Although he promised Valerie that he wouldn't talk to this girl…he had to.
'Haah, I will apologize to her.'
Reaching the dining hall, he looked around.
Everyone has their friends and lovers surrounding them. And the only person who sat in the corner, all alone and silent was the girl he was searching for.
Sometimes Austin felt bad for Valerie that no one was willing to talk to her….and until recently he also used to ignore her.
How lonely she must have felt to see the man she loves fawning over another woman and ignoring her.
…Austin used to even make fun of the fact that no one wanted to eat with Valerie.
With those thoughts, when Austin reached her, he rested the chocolate box on the table, and after sitting beside her, he hugged the girl.
"M-M-My lord…?" Valerie was shocked beyond belief as she felt herself being surrounded by a warmth that she dearly missed. However, this was too sudden!
The cold expression she previously wore melted completely as Austin embraced her close to him, feeling the guilt from his heart slowly receding, but it was still not enough.
"I have hurt you a lot, no?"
Valerie didn't know what had happened so suddenly, but hearing his voice, she knew he was thinking about their past.
Despite the embarrassment and shock, she rested her hands on his back and said,
"It's all okay now, Austin. I have already forgiven you."
Austin slowly parted away from her and told her, "If you forgive me so easily, then I will get the freedom to make more mistakes and just say a simple apology."
Valerie tilted her head adorably and asked, "Then…what should I do?"
Austin raised his brows mischievously before telling her, "Be angrier, sweetheart."
Valerie blushed hearing that, remembering she said something similar during the training.
She clutched his sleeve and told him, "I-It wasn't me…just my split personality….trust me, my lord."
Austin chuckled. The way her personality switches, he might have believed her lie.
"Here, "Offering her the box he said, "For you. There is a surprise in it."
Valerie curiously opened the box and found several heart-shaped chocolates resting inside.
"Go on, try one."
Valerie took the first one from the bottom left, and a bit on it, and instantly her eyes widened.
She heard his voice yet he wasn't speaking. His whisper reached her ears, almost like he was just right beside her.
A warm blush adorned her cheeks as she couldn't stop herself from smiling.
A smile that made Austin sigh in admiration. After a long day at work, this smile alone can vanish his weariness.
Valerie then closed the box and softly said, "I will have one every day."
"I expected much," Austin said with a smile before he asked, "Did you have dinner?"
Valerie nodded, "I was just about to finish."
Austin saw there were a few pieces of meat left—accurately chopped into cubes.
He picked her fork and was about to eat one, when suddenly Valerie said, "Ah…I used that…one."
Austin smiled at her, "Then the steak might taste a little sweet, I suppose?"
Valerie's face was a sight to gaze at after he said that.
The blush was so profound that she seemed on the verge of fainting.
And it wasn't only Austin but many others around them who were looking at Valerie with a surprised look.
"Is she the same strict girl who can even scold a Professor for their tardiness?" One of them asked.
"Don't know man…this version is completely different from what we see during classes…"
Whispers and murmurs were erupting from every corner since Valerie was not only the top student but a member of the student council. A disciplinary in charge, no less. And for her to behave so…maiden-ly was quite shocking.
Not so long after, they left the common hall and were headed towards the girl's dormitory.
They were walking slowly side by side, enjoying each others' company and the peaceful atmosphere.
While walking Austin suddenly remembered something and told her, "In six days, I will be leaving for the Capital…do you want to come with me?"
Naturally, Valerie was also invited to the party and she always goes there as the daughter of the Duke and Austin's fiancée.
Last year, they went separately, but not this year.
"I…would love to." Valerie did not have much expectations with the celebration but the journey back home surely would be sweet.
"And…have you planned on what you will give me on my birthday?"
Valerie has actually thought of gifting him a special dagger…however, she asked,
"Is there something my lord desires from me?"
Austin smiled upon hearing that and looked at Valerie with a tender expression.
They slowly came to a pause, and just as she thought he would tell her, Austin shook his head, "Not now, I will ask you that day."
Inching closer to her, he planted a soft kiss on her forehead and said, "Now go back and sleep. We have to wake up early tomorrow."
Valerie nodded with a smile never leaving her face before she turned around and began walking away.
Austin didn't walk away until he saw her room's lights turned on before he turned around and made his way back to the dormitory.
'Haah~I am sorry Val, but I can only ask for forgiveness as a gift, for what I am going to do….'
—-------**--------
A/N:- Okay, I love writing their interaction

chapters.title: Chapter 15: Chapter 14- Manipulation
chapters.content:
Chapter 15: Chapter 14- Manipulation
"Are you sure, master?" There was a frown on Sebastian's face when he asked that.
Austin was changing his clothes and getting ready for school.
Without looking at the man, he said, "Yes, Sebas. I can not be any more sure about this."
Sebastian thought for a moment before asking, "Do you have any proof that the student is actually planning something against you?"
Austin paused and then turned toward Sebastian.
With utter seriousness in his eyes, he told him, "If I am proven wrong, Sebas, then I will confess my deeds and leave this academy as a punishment."
Sebastian has nothing more to say. If his young master was absolute about something then it must be the case.
Austin slid his feet inside his shoes, and while he tied his laces, he told the older one, "In fifteen minutes, send Rudolph to my office."
"As you command, my lord."
….
Austin left his room and headed towards his office.
He doesn't have much work, and the classes start in two hours, so why is he going to his office rather than sharing the breakfast table with his fiancée?
Well, there was a definite reason.
The reason why Austin wanted Sebastian's loyalty to himself was because of this.
He needs to get rid of Parkinson before the psycho ends up hurting Valerie.
After ten or so minutes, someone knocked on the office door before Austin said,
"Come in." From the other side, the tall and broad black-haired man walked in.
"You called me?" Rudolph Sabretooth is the son of the Knight Commander and someone who has known Austin since the age of ten.
He is a good friend and someone who knows Austin's situation back home.
They used to spar in the past, but Rudolph easily became far too strong for Austin to match him in a battle.
Gesturing toward the couch, Austin said, "Sit."
Rudolph remained standing and said, "Just tell me quickly, I have someone to meet."
Austin smiled, "Must be Rhea. You finally got a worthy opponent to spar against."
Rudolph smirked, "Yup~she is the best."
Austin warmly smiled, "It fills my heart with joy to see that finally, you got yourself a real friend here. Back then, everyone used to ignore you but Rhea…she is different."
The smile on Rudolph's face extended; happy to hear someone praising the woman he adores.
"Yes, that she is. The perfect kind of woman which anyone could desire."
For a moment, Austin's face turned into a scowl but he quickly improved his expression and said, "You must be told to return to the Capital, right?"
Rudolph's expression turned sour, "Yeah…" He was told by his father to return and join the celebration. However, he didn't want to go and leave Rhea here with Parkinson and Morkel.
Austin leaned forward and suggested, "How about I make up some excuse in your stead and explain things to your father?"
Rudolph's eyes brightened, "Really? You will do that?"
"Of course, I can for my friend. Just don't send him any letter for the time being, okay?"
"If you can get me permission to stay back then anything for you!" The evident happiness on his face showed how much he was attached to Rhea and that even a few days of separation was too much for him.
Rudolph was then about to take his leave with a huge smile on his face when suddenly, Austin said,
"Uh-can you send Parkinson to the office?"
"Sure, buddy!" Rudolph turned around and left soon after.
Austin's smile immediately disappeared as he heaved a sigh and drank a few mouthfuls of water.
[Ding!]
[A new index has appeared!]
[Trickery: 5/100]
[Next reward at 10]
…
Now that puts a genuine smile on his face.
*Knock*
However, soon he regained his composure and after wearing his reading glasses he said,
"Come in." Austin began to pretend that he was working as he commanded.
From the other side, the long green-haired teenager walked in.
The lanky 5'10 looked displeased even though nothing Austin had spoken until now. His sharp grey eyes bore on Austin as he said,
"What do you want?" He was just about to go and have breakfast with Rhea when suddenly the asswipe called him.
Austin didn't remove his eyes from the document before he sternly spoke, "I have invited you here to warn you."
Parkinson frowned, a scowl appearing on his face, "Warn? About what?"
Austin slowly raised his eyes from the document and looked at him.
With his upturned gaze fixed on the guy he said,
"You have been wandering around the girl's dorm a lot. I saw you last night."
Parkinson's eyes widened in agitation. His fist clenched, "You….!!!"
"I am warning you, Parkinson, stop stalking Rhea or I will-"
"Or you will what?! Complain to the headmaster or your Papa?! Who are you gonna tell, you asshole! I knew it! You were just pretending to be all chummy with Valerie! You are still after my Rhea!"
His aura flared; the table and the shelves began to shake under his magical presence. The blood lust that the boy contained within was making it a bit stuffy inside the office.
Austin retained his calm, even though he knew with his current strength he couldn't defeat the guy.
However, he didn't show even a bit of apprehension and after redirecting his gaze back to the papers, he said,
"Think whatever you want. Just stop before-"
"To hell with your warning, asshole!" Parkinson suddenly opened the door, startling the ones passing by.
"Don't ever call me here or I am so gonna kill you!"
*SLAM*
Slamming the door, Parkinson walked away while seething.
Once the door was closed, a smirk extended his lips.
"Perfect….these guys are so easy to manipulate…"
Austin never saw anyone out of the girl's dormitory given Parkinson excels in assassination skills. However, he had the knowledge of the game so he used it here.
[Ding!]
[The host has reached the first threshold in Trickery!]
[Trickery: 10/100]
Austin let out a small chuckle as he leaned back in his seat, and rested his feet on the table,
"Now Parkinson, dance for me."
—--------**---------
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 16: Chapter 15- Punish me~
chapters.content:
Chapter 16: Chapter 15- Punish me~
*CLANG*
Hearing Parkinson slamming the tray on the table, Rhea was startled as she asked, "What happened? Why do you look displeased?"
Hearing her voice, it was like all his agitation melted away as Parkinson slowly sat down and shook his head, "Just some noisy pest. Don't worry about that."
If there was something good about this morning, then it was the fact that Rhea was currently alone, and they could have their time at the breakfast table.
However, just as Parkinson was about to ask if she wanted to taste the pastry he brought, she suddenly got up.
"Where are you going?" Her food was still half finished, which meant she was in a rush.
Rhea apologetically told him, "I have to submit the class report to the teacher before homeroom. Thankfully, Austin is helping me out this time."
Parkinson's eyes widened, "Wait! Are you taking his help? Why?" You could have asked me—he held from uttering the last part, fearing he might let out his possessiveness appear in his voice.
Rhea shrugged, "His management skills and his handwriting are the best in the class, that's why. Okay then."
Seeing Rhea walking away, the glass in Parkinson's hand began to crack, and not so long after, the glass broke into small fragments as Parkinson stared at the entrance of the common hall with his eyes turning blood red.
"Austin...Austin…..Austin…..that fucker….why can't he just…." He was sheathing right now, and whoever saw him decided to take a detour to stay away from the man.
If Morkel had been around, then he surely would have somehow calmed him down. However, he was sent to the nearby town for some reason.
Every second of his life is becoming harder for Parkinson to tolerate that piece of trash named Austin.
His anger seemed now more directed at the Prince rather than Valerie.
'I am gonna kill him…I cannot….no longer….hahahahah!!' Everyone watched in horror as Parkinson began to laugh hysterically.
—------**--------
Inside the classroom, Rhea could be seen sitting in the front seat, doing her work.
She handed half of the list to Austin, and she would have chosen to sit beside him for efficient work. However, when she saw the purple-haired lady sitting in the back, Rhea chose to sit in the front.
Austin, meanwhile, was writing the report of every student about their attendance in class and during practical lessons, while Valerie handed him the profile according to the name.
Seeing her Lord's hand moving so elegantly on the paper, drawing every letter like an artist creating art, she couldn't help but sigh in admiration.
His fingers are well shaped and his nails always remain finely trimmed. In all her life, she has never met a man who takes care of his appearance so well.
"Staring at me so hard, don't tell me you fell for me." Hearing his voice she immediately moved her gaze away, realizing how she must be making him uncomfortable.
Austin smiled at her as he rested his cheek in his hand, and looked at the girl, "Tell me, Val, aren't you already tired of looking at the same face so many times?"
Her embarrassment soon subdued as she looked at her Lord and slowly shook her head,
"Getting tired while looking at you is simply not possible, my lord. I can sit here and watch you for days."
Austin chuckled—really, when she is honest, she is dangerous for his heart.
Tilting his head a little, he asked, "I have noticed you often call me 'Lord' and hesitate to call me by my name. Why is that?"
Although there is a custom of ladies of royal houses to address their husband as 'Lord,' Valerie isn't married to him, and Austin would never force her to stick to the traditions.
However ..it's a fact that he feels his heart fluttering whenever she softly calls him 'My lord'.
Valerie was shy about confessing it, but as he asked previously, she didn't want to hide things and let it become a source of misunderstanding between them.
"It's the…admiration I have for you that makes me feel a little reluctant to call you by your name."
Austin raised his brows before drawing closer to her and whispering, "Then how about trying something else? Dear or Honey for example?"
Valerie's eyes slowly widened, her cheeks reminiscent of the setting sun as she lowered her eyes and parted her lips,
"....t-that….I-I need…s-some…time to prepare…."
Austin happily chuckled, as he wrapped his arm around her shoulder and hugged the shy fluff ball of cuteness.
"Valerie, oh Valerie. How adorable can you be?"
Through morning flirting, they finally finished working on the reports and Austin gave it to Rhea, who seemed to be blushing slightly when she received the papers.
"Everything alright?" Austin asked, thinking that she might have a fever.
However, her response made her realize, "You know I am a superhuman too, right…?"
"I guess yeah, that's why you are in this academy?" He plainly stated.
The pink head grumbled before taking the papers from him and saying, "Forget it…you are not someone I can predict anymore."
Austin shrugged as he turned around and headed back to his seat.
Seeing Valerie standing near the desk, he asked, "Can't you just sit beside me?" Although there were rules that one had to sit on the seat assigned to them at the beginning of the semester, Austin really doesn't want to part ways with his fiancée.
Valerie looked troubled. As much as she sticks to rules and regulations most of the time, she also wants to share the seat with her beloved.
Suddenly she had a thought before she assured him, "I will talk to the teacher."
"Hmm? How will you manage?"
Valerie looked hesitant as she said, "As the disciplinarian in charge, I have the right to keep a close eye on the problem child."
Austin mischievously smiled, "So am I now a problem child, eh?"
"N-No…I…don't…"
Austin held her hand and pulled her closer. Wrapping his hand around her slender waist he muttered, "Well, true. For you, I can be quite problematic from time to time. And as a disciplinary officer, I hope you can punish me from time to time."
After that, Valerie spent a whole period in a daze.
—-------**---------
A/N:- Thanks for reading. Save the book in your library.

chapters.title: Chapter 17: Chapter 16- Out of control(1)
chapters.content:
Chapter 17: Chapter 16- Out of control(1)
The academy focused both on the academic as well as physical growth of the students.
Those who graduate from the central academy of the nation walk towards a brighter future, and there is a reason for it.
The academy ensures to identify and polish the talent of each student while providing a basic knowledge in every field. So, if in the future, the student fails to excel in the field they always had an interest in, they can at least look for another job with the knowledge they received.
Just like how Austin was more suited for management jobs, someone who has a quality of a leader and a manager. However, he joined the academy with the intention of becoming a well-versed warrior who can continue the legacy of his ancestors.
Although people have already assumed that Austin can never become the next king—given how brilliant the eldest one was—Austin always aimed to become the strongest so he could make his parents regret choosing his elder brother over Austin.
Well, the current Austin has a different goal in his mind.
The Demon King.
Yeah, the same old Demon king also resides in this world. And to defeat that being, Austin has to travel a very long path.
In the game, Rhea was able to reach that level where she could use her wits and plot armor to defeat the King. However, if talking about raw power and experience, the Demon King far dominated the Protagonist.
The Demon King has four Generals—The Parasite Chief, the Succubus Queen, the Orc Lord, and the Elven General.
After defeating one of the four generals, Valerie later becomes the Parasite Chief so she can take revenge on Rhea and get her beloved back.
Rhea failed to defeat the Parasite Chief in their first exchange, so she, along with her harem members, made up a plan.
Austin was used to lure Valerie into a trap where Rhea stabs her from behind. However, since the Parasite Chief had two hearts, Austin stabs the other one.
And the most saddening part…when Austin raises his weapon against Valerie she doesn't even try to dodge. With a smile, she embraced whatever her beloved had to offer.
He still remembers the last word she said before life faded from her eyes,
'I-If I knew… the-that my death can make you happy ....then I would have stabbed myself a long time ago…to see that smile…'
That line was etched in his memories, and it was the reason why Austin always felt so much pity and sadness whenever he faced his fiancée.
*CLANG*
Feeling the absence of a dagger from his hand, Austin turned towards Valerie and found her looking back at him worryingly.
"Are you hurt? Show me your hand." She inched closer to him and looked at his hand.
There was a red glaring mark down his index finger, showing that the strike, indeed, was quite difficult for him to withstand.
Valerie inwardly reprimanded herself for getting engrossed in the spar so much that she ended up hurting her Lord.
"Valerie, it doesn't hurt." Austin assured her, "I was not paying attention, sorry about that." He confessed.
They were in the middle of a spar, and Austin got so completely occupied by his thoughts that he never saw that strike and ended up losing his weapon.
Valerie shook her head, "No, Austin, it was my fault. You were blocking so well that I…anyway, let's go to the medic."
Austin heaved a sigh and didn't say anything after that. However, before they could have turned around to leave, someone called out,
"I propose a duel against you, Austin."
The other students, along with the instructor, turned to look at the teenager who stated that.
Without even looking at Austin could tell who this person was.
"...Parkinson." Austin heaved a sigh, "Why don't you find someone of your battle style to fight against? I am clearly not in your league."
Austin plainly stated that, making Parkinson smirk. There were other students as well who snickered upon hearing that.
However, it didn't affect the Prince at all. He wasn't ashamed to accept his current self. However, he would regard himself as a failure if he stopped improving.
"Don't worry, I will put a handicap on myself and won't use my Soul Shard. Of course, you can."
Valerie frowned, "Austin is injured and can't fight right now."
Parkinson smirked, and while ignoring the girl he mocked the blond Prince, "What happened, Austin? Have you lost your pride and dignity and just decided to hide behind your fiancée? I never thought you would become this pathetic."
Rhea, who was not so far away from them, frowned and was about to step forward when suddenly Rudolph held her shoulder and stopped her.
"Don't, Rhea. It's a matter between two men and you or I don't have the right to interfere."
Rhea was annoyed by such principles; however, until the instructor was here, she decided not to take things into her own hands.
'Damn it, Park…why are you behaving like a prick all of a sudden?'
Back in the middle of all this drama, the instructor warned, "Watch your words, Parkinson."
The said boy just shrugged, "I just didn't mind decency while speaking but what I said is true, no? Austin only knows how to hide behind-"
"Okay, stop. I don't like that potty mouth calling out Val's name." Austin said as he stepped forward.
A few people chuckled hearing that while Parkinson snarled, "So you decided to be a man today?"
Austin heaved a weary sigh, "How much can you yap, Parkinson? Let's just get started man."
Parkinson scowled before he went towards the shelf to pick a weapon.
Meanwhile, Valerie stepped forward and worriedly asked, "My lord…is this really okay?"
Austin fondly smiled at her and said, "I don't care what the world says, love. Until you have confidence in me, I know I can defeat anyone. Well, not defeat but surely I can push beyond my limits."
Valerie's shoulders relaxed upon hearing that.
Very shyly, she held his hand and said, "I will be cheering for you."
Austin confidently smiled and told her, "That's all I need."
—----*-----
A/N:- Yeah, humiliate him. I hope you all are enjoying the novel so far.

chapters.title: Chapter 18: Chapter 17- Out of control(2)
chapters.content:
Chapter 18: Chapter 17- Out of control(2)
The gym was silent, save for the sharp clash of blades. Everyone was intently watching the spectacle unfolding before them.
Parkinson moved like a shadow, his wooden sword slicing through the air with a whistle. Austin barely deflected it with his soul-shard, sparks flaring as the weapons collided. Sweat ran down his brow, his feet sliding back from the sheer force of Parkinson's attack.
"Too slow, Austin!" Parkinson taunted, darting in low. The wooden blade struck Austin's thigh with a crack, making him stumble.
A ripple of murmurs echoed from their classmates, who leaned closer, their eyes wide with awe and anticipation.
Parkinson didn't let up. He spun on his heel, his sword aiming for Austin's ribs. The blow grazed him, drawing a grunt of pain. Parkinson grinned, relentlessly, his strikes blurring together in a flurry of arcs and thrusts. Austin ducked, sidestepped, and blocked, but each movement cost him ground.
"He is getting dominated. Parkinson is in the top five of the first year, and Austin..."
"Austin was ranked in the bottom five in the practical assessment."
"He is too predictable and slow on his feet." Comments like these continued to flow toward the arena, where Austin had been getting overwhelmed for the past two minutes.
Valerie was clenching her fist with enough force to turn her knuckles white. Seeing her Lord getting harmed was not something she could ever enjoy. Her heart bled, and her mind was filled with agitation toward Parkinson.
However, she chose to believe in her beloved and silently watched the battle,
'You can do this...'
"What's wrong? Out of tricks already?" Parkinson sneered, stepping forward with another sweeping strike.
Austin's mind raced. He wasn't fast enough to match Parkinson's speed, but speed wasn't the only weapon in a fight.
As Parkinson's wooden sword came down again, Austin sidestepped sharply, letting the blade skim past him. With a flick of his wrist, one dagger flew from his hand, spinning toward the ground near Parkinson's feet.
The clatter of metal drew Parkinson's eyes for a fraction of a second. That was all Austin needed.
He surged forward, slamming his shoulder into Parkinson's chest. The impact sent the faster fighter staggering back, his footing wobbly from the distraction. Austin's second dagger flashed, nicking Parkinson's arm with a shallow cut.
"Agh!" Parkinson gritted his teeth; he didn't think Austin would ever let go of Soul Shard, knowing that the idiot would lose his connection with his Shard once it was released from the hold.
"Way to go, Austin!"
Suddenly, a cheer from the audience erupted, and that made Parkinson's eyes widen.
He couldn't believe that no one....but...Rhea cheered for him.
The slight distraction was all Austin needed as he shot forward, his fist cocked, and the teenager aimed to hit the boy in the chest.
**DHAK**
However, something unexpected occurred and Parkinson held his fist right before it could have made contact with its target.
Parkinson's grip tightened around Austin's fist like a vice, his knuckles white with pressure. His eyes, sharp and furious, locked onto Austin's with an intensity that made the room fall silent.
"You think you can win this?" Parkinson hissed, his voice low but filled with menace. He shoved Austin back with a force that sent him stumbling. Without hesitation, Parkinson closed the gap, his wooden sword forgotten on the floor.
Before Austin could steady himself, Parkinson's palm slammed into his chest, driving him backward. The impact knocked the wind out of him, and he barely had time to raise his daggers before Parkinson was on him again.
"You stole her from me!" Parkinson roared, his movements faster and more brutal now, fueled by frustration and humiliation.
A sharp kick caught Austin in the side, sending him crashing to the floor. He rolled quickly, trying to recover, but Parkinson was relentless. A downward strike with his palm connected with Austin's shoulder, pinning him to the ground.
The crowd winced as the sound of the impact echoed through the gym. Parkinson's expression was a mix of fury and something darker—a need to reassert his dominance. He grabbed Austin by the collar, lifting him slightly off the floor.
"You don't deserve to fight me!" he spat, glaring furiously at his opponent.
Austin, being held by the person who went back on his words for not using Aura, chuckled.
Under everyone's astonished gazes the Soul Shard of Austin began to levitate as the owner of the daggers remained tightly held by Parkinson.
"You don't deserve to live! You are nothing but a piece of trash wh-"
"Parkinson, watch out!"
Someone from the crowd shouted, alerting the green-haired before he spun on his feet and barely caught the dagger by his hand.
**SHLINK**
The momentum of the blade caused his hand to bleed; however, Parkinson fueled his body with enough Aura to withstand the impact.
"Such a cheap tri-khuk!"
Suddenly a kick was delivered to his ribs, making Parkinson wince. Turning around, Parkinson found his eyes widening.
In a blur of motion, Austin's aura flared, a faint glow igniting around his body. His muscles tensed, his form becoming even more solid and powerful.
The same person who can barely use his Soul Shard was now utilizing his aura to strengthen his body?!
"How is that even possible?!"
"I heard he was getting trained by the best...but this is too sudden!"
Even Valerie was amazed since her Lord wasn't able to use his Aura for anything other than utilizing it to summon his Soul Shard.
Amidst the growing curiosity and tension, Austin threw his shoulder into Parkinson's chest, the impact causing the faster fighter to stagger back, his footing momentarily compromised. Parkinson grunted, trying to regain control, but Austin was already closing the distance, moving with fluidity and precision.
Austin's foot snapped upward, catching Parkinson in the midsection with a devastating knee strike, the force amplified by his aura. The wind was knocked from Parkinson's lungs, and he doubled over, gasping for air. Before he could react, Austin surged forward, locking his arms around Parkinson's waist in a powerful clinch.
The crowd watched in stunned silence as Austin used his aura to strengthen his body, lifting Parkinson off his feet with ease. He slammed Parkinson to the mat with an earth-shaking thud, the crowd wincing at the brutal impact.
"What kind of brute fighting style is that?" Even the instructor was amazed.
Without missing a beat, Austin moved like a seasoned fighter. He mounted Parkinson, straddling him with perfect control. His fists rained down in rapid succession, each punch laced with the power of his aura.
Parkinson tried to cover his face, but Austin was relentless. A jab to the jaw, then an elbow to the temple. Each strike pushed Parkinson further into disarray.
Austin didn't slow down. His fists turned into a blur, the blows landing with brutal efficiency. Each punch caused the blood of his enemy to spurt.
Parkinson's face was slowly changing as Austin continued to charge like a restless bull.
Parkinson's attempts to block and counter were futile against the onslaught.
Austin had him trapped. With a roar of frustration, Parkinson tried to push Austin off, but Austin was too fast, too strong. He wrapped one hand around Parkinson's neck in a tight chokehold, cutting off his air supply. The green-haired fighter struggled, his hands clawing at Austin's arm, but his movements grew weaker as the pressure increased.
However, before Austin could continue, someone pushed him away from Parkinson—allowing Parkinson to choke out-breath.
Everyone watched in awe and admiration how Austin shifted the tides of the battle in an instant and completely overwhelmed Parkinson.
Surely, the green-haired wasn't using his strongest weapon, his Shard, but still, in close combat, Austin showed his dominance.
Standing at one side with his hands resting on his waist, Austin couldn't help but mutter,
'Who knew three years of MMA training would turn out to be helpful someday....'
----------**---------
A/N:- Now, he is so gonna get out of control. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 19: Chapter 18- I am proud of you
chapters.content:
Chapter 19: Chapter 18- I am proud of you
Austin was taken to the infirmary after the battle since he was gravely injured during the battle.
Naturally, the same could be said about Parkinson.
Austin had been in a slight daze since the moment he received a few notifications from the system. And he vaguely remembers whatever happened after that.
Inside the infirmary, the instructor told him to rest there for the time being until the nurse allowed him to return back to the room.
"Ou!" He winced as the nurse applied medicine to his wounds. It stings!
The nurse huffed, "You kids don't know restraints even while sparring."
Austin chuckled, "Blame my opponent for going so wild."
The nurse frowned, "I heard what happened. Why didn't you back out?"
Austin heaved a sigh, "Having the capability to defeat the opponent yet surrendering? Quite unbecoming of a warrior I would have been."
The nurse didn't say anything after that and continued to patch up his wounds.
It was rare for Austin to get injured this much. He generally heals himself in his office since he doesn't incur more than a wound or a shallow cut, during training.
"Get up….I need to remove your shirt." There were some wounds on his torso and back, which she needed to clean before applying bandages.
Austin was about to get up when suddenly someone interrupted, "Let me take care of him."
The nurse turned around and raised her brows seeing a frowning Valerie standing there.
"You can manage it, right?" The nurse asked as she got up from the seat.
Valerie nodded before the older one walked away—heading towards the patient which needed much more medical attention at the moment.
Valerie has seen several wounded persons in the past—given she has gone on a few excursions with the battalions to get some field experience.
She has been severely wounded multiple times in the past as well, during training and hunting. However, none of those wounds ever made her this shaken up as she was at the moment.
Her hands trembled when she unbuttoned his shirt and looked at his wounds.
"Hey…I am fine, you know." Seeing her shed tears, Austin assured her.
Valerie wordlessly picked the wet clothes
before bringing it near the slit at his waist.
She softly cleaned the blood before taking the cotton pad and applying it to his injury.
"Val…" Austin held her hand and made her look at him, "Will you say something? More than my injuries, I am more troubled about you now."
He cupped her cheek and saw the girl closing her eyes and weeping in silence.
She nestled her face in his warm hand, allowing her aggressively beating heart to attain some much-needed peace.
"You do know that I will continue to get injured in the future, right? After all, I want to become stronger…so I can stand beside you." Austin told her and someone who encouraged her Lord to participate in the tournament, Valerie knew he surely would get injured while trying to develop his skills.
However…at that time she didn't think she would feel so much grief seeing him like this.
"...I know…and I apologize for behaving so unreasonably, my lord. However, I just can't…seeing you like this…makes me…"
Austin pulled her to sit beside him and wrapped the lady in his arms.
It might be the first time that someone cried for him over some injuries. In his previous life, his parents never cared about him enough to get worried over his pain, and even in this life, Austin was awarded with some irresponsible parents.
So yes, Valerie was his first.
"You know Val…during my battle, there came a time when I thought I should give up," He confessed,
"However, when I remembered that my fiancée was watching me…I decided that I can't have her see my lame side."
Valerie couldn't stop herself from giving a soft chuckle even while she was weeping, "You won't have looked lame even if you have faced defeat."
"Yeah, but I wanted to impress you. So tell me, Val…" Holding her shoulders he looked her in the eyes, and asked,
"Are you proud of me?"
Valerie fondly smiled, feeling a sudden intimacy with her Lord when he asked that.
She placed her hand over his, squeezing it gently as if to reassure herself as much as him before she honestly answered,
"Yes, Austin, I am proud of you."
—-------**-------
After things calmed down and Valerie finished applying medicine she went to bring something to drink.
Left alone, Austin checked the notifications which the system sent during the battle,
[Ding!]
[A new index has appeared!]
[Durability: 11/100]
[Ding!]
[Upon reaching the first tier, the Host is awarded with the skill 'Adapt'!]
[Adapt: Allows the host to learn and copy the ability of their opponent for a short duration!]
[Time limit: 3 minutes]
…
Austin heaved a sigh. Now he understood what happened back then.
The reason he suddenly was able to utilize the same technique as Parkinson and strengthen his body using Aura was that the system activated 'Adapt.'
'Good timing, buddy.'
He would need to ask more about that skill, which sounded extremely useful, but for now, he rested back and thought about Parkinson.
During the battle, Rhea cheered for him, which wasn't in the plan, but she did. Considering she was displeased by Parkinson's demand to spar against Austin and how the Protagonist mutually supports all the people she considers her friends, it wasn't unnatural for her to cheer for him.
After all, if she cheered for Austin then she came to stop him as well, when Austin was going out of control.
Parkinson lost his cool mid-battle and swore to kill him…and that was extremely helpful for Austin.
'You have dug the perfect hole for yourself, Parkinson…now I just need to give a slight push, and you are out of the game.'
—-------**-------
A/N:- Thanks for reading. Drop a comment and add a review. People have stopped saving the book!!!

chapters.title: Chapter 20: Chapter 19- Two-faced?
chapters.content:
Chapter 20: Chapter 19- Two-faced?
Rhea was troubled about several things these days.
After the incident with Valerie, several things changed in her life.
It was going well. Until that day…her friends were close to her. Her teachers were fond of her. And most of all, her friends—Austin, Adolf, and Parkinson respected each other quite well.
However, after that incident when Austin took Valerie's side—which was the correct thing to do—Parkinson has been behaving strangely lately.
He always seemed to be antagonizing someone…or to be more accurate, his scorn seemed to be directed at Austin.
She was aware that he deeply cared about her; however, blaming someone who took the right call and cleared the misunderstanding ... yeah, Parkinson was wrong there.
And then there was Austin.
Although she couldn't say anything in regard to his changed behavior towards her, it felt strange.
She…didn't know how to express it.
When he decided to stop eating with them or when it was he refused to give her something she wanted.
By no means was she a demanding girl who wanted to attain whatever she desired. However, that day when he pulled away that chocolate box…Rhea was slightly hurt.
And then…his sudden intimacy with Valerie. In the classroom and before the battle…when he pulled Valerie closer and whispered things…it made her feel that either he was pretending to be this close to her, or he might be actually—no, that can't be possible
'No one can fall for someone in just a day after ignoring them for a year…' Rhea assumed that Austin was playing with Valarie's heart for his selfish interest.
But why? And what could force the Prince to take such a cheap route?
She didn't know…and didn't want to focus on it.
She first needed to take care of Parkinson.
Entering the infirmary she was met by the worried look of the nurse.
Rhea frowned, "What happened?"
The nurse was startled to see her all of a sudden, however, her eyes soon said 'Perfect timing!',
"Tell me, Rhea, have you seen Parkinson?"
Rhea frowned, "He is not here?"
The nurse's face looked pale, as she shook her head, "No…his bed is empty."
Rhea heaved a sigh and rested her hands on her shoulders to calm down the lady, "Relax, Hilary. Parkinson always carries several potions and he doesn't like to sleep anywhere other than his bed…he must have gone back to his room."
The nurse looked evidently calmer as she asked, "Can you do me a favor and check on him?"
Rhea nodded before she glanced at the bed where Austin rested…however, he wasn't there anymore.
'Valerie must have taken him away…'
Wordlessly she took written permission from the nurse before heading toward the dormitory
Showing permission from the nurse to the warden, she heard him saying, "Cover your head and don't take too long."
Rhea nodded as she used her shawl to cover her head and walked inside the building.
She has come here twice before, but the first time to meet a guy.
Although she assured the nurse, Rhea was herself quite anxious about Parkinson.
Hurriedly ascending to the first floor she beelined towards Parkinson's room.
She was afraid of being seen by someone and being called things that no girl desired to be regarded as.
*Knock*
She waited for a minute, before,
*Knock* *Knock*
This time she didn't have to wait as the door slowly parted from the inside, and a grim face popped out.
Parkinson was expecting Morkel to be there, however, seeing Rhea, he was startled.
"Y-You…"
"Yes, it's me. Now, let me in?" She didn't want to stand here and get spotted so she suggested.
Parkinson nodded hurriedly but then he stopped and told her nervously, "You can't come in. Tell me right here."
Rhea frowned, "What is it with you? Is there someone inside you don't want me to see?"
Parkinson looked mildly irritated as he asked, "Can't you just finish what you came for and leave? Your presence is only going to cause rumors if people see you."
Now Rhea was annoyed as well, as she said, "I was worried for you, so I came to check up on you, and you are giving me that attitude?"
Parkinson's lips curled in a mocking smile as he said, "After cheering for Austin when he was beating me into a pulp, you came here to see if I am doing good? When did you become such a two-faced person, Rhea?"
Rhea's brows knitted in a frown as she scowled, "I was cheering for you as well, Parkinson. It's just that you were so obstinate in thinking that I am against you that you never heard me."
Parkinson snickered, "You won't believe it when I say this, but Rhea, my eyes and ears always remain devoted to you. So you think I wouldn't have noticed if you were really happy when I was on the dominating side?"
Rhea was so angry at that that she wanted to laugh, "First you chose to fight against someone who clearly was weaker than you, then you showed such brutality which is not befitting for someone to showcase during a spar, and you believe I should be proud of you because of that?"
"No one is asking for your validation, Rhea. So shut the crap and scram." He spoke with a blooming smile.
Rhea clenched her fist, her teeth grinding. Her eyes turned wet, which startled Parkinson, given he had seldom seen her cry. However, before he could have approached her, she raised her hand to stop him and muttered, "Your recent behavior is making me wonder whether I ever knew you."
Saying so, she turned on her heels and walked away while wiping her eyes.
Parkinson's hand remained raised for a long time, watching her back until it disappeared from the corner of the gallery.
Soon he clenched his hand into a fist, as through his gritted teeth, he muttered,
'It's all because of that damn dog!'
Slamming the door behind him, Parkinson returned to his room.
Unbeknownst to him, that night, a person from the infirmary disappeared.
—------**-------
A/N:- Thanks for reading. A single cheer it all took.

chapters.title: Chapter 21: Chapter 20- Caught(1)
chapters.content:
Chapter 21: Chapter 20- Caught(1)
The next day at school, Parkinson was sitting in his seat silently, his aura explicitly telling people to stay away from him.
Rudolph as well, didn't approach him. Although he didn't possess common sense as others, he knew the reason behind his gloominess.
He heard from Rhea what happened last night when she went to check on him.
Rudolph was displeased at how he behaved, however, Rhea told him to not talk about it to anyone and especially Parkinson. She said the green-haired needed some time alone.
The class instantly quieted down when suddenly a certain violet-haired girl walked inside, her steps remained a little hurried but elegant.
She had a frown on her face, and her current demeanor made people even more frightened than they were of Parkinson's.
Her feet stopped only once she was in front of Rudolph before she asked, "Did you meet Austin in the morning?"
Rudolph frowned before shaking his head, "Of course not. He must be resting in his room so he didn't invite me to his office as well."
Valerie's frown deepened, and unlike what others thought, she didn't go to sit in her seat but rather made her way out of the class.
Rhea also got up from her seat and followed Valerie—forgetting all her reservations towards the girl, she asked,
"What happened?"
Valerie ignored her and continued to move toward the teacher's building.
Rhea was not annoyed—she was accustomed to it—and silently followed the girl until they reached the staff room.
*Knock*
Every teacher, those who were preparing to leave for their classes and those who were preparing study materials, all turned toward the violette and shivered.
Among them was a senior Professor who stepped forward and asked, "Student Valerie? Is everything alright?"
It was rare for her to be seen anywhere around during the lecture hour.
Valerie, spoke in a grave tone, "Student Austin is nowhere to be found. I talked to his butler and he isn't in his room and not anywhere in the school."
Rhea's eyes widened, "Didn't he return to the room with you."
Valerie felt annoyed because of her nonsensical questions, "Do you think I will enter the dormitory?"
Rhea sealed her lips, feeling a little embarrassed now.
The teacher frowned; unless it had been serious, she wouldn't have come here.
"Okay, I will go and search the dormitory. Meanwhile, go and look for him in the gymnasium."
Valerie nodded and instantly dashed away.
The Professor told Rhea to look for him in the cafeteria while he asked another teacher to go and look in the bathrooms.
Instantly more than ten people were looking for him.
Not only was Austin a student of the Academy, but he was the Prince of the country as well. Although noble status doesn't matter when they are within the academy, they all know the consequences they might face if something happens to Austin.
Not so long after, students also started to realize that something was wrong as their homeroom never began even though it was already past the hour.
The representative of every class began to come out and ask what was happening.
Slowly, as the minute passed, news spread like wildfire. Slowly every student got to know that Austin was missing.
He wasn't found in any gym or other training grounds. He wasn't in the front garden or any washroom. The cafeteria was empty and the chef said he didn't spot Austin in the morning as well.
The tension was growing with passing each moment. The students were told to self-study at the moment while the Council members were asked to search for him in every corner of the school.
The guards were asked if they spotted Austin going out of the academy. However, they confirmed that they never saw him around the entrance.
Once the Headmaster heard about it, he instantly assigned a crew to go and look for him outside the Academy.
Meanwhile, the warden of the male and female dormitory was told to search each building thoroughly with the help of the students.
Parkinson was indifferently reading his books, not minding the chaos around him. He couldn't care less about Austin, if anything, he would be happy if the blond dog realized his worth and left the academy.
However, suddenly he heard something fleetingly, that made every strand of his body erect in alert,
"It seems they are going to search everyone's room as well-" The boy who said that, instantly turned still as he was grabbed by his collar and lifted off his seat.
"What did you just say?!" Parkinson shouted.
The boy snarled and pushed Parkinson with enough strength to make him stumble back,
"Don't you ever grab my collar again," He threatened.
Parkinson clenched his fist, his aura flaring, but the other guy didn't back off—ready to retaliate if Parkinson attacked.
However, he didn't remain here to engage in mindless battle and bolted out of the classroom
He can't let them enter his room. No one can see what was in there…no one!
…
There was no option left other than entering every room and searching for Austin inside every student's dormitory.
It was known that Austin was injured and under the effect of a pain-relieving drug last night, so there was a chance that he accidentally entered someone else's room and fell asleep.
However, the search didn't begin from the first room on the first floor but a certain room on the second floor.
The Headmaster stood before Parkinson's room with the other Professors and a few students. Even Valerie and Rhea were present, under special circumstances.
The Headmaster was about to tell the Professor to enter the room when suddenly,
"Wait!" Someone dashed inside the gallery and ran towards them.
Parkinson weaved through the crowd and stood before his room door, his arms extended to block the door as he said,
"You can't go inside!"
Now the suspicion was much more profound.
The Headmaster wordlessly glanced at one of the professors before he extended his hands, and easily, Parkinson was pulled away.
The supreme authority stepped forward and pushed open the door.
—-----**------
A/N:- Thanks for reading. Guess who is trapped.

chapters.title: Chapter 22: Chapter 21- Caught(2)
chapters.content:
Chapter 22: Chapter 21- Caught(2)
If Parkinson had the option to end this world right now, he wouldn't have thought twice about blowing it all up to cover the things everyone is about to see.
The door of his room was parted and everyone was assaulted by a strong scent of potions.
The headmaster frowned and glanced at Parkinson, "You were forbidden."
The green-haired scoffed, "That's the tradition."
The one who was holding Parkinson growled, "Speak respectfully, or your crimes will continue to pile up."
The teenager winced as his arms were twisted behind his back until the Headmaster gestured for him to stop.
The bespectacled man, formally known as Philius Croweb, heaved a sigh as he stepped inside the room.
He was aware that in the place where Parkinson comes from, potion-making is a very common job and something they take pride in. However, in this nation, to make a potion, one needs to gain a license first.
Philius naturally warned Parkinson when the teenager demanded to get himself a seat in the academy, however, Parkinson broke his promise.
"Oh, my lord..." The Headmaster's eyes stretched wide as he looked at the student's room, which was filled with nothing but a certain pink-haired girl.
Every corner of the room has something that is related to Rhea.
From the bedsheet to the couch, from the mat to the stuffed toys. Parkinson has painted everything in the shade of his classmate.
The other teachers were also disgusted at how Parkinson had decorated his room. It looked nothing less than horrifying, and most of all, Rhea was affected by all this quite severely.
Her feet felt numb as the girl couldn't believe what her eyes were showing her.
Valerie indifferently looked at the surroundings before she stepped forward and began searching the room
"Rhea...please listen to me. I wanted to tell you about my feelings but all the drama with Valerie and Austin...please trust me, my emotions were pure—"
"Just...just shut up!" Rhea clasped her hand before her face and begged him to close his mouth. Her voice was hoarse since she barely prevented herself from vomiting just now.
The same person she thought was pure and considerate was so...disgusting and deceiving all this time?
Parkinson was left speechless. He wanted to say something but couldn't utter a single word and just continued to move his mouth like a fish for a couple of minutes before suddenly, Valerie said,
"There is something in there." She frowned upon noticing the shallowness of the wooden floor beneath her feet compared to the other sides.
She summoned her Soul Shard and tore away the carpet—slashing Rhea's face drawn on it, in the process.
"STOP YOU!!" Seeing Parkinson aggressively trying to break free, everyone's suspicion rose.
Everyone gazed at the slight cracks in a square, signifying there was a secret door.
The headmaster gave Valerie the nod before the violette extended her shard burnt the lock on the small door, and raised her foot to stomp on it,
*CLINK*
The lock broke instantly and the door was flung open to the other side—however, the door didn't completely open as there was something that prevented it from showing everything inside.
All the color from Valerie's face disappeared when her gaze landed on the strands of golden locks.
Very slowly she stepped closer and pulled the door back before using her Aura to strengthen her body and tear away the door—only to find her body freezing the moment her gaze landed on the person lying half dead there.
"A-A-Austin...."
Philius instantly jumped inside and picked up the young man in his arms before pressing his fingers on his wrist.
Those few seconds, he took were like an eternity to Valerie. She looked at her Lord with her eyes blurred by her tears.
She died several times in those few seconds before the headmaster nodded and told her, "He is alive."
She slumped back on her legs, hearing that, allowing her breath, which had been stuck in her throat for a long, to seep out.
Valerie's face was hidden behind her long hair as she stared at Austin's battered body for a few seconds then suddenly,
Something snapped.
Valerie's trembling hand clenched into a fist as her eyes locked onto Parkinson. That glance alone was enough to horrify not only Parkinson but the Professor holding him.
Her body began to radiate a palpable aura of fury—dark and suffocating, like a storm tearing through the academy. The air grew heavy, each breath dragging as if the weight of her rage pressed down on everyone in the room.
Parkinson stumbled back, his knees buckling under the crushing force. "W-Wait! I didn't—"
"Enough!" Valerie's voice was a raw snarl, and her body erupted with Soul energy. Her shard glowed ominously, jagged cracks of light spilling out from her clenched hands.
The ground trembled beneath her as the walls groaned under the pressure of her unrestrained power. The temperature in the room plummeted, and a piercing chill swept through, sending shivers even through the most hardened teachers.
"She's losing control!" one teacher yelled, gripping their staff tightly to form a barrier around Parkinson.
"Valerie, stop!" another teacher cried, stepping forward to hold her back.
But it was futile. Valerie took a single step toward Parkinson, and the shockwave of her aura knocked the teacher to the ground, their barrier shattering like glass.
"You put him in there…" Valerie hissed, her voice trembling with grief and rage. Her movements were slow but deliberate, like a predator toying with its prey. "You tortured him."
Parkinson whimpered, his face pale as death. The very blood in his veins felt as if it had frozen solid. "I—It wasn't me! You have to believe me—!"
"Believe you?" Valerie's shout reverberated through the academy, shaking the chandeliers and cracking the windows. Her Soul energy surged like a tidal wave, blasting through the room.
One by one, the teachers stepped forward, each unleashing their power to suppress her. Defensive shields, binding spells, and suppressive sigils flared to life, encasing Valerie in a cocoon of shimmering light.
"Hold her down!" the headmaster ordered sharply.
The combined effort of the teachers strained against Valerie's immense strength, but she continued to advance, her burning gaze fixed solely on Parkinson. Each step forward sent cracks racing along the floor, fissures spreading through the very foundation of the academy.
Rhea had already been shot away by the immense force and couldn't even get up because of the invisible weight she was feeling all over her.
Her voice was low and guttural as she whispered, "You'll pay for this."
A flash of her Soul Shard illuminated the room, and a deafening roar of power erupted from her, blasting through the suppressive spells like paper. The teachers were hurled back, slamming into walls and furniture, groaning as they struggled to regain their footing.
Valerie raised her hand, her shard blazing with murderous intent, aimed straight at Parkinson's trembling figure.
Philius clenched his teeth as he removed the glove from his hand, 'Guess there is no option...'
However, before he could have stopped Valerie, Austin suddenly called out,
"Val..."
It was a very soft hum, which Philius barely heard—however, it worked like a wonder, slicing through the immense Aura of the girl, the whisper reached her ear, and instantly, Valerie stopped in her track and upon turning around, she saw her beloved raising his hand in her direction, and softly gesturing her to come closer.
Tears began to rain down her eyes as she walked through the broken mess of a room, and knelt beside her Lord.
Philius heaved a sigh and allowed her to take a hold of Austin as the violette hugged her beloved close to her and for the first time, everyone heard Valerie crying.
---------**--------
A/N:- Okay, yeah, she is that strong.
Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 23: Chapter 22- Sudden arrival(1)
chapters.content:
Chapter 23: Chapter 22- Sudden arrival(1)
Austin had a very clear goal behind his actions. People might call it going to some extreme length to trap Parkinson, but he had to.
Under no other crime would he have been expelled from the Academy except for kidnapping and possible murder of a fellow schoolmate.
It was necessary to get rid of Parkinson since Austin had already shifted the plot by not letting Valerie get suspended. So he chose to act first rather than letting his opponent make strategies and try to harm him or his beloved.
The only person who could have changed things, and completely demolished his plans was Valerie. He knew her strength and the extent of her love for him.
If she had harmed Parkinson or, worse, killed him, things would have taken a very awful turn. That's why, despite having the plans of remaining unconscious for the entire time, Austin chose to wake up and stop his fiancée.
Now, inside the infirmary were several teachers and the Headmaster. It has been a few hours since Austin was rescued and thanks to recovery potions, he can barely talk.
Under normal circumstances, the Headmaster would have let Austin recover first, but things soon were going to turn hectic.
Once the father of the suspect gets informed about the situation, by no means would he let Parkinson remain in the academy anymore. Parkinson would be taken away under the pretense that he would be judged by his father. But in the end, the teenager wouldn't get punished.
Sebastian was using a cotton pad to clean the wound on his master's cheek as the blond Prince heard the supreme authority asking, "Austin...do you remember what happened?"
Austin looked dazed for a moment, his eyes situated on nothing particular as he thought back on what happened before he informed,
"I returned to my room late at night...and fell asleep instantly. Then suddenly, my sleep was disturbed in the middle of the night because of some awful scent."
Valerie's hand trembled hearing that, and the Professors flinched—ready to subdue her this time if things went out of control. However, Austin held her hand and gave her an assuring look, as he continued to talk,
"I saw a pair of green eyes who were pressing the fabric against my mouth....and the smell was making me dizzy and sluggish. I couldn't muster up the courage to fight against him."
Philius frowned, "Was it the scent of used socks?"
"Y-Yes...that's it. Very awful." Austin affirmed.
The headmaster nodded, before he informed others, "It's the Dizzy Dew—given to prisoners during interrogation to prevent them from killing themselves."
Everyone in the crowd was aware of the potion, as the nurse said, "I thought such a potion is prohibited to bring in the academy?"
Potions have always been a sensitive topic in the academy, and due to some previous events, all the ingredients of the potions are closely monitored.
Philius grimly said, "Parkinson must have received the materials through his weekly parcels from his hometown."
Turning back toward the younger one, Philius wordlessly urged Austin to continue.
"After that...I was feeling someone was hitting me...using a blunt object but I wasn't able to react at all. My Aura was not working as well nor could I muster up the strength to cry out for help."
Suddenly, a voice emerged from the crowd, which attracted everyone's attention, "If I may ask, Sebastian, where were you when all this happened?"
It was Morkel who walked inside the infirmary and questioned the loyal servant from the royal family who had the duty to protect the young master all the time.
Naturally, if Sebastian had been around Austin would have never been kidnapped.
Every eye then turned towards the grey-haired man but it wasn't him who answered the question.
"I sent Sebastian to patrol around the premises. Since Harold and a few professors are not in the academy for the time being, we were short on staff members." The Headmaster informed before his brows drew closer,
"What are you trying to imply here, Morkel?"
The bespectacled one raised his hands and innocently stated, "I am not making any judgments here, sir; however, we need to look at things from different angles as well."
Advancing towards them, he stood while facing Austin before uttering, "There must be a severe reason why student Parkinson suddenly decided to kidnap Austin."
Austin stared at the man with an indifferent look—he knew that until he was here, he wouldn't let Parkinson get punished so easily.
Fortunately, the one who gave him the proof was someone from his team, "There was a reason, Professor."
The tallest one in the room called out, urging everyone to look at him as Rudolph added,
"Yesterday, in the morning, when Austin invited Parkinson to talk, he left his office while shouting madly. Several students saw him threatening Austin."
Morkel frowned, "Did you hear it from someone?"
"Yes, many students were talking about it. If you want you can confirm it from them."
"And we shouldn't forget about the spar yesterday. We all heard how Parkinson was showing his grudge during the battle, continuously swearing to kill Austin."
The instructor in charge of the battle yesterday, added.
Philius frowned before his eyes went towards Austin, and he asked, "Do you know the reason?"
Austin thought for a moment before responding, "...maybe because I took Valerie's side in the trials that pissed him off?"
If Austin had said that a few hours ago, no one would have believed that Parkinson could take such a big step just because of that. However, after witnessing how madly he is obsessed with Rhea, it doesn't sound implausible.
It was not unknown to others that Austin and Rhea were close, and someone who is so madly in love with Rhea, surely would see Austin as an enemy.
The evidence was against him and Philius seemed to have reached a conclusion.
However, before he could have said anything, a Professor entered the infirmary and stated,
"Headmaster! The Prime Minister from the Hener kingdom has arrived."
The Professor began to murmuring, wondering how the new reached Parkinson's family so soon.
While Austin kept his cold gaze constant on Morkel'sh smiling ones.
'This assh*le is hell-bent on ruining my plans...'
---------**--------
A/N:- Yeah, not everything can go according to the plans..

chapters.title: Chapter 24: Chapter 23- Sudden arrival(2)
chapters.content:
Chapter 24: Chapter 23- Sudden arrival(2)
Morkel knew something was wrong when he reached the academy this morning, and it did not take more than half a minute for him to discern the whole thing—thanks to his information sources.
It seems the Prince has finally found the use of that thing that resides between his ears. Until now, he has been so simple-minded and idiotic at times that Morkel never thought that Austin would plot so cunningly against Parkinson.
Why wasn't Morkel not believing Austin? Was it because he was close to Parkinson or because he hated Austin? None. It was because he knew Parkinson wouldn't take such a major step with so many traces left behind.
Morkel knows Parkinson's style; he kills on the spot rather than dragging his prey to his house where he could get easily caught. Morkel was closely aware of everything and everyone that surrounds Rhea, so naturally, he discerned that Parkinson didn't abduct the Prince, rather, the blond bastard set this whole thing up.
However, considering the Prince took this major step which could get him expelled easily if caught, Morkel knew that Austin wouldn't have done half-hearted work.
The bespectacled Professor knew that if things didn't work out, quite well, he had to keep a Plan B to ensure Parkinson's safety. After all, there were still things that Parkinson needed to do for Morkel.
That's why Morkel informed the Prime Minister of the Hener Kingdom. The Professor was aware that the Prime Minister was around since he was sent to escort the Minister to the Kingdom just this morning.
And thankfully, just when Morkel wanted the Minister arrived at the academy. And not alone; he brought a very useful pawn along~
"Your Highness, Aiden!" Morkel beamed as he spotted the silver head standing in the common hall along with the Prime Minister.
Philius' eyes momentarily narrowed before he greeted, "Minister Abel. Your Highness Aiden. It's nice to see you in good health."
The long silver-haired man smiled at the older one before saying, "You look the same as ever; must be regular exercise and a strict diet."
The friendliness in his tone wasn't enough for Philius to put his guard down, "You praise me too much, Your Highness."
Turning toward the two alternatively, he asked, "So what could be the reason for your sudden arrival?"
"Don't be sly with me, Headmaster, I am quite aware of what treatment my nephew has been facing recently."
Hearing that tone, Philius dropped the act and told him, "Then you must be aware of the crime which your precious nephew has committed, I suppose?"
The atmosphere around the two significantly dropped as Abel kept his condensing gaze fixated on the grey-haired individual.
Aiden stepped in and dissipated the tension, "Now, now, we all are adults here so let us talk over things rather than partaking in anything impulsively."
Hearing Aiden's words Abel scoffed and told the Headmaster, "You cannot punish my nephew here. His hearin-"
"Student Parkinson has tried to harm student Austin. And since Student Parkinson is a student of the academy which I govern, I will not, under any circumstances, let him get taken away." In a single breath and with his voice loud enough to be heard by every single person inside the common hall, the Headmaster stated.
Abel's complexion shifted to blue and red, showing his anger as he clenched his fist and asked, "Are you prepared to face the consequences of offending the King?!"
"I see no King here, and if the King is willing to use his name to save a criminal then yes, I am prepared for whatever consequences this can bring to me." There was not a spec of hesitation or nervousness in his voice as the Headmaster shared a piece of his mind.
Before Abel could have flown in rage, Aiden stepped in, "However, Headmaster, for the crime Parkinson has committed, I assume you need to bring him before the council of judgment, right?"
Philius frowned, however, he couldn't refute it, "...yes." Above a certain degree, every crime should be presented before the Council of Judgement—a group of judges who form a decision which only the Monarch can dismiss.
Aiden heaved a sigh before asking him, "Then offer me the chance to take the right call and present the student before the council. Whatever decision they take will be final."
Drawing closer he added, "And trust me,
Headmaster, if it's proven that Parkinson has indeed tried to kill my brother, I swear nothing less than a death sentence would be awarded to Parkinson."
Philius remained silent for a moment—he was aware that the relationship between Austin and Aiden was complicated, but right now, Philius could see the burning anger in Aiden's eyes.
And even if he tried to, Philius couldn't form a judgment on someone who has abducted a student. In the end, he nodded,
"Okay, you can take him."
…However, naturally, he would send people with them who would be Philius' ears and eyes.
—------**--------
Rudolph found Rhea to be sitting in the garden, acquiring the cornermost seat, which remained hidden by the passerby.
Her legs were curled as she stared at nothing constant. The stains at the corner of her eyes clearly told that the girl had cried for a long time.
The giant boy sat down beside her and offered the pink head some ice cream which he brought along, "Here…I have heard sugary items help elevate the mood."
Rhea looked at the small bowl before saying, "And you chose the strawberry flavor? Did you want to worsen my mood?"
Rudolph was startled, "You don't like strawberries?"
Rhea didn't say anything and took the ice cream from him.
While she was slowly eating, she asked Rudolph, "You knew about it…that how…he has been stalking me?"
Rudolph shook his head, "No, or I would have stopped him."
From further investigation, it turned out Rhea used things like her handkerchief, tissue papers, stationery, and even some of her clothes were found in his cupboard.
Rhea couldn't help but sigh, "Why always me…"
Rudolph raised his brows, "Hmm? Did you say something?"
Rhea shook her head before smiling at him as she said, "Thanks for the ice cream. It helped."
—-----**-------
A/N:- Thanks for reading. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 25: Chapter 24- Ignored
chapters.content:
Chapter 25: Chapter 24- Ignored
"Did he leave?" Austin asked as he saw Valerie walking inside the infirmary with a serious frown on her face.
Hearing his voice, her distress turned into concern as she said, "Yes…it seems he was in a rush to return to the Capital."
Austin chuckled as he invited her to sit on the stool near the bed before he told his fiancée,
"You think I will be sad because my brother doesn't care about me or any of my family members didn't even contact me even after hearing about my situation?"
His tone already suggested that he didn't. However, Valerie felt quite sad seeing the indifference from her Lord. She has seen how close he has always been to his parents in the past.
Austin was the most loved and spoiled child of the family, even though he had two younger sisters. Everyone used to adore him until his elder brother appeared out of nowhere.
Only Valerie knows how lonely Austin had become when his parents started ignoring his existence in the name of giving their elder one the time and affection he was devoid of.
And the gap between Austin and his family has turned so wide that having no one to look out for him does no longer affect her Lord.
Valerie didn't know how to feel about it…
"Val, I already told you that, except for you, I care about no one. I just want your attention and love." He kissed the back of her hand as he softly muttered.
He could barely open his eyes; his body was still covered in bandages…yet the affection in his eyes had not subdued even a bit.
Valerie couldn't stop herself from smiling as she brought his hand, pressed it against her cheek, and said, "You will always have me—until the end and beyond that…I will never leave your side."
—------**-------
Sebastian was currently moving toward the infirmary, when suddenly he heard a voice, "Wait a moment."
Turning towards the source of the voice, Sebastian lowered his head, "What can I do for you, Young Lady?"
Valerie appeared from the shadows while holding a long bag in her hand.
She handed the bag to Sebastian, urging the older one to look inside.
His eyes widened as he saw there was a steel pipe inside the bag, which was damaged slightly and had severe blood marks on it.
Sebastian looked at the lady and found her arms crossed and eyes narrowed as she said, "I won't ask why, but in the future, for whatever reason, if you dare hurt my Lord, I won't hesitate to kill you."
Sebastian regained his calm before muttering, "And you know that even death cannot stop me from listening to the young master's command."
Valerie's expression turned sour, as she got the confirmation.
She already guessed that Her Lord had planned everything the moment she studied his injuries, and inspected his room during the investigation.
She turned around and was about to walk away when suddenly the older one said,
"He did it for you…wanted to keep you safe."
Valerie paused, and without looking at the butler, she said, "Don't misunderstand me, Sebastian. I am not displeased about this…far from it. After all, I was about to get rid of that snake by myself sooner than later."
With her fist clenched she added, "I just can never feel happy about something that caused him pain."
Sebastian was once again reminded of how much the young lady adored his young master—and that made him smile.
As she resumed walking she told him, "Don't tell him that I know…"
—------**-------
There was a severe frown on his face as the man who had similar blond hair as Austin, read the letter.
The King of the Eryndor—Cedric Eryndor, read the report he received from the headmaster through an ethereal courier.
"What happened, dear?" His wife, Sophie asked as she saw her husband frowning while reading the letter.
Cedric turned towards his wife before saying, "It's about Austin…it seems he is injured severely-" Before he could continue his wife interrupted,
"Must have fought with someone. Let the headmaster handle it and stop worrying about it." Saying so she went back to sleep.
Cedric heaved a sigh; it wasn't the first time he had seen such negligence from his wife.
She no longer takes anything about Austin seriously; brushing it off like he is nothing but a mischievous child. However, here, the matter was serious—Austin was kidnapped and nearly killed.
And his wife…she doesn't even want to hear about it.
