'Because of Aiden, she has completely forgotten about Austin…' He doesn't blame the eldest one for that since Aiden never asked them to ignore Austin.
However, the guilt Cedric and Sophie felt towards Aiden, made them completely ignorant towards Austin.
But not this time—this was a very grave matter. His son, the second Prince of the nation was kidnapped.
Cedric cannot take this lightly or others would continue to torment Austin while considering that his family no longer cares about him.
Changing his clothes, he was about to leave when suddenly his wife asked,"Where are you going all of a sudden?" There was displeasure in her voice. After all, it was the first time in years that they got this opportunity to spend time in peace, given Aiden was there to take care of things.
Cedric didn't turn to look at his wife before saying, "Going to do what a father must do for his child."
Sophie frowned….just because of some school fight her husband was leaving her like this.
'Austin…why didn't you turn out to be like your elder brother?' Sophie couldn't help but complain in her heart.
—------**--------
A/N:- Damn, there are people like her who exist in the real world as well. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 26: Chapter 25- Favor?
chapters.content:
Chapter 26: Chapter 25- Favor?
For the next few days, Austin was focused on his recovery. He directed Sebastian where to hit so in case he needed to fight someone while he was recovering, Austin wouldn't fall helpless
Around the fourth day after that incident, the news arrived that the suspect—Parkinson—escaped the convoy that was bringing him to the central capital.
Around twenty elite soldiers were taking him there yet he escaped—yeah, why not.
Austin knew something like this would happen, however, he wasn't regretting anything. His primary goal was to make everyone realize his true nature and show Parkinson as a criminal. And by running away everyone now knows that he, indeed, was the criminal.
The investigation regarding the matter came to a halt since Parkinson gave them the biggest proof of being the wrongdoer.
For his security and others, some soldiers from the capital were stationed at the boy's dormitory, however, Austin declined any security following him except for Sebastian.
The Headmaster didn't insist, being aware of Sebastian's skills and devotion to his duties. However, he asked Austin to remain indoors for the time being.
It was the sixth day, and today, Austin was supposed to leave the school to reach the Capital on time. After all, tomorrow was his birthday and a ceremony was held to celebrate the return of the first Prince.
However, now, naturally, Austin couldn't go considering his health.
"I feel bad for you..." Austin muttered as, with Valerie's help, he walked into the garden.
Valerie was holding his hand since his left leg was still not completely healed, and her Lord seldom fell while walking.
Raising her brows, the pretty lady asked, "Why though? I never liked those flashy ceremonies."
She wasn't lying when she said that, and the reason why she ever used to join such celebrations was because her father asked her to. Later, Austin invited her.
Austin paused, and while looking at her, he uttered, "Except for the yearly holidays during winter, it's only around my birthday when you meet your parents."
A brief wave of shock rendered her speechless as she stared at her Lord with her eyes turning round.
Austin sighed before telling her, "Unlike mine, your parents adore you and your siblings equally well, and I am aware of how fond you are of them."
Cupping her cheek softly, he asked, "What do you say, should we take a few days off after I recover and visit your parents? After our engagement, I haven't met them as well."
With his gaze drifting to the front he added, "I want to make a good impression on my father in law as-"
*Thud*
Suddenly, Austin was surrounded by the scent of jasmine, and his body was enveloped by a warm sensation as Valerie hugged him.
Austin was taken aback by the sudden embrace but he soon reciprocated and wrapped his arms around his fiancée.
Her soft and warm body was addictive; he always felt a great urge to keep holding her for a long time...it makes him calm and elevates his heart rate at the same time.
Valerie had tears in her eyes as she whispered, "The way you have been considerate about such small things related to me...I feel quite happy."
For others, it might be trivial; however, for Valerie, the very thought of closing the distance between her parents and himself was a very considerate and loving act.
A few days ago, even a single glance from him was enough for her to remain content. Even if it was filled with contempt, she loved it when he scolded her. That's why when he suddenly started showing her with all his affection, Valerie wasn't able to hold back herself.
"Make a habit of it, Val...my every action will always be aimed to make you happy." He softly muttered, and he meant what he said.
In his previous life, there was no one he met who loved him so unconditionally, however, now that he had such a person so close to him, Austin was not going to let her go.
Ever.
.....
Their walk came to an end as soon as they decided to share tea before resting in their rooms.
Valerie was silent until the cafeteria, and someone who closely observes her regularly these days, Austin could tell that she was quite embarrassed right now
After all, for a maiden like Valerie, it was too much to suddenly hug a boy, even though he was her fiancé. And not to talk about, so openly!
There was a strong urge in him to rub his cheek against hers and pat the girl who can get shy about such trivial things. However, if he does that, there is a high chance Valerie might lock herself up in her room for the next ten days in embarrassment.
"You still prefer tea without sugar?" Valerie looked up and nodded with perplexity vivid in her eyes.
"Is it because you want to maintain your health?" Austin asked curiously.
"...I don't need to avoid sugar just because of that since I train enough to avoid getting myself extra weight." Valerie added, "It's just...I no longer like sweet things."
Austin raised his brows as he also picked his black coffee, without sugar. He remembered Valarie once loved sugary things, but slowly, her taste changed....
Did she intentionally change it?
He never got the chance to ask, as suddenly a familiar face appeared before them, "Hey, Austin?"
Rudolph sat down beside Austin with concern written over his face.
The blond Prince hummed in question before he heard the other one hesitantly asking, "Can you do me a favor ..and talk to Rhea?"
Valerie flinched, the hold around the tea cup tightening.
Austin didn't miss her reaction, however, rather than outrightly rejecting the guy, he asked, "Why me? You can go talk to her, no?"
"Agh-you know how bad I am at this. I don't know what to say to console someone...and at the moment, Rhea needs someone who can give her some emotional support."
With his eyes revealing a lot more than his words, Rudolph added, "...I think this incident with Parkinson...it has reminded her of something bad. I have never seen Rhea being so silent before..."
It struck him then. Austin remembered that small incident that Rhea once mentioned in the story later on, which urges Parkinson to stop his stalker-like act.
Heaving a sigh, and while holding Valarie's hand, Austin said, "I will see what I can do."
-----------**----------

chapters.title: Chapter 27: Chapter 26- Sudden visit(1)
chapters.content:
Chapter 27: Chapter 26- Sudden visit(1)
Was there any specific reason for which Austin had to approach Rhea?
Yeah, he had. Not because Rudolph asked him to, but rather, once Austin remembered the reason why Rhea seemed so upset because of that incident, he feared that the Protagonist might end up killing herself.
Although he didn't like the pinkhead much, it was an irrefutable fact that Rhea was a necessary asset for him and this world. She is the only living entity who can summon two soul shards at one time and can slay the Demon Lord.
As such Austin has to ensure that she doesn't end up taking any step that can change the world's fate for the worst.
That's why after talking with Valerie and asking her to remain nearby, Austin approached Rhea.
Valerie didn't seem to be willing but when Austin told her about Rhea's situation, she didn't say anything. She never stopped him from meeting her, however, when the reluctance in her eyes subdued, Austin felt comfortable approaching Rhea.
Why was he being so mindful of Valerie's opinion? Well, of course, he would care about what his partner likes and what she doesn't. In the future there might arise instances where Austin wouldn't like her accompanying someone, so he would naturally express his displeasure.
After his talk with Valerie, he asks Rudolph where he can find the pink-head
"The last bench in the garden; where she always goes at times like these..."
Austin nodded before, with Valerie's help he walked towards the garden
Once they spotted the girl, Valerie said, "I will be nearby."
Austin nodded before he advanced toward the Protagonist.
Staring at the sky, she remained sitting silently. Her eyes were red and her whole demeanor showed how tired she was of her life.
"Can I sit here?"
She jerked in surprise hearing his voice before turning toward Austin and hurriedly getting up, "Yeah, sure. Ah, why are you roaming around like this when you haven't recovered yet?"
She saw him limping slightly so she tried to help him—only to flinch as she sensed an ominous presence from nearby.
However, when she turned she found no one there.
'Strange ..'
"The nurse said that it was okay to take a few minutes of walk...." Austin said while he settled down on the bench.
Rhea didn't bother to check why she felt so horrified just now and sat down beside the blond Prince.
"How is your health now? Does it still hurt?" She asked in concern.
Austin shrugged, "Better than before; thanks to Valerie's support."
Rhea fondly smiled, "I saw you two earlier. Seriously, the way she takes care of you...I feel I should learn from her."
Austin smiled—he likes it when someone praises his lover.
"Well, she is a sweet girl." He sighed as the duo turned momentarily silent after that.
Glancing at her, Austin asked, "What about you? How is it going?"
Rhea didn't raise her head to look at him as she muttered, "Doing good. Valerie did knock me out back then but it was still nothing compared to how much pain I had received during training."
"I am not talking about your physical health, Rhea." Austin plainly stated, making Rhea flinch.
She still refused to look at him as she sighed.
There were a few moments of silence and Austin didn't urge her to speak.
Finally, after she collected her thoughts, Rhea spoke, "There was someone close to me...when I used to live alone back in the town. He was my neighbor, a sweet guy. He was six years older than me, and when he found out that I lived alone, he started caring about me...you know, providing food once in a while, bringing me stuff from his farm."
There was a pause, the girl seemingly quite sensitive about the topic, as she continued, "I adored him as a brother...but it turned out he had some other thoughts about me."
Leaning back, she said, "One of those days, he drugged me and tried to force himself on me. I escaped since my natural tolerance against drugs is quite strong, and later, when people searched his home, numerous disturbing things were found."
Austin asked, "Just like Parkinson?"
She glanced at him, before nodding, "Yup, just like him, that guy was also a creep. Collecting my things and using them for whatnot."
Austin was aware of the incident. Canonically, when Parkinson hears about it, he decides to change himself, and the fact that he once used to stalk Rhea is never revealed.
A weary sigh seeped through her lips, as the girl muttered, "That's why...I felt so shaken up when I found out that my best friend was the same as that guy. I was shaken down to my core and couldn't bear to look at Parkinson again."
With her expression turning a little sad, she added, "And since that day, I have been ignoring Rudolph as well...I can't tell him the reason why I am like this."
"Then why did you tell me?" Austin asked. Rudolph was as close to her as Austin was. However, she didn't hesitate to disclose her past to Austin.
Rhea smiled at the blond one before confessing, "Because I knew you wouldn't sympathize with me, and that would save me from feeling pathetic."
Austin chuckled, "I seemed to have formed a very cold perception in your eyes."
"More like you have reserved all your warmth and love for a certain someone." Her smile was contagious, which urged Austin to smile as well, in response.
Rhea got up, "Okay then, let's go back. I will be fine by tomorrow. Hopefully."
Austin also got up before suggesting, "You should probably talk to Rudolph. He is quite-" Austin paused as he sensed someone approaching them.
Turning towards the person, he noticed it was one of the Professors from the third year.
"Austin." He said, in between his labored breathing, "You have been summoned to the Headmaster's office. Someone came to meet you."
----------**----------
A/N:- Thank you for reading. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 28: Chapter 27- Sudden visit(2)
chapters.content:
Chapter 28: Chapter 27- Sudden visit(2)
Austin was surprised. He really was.
From his knowledge, his father and his mother were on a trip, far away from the capital, and were enjoying their quality time after a long while. After all, there was now someone responsible and mature handling the nation when the King was away.
Needless to say, it wasn't Austin.
However, the blond Prince never expected that his father would actually arrive at the Academy after a few days of the incident. And for the most astonishing part, he looked worried.
"Austin...how have you been, son?" Cedric asked, his eyes looking tired, must be because of the long journey, yet he held enough strength to approach his son and help him sit down.
"I am quite fine, father. Thanks to the Headmaster's consideration to let me rest more and Valerie's care." He responded, not even a speck of resentment or grief in his voice, which greatly startled the King.
He had been noticing the way Austin had started distancing himself from them, seldom ignoring his letters and often delaying his arrival back home during the vacations.
Cedric was not surprised, and he couldn't blame anyone else but himself for this. After all, while fulfilling his role as the father of his first child, his eyes strayed from his other one.
"I heard what happened from the Headmaster...everything." he spoke, his tone turning colder with each syllable, "And I promise you, I will punish that evildoer who dared to harm you ."
"Then you might as well have to wage a war now, father." Austin simply stated as he rested his hands on his thighs.
The older one looked at his son in shock for a moment, only to realize the meaning behind his words.
Parkinson was the son of a king, just like Austin, and undoubtedly, after committing the crime, that bastard must have run back to his home—seeking protection behind the man against whom Cedric couldn't casually go.
Despite having the intention, Cedric couldn't say 'So what? I will still catch him and punish him' since he knew, it would be nothing but a lie. After all, as a father, he can be emotional, but as a king, he has to be rational.
Austin heaved a sigh, "We both know that Hener provides us with valuable military supplies, and it is one of the vast trade centers for our people. Waging a war against them would weaken us in several ways."
Cedric frowned and looked at his son with a disapproving look, "You don't feel the urge for vengeance?"
"I do but I can't go against someone who is being backed up by a whole nation."
"You have the support of a kingdom as well!" Cedric retorted.
Austin scoffed, "Do I have? I doubt that."
The vigor from his face disappeared as the man looked at his son with concern.
Austin heaved a sigh, "Look Father, it would be better if we stop right here and right now."
Cedric was feeling defeated seeing his own child having no faith in him. And the worst thing, Austin didn't look affected because of it at all.
Sitting down across from him, Cedric couldn't help but ask, "You...resent me, don't you?"
Austin shook his head, "Not at all. What makes you feel like I am bitter about something?"
Cedric didn't say anything about it since he knew he would end up giving him more than enough reason, but there would be nothing he could say to gain his son's forgiveness.
With his shoulders slumped and eyes drawn to the ground, the man muttered, "Even if you hate...it won't matter until you remain safe."
Austin couldn't understand this man. Even in his previous life, he had parents who cared little to nothing about him, and when they came back home once a year, they showered him with love, expecting him to forget all those days when he needed his parents the most.
However, even though the man in front of him looked pitiful, and the original Austin would have melted at the sight, the current him couldn't feel anything for the man at all. No resentment, no pity.
Cedric remained sitting there for another minute before he asked, "Will you return with me for your birthday? Your sister has arranged a grand feast for everyone back in the capital."
'For me? Yeah, why not.'
"I am not in the condition to travel a long distance."
"Then...should I stay here and celebrate your birthday with you?"
Austin shook his head, "Many important people will be there tomorrow so the King must be around. Not to forget, Mother would be upset if you don't attend the celebration."
Again, he sensed it. Pure indifference in his voice like he didn't care about the fact that he would be all alone during his most special day.
Cedric didn't say anything regarding it and got up before he turned around. Leaving a few words behind, he walked out,
"We are still your family, Austin...please never forget that."
Austin remained sitting in the administrator's office for a few minutes, pondering over what he said.
"Family eh...I have forgotten how it feels to have a family...."
....
Standing below the window, with her back pressed against the wall, Valerie heard the conversation between the duo.
The way her Lord showed indifference towards his father and things related to his family...broke her heart.
'He has lost all his hope...' With such thoughts, she turned around and left. Appearing before her Lord as now would push her to expose her grief. And that would hurt him as well.
She couldn't change the fact that he was betrayed by his family members, and whatever she does, she can never fill the hole they have created in Austin's heart.
However, she can naturally try to overwrite all those bitter feelings with tender love. Yes, she will do that.
She has been hesitant until now, but Valerie would no longer hold back in expressing how she feels about her beloved.
'You no longer need anyone else, I will be your everything from now on.'
----------**---------
A/N:- As someone with a loving family, I pity Austin. And as someone who has a series of failed love stories, I envy Austin.

chapters.title: Chapter 29: Chapter 28- Gamble
chapters.content:
Chapter 29: Chapter 28- Gamble
[Combat: 13/100]
{Next reward at 20}
[Romance: 30/100]
{Next reward at 40}
[Durability: 15/100]
{Next reward at 25}
[Trickery: 11/100]
{Next reward at 20}
[Ding!]
[Upon reaching the first threshold of Trickery, the host has received a reward!]
[Tap to see]
[Ding!]
[You have reached the second threshold of your overall achievements!]
[Overall Progression:20/100]
[Ding!]
[You have received a mega reward!]
[Tap to open]
Austin remained lying in his bed and stared at the screen. He received the notification yesterday when he was with Valarie but since he knew it would take time, he ignored it.
Then came his father and he completely forgot about the reward.
He can see the gift box hanging in the left, which was apparently the mega reward. However, before that, he chose to see what his trickery had gained him.
[Deceiving face: Allows the host to take the appearance of anyone for ten minutes.]
[Limitation: Can be used once in thirty hours.]
[Requirement: A droplet of the target's blood.]
Austin examined the mask and thought how cool it would have been if he had this mask a few days ago. Framing Parkinson would have been easier.
It was a theatrical wooden mask with a smiling face and two holes for the eyes. Something befitting a trickster.
Austin was about to open the Mega Reward when suddenly he received a notification on the system,
[Ding!]
[An exciting offer has appeared!]
[In exchange for the Mega Reward, the host has the offer to gain the function of 'Inventory'!]
[This is a one-time offer, and the decision cannot be reversed. Choose carefully.]
His eyes narrowed before he asked, "The mega reward in exchange for Inventory? What if I reject it, will I get an Inventory in the future?"
Truth be told, having a pocket dimension to store things was very useful. Considering this world doesn't have spatial storage, it becomes even more desirable.
However, it cannot be denied that the mega reward must have something useful as well.
[Ding!]
[There is a chance but rejecting the offer would lessen the probability!]
"..." Isn't it a threat now? Is the system forcing him to accept the Inventory?
Thinking for a bit, he asked, "Can you tell me the features of the inventory?"
[Ding!]
[Inventory: A pocket-dimensional storage that allows users to store and retrieve items instantly. It ignores weight and size limits, making it perfect for carrying essentials or treasures without burden.]
[Restriction: No living creature can be stored inside.]
[Limitation: The inventory size would be 100 cubic meters initially but it can be increased through QoD.]
Austin raised his brows as he read through the description. The inventory, just as he thought, seemed quite useful.
Providing an average room size of storage space in the inventory was hefty for someone who doesn't carry along many things. In the future, he can use it to hunt demons and bring them to exchange them for gold.
Not to talk about, he can carry several weapons except for his Soul Shard.
When his eyes went towards the last word, he asked, "What is QoD?"
[Quest on Demand: For the progression of any index, or skill, the Host can request quests from the system.]
[Caution: Rejecting three consecutive quests would cease the host's authority over QoD.]
'Scary...' Austin muttered under his breath before heaving a sigh.
This was a difficult choice. He really wanted that Inventory however, he couldn't tell what mega prize was awaiting him inside the box.
What if it turned out to be a powerful spell or a weapon of mass destruction?
Austin couldn't be a hundred percent sure in this.
'Ah, fuck it. I need the Mega Reward.' There was no point in pondering; Austin knew he would end up regretting his decision, so why not go with a little surprise and see what's in there?
[Ding!]
[The host showed brilliance in keeping loyal to his prize!]
[In addition to the mega reward, the host would gain the Inventory as well!]
"..." This system....is not normal.
[Ding!]
[Tap to open the reward!]
Austin heaved a sigh and decided to stop thinking about it.
Mentally tapping on the gift box, he was blinded by an orangish-red illumination, urging him to close his eyes.
Slowly he parted his eyes and found a bow floating before him. Its curved limbs resembling entwined vines, one side glowing deep red like molten ember and the other shimmering vibrant green like fresh leaves. Its grip is adorned with intricate patterns of thorns, and its string glows faintly, shifting between crimson and emerald hues.
Austin was so dazed that he looked at the description, a moment later,
[The Death Vow: Whoever the wielder names, the arrow launched from the bow would take their life. Regardless of their origin, gender, or in whichever world they reside.]
[Usage: 1]
Austin's lips were parted in shock, but to make sure he was comprehending it right, he asked the system,
"So whoever name I chant before releasing the arrow, that being will get killed?"
[Indeed, host.]
"Even immortal ones?"
[Indeed, host.]
"Crazy..." Austin slumped back in his bed, his mind in turmoil at how he could use this to slay so many great dangers approaching. And most of all, the Demon King.
'The final boss would be slain in a second if I use this...'
However, the Demon King is not in existence as of now, and those who summon that being are unknown to Austin.
He cannot be hasty in his decision.
[For now, the bow is stored in the Inventory. The host can retrieve it anytime.]
Austin heaved a sigh, "Thankfully, I have the storage, or keeping that glowing bow hidden would have been hectic."
*Knock* *Knock*
Austin was startled to hear someone knocking on his window.
It was only five in the morning so it was dark outside, making him a little wary.
He summoned his Soul Shard and slowly approached the window....only to sigh in relief when he saw a familiar pair of Violet eyes peeking at him.
*Click*
He opened the window for Valerie before inviting her inside.
She undid her shawl to reveal her reddened face, making Austin worried,
"Why did you come here when it's so cold outside?"
Shyly she lowered her head and faintly muttered,
"I-I wanted to be the first to wish you..."
"..." What mega reward? This is the ultimate reward.
His sweet little Villainess.
-----------**-----------
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 30: Chapter 29- His room
chapters.content:
Chapter 30: Chapter 29- His room
"Wait for me...it won't take long." Saying so, Austin closed the door of the bathroom.
They decided to have a walk around the garden together as a part of his recuperation, so he went to take a bath.
Left alone in his room, Valerie remained standing at her spot for a few seconds before she started looking around the place.
'This is the room...where he sleeps...and spends his alone time...' Her heart rate began to accelerate while imagining how vulnerable her Lord must remain in this place.
Tracing the edges of the chair where he sat as if to memorize its texture. Inhaling in the same air where he lives....gave her an unusual sense of relief and excitement.
Her eyes lingered on the door behind which he stood. She couldn't help but think about what could be on the other side—making her face hot as a strong gulp traveled down her throat.
Her eyes then traveled toward his bed; it was not much disheveled and only a few wrinkles could be seen.
She slowly approached the bed while keeping an ear focused on the door.
'What am I doing...' Although she knew it was bad for a maiden to be present inside a boy's room, even though he is her fiancé. However, she couldn't stop herself from satiating her curiosity.
She sat down on the bed, and touched the spot where he had been lying down a few moments ago,
'Warm...' Her eyes turned dazed, and before she knew it, she slowly fell onto the bed and brought the pillow on which he rested, in her arms.
His scent surrounded her, his warmth making her feel calm yet excited at the same time. She has never felt something like this.
Valerie clutched the pillow tighter, her breath shallow and uneven as she buried her face into it. The faint scent of him—comforting and undeniably his—wrapped around her like an embrace, making her heart race.
Her fingers brushed over the soft fabric, imagining for a fleeting moment that it was his skin beneath her touch.
She closed her eyes, her mind filled with thoughts of Austin. His smile, his voice, the way he looked at her with those gentle eyes. She sighed softly, pressing her cheek into the pillow as if it could bring her closer to him.
Her hand wandered to the blanket, fingertips grazing over it as she thought about how he must have wrapped it around himself, seeking warmth. The thought sent a shiver through her, a mixture of nervousness and longing.
'What would he think if he saw me like this?' The question echoed in her mind, but she couldn't pull herself out of the bed.
Her lips parted slightly as she whispered his name into the quiet room, her voice trembling with emotions she could no longer contain.
*Click*
Her eyes widened, the hair strands on her back stood erect in alert, and like a breeze, she flew out of his bed to stand at the exact spot where he left her.
Austin, freshly out of the bath, froze at his place as he looked at his fiancée, whose face was flushed and eyes watery slightly.
"Was I hallucinating, or were you really on my bed?"
Valerie did her best to retain her composure, however, her reddening cheeks exposed the truth, while she lied through her teeth,
"It must be the side effect of the medicine."
Austin raised his brows, barely suppressing himself from chuckling as he asked, "Why don't you sit down? Not like maidens are not allowed to at least sit on their fiancée chair, right?"
Valerie knew her Lord was teasing her now. However, she was so embarrassed by her actions just now that she couldn't even mutter a response.
Wordlessly, Valerie sat down.
Austin asked her, "Milk tea works for you?"
Valerie rose from her seat before suggesting, "Let me prepare the tea."
Austin smiled at the lady and shook his head, "It's your first official visit to my humble abode. Let me show some hospitality, my pretty lady."
Valerie shyly lowered her eyes before she sat back down.
Austin took the tea leaves from the shelf before putting them inside the boiling pot along with water. He used to like a mug of beer early in the morning, but after his rebirth, his taste changed. After all, no girl likes a man whose mouth stinks of alcohol.
While Austin was preparing the tea, he asked the other one, "Do you know if there is any change in the tournament preliminaries?"
Valerie was taken aback by the sudden shift of conversation, she soon answered nevertheless, "Until now, the students council has received no information regarding the changes. However, considering the new law enforcing an official member of each school in the Valor Council, there can be a few changes."
The Continental Council of Valor was the group of people who organized the tournament between the seven academies every year.
However, last year, they were blamed for interfering too much. The newspapers further elevated the situation by criticizing the council for showing partial treatment.
"You will possibly participate in the elite division?" Austin asked, a fond smile on his face.
There are two divisions in the tournament; for the first and second year, the rookie division is arranged where they need to perform tasks a lot easier and safer compared to the Elite division, in which the third year participates.
The difficulty of the tasks assigned to the Elite division was close to the military level.
Only a few individuals from the first or second year get selected for the Elite Division, and considering Valerie's strength, she undoubtedly would be chosen as one of the Elites.
"Ah..." Suddenly, Austin found a warm hand overlapping his hand, as Valerie stood behind him and softly whispered,
"In the tag team battle...I want my Lord to be my partner."
Austin's breath was caught in his throat as he gazed at her charming eyes, which held a sense of stubbornness.
Austin couldn't stop himself from smiling before assuring her, "I will be there with you."
----------**---------
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 31: Chapter 30- Soul Shard
chapters.content:
Chapter 31: Chapter 30- Soul Shard
Nearly three months there were, for the tournament to officially begin. Austin was barely a D-rank warrior as of now with a weak First-stage Soul Shard.
If someone wants to participate in the Elite category, then they should be in B-rank or above, like Valerie, who is an A-rank officially, but unofficially, she might as well have reached S.
It must sound almost impossible for someone to progress two ranks to participate in the Elite division. And until now, Austin also was thinking of participating in the Rookie-division.
However, now that his fiancée has asked, by no chance he would participate as a rookie.
Walking in the garden with their hands connected, Austin asked, "I will recover by tomorrow and I am hoping you will resume my training by then."
Valerie was about to deny his request, considering it was necessary for him to properly recuperate for another week....however, seeing the determination in his eyes and what they talked about just now back in his room, all she could do was to nod.
The duo continued to talk things about the tournament and the preparation required when suddenly Valerie asked,
"Can I ask you something about your Shard?"
Seeing her being so hesitant, Austin was confused, "Why are you being so nervous?"
"...because I know that you don't like when someone talks about your Shard."
Austin then realized the reason for her apprehension.
Austin's Soul Shard was a matter to joke about in the past. People used to laugh behind his back about his Soul Shard, calling it weird names. So Austin developed a sense of agitation and always fought the person who talked about his Shard.
However, now things are different.
"As my teacher and my fiancée, you have all the right to ask me whatever you want." His warm smile removed the stress, making her shoulders relax as she heard him add,
"Tell me what you want to know?"
His casual tone allowed her to verify that he wasn't forcing himself here.
"Initially, you awaken a small piece of Shard which was of the same size as a stick...then suddenly, one day, you were holding a dagger a few days before the academy assessment test."
Valerie remembers everything related to her Lord. She was herself quite disheartened to see her Lord desperately trying to make a weapon out of his Shard back then. However, naturally, he was failing every time.
But suddenly, one day, when she went to the palace, a few days before the examination, he was practicing with daggers carved out of his soul.
Austin dug deeper into his memories to remember what happened that day. Since that day was quite a special one for the original owner of the body, Austin still vividly remembers that day.
"You remember I had a bandage wrapped around my head?" He asked, to which Valerie nodded. She was so excited about the transformation of his Shard that she never asked about his injury.
Austin informed her, "A day before that, I went to hunt wild beasts in the forest...all alone." Valerie was taken aback,
"But you were not allowed-"
"Yes, I know that no royalty is allowed to hunt beasts without taking soldiers along with them. But it was easy for me to escape since the majority of the focus remained on Aiden."
A tinge of sadness flashed in her eyes followed by frustration. How can they be so lenient to not even notice Austin's absence?
Austin softly caressed her head to soothe her anger as he added, "I was frustrated that day that I couldn't develop my Shard at all; as such, I went to vent my frustration by killing a few beasts. I didn't know when I returned to my room or when the medic healed me since all night long I was just holding my Shard and sulking at my disability."
Valeria grew concerned as she held his arm. Her eyes trembled and she inwardly blamed herself for not being there when her Lord needed her.
"At that time, any word from you would have felt like you were making fun of me, so it's good that you didn't approach me at that time," Austin assured her, "It was good that I was alone that night."
Heaving a sigh, he told her what he felt that night, "I was hoping that either if something happens to the Soul Shard or I just...don't wake up tomorrow."
Her chest tightened, and her hands shook slightly as she tried to process what she'd just heard. The thought of Austin—her Austin—feeling so broken and alone was too much.
Tears bubbled in her eyes, and Austin instantly regretted telling her about it.
"If you start crying now...I won't tell you-"
"No, please...I want to know it all." Valerie insisted. She wanted to know everything he had gone through; experiencing even a percent of that pain would make her feel that she shared his burden.
Austin sighed and softly wiped her tears while he relayed, "...when I woke up, something miraculous happened and my Soul Shard took the form of daggers." He finishes quickly so she doesn't feel sad anymore.
Austin has the recollection of how happy he was that day when something meaningful appeared before him in the form of his Shard. He was jumping on his bed, dancing around, and nearly fell unconscious because of a sudden rush.
It took a few moments but Austin somehow calmed his lover and brought her to sit on the nearby bench.
"So yeah, this is the whole story behind my Soul Shard. I haven't told anyone about it except for you." Offering her some water, he continued, "However, I cannot say that my Soul Shard has ascended."
Valerie blinked in confusion before she finished gulping the water and asked, "But your weapon did transform, no?"
One's Shard can go through multiple transformations, and considering the form of Austin's Shard changed, Valerie assumed it must have gone through evolution.
However, "The strength behind my Shard remained the same, and the Astral Dial also said my Soul energy hasn't progressed at all."
Valerie frowned. This was unexpected.
However, before she could have asked him something further, someone called out,
"Happy birthday, Austin."
It was Rhea.
----------**---------
A/N:- Thanks for reading. If you are enjoying the story so far, make sure to drop a review/comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 32: Chapter 31- Priceless gift
chapters.content:
Chapter 32: Chapter 31- Priceless gift
Valerie...she is no longer your enemy and also stays away from your Lord. You need to retain your calm and behave like an adult. You are not a hopeless maiden in love who will glare at the woman who once was after your Lord. You need to be forgiving and move forward. Yes, you have to!
"Did I do anything wrong?" Rhea couldn't help but ask the violette with a helpless sigh, "You are intently staring at me so I thought...."
"I am not staring at you. It's my normal gaze." Valerie fought back however, even Austin could tell that Valerie was being anything but normal at the moment.
However, that's what makes her adorable.
He hooked his arm with hers before responding to the pinkhead, "Thank you. Are you out here to work out?" He asked to cool down the atmosphere a little.
After conversing with the Protagonist, he realizes that all pink heads aren't evil, and this Protagonist isn't unbearable like some other reverse harem protagonists he has heard about from his online friends.
Rhea also removed her eyes from Valerie, seemingly accepting her fate to be always scorned by her, as she said, "Yep, wanted to shake off the tension a little. Anyway, how old did you turn this year?"
"Seventeen." Smilingly he responded.
"So any plans today?" Saying so, Rhea glanced at Valerie, only to find a subtle excitement appearing in her eyes, making it evident that the disciplinary chief must have planned something.
"I was thinking of going to the market and buying a few things today."
Rhea again glanced at Valerie and found that subtle panic in her eyes now, urging the pink head to say,
"Uh-I heard there would be a major sale on clothing items today, so the rush in the market would be quite chaotic. Why don't you go there on the weekend?"
Another glance and Rhea was relieved to see the serenity returning to Valerie's gaze.
'Phew~'
Austin was surprised, "A sale? Off-season? It's unexpected..."
Seeing Austin suspecting her words, Rhea suggested, "You are injured, Austin and the Headmaster have also said to stay indoors for the time being."
The blond Prince nodded, "Yes, you are right. Thanks for the advice."
The pink head gave a smiling nod before she excused herself, "I will see you in the class."
Seeing the girl depart, Austin said, "We should also return to our rooms and prepare for the classes."He was resuming classes after a long time, so surely he wouldn't want to arrive late."
"Uh-" Valerie had something to ask; however, she forgot what it was. However, she knew it was something important.
"Yes?" Austin's brows were raised as he looked at the girl.
However, soon she shook her head, "It's nothing. Let me escort you back to the dorm."
Austin didn't resist since every minute with Valerie was bliss for him.
----------**---------
*Knock*
Austin was getting ready in his room when he heard the knock, "Come in, Sebas."
The door was unlocked, only to reveal the grey-haired man standing on the other side with a soft smile on his face, "Happy birthday, young lord."
Austin raised his brows, "Did you wake up late?" Generally, it has always been Sebastian who wished him first. However, today he arrived late.
"I was about to approach you, but when I heard Lady Valerie's voice from your room, I took the cue and stayed away until she was around."
Austin paused while he was tying his shoelaces and looked at the man with his eyes slightly parted wide,
"Sebastian...you know you are a great man, right?"
The man couldn't stop himself from chuckling, "I am aware, my Lord."
Stepping towards his master, the butler knelt before him and helped him tie his shoe laces.
Since Austin's leg was injured it was a little difficult for him to perform some of the trivial tasks.
While tying the shoe laces, the older one said, "It always warms my heart to see how brilliantly you have grown up, my lord. You have made several mistakes, but the fact you learned from your shortcomings makes me feel relieved."
Looking up at him, the butler took out something from his pocket before handing it to Austin, "This is a small gift from me. Happy birthday, my Lord."
Austin raised his brows in surprise seeing the detailed design on the small pocket watch.
"This is something I got from my father when he passed away—an artifact that will allow you to pause the time for a few seconds. However, you can use it only once a month since it takes the Lunar essence of a full moon to recharge."
Austin was thoroughly surprised, "Isn't it a very dangerous thing you are giving me?" Just thinking about gaining a few seconds of pause was quite terrifying. One single second of pause can conclude a battle.
Something like this should be a national treasure easily, and here...Sebastian was handing it to him? The second Prince and an academy student no less? Was it some kind of test?
However, Sebastian sighed in relief as he spoke, "I was told by my father to hand it to someone worthy of it. And now, you are wise enough to know its use, My Lord."
Austin was...taken aback. He continued to look at the man for a long time before he leaned forward and wrapped his hands around the man.
Sebastian smiled fondly, like a father comforting a child, he softly patted Austin's back as he heard him saying,
"Thank you, Sebas...thank you for trusting me." It has been so long for Austin to feel so...accepted by someone. Having a loving fiancée was one thing, but Sebastian gave him familial comfort.
Austin retained the original owner's memories but not his feelings. Yet, he knew that if the original had ever felt familial warmth, it must be akin to what he was experiencing now.
The butler continued to smile as he said, "If I don't trust you, then who will?"
----------**---------
A/N:- Thanks for reading. I am so thankful for everyone who wrote a review and regularly posted comments. All those collections, PS and GT, I am so thankful to you all.

chapters.title: Chapter 33: Chapter 32- Not eager?
chapters.content:
Chapter 33: Chapter 32- Not eager?
Not so long after, Austin could be seen heading toward the school building with a content smile on his face.
Sebastian is quite a good man—he realized it again today. Not because he gave him a priceless artifact that would be quite vital for him in the future, but rather because of the trust he showed in Austin by handing him such a dangerous tool.
It wasn't like Austin was searching for validation until now; however, being regarded as a sensible person by someone whom Austin respects was quite elating.
Entering the classroom, he was about to approach Valerie and tell her about the morning...when suddenly he paused upon feeling the oppressive aura from a certain corner of the class.
He turned his eyes and found the source of such intense force was none other than his fiancée who was sitting in the front; in her usual seat rather than with him.
Approaching his beloved, Austin glanced at others and found how each student was seated on their seats rather than moving around or chatting with others as they usually do before the homeroom. Just the aura of the lady was enough to warn them.
Amidst the dark raging storms, Austin was that serene breeze that brought the hurricane to a halt,
"What happened, Val?" He asked as he arrived before her, startling Valerie.
"Ah-n-nothing. Good morning." She collected her thoughts and greeted him immediately.
She was so occupied in her thoughts that she completely missed his arrival....hm?
Ah!
Austin suddenly had a realization, "Did the teacher reject your request to change seats?" Seeing how her bag was still on her usual seat even though they promised to sit together, Austin discerned the cause of her distress.
Valerie's eyes widened as if she was being accused here. However, soon her demeanor returned to normal as she realized lying to her Lord would be a criminal act for her.
"Yes...I am upset because my request was rejected."
Austin heaved a sigh, "I guess it's because of the frequent changes of seats that other students have been making these days that the teacher deemed it wrong to let anyone have their seats changed." Austin discerned the reason for the teacher to reject something the ideal student requested.
It wasn't like Valerie didn't understand the reason, however, why was she obliged to always follow the rules while the other students just do whatever they want?
"I will also break the rules and sit with you." She suddenly got up and exposed her desire.
However, "If you change seats now after getting rejected by the Professor, they will think that you are also undisciplined like other children, and don't give importance to the Professor's words. That would leave a very bad impression of yours."
Although Austin dearly wanted to sit with his Princess, he wouldn't suggest she adopt the method of an unruly student. Or she would become the same kind of student whom she usually punishes.
It wasn't like Valerie didn't understand what her Lord was trying to convey here, however, she couldn't stop herself from muttering,
"It seems...I was the only one...who was eager to sit together..." Her voice was low, and it might be his imagination, but he found his little Villainess to be pouting slightly as well.
Morning sweetness: received.
Holding her hand softly, he pressed her palm against his cheek, making her shiver slightly as he told her,
"How can you say that I didn't want to sit with my lovely fiancée? It's just we need to be a little patient and wait until the month-end seat shuffling. At that time, let's go and request the Professor together. Okay?"
Valerie's expression softened feeling the warmth of his skin as she slowly nodded, "Let's do that."
The atmosphere around the two was so lovely and sweet that no one in the classroom was able to keep their eyes away from them.
They couldn't believe that the same girl who was making others sweat bullets in nervousness just a few moments ago was smiling at her fiancé so kindly at the moment.
And much to the duo's and the whole class' annoyance, someone disturbed their moment as he called out,
"Happy birthday, bro!!" Rudolph entered the class, and upon spotting Austin, he didn't think twice before loudly wishing him and slamming his hand on his back.
*Thwack*
Valerie glared at the big bear before threatening, "Control your actions or I might have to take some action against you."
Rudolph sneered, "It's my friend's birthday. Naturally, I will be excited."
Austin winced, "Thanks but tone it down, Rud." Tightening his hand around hers, he assured Valerie and asked Rudolph, "Did you talk to Rhea?"
Rudolph's smile broadened as he said, "It's all thanks to you that Rhea seemed her usual self. Thanks mate." He was about to give another pat on his back but stopped when he felt the threatening aura from his left.
Austin nodded, "Well, I hope next time you will be able to comfort her much better."
Rudolph grinned, "Leave it to me."
"Okay now, sit down on your seats." Along with Rhea, the homeroom professor entered the class, urging everyone to take their seats.
Rhea hurried towards her seat, which was in the front, just a seat behind Valerie, while Austin walked towards his desk, which was in the back.
The seating arrangements in the class are done based on one's ranking—and at the moment, Valerie and Austin are at the top and the bottom of the list.
After taking the roll attendance the Professor stood on the podium and said, "Before starting the class, I would like to remind you all about the assessment tomorrow."
Austin frowned as he listened to the teacher intently.
"To maintain your ranking in the class or to improve it, every month this assessment happens. If you perform well, then it will reflect in your final exam scores but if you perform badly, you might get demoted to a different section." When the Professor said that, her eyes traveled towards Austin for a moment.
The blond Prince realized that his chances of getting demoted were the highest in the class.
'Damn...gotta ace the test tomorrow!'
---------**--------
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 34: Chapter 33- Spoiling
chapters.content:
Chapter 34: Chapter 33- Spoiling
Valorian Academy—the top-ranking academy in the nation which allows only two hundred students each year to enroll and has only four classes for each group.
The last hundred students are regarded as the second division and receive much more attention because of their weak standings during the assessment. The remaining hundred come in the first division.
It is said that those in the first division surely receive a good opportunity after graduation. The ranking certificate a student gets upon graduation gives a student priority over other students.
As such, it was the dream of every student to pass the academy from the first division and if it was from the first class—the Apex Circle—of the academy, then a golden future is inevitable.
Austin was able to reach this stage because of his academic brilliance and the hard work he has put into his battle techniques over the years. Since he wanted to make himself look better than his brother and get the attention of his parents, Austin trained each day, day and night, without rest.
Despite being a Prince and someone with a secure future, he continues to sharpen his skills, as if he doesn't work hard, he might not be able to survive for long.
During those times, it was only Valerie and Sebastian who looked at him from afar and they always remained concerned to see how desperately Austin was trying to become better.
After those sleepless nights, Austin finally reached the Apex Circle of the academy....however, as one could expect from the top students of the kingdom, he was still the twentieth ranked in the class.
And tomorrow, if he doesn't perform well, he might as well get demoted to the Vanguard Divison.
In the past, if it had been for his reputation, then at present, it was because of his fiancée that Austin didn't want himself to get demoted.
During the lunch break, Austin was intently thinking about the assessment, and without asking him, Valerie knew the thoughts revolving in his head.
With a worried expression, she suggested, "I will ask the Professor to shift your assessment to a later date."
Austin was startled to hear that, "No..why?"
"You are still not in your best shape to give it your all." Valerie reasoned, her tone a little quieter.
Austin realized that he might have asked rudely, "I am sorry, I didn't want to..." He held her hand softly and told her, "Thank you for worrying for me, Val, but getting special treatment would be unfair on those who still give their assessment despite being injured."
This was the school for warriors. Naturally, injuries and wounds were something they incurred daily. And if Austin gets some days to prepare, then surely others would follow suit and ask the same.
Valerie still looked apprehensive, but she didn't foolishly keep insisting and said, "There is a balm that my mother gave me a few months ago. Let me apply it to your wound today."
Austin heaved a sigh, "If that makes you feel better then sure. Umm, should we go to the infirmary?"
Valerie glanced around a bit, the action made her look adorable when she moved her round eyes left and right before she leaned forward and said,
"Exactly at seven-fifteen, the dorm warden goes for a walk. I will guide you."
Austin was shocked, "Are you inviting me to your room?"
Valerie blushed, hearing him say it so explicitly..
She looked at him with an upturned gaze, before asking, "...you won't come?"
"I will be there."
She smiled.
There was not a chance in seven hell that he would reject such an offer, and more so, when she was asking so cutely.
After a brief pause, he asked, "What is tomorrow's assessment? The regular sparring?"
Valerie shook her head, "Beast hunt; the students would be given a certain time slot to hunt a monster to pass the test and several things would decide the test results."
Ah! Austin suddenly realized which arc this was. He has some remembrance about this short arc right after Valerie's expulsion that occurs in the forest when Rhea faces a monster that was not supposed to be there.
Rhea was still a B-rank, and the monsters were only supposed to be of C-rank at best, considering the average levels and battle experience of students.
However, being the protagonist, how could she have faced a normal monster and passed the exam like normal students?
'So it is tomorrow eh...' Naturally, he could not tell Valerie about it, and considering she would be around, Austin knew that the danger would get subdued much more easily than it did canonically.
'Poor Rhea...' Naturally, now that Valerie would take down the monster, Rhea's development would be stolen. But not like he could do anything about it.
"Austin, I will be around, so if you need my help, just call me, okay?"
The blond Prince gave her a smile of assurance before he asked, "I should probably clear this task in the minimal time and without damaging the beast's body much, right?" He asked, a bit uncertain given this mode of assessment was not often adopted.
Valerie nodded and provided him with a bit more details, which generally a student is not aware of, which the Professors take into account while judging a student's skills.
Austin intently listened to her and inwardly noted everything in his mind so that tomorrow, he could perform well.
Once she was done, Austin leaned back in his seat and with a sigh, said, "I feel quite selfish to have taken advantage of your knowledge."
Valerie shook her head, a smile of contentment on her lips, "As a council member, if I cannot help the one I care for, then what's the point of having this position?"
Austin teased, "Don't spoil me too much or I might start demanding things from time to time."
Valerie rested her face on her hand and looked at Austin with a warm gaze, before whispering, "I would love to fulfill your demands. Whatever they might be."
"///" Okay, she might not be thinking about 'it,' but surely when she says things like that, more so with that charming look on her face, even someone with quite an experience as Austin couldn't help but feel shy a little.
'My fiancée can be dangerous even without a weapon...'
----------**---------
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 35: Chapter 34- Caught?
chapters.content:
Chapter 35: Chapter 34- Caught?
[Capital of Eryndor]
The palace was alive with celebration, its usual grandeur glowing with bright and joyful colors. The golden spires gleamed in the light of the setting sun, and banners of red and gold fluttered from every corner, adding a cheerful touch to the royal structure.
The grand gates, carved with images of mythical beasts, were draped in ribbons and flowers. Musicians stood nearby, playing lively tunes that welcomed everyone with a sense of excitement.
The wide marble paths leading to the entrance were lit with torches, their flickering flames casting a warm glow over the arriving guests.
Inside, the great hall was stunning. Lanterns hung from the high ceiling, their soft light making the polished floor shine. The walls were decorated with flowing curtains of green and blue, mixed with garlands of fresh flowers that filled the air with a sweet smell.
Long tables stood on either side of the hall, covered with all kinds of food and drink. There were trays of shiny fruits, steaming meats, and cakes decorated with intricate patterns. Crystal pitchers sparkled as they held colorful juices and wine.
The Lords of several noble houses, their families, and some guests from foreign lands were all gathered around on the joyous occasion of the second Prince's birthday and the First Prince's arrival.
"They say it, but I have mostly seen them celebrating the first Prince's return rather than congratulating the second Prince." One of the many groups was involved in the conversation relating to the situation with the royal family.
"Well, considering their worth it's no wonder that they pay more attention to the eldest one." Another woman voiced her opinion, and it wasn't just her who felt this way. Mostly everyone present around the grand hall knows that the eldest Prince is both strong and intelligent. There was no comparison between them.
"I have heard that the Second Prince hasn't even returned this year, yet they are celebrating the day." The third one muttered with a sneer.
And not only them but many others were aware that Austin didn't return this year for some unknown reason. However, the very fact that they had arranged the celebration made it obvious who held more importance in the royal family.
...
"This is wrong, mother." Inside the room of the King, the three family members of the royal family were present, and currently, the eldest child of the Monarch seemed quite displeased.
"I was about to return to the Academy and spend the birthday together with my brother. But you arranged everything here and forbade me to go as well." Aiden had a frown on his face and his tone was laced with displeasure.
The silver-head woman approached her lovely child and said, "My dear Aiden, your brother chose to remain alone this year and spend the birthday with his fiancée. Your father did ask him to come back but he denied."
Hearing that, Aiden's eyes widened slightly, "He said that?" He turned his gaze towards the patriarch and found him nodding,
"He wanted to spend the day with Valerie."
Aiden was surprised. Turning away from them he slowly muttered, "I thought they didn't have a good relationship? This is too sudden."
Hearing his words, the Queen added, "Isn't it good that now Austin has accepted his fiancée and we don't need to be so worried about him?"
A malicious grin extended his lips as the silver-headed prince muttered, "Yes, indeed, it's quite fascinating that they are now close."
Wiping off his smirk, he turned around and asked his parents, "Duke Corwon is joining the celebration, right?"
Cedric nodded, "Yes, he surely will. Is there something you wish to talk to him about?"
Aiden smiled fondly and told them, "Just wanted to let him know how his daughter was now happy with her betrothed. After all, as a father, he must be worried about her, no?"
Cedric narrowed his eyes, however, before he could say something, his wife beamed,
"Brilliant, baby. You definitely should talk to him and elevate his worries."
Although it was fleeting Cedric felt something was suspicious. But it was like a faint breeze passing by, he didn't think about it again.
-----------**---------
Back in the Academy, as Valerie said, exactly at seven fifteen Austin saw the warden heading toward the garden with her pet bird cradled in her arms.
The woman looked dangerous enough to make Austin hesitate since he knew getting caught meant another week in the infirmary.
However, he held himself together and once she walked fairly away, he draped the shawl over his head to hide his identity and entered the dormitory.
Since it was time for dinner, most of the students have gone to the cafeteria. Since tomorrow was the assessment, some of them were even practicing until now.
Austin was also planning to do some late-night warm-up and train with Valerie tomorrow morning to have his limbs warmed up a bit.
However, as of now, his focus is on reaching his fiancée.
Silently walking through the corridors he followed the small map she gave him. It was adorable how she drew even a few plants and paintings on the map so he could know that he was on the right path.
"Come on, now!"
Just as he reached the floor where his destination awaited, he heard the voice of a few females approaching.
Austin hurriedly climbed the stairs and waited for them to walk away.
Hiding at the corner, he was peeking at those passing girls when suddenly,
*Tap*
His whole body turned still in shock as he asked, "W-Who?"
"Austin?"
Austin felt the voice was familiar and since the other personas identified him, he turned to look at her,
"Student Council President." He muttered upon seeing the raven-haired woman standing there.
The head of the council stood there with a surprised look on her face, "What are you doing here?"
Austin looked uncertain, but before he could have said something,
"He is with me." A third voice interrupted them as they turned towards the violet-haired girl standing at the foot of the stairs.
Austin smiled at his beloved, as Valerie stated, "I have something to discuss with him, President."
The said President grinned, "It must be quite important that the Disciplinary officer broke one of the biggest rule of the Academy and invited her fiancé here."
The serious expression of the violette was ruined by the subtle blush that appeared on her cheeks.
Descending the stairs, the President paused before Valerie and said, "Don't worry, your secret is safe with me."
Once she walked away, Valerie heaved a sigh and extended her hand toward her Lord, "Let's go?"
---------**-------
A/N:- I should increase the word count already. Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 36: Chapter 35- Date?
chapters.content:
Chapter 36: Chapter 35- Date?
It was the first time for Austin to visit Valerie's room. It would be a lie to say that he was not nervous.
Although he had entered a woman's room in his past life, with Valerie, it was different.
He didn't know why, but everything Valerie gave him a different feeling…although he had done several things in the past with different partners, with Valerie, he felt it was his first.
Just like now, how he was hesitant to step inside the room where Valerie spends most of her time other than the classroom.
"Please come in," She said with a smile as they both stood before her room.
With a deep breath, he finally stepped inside—and was rendered speechless as he saw the scene awaiting inside.
The room was enshrouded in darkness and the only source of illumination was the candles on the cake resting over the table.
"It might not be great but I hope you like it…" she nervously muttered as she found him staring at the cake with an unreadable expression on his face.
She didn't have much idea how people celebrate birthdays these days, so she made the same arrangement as her parents used to do back home.
She decorated the room with ribbons and prepared a few snacks…and a birthday cap.
"Val…you didn't have to trouble yourself so much…or that's what I would have said, but right now I am too happy to think about that…"
Austin was feeling a lump in his throat when he saw someone actually caring about his birthday to make so many arrangements.
On his birthdays he has always been alone, and his parents only send some money for him to celebrate.
However, unlike other kids of his age, Austin actually liked it when someone celebrated his birthday; that's why he always bought a cake and cut it all alone in his room.
Even in this life, he never felt people were celebrating his birthday since everyone remained always focused on Aiden.
So…indeed, seeing Valerie caring so much about his birthday…made him emotional.
Inching closer to her, he embraced the girl as he felt his eyes burning with tears,
"I cannot tell you how lucky I am to have you in my life. Thank you for not abandoning me, Val…"
Valerie was slightly shocked but she soon calmed herself down and wrapped her hand around his back.
Resting her head on his shoulder she whispered, "I am very thankful to have you in my life as well. And until death separates us, I promise to be by your side."
Those words she always said in her mind previously, she was able to relay to the person today.
The duo remained hugging for another minute before Austin said, "Now, let's cut the cake before the candles melt."
Valerie nodded with a smile, "I will bring the knife."
As she walked away, Austin looked around the room and found that she had decorated the room quite well. And considering there was no shop around that sold these things, it must have been quite difficult for her.
Austin then looked at the cake and nearly chuckled as he saw that she nearly wrote 'M' as for 'My Lord' but then changed the M for A and wrote his name instead.
'Seriously, this girl…'
Valerie blushed when she saw her betrothed smiling while looking at the cake.
"L-Let's cut the cake…" The blush on her cheeks was prettier than the design of the cake so Austin began looking at his beloved instead.
"Do I make a wish?" He asked and found Valerie nodding her head vigorously,
"Yes, you should."
Austin closed his eyes with a smile and blew the candles as he wished,
'Whatever deity listens to my prayers, please bless our relationship.'
Once he opened his eyes, he found Valerie wearing the birthday cap and singing,
"Happy birthday, happy birthday; I wish you a very, very happy birthday."
Seeing that adorable little cap and the way she swayed left to right, he chuckled.
The room was filled with happiness as the duo enjoyed each other's presence.
For them, not a third person was required. Not a grand celebration was needed. No fancy gift or grand feast was needed when they both had each other.
….
Valerie had prepared some sweets and snacks, which they both enjoyed, along with the cake.
Austin loved the cake because he liked the soft bread rather than the cream. And thankfully, Valerie added very little cream.
"I followed the recipe and it turned out well." Valerie smilingly told him as he continued to praise his fiancée.
Although she made it sound so simple, looking at her burnt fingers, he could tell that she put a lot of effort into this.
"Hmm, let me see what you have gifted me," Austin said as he took the small box from nearby.
Valerie seemed slightly nervous; after all, this was the first time she had chosen a gift for him. Until now, it was her father and mother who brought gifts for Austin.
Austin unwrapped the gift and was amazed to see a red and white scarf resting inside,
"Woah…this is unexpected."
Valerie, while rubbing her thumbs against each other, stated, "It has been long since I knitted something…I hope you like it."
Austin paused and looked at the girl with his brows raised, "You knitted it?"
Valerie slowly nodded, "I wanted to give you something that I made…and since winters are approaching…"
The first thing she thought was a blade to give him; however, considering Austin receives mostly weapons and artifacts during his birthdays, she wanted to give him something unique this time.
So she made some time after classes to knit the scarf.
Austin wrapped the warm scarf around his neck as he muttered, "I will treasure it. Thank you."
After they finished cleaning up, Valerie took out the small container of the balm she talked about and asked Austin to fold his pants.
Austin did as she asked, and sat down on the bed.
Valerie winced upon seeing the injury around his knee. It was still quite swollen, and the bone around the kneecap was still quite fragile.
"It won't heal the wound but surely would provide relief and strengthen your muscles."
She spoke as she knelt down on the floor, urging Austin to say, "Sit on a chair."
Valerie shook her head, "It's okay, and you shouldn't keep your leg straight for long."
Austin yielded and offered his wound to her.
Valerie scooped some gel on her fingers before bringing it to his wounds.
"It may hurt a little."
Austin nodded as he saw Valerie gently applying the gel to the affected area.
Her slow movement and gentle care melted his heart as he just watched the girl in a daze.
Looking at the girl closely, Austin couldn't help but feel that there was nothing in this girl that he didn't like. She was just…perfect.
'Then why am I hesitating?'
After thinking for a bit, Austin asked, "Val, after tomorrow's assessment, will you go on a date with me?"
Valerie was startled by the sudden proposal as she looked at him with her round eyes.
However, seeing the plea in his gaze she couldn't remain silent for long before she answered him,
"I would love to."
—-------**--------
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 37: Chapter 36- First hunt
chapters.content:
Chapter 37: Chapter 36- First hunt
"Are you prepared, My Lord?" Sebastian asked, as Austin changed his attire and wore the expedition gear, and got prepared for the assessment.
It was mid-nood when the students were provided an hour of break so they could mentally and physically prepare themselves for the hunt.
Looking at the older one, Austin gave him a short nod before saying, "I think I can do this." After today's training and the fact that Austin has knowledge of the future, he knew he would be able to make it out alive and safe today.
"Even if you don't do well today, Young Master, don't forget that you still will get a lot more opportunities in the future. So please, pay attention to your safety."
Austin nodded, "Yep, I know. And you don't need to worry, because of you and Val, I cannot let myself get any more injured."
Taking a pause, and looking at his butler, Austin added with a thin smirk, "But don't assume that I am going to fail this one. I am going to retain my position in the Apex Circle."
Sebastian was rendered speechless for a moment. The confidence in his eyes and the way he left no room for persuasion left the man helpless.
In the end, Sebastian could only hope that his young lord, succeed in his venture.
—----**-----
The students 2-A were standing side by side near the rear entrance of the Academy.
They all were wearing similar uniforms. The top was a fitted jacket made of reinforced yet breathable fabric, tailored to allow a full range of motion. Its high collar provided protection against the elements, while multiple pockets were strategically placed for carrying tools and small supplies.
The trousers were sturdy and flexible, made from a lightweight yet tough material resistant to tears. Reinforced knee pads were built into the design, offering extra protection during treks through rough terrain.
Students were allowed to carry additional weapons, artifacts, and potions for this assessment.
Austin was wearing a pair of steel knuckles since he knew his Soul Shard was unreliable.
He was standing on the extreme right while Valerie was on the extreme left.
He couldn't turn to look at her. That's why he was waiting for the opportunity to see his Princess in this attire.
"Okay now that you all have gathered and seem prepared, I would like to tell you a few rules you need to keep in mind during this assessment."
The instructor was a tall woman with long green hair and a pair of piercing violet eyes. Austin remembered her name to be Victoria.
With her left hand on her waist, the woman began, "First, your goal: hunt monsters, the minimum limit is one, and the maximum is none. You have six hours in the forest so utilize your time wisely. Second, you cannot hunt your fellow classmates. Under any circumstances, you are not allowed to launch any attack which could harm your classmates. Third, if you feel your life is at risk or face any unexpected situation, use the spell [Regilia] or light up a torch provided to you."
Austin checked the SOS torch which he had kept in his pocket. Since he couldn't chant a spell, this was his best option if something went awry.
"Fourth, this is an assessment to test your individual strength and brilliance on the battlefield. So helping out others would have your points deducted. Be careful about that," When she said that, the teacher turned her eyes between Valerie and Rhea alternatively.
Valerie remained nonchalant while Rhea awkwardly smiled.
Victoria asked in a louder voice, "Cadets, are you ready?!"
"Yes, ma'am!"
The woman nodded, "Move out!"
At once, every student dashed ahead, a huge cloud of dust erupting as they entered the forest.
Austin was also like others, as he entered the forest, and after taking a few steps, he came to a halt.
'Okay, let's see…' If he remembers correctly, the forest was densely populated with monsters on the north-west side. And currently, he was standing somewhere around the south-east.
His first goal was to hunt a beast as soon as he could so that when the real threat arrived, he would have enough points. After all, when 'that being' would make an appearance there was a high chance for the professors to end this assessment.
So before that, he would gain some experience of hunting. Well, forget about the points, the experience is what matters.
'Okay, so the first step is…' He was just trying to try and sense the nearest beast when suddenly he felt something jumping towards him, urging Austin to sidestep, and barely dodge the beast.
"Fuck!" He cursed as he saw a sabertooth tiger landing in the space where he once stood.
'Brilliant…' Austin grinned as he got up on his feet and gripped his Soul Shard.
The manifestation of his soul glimmed with a deathly illumination as Austin stared at the seven-foot-long beast in the eye.
Austin had retained the memories of the previous owner so he knows about the weak points of the beast.
Its throat.
*Grr*
The tiger growled, ready to lunge any moment as it moved in a circle and retained its gaze on its prey.
Austin didn't flinch, his breathing steady despite the heavy tension in the air. His grip on the steel knuckles tightened, the glow of his Soul Shard pulsing faintly in sync with his heartbeat.
The sabertooth tiger growled low, its massive claws raking the dirt as it prowled in a circle. Its golden eyes locked on him, hungry and calculating.
'It's stronger and faster. I can't face it head-on,' Austin thought, his mind racing. 'But its movements are predictable. It's a beast, not a tactician.'
The tiger lunged suddenly, a blur of muscles and sharp fangs. Austin dove to the side, feeling the air shift as claws swiped inches from his face. He rolled to his feet, heart pounding, and quickly scanned his surroundings.
The forest floor was littered with broken branches and uneven terrain. Perfect.
As the tiger spun around, ready for another attack, Austin kicked up a cloud of dirt into its face. The beast snarled, momentarily blinded, giving him just enough time to grab a thick branch from the ground.
The tiger roared, shaking its head clear, and leapt again. This time, Austin ducked low and swung the branch with all his strength, aiming for its exposed underbelly. The wood cracked on impact, making the beast howl in pain, but it wasn't enough to stop it.
The beast suddenly used its skill and dashed toward Austin with faster pace, leaving no room for him to dodge.
"Guh!" Austin cried in pain as the tiger rammed its head into his chest, and threw the blond into the nearest tree.
It wasn't enough that the tiger pressed its massive paw against Austin's body to keep him pressed.
"*ROAAAAAAR*" Already considering it its victory, the tiger roared, but then,
**TREMBLE**
An aura that made the tiger tremble in fear, radiated from behind. The roar silenced up under the pressure as the beast felt its instincts shouting at it to run away.
**SQUELCH**
Austin took the advantage of the distraction and plunged his dagger into the tiger's vulnerable neck.
"*GRUOO*" The beast growled in pain as it swayed its head left and right to release the grip. However, Austin clung to his dagger and while gritting his teeth, he stabbed the dagger deeper,
"HAAAAA!!!" A loud cry of agony mixed with agitation echoed as Austin suddenly pushed the tiger back and got up on his feet
The tiger was bleeding profusely and was trying to get away, however, like shackles connecting them, Austin kept stabbing the dagger until the beast stopped moving around.
"*Gruff*" The last groan of pain seeped through the dying beast throat, as Austin stated,
"I hope you attain peace in the afterlife."
Praying for his first hunt, Austin began to pull out his dagger….only to find his eyes widening.
"What the heck…" he continued to pull and pull but the Shard seemed like getting endlessly pulled out of the dead beast's body.
"Damn…" the moment he took the whole dagger(?) out, he realised the reason why the beast died so easily.
Subconsciously, Austin augmented his Shard and increased its size.
But before celebrating the achievement, he looked at the one who assisted him and waved at her, "Thanks for that. See you later."
He received no response but he knew she was there.
His guardian angel. His dear Villainess.
—------**-------
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 38: Chapter 37- Catastrophe(1)
chapters.content:
Chapter 38: Chapter 37- Catastrophe(1)
It was strange. First, Austin was able to detach his Soul Shard to make it a melee weapon against Parkinson and now he was able to Augment his Shard without even trying.
What was this? A sudden change because Austin's soul was merged with someone who doesn't belong to this world?
As of now, Austin could only think of that being the reason responsible for this sudden change.
He was happy that he was progressing rapidly, more so when his goal was to participate in the tournament as an Elite, however, the sudden progression was happening without him realizing the method.
Spontaneous changes can be lethal since you won't know how to trigger it and might not be able to use it when it is needed the most.
For now, Austin was traveling through the forest to find his next prey. The sabertooth would grant him at least five points, and to remain in the Apex Circle he needed five. But, just to ensure his position, he was searching for another beast worth even a single point.
"*HISSS*"
Austin paused as he heard the voice of a serpent nearby, the hair strands on his back standing erect.
He didn't make any restless move since a serpent only makes its presence obvious when its eyes are on the prey. It means Austin was on the radar.
Austin released his Shard from the hand and before hitting the ground, it dissolved in the air.
Closing his eyes, Austin felt his breath turning a little unsteady as he judged the position of himself and his prey. This was his second time coming across a real threat, and it would be a lie to say that he was not scared.
'Keep calm...' Austin clenched his fists, his breaths grew steadier. The serpent's tail wrapped around his legs like a coiling noose. The slithering beast thought him trapped, but Austin's mind worked sharper than fear.
With a flick of his wrist, his Soul Shard materialized behind him, glowing with ethereal light.
"*HISSSSSS*"
