The serpent's hiss turned into a shrill scream as the weapon's sudden presence startled it. It reared back, fangs gleaming with venom, but Austin was already moving.
His boots slammed to the ground as he launched himself backward, narrowly escaping the snapping jaws.
The snake struck like a whip, its speed terrifying, but Austin was quicker. His shard met its attack mid-air, the collision releasing a sharp crack.
'Agh ..it hurts...' Austin winced as his Shard was bitten by the beast; however, he soon recalled his Shard back in his hand and leaped into action.
The zigros snake hissed violently, its body undulating with rage. Austin wasted no time. His figure blurred as he charged, closing the distance in a blink. The snake lunged, its fangs aimed for his throat, but Austin pivoted, his shard slicing upward in one fluid motion.
A streak of silver arced through the air, carving through the serpent's scaled armor. Its hiss faltered, replaced by the dull thud of its severed head hitting the ground.
Austin stood still, panting lightly as the zigross's lifeless body collapsed in a heap. His shard, now dripping with the creature's venomous blood, faded into mist.
Calming his breath, he heaved a sigh; he at least was living up to his rank as a D-rank warrior.
He still has the edge of an assassin even though he was a combatant in his last life.
'I should get going and prepare-' His eyes turned blurry and a sudden rush of nausea made him kneel on the ground.
A very terrifying presence, like a being straight forward abyss, had made an appearance in the forest. Austin was not able to control himself from throwing up as he felt his throat burning and his Soul Shard flickering.
The whole world seemed to be moving before his vision and he was just inches away from fainting.
"Austin!" Valerie suddenly appeared out of nowhere to support her lover. She took out a potion and some water which Austin took and instantly gulped down.
This sensation was too grim and terrifying for him to resist. However, he had a feeling that fainting right now would result in something devastating.
"Val...what is this?" His face was pale and sweat trickled down his head as he asked his fiancée.
Valerie had a frown on her face as she turned her face toward the north and said, "I might be wrong...but this presence exceeds any being that should be present here."
Austin was slightly confused...was the being whom Rhea had to face this terrifying? Wasn't it a bit too overpowered?
"We should get out of this forest and let the Instructor face the danger," Valerie said since her priority lies in Austin's safety.
However, "We cannot leave the forest." Austin muttered, as he got up on his feet and said, "There is a forcefield around the forest. The instructors cannot enter the place."
Valerie frowned in confusion but before she could have asked anything, Austin stepped forward and summoned his Shard in his hand.
Cocking his hand back he threw the Shard with all his strength. The dagger flew towards the Academy in a high arc, however, just after traveling a few meters, it was struck against an invisible wall, stealing all the pace from the dagger.
Austin told her, "I felt it since I was nearest to the exit point. And now I understand why so many beasts were roaming around the border of the forest."
Valerie finished what he was about to say, "They sensed the danger and were running away from it."
Austin nodded; it wasn't like he didn't expect it, however, the presence of the A-rank beast was way above what he anticipated.
Valerie's eyes sharpened, her body rigid as the tremors in the air grew heavier. She stepped forward, her voice low but resonating with authority.
"Stay behind me."
The ground beneath her cracked as an invisible force erupted around her. Austin could feel the weight of her power pressing against his chest—it was suffocating yet awe-inspiring.
Valerie raised her hand, fingers curling as if gripping something unseen. The atmosphere around her spiraled violently, and a chilling wind howled through the forest.
In a heartbeat, the swirling air coalesced into a glowing spear, its shaft forged from shimmering light, and its tip gleaming with a razor-sharp edge. Frost spread outward from the spear, freezing the grass beneath her feet.
Her grip tightened, and the spear pulsed with raw energy, sending sharp gusts of icy wind slicing through the trees. The temperature dropped, her presence turning into a force of nature.
Austin couldn't compare his Shard with hers at all. The only student whose Shard has gone through three evolution.
One of the Seven tools of mass destruction: Shiverfall.
Valerie was about to launch the spear and shatter the barrier when suddenly her eyes widened as she hurriedly turned to her left before slamming her spear against the ground
"Val?!" Austin exclaimed as suddenly huge spikes of ice erupted from the ground and trapped a being within the cage.
Valerie's eyes gave an ominous vibe as she stared at the huge monkey grinning from within the ice cage.
Austin's eyes widened seeing the monster, as he muttered under his breath,
'Isn't this an S-rank monster....why the fuck is it here?'
---------**--------
A/N:- I hope you all enjoyed the chapter. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 39: Chapter 38- Catastrophe(2)
chapters.content:
Chapter 39: Chapter 38- Catastrophe(2)
The plot has shifted somehow. The beast that was supposed to attack the students today was supposed to be an A-rank silver-horned rhino. Rhea would have to fight the beast being the third strongest of the class and someone who feels responsible for the safety of her classmate. And after a lot of struggle and a few flashbacks, she would have defeated the rhino.
Then what happened so suddenly for this Illusion Monkey, which was an S-rank to appear all of a sudden?
'Did Valerie's presence change something?' There is always the concept of the butterfly effect, and there is a saying that the world always tries to balance out forces to keep things in check.
In this world as well, the stronger a warrior becomes, the better the beasts would adapt and evolve.
As such, it would not be a far-fetched theory to say that the presence of an S-rank entity, Valerie, invited this disaster since an A-rank would have been a few swings of Valerie's spears, away from its demise.
"It's breaking..." Austin muttered, and in the next instance he found himself getting embraced
Valerie didn't waste time before carrying her Lord and leaping through the forest to reach a safe distance.
Her priority lies in keeping Austin safe, then only she could focus on defeating the monster.
However, as she anticipated, how far she went she couldn't find herself reaching anywhere.
Heaving a sigh, she paused, "It has already expanded its illusion." Austin stated as he realized that although she jumped quite away, they still were a few meters away from the Monkey who was still inside the ice cage.
Valerie asked, "Can you do me a favor and remain behind me? Please?" The pleading in her gaze explained how much she was worried for him.
However, "Don't treat me like your weakness, Val. I won't slow you down so just fight to your heart's content."
Valerie was rendered momentarily speechless....was she being a bit too protective? Did it hurt his feelings? Agh, she is an idiot.
Turning her attention back to the Monkey, Violette said, "Back me up, my Lord; I might need your assistance soon."
Austin smiled, "Don't worry, I got your back."
The ice cracked and instantly, the Monkey jumped out of the prison, its hulking from heaving with rage to be contained within the prison.
The Illusion Monkey stood tall, its twisted body rippling with unnatural strength. Its dark, matted fur shimmered faintly, as though it were not fully real, blending into the air around it like a heatwave.
Its glowing red eyes burned with malice, locking onto its prey with unsettling intelligence. A long, sinuous tail coiled and uncoiled, each movement brimming with tension, like a predator waiting to strike.
But the most horrifying part was its face—a grotesque mockery of human features, stretched into an eerie, distorted grin that radiated malice. As it moved, its form seemed to blur and shift, creating fleeting, ghostly replicas that vanished as quickly as they appeared, making it impossible to track.
Valerie's eyes glowed. She knew the weakness of this thing and that is its tail. Once you sever it, the Monkey would lose its vector and would be easy to hunt.
Her spear glimmered with a deathly illumination as she held it behind her back, and with her left hand raised, she gestured for him to come.
The Monkey growled before it slammed its balled fist on the ground, making a dent in the surface before it lunged into action.
Just as it launched forward, figure of the monkey blurred, and in the next instance, there were three replicas of the beast.
Austin's eyes widened as he couldn't discern which was the real one. The movie's logic of tracing the shadow also didn't work since all three of them had the same dark shadow.
Valerie's legs tensed as she kept her eyes fixed on her target. She didn't budge from her place until the beast was a spear length away from her before she planted the butt of her Shard on the ground and sent a small shockwave toward the incoming monkeys, making all three of them flicker.
Valerie smirked before she simply stabbed her spear above her head—erasing all the illusions as the beast was caught amidst his attempt to hurt the prey.
However, Valerie failed to stab it; rather, the monkey grabbed her spear and leaped back, trying to snatch the Shard from her.
Valerie narrowed her eyes and summoned the Shiverfall in her other hand; twirling on her feet, she swung the spear with death precision, trying to beside the monkey's neck.
The Illusion Monkey growled, its crimson eyes blazing under the harsh sunlight as it lunged at Valerie. She braced herself, her Shiverfall gleaming like ice in the noonday sun, and met its charge with a vicious upward slash. The spear's edge bit into the Monkey's shoulder, tearing through fur and muscle, but the beast roared and struck back.
Its clawed hand raked across her ribs, ripping through her leather armor and drawing blood.
Austin gritted his teeth but he couldn't find any opening to support his beloved.
Valerie clenched her fist and leaped back, hurling her spear with deadly precision.
The Illusion Monkey snarled and reached out to catch it, but the moment Shiverfall touched its hand, it dissolved into mist. Frost exploded over the beast's arm, encasing it in thick ice.
"Gruooogh!" The Monkey roared, thrashing against the numbing cold, but it didn't notice Valerie above.
Using a sturdy branch as her springboard, she launched herself toward her prey with terrifying speed. The branch snapped under the force of her leap, shards of wood scattering as she descended like a thunderbolt, her eyes locked on the beast's exposed flank.
Cocking her fist, Valerie's muscles tensed like coiled steel before she drove her punch into the Monkey's forehead with devastating force.
CRACK!
The sound of bone fracturing echoed like thunder as the colossal beast—ten feet tall—was lifted off its feet and hurled through the air.
BOOOOOOOM!
It slammed into the ground with earth-shattering force, creating a crater as the impact sent shockwaves rippling through the forest. Dust and debris exploded outward, silencing everything in its wake.
Austin watched, breathless, as his fiancée stood above the destruction, her fist still clenched, her expression cold and unyielding.
'Man...she is so cool.'
----------**--------
A/N:- If you are wondering if Austin is always going to remain on the sidelines, then no, Austin is the main character, so surely he will grow. Just give him some time. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 40: Chapter 39- Catastrophe(3)
chapters.content:
Chapter 40: Chapter 39- Catastrophe(3)
Rhea was near Rudolph during the initial minutes of the assessment, given they targeted the same beast at the same time.
Although Rudolph backed out soon after, given Rhea stabbed the beast, which Rudolph failed to do, they remained close by for the next few minutes...until the catastrophe appeared.
Rhea and Rudolph were in the top five strongest students from the Apex Circle, which explains why, unlike many other students, they didn't fall to their knees and were able to hold their stance.
Rhea was the first one to respond to the danger, as she dashed toward the border of the forest which was near to the Academy.
Her heart was beating rapidly, not only because she was moving her body rapidly but also because she was quite nervous.
This was the second time she had felt such an ominous aura from a being—the first time was when she faced the berserk Valerie back in Parkinson's room.
Although this presence was quite tamer in comparison to what Valerie radiated at that time, it was an irrefutable fact that this beast was not something that should have been present here.
"Rhea, you need to first assess the situation," Rudolph called out which made Rhea frown,
"What's there to assess? We need to take care of the danger before anyone could get harmed."
Rudolph clicked his tongue; this girl was always so hot-headed.
"Listen, why do you think there has been no interference from the instructors until now?" The taller one interrupted Rhea, much to the latter's annoyance.
"What do you mean? Just say it!" She couldn't waste her time here, and let her classmates get harmed. She knew Valerie would be able to handle the situation so Rhea must help the others to evacuate.
However, Rudolph's following words made her frown in confusion, "Can't you feel it? The sudden magical field surrounding us—it's a barrier; I have sensed and attempted to exit the forest. But as I thought, there is indeed someone who chanted this barrier to keep us within the forest."
Rhea asked, "Then shouldn't teachers have already sensed the situation and tried to break the barrier?"
Rudolph shook his head, "I don't know but there is nothing they are doing. As such, the first thing we should do is to take care of the barrier, or the students won't be able to evacuate."
Rhea clenched her fist, as she said, "Then go and search for that chanter while I look for the beast."
"But Valer-"
"I don't think she can do it all on her own," Rhea added, and in the next instance, a pink blur weaved through the forest.
Rudolph remained standing there for a few seconds before he heaved a sigh turned toward his left. As he dashed forward, a few words escaped his lips,
'Let's find this fucker first...'
-------**------
Illusion Monkey is an S-rank beast that was born with the ability to create illusions, divert the attention of its prey, and lure them into its trap. These kinds of beasts, which possess intelligence, generally love to play with their target before devouring them.
The beast Valerie was facing at the moment was no bigger than a teenager, in their terms; as such, although it would be easier to deal with it considering the lack of experience, Valerie needed to counter the short temper of the beast as well.
Just like how a single punch it all took and the Beast already bubbling with anger, the aura of the inhumane making the ground tremble and steam erupting from its body.
Valerie had her eyes trained on the beast; her Shard held firmly in her hand as she awaited its next move.
She could tell that there were no beasts around, thankfully, because of the presence of this hulking monster.
**THUMP** **THUMP**
The beast slammed its fist on its bulging cheats before it lunged into action.
Valerie frowned upon seeing that the beast was not creating any mirage anymore rather charging head on.
Valerie leaped from her position, her spear slicing through the air with a sharp whistle. Her aim was true, the spearheaded straight for the monkey's chest—
Until it wasn't.
At the last moment, the Illusion Monkey vanished, leaving behind a faint shimmer where it once stood. Valerie's spear struck empty air, embedding itself into the ground with a resounding thud.
Her instincts screamed too late.
The beast reappeared at her side, its fist already in motion.
BAM!
Valerie's body flew like a ragdoll, crashing through a cluster of trees. She winced as she landed hard on her side, her grip still tight on her Shard.
"Damn it!" she spat, blood trickling from the corner of her mouth. She forced herself to her feet, her eyes blazing with determination.
The monkey was on the move again, its body a blur of speed and malice.
Valerie slammed her Shard into the ground, summoning a wave of jagged ice that erupted like spears from the earth. The air chilled instantly, her ice magic surging with lethal intent.
But the beast was already gone, leaving only afterimages in its wake.
"Stay still, you monkey!" Valerie roared. She thrust her hand forward, and a torrent of frost shot out, the air crackling as the freezing spell expanded outward.
**THUD**
Suddenly, she heard the sound of two forces clashing from behind, urging the girl to twirl on her feet and witness her Lord protecting her, using his elongated Shard as a shield.
"A-Austin?" She was too startled to respond to his call immediately. But soon her ears picked,
"ABOVE!"
Her body moved on instincts as she stabbed her spear above her head, and this time, it definitely connected.
**SQUELCH**
The Monkey growled as it found its blood freezing by the effect of the weapon.
Valerie gritted her teeth and enlarged her spear.
"*GRUOOOEEGH*" The monkey cried in agony as the whole spear went through its stomach, penetrating from its back.
However, then, much to her shock, the Monkey turned into mist, and the being that appeared from behind the mist was...
"...Rhea?" Her eyes widened as she found that the monkey had tricked her and she ended up stabbing Rhea.
"khuk!" Austin groaned as the monkey he was facing was the real one...
....and the beast ended up breaking Auatin's Shard.
---------**--------
A/N:- If you didn't understand, Rhea jumped to help Austin, but the Monkey used its Illusion, and then you can follow. Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 41: Chapter 40- Catastrophe(End)
chapters.content:
Chapter 41: Chapter 40- Catastrophe(End)
One of the Seven Tools of Destruction, a title given to Shiverfall, born when Valerie pushed her Shard beyond what any mortal should ever achieve.
A skill that defies all comprehensibility and goes beyond any rankings. There are numerous ice users, but none could be compared to the one who cannot only freeze the physical world but influence the soul of a being.
Having the ability to freeze time for eternity around a certain region was the mechanism of Stasis.
In the original timeline, Valerie used it after a lot of research and deliberate practice. However, in this life, the agitation she felt upon seeing the Shard of her beloved getting snapped...his Soul receiving the damage, forced her body and Soul to reveal her Godly side.
....
The air around Valerie turned heavy, an unnatural stillness spreading outward. Her eyes, cold and devoid of emotion, locked onto the Illusion Monkey.
The beast hesitated, its instincts screaming danger. Its illusions flickered erratically, unable to take form. It screeched, panic rising as if sensing an inescapable doom.
Valerie raised her Shard, her movements deliberate yet unnervingly calm. The temperature plummeted, frost creeping along the ground, crackling like brittle glass.
The monkey lunged, desperate to escape, but its body froze mid-motion. Time itself seemed to grind to a halt, the beast's limbs suspended in the air, its terrified eyes wide and unblinking.
Austin, who was helping Rhea to stop her bleeding, had his eyes widened as he looked at the girl.
The mark of a snowflake spread across the whole forest, marking the wilderness within her range of influence as the Monkey was left nowhere to run.
Without a word, Valerie raised her hand. A circle of radiant frost formed beneath the monkey, spiraling upward with glacial precision. The light within the frost burned brighter, an aurora of gold and white that was beautiful yet suffocating, like the gaze of an unforgiving deity.
The monkey's body contorted, frozen mid-scream as the frost encased it. Time itself bent around the creature, its movements slowing to an agonizing crawl until nothing remained but silence.
The frost reached its apex, encasing the beast entirely. A sharp crack split the air as the icy sculpture glowed brilliantly for one horrifying moment—then shattered into a million sparkling fragments, scattering like divine judgment.
There was no resistance since the S-rank beast was never allowed to retaliate against the immortal strength of the being who was supposed to become one of the strongest entities that could rival demigods.
Austin watched her in astonishment and admiration as Valerie ended the Catastrophe in just a few seconds.
'The power that can make even a God envy...damn...she is strong.' Austin was brought back to his senses as Valerie knelt before him, and asked,
"Do you feel alright, my lord? It doesn't hurt anywhere, right? I will bring you to the church right away-" However, her words were interrupted,
"I...am dying...here..." Rhea groaned, unable to believe that she was being ignored even in her final moments.
Valerie narrowed her eyes and took out a potion. It was glowing with a cyan shade which she instantly poured over Rhea's wound and said, "You will be fine now."
Rhea indeed felt better as the warm liquid seeped inside her wounds, and healed her damaged organs. If not for her being awakened, the wound she received might have taken her life by now.
"Thanks..." Rhea muttered, "...well, you injured me so I guess there is no need to thank you."
Valerie remained silent, however, she was frustrated to see the girl resting her head on her beloved's thigh.
Austin, who was unaware of the reason behind her displeasure, said, "It's okay now, Val, you have defeated the foe."
A soft smile bloomed on her face, as Valerie said, "We defeated it...Austin. You protected me at that time, or I might have lost."
Although Austin knew that Valerie would have been fine even if she had taken that hit, he didn't say anything to correct her. It was a part of her, to appreciate his little efforts.
However, even though Austin wasn't able to do much during the battle, he learned several things watching the two powerhouses fight.
He has a long way to go, and fortunately, he has someone who can guide him on that path.
**SHATTER**
Everyone turned their eyes toward the sky as fragments of the barrier fell but disintegrated into nothingness before hitting the tree.
"The barrier seems to be lifted..." Austin muttered. He was aware of who chanted that barrier and planned on harming the students today.
'It's time to bring that man into light...'
-------**------
The students were evacuated and were carried to the infirmary. Since there were not many beds, various students were getting treated in their rooms.
Thankfully, there was enough supply and infirmary staff to handle the situation. And upon the call from the Headmaster, the church workers also arrived to help Austin rebuild his Shard.
Laying on his bed, Austin was recovering just like any other student, and beside his bed was the familiar grey-haired butler.
"I feel so useless these days, my Lord..."
Hearing the man sigh and looking older than his age, Austin felt bad, "It wasn't like you purposely chose to not protect me."
Sebastian didn't say anything but he still was quite disheartened to find his Young Master getting injured so regularly these days.
While Austin munched on the diced apples, Sebastian gave him, he asked, "What happened, Sebas? Why wasn't there any interference from the teachers?"
Sebastian continued to apply cooling ointment to his master's wound as he said, "For the initial few moments, no one noticed any chances, including me. However, the moment I realized the excessive serenity of the surroundings, I knew something was suspicion."
"Then? Did you try to break the barrier?" Austin was aware of the person behind this barrier, but how they prevented the others from damaging the spell from the outside was not within his knowledge.
Sebastian explained, "It was an ancient spell that witches used to utilize at the time of war between civilizations. Since Witches have always been secluded beings, who did not ever want to meddle with others' businesses, they always chanted these kinds of barriers around their town, which prevented any outside forces from disturbing them."
Taking a pause, he added, "The distinctive feature of this kind of barrier is that the more one tries to break it from the outside, the stronger the barrier gets."
Austin raised his brows, "Were witches peace-loving creatures."
Sebastian smiled, a mocking one it seemed, as he said, "If you anger a witch, or harm someone close to them, even if that thing is trivial in your eyes, then there could be nothing more dangerous than a Witch. They are one vengeful creature."
Austin was surprised to hear that, as he asked, "Are there still witches around?"
Sebastian nodded, "Witches can travel through space and time, and they age extremely slowly, compared to us humans. Some say that witches are nothing but myth. But I believe that they are still around."
----------**---------
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 42: Chapter 41- Council
chapters.content:
Chapter 42: Chapter 41- Council
Valerie was summoned by the Headmaster in his office, to report about the incident that transpired in the forest during the assessment.
There was a reason why she was called here alone, and that reason was, "You used an Ex-rank spell that defies the laws of this world. Are you aware?"
Valerie knew what Philius was talking about. And she also knows who reported it to him.
Rhea.
However, it was not like she could have hidden something so massive and devastating from the authorities for a long time, so she just answered truthfully, "I am aware, Headmaster."
Philius leaned forward and asked, "And do you know what my duty is as a Headmaster here?"
Valerie was aware but she didn't say anything; urging the man to utter,
"Anyone who possesses the strength that is wasted in the field they are currently engaged in, then the administrator or head of that field, must report about the entity to the Council."
Philius added, "The Council has already asked for your inclusion in the training camp. However, since you had the support of your father and you showed reluctance to join the ranks, we never forced you."
Valerie was aware, she was told by her father. However, her reluctance arose from the fact that after joining the Council she wouldn't be able to meet her Lord regularly.
Philius heaved a sigh, "If you had agreed, you would have been the youngest pillar. However, let's not talk about it, for now."
With his gaze redirecting towards Valerie, Philius asked, "But now...things are different. If the Council gets to know about the fact that you have surpassed the S-rank, not even I could save you from being taken away."
The Council did not belong to a single nation but was a Union formed by the leaders of the seven major nations of the human side. As such, no authority could go against the decision the Council takes.
Considering the importance of the Council and the things they are responsible for, naturally, they would need to have strong warriors in possession in case the Dark Side decides to attack them.
All the five warriors, who have surpassed S-rank in the past are now known as the Supreme Pillars of Defense. And Valerie would be the sixth.
However, "I don't want to go, Headmaster."
Philius heaved a sigh; he expected as much.
He was aware of Valerie's affection towards Austin and to what length Valerie could go if someone dared to detach them.
And considering Austin's current situation with his family, there should be someone around that boy who can take care of him.
Philius rested his arms on the table and stated, "Look, Valerie, by not telling the Council, I would be betraying humanity. After all, if something were to happen, and you can't be there on time to save others, I would be accountable for that."
The violet-haired girl remained silent, waiting for him to continue.
Philius added, "That's why I cannot allow you to continue being a student of the Academy, until graduation."
Valerie frowned, but before she could have said anything, the Supreme Authority said,
"Until the coronation next year, you can stay by Austin's side. However, after that, I cannot allow you to stay away from the Council."
"But, Headmaster-"
"That's the final decision, Valerie. That's all I could do for you, without getting myself crushed under the guilt of betraying the Council."
Valerie clenched her fist behind her back, before she said, "...understood."
There was nothing she could say to convince him, however, she was reluctant to part ways with her Lord.
Then...what she could do to remove herself from the possible recruitment as a Pillar?
It wasn't like Philips couldn't sense that the girl was still resistant to leaving Austin behind, but he chose to not talk about it anymore, rather, he warned her,
"If you don't want yourself to get forced into recruitment, don't use your Ex-rank skill during the tournament. After all, as of now, only Austin and Rhea know about it other than me....but during the tournament, there would be thousands of eyes watching you."
Valerie gave a firm nod, "Understood."
--------**--------
"Are you sure you don't want me to bring you food?" Rhea's friend, Cassie, asked her as she sat beside the pinkhead.
Rhea hadn't recovered, and there were still bandages around her stomach. Although the potion—it was of the highest grade—healed her internal organs and stopped her from bleeding, there was still damage dealt to her internal parts that needed some time to heal.
Shaking her head, she said, "I am fine, and can go out to have a meal." Rhea assured her. She felt bad to have someone taking care of her.
Although it was an emergency, Rhea didn't like to waste others' time taking care of her.
*Knock*
Hearing the knock, the two ladies turned towards the door, before Cassie got up to check who it was.
"Coming...ah!" She was startled to find the unexpected face waiting on the other end.
"V-V-Valerie?" Cassie was startled to find the violette standing there.
"Valerie?" Rhea was surprised as well, as she called out, "Let her in, Cassie."
The short brown-haired girl panicked before she hurriedly sidestepped and invited the Disciplinary officer inside.
Valerie stepped in before standing before Cassie and stating, "I will be here for the time being; you can go and have lunch."
Cassie was taken aback by the sudden suggestion(?). She glanced at Rhea, and upon finding her nodding in assent, Cassie said,
"Then, excuse me."
Once the third person walked out, Valerie closed the door and approached Rhea.
The atmosphere of the room suddenly turned heavy as Valerie took the seat beside the bed.
There was a dry smile on Rhea's lips, as she asked, "Why do you never smile if Austin is not around?"
Because he is the only reason, why I smile—Valerie inwardly muttered.
Once she sat down, Valerie asked, "Did you tell the Headmaster about what happened back then?"
Rhea was slightly nervous being asked about it, but she chose to remain honest, "Yes, I told him everything."
Valerie suddenly pulled out a rectangular parchment, in which ancient language was inscribed.
"You know what this is?" Valerie asked.
Rhea frowned upon looking at it closely as she muttered, "Oathseal."
Valerie nodded, "I want you to take an oath, that you won't tell anyone about what happened that day."
Rhea was expecting it, yet it didn't stop her from feeling surprised as she asked, "And what are you going to promise me in exchange?"
Without hesitation, Valerie stated, "After graduation, my father will hire you."
Rhea grinned. There was no point in hesitating. Being recruited by the Duke to serve in the military? Well, what can she ask for more?
"Deal."
--------**-------
A/N:- Rhea is one straightforward girl. Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 43: Chapter 42- The reason
chapters.content:
Chapter 43: Chapter 42- The reason
What was there to change and improve?
First was Austin's reaction to the sudden emergence of the Monkey. If not for Valerie being present around him, that late reaction would have been his death.
Austin was new to these dangers. All he has fought in his previous life was humans. Those fights were always predictable and never had been life-threatening—except for those MMA battles he fought after his first breakup.
His strength was growing and so was his Shard, however, he has to choose his enemies and fight those foes whom he can actually defeat. There are about seventy days left before the beginning of the contest; as such, he has to improve fast.
*Knock*
Hearing the knock on his window, he didn't have to look at the person to know who it was. However, who can resist looking at such a lovely face?
Turning his eyes toward the person, Austin said, "It's open, come in."
Valerie shyly lifted the window, before she jumped inside the room.
Considering Austin was forbidden from moving around, Valerie had no option but to show her unladylike side again.
She feels so ashamed yet excited at the same time!
"Are you okay?" She asked as she inched closer to him and revealed the thermos she brought with her.
Bringing a bowl near, she poured the soup she brewed back into her room before serving it to Austin, "Vegetable soup. Since the healer said that you should have easy-to-digest food, I have added very little meat."
Valerie offered the bowl as Austin rested his back against the headboard.
"It smells so good...did you make it?" Austin asked, an excited smile on his face.
Valerie smiled and nodded. Seeing his smile alone allowed her to forget about all the stress she had.
Austin scooped some hot soup and drank it.
"It's quite well balanced, Val. Did you add tomato in it?"
The girl nodded, "I thought it would be too spicy, so I just added tomato paste near the end. It's...not unpleasant right?"
"Are you kidding? I have never had something better than this?"
Although she knew that he was exaggerating, she couldn't stop herself from feeling elated. Being praised by the man she loves hits differently.
While Austin enjoyed the soup, he asked, "Do you not have to rest? I mean you got hit twice by that monster."
Austin has witnessed how strong that Monkey was; those punches Valerie faced were quite devastating and had enough force to crush a lower-ranked hunter's bones to dust.
Valerie heaved a sigh, "Look at you, my Lord...you had your Shard damaged yet you are worrying about me."
Valerie knows the pain of having one's Shard damaged since, in the past, in desperation, she also had her Spear cracked.
It feels like one is sucking your life force at a rapid pace, and the pain is equivalent to how one feels thousands of invisible needles stab at your spirit, leaving behind a relentless ache that doesn't fade.
The pain reverberates through your very being, as if every corner of your soul is crying out in anguish. The pain isn't just physical; it feels like your memories, identity, and emotions are unraveling, leaving you hollow and incomplete.
Despite that pain, Austin kept a bold front in front of Valerie, however, she heard his cries when she left.
Her body shook, and her heart wrenched in great pain, hearing his cries of agony. She still hasn't forgiven herself for letting her Lord face such pain because of her.
"You are blaming yourself and making me feel guilty." Austin suddenly muttered, his eyes drawn to the soup and a sad smile extending his lips.
Valerie's eyes widened as she said, "I-I am not blaming-"
"Who are you lying to, Val? I can read you like an open book, and can tell that you are blaming yourself for what I faced." Tilting his head and after holding her hand softly, he asked,
"Then shouldn't I blame myself for being so pathetically weak, as well?"
"No! You are-" She paused, realizing that saying anything would make it worse.
She first calmed herself down and held his hand back.
Austin gave her the time to collect her thoughts before he heard the girl uttering, "Please forgive me...I shouldn't feel like this, but every time I see you hurt, I feel myself responsible. I feel so frustrated with everything that hurts you...that I just lose my cool every time."
Lying to her betrothed was not a good thing, so she just confessed whatever she felt.
Austin smiled at the girl. She is so lovely, so pure that he feels himself unworthy of her fondness sometimes.
Cupping her cheek, he said, "The real reason why I jumped in was not only because I wanted to protect you, but there was another motive. Do you know what?"
Valerie looked at him questioningly.
Austin's eyes turned cold for a moment, as he confessed, "I just wanted somehow to hurt that beast...see its blood somehow....since the being who hurts you deserves nothing less than death."
A sudden rush of warmth made her face hot, upon seeing her Lord being so protective of her.
The murderous intent he radiated, the way his grip turned firm, and how his whole presence shouted danger, made the girl tear up.
And it wasn't just her eyes that turned moist.
Rubbing his thumb softly on her cheek, he added, "So it's not just you who thinks that way."
"My Lord..." She leaned her face in his hold, feeling his body heat, warming up her whole body.
....
After a few minutes, Austin finished the soup and they were now able to talk casually, given Austin removed a very heavy burden from her shoulders.
They were still holding hands, as Valerie asked, "Are you resuming your training from tomorrow?"
"Undoubtedly. I think I now can control the Augmentation of my Shard."
Valerie raised her brows, "I was really surprised to see the size of your Shard increasing. It's quite an improvement in a very short duration."
Austin smiled in glee, "You think? Well, it must be the training you provided with."
Valerie shook her head, "It's not that, Austin, it's the dedication and intention you hold to improve that has affected your Shard."
Austin was surprised, "Does Soul Shard react to a person's emotions?" There was no evidence of it in books so he wasn't sure.
However, "I always feel that Shards react to their wielder's thought process. That's why I was able to utilize that Ex-rank spell-" Valerie suddenly paused, as she recalled the discussion she had with the Principal.
Austin raised his brows, "Did something happen?" He has forgotten things relating to Council that's why he was genuinely confused by the sudden shift of her temperament.
Valerie hesitated for a moment, but then decided to reveal everything to her beloved, "I...was summoned by the Headmaster yesterday..."
She then told him everything that happened back in the office. The decision he made and the fact that she would have to work for the Council after the coronation next year.
Austin scoffed, "He said until coronation because the Headmaster knows that I will get attacked before that."
Valerie's brows drew closer in a frown, "What do you mean?"
Austin trusted this woman, so he didn't hesitate to reveal, "He isn't like how the world perceives him. My brother is a very cunning and selfish person. The slight chances I have to inherit the throne, he would try to eliminate those chances by either crippling me or worse, killing me."
The air around the two turned frosty. It wasn't that Valerie never suspected the elder brother of her beloved, but to think Aiden would be such a bastard(she trusts Austin's words blindly).
Austin smiled at his girl and said, "The Headmaster must be fearing that as well; that's why he is allowing you to remain by my side to protect me until coronation."
Valerie now understood the situation. Although she could risk her life to protect her beloved, she doesn't know if the risk would lessen even after the coronation.
"Austin...should we run away and start a new life somewhere far away?" She was a little frustrated by all the complications rising, and there was a slight desperation to just have a quiet life with her Lord that urged her to say that.
For a moment, Austin just wanted to say yes. After all, he never desired wealth or power. He just wanted to lead a peaceful life with the one he adores. However, considering the future, he couldn't just run away, or God knows what the protagonist might end up doing in front of the final threat. Worse, she might die before fighting the Demon Lord.
Cupping her cheeks, Austin assured her, "Although it sounds tempting, parting ways from our families would hurt them as well." Valerie didn't look up, feeling a little wronged that her Lord didn't want to start a new life with her. Although she knew what he was saying was right and practical, she couldn't stop herself from feeling like this.
Seeing that slight bulge of her cheek, Austin could not stop himself from chuckling as he asked, "Okay, I have angered my fiancée. What can I do to compensate?"
Valerie flinched, but then, while controlling her excitement(barely), she said, "A-A date?"
--------**-------
A/N:- Damn, she is so cute and easy to please. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 44: Chapter 43- Date
chapters.content:
Chapter 44: Chapter 43- Date
Austin promised a date to his fiancée so it was her right to demand a date.
Since it was only afternoon and from tomorrow, they had to continue their training and classes, Valerie and Austin decided to visit the market today and just walk around a bit.
Austin had planned something else…to bring her to a special place and spend some quality time with his beloved. However, his lover was worried about him traveling far away, so they decided to just visit the market near the Academy.
"Aren't you disappointed though? Every girl has so many dreams and plans for their first date, yet you are going on a bland shopping trip with me." Austin asked as they boarded the carriage and rode towards their destination.
Valerie smiled softly as she told him, "When it comes to dating, it's just about spending time with the person you like. And currently, I am doing the same."
Austin heaved a sigh, "Upgrade your demands, Val, or I might become nonchalant in our relationship."
The other one chuckled, her voice sounding like a melodious rhythm, before she said, "I will try to do that, my Lord."
….
Soon their carriage came to a halt at the entrance of the market.
Austin hopped off and offered his hand to the lady.
"Thank you," She voiced before Austin asked,
"Is there any specific place you want to visit?"
Valerie looked contemplative, "I don't know much about the stores present here. Let's look around first?" She suggested.
"Let's go then," He offered his hand, for her to hold.
Valerie's cheeks turned a little hot; this was not the first time for them to hold hands, yet every time she felt shy being so intimately close to her Lord.
"L-Let's go."
….
The market near the Academy was quite big, however, not very crowded. During the tournament or enrollment seasons, this market remains quite busy.
And since a tournament is about to start in two months, new stores are being established around the market.
The first place he brought the girl was an accessory shop, situated not so far away from the entrance.
Since they were wearing the uniform of the academy, the shopkeeper was extra polite, "What would the lovely couple like to see?"
Valerie and Austin ignored the shopkeeper and continued to look at the things on display.
The brunette was stumped at her place after being ignored by the two teenagers.
Austin picked a bracelet, thin metal bracelet that would look good both on males and females.
"That's a very wonderful artifact for a couple, " The lady began, "There is a feature of that artifact that allows you to track the other pair if commanded."
Austin was surprised, "How does that work?"
The shopkeeper finally felt a little useful as she relayed, "Just feed a droplet of your blood to the bracelet you would be giving your partner. And when you want to track them, just whisper 'Find me' into the artifact, and you will be guided to them."
Valerie frowned, "Isn't this an A-rank tracking device? Do you have a permit to sell it so openly?"
The seller was flustered upon hearing that, as she hurriedly added, "I-It can only detect its other half within five hundred meters of range, so it's not an A-grade."
Valerie's eyes were still cold, "Still this is a tool that can be used by the military. Have you gained the consent to sell it to the general masses?"
The brunette was now sweating profusely; not good; this little girl was too well-informed!
Much to her relief, Austin jumped in, "Aren't we lucky to have found something so highly useful without needing to request the military? I mean with this, we can track each other's location in case of an emergency."
The frost around the lavender-tressed receded as she softly muttered, "If you say so..."
Austin paid for the artifact, even though the shopkeeper was reluctant—given she feared Valerie informing the authorities about the shop—before they left the shop.
After walking a few steps, Valerie couldn't help but ask, "Do you think I am a troublesome woman?"
Austin was surprised, "Why would you say something like that?"
"I mean...I always remain so upright that many people say that it's a bother to hang around me."
Austin scoffed, "Then they are blind or just foolish. Your company is the best. If I have to choose two people to spend my entire life with, I will choose you twice."
"⁄⁠•⁠⁄⁠-⁠⁄⁠•⁠⁄" Valerie lowered her face, as she felt shy like never before.
Her Lord is so good to her.
The next place they visited was a dessert shop from where Austin picked two drinks,
"Are you sure you don't want any sugar?" The shopkeeper asked, with a surprised expression.
This was a dessert shop, a place for sweet lovers, yet the boy was asking not to add any sugar to the hot chocolate.
"Yes, please," Austin responded positively before he paid for the drinks and brought them back to Valerie, who was sitting on the bench near the fountain.
"Here you go." Handing her the hot chocolate, he also sat down and began sipping on his smoothie.
Yup, tastes great.
Valerie hesitantly sipped the drink and was pleasantly surprised to find only bitterness awaiting her.
She turned toward her beloved before asking, "You knew?"
While side-glancing at the girl, Austin asked, "Did you think, you are the only one observing the one you love?"
Valerie smiled, as she leaned her on his shoulder before whispering, "It makes me happy...thank you."
The duo then sat there and chatted about leisurely things. No stress of the tournament, no regret of the past, and no fear of the future.
They just enjoyed the moment and each other's presence. And that was all they could have ever asked for.
....
"Val, let's have some tea." It was getting dark and Valerie thought they would be returning to the academy now when suddenly her beloved suggested.
Valerie raised her brows before she asked, "Should we get back and have tea in the cafeteria?"
Austin smiled at her, "I think we will get something more than a beverage there."
Valerie was surprised to hear that, but since her Lord insisted, she didn't say anything against that and obediently followed him.
*Tring*
It was a small eatery with not many people sitting around.
However, those who were seated, couldn't resist the urge to look at the two individuals who just walked in.
"Are they...royalties"
"They have to be..."
"They look so good together."
"A warm boy and a cold girl, haa. What a dreamy couple."
Ignoring their comments, Valerie and Austin made their way to the counter and sat down side by side.
There was a white-haired man wiping the glass on the other side, who asked, "What would you like to have, sir?"
"A cup of herbal tea with no milk and two cubes of sugar." Hearing his words, the bartender looked up from the glass and glanced at Austin for a moment.
He rested the glass on the counter, before saying, "Wait a moment, sir."
Austin grinned; it worked.
He took out a small parchment which he was carrying and dropped it in the glass.
Valerie raised her brows seeing her Lord suddenly resting the paper there, but she didn't ask him right away.
The man soon came with a hot cup of tea resting on the tray.
He rested the tray on the counter before taking the glass with him.
Austin asked, "You want to ask me something?"
Valerie didn't wait to ask, "What was written in that parchment?"
Austin sipped the tea, a sigh of admiration seeping through his lips, as he responded, "Just an inquiry. I heard this place is quite useful to those who seek information."
Valerie asked, "And what did you ask for?"
Austin was about to respond when suddenly the same glass appeared on the counter.
Austin retrieved the parchment, before urging, "Let's go. We will talk in the carriage." After paying for the tea, Austin led Valerie out of the place and wordlessly, they headed towards the carriage.
Austin finally unfolded the parchment, and read the content.
Valerie also read the letters,
[Three men have infiltrated the Academy. Possibly, demonic humans.]
"...!!!" Valerie's eyes widened as she asked, "Is this informant reliable?"
"Sebastian trusts him, so yeah."
Valerie suggested, "Then should we inform the Headmaster?"
Austin shook his head, "They are capable enough to infiltrate the academy, so surely they must have an escape plan as well. We cannot move recklessly or they might prepone their plan."
Valerie was restless, "Then...what should we do?"
Austin heaved a sigh, "Give me some time to think. For now, don't let your guard down around anyone. And whenever we meet, we need to confirm a code to know that it's us."
Valerie raised her brows, "What kind of code."
"Mine will be 'At your service, my lady' and yours will be 'Kneel before the one you love.'"
Valerie blushed, "O-Okay..."
--------**-------
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 45: Chapter 44- Hurting her
chapters.content:
Chapter 45: Chapter 44- Hurting her
There were two reasons Austin wanted to meet that man at the eatery even though he was aware of the demon's presence in the Academy.
First, he wanted to assess the credibility of the man, and second, he wanted Valerie to understand the origin of his information. If he had simply told her about the demonic entities, she likely wouldn't have questioned his source. However, he valued transparency and chose not to conceal anything from her, openly revealing where his knowledge came from.
In the future, if she needs to gain some information, Austin has told her to get the passcode from either him or Sebastian; since it changes daily.
Now, back in his room, Austin was sitting on his bed, and studying his dagger.
It was a sixteen-inch-long dagger, which appears without any details. After all, his Shard has yet to receive its first evolution.
Through evolution, not only would his Shard gain new abilities, but Austin might awaken affinity with one of the six elements. Like Valerie, who gained an affinity with frost—a derivative of water.
Rhea has gained control over wind, and Rudolph can manipulate earth to a decent extent. The top ten second-year students have awakened their element. However, they can only utilize the bare minimum.
That's why Valerie is hailed as the strongest student; her control over the element is so strong that she can tap into the realm of a sorcerer, and even chant spells.
'It will take me some time, but I know I will get there... ' Maybe it was because of the system that Austin could now feel himself getting stronger by the day.
As of now, his status looks like this,
[Combat: 17/100]
{Next reward at 20}
[Romance: 35/100]
{Next reward at 40}
[Durability: 22/100]
{Next reward at 25}
[Trickery: 11/100]
{Next reward at 20}
[Overall Progression:22/100]
...
No new index has appeared and his durability has gone up because of that punch he received from that darn monkey.
Resting back on his bed, Austin asked, "Tell me, system, when I ask for a quest, let's assume for durability progression, will I get a completely unrelated task?"
[No, host. The system aims at keeping the Host's actual progression and the index meter aligned. As such, QoD would be focused on providing quests that would help you develop the stat for which you are going to request a quest.]
"Hmm..." Austin thought for a moment. Will this be wise?
The reason why he was even considering asking for a quest is the demonic intruders and the tournament.
Although he was making progress, he couldn't be certain he would reach the level required to qualify as an Elite.
'Well, I will just deny the quest if I find it absurd.'
"System, I want to request a quest through which my combat can reach 20."
[Ding!]
[Are you sure you want to use QoD for your combat advancement?]
[Three consecutive denials would cease the Host's authority over QoD.]
Austin heaved a sigh, "Yeah, I am sure."
[Ding!]
[Generating quest....]
[Assessing the current state....]
[Ding!]
[Quest: During combat land a decisive blow against Valerie Corwon.]
[Reward: +3 points, ???]
"..." Why is this system asking for the impossible?
Landing a blow on Valerie for the current him was insanely difficult. Valerie has ascended to the top tier of the hierarchy, and he was third from the bottom.
Heaving a sigh, Austin plopped down on the bed and covered his face with his forearm.
Although it seemed he had surrendered even before the battle, he was thinking of a strategy
'From what I have observed...there is something I can exploit during our spar...' Austin was already feeling bad about using Valerie for his benefit; however, considering it was about their future, Austin had to do it.
--------**--------
Austin and Valerie reached their meeting point exactly at five in the morning.
After a quick warm up both of them were prepared to spar.
"Start whenever you are ready," With a smile that extruded warmth, Valerie spoke as she took the battle stance without summoning her Shard.
On the other side, Austin was wielding his dagger from the beginning; his goal was to at least land a single blow today.
Taking a deep breath, he lunged into action.
Dashing towards his opponent, he held his dagger in a reverse grip, intending to draw in close combat from the get-go.
However, much to his surprise, Valerie suddenly jumped from her spot, completely disappearing from his field of vision, before Austin felt some weight over his shoulder.
"Today we will focus on mid-range combat." Kicking his chin, she backflipped gracefully, forcing Austin to stumble on his feet.
"Gah, that hurts..." Austin rubbed his chin as he felt his jaw turning numb by that blow.
Valerie looked concerned, "Should...I remain defensive for today?"
Austin grinned, "Not a chance. Let's go!"
He lunged into action again; spotting the wooden stick in her hand, he realized that she was going to force him to fight mid-range, so he extended the size of his Shard and drove it forward like a spear.
Valerie smirked before she allowed him to go past the point he expected her to parry and titled her body just enough for his Shard to not hurt her.
"Don't remove your eyes from me, My lord." Her whisper was dangerous, as Austin's heel was kicked.
**THUD**
Austin hit the ground with a thud, groaning as the impact jolted through his body. He rolled quickly to his side to avoid Valerie's next strike, her wooden stick slamming into the floor where his head had been moments before.
"You're relentless," he muttered, scrambling to his feet.
"And you're distracted," Valerie countered, spinning her stick effortlessly.
His mind raced. She was faster, stronger, and far more skilled. But he wasn't here to win—just to land one clean hit.
With a burst of speed, he dashed forward, feinting to the left before cutting to the right. His dagger slashed toward her shoulder.
Valerie sidestepped with ease, her stick snapping down toward his wrist. Austin barely managed to twist away, her blow grazing his arm.
"Nice dodge~" She singsonged.
Austin didn't pause there. Extending his Shard's blade to nearly its maximum length. He lunged again, swinging the elongated weapon in a sweeping arc to force Valerie back.
Valerie's smirk didn't falter. She ducked low, her stick coming up to block his strike with a satisfying crack. "Longer reach, same result," she teased, twisting her weapon to push him off balance.
Austin stumbled but recovered quickly, shortening the Shard and darting forward in close quarters. He thrust the blade toward her midsection, hoping to catch her off guard.
Valerie's movements were a blur. She pivoted to the side, her stick smacking his blade away before delivering a sharp tap to his ribs.
"Keep your stance balanced," she advised, stepping back to let him recover.
Austin looked up, gritted his teeth, and after summoning his dagger back in his hand, he threw it toward the girl.
Valerie barely moved her head and the weapon missed the target.
However, Austin wasn't done; he clenched his fist, and his dagger took a 180, relaunching towards Valerie from mid-air.
Valerie sensed the movement behind her, as she ducked in at the last moment, "No!" Only to realize that the dagger will stab her beloved now.
In her crouched position, she launched towards Austin, her pace faster than ever, so she could come between his Shard and him.
However, it was all Austin's ploy,
The moment she closed the distance, Austin seized the opportunity. With precise timing, he pivoted sharply, using the momentum to deliver a powerful kick.
THUD
His foot connected squarely with Valerie's jaw, the girl pausing in her tracks as Austin's Shard disintegrated into fragments.
Austin took a strong gulp as he removed his foot from her face, and nervously approached her, "Val....are you okay?"
Her face was hidden by her long hair, so he didn't know if she was hurt or angry. Well, he used himself to lure her into his trap, so it would be understandable if she was angry.
However, suddenly, Valerie jumped on him, hugging her Lord closely in her arms, as she said, "It was brilliant, Austin! You finally realized the essence of a battle."
Austin was flustered as he asked, "W-What is that?"
Valerie looked up at him, her face full of smiles, as she said, "There is no rule when you are fighting someone. Utilize everything you can to defeat your enemy."
Austin heaved a sigh, as he cupped her cheek and softly asked, "Does it hurt?"
Valerie shook her head, "Not much, but I like this pain."
Austin raised his brows, but before he could ask, Valerie responded, "This slight ache would keep reminding me that you are progressing brilliantly. "
Austin chuckled upon hearing that, as he hugged the girl and laid back down.
[Ding!]
[Congratulations, host!]
[You have achieved your goal!]
[Tap to open the reward!]
Yeah, life is good.
--------**--------

chapters.title: Chapter 46: Chapter 45- Suspect
chapters.content:
Chapter 46: Chapter 45- Suspect
[Congratulations, host!]
[You have fulfilled the requirement for your first quest!]
[Rewards: +3 Combat points, +2 Points(can be distributed independently).]
[Ding!]
[Congratulations host!]
[You have reached the second threshold of Combat!]
[Tap to open the reward.]
Austin had returned to his room, and while taking a shower, he read the system's notification.
He was able to land a clean hit on his lover, although through an underhanded method.
He knew that to land a hit on Valerie—someone with much more battle experience than him—he had to use himself as bait. Even during a spar, Valerie never ignores Austin's safety.
Even the strikes she lands, albeit using a fraction of her power, make her feel regretful. If not for Austin requesting her to not only dodge, she would have never considered hitting him back.
"Let's see...what is this reward?"
[Ding!]
[Whisperwing: A mystical artifact in the shape of a boomerang, imbued with sentient magic that allows it to obey verbal commands. It can alter its speed mid-flight, from swift and lethal to slow and controlled, ensuring precise strikes or safe returns to its wielder.]
[Limitation: Works only for an hour before enquiring a twelve hours of rest.]
[Note: It can be leveled up through stats points gained from QoD.]
Austin's brows were risen as he walked out of the bathroom, with a towel wrapped around his waist.
He summoned the weapon in his hand and was surprised by the runes inscribed on it.
'It's heavy....' Austin had to hold the boomerang with both of his hands and felt he needed to first gain some strength to use it.
"Whisperwing...too long....Whip? Yeah, that sounds good." As he named the weapon, a greenish hue surrounded the weapon.
Austin tossed it lightly in the air, and commanded, "Slow down."
The boomerang obeyed instantly, its movement shifting into an almost surreal pace. The air around it seemed to ripple and distort as it glided lazily, each rotation deliberate and mesmerizing.
Its polished surface caught the light, reflecting flashes of green with every turn, as though time itself had bent to the weapon's will.
Austin raised his brows; this was quite useful.
"Okay, now speed up!" His command was heard and the boomerang instantly tore through the floor and went to the lower floor.
"Shit!" Austin cursed before he called, "Come back, Whip."
The boomerang flew into his hand right away, and Austin made no delay in storing it in his inventory.
"The hell?" The resident of the lower room peeked up, "Austin? Why were you so eager to see me so early in the morning?" It was a third-year student who was still in bed, and the hole was created right above his face.
Austin apologized, "Just some experiment went wrong. Sorry, I will have it repaired by afternoon."
The senior grumbled before covering his face and ignoring him.
Austin heaved a sigh and decided to ask Sebastian for help.
------**------
Walking out of the dorm, he walked a few meters before reaching the fountain, near which his beloved awaited him.
"You look pretty today. Did you braid your hair differently?"
Valerie's cheeks were hot as she nodded, "I tried something different."
She didn't think her Lord would notice it right away. It was just a minor thing yet it made her elated.
Soon the duo walked towards the main building with their hands connected.
They were mostly engaged in conversation related to training and the tournament. They decided to talk about anything related to the demonic entities during lunch, in seclusion.
One thing is for sure: these demons are either too weak to be sensed by the soldiers guarding the Academy or too strong that they are hiding their presence brilliantly.
Austin knew that it was the first option.
The one who has sent these demons just wanted to assess the situation of the Academy and learn the premise so during the event, it could become easy to infiltrate.
"Just four more days..." As they reached the classroom, Valerie muttered under her breath.
Without asking her, he knew what she meant.
The sitting re-arrangement would be happening in four days, and Valerie was determined to sit with him.
"Don't worry, I will go with you to ask the Professor," Austin assured her.
Soon Austin walked towards his seat while Valerie sat in the front.
Rhea waved at him, to which the blond Prince just nodded.
Rudolph was sitting silently in his seat, rather than chatting to Rhea, which greatly surprised the Prince.
'Is he not well?' Austin wondered when the professor suddenly walked inside the class before homeroom time.
"Good morning class. I have some news to share."
The teacher looked a bit hurried, and that urged everyone to pay attention to her.
"What happened a few days ago during the assessment trials, was not supposed to happen. We have questioned a few students who suffered because of our failure to maintain security and have come to a conclusion."
The hot topic of most of the groups was the incident that transpired two days ago. Nothing like that has ever happened in the past.
Valorian Academy boasts capable teachers and reliable security. So, this might be one of the biggest crises they have faced in the past century.
It was said that the investigation was in progress, but now it seems they have finally found the culprit.
"There is someone from the student's body who was involved in the incident. And I am ashamed to say, that the impostor is from the Apex Circle."
A round of gasps resonated inside the classroom upon hearing that.
Everyone began whispering and murmuring about the allegation the Professor just made.
Not so long after, Rhea asked, "But ma'am, what led you to such a conclusion?"
The Professor heaved a sigh, "I was about to tell you all about it. Sit down first."
Rhea heeded her command before the class turned silent, wanting to hear her reason.
The older one voiced, "The only person who spotted the barrier chanter was Rudolph. He was the one who disrupted the chanter's magic and allowed us, the Professors to enter the forest."
Every eye turned towards the biggest guy in the class.
Austin frowned upon hearing that; Rudolph wasn't supposed to find the chanter. Canonically, he should have stayed with Rhea to help her deal with the devi. However, it seems, the presence of Valerie allowed him to think more calmly in the situation and move independently during the incident.
'Did he disciver who it was?' His unasked question was answered by the Professor,
"Although he wasn't able to see the impostor's face, Rudolph reported that it was a guy with silver hair."
When the lady said that, the students instantly turned around to the only silver head in the class—the Vice President of the Student Council and the heir of Duke Runebound—Sheldon.
However, all those gazes didn't bother the guy at all, and thanks to the Professor's following words, no one dared question Sheldon either.
"However, with the vice headmaster's help, we discerned that it wasn't Sheldon, so no point in suspecting him."
Everyone was aware of the Vice-headmaster's ability to detect lies, as such, no one anymore entertained the thought of Sheldon being the impostor.
The lady on the podium added, "That's why until we don't discern who is the real culprit, the headmaster has decided to keep the students of Apex Circle away from others."
"...!" The reaction of the students was quite varying. Some were shocked, some were enraged, and some were nonchalant.
"But why should we get treated like this? Not like we did anything here." One of the students asked, his voice carrying his frustration.
"Why should we be treated like this, Professor? It may be someone from a different year who is an impostor?"
The Professor heaved a sigh and told them, "I know you all are not happy because of the decision. However, it is an irrefutable fact that one from the Apex Circle was involved in the incident. We have verified it, so until we take the testimony of each student, you all are restricted from returning to your dorm."
With her voice turning a little cold, the Professor added, "And that's an order."
--------**--------
Austin inwardly rejoiced that since they weren't told to return to the dorm, he could spend more time with his fiancée...
They can have lunch together, then walk around the garden lesiurely, then have tea together...then...and then...and...
**SQUELCH**
However, none of his plans, involved him getting murdered by Valerie.
"V-Val..." Austin looked at his fiancée in horror, as her spear stabbed his chest and pinned him against the pillar.
His blood dyed his white shirt crimson red as he couldn't believe the woman he loved was suddenly attacking him.
Valerie stepped toward him, not a speck of remorse in her eyes as she said,
"It was for a short while, but you annoyed me to no end."
--------**--------
A/N:- Damn....the fuck. Well, drop a comment and wait for the next chapter.

chapters.title: Chapter 47: Chapter 46- Betrayal?
chapters.content:
Chapter 47: Chapter 46- Betrayal?
The notice for interrogation was not liked by the students; however, to ensure the safety of other students, it was necessary to thoroughly question the Apex Circle.
Currently, inside the common hall, only the students of Apex Circle were present. All the other students were told to have lunch back in their dorm room, because of security reasons.
The common hall was surrounded by several instructors, who were keeping an eye on the students while one student is sent to the Principal's office one after another for questioning.
"And what if the impostor has a shape-shifting ability?" Rhea asked, to no one in particular as she remained seated at the dining table.
Unlike usual, Rudolph wasn't around, so it explains why the other girls approached her.
Rhea's dormitory neighbor and her best friend, Cassie, asked, "Then won't the teachers find out the accomplice of the impostor?"
She got a point since even if someone from the students was allowing the intruder to let them imitate the student, they would get caught during the interrogation.
"Well, considering the Headmaster's brains and Vice-headmaster's cruelty, I know they would be able to capture the villain is." Another girl with pale yellow hair voiced.
Rhea raised her brows, "What cruelty?"
The girl seemed genuinely surprised, as she asked, "Don't you know? The vice-headmaster is an ex-executioner."
Rhea rolled her eyes, "Just because he used to be a slayer doesn't mean he is cruel to innocents as well."
Their conversation continued as the teacher came to ask for Austin,
"Yes, coming." Austin got up before following the instructor.
While he walked towards the office, he met Valerie en route, and whispered to her, "Wait for me in the garden."
The violette smiled and gave him a nod.
*Knock*
Austin knocked on the door once, before stepping inside.
Inside, only three people were standing: the headmaster, the vice-headmaster, and Austin's homeroom teacher.
"Good afternoon, sir, ma'am." Austin greeted before the bespectacled vice-headmaster stepped forward with his Shard appearing in his hand.
Harold stepped forward as he said, "You know the drill. You lie, we will know."
Austin gave him a firm nod as Harold returned to his spot after drawing the circle and stood on the left side of the table.
The Headmaster asked, "First tell me, what is your name?"
Austin, without any delay, responded, "Austin Eryndor."
The shade of the circle didn't change before Philius asked,
"Tell me Austin, are you, by any means, involved with demonic entities?"
This time as well, Austin didn't hesitate, "No, sir."
A few more questions were asked, all related to that incident or if anything the others said was untrue.
He answered only according to what he saw in the forest, rather than letting the knowledge of the game influence his responses.
After nearly fifteen minutes, Austin felt that he had given the proof of him not being the impostor.
And as he thought, "Okay, Austin-"
"Wait, Headmaster." Harold suddenly stopped him; his gaze was firm as ever as he said, "I want to ask him the last question."
Philius raised his brows before he gestured for him to go on.
Truth be told, Austin was now a little nervous. The Vice-headmaster is the only one in the teaching unit that gave him the chills.
His aura and appearance always make one think twice before speaking. And that same teacher has decided to interrupt his senior so he could ask Austin a question.
Yeah, he had a valid reason to be nervous.
The bespectacled one, stepped forward and asked him, "Were you aware of the demonic presence here in the academy before this interrogation?"
"...!" Austin flinched; this was unexpected.
The students weren't informed about Demonic entities infiltrating the premises until they were interrogated here. So Austin should also be like others, completely unaware of their presence.
Austin took a strong gulp, and the pause he took was enough to make Harold even more suspicious, "Tell me, Austin. Did you know about the demons beforehand?"
Austin knew lying was futile here, so he responded, "Yes, I did."
The shade of the circle didn't shift, and the only lady in the room gasped, "Austin....you..."
The blond prince heaved a sigh, "I knew demons were involved in this because I inquired about it."
Harold frowned, "How did you know? And who gave you the information?"
Austin calmly responded, "The very fact, a barrier strong enough to restrict even the professors was erected, gave birth to my suspicion. And then Rudolph said it was a silver head, yet it wasn't the Vice-prez. So shape-shifting, right? And demons are known for their ability to shapeshift, so I guessed it."
Harold's frown deepened, "You still didn't answer my second question. Who is the source of your information."
Austin glanced at the Headmaster before saying, "It's a common friend of mine and the Headmaster's." His suggestive look made Philius realize as he said,
"I understand. You can go now."
Harold was perplexed as he glanced at his superior and found him nodding in understanding.
Once Austin stepped out Harold asked, "Sir?"
Philius ignored his question, and told him, "For now, do me a favor and make someone monitor Austin for the time being."
Harold frowned, "But that butler...?"
Philius pinched the bridge of his nose, "I will talk to Sebastian...since it's about Austin's security; hopefully, he will understand."
----------**---------
Valerie was waiting for Austin in the pavilion situated in the garden where they usually sit and talk.
Her face was turned to the other side as she remained standing silently until she heard footsteps.
"Thanks for waiting." Austin smilingly said as he climbed the stairs and lovingly looked at his fiancée.
Valerie finally turned to look at him, an unreadable expression on her face, as she said,
"Kneel before the one you love."
Austin was stunned for a moment since he nearly forgot about the passcode, but soon he knelt and said,
"At your service, my lady."
There was a soft smile on Austin's face as he kept kneeling, waiting for her to respond.... however, rather than her words, her Shard gave him the response.
**SQUELCH**
"Ugh!" Austin groaned as she stabbed her spear into his shoulder and picked him from the floor.
Planting him against the pillar, Valerie gazed at Austin with a cold look.
"V-Val..." There was a sense of betrayal in his eyes as Austin gazed at his lover.
Without a speck of emotion in her eyes, Valerie stated, "Although, for a short while, you annoyed me to no end."
Her Soul energy made the ground shake, and her aura attracted the attention of the instructors, inside the common hall.
"Valerie, stop!" The Vice-headmaster arrived first and warned the girl.
"What the heck are you doing?! Let him go!" Rhea also arrived and shouted at the girl.
Soon, the whole pavilion was surrounded by people who were shouting at her, asking her to release Austin.
They didn't carelessly move towards her, fearing that she might end up killing Austin.
"Student Valerie?! What are you doing to the one you swore to protect?!" Philius couldn't believe his eyes. The same girl who rejected the offer to receive the greatest honor by joining the Council so she could protect her lover...was now killing him?
"W-Why...Val..." Austin, with tears welling up his eyes, asked her.
Valerie's aura flared and just as she was about to cease his life, a voice interrupted her, "We need that thing, Val."
Everyone turned their eyes towards the one who spoke, evident shock written over their faces.
Valerie didn't have to turn to know who it was, "My Lord..." She whispered, her heart finally regaining the serenity it needed to not slaughter the being who dared impersonating her beloved.
Philius's frown couldn't have been any deeper as he asked, "What in the world is happening, Austin?"
The blond Prince heaved a sigh before stepping onto the stage where everyone could see him clearly before stating, "We lured the demon, and Valerie captured it. The end."
Everyone gasped as they realized the identity of the one who was pinned against the wall
The skin of the fake Austin began to shred and the real face of the demon began to appear.
The creature had dark red, cracked skin, like searing embers frozen in flesh. Its jagged, black horns curve upward, shadowing hollow, glowing eyes that burn with malice.
The air around it stinks of sulfur and decay, as it glared at Valerie, "How did you find out?!"
The demon was suppressing its demonic presence quite brilliantly, and there were no mistakes in its appearance as well. And he knew the code as well!
Then...?
Valerie narrowed her eyes as she voiced, "If I were you, I wouldn't waste a thought on anything but your own life. Because even if you manage to escape the teachers, it won't matter—I'll be waiting for you out here."
--------**-------
A/N:- I hope you all enjoyed the chapter? Drop a comment and let me know. And yes, drop a review as well.

chapters.title: Chapter 48: Chapter 47- Crying Valerie
chapters.content:
Chapter 48: Chapter 47- Crying Valerie
[After returning to her room after the date]
Valerie stepped inside her room, and after closing the door, the first thing she did was take out the parchment her Lord handed to her in the carriage.
When he was telling her code, he silently placed the parchment inside her bag while making her notice it.
He slowly shook her head and that was enough for Valerie to understand what he meant.
She didn't say anything and wordlessly returned.
A frown marred her face as she read,
[The carriage driver was paying attention to our conversation; that's why I gave you the code loud enough for him to listen. Now, I can be paranoid but there is no harm in being cautious. Turn around.]
Valerie tilted her head and turned around. However, nothing happened, urging her to read the note once again, only to realize that she needed to turn the parchment around.
[That's why whenever either of us tells the code, the other one has to attack the other one. If I respond, don't hesitate to incapacitate me. Needless to say, I will do the same.]
[P.S: I enjoyed the date. Let's go again sometimes.]
She smiled reading the last remark, but soon she frowned, as she realized a fatal mistake.
Something her Lord noticed and she completely overlooked.
'I need to train my senses and be cautious all the time.'
----**----
And thanks to that, Valerie was able to recognize the entity to be inhumane. And it helped that the demon responded to the code; providing her the evidence to attack the entity.
"You did good." Austin praised his lover as they sat on the resting chairs, before the Headmaster's office.
Valerie smiled, "It was all your guidance that I was able to judge the situation."
Austin heaved a sigh, "Well, I just asked you to remain cautious." Glancing at her he added, "I was quite surprised when you stabbed that demon without another thought. I thought you might hesitate since he had the same face as me, but I was wrong."
There was a sense of pride in his voice and admiration for the girl who closed her heart to trap the devil.
Austin rested his back against the wall, as he said, "Fortunately, we caught-" "*sniff*"
Austin paused and instantly turned toward his lover.
His eyes widened as he saw large droplets of tears rolling down her eyes, as she tried to hide her face from him.
"Valerie?!" Austin instantly knelt before the girl and cupped her face, "What happened so suddenly?" He doesn't know what he said or did to make her cry. Or maybe it was that she got injured while confronting the Demon?
However, the cause of her tears was no one but him,
"....it's cruel...to *sniff* assume that...I was not affected....it pained ...me to stab the demon...." Tears uncontrollably poured down her big eyes as she complained.
Austin now realized his mistake. He has gotten so used to her brave side, that he sometimes forgets that she is a human as well, and a teenager, on top of that
