His heart was filled with guilt as he wiped her tears softly and told her, "I am sorry, Val, I didn't know you were hurting so much...and I just assumed everything was fine."
He was a failure as her partner to not sense the heavy emotions she had been carrying. He is such an idiot.
*Click*
The door suddenly parted and an instructor stepped out, "It's conc-what happened to her?" The woman frowned upon seeing Valerie sob.
Austin turned towards the older one before asking, "Can I take her back? She is not feeling well."
The instructor instantly nodded, "Yes, sure. The interrogation has concluded and the report will be sent to your office in an hour."
Austin nodded before he got up and said, "Excuse me."
Under the instructor's surprise gaze and Valerie's baffled one, Austin suddenly picked his lover in a bridal carry and stood back up.
Steam erupted over her head as Valerie failed to utter any comprehensive word, being so intimately close to her Lord.
"Okay then, instructor, see you tomorrow." Bidding farewell to the lady, Austin stepped forward and headed out of the building.
Valerie, after failing miserably to say anything for the first ten seconds, finally uttered, "I-I can walk..."
"Do you not like it?" He asked; doubt in his eyes.
Valerie opened her mouth to say something, but then she sealed her lips and clutched his shirt before saying, "I-I will be in your care."
Austin smiled, as he descended to the base floor.
Since it was already night there weren't many students around. However, those who were moving about stopped in their path and gazed at the handsome young man carrying his blushing princess.
Austin was immune to feeling embarrassed if it came to his beloved's sake. He cannot and will not leave Valerie alone, given her current state of mind.
"A-Are we not going to the infirmary?" Valerie asked, considering she thought they were going to be together for the time being and the infirmary was the only place.
However, "There are many people there, so let's go to my room."
Austin took out the Stopwatch from the Inventory before tapping on the reset dial—
*DING*
Instantly, everyone and everything paused around him as Austin entered the dorm, and sped towards the first floor.
He found Sebastian standing before his room, but first, he opened his door and stepped inside.
Closing the door, he heard a 'ding' from the stopwatch, as he gently laid Valerie on the bed.
"What....just happened?" Valerie was too astounded to suddenly find herself inside Austin's room, even though she was outside the dorm, a moment before.
Austin shook his head, "Nothing happened. Now, relax here, I will bring something warm for you to drink."
Valerie was still too baffled but she didn't insist on asking him about it and saw Austin walking towards the door.
*Click*
Parting the door, he called out, "Sebas."
"Young master? Is everything alright?" The butler was startled to find his lord inside the room, even though the room was empty a moment—ah.
"Yes, everything is fine. In an hour, you will receive a report from the school, regarding the interrogation of the Demon. Please bring it to me."
"Yes, my Lord...and do you need something else?" Sebastian asked.
Austin was a little embarrassed to say, "Bring me some tea and snacks. Valerie is staying at my place today." The butler must have already heard her voice so there was no point in hiding.
Sebastian smiled ear to ear as he said, "Remember you both are just students now so-"
"I know, agh!" Austin closed the door and walked back in.
"What happened?" Valerie asked her Lord, seeing him being all flustered.
Austin took a deep breath and shook his head, "Nothing....and you shouldn't get up."
Austin told her as he walked towards the small kitchen he had in the room. He set the milk to boil, and on one side, he took some cold milk and added dark chocolate to it, before putting it on flames.
Stirring the chocolate container continuously, he prepared a strong syrup before adding sugar to it, before taking two cups.
Pouring the syrup, he then poured the hot milk and a bit of sweet chocolate bits over it.
Bringing the two cups near the bed, he said, "It's sweet, so brace yourself."
Valerie paused while getting up before she stiffly nodded and took the mug.
Austin told her, "Having something warm and sweet helps in elevating the mood."
Valerie nodded once again; since it's her Lord made, she can even consume poison.
Sitting on the chair beside the bed, he said, "After thinking it carefully, I realized how difficult it must have been. For you...to hurt a being who looked just like me."
Valerie's eyes were drawn to the hot chocolate as she remained silent.
She couldn't explain how painful it was for her....for that wretched being calling out to her in the voice that affected her the most.
Although she knew that she was facing a fake, her hands were shaking. Although her soul knew that it wasn't her Lord, the very slight chance of her judging things wrongly made her heart tremble in apprehension.
In those few seconds, she went through several mood swings.
"I am sorry you had to go through something like that, Valerie...however, there might arise a chance where you might have to go through something similar again."
Valerie looked at her beloved with a sad look, "I know...but I don't know how I will face that situation again."
Resting his and her cup aside, Austin sat on the bed and brought the girl in his arms, "Everything will be fine, Val. I will always be there for you."
Valerie smiled as she rested her face on his chest and hummed, "I will be relying on you..."
--------**--------
A/N:- What engaged? They look like they are married already. Thanks for reading. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 49: Chapter 48- Let's go hunting
chapters.content:
Chapter 49: Chapter 48- Let's go hunting
Valerie was mentally exhausted so she fell asleep not so long after.
Austin remained sitting on the bed beside her, once he draped a duvet over the girl.
The situation with the demon was not following the canonical events.
Originally, the demon should have realized the potential of Rhea and should have approached her. However, Austin knew that with Valerie's presence in the academy, they would target her. As such, despite knowing that they were being heard, he voiced the code and wrote a note to Valerie to remain cautious.
The reason they are targeting students even though there are far stronger people in the academy—the Vice-headmaster for example—reveals their future plans.
'The tournament...' They would be targeting some specific students to recruit them during the tournament. As such, the presence of variables who hold strong minds and overwhelming strength, like Valerie, needs to be eliminated beforehand.
'They will try to convince them to join and if they get rejected, they will kill them during the tournament...'
Shaking away those thoughts, Austin took the parchment he received from Sebastian. It was the report from the instructors regarding the interrogation.
There was nothing much, other than,
[Infiltrated, caught, escaped, searching, eliminated, taken over.]
These were a few comprehensible words the demon spat out before the vow killed it.
The Vow on the Demon kind doesn't allow them to betray their kins. That's why, Austin was surprised that even this much was extracted from the demons.
'Hmm...let's see....infiltrated the academy. They were caught...hmm...caught while chanting the barrier? Possibly. Escaped...who? Searching who? The escaped one? And then eliminate them? Taken over...what, academy? No, if that was spoken for their intention, then it should have been 'take over', not 'taken over.' It means they have taken over something already. But what-ah! Identities, maybe.'
Austin was rummaging through his memories, piecing his knowledge of the game and the current situation.
'Although it was just a minor change, various things have been altered...' Austin fighting for Valerie's sake and preventing her from getting suspended has changed the focus of various foes' in her direction.
Although Austin could never regret standing up for his lover, he was feeling a little apprehensive about the future.
Valerie's presence has outshined Rhea's as such, it was inevitable for her always to be surrounded by danger.
"mm..." Hearing her mumbling, Austin's eyes directed toward his beloved.
Her serene sleeping face allowed his heart to regain its composure as he brought his hand toward her face and softly caressed her cheek,
"While I have you by my side...I know nothing can go wrong."
Austin remained seated there for a bit longer before he turned his eyes toward the window.
Getting up, he took out the Stopwatch from his inventory and opened the window.
The radiant moonlight converged and fell on the artifact.
Austin knew that today was a full moon night, so he chose to use the watch rather than the Mask he got from the system. He didn't want to surprise Valerie with the sudden use of an unidentified and unlicensed artifact.
"Hmm?" His eyes suddenly spotted a lone figure in the backyard, who was swinging his sword even though it was almost midnight.
Once Austin filled the Stopwatch's energy to the brim, he glanced at Valerie once before jumping through the window and landing a few meters behind Rudolph.
"Hey, you okay?" Although Austin knew that the big guy liked to train, it was still quite unusual for him to neglect his routine and remain awakened for this long.
Rudolph paused mid-swing and turned to look at him, "Did I disturb your sleep?"
Austin shook his head, "I wasn't sleeping. Anyway, is everything alright with you?"
Austin has noticed that ever since Rudolph has returned from the forest, he has remained isolated. He doesn't even approach Rhea and mostly remains silent.
Rudolph remained hesitant for a moment...but then he revealed, "After what I faced in the forest...I am quite shaken up."
Austin raised his brows, as he asked, "I never got to hear it from you. What exactly did you see?"
Rudolph planted his large sword on the ground, as he muttered, "It was a figure enshrouded in a cloak. I was only able to see its silver hair and golden eyes, while I tried to fight that being."
Looking annoyed, he clenched his fist and uttered, "It was frustrating to lose to that creature, who tried to harm my friends. I wish I had been stronger I would have captured that bastard."
Austin hummed, and after crossing his arms, he asked, "So you are punishing yourself because Rhea got injured?"
"...in a way, yes."
Austin heaved a sigh, "Look Rud, there was nothing else you could have done. Disrupting the barrier was quite important as well. So stop punishing yourself."
Rudolph nodded, "Thanks for that...well, I also understand that pushing myself like this won't do. I need to progress slowly."
Austin nodded in agreement, "Indeed, and if you get injured while overworking yourself, Rhea will blame herself."
Rudolph rubbed the back of his head, "Well, can't let that happen."
A brief pause descended between them, before Rudolph said, "I will be going to train in the forest after classes tomorrow...sparring against students is not helping me, so I am thinking of learning from real challenges."
Austin was surprised, "You know its not allowed us to explore the forest without permission, right?"
Rudolph scoffed, "I know I won't grow strong unless I take some risk. And that goes for you too, Austin...unless you don't take some risk, you will always get protected by Valerie, just like how she protected you back in the forest."
Austin clenched his fist as his gaze drew to the ground.
Rudolph stepped forward before suggesting, "We should be strong enough to protect the ones we love. That's why I am suggesting you come with me and explore new challenges."
Austin looked up at him before asking, "Will that help?"
Rudolph assured him, "I have gone hunting several times before joining the academy, so I know how much one develops their skills out in the wild rather than getting taught by these instructors."
Austin slowly nodded, "You are right...however, the problem is Sebastian. He will not allow me to go."
"Then don't tell him," Rudolph instantly added, "We will just leave for the forest right after the final bell, and escape through the back gate of the school."
Austin pondered for a moment, before nodding, "Okay then, let's go hunting. Just the two of us."
Rudolph shook Austin's hand, and not so long after, they decided to retire to their rooms.
Just as Rudolph turned, Austin asked, "Hey, where is your beloved dagger? You aren't carrying it?"
Rudolph turned still for a moment before turning towards the blond; he said, "...I kept it in my room since it was a bother to carry around."
"Hmm...well, good night. See you tomorrow."
----------**---------
"Did he suspect anything?" Just as Rudolph entered his room, a voice called out; however, the raven-haired ignored the other one, and first, he rested his sword against the wall.
Walking toward the cupboard he took out a dry towel, and began wiping his face when he heard,
"Is he coming along or not?" The other one asked again, urging Rudolph to say,
"Yeah, he is. However, I don't think that butler would not follow him."
There was an annoyed sneer on his face as Rudolph...or the demon sat down and faced his brethren.
"That butler is dangerous. He can sense our presence and is quite wicked for an old man. We need to pay close attention." The other demon added.
However, the demon impersonating Rudolph shook his head, "If that butler follows we won't take Austin as a hostage. It would be too dangerous."
The other demon didn't say anything since, after a bit of contemplation, he also agreed.
These two demons weren't strong enough to go against Sebastian, whose rank and experience are unknown.
Sebastian was the only one who sensed the witchcraft that was used to chant the barrier. Sebastian even attacked the barrier at the exact spot, where the demon was standing on the other side.
As such, it becomes necessary to avoid confrontation with that butler, since they could no longer make any mistakes in this mission. They have already lost their brother today.
Originally, they didn't plan on kidnapping Austin; however, after realizing the real mastermind behind this incident, they decided to take Austin as a hostage and use him to lure Valerie into their trap.
And once Austin's purpose would be fulfilled, the blond Prince would be bestowed with the most gruesome death.
'Just you wait Austin....I swear I will make you pay for the death of my brother. Just a few more hours, enjoy your freedom as much as you can.'
--------**-------
A/N:- I hope you all enjoyed reading the chapter. I am searching for Valerie and Austin's images, but if you have suggestions, post them here or on my discord.
Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 50: Chapter 49- Hunting(1)
chapters.content:
Chapter 50: Chapter 49- Hunting(1)
How long has it been? Rudolph doesn't know.
His wound was still actively bleeding, and if not for him learning survival skills from his father, he might have died long ago.
Rudolph was attacked by the demon when he went to find the barrier chanter.
A huge wound was inflicted on his torso, and the boy had no option but to run for his life. His Soul Shard was damaged in the process of warding off the demon that was on his tail, but more than his life, nothing more was important.
'Where am I right now...' He gazed at the surroundings and couldn't discern whether he was inside the Academy forest anymore or not.
He was being chased by one of the two demons, with the naked intention of slaughtering him before Rudolph could reach the teachers and inform them about the Demonic presence.
Clutching the wound with the makeshift pad he made with leaves and fur, Rudolph found his vision swirling and his consciousness slipping off.
He knows if he faints now, he might never wake up again. Even if he doesn't die because of blood loss, the wild beast in the vicinity would surely feast upon his body before he wakes up.
'No...I can't die now...I have to return to Rhea...and tell her my feelings ..my parents...they are waiting for me as well...' Using those emotions as his crutches, Rudolph pushed himself off the ground and headed towards a random direction, praying that he find someone who can help him.
---------**---------
The next day, the two demons had kept their eyes on Austin since the morning.
They have noted that Austin trains with their target early in the morning, so they assumed it might be a part of their daily routine. However, today, they weren't spotted training together.
Secondly, Valerie wasn't found waiting for Austin at the fountain, something that was quite unusual.
[Target hasn't left her room since last night.]
[Must be the weak mind of the human that got burdened.]
The two demons communicated as they realized the possible reason for Valerie not leaving her dormitory. If Austin had made contact with her after last night, then they might have suspected Austin being suspicious of Rudolph. However, Austin hasn't tried to contact Valerie at all.
[Austin is approaching the classroom. Make sure not to get overly excited, and don't let anyone else catch the whiff of our plan.]
Any other baggage along with Austin was undesirable; that's why the demon impersonating Rudolph told Austin not to share anything about the secret hunting trip.
That's why, the fake Rudolph strikes at that point where every man is feeble—their ego.
Just when the demon made him recall the fact that Valerie protected him back in the forest, Austin aggressively reacted; showing that, as a man, he couldn't let himself get protected by his woman anymore.
[Target has entered the classroom. Normally chatting and greeting others.]
The demon responded as it continued to closely monitor Austin, who didn't seem anything out of the ordinary.
[I have spotted the butler; going after him.]
The other demon caught sight of the grey-haired butler heading out of the boy's dormitory while holding a folder in his hand.
The demon, who had a camouflaging skill, blended in the surroundings and followed Sebastian from a decent distance to not get caught.
[The butler is approaching the library.]
[Keep a close eye on him. Follow him into the urinal as well.]
[Understood.]
The fake Rudolph didn't want to involve any risk in this mission. Kidnapping Austin could grant them so many benefits that their Lord might rank them up in the army.
And not only monetary benefits, through Austin the demon could offer its Lord a strong corrupted warrior as Valerie as well.
'The girl is crazy enough to willingly jump into the Cursed Pond and serve the dark side.' the Demon barely suppressed its grin, thinking of the near future.
"Good morning, class." Soon the homeroom teacher arrived and informed them, "Valerie is not well today, so Sheldon, you are on disciplinary duty today." The silverhead nodded before the class began.
There were a few who were surprised to hear that the disciplined Disciplinary in-charge was taking a break from school. However, when they recalled yesterday's event they felt it was quite natural.
The class began, and the fake Rudolph silently just remained seated. No excess peeking nor asking anything.
His one ear was on the surroundings and one was focused on Austin.
[The butler has left the library cabin only once to get another two-hour reservation. It seems he has been working on something important.]
Hearing his brother's voice, the demon impersonating Rudolph warned,
[Don't do anything stupid by trying to look at his work. We are not told to get involved with the Capital's matters.]
Before coming here, they received information about a few individuals, among which Sebastian also was the one.
It was known to the two of them, that Sebastian once used to work for the King, and even after he changed the subject of his servitude, the butler still was involved with national matters.
[I know, and I won't go anywhere near that man.]
The fake Rudolph heaved a sigh before he heard the bell for the lunch ringing, and the students getting up from their seats.
"Hey, you wanna eat together?" The pink-haired girl, who was their secondary target, approached the demon.
Rudolph slowly shook his head as he said, "I have some work to do. I will see you later." Saying so, he got up and walked away.
The demon couldn't stay around with those people who know Rudolph closely or they might suspect its identity. As such, it was keeping itself away from as many people as it could.
Rhea watched Rudolph walking away with a concerned look on her face. She could sense that something was wrong with him, but since he was refusing to talk things out, she was left with no other option but,
"Austin."
The blond Prince was surprised to be approached by Rhea all of a sudden, as he paused in his tracks and asked, "What happened?"
The pinkhead asked, "Can you do me a favor and talk to Rudolph? He seems quite troubled these days."
Hearing her words, Austin frowned slightly as he said, "I am concerned as well for him...okay, I will do something."
Rhea smiled before she thanked him.
'I should probably visit the library after school and finish my assignment...' With those thoughts, Rhea walked away and joined her friends.
----------**---------
[The Butler has come out for the third time to get himself some water and asked for another two hours of reservation. It seems he was given some emergency work.]
As the last class neared the conclusion, Rudolph heard his brother's voice in his head.
[It's good then. The butler seems busy and Austin most probably won't tell him about the hunting trip.]
The fake Rudolph replied, only to hear,
[Then can I return to the room and relax a bit? I am quite tir-]
[Don't you dare move from there!] The fake Rudolph flared, his eyes widened in agitation,
[You need to keep an eye on him! If he suspects something or changes his mind to follow his master, we would be done for! So you better stick to that place!]
The fake Rudolph ordered, only to hear the other side grumble,
[Fine, I understand. But Kalwar, you need to feed me fresh human meat after this.]
[Yeah, whatever. Just do your job properly.]
As Rudolph finished speaking, the class bell rang and the teacher finally walked out of the class.
'Finally, after today, I won't need to sit in this useless class...' Kalwar knows that nothing could be a better teacher than life, as such it felt all this academy and classes were nothing but a waste
He packed his book and was waiting when suddenly someone approached him, "Are we still going?"
Rudolph barely suppressed a grin, as he hummed, "I am going for sure, but what about you?"
Austin tightly held the strap of his bag and said, "I didn't tell anyone so there won't be anyone to interfere. Let's go."
Rudolph nodded before he picked up the bag and got up, only to hear, "Where are you two going?"
Kalwar inwardly clicked his tongue hearing the secondary target suddenly jumping in their conversation.
Austin raised his brows and replied, "Just planning to spar a little. What about you?"
Kalwar heaved a sigh hearing that Austin didn't reveal their plans.
Rhea shrugged, "I got some paperwork to finish. Then see ya." She waved at them and walked away.
Rudolph turned toward Austin before asking, "Should we also go?"
The blond Prince nodded before the duo approached the entrance of the class.
Kalwar grinned as he saw the Prince casually following him towards the back entrance of the school.
'Finally, I will take my revenge!'
--------**-------
A/N:- Thanks for reading. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 51: Chapter 50- Hunting(2)
chapters.content:
Chapter 51: Chapter 50- Hunting(2)
"Thank you for making some time for me, Lord Corwon. That day, we couldn't talk properly." It was after a few days, that Aiden requested a meeting with Duke Corwon.
Since he was in the capital, Adam didn't mind meeting with the first Prince who seemed rather eager about something.
"No need to thank me, Aiden. So, was there something important you wanted to discuss?" Adam asked as he picked up his teacup and took a small sip.
The blond Prince, with a soft smile, said, "I wanted to inform you that your daughter and my brother's relationship has improved quite brilliantly in these few days. As a father, you must be worried about her, so I thought I should inform you."
Corwon was surprised; since he had been in the Capital for the past few weeks, he hadn't received any word from Valerie through letters, so he didn't know.
"Is that so?"
"Yes. Recently, because Austin 'refused to return' to the capital, Valerie also decided to stay there and keep his company."
Duke Corwon's brows drew closer a little, as he asked, "Austin didn't return? Why?"
Aiden barely suppressed a smile, and with a saddened look, he said, "Well, I feel like a failure as a brother to say this but...I feel my presence has been making Austin feel like an 'outsider'." Very faintly, to the point one cannot notice unless they are told about it, Aiden's eyes glowed when he uttered the last word.
"Outsider...I have also heard a few things about Austin's reluctance to associate with his own family."
Aiden nodded, "Indeed...it seems, after my return, everyone has always been focused on me, which made my brother quite disheartened. And for that, I cannot help but 'blame myself'."
"You shouldn't blame yourself for something you are not responsible for, Aiden! And it wasn't like others were paying attention to you for nothing. They saw potential in you to be the next king."
That's right. Adam also feels that Aiden has all the qualities required to become the next Monarch. Not only is he a level-headed young man, but also a brilliant swordsman as well.
"I feel honored to hear those words from you, Lord Corwon. It's just that Father had mother supporting him, so he was able to handle everything so perfectly. I also hope I can 'find a woman' capable like my mother who is both strong and intelligent, who can 'support me'."
This time Adam didn't say anything immediately. He was forced to think about what Aiden said.
Cedric indeed received a wife who supported him in his various phases. Even Corwon, who once was a Commander of the Royal Order, was promoted to a Duke suddenly. As such, if not for his wife he might not have been able to manage things.
And as the next ruler, Aiden also needs a competent partner...someone like...
"Okay then, Lord Corwon, I won't take any more of your time." Aiden got up from his seat, urging Adam to get up as well, as the two men shook hands.
"Let's hope Austin and Valerie have a good future."
Adam nodded, however, looking at him anyone could tell that his mind was clustered with thoughts at the moment
Aiden grinned, 'Perfect. The seed is sown.'
---------**---------
Rudolph was leading Austin into the forest after they passed the perimeter of the school. Fortunately, they didn't get caught or this would have ended in the most abrupt and undesirable manner.
"Have you come here before to hunt alone?" Austin suddenly asked, looking a bit cautious of the surroundings.
Seeing his slightly apprehensive self, Rudolph barely suppressed a grin, as he responded, "A few times in the past, and don't worry, there aren't any beasts above C-rank here since students often are brought here."
Austin nodded, "I also know that, but I am new to hunting and a D-rank at that."
Rudolph wanted to scoff; a Prince so weak and needed to be protected by a woman. Such a sore loser.
They trod through the shallow wilderness and entered the heart of the forest where only huge trees and the sound of monsters movements could be sensed.
Austin took a strong gulp as he said, "Isn't it enough? We are already too far from the Academy."
Rudolph turned towards Austin before muttering, "Yeah, this should be fine. After all, even if you shout, no one will hear your cries."
Austin frowned as he asked, "What do you m-ah!"
He gasped upon seeing Rudolph's skin melting, and a red skin appearing from behind the shell.
"A demon....?" Austin's eyes parted wide as he saw the creature finally showing its real self.
The demon's flesh was a deep crimson, slick and raw as though freshly flayed, with patches of blackened veins pulsating just beneath the surface. Its face twisted unnaturally, the jaw elongating to reveal jagged teeth that jutted out at uneven angles.
Clawed hands, gnarled and bony, twitched erratically, and its eyes—sunken and glowing a sickly yellow—seemed to bore straight into the soul. A faint stench of burning meat filled the air as Austin froze, unable to tear his gaze away.
The demon grinned, a grin that could make one skin crawl in disgust, as it stated, "Surprised? Well, I did expect you to be naive but this much that you didn't sense anything strange in my behavior?"
Austin's eyes were still parted wide, as he asked, "You...then where is my friend?!" He shouted as he summoned his Shard.
The demon laughed, his laugh resonating across the forest, making Austin flinch before the demon looked back at him and said,
"Look at you! Being on the verge of death yet worrying about others. Aren't you an innocent one?"
Austin took a strong gulp as he said, "Y-You can't kill me...I-I am the second Prince-"
"Pfft- do you think I give a fuck about that? We are here to get you, and through you, we will lure that bitch named Valerie."
"Valerie?! What do you need from her?!" Austin cried, his grip on his Shard becoming firmer.
The demon snarled, "That girl is far more useful than you could ever be. She will be corrupted once she is taken back. And not only her, during the tournament numerous students from various academies would be recruited into the demonic army."
"And you know the first task they would be given? To slaughter their brethren." Kalwar muttered a sense of euphoria in his voice. It's always fun to watch the corrupted humans destroy their homes, and then once they realize what they have done, their cries sound the best. Ahh~~
"Such wicked plans....who in the world can be so...cruel..." There were tears in Austin's eyes as he muttered,
"My master, one and only Lord Zevrath." And now, after succeeding in this mission, Kalwar would become one of the seven Generals under Zevarath..finally!
"So cruel....so cruel..." Austin's cries sounded melodious in his ears, but then, "...trying to be so cruel that it sounds childish."
Kalwar frowned as suddenly Austin raised his face, and all the traces of fear and remorse disappeared from his face.
He wiped the tears and heaved a sigh, "So that's the plan, eh? And this Zevrath...he is the King of Demonic Beast, right? He has fallen so much to target children now?"
The previous fear and anxiety were no longer seen on his face as Austin casually muttered
Kalwar spat, "Why are you pretending that you don't care about all this? Do you understand what kind of situation you are in?"
For some reason, even though nothing had changed other than Austin's expression, Kalwar was experiencing a bad sensation...something was not right.
"Your acting skills are top-notch, master." Suddenly, a voice sent a jolt down Kalwar's spine as it twirled on its feet and turned towards the source of the voice.
"Y-You...!"
The biggest obstacle that could ruin this mission—Sebastian!
"How are you at two places at the same time?!" Kalwar barked as it asked its brother just a few seconds ago, and Sebastian was still in the library.
Austin chuckled, "You demons are so easy to fool that I really don't find anything to be threatened about."
Kalwar clenched its fist, its nail digging into its flesh as it turned toward Austin and spat, "How did you find out?!"
Austin yawned, "There were so many hints, but let me give you the strongest one." With his eyes turning cold, Austin stated, "Rudolph never separates his beloved dagger from him...even while sleeping."
The demon gritted its teeth. Just a dagger was enough to make him realize?
Austin shrugged, "I even gave you a hint that I am suspicious by deliberately asking for the dagger; was testing your IQ. But I guess I was right about you guys being mindless creatures after all."
"Damn you!!!" Kalwar suddenly launched toward Austin, its nails elongating. The demon believed that Sebastian might jump in. However, Austin suddenly summoned his Shard and threw it towards Kalwar.
The demon simply swatted the dagger away—only to be hit by Austin's fist—making the demon realize,
'The dagger was just a feint...'
Kalwar leaped away, feeling its nose bleeding.
Austin looked at his fist with a grin, as he muttered, "Don't interrupt the battle unless you see him using some dirty tricks, Sebas. I wanna test a few things on this test subject."
"As you command, my Lord."
---------**---------
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 52: Chapter 51- Hunting(3)
chapters.content:
Chapter 52: Chapter 51- Hunting(3)
"Please don't panic after hearing what I am about to say," Austin warned as he made Sebastian and Valerie sit in front of him; early in the morning.
When Valerie woke up, her Lord said that they wouldn't be doing any training today since there was another urgent matter they needed to take care of.
She was baffled but considering how serious he looked she didn't say anything and remained seated.
Sebastian was also startled when his master came to wake him up at four. It was quite unusual for his master to wake up before him, so Sebastian already guessed it was something urgent.
"What is it, Young Master?" Sebastian asked, a bit of anxiety reflecting in his voice.
Austin calmly told them, "I am being lured by a demon into the forest today."
Valerie's eyes widened and Sebastian frowned upon hearing that. However, before any of the two could have said something, Austin added,
"The demon has impersonated Rudolph and has invited me into the forest for hunting yesterday. He has asked me to not tell anyone, especially you, Sebastian."
"Then we should hurry up and inform the authorities!" Valerie hurriedly spoke. The very thought of her Lord being targeted by the Demon made her much more apprehensive than she could ever have for herself.
Austin shook his head, "There were three Demons. If we take out the one who lost its life yesterday, there are still two left. That means the Demon could be anyone...a student, a teacher, or maybe the Headmaster. That's why we cannot trust anyone."
Sebastian nodded, "You are right. These Demons are brilliant in masking their presence and proficient in sneaking at places. I am assuming that it's because of their skills that they were selected to infiltrate the academy."
Hearing the butler's words, the only conclusion Valerie could draw was, "That means...you are going with that creature?"
Austin slowly nodded, "I have to Val, or we won't be able to capture the Demons. They can change their appearance, and since I am sure one of the two has taken Rudolph's form, we shouldn't risk our chances here."
Although Valerie knew that her Lord was making the right decision here, she couldn't help but feel worried about all this.
"My lord, there is a high chance for the other demon to be watching me all the time."
Austin nodded, "Yes, Sebastian, that's why I want you to remain before their eyes all the time, even when I go with the Demon into the forest."
"Then I will follow you!" Valerie immediately added. If she could be near him, then at least she might have the assurance that nothing would happen to him.
However, "No, Valerie, your presence is too strong, and the Demons would keep an eye on you. Since I brought you here without letting anyone notice us, the demons would be thinking that you are in your dormitory." After all, Austin stopped the time when he brought Valerie here.
Sebastian frowned, "Then young lord, are you planning to go with that thing alone?" In his voice, one could hear the reluctance.
Valerie also held the sentiment. Although she knew her Lord could protect himself, the opponent, this time, was not a regular human who would use predictive means to harm their nemesis. These demonic creatures are nasty and don't hold any principles while battling.
Austin heaved a sigh, before suddenly a mask appeared in his hand, "Valerie, when you wear this mask, you'll be able to impersonate Sebastian. The disguise will only last for ten minutes, so choose a spot where you won't be visible to the demon most of the time. Occasionally, while wearing the mask, make brief appearances in public to keep the demon convinced that Sebastian isn't following me."
Valerie took the mask with a frown on her face. She has never heard of such an artifact before that allows such duration of disguise.
"Sebastian, drop a blood on that mask just when we are about to leave. And after that, remain hidden as much as you can. After class, I, along with the fake Rudolph, will leave from the back entrance of the school. Follow us silently, and wait for my signal."
Sebastia nodded, "As you command, young master."
---------**----------
'Really, young master has grown brilliantly in these few weeks. I am so proud of you, young master.' Sebastian was on the verge of tears, seeing how seamlessly everything flowed according to Austin's plan.
And now, the demon was standing before him, stripped of its arrogance as it clutched its mouth which was punched by Austin.
"You are weak, aren't you? That's why you were sent here." Austin assumed, as he wiped his hand and got prepared for the battle.
The Demon narrowed its eyes and didn't respond. There was still a chance for Kalwar to take the brat hostage.
'While being engaged in battle, I need to get past that butler's reach and grab the Prince.' Kalwar planned its immediate course of action—only to find its eyes widening, as it saw something advancing towards it.
**SHLINK**
The demon ducked in the last moment as a wooden tool flew past the spot where its head was a moment ago.
"Nice dodge!" Austin cried, as he sped towards the Demon and swung his dagger.
*Cling*
The metallic scent of its blood reached the Prince's nose before Kalwar flexed its sharp claw and dropped it toward Austin's shoulder.
Kalwar's claws slashed down, but Austin dodged, the tips tearing his sleeve. In a flash, Austin summoned his dagger and slashed upward, cutting deep into the demon's arm.
The demon hissed and swung a kick. Austin jumped back, but the edge of the kick caught his shin, making him stumble slightly. Gritting his teeth, he spun around, throwing a broken plank toward Kalwar's legs.
Kalwar jumped, landing with a crash before leaping at Austin with wild eyes full of rage. It was too fast, a blur of movement that made Austin tense, his dagger raised.
The demon appeared from the left, and Austin swung his dagger, but that was a feint, as the demon slashed its claw and damaged Austin's right side.
"Agh!" Austin staggered back, pain shooting through him.
Kalwar vanished again, turning into mist. Austin's heart raced as he spun in circles, trying to track the demon's movement. The air felt thick as Kalwar moved around him, hitting from all angles.
One moment, the demon was behind him, and the next, its claws tore into his shoulder. He barely had time to turn before Kalwar appeared on his right, leaving another shallow cut.
Austin's breaths were shallow, and blood stained his clothes. Kalwar was everywhere—quick and relentless—wearing him down bit by bit.
"What happened to you now, Prince?! Can't keep up the grin anymore?" The Demon mocked, still not traceable with that damned skill of its.
Austin remained standing, his head hanging low, and his Shard held tightly in his left hand.
It was then,
*CLANG*
Kalwar's eyes widened as its claw was parried by the dagger, even though Austin wasn't even looking at it.
'A lucky guess!' Kalwar refused to believe that the weakling was able to dodge the attack with his pitiful senses.
He vanished again and attacked Austin from the front, only to be met by the same conclusion.
*CLANG*
Magically, Austin's Shard appears before its claw and blocks Kalwar from enjoying the slow torture he is inflicting.
Kalwar growled in frustration, disappearing again into the mist. He reappeared behind Austin, his claws slashing downward with deadly force.
*CLANG*
The dagger shot up, blocking the attack without hesitation. Austin didn't even flinch, his head still hanging low.
"You're toying with me!" Kalwar spat, rage fueling his every move. He vanished again, zigzagging in unnatural patterns, aiming for Austin's side.
*CLANG*
The shard was there, perfectly timed, deflecting the strike. Kalwar snarled, retreating only to attack from above. His claws came down like a guillotine, eager to crush the blond.
*CLANG*
The dagger rose to meet him, sending sparks flying. Kalwar's movements grew frantic, each strike more desperate than the last. Left, right, above, below—every attack was met with the same, precise block.
Austin didn't move. His feet stayed planted, his breathing steady, as if Kalwar wasn't even worth the effort.
"You're not even looking at me!" Kalwar roared, his voice trembling with disbelief. He vanished again, attacking from every angle in rapid succession.
*CLANG! CLANG! CLANG!*
The dagger danced, blocking every strike with an almost mocking ease. Kalwar stumbled back, panting, his claws trembling.
"How...." The demon spat, couldn't believe its eyes that a mere weakling was able to catch up with his renowned skill.
Austin finally looked up, and the first thing his eyes caught was the system screen,
[Adapt is in use!]
[Remaining time: 30 seconds]
Tilting his head, Austin muttered, "Now, it's my turn."
---------**--------
A/N:- The Demon is a C-rank, if you are wondering. Well, I hope you all enjoyed the chapter. Thanks for reading and drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 53: Chapter 52- Hunting(End)
chapters.content:
Chapter 53: Chapter 52- Hunting(End)
You cannot grow stronger unless you learn from your enemies. And that's exactly what Austin did when he realized the difference between him and his enemy.
He had more than one way to subdue the demon, asking Sebastian would have been the easiest. However, he was striving for a stronger self, wanting to become someone who could stand beside Valere and face the dangers that would be threatening the world in the near future.
As such, the most important thing, he needed to do was,
Learn.
[Skill 'Adapt' is in use!]
[Time remaining: 30 seconds.]
Austin shot toward the demon, his speed exceeding Kalwar's expectations, as it hurriedly raised its claw to parry the attack. However,
*SQUELCH*
It was stabbed from behind, the target in front dissolving into a mist.
Kalwar's eyes widened as it shakily muttered, "H-How....c-can you use my s-skill...."
Austin didn't reply, rather, he drove the dagger into the gut of the demon with all his force.
'System, add all my three points into combat.' he commanded, as Austin released the hold from his dagger, and began launching and barrage of punches at the demon
Kalwar was overwhelmed by the speed and flexibility of the human, who was easily maneuvering through its defense and launching attacks at its vital point.
"YOU FUCKER!!"
The demon roared, its dark energy pulsating and becoming alive.
Kalwar joined its hand and dropped the hammer on Austin's head—only to strike nothing but open air, as Austin disappeared once again.
**SQUELCH**
Another searing pain ripped through the demon's monstrous form as Austin drove his blade deep into its back.
"RAAAHHHH!" The demon roared, its guttural howl shaking the air. It swung its massive arm wildly, trying to crush the human pest clinging to it. But what once made Kalwar proud, now filled him with rage and helplessness.
*SWISH*
Austin vanished in an instant, dissolving into a cold mist. Before Kalwar could react, Austin reappeared above him, his silhouette framed against the darkening sky.
His fist was drawn back, veins bulging as power surged through him. His glowing eyes locked onto the demon's head like a predator about to deliver the killing blow.
With a thunderous crack, Austin's fist slammed into the demon's skull. The sheer force drove Kalwar's feet deep into the ground, the earth splitting beneath the weight of the impact. Blood erupted from the demon's eyes and nose in sickening streams, its body convulsing as a horrific crunch echoed through the battlefield.
Austin's sleeve shredded from the raw power of the strike, his arm dripping with the demon's foul ichor. The once-proud demon lord now sagged, trembling, pinned in place by the human's merciless strength.
Austin jumped back and looked at his fist.
'Increasing combat stat has improved my strength and speed as well...I might become C-rank in a few days at this rate.'
Kalwar dropped to its knees, unable to discern what went wrong and how it ended up being so gravely wounded by a lowlife.
Austin...was supposed to be weak and should had a fragile ego. What suddenly changed, and how could he use the same skill as Kalwar?
...nothing made sense.
"Before I kill you, tell me where Rudolph is."
Kalwar's broken jaw made a guttural voice, "Dead...killed....ripped to shred-"
"Bullshit. I know he escaped you guys. Your deceased brother gave the information."
"..." Kalwar was stunned into silence. It had known its late brother had been captured for interrogation, but it never imagined that its brother would reveal so much before the Vow claimed its life.
"Well, not like you are going to say anything. So just-"
"You think this is over?" Just as Austin raised his hand, with the intention to kill the demon, Kalwar voiced something unexpected.
"Do...you...believe, this will end...like this...?" Raising its broken face, the demon asked, "....I still have a brother...back in...the academy...and hundreds...of innocent....students...he could kill...within seconds...how are you going to...stop that catastrophe?"
Austin narrowed his eyes. Until now, if the demon was confident in its brother, then Valerie hadn't found the last demon.
'No wonder. If even the security of the academy and Sebastian couldn't sense the demon, then Valerie surely can't...' Austin showed hesitation for the first time.
The demon was dangerous...with the ability to camouflage and shapeshift, it could cause mayhem and make people believe something that isn't true.
"Imagine...slaughtering people while wearing a certain Prince's facade...how would that look...?"
Kalwar grinned, liking the hesitation Austin was exposing.
"Young master, should I retreat and search for-"
"Don't you dare! If any of you two move, I will give him the command right away!"
This...was bad.
Austin knew if the demon killed even a few students, the whole plot would shift, and the other students might decide to leave the academy because they mistrust the security. In the first place, he doesn't like the idea of innocent lives getting wasted.
'Was I hasty...I should have thought about the third demon...' Austin clenched his fist in regret. Despite all the planning, he ended up making a severe mistake.
He depended on Valerie a lot for this, and now he was stuck in a deadlock.
"So what would it be, Your Highness? Either you come with me, and ensure mine and my brother's safety, or I allow my brother to unleash his fury on your dear schoolmates..starting from that bitch of a fiancée of yours."
Austin growled. This was the second time the Demon had insulted Valerie, and he was on the verge of making an impulsive decision.
Sebastian remained silent, his eyes focused on his master, as the butler awaited any command at the moment.
'What will be your decision, young master...'
Austin took a deep breath, and said, "I-"
*CRASH*
Suddenly something crashed between the demon and the Prince.
It was a corpse. A being who was killed...no, slaughtered.
Kalwar's body shook... Its eyes witnessed the body of its brother, yet its mind failed to register what it was witnessing.
"Astor...Astor..." Kalwar shook the body of its brother, however, no response came.
Austin raised his brows and turned toward the female who appeared from behind.
The pink-haired teenager had a cold look in her eyes as if killing a demon was nothing she felt anxious about. However, only Rhea knows how difficult it was for her...to kill a sane being who was begging her for its life.
It was her luck, that she stumbled upon the demon when she went to the library a few minutes ago. After that, the demon tried to escape but she chased it down and hunted the being who could have become the reason for her classmate's death.
"You....killed...you killed my BROTH-*KWHACK*" The Demon wasn't allowed to cry as a fast-paced boomerang crushed the beast's head and ceased its existence.
Sebastian's brows were raised, "I was wondering what you threw at the demon back then...so it was an artifact."
Austin nodded before he retrieved the weapon and approached the corpse of the duo.
The beings who could have caused unimaginable damage were slaughtered.
"Austin...were they after that beast attack back then?"
Rhea asked, feeling her heart a bit heavy after slaughtering the demon. This was the first time for her to kill something capable of conversing and was weaker than her.
Austin glanced at the girl and somehow understood what she was thinking, urging him to say, "You did the right thing because these two were about to turn the Valorian Academy into a graveyard."
Rhea's mouth parted slightly as she turned towards the blond and heard him adding, "You cannot show hesitation in front of those whose sole intention of existence is to cause mayhem. Remember that, Rhea, or one day, you would be lying somewhere like them."
Rhea took a strong gulp and looked back at the two demons.
He was right...she could not hesitate in battle or that would be her death.
Sebastian was impressed by the fact that how her master could be cold and blunt in front of others while if it's about Lady Valerie, he becomes all soft and considerate while speaking.
Austin took a deep breath, before telling Sebastian, "Sebas...can you do me a favor and join the search team to locate Rudolph?"
"I will also go." Rhea instantly added.
Austin didn't say anything about that, however, he believed that with the school instructors searching for him, it would be pretty easy to locate Rudolph.
"Young Master, you should probably get healed up before Lady Valerie sees you."
Austin jolted as he looked down at him...he had received several wounds, which surely would make Valerie panic.
"Yeah, I should-"
"M-My Lord..."
Too late.
-----------**---------
A/N:- I hope you all enjoyed the chapter. This was the second arc of the novel which concluded. If you are enjoying the story so far, make sure to drop a review.

chapters.title: Chapter 54: Chapter 53- Dinner
chapters.content:
Chapter 54: Chapter 53- Dinner
Austin didn't leak the information regarding the Demons and only told the Headmaster about the whole situation.
To say Philius was surprised would have been an understatement. He was baffled at how many serious and life-threatening decisions Austin took to capture the demon all by himself.
"You should have at least told me before following that demon into the forest. Although Sebastian was with you, it doesn't change the fact that you led yourself into their trap."
Inside the Headmaster's office, only the two of them were present, when Austin was getting scolded.
"Everything happened so fast that I never found the opportunity to notify you. And, that demon was monitoring my movements so making unexpected contact with you would have made them suspicious."
Although Philius agrees that what Austin did was the best possible route to handle the situation, he couldn't get rid of the anxiety of thinking of a student endangering their life so casually.
It was his failure as a Headmaster that a student had to go to such lengths.
"So...are your injuries healed?" Philius asked as he looked at the bandages around his arm and torso.
Austin nodded, "More or less. Just a few days of rest and I will be fine."
The older one said, "Take a few days of rest from classes and let your body heal itself. You have been sustaining grave injuries these days."
Not so long after, Austin made his way out of the room.
Philius took a deep breath and thought back on the young man, who once used to remain troubled about his shortcomings, always entangled in what he lost. However, now, the same young man has been showing such tendencies that Philius couldn't believe that he is the same Austin.
Calm, responsible, cunning and brave.
Taking out a parchment, Philius began writing a letter to the King.
Although Austin has requested to keep the matter a secret from the students, fearing that the news of the demons roaming around might create chaos, it doesn't mean that he couldn't let a father know about his son's deeds.
'He is no longer a troublemaking child, Cedric.'
--------**--------
While he was walking back to his dormitory, Austin checked the system,
[Combat: 26/100]
{Next reward at 40}
[Romance: 37/100]
{Next reward at 40}
[Durability: 25/100]
{Next reward at 40}
[Trickery: 21/100]
{Next reward at 35}
[Overall Progression: 26/100]
[Ding!]
[You have two new rewards!]
[Tap to view!]
Austin raised his brows upon seeing that his Combat, Durability, and Trickery stats had gone up.
'Fooling a fool has gained me a reward? Nice.'
He viewed the rewards,
[Death Disguise: Upon swallowing the pill, the Host's heartbeat halts for five minutes, effectively simulating death. During this time, the Host is indistinguishable from a lifeless body. The effect persists until the orb's influence completely dissipates.]
'....this is unexpected ' He couldn't think of using it any time in the near future. However, considering how unpredictable and dangerous the foes were, Austin had a feeling that he wouldn't let the artifact rot in inventory for long.
'Next.'
[Absolute Barrier Scroll: Grants the Host the ability to learn the skill Absolute Barrier. The duration of the barrier depends on the Host's intelligence stat.
The Absolute Barrier offers complete protection against all forms of damage, both physical and magical, regardless of the attack's strength or intensity.]
[Current limitation: 30 seconds.]
[Note: Once the barrier is deployed, it cannot be recalled unless its limited time is up. And after one use, it takes thirty hours of rest before the Barrier can be chanted again.]
'Cool...' Even if it's for half a minute, if he gets immune to all kinds of damage, Austin knew he would be able to utilize that time to his benefit.
*Click*
Opening the door of his room, he stepped inside.
A smile bloomed on his face when he found Valerie arranging food on the table while wearing an apron.
"You cooked food in such a small space?" Austin's kitchen wasn't big since he never learned to cook in the past. And since there was a cafeteria available, he never found the necessity to bring more kitchen equipment than a teapot and a few cups.
"It wasn't difficult since you have kept all the things at their designated places." Valerie complimented. Austin's things always remain neat and tidy. As such, Valerie didn't have a hard time finding things in the kitchen.
"So? What did the Headmaster say?" As Valerie rested the pot on the table, she asked.
"Just scolded me and praised me a little. He will be sending someone to guard me all the time since Sebas is busy."
Valerie frowned, "Why do you need someone else...when I am here?" She felt a little shy saying that so boldly.
"Well, he doesn't know that you sneak into my room, so there is no stopping him."
Valerie blushed hearing that 'sneak' part. When she entered his room for the first time, she was embarrassed to death and had to make up her mind for the whole night to make the decision.
However, now, it seems it was normal for her to climb inside his room.
"Austin...do you think I am shameless?" Although it didn't seem Austin minded her coming here, rather he welcomed her with open arms, it was still quite an unlady-like behavior for Valerie to enter her fiancé's resting space.
Her mother would have fainted if she had heard about it.
Austin softly smiled as he held her hand, and spoke, "The world might regard this shameless, and the things you have learned back home might make you feel bad for coming to my room like this....but, in my eyes, you are the best partner I could have ever asked for."
His eyes were warm and honest when he spoke, "It's your care and love that you always come here, so don't ever regard this as a bad thing."
Valerie took a deep breath, upon hearing his words.
That's right, she shouldn't think about the world when the person whose opinion matters the most to her was content with her presence.
"Thank you."
They then sat down and began eating the dinner she prepared.
It was nothing fancy, just curry and rice, yet Austin couldn't stop praising her with each bite.
They were talking nothing serious during the dinner. Their talk mostly was about their childhood and the silly things they used to do.
"...yeah, I remember that day. Those few guys were nothing but wannabe goons, trying to corner you." Austin chuckled, remembering that celebration night when Valerie was cornered by a few kids from noble families.
She was just a kid but at that time, her tongue was more poisonous than a lethal snake's. She said things that didn't sit well with them, and they tried to bully her.
"And then...you arrived and saved me from them." That's my favorite part of that memory. Valerie couldn't forget that time when Austin appeared like a savior...fighting the three older kids, and despite the injury, he continued to fight them until they didn't start to cry.
And when Valerie asked, why did he go this far to hurt them, he said,
'I only can make you laugh and cry....and I won't let that authority be snatched by some snorty kids.'
That statement made her both, laugh and cry.
Austin grumbled, "Forget about that. I was just trying to act cool." He was a little embarrassed.
Valerie smiled, "Well, you did look cool."
Seeing the side-eyed look, and that smile on her face, Austin gulped and refused to look at her anymore.
She can be pretty dangerous for his heart from time to time.
After dinner, they were washing dishes together, when Valerie asked, "Did you find any changes in your Shard today?"
Austin raised his brows and thought back on the battle with Kalwar.
"...I think I did sense something absurd." Austin stated, "When I stabbed the demon, I was targeting its heart, but the dagger stabbed a little lower than the target...it was then when I felt the dagger bending upward."
"...!!" Valerie's eyes parted wide, "Your Shard changed shape on your will?"
"Not conscious but yeah, it heard my wish and bent to target the heart. However, the demon was fast and pushed me off instantly."
Valerie was stunned; changing the shape and form of your Soul is no easy feat. No, maybe there are only a few individuals in the world who can do that.
"Austin I-"
**Knock**
They both turned towards the door and heard the person on the other side, "It's me, young master."
Austin wiped his hand and approached the door.
*Click*
"When did you return, Sebas?" Austin asked since the butler went with the search team to locate Rudolph.
Sebastian informed, "Just now, and we have found Sir Rudolph."
Austin's eyes widened, as he hurriedly asked, "Where is he?"
"In the infirmary, sir. His situation is critical."
Austin nodded before he urged, "Let's go, Val."
Valerie was also about to step out with Austin when Sebastian said, "Your presence is required somewhere else right now, Miss Valerie. Someone is waiting for you in the administrator's office."
Valerie was surprised, "Who?"
"Your father."
--------**--------
A/N:- Eager for the next chapter? Well, I can barely stop my fingers from writing about their conversation. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 55: Chapter 54- Won't forgive
chapters.content:
Chapter 55: Chapter 54- Won't forgive
Austin felt a little apprehensive due to Lord Corwon's sudden visit. He couldn't pinpoint why, but he was feeling a bit nervous.
'It must be because of the demon attack...' Considering the recent headlines about the demon's appearance, many parents have come to check on their children.
Not to mention, Valerie was directly involved with the demon. It was only natural for Lord Corwon to visit her.
'Unlike my parents, they care about their daughter.' With those thoughts, Austin entered the infirmary.
Inside, several professors were gathered, and the medical team was working on a single bed where Rudolph lay. His stomach bore a severe wound, and he looked extremely pale. Likely from blood loss and exhaustion.
"He'll be saved," Harold said, standing beside Austin.
The blond prince asked, "Where was he found?"
"At the outskirts of the Randare Market."
Austin raised his brows. That was at least half a day's travel, and in his condition, Rudolph had made it there.
'He must've lost his sense of direction...' He sighed, then asked, "Did he say anything after being recovered?"
Harold nodded. "Just one thing: 'Demons are about to attack... protect Rhea.'"
Austin almost chuckled at that. Even on the verge of death, the guy was still worried about his favorite woman.
'Well, I can't say I can't relate.'
There was a brief silence as Harold seemed to be gathering his thoughts. Finally, he turned to the younger one, fist clenched behind his back, and said, "I apologize for doubting you. And for capturing the demon, I thank you with all my heart."
Austin was a bit taken aback by the man's bow. Considering Harold's devotion to the safety of the students, it wasn't a huge surprise that he felt indebted to Austin.
With a soft smile, the blond prince said, "This school is as important to me as it is to you. There's no need to thank me, Sir."
--------**-------
Valerie, as instructed, made her way toward the administrator's office where her father was waiting.
She hadn't received any letter about his visit, so she was a bit surprised.
"He's inside," the administrator said, and Valerie nodded before walking into the waiting area.
"Father," she called out as she entered the office, where the violet-haired man sat.
Adam stood with a smile and walked toward his beloved daughter. "Valerie, it's been a long time."
The last time she visited home was during Austin's birthday last year. It had been over a year since Adam had seen his daughter, and he had to admit that she had become even more beautiful in this brief time.
"Is everything okay?" Valerie asked though it should have been her father asking that question.
"Yes, everything's fine. Why would you ask?" Lord Corwon responded, perplexed.
"I never received a letter about your visit, and it's unexpected for you—the Duke—to pay a visit out of the blue."
It wasn't that Valerie didn't feel elated meeting her father after so long. It was just that, considering the enormous workload he always had, she found his unexpected visit strange.
"It's natural for me to worry when I hear that my daughter fought a demon," Adam huffed, not liking the fact that his visit was being questioned. After all, he was a father before he was a Duke.
Valerie smiled softly and urged him to sit down. She sensed the displeasure in his tone and realized that she might have been too harsh.
She poured him a glass of water and said, "It wasn't very dangerous to handle the demon. Austin planned everything and minimized the risk to almost zero."
Adam's expression shifted when he heard that name, which didn't go unnoticed by Valerie. However, she didn't say anything, instead hearing him ask,
"Why didn't you return for the celebration this time? You could have asked Austin to come with you. His family arranged such a grand feast, and the birthday boy wasn't there to enjoy the occasion."
Valerie sighed. "It's not like they celebrated the day solely for him. On the other hand, if the First Prince hadn't been able to come, I doubt they would have arranged such a grand feast just for Austin."
It pained her to say this, but it was the truth. Austin's family didn't give him the attention or care a child should receive.
Forget about everything else—the news of the demon's appearance had shaken everyone. From farmers to nobles, everyone rushed to meet their children to ensure they were safe.
And what about the royal family?
Adam took a deep breath and asked, "So you know that Austin's relationship with his family isn't good."
His tone didn't carry any sympathy, which Valerie had expected. Instead, it sounded serious, as if he was about to say something significant.
"Father, what are you trying to imply here?" Her tone shifted, and the air around her seemed to change.
Adam didn't hold back and voiced his thoughts. "As my eldest daughter and someone with the potential to become a great ruler, I believe you're wasting your potential by staying by Austin's side."
*Tremble*
The glass on the table, the chandelier overhead, and the gemstones around the room began to shake and flicker under her aura.
Her fist clenched, and her eyes turned cold as steel as she asked, "What are you suggesting, Father?"
Adam could tell that his daughter had grown much stronger since the last time they met. But he didn't hold back, stating what he believed to be the best course of action.
"I want you to annul this engagement and get engaged to Aiden."
*CRACK*
The ground under her feet cracked as she shifted her foot slightly.
Her overwhelming aura caused the administrator to rush in. "Is everything okay?!"
Lord Corwon raised his hand, signaling for the officer to leave, and soon the man was gone.
Valerie's gaze never left her father as she said, "Father... I've respected every decision you've made for me. Everything you said, I followed without objection. And in return, I asked you for a single thing."
Adam's eyes grew grim. "I know you asked me never to question your relationship with Austin nor try to separate you two... but you need to understand, daughter. Aiden is a much more suitable partner for you."
Valerie took a deep breath and calmed herself. She knew continuing at this pace wouldn't lead anywhere.
Leaning over the table, she asked, "What do you require from your son-in-law? Someone who cares for me and is strong enough to protect me, right?"
Adam nodded. "Yes... those are the qualities I need at the very least."
Valerie interlaced her fingers and asked, "Do you remember, Father? Austin was hailed as the weakest noble child until two years ago. Someone who awakened a useless Shard and couldn't grow his strength, no matter how hard he tried."
Adam nodded. "Yes, that's why we were always uncertain about letting you two get engaged."
"Yes, but didn't he prove you, and everyone else, wrong by enrolling in one of the top-ranked academies in the world?"
Adam was speechless. It was true—Austin had been weaker than any of those noble children who were born with strong bloodlines and trained since childhood. But against all odds, he had been admitted to the prestigious Valorian Academy and made it to the top.
"And recently, he fought and defeated a demon—all by himself. If you don't believe me, you can ask the Headmaster."
That statement shocked him. No one, not even the king, knew about this, as Adam had just met with him yesterday.
For Valerie to defeat a demon was praiseworthy, but for Austin to do so was something that left even the most experienced shocked.
Valerie sighed and added, "And if you're worried about whether Austin takes care of me, let me ask you this, Father... Have you ever stayed awake all night, sitting beside Mother just to comfort her when she was anxious? Not only that—when the entire school turned against me, blamed me for harming a classmate, and even when I believed I was at fault and was ready to accept punishment... do you know who stood by my side and fought to protect my pride?"
Her voice trembled, and tears welled up in her eyes. "It was Austin."
The room fell into silence.
Adam looked down, his eyes filled with confusion and regret.
He couldn't understand why he ever considered separating his daughter from the boy she adored. It wasn't like he hadn't seen how close they had grown. Yet, he...
'What is wrong with me?'
Sighing heavily, Adam lowered his head and said, "Please forgive me, Val... I shouldn't have said that."
"No, I won't forgive you." Without another word, Valerie wiped away her tears and walked out of the room, leaving a defeated father behind.
Unbeknownst to both, there was someone listening to their conversation. And once Valerie walked out, the man sat down and took out a parchment,
'Guess Lord Aiden is going to fly in rage...'
--------**-------
A/N:- Imagine someone other than her father asking her to break up.

chapters.title: Chapter 56: Chapter 55- Nothing without you
chapters.content:
Chapter 56: Chapter 55- Nothing without you
Austin didn't find Valerie in the common hall, so while assuming that she was still with her father, he returned to his room.
Rudolph's situation was critical but the healer said that she would save him. The healers of the academy are quite well-trained and possess commendable skills. In their hands, Rudolph was safe.
Austin was currently brewing himself some coffee in his room when he asked the system,
"Is there no description I get on Shard? Or maybe a skill like Appraisal?"
The situation with his Shard was quite complicated. His Soul Shard has been acting weirdly, more so when Austin gets into dangerous situations.
Although it has never betrayed him until now, fortunately, discerning the mechanism of the equipment that was attached to his Soul was quite important.
[Unfortunately, host, the system cannot assign a quest for a specific reward. You can only request a quest to target a specific progression. However, there are chances that the reward obtained from the Overall progression might grant you the skill of Appraisal.]
Austin hummed, as he whisked the coffee and put the milk to boil.
The stress of the three demons was over, and before the tournament, there should be only a few small arcs. However, Austin's main focus was on the tournament.
He was, most probably nearing the C-rank now. He would officially become a C-rank with some training and a few quests of the system.
Before the tournament, he, at least, needs to reach B-rank—one of the prerequisites of the tournament.
Even after that, he needs to go through a few tests to be selected as an Elite.
And the journey doesn't end there; during the winter vacation he needs to go treasure hunting as well—and for that he has to do something through preparation.
'A long way to go…and so less time I have…' Yet, he was optimistic. After all, there was his supportive butler and loving fiancée for him.
*Knock*
Suddenly, Austin heard a knock on his door, urging him to turn off the boiler and approach the door.
*Click*
Surprisingly, it was Sebastian, "Young Master…Lady Valerie…in the gym." The way he was unsteadily breathing and looked panicked gave him enough reason to break into a sprint as Austin made his way out of the dormitory.
Several thoughts crossed his mind as he advanced towards the gymnasium.
—---**----
[A few seconds ago]
Rhea's eyes were parted wide when she arrived in the indoor gym to retrieve something. She wanted to return to the infirmary as soon as she could so she could look after Rudolph. However, the sight she was greeted with froze her in shock.
"What the….heck…" the gym was a mess. Hundreds of wooden training dolls were lying on the ground—snapped and wasted.
These are special training dolls with enchantment imbued in them to make them stronger than normal wood. It takes several days for a student to practice against a single doll to break it.
And here…hundreds of them were scattered around.
**DHAK**
Rhea raised her eyes and turned towards the cause of this mayhem.
Valerie, on the other side, was showing her profound skills in martial arts and beating the nonliving but pitiful training doll.
**SNAP**
Not so long after, that training doll snapped as well—leaving none anymore.
Rhea hurriedly approached Valerie, only to stop in her tracks when suddenly Valerie summoned her Shard and pointed it towards Rhea,
"R-Relax…I am not here to hurt you."
Valerie narrowed her eyes before she released her Shard and turned away.
Rhea approached her again, this time cautiously, and said, "Your hands are bleeding. You should stop training now-"
Valerie sharply turned, making the pink head flinch, before the violette stated, "Listen, I don't want any suggestions from anyone right now. So please, leave."
Rhea was troubled seeing that indifference in Valerie's eyes. It reminded her of that day when Valerie snapped her Shard. That day, she was upset because Rhea damaged the dress that Austin gifted. Then today as well…
"Val."
Suddenly, they heard a voice from the entrance.
Valerie heard him but didn't turn to look at him—fearing she might cry and let him know all her grief once again. She feared that she might make him sad because of her…once again.
Austin again voiced as he advanced at her, "...won't you look at me, Val?"
Valerie flinched and clenched her fist. Tears welled up in her eyes, as she continued to look down.
Rhea, upon finding the right person at the right place, took the cue and stepped back,
'I no longer need to worry for her…'
Austin stood beside his lover, before holding her wrist and uttering, "Please look at me Val…"
His soft voice and the familiar warmth broke her resistance as she turned towards him and rested her head on his chest.
The gym, which was previously hearing the screams of her wrath, was now filled with the cries of her agony.
Austin rubbed her back and continued to whisper, 'It's okay…I am here…'
—-----**-------
Austin brought the girl to the stands and heard what happened.
She somehow calmed down enough to tell him about the conversation she had with her father.
Austin knelt before the girl and slowly removed the splinters from her hands. Seeing her blood oozing, made his heart shake. A lump seemed to have grown in his throat that made breathing difficult.
"...I don't understand why…why would father ever suggest something…." Her voice was shaky. Anything that proposes separation from her beloved makes her so painfully hurt and agitated…
Austin didn't look up at her and took a bottle of disinfectant and cotton from his <Inventory>.
While he cleaned her wounds, he told her, "You know Val, whenever everything seems like going good in my life, and I find myself being too happy…I always wonder, what if…my greatest source of happiness is snatched away from me?"
His tone was heavy, numerous emotions his voice held.
Forgetting about her grief, the violet-haired heard him saying,
"I have thought a few times…what if you get separated from me for some reason…and you know what I saw beyond that possibility?"
Valerie hesitated, not wanting to hear what he thought, but in the end, curiosity got the better of her, "What?"
"Nothing." Austin raised his face and looked in the eye, "I saw nothing…just pure blank."
Her eyes slightly stretched, as the burn from the medicine and the pain from her bones seemed insignificant in front of the pain her Darling was showing.
"I…cannot imagine a world where I can't live with you. Complete emptiness…I will lose my reason to live. After all, for me, everything starts and ends with you."
Valerie gazed at her beloved, a choked sob left her throat, as she heard him saying,
"So…even if it's your father, I cannot…I will not let you go, Valerie."
"Don't…!" She held his face with her shaky fingers, "...never let go. Valerie can only belong to her Lord…to you."
Their arms encircled around each other, and the embrace was more fierce and passionate than ever. It was like the duo was trying to become one with the hug. The very thought of being separated shook them to the core—making them realize what's the most important thing for them.
And that is to always stay together.
—-----**-------
Austin cleaned her wounds and wrapped bandages around her knuckles.
"Why did you come here instead of meeting me? Hurting yourself because someone else hurt you?" Austin asked, his tone signifying displeasure.
Valerie, meekly, responded, "I…didn't want to make you upset by all this…so I thought…"
"So you were intending to hide such a big thing from me? Am I that unreliable, Val?"
The spear-user instantly shook her head, "No, that's not…! I wasn't going to hide it forever, just for the time being considering the recent events."
Austin was surrounded by challenges that were both mentally and physically taxing. Recently, his friend recovered from a critical situation, and Valerie didn't want to elevate his burden anymore.
Austin heaved a sigh, "Physically, I might not be impressive, but you can trust me when it comes to taking mental pressure. I am good at it."
Once he finished wrapping up the bandage, he asked, "There…feels better now?"
Valerie was about to nod in assent…then something came to her mind, and she shyly shook, "...still hurts a little."
Austin barely held himself from grinning as he brought her hands near his lips and tenderly kissed them.
"Now, is it okay?"
Valerie smiled, "Yes, it's better now."
—-----**------
Sitting inside his office room, Aiden read the letter and didn't feel betrayed.
He expected this. Valerie is a strong woman who can fight anyone if it comes to Austin.
Bringing the parchment near the candle, he burned the tip of it.
Watching the burning letter with a malicious grin, he muttered,
"It will be fun…this hunt will be more enjoyable, the more you resist."
As the parchment burned, Aiden thought of his next move, which could detach his little brother from his sole reason for happiness.
—----**-----
A/N:- For Valerie, Austin is both her strength and weakness. Well, you all can see how attached they are, so no need to worry about needless separation and shiiii. Thanks for reading, drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 57: Chapter 56- Sudden meeting
chapters.content:
Chapter 57: Chapter 56- Sudden meeting
"Guh…" Rudolph exhaled a choked breath, as he parted his eyes and looked at the first thing his eyes caught.
White ceiling.
The last thing he remembered was seeing the voice headmaster and warning him about the demons. Then…
"Where am I?"
"In the heavens, child." Just as he asked the question, someone called out from his left.
Rudolph turned his head and found a familiar person sitting there.
With a weak smile, he uttered, "Although you are pretty as an angel, it doesn't mean I will get fooled that easily."
Hearing those words, Rhea blushed slightly and leaned forward. "How are you feeling now? Does it still hurt?" Her voice carried a mix of relief and concern.
Rudolph tried to move his body and indeed, there was some pain in his stomach and legs, "Kind of. But I know I will recover in a few days."
Rhea heaved a sigh, "No need to rush, the headmaster has already given you a few weeks of leave."
Rudolph shrugged, "The more free time the better. I can use that time to train." He doesn't like reading books and remembering things. The only reason he got admitted to Apex Circle was because of his strength.
"...hey, Rudolph…I am sorry for what happened back then." Hearing Rhea's slow muttering, the raven-haired was surprised,
Her tone caught him off guard, and he turned to look at her, his brows furrowing. "Why are you apologizing? It was my mistake for underestimating the enemy and charging in head-on. You don't need to—"
"But-" she interrupted, "if I had listened to you and gone after the chanter like you suggested, you wouldn't have gotten hurt. Valerie wouldn't have…" Her words faltered as she trailed off. "I feel like it's my fault."
Rhea could shake off the feeling that she was, in a way, responsible for Rudolph's situation. After all, he insisted she come and catch the chanter first and let Valerie deal with the monster.
And if Rhea hadn't intervened, Valerie surely would have defeated that being.
Rudolph slowly moved his hand and held hers.
