The slight connection made her jolt as she heard him saying, "...you are an idiot to blame yourself for this. You always intended to protect your classmates, and that's not something you should feel shameful about."
With his face adopting a warm smile, the boy added, "That's a quality, I admire about you. Never blame yourself for it."
Rhea was…stunned.
It was strange that days of pondering over the same thing, that if only she had done this or that, was quelled just by a few words of comfort.
Tears welled up in her eyes as Rhea, while wiping them, uttered, "Okay, I won't blame myself if only you recover soon and get back to the training ground. We have a lot to catch up on."
—----**-----
*SWISH*
Valerie's eyes widened as she continued to dodge the relentless attacks from her beloved.
His precision was sharper, his focus unshaken, and his speed far beyond what she remembered. And not only that,
**CRACK**
Seeing the crack forming on the tree where her body was a moment ago, she could tell that his strength had improved as well.
She sidestepped, narrowly avoiding the dagger aimed at her. With a swift motion, she twisted his arm upward, forcing his hand open. In the same breath, she spun on her heel, her other hand darting in to snatch the dagger mid-air before it could fall.
"Agh!" Austin winced, disarmed in an instant, as Valerie stepped back, the dagger now firmly in her grasp.
"I lost." Austin accepted his defeat before Valerie asked,
"Does it hurt?"
Austin shook his head, "Nothing to be worried about." He rotated his wrist and found it just stinging a little.
"I must say, Austin, you have improved quite a lot in so little time. I have noticed that your unnatural growth is linked with the growth of your Shard."
Austin couldn't tell her that it was the system that was allowing him to elevate his stats.
"Maybe…" he shrugged, "Well, let's get back and get changed?"
Valerie nodded before they walked back to their respective dorms to change.
It has been four days since that incident. After that day, Lord Corwin hasn't contacted Valerie, nor has the girl shown any initiative to send him any letter.
En route, he asked the system,
'Stats.'
[Combat: 28/100]
{Next reward at 40}
[Romance: 42/100]
{Next reward at 60}
[Durability: 30/100]
{Next reward at 40}
[Trickery: 21/100]
{Next reward at 35}
[Overall Progression: 28.5/100]
…
He advanced to the next stage in romance that day when he comforted Valerie in the gym.
As a reward, he received a bouquet of ever fragrant flowers, which he naturally gifted to Valerie.
She was happy receiving the flowers, to the point she was about to frame them until Austin told her the special thing about the flowers.
'Hmm….my durability is increasing very slowly. System, assign me a quest.'
[Are you sure you want to use QoD for your durability enhancement?]
[Three consecutive failures would cease the Host's authority over QoD.]
Austin affirmed, "Yes."
[Ding…]
[Generating Quest…]
[Assessing current status…]
[Ding!]
[Quest: Endure these challenges to develop your durability:
Dive into water below 0°C for 100 minutes.
Perform 1,000 push-ups and run 50 km wearing weighted gear of 200kg.
Endure 50°C heat for 120 minutes.]
[Reward: +10 Durability, ???]
[Time limit: 2d 23h 59m]
"...." Austin was…taken aback.
This was the second time he demanded a quest and the system has begun showing its sadist side.
'Well, durability means elevating endurance, so surely, these criteria would help my body to become more sturdy.'
To fulfill the challenges, he would need gemstones. Magic beast that gives gemstones cannot be found easily around the Academy, so there was no point trying to find one.
So he was left with only one option: buy the necessary equipment.
As for the weighted gears, then he would borrow them from the school gymnasium.
He didn't have much time, so the workout part would need to be divided into two parts. And the endurance part would be done on alternative days.
*Knock*
"Young master." Hearing the voice from the other end, Austin got up from the bed and approached the door.
While reading the necessity, Austin had taken a bath and changed his clothes, so there was no rush.
"Good morning, Sebastian." Exchanging greetings with the butler, Austin was headed towards his office.
En route, Austin asked, "Can you bring me three Ice and three Fire Gemstones of the Third grade?"
Sebastian politely responded, "Understood; I will deliver it by tomorrow."
Austin hummed before he and the butler walked inside the office.
Sebastian, upon finding them no longer in the range of being heard by others, spoke, "Young Master, I have some news to share regarding the Capital."
Austin's brows rose. "What news?"
Sebastian informed, "Recently, an emergency meeting was arranged. The situation with the kingdom in the far south looks dire."
Austin frowned; there are seven major nations on the human side. And the nation of the far south was the second strongest country when it came to military strength.
Eryndor was strong but if only its allies keep supporting the kingdom.
Eryndor was the heart of trade that's why four nations are in alliance with Eryndor. That's why, until now, the nation in the South hasn't done anything against Eryndor, despite their past grudges.
But now, 'Hener must have pulled their hands…' The greatest supplier of military supplies, the kingdom of Hener, would surely now backstab Eryndor.
Reason? Parkinson.
'Has the plot shifted?' Austin turned towards Sebastian, before asking,
"Can you find out what was discussed in that meeting?"
Sebastian seemed hesitant, "For that, I will need to visit the Capital."
"Then please do so. I need to know if a war is approaching."
Sebastian lowered his head, "As you command, sir."
—----**------
Soon, Austin left the office, heading toward the school.
The situation with the capital was still unclear, so he didn't ponder over it needlessly and decided to reach the rendezvous point on time.
Valerie was waiting for him there, however, unlike usual, there was no smile on her face.
Austin approached her, "Is everything good?"
Valerie smiled instantly seeing him, as she nodded, "Yes, I am fine." Taking out a parchment, she showed him, "I just got this from Miss Norma."
Austin frowned slightly upon hearing the name, as he asked, "If I am not wrong, she is the secretary of your father?"
"Yes, she is. I asked her to give me the list of people who contacted father before he came to meet me. I asked her to keep it a secret from father, but even if he finds out, he won't mind."
Austin raised his brows, "Did you suspect something?"
The violette nodded, "And my suspicion was right."
She pointed at the specific name of the person who came to meet Lord Corwon, just two days before he arrived at the Academy.
'The first Prince, Eryndor Aiden.'
—-----**-------
A/N:- I hope you all are enjoying the story so far. Thank you for reading. Drop a commment.

chapters.title: Chapter 58: Chapter 57- Aiden
chapters.content:
Chapter 58: Chapter 57- Aiden
Aiden. Someone who was separated from his parents around his birth. His upbringing was in an orphanage. A place where the boy got to learn various things, which surely, someone his age shouldn't have.
At the age of five, he learned that if he wanted to eat to survive, then he had to be strong. But because he was weak, his bread always got snatched by the taller and soldier kids.
The warden of the place never said anything, so Aiden learned that begging for others help was futile.
He always had to pick from the garbage bin or work overtime to eat a piece of bread. Washing dishes, brushing toilets, cleaning drainage pipes...doing all those nasty things that everyone avoided. And all for a piece of bread so he could survive.
He even tried stealing, but on his first attempt, he was caught and received a punishment which gives him nightmares to this date.
By the time he turned seven and became strong enough to show dominance, his house—the orphanage—got snatched away as a newly appointed noble decided to demolish the orphanage and build a bar there.
That was the second lesson of his life—strength is not only the thing required. You need money as well. And until you have the two you can take anything away from anyone.
By the age of thirteen, he was working at a brothel. He used to clean rooms and drive away the problem customers. Slum and poverty had allowed him to learn a few techniques with a stick, so he was fairly strong for his age.
When he was there, he fell for a woman who used to work as a prostitute for the brothel.
Aiden didn't have a problem with her job but he was determined to liberate her. She was initially resistant, calling herself impure and not his worth. However, Aiden said something that completely changed her mind,
'The only time I can actually smile...or feel the warmth of a family, is when I am with you. Please, never abandon me, Mary.' in the end, she agreed.
As such, he began doing several jobs a day, barely getting any sleep, and even neglected food. He cut the cost in every single way possible—picking garbage again for his body requirement.
However, the day he earned enough money to liberate his first love—his Marilyn...she was...she was killed by one of her customers.
That was the day, Aiden learned his third lesson.
Aiden...sat there, in front of her grave, for two days. Without sleep, without food. He just stared at her name, and like the falling snowflakes, he found all his dreams and feelings falling and disappearing after crashing against the ground.
After two and a half days, when Aiden got up from the ground, there was a glowing sword in his hand.
Looking half-dead, the boy advanced across the snowy field and didn't pause until he reached a certain mansion.
He slaughtered everyone and everything that came in his path. It was pure horror to see a weak man killing people here and there as he advanced toward the one who killed Marilyn.
"Pl-Please...d-don't kill me...I didn't know that she...s-she would die...."
Aiden smirked a smile that formed for the first time on his face after Marilyn's death before he swung his Shard.
The noble was split in half, his eyes still widened, and the last thing the dying man heard was,
"Sorry...I also didn't know...that this will kill you."
That day...Aiden didn't slaughter that man who took Marilyn's life but also killed all his emotions.
That incident taught him a very valuable lesson; if you want to survive in this world, you need to snatch from people.
Take things away from them, that's the only way.
.....
Austin is aware of the First Prince's back story, and he genuinely sympathizes with him.
He has gone through experiences that no one ever should go through. He was snatched away from his food, house, and love.
And when he returned to the capital, he instantly considered Austin his enemy.
After all, in Aiden's eyes, Austin had hogged everything and everyone that belonged to Aiden.
That's why, Aiden decided to take everything away from him.
His parents, his status as the First Prince, his fame, and now ..
'He is after the person who matters the most to me. Yeah, he is dead.' Austin doesn't give a crap about what he went through. Until it was about his parents and the throne, Austin didn't mind.
But now that Aiden has turned his disgusting gaze towards Valerie....nu-uh, Austin isn't going to let it slide.
'Aiden needs to disappear.'
Canonically, Aiden gets infatuated with Rhea since Austin shows interest in her. And because of his obsession to obtain Rhea, his evil plans get exposed, and so does his mind-washing skill—Persuasive Tongue.
'Hmm...presently, he has already built himself quite a reputation in the council and his impression of the King' is quite strong as well.'
Austin couldn't just stay idle and do nothing about it. He has to get rid of Aiden somehow. And for that, he needs to expose his evil plans.
'Tch....but he doesn't start the slave trade any time soon...and other than there is no other way to expose him.' In the future, Rhea exposes his human trafficking, and that leads to the revelation of his skill and then and then...
But as of now, Austin couldn't think of any route to expose Aiden. And that bastard is so sick in the head, that coercing him wouldn't do any good.
'Should I take help from Sebastian and kill—no, Sebastian wouldn't kill the First Prince unless I give him some reason to do so.'
Lost in his thoughts, he never noticed when the Professor was standing before him.
"Austin."
"Ah, yes." He instantly shot his eyes toward the board, and answered, "The left ear."
People around him were astounded to see the quick response to the question even though, it was obvious that he wasn't paying attention to the class.
The teacher sighed, "I was about to suggest you open the window if you want, but well, that's the correct answer."
The students chuckled hearing that before the teacher returned to the podium.
Valerie had a concerned look on her face. She was well aware of the reason behind his distraction.
Although she was feeling bad about giving him another reason to worry, Valerie didn't regret her decision.
This situation with Aiden needs to be dealt with, and only her Lord could think of a way to eradicate that piece of junk.
.....
Not so long after the lunch break arrived, the students began walking towards the common hall to get some much-needed break.
Rhea, who was about to walk in a different direction, was interrupted by Austin, "Going to the infirmary?"
The pinkhead turned around and found Valerie and Austin standing there.
Smilingly, she nodded, "Yeah. He will get discharged soon."
"Yes, I know. But shouldn't you first eat something?"
Rhea was rendered speechless ...she looked down and said, "I feel Rudolph must be getting bored so-"
"But he won't like it as well if you get sick while taking care of him," Austin added, making Rhea realize that she might be exerting herself a little too much.
Valerie rolled her eyes, "The guilt and regret."
Rhea pouted, "Hey! Can you be a little sympathetic?"
Valerie shrugged, "If you understand what I am saying, then move on. No one is blaming you."
Saying so, she pulled Austin's sleeve, urging him to say, "Well, see you later."
Once they were out of sight, Valerie asked, "What do you think? Should we inform Father?"
Austin shook his head, "Nope if we do, Lord Corwon would think I am manipulating you."
Valerie frowned, "Why would he-oh." She then realized. If she called Aiden evil, without any evidence, surely her father would think that Austin has manipulated her out of jealousy.
Austin nodded, "Yes, so we should keep the information to us. And when I say 'us' I am not even involving Sebastian."
Valerie was startled, "But didn't he swear loyalty to you?"
Austin nodded, "He did, but as the man who has served my father and the nation for so long, my action against Aiden would seem like usurpation.
Valerie grew concerned, "Doing things without his support or letting him notice would be quite difficult."
Sebastian is an observant man, someone who pays close attention to Austin and the people around him. Naturally, if they plot against the First Prince, the butler would find out about it sooner than later.
Austin nodded, as he settled the food trays on the table and ushered Valerie to take a seat.
"Directly attacking Aiden would be difficult and risky, that's why we are going to do something that will agitate him to no end?"
Valerie frowned. She originally thought that they would just go to the Capital and secretly assassinate the stem of this problem. However, now that she heard his words, she realized that it would be too hasty.
Unlike Austin, who had already picked up his spoon and was scooping some soup, Valerie's focus was still on her Lord as she asked, "What?"
Austin first tasted the delicious soup, before he told her, "We will snatch something from him, which Aiden dearly treasures."
With a thin grin, Austin added, "His dreams for the throne."
---------**-------
A/N:- I hope you all enjoyed reading the chapter. Thanks for reading. Dop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 59: Chapter 58- First Step
chapters.content:
Chapter 59: Chapter 58- First Step
Cedric has been quite busy these days. The situation with the Southern nation is very critical.
The news of weakening ties with the Hener Kingdom sent a clear signal to the world: the Eryndor Kingdom was no longer the formidable power it once was.
Those who have been greedy to obtain all the riches of Eryndor suddenly started to act up. However, Eryndor still has the support of two major kingdoms, so they won't attack Eryndor solely for claiming their treasury.
However, a specific kingdom doesn't follow the same thought process as the others, and their reason for attacking Eryndor is completely different as well.
"If they attack us now it would be mayhem." Cedric heaved a sigh as he looked older than his age with his face adopting a worrisome expression.
The nation in the South—Drenovar has strong military resources, fearsome Generals, and advanced artifacts that could grant them victory against Eryndor unless Hener supports them during the time of war.
However, considering the situation with the Prince of Hener, it was highly unlikely they would show their support when Eryndor would need them the most.
Cedric received advice from the Council to have a talk with Hener's King regarding the matter. However, Cedric immediately rejected the proposal. He will not negotiate with the nation, whose heir tried to kill his son.
Speaking about Austin, Cedric recently received a letter from Headmaster Philius, regarding the incident with the Demon.
A proud smile bloomed on his face as he read the letter again, feeling his chest puffing with pride as he read how Austin gallantly fought against the inhumane and won without any external support.
Austin has shown his wits and strength to capture the Demons and save his friends.
'You have turned into such a fine young man, Austin. Your father is proud of you...' With a smile of contentment, Cedric fell asleep on his working chair.
---------**--------
"So the war is inevitable," Austin muttered as he sat in his office and heaved a sigh after hearing the backstory that he already knew.
The country in the South once had a good relationship with Eryndor. They used to be trading partners and before Hener, Eryndor used to receive military supplies from Drenovar.
However, two decades ago, when the Queen and the King came to Eryndor to join the harvest celebration, a group of assassins attacked the two royalties and killed them in the room they were staying in.
Naturally, questions arose about how assassins entered the most secure establishment of Eryndor. And in no time, those questions turned into allegations.
At that time, if not for the Union Council, Eryndor might have been erased from the map.
However, even though the situation was settled, the flames of revenge have yet to be subdued.
And now that Hener, the biggest backer of Eryndor has pulled their hands, Drenovar would surely find a way to attack Eryndor. And this time, it's highly unlikely for the Union to interfere.
"My Lord, if the war breaks out, it is highly likely that the Academy will be suspended."
Austin nodded, "And the Council would declare Valorian Academy ineligible to participate." The council that arranged the tournament works under the Union Council.
This war would not only affect the natural progression of the story but also would restrict Austin's movement. And if things come to it, Valerie would be forced to the frontlines, given her position as one of the strongest warriors of Eryndor.
No, that was unacceptable. This war would ruin many things, and Austin doesn't like the idea of letting Valerie get involved with it.
"Sebastian, we need to stop this war from happening."
Sebastian's eyes stretched in shock, "But sir, what can we-"
"We need to find a way to not only erase their hostile intentions but also make Drenovar our ally."
Sebastian was at a loss for words. While his Lord had honed his skills remarkably in just a few days, and his strategies had proven flawless so far, this situation was different. It involved the delicate balance between two kingdoms, where a single misstep could result in thousands of deaths and the fall of Eryndor.
"My Lord...as your server, I cannot stop you, but as an advisor, I would suggest you not involve yourself with this matter."
Austin heaved a sigh, "You want me not to do anything and let them destroy the kingdom that my ancestors built against all resistance?"
Austin shook his head, "No, Sebastian. I may not be the first choice for the throne, but that doesn't mean I will just sit here and let them annihilate my birthland."
Sebastian was touched by his words. His heart rate elevated seeing his Lord being so devoted to his nation. At this age when children mostly remain busy making connections and thinking about their future, Austin was worried about his motherland.
Kneeling before his Lord, the grey-haired man uttered, "Please don't hesitate to ask my help in any manner, sir. This loyal servant would sacrifice his life for you to fulfill your goal."
Austin heaved a sigh of relief. Thankfully, he was able to convince Sebastian.
Although he was determined to stop this war, Austin's main reason was to threaten Aiden's position as the next King. And knowing that assho*e Austin knew, in desperation and panic, he would make a mistake.
'This is my first step towards your downfall, Aiden.'
---------**--------
The next morning, Austin and Valerie were sitting side by side on the resting bench nearly at six.
They have been sparring for the past two hours and that was quite surprising for Valerie, "Your stamina has increased."
Austin raised his brows, "That's so? But I started training with weighted gears just yesterday."
Valerie was taken aback, "You are training after school?"
Austin nodded, "Yeah, just for an hour after school I have started training in the gym. That's why, you can be rest assured about my stamina."
The way he smiled near the end made Valerie realize what he was talking about.
*Puff*
Steams erupted from her head, as she leaned her head down and fidgeted at her place.
Austin chuckled, seeing her reaction as he leaned toward his beloved.
Soon they returned to their respective rooms to prepare for the school.
-------**------
"I have news to share." It was early in the morning when all the students gathered in the classroom and the teacher arrived not so long after
Hearing her words, everyone quieted down, and a sense of tension spread in the classroom. After all, whenever the teacher gave them any news it always was unpleasant and disturbing.
But today,
"The trials for the tournament would start next week."
A round of gasps erupted in the classroom, and one of the students asked, "This soon?"
The older one nodded, "Yes, this early. As you all know, we select the best students from each year to participate in the tournament. We need to first set up the trials to select those special students who would be representing the academy."
Taking a pause and after ensuring that every eye was on her she added, "There will be three rounds of trials—starting from one on one duel between the participants. It's your choice in which division you want to participate in but if you are planning to enter the tournament as an Elite, you must have the tag of a B-rank."
Austin heaved a sigh; although he knew it, hearing it from the teacher made him a bit nervous.
He just broke into C-rank after his battle with Kalwar, and now, he has like two months before the tournament officially begins.
'I need to continue with my quest and fight a few beasts. Thankfully, there is no limit to QoD.' Austin decided to rely on the system as much as he could for this tournament.
"Is there anything anyone wants to ask?" The teacher asked, and Austin instantly shot his hand up, "Yes, Austin?"
The blond Prince got up, and under everyone's gaze, he asked, "For the trials of the Elite tier, does one need to be a B-rank even for that?"
Many eyebrows rose upon hearing that. There were a few who openly smirked and scoffed at his question. It was not a hidden fact that Austin was a D-rank and the weakest one in the class at that. From him, this question sounded nothing less than a joke.
However, their smirk faded when suddenly they felt an ominous presence from a certain desk; reminding them that the one standing beside Austin was none other than the strongest student of the academy.
The Professor heaved a sigh, "Even if there is no rule, what would be the point in participating in the Elite trials when no one can grow their stats in just a month?"
Austin smiled and told her, "Thank you, ma'am." He didn't need any further information.
He has a week to prepare for the trials and a month for the tournament. Was it difficult? Yes. But was it impossible? Hell, nah.
-------**------
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 60: Chapter 59- Not interested?
chapters.content:
Chapter 60: Chapter 59- Not interested?
Sitting inside the cold water, Austin closed his eyes and allowed his mind to attain some peace.
He was using the Gemstones that Sebastian brought for him to turn the temperature of the water beyond the resistance point. Although it was a little uncomfortable in the beginning, by the fifteenth minute, he could not feel his muscles at all, so it was all good.
'I used to take an ice bath in the past, but now it's all a distant memory...' In his last life, there was a time when Luke was intensely immersed in sports and martial arts. His life was going well, and his body was at its peak state.
However, then came the relationship, then his time and focus moved from sports, and he ended up ruining everything. Thankfully, Valerie is the kind of girl who not only helps him maintain his health but also her hard work and discipline motivates him.
Thinking about the future, a name resounded in his head as Austin thought of a plan.
'The Elysian Elixir.'
He has currently given Sebastian the task of knowing more about Drenovar's situation and how they can exploit their shortcomings for their benefit.
However, it was just to keep Sebastian in good faith that Austin asked him to collect information. For someone who has played the game until the end(nearly), Austin knows the situation with Drenovar.
The King of the nation had fallen sick and was suffering from an incurable disease. He was counting his final days, and before his death, he wanted to bring down the nation and avenge his grandparents.
Canonically, Rhea luckily comes across the elixir, and later, when she meets the King of Drenovar, she feeds him the medicine and saves Eryndor from its possible demise.
However, it happens a lot later since, canonically, Hener doesn't remove their support from Eryndor this soon. It was the involvement of Aiden with them in human trafficking that disturbs the alliance and later gives Drenovar the opportunity.
'I need to take care of Drenovar before the tournament. I have a feeling that they have already started their preparation...'
The heirs of Drenovar always give their family, the utmost priority. Taking revenge for the late Emperor and Empress is their primary goal...however, if Austin saves the current king from his agony, surely,
'They would be indebted to the rescuer.'
Now the problem was to search for the elixir in the vast forest of Eryndor. He knows the general location but the exact coordinates slipped his mind. However, Austin knows that if he reaches the place, he will be able to pinpoint it.
*Knock*
"Young master," Sebastian called from the other side, making Austin realize that he might have overdone it.
"Ah, yes. Wait a minute." He took out the gemstone and used the other one to melt the ice.
Pushing himself up, he removed his numb body from the water before wiping his body and changing his clothes.
*Click*
He found Sebastian preparing the tea on one side and a file resting on the bed
Austin stepped forward took the file, and read through the report.
"Hmm...haven't been seen for the past three weeks in the courtroom. No hunting trips, not even attending the birthday celebration of his daughter."
Sebastian returned to his master while holding the tray, as he muttered, "In my knowledge, sir, Your Majesty Zaydan is either gravely injured or ill." Sebastian was also aware of the close bond the family shares; as such, under normal circumstances, it would have been impossible for the King to not attend his only daughter's birthday.
Austin hummed as he picked up the cup and settled down. He has a plan and knows that he can execute it; it's just he lacks manpower and resources.
He has three thousand gold coins in total, which he has been saving for a few months. Also, Sebastian knows a few important people who could help them reach Drenovar safely.
"I just hope my preliminary matches happen early."
Sebastian commented, "You need to face the first round and then you would be provided with half a month of free time for the second round. After all, the whole school participates in this."
Austin nodded, "That's why I just want them to put my name first on the list."
Sebastian advised, "Maybe you can ask Headmaster Philius for help? Naturally, after what you have done for the Academy, he wouldn't reject your request."
Austin smiled, "That's a great idea." He would just make some excuse that he needs to return home for some business and get himself a few days off under the pretense.
Sebastian gave him a short bow and said, "I will be leaving now,"
Austin was surprised, "So suddenly? You can stay here and finish the tea first."
Sebastian raised his brows, and with a faint smile, he asked, "Do you really want me to stay, young lord?"
Austin was perplexed, as he parted his mouth to ask what he was talking about when suddenly,
*Knock* *Knock*
Austin paused....blushed, and got up, "O-Okay, you may go now."
Sebastian gave a slight bow to the gentleman and the lady before making his way out of the room.
Austin took a deep breath and turned towards the window.
There, he saw a face that made his heart race and calmed his nerves at the same time.
He opened the window and offered his hand to the girl, "Good evening, my lovely lady."
Valerie smiled shyly as she responded, "Good evening...did I disturb you?"
She noticed just after the moment she knocked that her Lord was discussing something with Sebastian. But it was too late to think.
"No, not at all. We weren't talking about anything serious." He held her bag and led the lady inside.
As Valerie sat on the bed, Austin rested her bag on the chair and said, "I will prepare some tea for you."
Valerie shook her head, "No, it's okay."
Austin raised his brows, "You sure?" Getting a nod from her, Austin sat down on the chair across from her and asked, "So you wanted to study together?"
"Yes. There is a written test in two days, and I want to keep up with others."
Valerie wasn't bad in academics, but Austin was just too brilliant for a comparison.
He has a very sharp mind and impressive memory.
Austin nodded before he asked, "Then let's get started."
Valerie nodded and soon joined Austin at the table.
Austin opened the book and began flipping through the pages where she had doubts.
Since the mathematics of this world was quite undeveloped, he used the methods he learned back on earth and utilized his naturally sharp mind for calculations.
"So yeah...you need to add this..."
While Austin was explaining the method, Valerie continued to glance at him every once in a while.
'Is he really not...' She had read many romance novels and realized something very crucial about their relationship.
Even though they are so close, alone in his room, Austin never shows any sign of having any of 'those' thoughts for her.
Valerie isn't a hasty girl who wants to do those things that only a couple should do after marriage, but still...it was a little disheartening to see her Lord being completely fine even when they are so close.
'This is bad...does My Lord only have platonic feelings for me...' The thought continued to poke at her, and she wasn't able to focus on the question at all.
"Okay, tell me." Valerie was startled when suddenly, Austin closed the book and turned to look at her.
She shook her head, "N-Nothing."
Austin heaved a sigh, "Look Val, I know you enough to tell that unless something is troubling you, you won't neglect my words."
Valerie was rendered speechless; she was now regretting thinking about it when her Lord was so focused on teaching her.
And now that she has already wasted his time so much, she didn't hide the matter, "I...I feel you aren't interested in me...as in that way."
Austin raised his brows, "You mean to say, I am not sexually interested in you? That I don't find you attractive?"
Valerie's cheeks were flushed, but she nodded, with her head leaning forward.
Austin exhaled a long breath. Pinching the bridge of his nose, he revealed, "Every day, thirty minutes of meditation in the morning before meeting you, and thirty minutes at night so I can control my emotion in front of you, Val. It's not like I don't find you attractive, I just fear that my action might hurt you."
Valerie was stunned to hear that, as she asked, "Y-You do that daily...?"
Austin nodded, "Yes of course, otherwise," Leaning closer to her ear, he sensually whispered, "...nothing in this world could have stopped me from knowing how loud my Val can be in bed."
His hot breath, coupled with those words were too much for the maiden-hearted Valerie. And as a result,
"...*faints*"
--------**-------
A/N:- I hope you all enjoyed reading the story. I am taking their relationship slowly since I am giving both of them time to realise their feelings(especially Austin).
Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 61: Chapter 60- Friendly Spar
chapters.content:
Chapter 61: Chapter 60- Friendly Spar
"Has he left his room?" Sitting inside his room was the King of the Hener Kingdom, Zurkis.
(A/N:- Changed the King's name Zurkus->Zurkis.)
The Prime Minister of Hener heaved a sigh and shook his head, "No, Your Majesty. Young Master Park hasn't left his room ever since he returned. He barely eats anything or answers to anyone."
Zurkis took a long breath and then his mind went to the reason for his son's current condition.
With his turning frosty, he asked, "Abel…tell me, are you sure Park was framed?"
The Prime Minister's expression turned grim as he affirmed, "I had a thorough conversation with Professor Morkel…he has been supporting Your Highness Park during his stay at the Academy."
Taking a pause, he added, "And according to him, Your Highness Park usually prefers to hunt and instantly kill his prey. Surely, he has an animosity against Prince Austin, but that doesn't mean Your Highness Park would take such a risky decision of not killing him right away rather than torturing him."
Zurkis nodded, "I have taught him so I know he won't torture someone whom he hates. Just slit their throat and end the chapter."
Interlocking his fingers, he leaned forward, and added, "That means someone plotted against my son…and then framed him."
Abel nodded, "It seems to be the case, my Lord."
Zurkis remained silent for a moment, before he uttered, "Butchering the Prince, who became the reason for my son's condition, would not be sufficient. We need to eradicate his home, his family, and everyone he loves-"
"Father…" Zurkis paused, as he heard a familiar voice from the entrance of the room.
With his eyes widened, he hurriedly got up, "Park?"
The same lanky young man was looking excessively thin and pale, in comparison to the last time Zurkis saw him.
Parkinson's eyes were drawn to the ground, as he muttered, "I want to meet her…"
Zurkis was baffled about whom he was talking about, when suddenly, Abel stepped forward and whispered, "The girl Your Highness is infatuated with. Rhea."
Zurkis remembered hearing about the girl from Parkinson, through the letters in the past as well. The only reason why Parkinson decided to stay at Eryndor, even though he initially went there as an exchange student was because of her.
Zurkis rested his hand on Parkinson's shoulder and said, "Look son, there are only two ways of meeting her; first, kidnap her and bring her here. Second, infiltrate Eryndor and meet her in secrecy. However, the second option is risky so as your father, I will suggest otherwise."
Parkinson bit his lips; just to meet the love of his life he needs to commit a crime now, huh?
Abel stepped forward and said, "There is a third way, as well, my Lord."
Abel suggested, "We can offer alliance to Eryndor if they agree to marry Rhea to our Young L-"
"And get myself a lifetime's worth of hatred." Parkinson spat, his eyes made the Prime Minister shiver.
"Son? Is she that strong-headed?"
Parkinson's eyes softened, as he said, "She is a woman of strict ideals, and I don't want to start my life with her through underhanded methods."
Zurkis heaved a sigh as he cupped his son's face before asking, "Tell me, what do you want to do, son? Unless it risks the lives of my people, I can do everything for you."
Parkinson thought for a moment, before asking, "Can I…get a spot in the Avron academy with a fake identity?"
Avron Academy was the central academy of Hener. Hearing that Parkinson wanted to return there made Zurkis baffled, " But why with a fake identity?"
Abel answered that for him, "Because the young master wants to participate in the tournament and meet Miss Rhea through it."
Now Zurkis realized his true motive.
Patting his shoulder proudly, the man muttered, "Do whatever you want, son. You have my full support!"
Parkinson grinned hearing that, 'Wait for me Rhea….I will meet you and clear all the misunderstandings…'
—------**--------
"Okay then, line up with your partner, and wait for your turn."
It was during the physical training class that the students of Apex Circle in the second year and Brilliance Crest in the third year were grouped in the gymnasium.
Today, a joint training was arranged to let the students know more about teaming up with those with whom they are not so familiar.
In the tournament, they need to participate with their fellow schoolmates, given not only the Apex Circle would be participating in the tournament.
In the second round of the Elite division, where students need to participate as a duo, they cannot be choosy. The best need to pair with the best, regardless of which section or year they belong to.
The students were paired up according to their ranking, that is, the first ranker of Apex Circle was with the first ranker of Brilliance Crest, and so on.
Austin was paired up with a guy with pale yellow hair and freckles on his face. His back was slightly hunched, and from his demeanor, he seemed underconfident.
Austin glanced at Valerie and found a super energetic guy with pale green hair, standing beside her.nHe was trying his best to talk to Valerie with his eyes sparkling. However, despite all the efforts, Valerie wasn't uttering a single word.
…
"So I watched it, and my friends said if you keep following his path and methods, you will also land into Apex Circle next year…"
Valerie suddenly reacted to his words, making the boy feel that she was finally taking an interest.
However, when he noticed her gaze traveling past him, he frowned in confusion.
Turning his head, he found the center of her attention and realized that she wasn't even listening to him.
'Seriously, what she sees in him…isn't he just a useless Prince with narcissistic tendencies?'
Valerie, unaware of the other one's thoughts, smiled at her beloved.
'Do your best!' She cheered for him.
…
"Instructor, isn't it boring to just battle without a prize? How about we add a bet."
The instructor of the Brilliance Crest suggested as he stepped forward, "Offering something at the cost of loss is a very good source of motivation for the students."
The female instructor of Apex Circle shrugged, "If the bet is within rules then I have no problem with that."
The other one grinned, before ushering, "We will start from the first pair; Valerie and Blaze, step forward."
The green-haired boy grinned as he ushered, "After you, lady."
Valerie didn't react and just walked towards the arena.
Everyone was quite hyped for this battle. It was said that Blaze was quite a talented warrior, however, because of the restriction he put on himself, he couldn't get himself a seat in the Apex Circle.
"The best versus the best." One of the students muttered.
"We will finally see the Pride of Valor struggling against someone."
"Haah~her cold look is so exciting. Step on me, mommy~"
"Dude, you need to chill…"
The murmuring from the crowd was ignored as the two participants stood while facing each other.
The third-year's instructor stated, "No killing, no attack that can leave lasting damage. Remember, this is just a friendly spar."
Blaze smirked as he said, "About the bet, sir, if I win, I want you to go on a date with me, Miss Valerie."
"Oooooh~"
"Blaze got guts, eh!"
"Say yes, say yes!"
Completely ignoring the fact that Valerie has a fiancée, Blaze suggested.
Valerie's expression turned frosty, the whole gymnasium felt the shiver as snow began forming around the arena.
Turning her attention to the Instructor, making the older one flinch, she asked, "What is the punishment for crippling my opponent, sir?"
The chattering of the audience and the smirk on Blaze's face disappeared upon hearing those words.
Everyone who has seen Valerie in action before, that's why they know that the girl might not be lying.
Rhea was shaking her head, as she muttered,
'Only target Austin if you want to suicide.'
The instructor responded in a grim voice, "Expulsion from the Academy, and possible imprisonment."
Valerie nodded before she turned towards her opponent and muttered to herself, "So I need to stop just before making him cripple huh?"
Hearing those words, Blaze's fist clenched as he said, "Aren't you too confident in yourself?"
Valerie didn't respond; she had already considered herself facing an insect, and as such, she found it nonsensical to reply to those buzzes.
The Instructor of the first year was a little anxious to let this spar take place but it was already too late,
"Begin!"
Blaze instantly summoned his Soul Shard and was about to lunge at Valerie, only to realize,
"Huh?" The man found himself completely immobile with his feet encased in a thick layer of ice.
Valerie didn't summon her Shard; rather, she stepped forward while cracking her knuckles and looking at Blaze with nothing but pure indifference.
Austin chuckled, and with a shake of his head, he muttered, 'He is about to experience a world of pain.'
—------**-------
A/N:- I hope you all enjoyed reading the chapter. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 62: Chapter 61- Lester
chapters.content:
Chapter 62: Chapter 61- Lester
The third-year student, Blaze, was taken to the infirmary after the 'friendly spar'. He wasn't crippled, or any lasting damage was dealt; however, receiving several blows, to the face no less, by an S-rank whose expertise lies in combat was, surely, would be too much for the man.
Something that everyone was surprised by was the fact that Rhea lost her battle against the barrier user. She lost her cool in the middle and lost her steam by the third minute as well; leading to an easy victory for her opponent.
Austin was...slightly concerned after witnessing the battle. She should have been able to defeat her opponent and also made some connections with her second Shard. However, the cross-bow she wields is just a decoration to her, giving her the label of 'Dual-wielder' and nothing more.
'I cannot help her train, but surely can give a few tips.' It was an undeniable fact that against the final boss, Rhea was a great asset. Valerie was strong and there were a few more who would be actively participating in the war. However, there were several Generals as well who needed to be dealt with.
Rhea, the chosen one, cannot fall behind and remain in the shadows. Although Austin knows that he has snatched a few chances of her progression, she shouldn't have lost her true motivation to become stronger.
"Austin and Lester, step onto the stage." Hearing the instructor's voice, Austin and the other guy walked forward.
Since it was the end of the class, many people were yawning and wanting to return to their dorms.
"We need to watch the bottom feeders as well, now?"
"The lowest of the low..."
"I wish I could dip in a warm bath already..."
"Now they will fruitlessly put effort to make this match look exciting and tough."
Several opinions were flying in their direction, and looking at how Lester was hiding his face from the crowd, Austin assumed he was being affected by their comments.
"Don't limit yourself because they expect us to finish fast, okay?" Austin urged as they stood facing each other in the arena.
Every battle, every spar matters to his growth, as such, Austin didn't want to let others ruin it for him.
Lester took a strong gulp, as he said, "Please don't hurt me too much. My mum gets worried if she sees me injured."
Austin was baffled hearing that. However, he never got the chance to ask anything as the instructor barked,
"Begin!"
Austin placed his hand behind his back and summoned his WhisperWing, making it seem he was taking it out from behind.
"Woah, no Shard but an old school boomerang?"
"The guy got style and a bird brain to think he can defeat a third year with that."
"But it's Lester we are talking about."
Ignoring the murmurs of the crowd, Austin hurled WhisperWing toward Lester, aiming for his head. If it landed, the blow would create the perfect opening.
The boomerang tore through the air, a blur of motion slicing toward its target.
Austin's vision sharpened as he summoned his Soul Shard, every second stretching like an eternity. He couldn't afford to underestimate Lester—not even as the lowest-ranked.
But something felt off.
'What the…?'
Lester, fully aware of the approaching boomerang, calmly lifted his hood, pulling it over his head with agonizing slowness.
Ten feet.
Austin gripped his Shard and stepped forward, and time seemed to crawl. WhisperWing was inches away from colliding with Lester's forehead.
And then—
*ZAP*
Lester vanished into thin mist. The boomerang soared through empty space, its sharp whistle fading into silence.
"What?!" Austin skidded to a halt, scanning the arena. His heart pounded. Did Lester have some kind of vanishing skill like Kalwar?
His answer came fast.
*SHLINK!*
A thin line of pain flared on Austin's shoulder. His eyes widened as a shadow blurred past him with unnatural speed.
Lester.
The realization hit like a hammer.
'A speedster.'
Blood trickled down Austin's arm. His pulse roared in his ears as he turned, bracing for the next strike.
Austin spun on his heel, scanning the arena with razor-sharp focus. His instincts screamed danger, but his eyes barely caught the flickers of Lester darting around him, faster than his body could keep up.
Another blur.
*SWISH!*
A shallow gash opened across his ribs. Austin hissed, staggering back, gripping his Soul Shard tighter. Blood seeped into his shirt, but he forced himself to stay on his feet.
He sharpened his senses, watching for even the faintest sign of movement.
A gust of wind to his left. He twisted, raising his Shard defensively—too slow.
SLASH!
This time, a thin cut appeared on his thigh. His knees buckled slightly, but he caught himself before hitting the ground.
"Goddamn! Lester at it! He is upholding the honor of Brilliance Crest!"
"Lester is going brutal. Not finishing the battle but inflicting small wounds. Wicked~"
"Is he toying with Austin? Woah, woah, woah, you're gonna anger a certain someone, lad."
Rhea bit her lips seeing Austin being completely helpless against the speedster. Even she cannot keep up with his movement because of his tendency to remain completely out of any pattern.
Valeria balled her fist, but there was no other reaction detectable from her.
Austin calmed his mind and assessed the situation. Thanks to his increased durability, he was still in the condition to think rationally.
'He is going to the far end of the arena and returning to attack me.' Austin could trace the guy however, his reaction speed was too slow to attack or defend himself.
Holding his Shard above his head, he increased the size to the point that both ends touched the rim of the arena.
"Woah! Augmentation?"
"That size is unreal for a last ranker."
"His size is making me wet...ahh~"
Austin's trick worked; Lester finally had to bring himself to a halt, or he would have collided with the Shard that had perfectly divided the arena into two.
"Wing!" Austin called out, and in the next instance Lester found something advancing toward him
**CRACK**
However, it was too late. Before the speedster could react, the boomerang hit him on the back of his head, pushing his head forward from his body and drawing blood from his nose.
And it wasn't it, as the speedster suddenly found his hair being clutched and a knee advancing towards his face.
'This is gonna hurt...' was his last thought before Lester was thrown out of the arena after being hit.
*THUD*
The third year fell to the ground with a soft thud; knocked out cold.
The instructor heaved a sigh in disappointment to see the match concluding so soon before he announced,
"Austin wins!"
Austin wiped the blood from his lips before asking the instructor, "Can you feed him a potion before sending him home? He said his mother would be worried."
The instructor seemed to have remembered something as he said, "Ah, yes, his mother works in the kitchen. Well, I will ask the healer to feed him one. You can go now, student."
Austin gave him a firm nod before he found his hand being enveloped in a familiar warmth.
"Did I worry you?" Austin asked with a warm smile as he turned towards his beloved.
With a soft smile on her face, she said, "I, indeed, am worried, but the pride I feel right now has completely overshadowed it."
Austin grinned, "Glad to hear that."
---------**--------
Rudolph was doing something that annoys him to no end.
Resting.
It has been like three days already since he was brought here, and thanks to potions and proper care, he has recovered quite well.
Although not completely, his body was functioning well, so he asked if he could 'walk around' a bit. However, the vice-headmaster completely rejected the request, saying that Rudolph would again jump into the arena to train.
Well, he was not wrong but can there be any better way to recuperate than some light training?
'It feels so bad to see Rhea coming here every day...' He has told her not to, but the silly girl always comes to meet him after school and before school. Most of the time, if not in the classes, she spends it here in the infirmary.
And that makes him feel guilty, making him feel the need to recover faster, even more.
"You have a visitor." The nurse informed, making Rudolph think that it was Rhea again...but much to his disappointment, it wasn't her.
"Morkel." With his voice a little heavy, and a frown knitting his brows, Rudolph called out.
The green-haired man pressed his finger against the bridge of his glasses, as he said, "You seem dissatisfied. Were you expecting Rhea to come?"
Rudolph heaved a weary sigh, "Just tell me why you came to meet me. I am not in the mood to argue with you."
Morkel chuckled, "Look at you, being all wary of me and all friendly with our enemy."
Rudolph's frown deepened, "What nonsense are you spouting now? What enemy?"
Morkel, with his brows raised, asked, "Oh you know him. Your dear childhood friend, who framed Parkinson? Does that ring any bells?"
Rudolph growled, "Don't you fucking dare talk nonsense about Austin. We all had the evidence against Parkinson."
Morkel chuckled, "You will always remain a knucklehead, Rudolph. Well, let me share some insight that might help you realize one or two things about your dear friend~"
---------**--------
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 63: Chapter 62- Worth
chapters.content:
Chapter 63: Chapter 62- Worth
Austin's heart raced as the battlefield became a blur of movements.
CLANG! CLINK!
Valerie's spear thrust forward with lightning precision, the air hissing around its tip. Sebastian sidestepped with inhuman speed, his steel baton meeting her weapon in a deafening clash.
"Good observation, lady." The butler praised.
Valerie spun, her spear sweeping low in a circular motion. Dust exploded as the weapon scraped the ground, aiming for Sebastian's legs, but he leaped back effortlessly his figure blurring.
WHOOSH.
A sharp jab from his baton grazed her ribs. Valerie staggered slightly, then planted her spear into the ground for balance.
"Fast," she admitted, her lips curling into a smirk. "But speed means nothing if you can't land a clean hit."
Sebastian's figure flickered, appearing to her left. "Care to test that theory?"
Valerie didn't answer. Instead, she thrust her spear forward in a feint, pulling back instantly and spinning the weapon above her head. A sharp gust of wind followed, forcing Sebastian to retreat for a fraction of a second—just enough time.
She lunged, her spear glowing faintly as she aimed for his chest.
CLANG!
Sebastian blocked, but the force of the strike sent him sliding back, his feet dragging through the dirt.
"What strength..." Sebastian sighed before his figure dissolved in thin air.
Valerie's breathing steadied as she scanned the area, her spear raised and ready.
A faint sound came from her right. She turned sharply, thrusting her spear, but it struck nothing. Sebastian appeared behind her, his baton swinging down.
She spun, blocking just in time, and pushed him with enough force to create a gap for her kick to land on his chest.
**DHAK**
Sebastian was forced back, as he finally concluded, "I think this should be it."
Valerie paused in her tracks as she asked, "Are you fine?"
Sebastian nodded, before he revealed his reason to stop her, "You have been sparring for the past four hours. First with the young master and now me. You should not push yourself this much, Miss Valerie."
"Yeah, he is right." Pushing himself up, Austin approached his beloved fiancée and said, "It's not like we are going to a war tomorrow."
"But we are, in a few days, no?" Valerie asked, her voice sounding serious this time.
Sebastian exchanged a glance with the Prince before voicing, "It's not exactly a war, lady. We are going to just gain information about them." His words held conviction but left a whole lot of room for questioning.
And those questions were directed at Austin.
"Let's talk about it tonight at my office."
--------**-------
[Combat: 29.5/100]
{Next reward at 40}
[Romance: 42/100]
{Next reward at 60}
[Durability: 40/100]
{Next reward at 60}
[Trickery: 21/100]
{Next reward at 35}
[Overall Progression: 31.1/100]
[Next Reward at 50]
…
[Ding!]
[You have gained a reward upon breaking into the next stage of Durability.]
[Ding!]
[You have received a reward for reaching the third stage of Overall Progression.]
Coming out of the steam bath, Austin checked the notification of the system.
He has finished the endurance test just now, even though there was a day left.
It was a pain initially, but later, once his body got used to it, Austin felt much more immune to extreme heat and cold. And given the relief he felt in the ice bath, he was thinking of making it a part of his daily life.
"Show me the rewards." Wiping his body, Austin asked.
[Ding!]
[Aqua Lungs: Allows the host to breathe underwater for thirty minutes without any trouble.]
[Note: The duration of the skill cannot be increased.]
[Limitation: Can be used once in three days.]
Austin hummed in satisfaction. He would be visiting the city situated by the sea, so surely, this skill could prove to be useful.
As he began wearing his clothes, he heard another 'ding'.
[Prying Eyes: Allows the host to see through any obstacle and spell for thirty seconds.]
[Limitation: Once in 30 hours]
[Note: Can be upgraded using system rewards.]
...
Austin chuckled; this was one of the most desirable skills back on Earth by many men.
'This system provides quite good reward eh...but the next threshold becomes quite distant with each accomplishment...' Heaving a sigh, he got up from the bed.
There were no classes today, and he planned on visiting Rudolph today and then meeting the Headmaster.
Valerie was taking it easy and resting in her room. She trained more than usual, so Austin told her to rest as much as she could.
Although his mission was important, it doesn't mean he would let Valerie get overworked because of it.
There were four days for the tournament to finally begin. If he gets permission from the Headmaster, then he will go to search for the elixir tomorrow and, after giving his trials, leave for Drenovar.
And if the Headmaster denies...well, he has a plan for that as well.
Leaving his dormitory, Austin was headed towards the infirmary.
Many students were roaming around in their casual clothes since today was the weekend.
Entering the main building of the school, he walked through the long corridor. On his left were several storage rooms for medical supplies. And on his right was a beautiful garden where the Protagonist usually spends her time.
Reaching near the end of the corridor Austin turned to his left and entered the infirmary, "I am here to meet Rudolph."
He informed the nurse at the reception desk.
The nurse looked up from the file she was reading and instantly blushed upon gazing at the handsome Prince.
His aquamarine eyes sparkled like gems under the sunlight, perfectly complementing his long, golden hair that fell in soft layers, framing his face and cascading down his back. The neat parting in the middle revealed his sharp features, while the shorter strands at the front added a touch of elegance and charm to his regal appearance.
"Y-Yes, please come with me." She got up and urged him to follow her.
With his hands in his pocket, Austin walked for a short distance before the nurse turned to look at him and gestured, "He is there."
Austin nodded and before the lady could have said anything further, he walked past her.
"Hello, broken mess." Austin greeted his friend who was eating muffins or something while sitting on the bed.
There were still bandages around his stomach but other than that, he seemed fine.
"Damn...what a way to greet your friend who is suffering from boredom." Rudolph extended the plate of dessert, but Austin shook his head.
"I am good. And what about you? How long will it take?" The blond one asked as he took the glass of water from a nearby bedside table.
"Dunno man, they say they will release me tomorrow, then someone comes to inspect my wounds and say, just one more day."
Austin raised his brows, "Is there any serious problem with your wound? Is it not healing?"
Rudolph scoffed, "None can inflict such a wound on me, that I cannot recover from."
Austin rolled his eyes, "Then why are you still all wrapped up?"
The raven-haired sighed, "The Dark energy was utilized to injure me, so it is taking a lot longer than usual. And since they know I will be participating in the tournament, they are seeking my full recovery before letting me go." Saying so, he inserted a whole donut in his big mouth, at once.
Austin hummed, as he leaned back in his seat and rested his left leg on the other.
Rudolph set the platter aside, and with his gaze drawn to the ground, he muttered, "Morkel visited me yesterday."
Austin's brows were raised, "The third year's Professor? What did he say?"
He was expecting that bespectacled bastard to approach Rudolph so he wasn't that surprised.
Rudolph looked serious, but he didn't hesitate in revealing, "He was accusing you of framing Parkinson."
Well, he got that right—Austin inwardly muttered.
"Hmm? That's...something new."
Rudolph heaved a sigh, "If he had done this before when you were pursuing Rhea, I would have understood since Morkel is the kind of guy who can use such underhanded tactics to remove his competition. However, now that you have finally settled on Valerie...I am completely baffled as to why he is targeting you now."
Austin chuckled, "Well, old rivalry maybe? Forget about him."
Rudolph nodded, "Yeah, let's not talk about him." With a grin, Rudolph asked, "I heard you defeated a Third-year student yesterday. Once I recover, how about sparring a little? Like the old times?"
Austin chuckled; it's been a while since they sparred. Rudolph's Shard made him too strong so training with Austin became a waste of time for him
In just a short while, thanks to the assistance of the system along with Sebastian and Valerie, Austin has regained his worth in other's eyes.
He was no longer the helpless Prince or the heartbroken loser. He now has an ambition in his mind that he would achieve by hook or by crook.
And that is to create a peaceful world where he could happily live with his Val.
"Yeah, sure. Let's do that."
--------**--------
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 64: Chapter 63- Partner
chapters.content:
Chapter 64: Chapter 63- Partner
Austin expected Morkel to try and convince Rudolph that Austin was the actual culprit behind the incident. However, thanks to Austin's recent deeds and the praises Rudolph heard from Rhea, Rudolph simply swatted those accusation away.
Well, even if Rudolph suspects something, Austin doesn't think he would take any action. Parkinson was a creep and someone who went ahead of himself while pursuing Rhea.
The evidence of being obsessed with her has made Rudolph disgusted with that person; as such, it was highly unlikely he would interfere in this matter any further.
Leaving the infirmary, he was heading toward the Headmaster's office. The reason for his visit was to request him to let Austin and Valerie give their trials early; on the first day if possible.
'System, is there any way to divide the parameters into different divisions? Like, can I get specific stats for my strength and speed?'
It was becoming a little difficult to track which field he should be focusing on. Like, during the battle against Lester, he was able to track the man, however, his body wasn't able to react.
And in comparison to heat, he can withstand cold temperatures fairly well. So what was his resistance against poison and sound waves? How far can he withhold against curses and mental interference magic?
That's why if he gets separate stats-
[Not yet, host. Once you reach a certain threshold, you may receive a separate status window for every attribute.]
"..." Well, fine. He has to earn every single thing with this one.
*Knock*
Reaching the headmaster's office, he knocked once and heard, "Come in."
"Excuse me for intr-uding…" the pause came because Austin was dazed to see a face he was too damn familiar with, yet every single time, that face leaves him awestruck.
"Val…what are you doing here?" Inside the office, other than the Headmaster there was Valerie as well.
The girl smilingly replied, "I was notified by someone that the Headmaster wants to meet me. Did I surprise you?"
"Yeah…but in the best way possible." That response added faint redness to her fluffy cheeks.
"Haah~youth." The man behind the desk sighed, making Austin realize that this might not be the best place to flirt. But what can he do? He was actually very surprised to find her here.
"I had something to discuss with student Valerie and received your request, so I asked her to come as well." Interlacing his fingers on the table, the man added, "After all, this involves both of you."
Austin frowned slightly, as he said, "I think, before stating my request, I would like to hear what you have to say."
Philius nodded, "If you insist. First, sit down."
Austin pulled a chair for the lady, earning a melodious 'Thank you' in response, before taking the seat beside her.
Philius began, "Do you know the importance of this tournament?"
Austin shared a glance with Valerie before asking, "Are we talking about in relation to the nation, how important is it?"
The Headmaster nodded, ushering Valerie to say, "The tournament allows the other nation to witness the strength of each kingdom's rising warriors; further helping them to decide which country in the future they want to 'invest' in."
Here, investing means various things, like trade, supplies, and financial support.
The older one nodded, "In short, the students participating in this tournament decide the future of the nation, in a way."
Austin heaved a sigh and remained silent. He still had no idea where he was taking this conversation.
"As you two know, Valorian Academy has always remained near the bottom during the tournament. Because of the lack of facilities—don't mind my words, Austin—we cannot provide the training and give experience to the students which could help them grow."
Austin shook his head, implying that he didn't mind.
The reason why Valorian Academy fails is because of a lack of facilities, he says. However, in Austin's eyes,
"It's the failure of the students, sir." He said, not a speck of hesitation in his voice, "I am sure you know that the nation in the far north, our neighboring country, doesn't provide facilities to their cadets. The students of their central academy train and learn in the wild—they are trained like soldiers and are provided very basic necessities. And if I am not wrong, the Auroracrest Academy has ranked in the top three most of the time, no?"
Philius smiled in defeat, "Well, we cannot blame the students…it's just the facilities they are provided with since their birth that don't allow them to adapt."
Austin nodded; most of the students who come here are from noble families, so it was understandable why Valorian Academy ranks so low.
A brief pause befell in the room before the oldest one again began, "So, as you know, the first round of Elite division requires two students to participate. Each school can send three pairs." Turning his gaze towards Valerie, Philius added, "And I know that you will be among the six."
Austin held his breath…so this was it.
"As such, I want to know about your preference first, Student Valerie, since, as you know, in the contest, you need to trust your partner."
Although the contest changes, the basics remain the same. In the team-up battle, the two have to always remain in coordination and blindly trust each other.
Valerie didn't hesitate to say, "I want to participate with Austin, sir."
Philius heaved a sigh, "I expected much…" Looking at the other one, he added, "But Austin, you do know the perquisite of participating as an Elite, right?"
"I need to be ranked B," Austin spoke, with his fists clenched and a serious frown marring his face.
Philius nodded, "Yes—that's what every academy follows, but….for you, I am about to make an exception."
Austin's eyes stretched slightly, and Valerie gasped in disbelief and excitement.
The older one added, "I have seen you train these days…and I know what you recently accomplished, which, as a student, is incredible and praiseworthy. So I know you exceed your past self."
"That's why, Austin, I am giving you an opportunity; if you can beat the person I selected as Valerie's partner, you can participate as an Elite, regardless of your rank."
Austin took a deep breath. He didn't reveal the fact that he has already leveled up and reached C-rank.
Why? Well, unless your Shard doesn't evolve, an awakened remains on the same stage throughout their life. As such, in the Headmaster's eyes, Austin was still a D-rank who defeated a demon…possibly by luck.
'Well, unless I reach a rank where I don't get forced to serve the military or Council, I shouldn't reveal it.'
"Okay headmaster, I am ready to face the challenge."
—-----**------
After leaving the office, Valerie and Austin decided to have tea together.
While holding hands, they walked down the gallery in silence for a few moments, before Valerie asked, "When are we leaving?"
Austin thought for a moment before responding, "Since we got the assurance that our matches will be held on the first day, we can-" Austin suddenly took a sharp turn to look behind him.
Valerie frowned, "Is anyone there?" Her detection abilities were not as good as her Lord so she failed to notice anything.
Austin didn't reply to her; rather, he used his 'Prying Eyes' to see through the walls.
'Heeh~talk about an elite stalker…' Austin saw Morkel standing behind the wall, undoubtedly spying on them.
"Well, it was nothing. Anyway, we will leave for the capital just the day after the trials. We can't let your father get the wrong idea about our relationship."
Valerie wasn't dumb to not understand that, indeed, there was someone listening to their conversation, so she played along, "Although I have told him my decision regarding the engagement, it would be better if you meet him in person and assure him."
Austin grinned, "That…I surely will." Although not immediately, Austin was planning to actually visit his in-laws as soon as he could.
He has never paid them a visit after the engagement. They have only met through the gathering during his birthday. And that is very inappropriate.
'The great forest where we can find the elixir is just a single day from the Duchy…'
They made their way out of the main building and once Austin made sure that they weren't heard, he whispered to Valerie, "About the trip and everything related to Drenovar, we will only talk in my office."
Valerie lowered her eyes and apologized, "I am sorry about earlier. I should have been careful."
Austin gave her hand a light squeeze before relating, "It's okay. Now let's go and enjoy some fresh tea."
Meanwhile, Parkinson frowned upon realizing that they were leaving just after the trials.
'They surely aren't going to meet Lord Corwon…' Looking at the place from where the duo disappeared, Morkel muttered,
"What are you brewing, Austin…*
—--**----
A/N:- I hope you all enjoyed reading the chapter. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 65: Chapter 64- Advice
chapters.content:
Chapter 65: Chapter 64- Advice
It was frustrating.
*CLANG*
The sword of the girl struck onto the mechanical doll yet it didn't slice it. Two months ago, it used to slice it.
That's why it's frustrating.
"*Huff* *Huff* " Stepping back, she held the glowing sword with both of her hands and looked at the training doll, which had received several slashes but not any significant damage that could have killed a living being.
It was frustrating.
She has already gained her second Evolution, making her an A-rank. And, on top of it, Rhea was the only human being in the whole world who could summon a second Shard as well.
What a lucky girl. But...
'It's so goddamn frustrating!'
*CLANG*
Another strike, and with all the ferocity she held, it did nothing when her Shard connected with the doll, and vibration from the metal, shook her arms.
Gritting her teeth, she raised her sword and began hitting the target with blunt force.
*CLANG* *CLANG* *CLANG*
After her defeat—no, after her embarrassing defeat against the third year, she had been like this. That's why, even so late at night the girl was inside the gymnasium.
It would have been understandable if she had lost against an impossibly difficult opponent—however, her past self would have been able to defeat the guy she faced today.
'What is wrong with me?!'
*CLANG*
Forced back on her feet, she breathed roughly as the doll was finally broken, but not cleaved.
And that was a shame in the name of swordsmanship.
"Tired of yourself?"
Suddenly, a voice, a familiar one, called out.
Rhea turned her head, and indeed, it was Austin standing there.
He seemed sweaty, which meant he was also training in the gym, yet she never noticed.
Rhea heaved a sigh, and responded, "Kind of."
"Then why don't you take a break and try to think what is going wrong with you?"
Rhea shook her head, "I just need to take it from the top and keep myself focused this time." She cannot continue to slack off. The tournament begins in four days, and if she continues like this, she might not be able to participate as an Elite.
...or maybe couldn't participate at all.
'No, no, no! That's not acceptable!' Inwardly she shook her head and clenched her fists in determination.
And because of her inner monologue, she never sensed Austin approaching.
"Rhea,"
"Ah!" She was startled as she jumped back.
Austin continued, "What do you see when you raise your sword and try to decapitate a training doll?"
Rhea opened her mouth, but no word came. She...just couldn't voice it out.
Austin exhaled a sigh, before answering the question he asked, "You remember the Demon you slaughtered back then, no?"
Rhea's shoulders lost their strength as her Shard slowly disintegrated. With her eyes unfocused, she nodded.
She...just couldn't get over the grief of killing someone who was begging for mercy. She wasn't like that. She always believed in giving others a second chance.
In the past, she has only retorted to killing when she caught a beast causing mayhem. That's why, when an inhumane being, for the first time, begged to let them live, Rhea was shaken up to her core.
Austin called out, "Rhea, imagine you let that demon live and that being ends up killing several students of the Academy. And not only that, after locating Rudolph he had killed him as well. Now you tell me, who would have been responsible for all those murders? The Demon? Well, it's his nature to kill humans. So? Who would have been responsible?"
Rhea's eyes were slightly stretched as she stared at Austin in both realization and regret.
...she completely forgot something basic in this whole chaos.
The reason why she lifted her Sword and swore to become a warrior.
The reason why she hates the Demons and wants to slaughter each one of them.
And that reason is...she doesn't want to lose someone close to her. Ever again.
With a newfound determination ablaze in her eyes, the pink head voiced, "Thank you, Austin. You helped me a lot."
Austin shrugged, "Well, I just stated the fact."
-------**-------
Exiting the gymnasium, Austin turned to his left and found his beloved standing there
He has already told her that he would talk to Rhea today after training. And as he thought, she couldn't resist coming here.
"You never gave me any advice." A tinge of complaints could be sensed in her voice.
Austin smiled fondly at her, "Well, you are already perfect." He was about to hold her hand, but then remembered how sweaty he was, and dropped the plan—
—only to find Valerie hugging his arm without showing any discomfort at all.
"But I am so bad at observation. I even failed to notice the demon back then."
Austin hummed; this, indeed, was a problem.
The ranking system of this world was kind of flawed. They rank a person based on the evolution of their shard and the opponent they could defeat within a limited time.
They should have assessed everything, including speed, senses, and magic control. But even so, Valerie would have ranked 'S' given she only lacks observation skills. Her magic control and other attributes were top-notch.
After a bit of thinking, Austin asked, "Is there any specific training you are doing to sharpen your senses?"
Valerie shook her head, "The instructors back home never focused on that subject, and the instructors of the academy are mostly focused on battle and weapon control."
Austin hummed; that was true. Seriously, if he had been the Headmaster or someone in the management, he would have made several changes in how the instructors handled the students.
So...how can he help his lover in her training?
'Ah...how can I forget?' With a smile, Austin demanded, 'System, give me a quest to enhance my senses.'
[Sorry host, but you cannot request Quest for a sub-attribute.]
[Does the host want to request a Quest for Combat progression?]
"..." This system is useless.
Sometimes.
-------**-------
A/N:- Thanks for reading. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 66: Chapter 65- SS: The first day they met
chapters.content:
Chapter 66: Chapter 65- SS: The first day they met
"Valerie, you are a creep. Go away." This wasn't the first time she heard that word.
Creep.
She has heard it many times from different people.
Her father is a Duke, that's why she has to join several gatherings regularly. And according to the lessons she had learned by her tutors, she needs to maintain good relationships with people around her.
Being the only daughter of the Duke, she has to maintain a good reputation and create connections with the children of other noble households.
However…she couldn't maintain a facade for long and ends up saying things which others don't like much.
And that's why she always gets left out.
*Step* *Step*
Walking alone in the garden she kept her face towards the flowers, and wiped her eyes.
Although she doesn't know anyone here, being called a creep and told to go away hurts her.
'Am I really bad…will I never make any friends?'
Trying to change herself she has practiced smiling in front of the mirror for hours. Those fake smiles which her Instructor taught her. However, even after practicing for hours, the girl couldn't muster up a smile when it's needed the most.
'They even threw away the cookies I baked…' She recently learned to bake cookies and brought them so she could make a good impression.
…However, forget about looking at it, they threw it on the floor.
Now carrying the pouch of broken cookies, Valerie was wondering if she should eat it or feed the ducks…when suddenly,
"Can I have them? I am kind of craving for some sweets."
Valerie turned to her left and found a blond guy standing there with his eyes affixed on her cookies.
She lifted the bag, and asked, "You want them. They are all crumbled tho…"
The boy shrugged, "Who cares about the shape? It's all the taste."
He stepped forward and took the bag from her.
Taking out the cookie crumbs, he ate them and instantly, his eyes widened.
Valerie held her breath, "Is it bad?" Although she has tried seven times before she couldn't be sure if it would have been the same the eighth time.
However, against her fears, "It's incredible. The choco chips and the sweetness is on point. I love them." He seemed genuinely delighted.
The boy smiled as he said, "You sure have a pretty smile, lady. Will you tell me your name? By the way, I am…"
….
"Ah..!" Valerie suddenly jolted out of her sleep as she felt her arm turning numb.
She noticed that her arm was pressed under her weight, that's why it was ice cold now.
"Haah…what a lovely dream…" She smiled in daze as she hugged her special pillow close to her.
On the pillow the figure of a certain blond was etched. And not only that her bedsheet, the paintings around the room, and even on her pajamas…there was only Austin and Austin.
With a smile full of happiness, she fell back on the bed and enjoyed a few moments of bliss, before finally leaving her bed.
Taking a shower, that erased her drowsiness, she brushed her teeth. Checking her nails, she took her time braiding her hair.
After that, she took out her clothes and changed into her training attire.
"Hmm…" Her eyes fell on the packet of flour on the kitchen counter. Since she had some time, she decided to bake some cookies.
She had already had all the ingredients since she was planning to bake something for her Lord, for some time now.
She tied her apron quickly, brushing a strand of hair from her face.
She grabbed a large mixing bowl, tossing in butter and sugar, her hands moving fast as she whipped them together with a wooden spoon.
The soft sound of butter creaming filled the air. Next came the eggs—she cracked them one-handed, tossing the shells into the sink without breaking stride.
Flour, baking powder, and a pinch of salt went into another bowl. She didn't bother measuring too precisely; she trusted her instincts. With a quick motion, she combined the dry ingredients with the wet, stirring until the dough came together.
Chunks of chocolate followed, and Valerie grabbed a spoon, dropping rough scoops of dough onto a baking tray.
