The makeshift baking pot was already pre-heated so she just placed the tray inside and undid her apron.
Letting it bake inside until she find it appropriate, she finally took it out and let it rest for a few minutes.
With a smile, she took a similar bag, in which she used to bring cookies for Austin back then.
'Does he still remember…' Valerie seldom came to meet him and only gave him cookies like four times, even that, when she was not awakened. After awakening her Shard she rarely met him.
With slight hope and extreme nervousness she packed the cookies and walked out of her room.
Heading toward the training ground, she found her beloved already present there; stretching his arms.
"G-Good morning." Unusually nervous, she greeted him.
Austin turned towards her with a smile, "Morning…hmm?" His eyes landed on the small packet she held in both of her hands.
"This…is for me?" Austin asked, as he took the cookies from her hand.
Valerie said, "I thought you may like it…"
Austin smiled, as he took out one of the cookies, and said, "Although you have shaped them quite perfectly," He crumbled them in his hand before pouring the crumbs in his mouth, "I like it more this way." While chewing, he told her.
Valerie's eyes slightly widened as she covered her mouth and asked, "Y-You still remember…"
Austin grinned, "How can I forget that day, when I met you for the first time?"
Valerie's face was full of smiles. She assumed that since so much time had passed, he might not have remembered it. But…
'You treasure everything related to me as much as I do…'
—-----**-------
A/N:- If you are wondering, then yes, Austin and Luke's soul merged. Austin never died, he just unlocked Luke's memories. Well, I might mention it at some point.

chapters.title: Chapter 67: Chapter 66- The last option?
chapters.content:
Chapter 67: Chapter 66- The last option?
It was another day for Harold in the academy as a professor.
He was currently in charge of third-year students, his main subject remains beast anatomy.
Well, he applied for a physical training educator; however, considering his not-so-friendly fighting style, the board decided that he would be too much for the young children. And in the end, he was told to stick to books.
Harold used to work as an Executioner, a post given to a hunter whose sole job was to hunt and kill his prey. There are porters, warriors, tanks, supporters, healers, and the least desirable job: executioner.
Harold has spilled tons of blood from his enemies in the past. He was only told to hunt beasts and demons who loitered around the nation; however, at one point, his craving for blood elevated so much that he ended up intruding into the Cursed Realm.
A world on the other side of the Riftline.
He wanted to kill and kill, as such, rather than searching for one or two prey, he chose to jump into the den of demons.
...he barely managed to return alive. It was not a place, it was a literal hell.
Dark red skies, suffocating thick and heavy air, and a world devoted to chaos.
It was thanks to the Union Council that pulled him away from there or Harold was dead that day.
Then, the Union Council ordered him to serve the Academy for a few years as a punishment....and once Harold began his journey as a teacher, he stopped seeking the same bloody path he once loved to tread.
"Morning, Professor." One of the early waking students, the vice-president of the student council, Sheldon Runebound, greeted him.
"Good morning, Sheldon. I can see that you are following your routine as always." He was one of the very few students in the academy who seemed more mature than his age and had a definite life goal.
Someone who thrives to become the best.
"Discipline is one of the most basic necessary traits for a student." He responded; his face not revealing any emotion.
Harold nodded, "Continue then."
Sheldon nodded before he resumed his jogging.
The vice headmaster had woken up a little earlier than usual, so he was just casually patrolling around the school.
Unexpectedly, he found a pair of students, so early training as well.
"Hmm?" It was Valerie and Austin; currently engaged in a non-typical routine of training.
Valerie's eyes were covered with a blindfold, while Austin moved around the ground, trying to close in without letting her notice
Sometimes it worked and sometimes it didn't.
Harold frowned; an S-rank is having trouble tracing a being who was purposely radiating his Soul energy(Austin was wielding his Shard)?
"Ah, Professor Harold." Austin noticed the man standing nearby, so he called out.
Valerie lifted the blindfold before greeting him, "Good morning, sir."
Harold gave a short nod before asking, "What you two were doing just now?" Although he guessed it, he needed confirmation.
And as he expected, "I was helping Valerie train her senses."
Harold's brows knitted in a tight frown, "Valerie? Did you not give a rank evaluation test before assuming your rank?"
The violet-haired's expression turned a little solemn, while Austin visibly frowned in displeasure.
After a brief pause, she responded, "Their testing method is flawed and doesn't evaluate all the attributes of a warrior. I overwhelmed the parameters with my strength and magic control."
Harold received his answer, "That is correct. I apologize for doubting you." Heaving a sigh, he added, "Don't you have a better way of training? Austin has adopted a good method, but that's not how you train your basics."
Austin raised his brows, "But I thought sensing the source of Soul Energy should be the basic?"
Harold shook his head, "The most basic level of observation requires you to listen to your opponent's movements. Their footsteps, and if that's not it, you need to hear their breathing, their heartbeat."
Valerie and Austin were amazed as the latter asked, "Is that even possible? And in the first place, is it required?"
Harold chuckled, a very rare laugh escaping his throat, as he enlightened the duo, "If you don't know, seventy percent of assassins and mercenaries are non-awakened. Why? Well, because most of the time they are told to hunt those who can sense Soul Energy clearly or have a tool for that. That's why there is a demand for non-awakened hunters in the market."
Austin slowly nodded, acknowledging that what he was saying, made sense.
Harold folded his arms on his chest before relaying, "I have a perfect tool to help you, Valerie, in my storage. An artifact I once won in a bet that allows one to sharpen their observation skill."
For some amusing reasons, more than Valerie, Austin seemed excited as he said, "Is that so? Can we get that?"
Harold smiled fondly, "Yes, I can lend you that. However, don't let anyone find out that it was me who gave you the artifact."
Austin nodded, "Thank you, sir."
---------**--------
[Capital of Eryndor]
"The situation is getting severe." The Prime Minister voiced as he sat on the round table along with the other ministers.
The situation of Drenovar was getting serious; recently five spies were caught snooping around in Eryndor. Although they killed themselves before the authorities could have taken them for interrogation, it was pretty much evident which country would have sent spies to Eryndor so aggressively.
Cedric had a frown on his face as he looked at the map of the Capital; there were four main entrances, and the guards of the front entrance were slaughtered, possibly by the five assassins.
This was not an attempt to spy on them since if spying had been the motive, they wouldn't have slaughtered seventeen top-ranking soldiers in the first place.
It was an announcement that Drenovar could enter Eryndor anytime and annihilate them on will.
"Father, I think we should send forces in retaliation." The First Prince of the nation voiced with a serious look on his face.
The Captain of the Imperial Legion agreed, "Indeed, we must portray that we are not weak, Your Majesty. I am in support of what Your Highness just suggested."
Cedric heaved a sigh, before telling them, "Direct retaliation means we have accepted their challenge and are ready for a war."
"But what's the problem with that? We can't just let them send forces one after another and lose our people's faith." When Aiden said that, several heads turned towards each other; muttering and nodding in assent.
From their perspective, it would be disastrous if the civilians lost their faith in the government and decided to migrate.
However, only the Prime Minister and the King know the actual problem here.
Eryndor was not prepared to face Drenovar in battle unless they received support from any of the three major countries.
Their army supplies and human resources were limited and comparatively very little.
And under such circumstances, it would be like harming oneself to retain one's pride.
Aiden narrowed his eyes and said, "If the number of soldiers is a problem, then we can ask non-militant entities to fight for their nation."
That statement gained many confused looks as the Chief Advisor asked, "What do you mean, Prince? Are we talking about forced recruitment of the general masses?" There have been several cases when some nations recruited civilians into the military during a war.
However, Aiden had a different opinion, "That would be a little too much for them...after all, the general masses are completely unrelated to military works."
Turning his gaze towards the Supreme Authority, the silver-haired added, "However, it won't be unfair to ask those who are aiming to become warriors in the future. For example, the students of the Academy?"
"...!" Several eyes widened in realization, and the Prime Minister was stunned at the suggestion too.
Surely, those who have been admitted to the academy are aiming to become a renowned warrior in the future, however, they still were kids.
The Prime Minister—Oakdine Arthur, couldn't help but glance at His Majesty and think, 'What will you do, Your Majesty...' As the Prime Minister, he had the authority to say something here, however, considering how many ministers seemed convinced by Aiden's idea, he left the burden on the King.
And as Arthur wished, "We cannot push young children to bear the burden of a war. True, they are preparing to become a warrior in the future, but not all of them wish to fight on the frontline."
Looking at Aiden, Cedric clearly stated, "So no, we are not going to recruit any students for this war."
Aiden lowered his head, seemingly accepting whatever his father wished; however, under the table, his nails dug into his flesh as he clenched his fist in agitation.
Fuck!
Cedric intertwined his fingers on the table as he thought,
'This is concerning...I might have to..ugh...'
"Your Majesty?" The Prime Minister rose from his seat seeing the King clutching his chest
However, Cedric shook his head and said, "I am fine..."
---------**--------
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 68: Chapter 67- Sudden quest
chapters.content:
Chapter 68: Chapter 67- Sudden quest
There are two days left, if taken out today, for the Tournament to officially commence.
The gymnasium has been set off-limits by the management since that's the place where all the trials would be taking place.
For fair competition and to avoid favoritism, two members of the council committee attend the trials. Their only motive is to ensure fair competition and right judgment.
There are a few instances as well, when the Council interfered in the selection procedure by giving the position of participation to someone who might have faced defeat but showed better potential than the winner.
Although the practice was quite criticized, the Union Council has made no move to abolish the method.
As such, the participants aiming to become a part of the Tournament not only have to win the matches but also have to show their potential by going all out.
After all, they would rather have a competent loser rather than a complacent winner.
**CRACK**
The face of the wooden doll cracked as Rudolph landed the punch squarely on the tool.
Those girls who came to watch him, squealed in excitement to see their idol being back in shape.
Since the training hall was currently being prepared for the trials, the students were allowed to utilize the outdoor grounds to train. Naturally, all the equipment required and requested was delivered to them.
Sweat dripped down his forehead as Rudolph reeled back his punch and allowed the broken pieces to fall to the ground.
He wiped the sweat and gave a nod of satisfaction. He wasn't out of shape, at the very least.
*Slash*
Hearing the slicing of the blade, Rudolph and many others turned towards the warrior with shiny blond hair, currently involved in melee training with the target, hanging by the bracket.
Austin was utilizing his Shard to aim for the targets and calling it back as fast as it stabbed before throwing it again.
The successive recall of one's Shard is quite taxing, and that could be seen from his complexion.
"I am impressed, mate." Rudolph approached his friend once Austin finally stopped. There was no one looking at him until now, but when the star warrior from the Apex Circle approached him, every eye turned towards Austin.
The blond one raised his brows, "I missed several targets, tho…"
Rudolph chuckled, "We both have a bad aim. And I am talking about your growth. Just until a few days ago, you couldn't detach your Shard from you, and now…you see someone at the peak of your rank."
Rudolph was about to suggest re-evaluation, when suddenly, Austin said, "It's thanks to constant training and the recent events I got involved with." Austin somehow sensed what he was about to say, which ushered him to change the topic.
Rudolph grinned, "Then how about sparring against me? We can help each other improve…like the old times."
"Pfft-what are you spouting, bud. You will break his morale before the event." One of the guys, whom Austin remembered to be a third-year student, suddenly interrupted them.
'The guy on the Disciplinary Committee…Abel.' Austin has begun taking a record of every notable being in the university who may interfere with the plot in one way or another.
Rudolph growled, "Who are you to intervene between our talk?"
The grey-haired's eyes narrowed. His Soul energy made it difficult to breathe, as he uttered, "Your senior and someone who is just stating the fact."
The students began to gather around. They could sense the tension in the air and the probable battle incoming.
Rudolph was not someone who could get intimidated so easily.
With his canines peeking, the raven-haired stepped toward the senior. His hands in his pockets, as he leaned forward and said, "Now I remember your face. Aren't you the same guy whose post was taken away by my classmate, and as a third year you had to work under her?"
Rudolph suddenly leaned back and with a thoughtful look, he cupped his chin, "Oh~so you are here to take revenge on Austin. Oh, my poor soul."
"Pfft-hahahah!"
"Seriously, Abel…have some dignity man…"
"His senior from second year…uh, isn't it…"
Hearing all the mockery and ridicule, Abel's aura flared as he was about to jump on Rudolph, "You…!"
But then, a violent surge of energy completely swatted away Abel's aura, even throwing him off his feet.
Every eye turned towards the person in awe and amazement, while Austin was the only person who looked at her with fondness.
Valerie stepped forward, her presence domineering. Clad in a black shirt and white skirt, she was extruding a very youthful charm. However, those cold and calculating eyes warned everyone to remain five feet away from the girl.
Looking down at the fallen officer, she said, "Senior Abel, since you have forgotten, I must remind you: according to the rules, instigating a fight or provoking someone is a punishable offense unless you have the permission of a duel. And you, clearly, don't have one."
Abel growled, "Arrived again, to flash your authority!"
He scrambled to his feet, and glared at Austin, "At least I am better than you…hiding behind a woman."
Austin rolled his eyes. This world was filled with this kind of people who believed in male supremacy.
Abel didn't stand there for long, before Valerie turned towards Rudolph and warned him too, "I am aware of your passion for battle, but provoking someone like this is-"
Rudolph scoffed, "Look at you, being all wise and disciplined." With a grin, he added, "You accept it or not, but if that snort had insulted Austin again, you might have directly crushed him rather than provoking him like me."
Valerie was rendered speechless. He was…probably right.
Austin heaved a sigh, "You both have a short temper, eh? Learn from me."
"Yeah, you should, Rudolph. I was kind of nervous seeing you picking on a third year." Rhea walked in, as she undid her bun and allowed her short hair to freely fall over her shoulder.
Rudolph was stunned, "When did you cut your hair?!"
He met her this morning and she still had her silky long hair.
Rhea shrugged, "It was a distraction and a burden to take care of." She narrowed her eyes, with a grin extending her lips, "Are you going to no longer associate with me, just because I am no longer beautiful?"
Rudolph, with all sincerity, responded, "That can never be possible, and you are still beautiful."
Rhea was startled to hear such a quick response, as a faint blush appeared on her cheeks.
Meanwhile, Austin suddenly received an unexpected notification on the system screen,
[Ding!]
[Path to becoming stronger!]
[A sudden quest has appeared!]
[Would you like to see?]
[Y/N]
He was startled to receive the sudden notification.
Until now, unless he demanded a quest, the System never proposed one on its initiative. That's why it was surprising.
"Austin?" Seeing him being dazed, Valerie called out.
Austin shook his head, "It's nothing…" Turning his eyes toward his fiancée, he asked, "How did the training go?"
Valerie received the artifact to train her observation skills, and she has been cooped up in her room since morning, training her senses in a compact place as in the beginning.
Valerie smilingly replied, "I think this will be helpful. I was actually able to pick up on traces of movement and react on time." Glancing around and making sure that no one was looking, she whispered, "...i-if you want…y-you can come to my room and t-train with me…"
*Ba* *Dum*
That made his heart race. However, he had a feeling that the quest from the system would take some time, so he said,
"I will try to sneak in…but don't wait for me and continue your training. We only have two days."
Valerie nodded with her fist clenched, "Yes."
…
After separating from the group, Austin headed back to his room.
En route, he asked,
'Show me what this quest is about.'
[Ding!]
[Path to Becoming Stronger Unlocked]
[A new quest has been generated to assist the Host in developing skills and enhancing stats.]
Quest Objective: The Host will be transported to a fully simulated environment where specific tasks must be completed to earn points.
Reward System: Points earned during the quest can be allocated to upgrade individual stats, excluding Overall Progression.
Bonus Rewards: Exceptional performance may grant additional rewards, including rare items or unique abilities.
Time Distortion: The simulated dimension operates outside the Host's reality. No time will elapse in the real world, regardless of the duration spent within the quest.
[Prepare yourself, Host. Your path to strength awaits.]
Austin read the description twice. This was unexpected.
If he accepts the quest, which he most likely will, he can gain strength and experience before the tournament.
Thinking for a bit, he asked, 'Can I die there?'
[Yes, host. But there would be an option provided to retreat when you find it necessary.]
Austin hummed, this was assuring.
After a brief silence, Austin said,
"Okay, I accept."
—----**------
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 69: Chapter 68- Grinding(1)
chapters.content:
Chapter 69: Chapter 68- Grinding(1)
Austin was kind of nervous. However, this was necessary. His current growth rate was not enough. He would be getting involved with the nation which was on the verge of a war with Eryndor.
A single mistake means Austin would be trapped there with Valerie and Sebastian. And he cannot depend on those two to protect him. Not then, not now.
He hasn't taken offense to what the Demon or Abel said about him depending on Valerie. He could never be ashamed of that. However, he still hasn't forgotten that incident when Valerie was facing that Monkey, and more than defeating the creature, she was focused on keeping him safe.
He wants to walk beside her...wants to be her strength, not weakness.
That's why this was necessary.
[System Notification]
[Dungeon Name: Moonlit Mirage]
[Level: C-]
[Time Limit: 6 hours]
[Reward: ???]
[Important Notes:]
[1. Attribute Point Scaling:]
[Durability: +1 requires 20 dungeon points.]
[Combat: +1 requires 40 dungeon points.]
[Other attributes follow similar scaling.]
[2. Magical Item Enhancement:]
[Dungeon points can be used to upgrade magical items obtained as system rewards.]
[3. Shop Unlock:]
[Cost: 500 dungeon points to activate the 'Shop' feature.]
[4. Retreat Requirement:]
[Minimum Points Required: 10 dungeon points.]
[Tip: Perform efficiently to maximize point acquisition and unlock system benefits.]
Austin read the notifications carefully, before he asked, "Unless I don't score ten, I can't come back?"
[Indeed, host. You at least need ten points for the retreat option to appear.]
Austin took a deep breath; he couldn't tell what was waiting for him; as such, gaining ten points can become concerning.
'Well, it's C-...surely, I can handle that much.'
After thinking for a bit, Austin asked, 'Can I take equipment to the dungeon?'
[No, host. Only the rewards you gained from the system, can be used there.]
"...not even my Shard?" Austin was shocked and now anxious. However,
[Your Shard is a part of your Soul, so naturally, it's impossible to restrict it.]
Austin heaved a sigh of relief.
Opening his drawer, he took out a single photo resting there.
Valerie's smiling face was drawn on the small parchment.
"Wish me luck." Putting the picture back, he stated, "I am ready."
[Ding!]
[Best of luck, host!]
Austin's vision was surrounded by blinding light, as he closed his eyes and waited to feel the changes.
His body did move, but his feet remained rooted. He felt like crossing through a long distance in seconds. However, he hadn't made any move at all.
*Rustle*
Austin felt his face being touched by the serene wind.
He slowly opened his eyes and found himself in unfamiliar surroundings.
Austin blinked, his breath catching as he took in the sight before him.
The shrine was ancient, yet eerily pristine, as if untouched by time. The curved roof of the main building gleamed faintly under the pale moonlight, its edges adorned with intricate carvings of twisting dragons and coiling smoke.
Lanterns hung from wooden beams, their soft glow casting long, flickering shadows across the ground.
But what froze Austin in place were the figures standing in silent rows.
Hundreds of beings stood shrouded in black cloaks, their hoods pulled low to hide their faces. Not a single one moved, yet their presence was suffocating. Each figure held a curved blade in one hand, the edge glinting menacingly under the moonlight.
They faced the shrine, unmoving, like statues waiting for a command.
Austin could see grey numbers over their heads, indicating: 1
'So they are worth 1 point, eh?' Austin needed to defeat at least ten of them to get back. However, his focus was currently on how much he could defeat in one go.
There was a red line, before which he stood. Austin instinctively knew that if he crossed the line, those beings would attack him.
Austin rolled his sleeve and summoned his dagger in his left hand.
"Let's go!" In an instant, he jumped forward, and the other side moved as well.
Three beings marched forward, wielding their weapon and faintly releasing their aura.
However, surprisingly, Austin was the first to reach them, as he ducked under the first one's attack and simultaneously plunged his dagger into the ninja's throat.
*SHWAAA*
The dungeon resident disintegrated at the attack before Austin jumped back—before the other two could have attacked him.
Austin's lips curled into a faint smirk. "This might be easier than I thought."
The remaining two ninjas lunged, their curved blades slicing through the air. Austin sidestepped, the sharp wind of their missed strikes brushing his face. He spun low, his dagger flashing as it carved into the leg of one enemy.
CRACKLE!
The figure crumbled into ash, disintegration just like the first.
The last ninja spun around, blade raised for a downward strike. Austin leaped back, avoiding the deadly arc, then surged forward, slamming his dagger into its chest before it could recover.
SHWAAA!
Another one is gone.
"Three down. Seven to go." Austin's eyes darted to the approaching figures—this time, five were coming at once.
They moved faster, more coordinated, blades whistling as they cut through the space between them. Austin ducked under one strike, kicked off the ground, and twisted mid-air to avoid another.
CLANG!
His dagger clashed against an enemy's blade, sparks flying. He slid to the side, slashing his weapon across the ninja's neck.
The figure dissolved, but the next ninja was already on him.
Austin barely raised his dagger in time to block the strike, but because of his lack of footing, the force of the blow sent him stumbling back. His footing faltered, and another enemy took advantage, its blade slashing across his arm.
'I can't reach it...!' Austin augmented his Shard, making it longer, and barely parrying the attack.
*CLANG*
A sudden burst of speed erupted as he used the elongated Shard to slash his enemies one after another.
Just as the last one dropped to the ground, the hair on the back of his neck stood erect, as Austin ducked just in time to dodge the incoming shuriken.
*KIRRRK*
The sharp blade dug into the tree at the height where his head should have been.
Austin's eyes widened as he realized that with each wave, the ninjas were getting more dangerous.
Austin's heart pounded as his eyes darted around, trying to locate the source of the shuriken. The faint rustling of leaves above him was his only warning.
SWISH!
A flurry of shuriken rained down. Austin leaped back, narrowly avoiding most of them, but one grazed his thigh, drawing a thin line of blood.
"Tch!" He hissed, the pain sharp but manageable.
Three ninjas emerged from the shadows, moving in sync. Their steps were eerily silent, and their blades gleamed under the moonlight.
They rushed him.
Austin lunged forward to meet the first, his elongated Shard arcing in a swift, powerful slash. The blade found its mark, cleaving through the ninja's chest and disintegrating it in a burst of ash.
But the second and third were already on him.
Austin parried one blade, then twisted to block the other. Sparks flew as his Shard clashed against their weapons. He spun, aiming to strike one of them, but the ninja ducked and retaliated with a quick jab.
SLASH!
The blade nicked Austin's side, ripping through his shirt and leaving a shallow wound.
"Dammit!" Austin gritted his teeth, jumping back to create distance, but the third ninja closed the gap instantly.
The enemy's blade came down in a deadly arc, and Austin barely managed to sidestep it. His Shard lashed out, slicing the ninja's leg, but not before another shuriken zipped through the air.
THUNK!
It grazed his shoulder, tearing through flesh. Blood trickled down his arm, and the pain made his grip falter for a split second.
Austin glared at the one throwing Shuriken before he muttered,
"You wanna play with throwables, eh?'
The Ninja didn't have time to dodge as a heavy boomerang was thrown in its direction, completely destroying its head and ceasing its existence.
*SHLINK*
Austin didn't lose focus from the battle, just because he manipulated Wisp. He easily dodged the incoming blade, ducking under it and grabbing the ninja by its throat.
*CRACK*
A sickening sound resonated before Austin killed the last of the wave with his bare hand.
[Ding!]
[Upon reaching the first threshold, the host gains permission to return to the real world any time he wishes.]
[Return?]
[Y/N]
Blood was trickling down from several corners, and there were more than two hundred ninjas still waiting for their turn.
And...Austin had a feeling that there was a presence, far greater than these small fries, waiting for him inside the shrine. Like a Boss.
Under such a situation, the best thing would have been to return and first patch himself up and make a strategy for how to defeat them efficiently.
However,
"Who cares~" Austin grinned, as he recalled Wisp and his Shard in each hand.
He was so going to enjoy this battle.
----------**----------
A/N:- Well, he also wants to level up. I hope the combat scene wasn't boring, I tried making it fast-paced, and since I am still in learning phase, don't be too harsh in the comments ⊙⁠﹏⁠⊙.

chapters.title: Chapter 70: Chapter 69- Grinding(2)
chapters.content:
Chapter 70: Chapter 69- Grinding(2)
"Haah...haah..." Austin was...tired.
Sweat and blood poured from different sides of his body. He has been fighting for the past hour and has dispatched more than a hundred ninjas.
He received over a hundred points. However, the problem was that with each wave, the points were getting lesser.
Like now, each ninja gets him only 0.4 points, which means he needs five of them to gain two points.
He still had five hours before the System would forcibly throw him out; however, as of now, he couldn't think straight to fight anymore.
His hands were trembling, and his vision was hazy.
If not for the temporary resting point he purchased for five points, he might have returned by now.
"System...show me my stats ..."
He could feel he had become sharper and stronger by now, however, how much, he had no idea.
[Combat: 32.5/100]
{Next reward at 40}
[Romance: 42/100]
{Next reward at 60}
[Durability: 44/100]
{Next reward at 60}
[Trickery: 21/100]
{Next reward at 35}
[Overall Progression: 31.1/100]
[Next Reward at 50]
...
His combat and durability have gone up in just an hour...crazy.
Although training with Valerie and Sebastian was beneficial, their fondness towards him restricts them from actually going a little harsh on him. So this experience, where his opponents were coming at him with the intention to kill him was quite good for a change.
But the question arises whether he should proceed or retreat?
'Can I really defeat that guy?' After defeating one hundred and fifty dungeon dwellers, a mid-boss appeared before Austin.
This one was quite intimidating, wearing a red shroud over its face and carrying a long sword.
Austin could tell that the being was quite dangerous....but the points highlighting over its head... were quite tempering.
[Vice Commander Mentis.]
[100 Points.]
That was like defeating two fifty ninjas at once...and that was quite tempting.
'Should I retreat and come back with more preparation?' The thought passed through his mind when suddenly,
[Note: If you leave now and enter the dungeon later, you would need to face one hundred and fifty soldiers first before reaching the Vice-commander.]
"..." So this system doesn't want him to leave, eh?
Austin heaved a sigh. He still had two minutes left before this resting zone would fade away, and he would get attacked by the mid-boss.
"Going back and returning...would result in something similar to how I am feeling right now."
Austin wiped the sweat and blood from his face using the corner of his sleeve. His school uniform was quite dirty by now, but he had more than a dozen hanging in the wardrobe, so no worries there.
Summoning his Shard in his left hand, he squatted on the ground and faintly whispered, 'I know I don't have much Soul Energy left, but until the last breath, stay by my side...' He might have lost a few screws to talk to his Shard, but he felt the real necessity of his Shard's support right now.
Looking at the clock, Austin saw only thirty seconds left.
He clenched his fists and shut his eyes, forcing his racing heart to slow.
Tick. Tick. Tick.
His breathing steadied, his thoughts sharpened, and his senses expanded.
Tick. Tick.
'This is it...'
**BUZZZZ**
Austin shot forward like a bullet, his Shard gleaming as he charged at the towering knight. Every muscle screamed with effort as he raised the blade high, aiming straight for its head.
**WHOOSH**
The knight vanished.
Austin's Shard sliced through nothing but air.
**WHAM**
"Gah!" The blow came from his blind spot, slamming into his ribs like a sledgehammer. His body spun midair before being sent hurtling away.
**SCREECH**
Digging his Shard into the earth, he skidded to a halt, coughing as pain exploded in his side. His gaze snapped up—but the knight was gone again.
*WHOOSH*
"Damn it!" Austin ducked just as a massive sword carved through the space where his neck had been. The air howled with the force of the swing.
He spun while being squatted, and tried to grab the sword by its handle, desperate to gain control.
*CLANG*
Too late. The knight jerked the weapon away, its glowing eyes locking onto Austin as its massive fist rocketed toward him.
**CRACK**
"KHAAK!" The punch hit Austin square in the chest, sending him flying like a ragdoll. Blood burst from his mouth as his back slammed into a jagged rock, the impact knocking the air out of him.
He collapsed to the ground, gasping for breath. His body ached, every muscle screaming in pain. His vision blurred, and the knight's heavy footsteps echoed in his ears.
Austin struggled to stand, his knees shaking. Pain burned everywhere, and for the first time, he felt completely overwhelmed.
'It hurts... it hurts so much... I can't take this...'
The knight drew closer, raising its massive sword. The cold steel gleamed, ready to finish him off.
Austin could retreat. One word and this would all be over.
But then Valerie's face filled his mind—her determined smile, her strength...it was like she was whispering, 'I know you can do it.'
Against his thoughts, the knight reached Austin and delivered the final blow.
*CLANG*
The sword came down, but it didn't hit him. A cyan barrier appeared above him, stopping the blade in its tracks.
[Ding!]
[Absolute Barrier is in use!]
Austin's eyes snapped open. His hand shot up and grabbed the blade. His fingers tightened, blood dripping down the edges, but he didn't let go.
"This sword…" Austin growled, his voice low and full of anger. "It's annoying."
His grip tightened, and cracks spread across the blade. The knight jerked back, startled, but Austin didn't give it a chance.
With a roar, Austin charged forward, his fist glowing with raw energy.
**BOOM**
His punch connected with the knight's chest. The force was terrifying. The knight's armor caved in with a deafening crunch, and its body shot backward like a missile, slamming into the ground with an earth-shaking crash.
The ground trembled. Dust filled the air. Austin stood there, his bloodied hand trembling, his eyes burning with fury.
Austin clenched his fist and was about to lunge forward to end this battle when suddenly,
[Congratulations, host, for defeating the Vice-Commander!]
[You have gained: 100 points.]
[Total points: 205]
"..." That knight was ...more feeble than Austin thought....
---------**--------
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 71: Chapter 70- Hard choice
chapters.content:
Chapter 71: Chapter 70- Hard choice
Austin returned to his room—all healed and returned to his previous state before he entered the dungeon.
He was quite troubled previously, wondering how he could hide the injuries so that Valerie and Sebastian wouldn't notice. However, he doesn't need to anymore.
'System?'
[As mentioned host, it was just a simulation. Unless you die there and lose your connection with the real world, every wound will be healed once you get back.]
Austin smiled, 'Nice.'
Then he can go all out next time. Well, he wasn't holding back his punches, but surely, his over-caution during the battle has resulted in restricted movements.
'So system, I can use the points anytime I want, right?'
[Yes, host. However, you must use them before entering the dungeon once again, or they will be refreshed.]
"...why are you playing games with me?" Austin was frustrated. He wanted to accumulate the points to unlock the shop feature and here ...
[A light joke to lift your mood :)]
[You can use your points anytime you want.]
"...." A broken system he got. Is there any way to exchange?
Heaving a sigh, Austin went to the bathroom and took a thorough bath. There was no blood but his body was stiff and sore. Although his wounds were healed, his mind was still filled with the thoughts of the battle.
It was the first time he went through such intense trials, so naturally, he would be a little overwhelmed.
After the bath, he walked out of the room and tried to find something to eat. However, there was nothing so he dropped the plan and walked back to the bed.
'I should go and eat something at the common hall...' He thought as he rested his back against the headboard.
He had to meet Valerie and have dinner with her...however, he was too tired to move around so before he knew, Austin fell asleep.
---------**--------
*Shlik*
Valerie moved just as she heard the sound of movement from her left flank, the wooden sword held tight in her hand, as she launched toward the target
Slicing the blue flames with the sword, she gracefully landed on the ground without making a single noise.
*Shlik*
Followed instantly by that movement, another sound erupted, this time too close to her, so she didn't bother turning and stabbed the blade behind her with enough force to stab a person.
She heard the light dying down, and the session coming to an end.
"Haah..." Exhaling a long sigh, she wiped her sweat and went to pick up the golden orb that was helping her train.
This was the artifact she received from the Vice-headmaster that sent several light orbs at random spots within a closed space and made very minimal sound, which one needed to perceive and attack before the orb could hit them.
However, for Valerie, rather than the physical pain of being hit by the orb, she took damage to her pride when she failed to notice those orbs.
Although she wasn't able to dodge and counter every orb, she was slowly getting there.
"It's quite late....he didn't come..." Valerie previously invited Austin to her room—which was quite embarrassing and the girl needs to work on her random impulses—however, he didn't come.
She went to the common hall a few minutes ago, and he wasn't there to have dinner as well. Even Sebastian was nowhere to be seen, so she had no idea what he was doing.
"...did something happen?" A frown contoured her moon-like face as she peeked out of the window.
Abel lives in the same building as Austin, so it wouldn't be too surprising for that annoying incompetent creature to go and trouble her beloved.
'If only I had a license to kill...'
She went into the bathroom and took a quick shower before changing her clothes and wearing a black skirt and pink top.
Sliding her feet into her sandals, she walked down the stairs and was met by a familiar face, "Oh, hey."
It was the student council president, Rothaux Annabelle, who greeted her.
Valerie returned the greetings, "Good evening, President."
Anna looked at Valerie once again before complimenting, "You look great today. Going on a date with Austin?"
Valerie shook her head, "Just going to check on him."
Anna grinned, "Infiltrating the dorms?"
Valerie narrowed her eyes, "I wouldn't go that far...just going to check if he is in the common hall." Yeah, she lied. She was definitely going to his room.
Anna chuckled, seeing her junior trying so hard to suppress her emotions.
However, soon her laughter died down, and the redhead added, "By the way, you don't need to worry about Abel. I have given him the final warning today that another complaint and his position as a Disciplinary officer would be taken away. Worse, I might make an official request to suspend him."
Valerie was taken aback, "Just because of what happened today?" She couldn't be any more thankful for the President to take such harsh steps, since insulting her Lord means severe punishment. Death, if possible. However, considering how patient and forgiving the President is, it was quite surprising.
Anna shook her head and with a smile extending her lips, she added, "No....he has been breaking quite many rules for the past six months...ever since..." She paused, not wanting to add the part.
However, Valerie understood what she meant to say. Abel has been rebellious ever since Valerie was given the post of Disciplinary Chief, even though that post should be Abel's. However, it was a known fact that Valerie was one of the most disciplined and upright people; with her strength, Annabelle was forced to make the hard choice.
The redhead rested her hand on Valerie's shoulder before assuring her, "Don't worry about him and focus on the upcoming tournament."
Valerie nodded before the older one walked away.
Once alone, she began walking...however, her feet weren't leading her to the common hall.
'Did you forget our promise?' She wants to complain.
----------**--------
A/N:- Istg, if I had a girlfriend like Val, I wouldn't have minded listening to her complaint every day. Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 72: Chapter 71- Confession
chapters.content:
Chapter 72: Chapter 71- Confession
"But why am I the bad guy if, as your boyfriend, I am just asking you to pay a little less attention to your friends, and more to me?" Luke couldn't help but ask with a frown.
The other person's face was hazy, but he knew she was his girlfriend…someone who had been tormenting him with her behavior for quite some time now.
"Listen, Luke, we are dating, so let's not interfere with each other's personal life. I never told you to not hang out with your friends, but-"
"Hang out? Really, Nia? You were sleeping over at your friend's place who is a guy and had confessed to you in the past. Don't you find anything….not a single thing weird here?"
The other responded aggressively, "There were other people as well! And not just because we slept under the same roof, we had sex!"
"..." Luke lost it. He couldn't understand what was the problem. He has already faced seven breakups by now, and all seven times, he got dumped because of absurd reasons.
Either the girl said 'You deserved better' or 'You expect too much'. He never expected anything from anyone.
He just desired a normal relationship where his partner remained loyal to him…and on whom Luke could actually rely at times. Naturally, he never cheated on any of his girlfriends, since he never was a hypocrite.
For the first time, he believed that his partner might be at fault. And that belief continued until a couple of more times since his friends also said that he didn't do anything bad.
But ..with time and with each breakup, he started to feel.
'Is it that….that actually there is something wrong with me?'
….
"Ah…" Austin woke up from his slumber, his head feeling a little heavy.
He didn't know why but he was having a dream of his ex-girlfriend.
"Are you okay?"
Austin was startled to hear that voice, as he hurriedly turned to his left and found a familiar pair of eyes looking back at him with concern filled in them.
"Val…" He didn't know why, but seeing her right now so unexpectedly filled his heart with inexplicable warmth.
"Sorry, I came here without telling you and even stayed…but you looked quite anxious in your sleep…" She apologized with guilt and nervousness evident on her face.
Austin wanted to laugh. His source of happiness and peace was being apologetic for approaching him.
He tested his back against the headboard, and responded in a soft voice, "I don't mind…rather, I am happy to see you here. As you said, I was feeling a bit restless."
Valerie's thin brows elevated, "What happened?" She was like an innocent child worried for her sick parent and being very cautious even while speaking.
Austin heaved a sigh and held her hand, "Can I ask you something?"
Valerie nodded and straightened her back.
"Can you do me a favor and tell me if I become annoying at some point? Like I can be unbearable sometimes…make you feel that I am bothersome. So when you feel like it, don't think twice before telling me what I am doing wrong, okay?"
Valerie was stunned. She couldn't fathom why he thought of something like that all of a sudden. Why would she ever be annoyed with him? Rather, it was she who felt that her actions might become bothersome to him sometimes.
In the past, he used to say that she was unbearable; however, recently, after that incident, he always welcomed her presence.
Call it being paranoid, but she still sometimes feels scared that everything might turn out to be a dream and this dream-like reality might crumble one day.
That's why, "I will…but in return, you have to promise me something as well." Holding his hand between hers, she said, "Whatever happens in the future…if your feelings change for me because of any reason, let me know about it. I will do something to make you not dislike me."
Austin shook his head, "I love you, Valerie…and that is a fact no one can change."
"...!" Valerie paused. A tremor ran down her spine, and her eyes stretched wide.
Austin was baffled as he asked, "What happened?"
Valerie lowered her eyes, her cheeks adopting the shade of the setting sun, as she slowly muttered, "...y-you confessed…"
Realization hit him hard as Austin covered his face in both frustration and slight embarrassment.
Although engaged for almost two years now, he hasn't proposed to her. Like goddamn!
"Wait a minute .." Valerie was startled when suddenly Austin jumped from the bed and after opening the window, he jumped out.
"Huh?" Shocked, she got up and advanced towards the window, only to find Austin leaping back up, "Ehhh? How are you so fast? And why did you suddenly jump out?"
Austin smiled at the girl before stepping inside.
Standing face to face with the love of his life, he first knelt on the ground, his left knee firmly pressed on the ground.
"Curse me or slap me, I will accept it all, for the crime I have committed." Lifting the flower he brought from the garden, he continued,
"Although I am late, I want to tell you my feelings, Valerie." He was…strangely feeling quite nervous, but not even God could stop him from continuing at the moment,
"I have gone through several life experiences and met several people. However, only a single person gave me the feeling that without her …I wouldn't be able to live. That person who has been with me during my hard times and helped me become a man who I am right now. My happiness, and the reason why I have started to love each day of my life."
Valerie's eyes turned moist as she remained rooted at her spot, etching each of his words in the deepest spot of her mind so she couldn't forget about them until her last breath.
Austin locked his eyes with hers before adding, "I, Austin Eryndor, is head over heels for you, Valerie. And I promise to keep you happy for the rest of your life."
Valerie covered her mouth, barely holding a sob. She so wanted to hear those words from him… Finally, today, the man to whom she has devoted her life was confessing his feelings as well.
Rather than answering him, she knelt before her Lord, and to his utmost surprise, Valerie kissed him.
"....!!" Austin's eyes widened as he felt her warm and fluffy lips pressing against his.
It was nothing passionate, just a light peck, but that light connection was enough to blow all his senses.
Valerie broke the kiss soon after, before she looked at him with a broad smile, and said,
"Please take care of me."
—------**-------
A/N:- And cut! That's the perfect ending! I'm kidding; this is just the beginning.
Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 73: Chapter 72- I need some help....
chapters.content:
Chapter 73: Chapter 72- I need some help....
The next morning, Valerie woke up in a daze.
Last night…something incredible happened.
"Gahhhhhh!" Pressing her face against the pillow, she kicked her legs and punched the bed in embarrassment with evident excitement.
This was a very sweet feeling. The one she adores, reciprocated her feelings. He said he loves her…Austin loves Valerie.
"Kyaah! I can't!" Hiding her face she flipped on the bed.
She could remember every single detail of last night. Despite the absurdity of the matter, it was an undeniable fact that Valerie got proposed to by the man of her dreams.
"Oh my god…my heart is racing…I won't die, right? But I want to spend my life with my Lord. No, no, no dying. He said he wants to spend his life with me; does that mean he wants to marry me? He wants to marry me right?"
A happy smile bloomed on her face as she covered her cheeks and fidgeted on the bed.
If anyone except for Austin had seen her in her current state, they might have fainted. Austin would have only grinned and patted the soft adorable girl.
Valerie was over cloud nine and couldn't think how she should react. She wanted to dance around and proudly announce that she received a confession.
"Would it be too much if I suddenly become a little clingy? I mean, I am now his girlfriend-ah! I am already engaged to him, so it's okay right?"
She was happy.
However, regardless of her happiness, she couldn't neglect her Lord's training.
She was happy and excited, but that could wait.
Taking a shower and following her usual routine, she changed her clothes and wore her training attire.
Just for a change, she braided her hair and clipped it with a lavender-petalled hair clip.
"Is it too much?" As a warrior, she shouldn't be too focused on her hair…but just for today, "I want to look a little different."
With those thoughts, she left the dormitory.
…
When she reached their usual spot where they train, Valerie found her Lord already stretching his limbs and preparing for the training.
'Not good…for two days now, I arrived here after him…' In the past, she used to reach here an hour ago, so he didn't need to wait. But these days, she has been irresponsible.
Not good. Need to change.
"Oh, you are here." Austin turned towards his beloved and was stunned to find her looking too beautiful for sore eyes.
If he could, he would have taken hundreds of pictures of hers right now and saved one of the best of them as his phone wallpaper.
Too darn beautiful.
"I am sorry for arriving late." She spoke as she rested the bag on the resting bench, and asked, "Good morning, Austin."
A smiling Valerie early in the morning…yes, that's the perfect way to start a day.
"You braid your hair? It looks beautiful."
Valerie shyly smiled, "T-Thank you…" A slight red hue appeared on her face as she crossed her hands behind her back.
There were not any words spoken between them, yet they talked. The atmosphere around them was quite pleasant and could heal one's heart.
But then suddenly,
"Morning."
It was Rhea.
The pink head looked genuinely apologetic as soon as she realized that they weren't training but flirting.
However, it was too late; she already called out to him.
"Yes, Rhea?" Heaving a sigh, he asked her.
Rhea was wearing her training outfit as she asked, "I wanted to take some advice from Valerie…if that's okay."
"No, it's not." Valerie's instant refusal left Rhea sobbing,
"O-kay…I will go…"
Austin chuckled seeing that action and reaction, before he asked, "Advice on what?"
Rhea beamed, finally gaining some hope as she asked, "About magic control over my Shard."
Turning towards Austin, she summoned her Shard, which had definite features.
Its surface glows with faint silver runes, shifting subtly as if alive, etched during its second evolution. The hilt is simple but firm, wrapped in a material resembling blackened steel, with a faint aura pulsing from the shard's core.
Rhea was an A-rank because of her Shard's evolution.
After the first evolution, an awakened can augment their Shard and move them away freely from their body. That's why archers who haven't gone through first evolution are basically non-awakened.
After the second evolution, an awakened gains the ability to use the magical attribute of their shard. As for Valerie, it's Ice. And for Rudolph, it's earth magic. Manipulating the element to a basic level is what one gains.
Although it doesn't sound much, the difference between the awakened of the first stage and the second one is quite huge.
And then comes the third stage—a point where the awakened step beyond mortal limits and seize the power to manipulate reality itself. At this stage, they don't just wield magic; they bend the very laws of existence, rewriting nature's rules to obey their will.
Like Valerie, who trapped the Illusion Monkey within a frozen time chamber, twisting time into her servant and shattering the natural order with a mere thought.
This power is why those who reach the third stage are feared as walking calamities—beings who can tear the world apart at their whim. They are called S-rank Awakened, and their very presence heralds destruction.
Valerie didn't want to look bad and rude in her Lord's eyes, that's why she said, "Tell me what is your problem?" Quite literally.
Rhea, who didn't notice the displeasure in Valerie's voice, innocently stated, "When I try launching a simple spell like Ariel Slash, I release too much Soul energy. That's why I can only depend on my magic once or twice during a battle."
Valerie was known for her exceptional magic control. Her efficiency while using spells was truly admirable. As such, Rhea thought why not ask the best?
Valerie crossed her arms, and told her, "Attack me."
Rhea was startled, "W-What?"
Austin slowly stepped back as he heard Valerie taunting, "What happened? Can't you?"
"But it would be too much…you are too close to dodge," Rhea argued, finding it absurd how Valerie could ask her to launch an attack from this close.
Suddenly, Valerie summoned her Shard; the menacing presence of the Spear twisted the air and released crackles from the divine armament.
With her eyes cold as steel, Valerie added, "If you don't, then I will." Her words died by the violent noise of her Shard as she swung toward Rhea, and in a panic, Rhea launched a Wind Blade.
*CLANG*
Valerie easily swatted the advancing blade and allowed Rhea to calm down first.
The pink head opened her eyes and asked in disbelief, "Why did you do that?!"
Ignoring her complaint, she explained, "See that? Just because you were in a panic, you released a huge amount of Soul Energy in that single attack." Allowing her Spear to disintegrate, she added, "Your emotions heavily control the magic control. First, go and calm your mind before trying to use spells."
Rhea clutched the handle of the blade tightly as with a resolute expression, she responded,
"Understood!"
—------**-------
A/N:- Heroine learning from the Villainess. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 74: Chapter 73- Sick father
chapters.content:
Chapter 74: Chapter 73- Sick father
"So students, we are concluding the classes a little early today so you all can take it easy a little and take your time to prepare for tomorrow." It was the period just before recess when the teacher announced.
"Every student gets only one chance to prove their worth and make a name for themselves. Some will succeed, others might fail—but never forget what was already decided the moment you stepped into this prestigious school. You are the chosen ones, destined to walk a harsh path, one that leads to glory."
Austin heaved a sigh and stopped listening. It wasn't like he didn't respect the teachers, but because of their restrictions and fear of the student's background, they had to be very careful even while speaking.
Although the Headmaster has abolished exploiting one's status to intimidate others, especially teachers, in the past, there have been several incidents where the Professors had to pay the price for their actions against certain students.
'The fake liberty of speech is almost laughable...'
Glancing at Valerie he found the girl intently listening to the teacher. She is the top student and the chief of the disciplinary committee, so it was natural for her to be so attentive in class.
'Don't look at the teacher so carefully...I might get jealous...' With a smile, he stared at her back for another moment, before calling out,
'System, tell me something. How many dungeons are there in total?'
[There are a total of ten dungeons that the Host needs to cross before the Host would reach the epitome of humanity.]
Austin raised his brows, 'Epitome?'
[Indeed, host. There are two stages of the system; the first one is called (Warrior Struggle) and the second stage is (Path to Glory).]
Austin raised his brows, 'When will I enter the second stage and what is different in the second stage compared to the first one?'
[That information cannot be disclosed as of now since it would take a few hours for the system to upgrade. As for the requirement to reach that stage, the host needs to reach a hundred points in the overall progression.]
Austin hummed, he somehow guessed it.
With the current rate, he would become a B-rank once he conquered this dungeon...or maybe the one after this one.
He couldn't be sure since there was no parameter he could use to keep a record of his status.
'I think it would be best to search for a beast to hunt.'
After a bit of thought, Austin asked, "Can I request another dungeon right after this one?"
[Ding!]
[In exchange for 300 points, the host can request the Second Dungeon instantaneously.]
[Note: Further, the cost of the dungeon generation will rise as the Host continues to progress.]
'....' Austin was a bit taken aback by that huge amount being asked.
He fought with his life on the line for an hour to earn those points and now, the system was asking it so simply just for doing its job.
'...and what if I don't spend my points?'
[Then the host would have to wait for the system to randomly summon a dungeon, like the first time.]
'...and how many days that may take?'
[From one day to one year.]
"..." This is just purely asking him to sacrifice those hard-earned points. Sigh.
So he has to utilize those points since before the tournament, he needs to make sure he has reached B-rank. Well, he won't get his rank officially evaluated, but he surely would need that strength to not lose against the opponent; Headmaster Philius would choose for him.
'System, is there any reward for my Shard to upgrade?'
[Your Shard is a part of your Soul, and your Soul Energy is progressing alongside your Combat stats.]
Austin hummed; understandable.
The evolution of his Soul Shard would allow him to realize his affinity with an element.
Although he was more suitable as a fighter, having a few spells would allow him to remain versatile during a battle.
"Austin?" The blond Prince jerked out of his daze as he looked to his left and found Rudolph standing there.
"Yeah?"
"You...free? I want to discuss something with you."
He sounded serious, which made Austin curious. However, when he looked to the other side, he found Valerie standing there, uncertainty written on her face.
"Is it okay if I invite Valerie along?"
Rudolph glanced where Austin's eyes were directed before he assented, "Yeah, sure."
"Where are you going? Can I also come?" Rhea suddenly appeared before them as she asked with a soft smile.
Rudolph looked troubled, and from his expression alone Austin guessed what it could be.
That's why he suggested, "Don't you have some training to finish? Why don't you wait for Valerie in the training ground?"
Rhea understood that the matter could not be shared with her, and as such, she smilingly said, "Okay, then, see you guys around."
Rudolph felt extremely bad letting her go. He generally doesn't hide anything from her....but informing her about this would only increase the mental burden on the girl.
Rhea was already too stressed because of her recent defeat, and the upcoming tournament. As such, Rudolph didn't want to add another source of stress to her.
Austin urged, "Shall we go?"
Rudolph nodded before Austin approached his lover and extended his hand toward her.
"Is everything all right?" Valerie asked as she held his hand.
The familiar warmth made her heart flutter, but she chose to not let her get distracted.
"Rudolph has some news to share...possibly about the Capital."
Rudolph's father was the Commander of the Imperial Legion and someone who was an integral part of the council. As such, Austin guessed it must be about the Council or something that happened in the capital that caused Rudolph so much anxiety.
If he was guessing it right, then Drenovar must have made some moves.
They followed the bigger guy to the garden since the Common Hall must be too crowded to talk peacefully.
The back garden of the campus was not completely devoid of the populace, but surely, it wasn't as noisy.
As they reached the resting bench, Austin noticed the dust and dried leaves settled on the bench.
Taking out his handkerchief, he cleaned the seat for Valerie before gesturing for her to sit down.
"Thank you."
Austin smiled at the girl before dusting off the seat for himself as well and sitting beside her.
Rudolph, whose seat was still covered with dust, stared at his friend in betrayal, "Seriously dude, you chose your lover and forgot about your bro?"
Austin shrugged as Rudolph took out his handkerchief, and after cleaning his seat, he also sat down.
"So what is it?" Austin asked.
Rudolph made sure that no one was listening to their conversation before he asked, "Did you recently receive any letter from your mother or brother?"
Austin shook his head, "No, what happened?"
Rudolph frowned, a little troubled about the fact how blatantly they were ignoring him, even about these important family matters.
In a grim voice, he said, "Your father might not be well. He looked extremely pale and weak during the recent council meeting. Maybe it was because of the stress but his case is quite concerning."
Austin had a severe frown on his face; this was unexpected.
This wasn't part of the plot, but maybe—because of Drenovar and the strain of the war—it had started to take a toll on him.
However, something told Austin that this wasn't just the stress.
'Is Aiden planning to remove father...but as of now, even if the King dies he wouldn't receive the throne right away....' The most annoying trait of the first Prince was his unpredictable nature.
He can never predict Aiden's next move because of his twisted nature. As such, it wouldn't be a surprise that he might have targeted his father to gain control over Eryndor.
"Austin...I think you should go and meet him. You might have grudges against him, but he is your father." Rudolph added, sounding resolute.
Austin wasn't surprised that Rudolph was suggesting something like this despite being aware of how Austin have been treated by his family in the past few years.
The close bond he shares with his family, especially his father, makes Rudolph believe that family members should always forgive each other, regardless of what crime they might have committed.
'More than any familial feelings I might have for that man, I need him as the King to not let Eryndor meet its demise.'
Austin couldn't let the King fall or Eryndor will fall. And that would be disastrous in several ways.
"Austin..." Hearing her soft voice, Austin turned to look at her.
Valerie had a concerned look on her face as she asked him wordlessly, what he wanted to do.
Releasing a long long breath, he finally made the decision, "After my trials, I will go and seen him."
---------**--------
A/N:- We are approaching towards the downfall. Not of Eryndor, but of a certain silver-headed bastard.
Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 75: Chapter 74- Change of plans?
chapters.content:
Chapter 75: Chapter 74- Change of plans?
"Are you returning to your room?" Austin asked as they stood near the girl's dorm.
It was already past dinner time and they have spent most of their time together.
It was strange yet not that when you are with your favorite person, you don't realize when time passes.
"I…have to," Valerie responded as she held his hands and stood face to face.
Austin heaved a sigh and nodded, "Well, tomorrow is our trial and we will get to know who I will be facing to be with you."
Valerie shyly lowered her gaze, her beautiful lips arching in a smile, as she said, "But we are already together."
Austin shook his head, "Tomorrow, I am going to win the place beside you."
Valerie looked up into his eyes; the determination and confidence he held made her heart flutter.
How time changes. Once, he only seemed so determined about only one person—Rhea. But now, his focus, and goal was her.
It was his ambition to be with her.
Valerie squeezed his hand and uttered, "I know you will win tomorrow."
Hearing that, Austin mischievously grinned, before asking, "But if I win, I will naturally get to participate with you. What will you give me?"
Valerie was confused, her head tilted slightly, as she asked, "What…I can give you?"
Austin inched closer. His breath made her ticklish, as she held her breath upon finding the distance between their lips almost non-existent.
She was suddenly reminded of that moment when they kissed, further elevating her panic.
"A-Au-Austin…I-I-I…"
Austin looked into her beautiful trembling eyes. Her body was trembling in both nervousness and anticipation.
Leaning his face to the side a little, he whispered in her ear, "If I win tomorrow, I want to have the taste of your sweet lips, once again."
Valerie's eyes stretched slightly, as she opened her mouth to say something, only to find her Lord's finger pressing against her lips, "I won't take anything but 'yes' as a response."
Valerie wasn't going to reject him anyway, but still…why should she be the one to kiss? She even became shameless for the first time.
'...it's the reward he is asking for though…' Valerie steeled her nerves, and with her eyes closed, she nodded in assent.
Austin smiled before he stepped back, "Go and rest, Valerie. Tomorrow will be a tiring day for you."
—------**--------
"Shit…that might have been too much…" Returning to his room, Austin clutched his chest and found his heart violently beating.
His face was hot, and whenever he remembered the expression on his lover's face, he felt his mind turning numb and a shiver of excitement running down his spine.
'She looked so timid and adorable…' One couldn't comprehend how such a fierce and cold warrior could make such an expression when he flirts with her.
"I can't let anyone else see that expression or they will fall for her right away…" Flirting is okay, but he can't do that outside.
*Knock*
Hearing the knock, Austin first steadied his breathing before opening the door and finding a familiar grey-haired man standing there.
"Good evening, sir." Sebastian greeted as he entered the room.
"Sebastian…did you know about Father?" Austin asked right away. Although he heard the news from Rudolph, he couldn't be a hundred percent sure until his trusted butler affirmed.
And indeed, "He is not doing well, sir. I received the news from a trusted source."
Austin hummed, a deep frown marring his face as he sat down on the chair and rested his hand on the table.
After thinking for a bit, Austin asked, "What information do you have about the staff regularly working in the palace?"
"I have details about everyone," Sebastian responded. For someone who used to serve the king, it was his duty to keep a record of those who regularly came in contact with Cedric.
Austin grimly asked, "What do you know about the chef working in the kitchen? Do they have a family?"
Sebastian was confused, "There are currently three chefs and seven cooks in the royal kitchen. And yes, they have their families except for the youngest cook who recently joined. He is an orphan."
Austin hummed, before he asked, "I know it is too much, but can you do a background check on all these, especially the new one for me? I might be paranoid but I feel Father's sudden health deterioration is not just out of stress."
Austin could only trust Sebastian with this work. He doesn't have the resources or manpower to do this job. And if Sebastian finds Aiden's involvement in this matter then it would be quite beneficial for Austin.
"If possible…huh?" Austin was surprised to see the butler, despite the severity of the matter, was smiling warmly at him.
Sebastian explained, "It warms my heart to see you being worried for your Father, despite the distance you two may have created."
Austin sighed. Interlacing his fingers, he said, "I am worried about the nation and our people. If the King falls, I hardly believe my elder brother could handle the responsibilities of the throne as of now."
"Yes, yes, I understand you," Sebastian said; however, seeing how the man was grinning, it was evident that he didn't believe in him at all.
Austin groaned, "You really are…well, if possible, find out about them by the day after tomorrow."
Sebastian nodded diligently, "Understood, sir. And…is there any change in plans for our trip?"
Austin nodded, "We will first visit the Great Forest, then meet Duke Corwon, and finally visit the capital. Since there would be fifteen days before the tournament officially begins, I think we can cover the journey in that brief time."
Sebastian was a little concerned, "But sir, if we visit the Capital-"
"I know that we won't make it to Drenovar on time. That's why I am planning to postpone the trip…" but was that a wise choice? Austin was racing against time.
—------**-------
"Based on the decision of the council, Eryndor and Drenovar might not get the permission to participate."
Hearing those words from the Headmaster, a few didn't react and a few gasped.
It was late evening when the meeting of the teachers was held in the conference room where the Headmaster, Vice-headmaster along with other teachers were present.
The topic in discussion was, naturally, the tournament.
"Is it because of the possible war, sir?" One of the teachers asked, and he got a nod in response.
"Indeed. Although we haven't received any notice from the Union Council, it is being speculated that they would not allow the academy of the two nations who are on the verge of a clash, to participate."
"But what war has to do with this tournament?" Another Professor asked.
This time, it was Morkel who responded, "There are several reasons, Professor Dorothy, but the most obvious one is personal grudge and manipulation. While we may not instruct our students to target those from Drenovar, who's to say they wouldn't encourage theirs to use this opportunity to take revenge on Eryndor?"
Dorothy raised her brows, "Are you suggesting that they will ask their students to harm our students."
Morkel shrugged, "Who knows."
Every eye then turned towards the Headmaster, before Philius added, "Professor Morkel is right about that. That's why, it isn't safe for us to send our students inside the ring where they gain the opportunity to severely damage our students."
The Vice-headmaster asked, "So are we withdrawing?"
Philius shook his head, "Unless the Union Council doesn't tell us so, we are going to move with our original plan. We will hold the trials as scheduled and see what happens."
Morkel exhaled a weary sigh as he said, "All we can do is hope for a miracle."
—-------**---------
It was quite late at night when Austin finally finished his planning about the upcoming trip to places.
He would be quite busy for some time now, however, this was necessary.
If the First Prince hadn't made a move towards Valerie, Austin might have used Aiden for his benefit. However, now….Aiden needs to die.
'If things don't go in the way I desire them to be…then I always have a plan B…' Austin looked at the small pocket watch Sebastian gifted him. If he fails then directly slaughtering Aiden would be the only option left for him.
'Haah…let's think about that later…' He has a more important thing in hand right now. His training.
Tomorrow was his trial, and the Headmaster would be choosing his opponent. If Austin wins against him then he can have his spot reserved as an Elite.
That's why…
'System, re-open Stage 1…'
[Ding!]
[Re-establishing the stage…]
[Floor 1: Moonlit Mirage]
[Rank: C-]
[Time limit: 6 hours]
[Current points: 205]
[Enter?]
[Y/N]
Taking a deep breath, Austin summoned his Shard in his left hand before commanding,
"Yes."
—------**--------
A/N:- I hope you all are enjoying the story so far. I will develop the world in the background with this arc and won't allow it to become boring. I promise. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 76: Chapter 75- You are needed
chapters.content:
Chapter 76: Chapter 75- You are needed
The greatest happiness of a warrior is not to buy new equipment, rather, it is to find themselves progressing.
Just like how Austin was feeling currently.
*CLANG*
*SWAAAH*
Hia dagger parried the incoming blade before his fist dug a hole in the chest of the ninja, ceasing its existence in one blow.
The blond Prince didn't stay there to marvel at his strength. Rather, he twirled on his feet, ducking low to dodge the incoming saber, before he plunged his elongated dagger into the ninja.
*SWAAAH*
If it was difficult for Austin to keep track of the dungeon dwellers when he entered the dungeon for the first time, then now, he was easily able to track their movements and react on time.
His reflexes and strength have elevated thanks to the progression he made yesterday.
*CLANG*
Sparks flew as Austin twisted his wrist, knocking aside another blade before driving his knee into the attacker's ribs. The soldier barely had time to stagger before Austin's dagger flashed—slicing cleanly through its throat.
He didn't stop. He couldn't.
Another enemy lunged from the shadows, but Austin was faster. He ducked, feeling the wind of a blade passing over his head, then shot up like a spring, slamming his dagger into the ninja's chin. The force sent it flying back before it even had the chance to react.
*SWISH*
Austin tilted his head just in time as a blade passed from the spot, before the blond Prince grabbed the attacker's wrist, twisting it before pulling the assailant in front.
Austin held the other hand of the ninja, before kicking it with enough force to send its body flying while its hands remained in Austin's captive.
The ninja dissolved into nothingness before Austin continued to parry and counter whoever came in his way
Unlike before when they were coming in waves, now, they were attacking altogether.
From a different angle, it would have seemed horrifying to see a single human being surrounded by more than two hundred ambushers.
However, Austin didn't let that information overwhelm his mind. Until he could see, he could fight.
*RUMBLE*
The swarm closed in.
Blades flashed from every direction.
Austin moved.
CLANG! He parried a sword, sidestepped a spear, then thrust—his dagger sinking into a ninja's chest before he tore it out in a violent arc, severing another's head in the same motion.
But they kept coming.
Austin moved his eyes restlessly on the battlefield, tracking the incoming enemies one after another.
Just as he found his body was getting a little slower, Austin jumped over the attack and landed on one of the soldier's shoulder
Jumping high into the air, Austin summoned his beloved boomerang before throwing it towards the lot.
The moment Wisp left his hand, the air howled.
*SHHHHK*
The boomerang shot forward like a ghostly blade, cutting clean through the first row of enemies. It didn't stop. It twisted mid-air, curving back toward Austin before veering sideways—tearing through another dozen ninjas in a single arc.
Limbs flew. Bodies dissolved into black mist.
Austin was brought down to the ground, as he landed with his elongated Shard piercing through the head of the ninja below him.
*Dhak*
Austin landed on the ground before ducking his head and extending his Shard enough to stab the nearby soldiers.
*SHWAAAA*
Austin continued to move restlessly around the ground, dominating the field with his speed and strength.
Slowly, the number went down, and his points continued to go up.
'Just a little more...'
----------**----------
[A little while ago]
Morkel was in his office, arranging his notes and documents.
For the next month, he wasn't scheduled for regular classes, that's why he was planning to arrange all his documents in his free time.
'Ah...' He suddenly found a certain letter that brought back a few memories.
'How can I forget about this...' A nostalgic smile formed on his lips.
He joined the academy at the age of twenty-two—just right after he finished his diploma.
Initially, he wasn't well accepted by the students, and despite his knowledge, he was told to teach the first year rather than the third.
From the Headmaster's perspective, Morkel needed some experience in the initial phase.
He didn't mind; he knew he had to become mature enough to handle mature students.
However, because of a lack of experience, he often made many mistakes in his initial days. He was clumsy and easily got intimidated. And because the Headmaster praised him, the other Professor didn't like him much, so he was left alone to sort it out all by himself.
After one year, Morkel felt that he might not be good as a teacher. The students never took him seriously, and the other teachers only looked at him with pity.
He was tired...wanted to cry. He was a man, that's why he wasn't allowed to even cry in the open. And because he was an illegitimate child, there was no one to listen to his troubles.
That's why, one day he decided to resign from his job and become a researcher. Although that job wouldn't have paid well, at least he would get freedom from all this pressure.
One of those evenings when he was making his way to the Headmaster's office, carrying his resigning letter in his hand, he suddenly stumbled into a certain pinkhead who recently joined the academy.
The letter from his hand dropped to the ground and before he could have picked it up, the girl crouched down to pick the letter.
Her brows were raised when she read the subject of the matter before she looked up at the Professor.
Morkel was quite embarrassed at that time since, because of his clumsiness, he wouldn't be able to leave in silence as well.
However, the girl didn't say anything regarding that and just handed the letter to him.
"T-Thank you..." Morkel, while stuttering, thanked the polite girl.
The girl didn't respond to that; rather, while looking at him in the eyes, she uttered, "I loved your lectures...the only person whom I can understand in this academy. But I guess, it's a tradition for everyone I like to leave one day." Heaving a sigh, she added, "Anyway, farewell, teacher."
Morkel was rendered speechless. He was never told that they loved his lectures...nor was he told that his presence was needed by someone.
Being practically an orphan, he has long lost the sensation of being liked by someone. To be needed by someone.
He remained rooted in his spot for a long time...before he turned around and decided not to resign.
He joined the academy because of his hobby of teaching...however, the reason he stayed was different. He stayed for a certain student.
Rhea.
'Haah...some people might call me a creep...but only I know how pure my feelings are for you...' Looking at the only picture he had in his diary, Morkel exhaled a long breath.
He didn't know if she would ever accept him or not...however, until his last breath, Morkel had taken an oath to protect that smile on her face.
And to keep her smiling, there was someone who needed to disappear.
Austin.
---------**--------
"Haah....haah....haah...fuck..." Austin collapsed on the ground. His Shard disintegrated, and his boomerang returned to his inventory as the teenager remained lying within the resting zone.
