He finally defeated all the two hundred and fifty soldiers.
Initially, it was too easy...making him believe that it would be a piece of cake. However, soon he realized that, unlike a video game where you can spam moves against mobs, here things were different.
His opponents might be mindless creatures, but they still possessed the instincts of warriors.
It took a lot from him—seven slashes, fifteen bruises, and a broken tooth to defeat all of them.
However, thanks to all that hard work and pain, he was able to earn something very valuable,
[Total Points: 205-> 270]
Austin was slightly dissatisfied. The reason was the reduction of points per soldier as he advanced.
For the first hundred soldiers, it was 0.4.
For the next hundred, it went down to 0.2.
And the next fifty, 0.1.
'You are such a cheapstake, system.'
Heaving a sigh, Austin got up from the ground but remained seated.
His legs were trembling as he looked at the timer.
[10:31]
There were still ten minutes left for him to rest. However, considering the being he needs to fight, these ten minutes were far too less.
[Name: Commander Red Wing]
[Rank: B-]
Austin exhaled a weary breath, 'Wasn't this dungeon supposed to be filled with just C-ranks?'
[Ding!]
[Indeed, host. However, after calculating the time it took for the host to defeat all the soldiers, and the stats progression the host earned, the Boss level was increased accordingly.]
"..." This was like asking him how much he tries to farm EXP through mobs, the dungeon boss would always be a rank higher than him.
'Well, not like I am here for an easy battle.' Tearing his shirt sleeve, he wrapped it around his wounded elbow.
Once done, Austin got up and summoned his weapon.
The timer ticked towards the zero, as Austin prepared himself.
'Just for the last time...'
*Bzzz*
The buzzer echoed as Austin took a step forward—only to find his vision turning blurry.
"Huh..."
---------**---------
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 77: Chapter 76- Conquered
chapters.content:
Chapter 77: Chapter 76- Conquered
[Note: Your Opponent has used the skill 'Withering Gaze'!]
[Caution: Host's combat stats have gone down by 20%.]
"Fuck..." Austin grumbled as he pushed himself off the wall where he was punched.
The moment he stepped into the arena, he felt his vision turning blurry...turned out his opponent used a skill.
'This is insane...I am already a level below that thing...and now...'
Austin felt the piercing gaze of the red-armored knight, cold and merciless. A shiver ran down his spine as he looked at his opponent.
Its eyes, glowing red like burning embers, locked onto him with an overwhelming presence. Black smoke curls from where its mouth should be, hiding its face in darkness. The sheer force of its stare made the air feel heavier as if crushing him under its will.
Austin could feel his body growing sluggish from the effect, and to make matters worse, the last blow had snapped a couple of his ribs.
*CLINK*
The soldier's foot shifted, the air tensed, and under Austin's widened gaze, the Commander lunged.
"Fuck!" Panic surged through him as he hastily chanted, the Absolute Barrier flaring to life around his body.
*CLANG*
The knight's fist crashed against the glowing shield, sending sparks flying—but the attack failed to reach him.
Gritting his teeth, Austin seized the opening, driving his fist forward with every ounce of strength left in him.
**THWACK**
A shockwave burst from behind the knight as it was pushed backward.
Austin grinned. The barrier would last thirty seconds—until then, he was untouchable.
Austin wasted no time. The moment the knight staggered back, he lunged forward, fists clenched, driving into the opening like a relentless storm.
**BAM**
His punch slammed into the knight's chest plate, forcing it back another step. But the knight barely reacted—no flinch, no grunt of pain—just those burning red eyes staring him down.
Austin gritted his teeth.
This wasn't enough.
"Wisp!" He called out, and instantly something hit the knight on its back, making it stumble forward.
*SWISH*
Taking the opportunity, Austin summoned his dagger and plunged it forward.
However,
*CLANG*
Just in time, the knight held the blade from piercing its awakened chest plate. And just in time, the barrier went down,
"Shi-*BOOOOM*"
A bone-cracking punch landed on his gut, sending Austin flying back—losing hold of his dagger as he did.
Austin ducked low and dug into the ground to grab something, or he would hit the wall once again.
*SCREECH*
His nails dugs, broke, and bled, but he finally brought himself to a pause before lunging forward.
Summoning his dagger in his hand, he elongated it to make it a sword, only to find something astonishing,
"Fuck!" Austin had to stop his charge, as suddenly the Knight summoned its own long sword as well and slashed towards Austin.
*SWISSH*
Under Austin's widened gaze, the blade's tip passed by a hair's breadth.
At that moment, Austin truly felt the dread for his life.
**CRACK**
The blade struck into the ground, creating cracks on the tile as Austin leaped away.
"*Huff* *Huff*" Austin felt a chill running down his spine. His face was pale as he stared at the knight who had dominated him both physically and mentally.
'This is bad...that could have split my head...' Austin was horrified.
That was the moment when Austin felt that this was not within his power to defeat this guy right now...he was too strong for the current him.
[Does the Host want to retreat?]
[Y/N]
Austin was about to say yes. He might need to defeat two hundred and fifty soldiers once again, but the next time he could come more prepared and with a strategy
He didn't have the barrier and he was too injured to even stand properly.
'Ye-' He was about to give the command when suddenly, he began to feel lighter. The invisible weight from his body was removed as he was notified,
[Note: Your opponent has disabled the effect of 'Withering Gaze'!]
[Note: All your stats have returned to normal.]
Austin's expression turned blank as he turned towards the Commander.
Unlike before when there was indifference oozing from those red glowing eyes, now there was a definite emotion Austin could sense from those eyes.
Pity.
....
At that moment, something was hurt. Any part of his body wasn't as wounded as his ego right now.
Austin snapped.
*BOOOM*
Austin directly charged, making it seem like he was coming in full force. Predictably, the knight raised its massive sword to intercept him—just as he planned.
At the last second, Austin twisted his body mid-lunge, letting his foot slide across the cracked tiles as he abruptly lowered his center of gravity. Instead of clashing head-on, he darted toward the knight's side.
The knight's sword swung straight through empty air.
Austin's dagger split in two, and with precise, surgical movements—
**THWACK!**
He struck the knight's back knee joint with the blunt end of his weapon.
CRACK!
The knight staggered, its stance crumbling as its knee buckled.
Austin grinned before he wrapped his leg around the Knight's neck, and before the knight could get up, Austin used both of his hands to plunge the dagger into the Knight's back.
**THWANG**
There was a loud noise, and this time, the armor of the warrior crumbled.
**RUMBLE**
The aura of the knight flared as it instantly got up on its feet, and after grabbing Austin by his collar, he removed the blond from its body and threw Austin like a ragdoll.
Austin slid on his feet and grabbed his WhisperWing from the ground.
*DHAK* *DHAK*
The knight advanced towards Austin, its sword raised high, but then, something came flying in its way, that left the Commander with no option but to swat the boomerang away.
Big mistake.
Just as the boomerang disappeared from its sight, the knight found the human levitating mid-air with his fist cocked.
For the first time, panic appeared in the Commander's eyes, but it was too late,
**BOOOOOOM**
With the strength that counted every single Combat point, Austin landed the blow on the Knight's jaw, sending it sliding back.
Austin landed on the ground, his knuckles aching, but there was a grin on his face.
However, soon, that grin was wiped off,
"*KHWAAAAAAAAAKH*" The knight suddenly came to a halt before howling in anger as its black aura flared like a stormy sky.
Austin's eyes narrowed as he had only a split second to summon his Shard and block the incoming attacks
**CLANG**
Sparks exploded as Austin barely parried the knight's relentless strike. The sheer force sent tremors down his arms, his muscles screaming in protest. His feet dug into the cracked tiles, the pressure nearly making his knees buckle.
The knight pressed on, its movements sharp and refined. Its massive sword moved like a whirlwind, each slash carrying the weight of a battle-hardened warrior.
**SWISH—CLANG—CLANK**
Austin struggled to keep up. His blade deflected the knight's attacks just enough to avoid fatal damage, but not enough to retaliate. The knight's superior strength was evident—every exchange forced Austin to retreat, barely able to catch his breath before another attack came barreling his way.
Suddenly—
*SLASH*
A shallow cut opened on Austin's side as he failed to evade in time. Blood seeped through his torn shirt, but he clenched his jaw, ignoring the pain.
The knight capitalized on the opening.
**WHOOSH—BOOM**
Austin barely twisted his body, narrowly avoiding a downward strike that shattered the ground where he once stood.
'Shit, he's too strong...' Austin gritted his teeth. Every attack was relentless, calculated, and designed to crush him.
But—
He was getting faster.
His arms no longer trembled as much with each clash. His feet found more stability on the shattered ground. His parries became cleaner, his counters more precise.
The knight swung diagonally—a perfect execution.
Austin didn't block.
Instead, he sidestepped—his body moving on instinct like he had fought this battle before.
The blade narrowly missed his chest.
Austin twisted the blade in hand.
*CLANG*
The armor of the Commander trembled as Austin's Shard made contact.
For the first time, Austin's attack connected.
The knight flinched.
Austin's eyes sharpened.
He was adapting.
His mind pieced together the knight's attack pattern, its timing, its habits. The wide swings, the brief pause before a powerful downward slash—it was all becoming clearer.
The next exchange was no longer a desperate survival.
The knight slashed—Austin dodged.
The knight stabbed—Austin parried.
The knight swung low—Austin leaped.
The more they fought, the more Austin dictated the rhythm.
The Commander, once an unstoppable force, now finds itself unable to overwhelm its opponent.
Austin's expression shifted.
This wasn't just a battle anymore. This was a hunt.
The Commander was forced back on its feet as it restlessly swung its blade, but Austin masterfully parried and countered with a strong slash.
The armor of the knight was starting to crack from several spots, and the Commander was being pushed back.
*SLASH*
In desperation to make some space, the Commander swung its sword in a horizontal slash; however, Austin had enough time to duck under the attack and punch the Commander with every the strength deriving from each fibre of his body.
"*KHWNG*" Red Wing staggered back, tattered and wounded.
Austin's blood had long dried as he watched the Commander in pity, "What are you going to do now?"
While clutching its wounded stomach, the Commander, in desperation, activated its skill,
*SHLINK*
Its eyes began to glow and Austin felt his body turning heavy instantly.
The Commander grinned, clutching its sword and ready to end the battle with one final swing.
However, suddenly,
*SHLINK*
A heavy invisible force descended upon the Commander. Its eyes widened as it turned to look at Austin...or to be more precise, in his glowing blue eyes.
[Ding!]
[Skill Adapt in use!]
[The Opponent's stats would be lowered significantly!]
Austin grinned, "Guess your last option is also devoured."
---------**--------
A/N:- Took me properly an hour and half to write this. I hope you all enjoyed reading the fighting scene. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 78: Chapter 77- The obstacle
chapters.content:
Chapter 78: Chapter 77- The obstacle
[Combat: 38/100]
{Next reward at 40}
[Romance: 42/100]
{Next reward at 60}
[Durability: 50/100]
{Next reward at 60}
[Trickery: 21/100]
{Next reward at 35}
[Overall Progression: 40.5/100]
[Next Reward at 50]
…
Austin was back in his room. Through his blurry gaze, he saw his stats and felt a smile stretching his lips.
He…finally defeated that armored bastard. It was difficult, painful, and life-threatening, but he was able to flip the table and, in the end, dominate the field.
"Fuck…my bones are still shaky…" He knew it was just his shaken mental state influencing him, but he couldn't do anything about it.
His clothes were all clean, and his wounds had disappeared. However, if he were to be told to fight even an E-rank, he might pass out just by a single attack.
'System…how many points?'
[Ding!]
[You have gained 250 points!]
[Points: 520]
Austin's lips stretched into a grin, this was sweet.
He looked outside and found it had already turned dark. Although he was hungry, nothing could move him as of now.
As such, closing his eyes, Austin fell asleep.
—--------**-----------
*SHLINK*
*CRACK*
Rhea stood behind the training doll, her Shard glowing with raw energy and her chest heaving in labored breathing.
However, the most noticeable thing about the situation was that the training doll was cleaved in perfect two—something that took her seventeen attempts to achieve.
A sense of pride and excitement bloomed in her chest as she looked at the fallen piece of doll.
Rhea roamed her eyes to see if someone else also saw the achievement…however, there was none,
"Well, not like I was doing it to impress someone." Rhea allowed her Shard to disintegrate as she began walking to her dorm.
Thanks to Valerie's advice, upon Austin's insistence, she was able to realize the most basic yet severe problem with her spell casting.
Her emotions.
Rhea always has been an emotional girl who couldn't hide her sentiments well, and definitely not control them as well.
An example of such was that incident when Valerie snapped her sword in two, because of Rhea's outburst.
Recalling that incident with the Illusion Monkey, Rhea couldn't help but shudder.
That day…Valerie could have easily killed her if she wanted to.
*Click*
Entering her dorm room, she decided to take a bath first.
After sweating for so long she was feeling all sticky.
So after letting go of her training uniform, the girl dipped into the water.
"Haah~feels so good." A smile blossomed on her face as she felt her sore muscles receiving some much-needed relaxation.
Opening her eyes, Rhea's eyes traveled towards her collarbone….there were several marks and cuts that flawed her skin.
As a girl, she had always been a little hesitant about the scars since other girls always applied potions or got themselves treated when they received a wound, resulting in no permanent scar at all.
However, Rhea never had the privilege so numerous marks tainted her body.
The only person who had seen her body beneath her neck was Parkinson.
She was once trying on a low-cut dress for the farewell celebration of the third year….however, she didn't take many steps out of the dorm before changing her mind.
The shallow marks on her body made her look ugly in her opinion that's why she planned on changing…only for Parkinson appear out of nowhere and say something that changed her mind,
'Those marks aren't scars but the medals of your bravery. And my dear Rhea, you don't hide your medals right?'
Although she never reached the venue since a fight broke out and the ceremony was canceled, she lost her hesitation that day.
At that time…everything was fine.
She deemed Parkinson as her good friend. He always appeared whenever she felt lonely or disoriented. He always said the thing which she desired to hear the most at that moment.
But…now she realized that his intentions towards her were never revolving around friendship.
Clenching her fist, she muttered under her breath, "I wish we never meet again, Park."
—--------**----------
"So, are you prepared, my son?" Zurkis asked with a wide grin on his face and his eyes turned crescent.
He was holding a goblet of wine as he sat on the dining table with his wife and son to enjoy the celebratory feast.
"Yeah, kinda," Parkinson spoke as he slowly ate the meat with all the elegance.
His mother, Shafina El Hener, looked at her son and spoke with her eyes narrowed, "That get-up has ruined your looks. I am displeased."
The lady has long, flowing, pale purple hair and sharp green eyes. A mole under her left eye added charm to her looks. And top of it, a figure that could make a man drool.
Being such a beauty, she always cared about her son's looks and aesthetics. That's why this disguise made her feel unpleasant.
"You haven't pursued someone in life, that's why you won't know," Parkinson replied.
Shafina chuckled, "I had men running behind me all their lives, but I only chose the wealthiest one. It's all come to whom you find most advantageous to you, in life."
Parkinson rolled his eyes, "Calling yourself a gold-digger is wild."
Shafina giggled as she held her husband's hand and added, "I did fall for this man later, but initially, it was all about his worth."
Zurkis kissed the back of her hand to show his affection for the woman he had ever allowed himself to love.
With her eyes turning serious, she looked at her son, and told him, "That's why, Son, you need to think first—is this girl really worth your attention-"
*CLANG*
Parkinson broke the plate in two with the fork as he stared at his mother dead in the eye.
"Rhea isn't a thing, whose worth I will evaluate. Even if she had been crippled and the ugliest girl in the world, I still would have chosen her."
Saying so, Parkinson got up from the table and walked away.
Zurkis heaved a sigh, "Dear, I told you to not talk about that girl."
Shafina casually stabbed her fork into the small tomato and said, "I just wanted to see how mad he is for that girl."
With her eyes holding a subtle killing intent, she added, "And now that I have seen how far he can go for her, as his mother, it's my duty to not let anyone come between them."
Zurkis raised his brows, "Have you thought of something?"
Shafina grinned, "This brat, Austin, who framed our son…do you think I will let him off the hook so easily?"
The woman suddenly took out a folded parchment with the official stamp of El Hener present on it.
Zurkis frowned before taking the parchment from the woman as he heard her saying,
"We will offer Eryndor a helping hand during this time of crisis. We will provide military supplies at lower rates because this is an emergency situation. And more so, we can even provide the high-grade potions which are Hener's specialty."
With a malicious grin extending her lips, she added, "And in exchange, they only exile a certain Prince."
------**------
*Knock*
Sebastian frowned. This was the second time he knocked but his master hadn't responded yet.
*Knock*
A third time. Even if he had been in the bathroom he would have called out to wait.
Using his authority as his guardian, he unlocked the door and walked inside, "Young Master-"
However, the sight awaiting inside completely baffled Sebastian.
"U-Umm…" Valerie's face couldn't have been any more redder as she remained tightly encaged in her Lord's arms.
….
To explain the situation, let's go back three hours in time,
Valerie had an appointment with her Lord at the training ground to do some final touch-ups and discuss their plans.
She was waiting for him until half past the designated time, yet he didn't arrive.
It was uncommon for Austin to arrive late, which made Valerie worried.
Several thoughts began disturbing her, and in the end, she ended up sneaking inside his room.
"Hmm?" However, she was surprised to find that he was doing the most obvious thing that made him late.
Sleeping.
His peacefully sleeping face was quite calming and fascinating.
During the battle, he always makes such an intense face that leaves Valerie all hot and bothered. She always feels that if he ever commands her to even jump into a river with that expression, she would obediently do so.
And when he is with her, that warm smile never leaves his face. That expression gives her a very fuzzy feeling and wants to make her cherish the moment.
"Hmm?" Without noticing she was a lot closer to his face than a maiden should be.
Her face began to get hot by his breath as she gazed at those thin lips. That reminded her of that kiss she shared with him for the first time.
That was her first kiss. And she will always remember it since, as going against her manners, she kissed her Lord on her initiative.
Slowly bringing her fingers toward his lips, she wanted to touch them, when suddenly,
*Clench*
Even while soundly asleep, Austin grabbed her hand and under Valerie's widened gaze, she was pulled to the bed.
"You aren't escaping…until…I am satisfied…"
As such, as a dutiful wife, she didn't try to escape.
…
And now,
"Fufu~sorry for this old one to disturb the two love birds." Sebastian chuckled before he gave a slight bow and walked out of the room.
Valerie was on the verge of dying of embarrassment!
"Mm…don't go…"
…or maybe, she will live, thanks to her Lord.
—--------**------------
A/N:- Valerie is just a floofy plush for Austin. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 79: Chapter 78- Switch sides
chapters.content:
Chapter 79: Chapter 78- Switch sides
"I....apologize. I was too tired and sleepy to notice." It was rare for Austin to appear so apologetic. However, today, his action was quite bothersome.
He returned all tired last night and fell asleep, and when in the morning, Valerie came to get him for training, he didn't get up and even pulled Valerie to sleep beside him.
"No, no...you don't need to...I-I don't mind..." Valerie assured him that it was okay since she didn't like how her Lord was feeling bad for hugging her in his sleep.
Well, it was true that she wasn't able to calm her heart even for a moment in those hours, but she never felt displeasure from his embrace.
If anything, she wanted to remain always there...
Austin heaved a sigh, as he slowly sliced the pancake and told her, "I have a very bad habit of clinging to something in my sleep, so if it happens in the future, please wake me up."
Valerie's cheeks were tainted with some redness as she nodded....however, truth be told, she wasn't ever going to wake him up if he ended up embracing her like that again.
The atmosphere between them finally returned to normal once Austin gained her forgiveness. He really needs to do something about his habits.
The classes were suspended today, all the students have already gathered in the training hall, which explains why the common hall was so empty.
Austin went to ask for his match, and it turned out that it was scheduled for the evening. Valerie's match would be in the afternoon.
"Are you prepared?" Valerie asked as she scooped some cereal and brought them to her lips.
Austin exhaled a sigh, "I think I am prepared but let's see what opponent I get to face." Austin wasn't sure where he stands right now. His skills have developed and more than anything, his senses have sharpened.
Now, whether these things would help him win the match or not was another matter.
During the selection match, he wouldn't be able to use his 'Absolute Barrier' given the thirty hours haven't elapsed since he last used it. And second, he couldn't just out of nowhere use a skill.
Surely, he could use WhisperWing, but the Stopwatch was out of the question, given he wouldn't be able to recharge it for a month. And Austin has a more significant requirement for that Stopwatch.
While eating, Austin suddenly realized that his left hand was still quite shaky after the battle against the Commander. Just a single intense life-threatening battle Austin has gone through, and he was so shaken up.
Looking up at Valerie, he couldn't help but ask, "How did you do it?"
Valerie blinked in confusion before asking, "I don't understand?"
Austin, with a smile, asked her, "To become this strong...you surely must have gone through several difficult trials. How did you manage everything?"
Valerie was slightly taken aback by the sudden interest in her days of struggle.
She looked at the sincere admiration in his eyes and felt her heart accelerating.
"I...don't know if I should be receiving such high praises from you-"
"Of course, you should. It wasn't like you awakened the Third Evolution just by sitting at home and doing nothing. I have seen how hard you used to work in the past that made you what you are right now."
With her eyes drawn to the table, Valerie slowly muttered, "....and that hard work created distance between us."
Valerie said that, but instantly regretted it. With her eyes widened, she looked up at Austin and shook her head, "No, I don't mean-"
"It's okay, Val." Austin held her hand, and assured her, "I understand what you meant."
Exhaling a breath that contained both frustration and weariness, he said, "I was....jealous of seeing you achieve what I could never."
"But it's not true. I can see that you are progressing now, and in no time you will go through an Evolution." Valerie added, and she was not saying sweet words just because of her feelings for him.
She has seen him going through phases in his life—from summoning his Shard to coming this far, he has suffered a lot and worked harder than anyone else.
Austin smiled at her, feeling his shoulders, which were stiff because of nervousness, finally relaxing when her familiar warmth seeped through his skin and touched his heart.
However, soon he was distracted as Austin caught the sight of a familiar man who did his best to hide himself but failed to do so. Considering Valerie didn't react it was obvious that she didn't notice him, but Austin did.
"Val, go ahead and keep a seat for me in the stands. I have some work to finish." Austin said as he got up from the seat.
°°°°°°
Morkel didn't know why he escaped the common hall when he went there just to buy a sandwich.
'Maybe it's the side effect of spying so regularly on him...' Morkel was given the task of keeping an eye on Austin and because of that, he eventually got a habit of hiding whenever his eyes landed on the blond Prince.
Sometimes Morkel felt, 'What the hell am I doing...?' but then when he remembered what was at stake, he couldn't stop himself.
"Yo, Professor." Suddenly, a voice rang from behind which was familiar.
Morkel narrowed his eyes and turned around, "Austin." He called out.
The blond Prince was resting his back against the wall with his hands folded as he called out, "I was wondering if you could spare some time for me. If only your Lord allows you, that is."
Morkel narrowed his eyes, "I serve no one."
Austin, with a smile never fading from his face, inches closer to the man, before whispering, "Then are spying over me for no good reason? I doubt that."
"Who said I was spying? Are you putting allegations on your teacher?"
Austin looked amazed, "Still going to put on an act? What exactly did Aiden promise you? A well-paid job for Rhea? Or a promotion for you?" With a grin extending his lips, Austin faintly whispered, "Or did he promise to find out who killed her parents?"
Morkel's eyes widened in shock as he stared at the younger one in disbelief.
That reaction alone was enough to confirm that Aiden had indeed promised Morkel the names of those responsible for Rhea's parents' deaths.
Austin heaved a sigh, "You are so naive, Morkel, to trust a man who was an orphan until a few years ago. Do you think he really knows something so insignificant like an ambush in a small village like Cadstead?"
Morkel was further delivered with another shocking blow, "You know about her hometown?" Morkel believed that it was only he who knew from where Rhea originally belonged.
Austin shrugged, "Not a big issue for me, who has spent years in the council, remained involved with the Ministers, and is served by the man who once served the King."
Morkel narrowed his eyes and was forced to contemplate the credibility of the matter.
Naturally, there was no record of the ambush in Rhea's hometown. All the information Austin had comes from his last life.
Morkel remained silent, and that allowed Austin to add, "I can give you the names and the details. Just switch your loyalty."
Morkel snapped out of his reverie before he looked at Austin in suspicion, "Why would you share that information with me rather than tell it directly to Rhea?"
Austin chuckled, "Do you still think I am after Rhea? Can't you see I have already moved on by realizing my mistake?"
Morkel frowned, "But...I heard it's all just an act?"
"Heard from whom? Aiden, right?" Austin heaved a weary sigh, "Look Morkel, you are being fooled by him. Aiden won't give a single crap even if you die today or something happens to Rhea. All he desires is the throne."
There was a reason why Austin was going above and beyond to bring Morkel to his side—it's the man's usefulness in the long race.
He has a great mind, a great talent, and is easy to manipulate since his weak nerve is in Austin's hold.
Unlike Parkinson, who can use extreme methods to get rid of people who annoy him or try to harm Rhea, Morkel is much more tamer.
A long silence descended between them before finally Morkel responded,
"Give me some time to think."
Austin nodded, "Okay, take your time...but I need a response by the evening."
Saying so, the blond one walked away.
Even if Morkel ends up revealing everything to Aiden, Austin wouldn't receive any damage from it. He was not going to pretend to be all friendly with Aiden, and the information from Morkel wouldn't do a shit to Austin's reputation since, in the Capital, Austin doesn't hold much importance.
'If he accepts, he stays in the game, and if he doesn't...then Rhea, sorry for your loss.'
----------**----------
A/N:- Thanks for reading and showing all the love. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 80: Chapter 79- The perfect plan
chapters.content:
Chapter 80: Chapter 79- The perfect plan
"Is everything good?" Valerie asked as Austin approached her in the stands.
The blond Prince nodded, "Yes, everything is fine."
The audience at the indoor training hall was just purely astonishing.
All the students arrived to witness the contest between the students who once trained and learned together but now were competing to get a spot in the tournament.
"They are giving it their all," Austin commented as he watched the combat between the two participants who were battered and bruised yet not yielding at all.
Not only the two but the three other arenas had the same view—the participants were going beyond their limits to defeat their opponents.
"It can be their chance of a lifetime...especially for the third-year students," Valerie added as she remained sitting with a graceful posture and watched the matches with not much interest.
"...is it really necessary to drag the match...." She couldn't help but wonder
In one of the four arenas, there was a third-year student who was definitely strong enough to defeat his opponent in a few attacks. Valerie had fought him and his opponent in the past so she knows. However, even that person just keeps dragging on the battle rather than ending it right away.
Austin scanned the stands until his eyes settled on a particular bracket—a glass-paneled section where two formally dressed individuals sat. With notepads in hand, they watched the matches intently, analyzing every move.
"They are dragging it because of them," While pointing out at the two individuals, far away from them, Austin spoke.
Valerie's brows tensed, "That means...I also have to..."
Austin nodded, "Yeah...just don't one-shot your opponent and let them use a few tricks as well."
Valerie felt a headache approaching. This was pure stupid. In a real battle, she wouldn't need to wait to see what her opponent could do. Plunging her spear in their chest and butchering them has always been the best option.
'Feels more like a stage play than a battle....'
Regardless of her inner monologue, she has no other option but to follow the trend and let her enemy attack her first.
"Don't overthink about it, Val. I know you will do just great." To soothe her disturbed mind, Austin placed his hand on hers and smiled at the girl fondly.
All the building stress melted in an instant under his warm gaze, as she nodded in assent, "If you say so..."
....
Soon, Valerie got up and said, "I need to report to the preparation room."
It was quite peaceful here up in the stands, away from other students and sitting with their hands connected. It felt like they had built a small world out of the chaos, and Valerie was alone with her Lord in that world.
However, unfortunately, she has to go now since her battle is about to start.
"Good luck, Val. I will be cheering for you." Austin got up and kissed her forehead before whispering, "Don't get hurt."
An irresistible smile bloomed on her face as she whispered, "Understood."
....
As Valerie left, Austin sat alone in the back with his feet resting over the seat in front.
"System, I have gathered points to unlock the shop, right? What exactly can I get in the shop?"
[Unfortunately, host, unless you unlock it, the System couldn't provide any information about the Shop.]
Austin heaved a weary sigh, this system was unnecessarily secretive sometimes.
He was not unlocking the shop because he didn't know what kind of enemy he would be facing during the tournament. Then there was the trip to the Capital as well. And on top of it, to summon another Dungeon he needs points. So unlocking Shop right now was nearly impossible.
'I need to be patient-'
"KYAAAAAAH! ITS LADY VALERIE!"
"SHE FINALLY JOINED THE BATTLE!"
"YEAAAAAAAHHHHHHH!"
"How majestic!"
"She looks like a domineering queen!"
"Wooof...wooof..."
"She is finally here!!"
The booming voice of the audience broke his train of thoughts, as Austin saw his girl walking towards the arena.
'Despite being a Villainess, she has gained quite a fan following...' Especially after the Demon incident when she bravely stabbed the inhumane, people started hailing her as a War Goddess, Ice Princess, or whatnot.
Austin sighed in admiration to see that serious eye and cold look.
The expression she wore in the morning when he got up and found her in his arms was in completely stark contrast.
The flustered Valerie is cute and innocent, which makes him want to corrupt her. And the version of Valerie, who steps into battlefield—cold and calculating—makes him admire her.
....
Valerie wasn't bothered by all the noise even though, at the moment most of the students were looking at her and cheering for her.
She simply stepped onto the arena and looked at her opponent.
It was a third-year student, who was also the Captain of the most successful raid team of the school—Ryan Grimshaw. He was possibly the strongest student from the third year and seemed rather confident in his skills by that smirk on his face.
"Any other person from the second year, I would have felt disappointed. But with you, I feel honored." The black-haired man gave a slight bow to the lady.
Valerie remained silent and waited for the match referee to step inside.
Valerie's eyes traveled towards the bracket where the two judges from the Council sat. She knew that they had a keen interest in her and were looking for an excuse to recruit her.
Following the Headmaster's advice she couldn't use her Disaster-ranked spell under any circumstances. But to be chosen as an Elite in the tournament she has to give it her all as well...
Quite a dilemma.
"Participants, ready?" The referee stood in the middle of the arena, before asking.
Ryan summoned his battle axe and nodded, "Ready."
The air around Valerie turned cold, as she called out, "Shiverfall." The majestic spear appeared in her hand which she held behind her back.
Taking the battle stance, Valerie nodded, "Ready."
The referee looked between the two participants once, before announcing,
"Begin!!"
----------**---------
"Fuck!" *CLANG*
The vase was thrown to the ground, shattering into pieces as Aiden cursed aloud.
*STOMP* *STOMP*
Everything was going against the plan. He failed to change Duke Corwon's mind, the plan to send students to the battlefield was rejected, and that damn dog has stopped eating food made in the kitchen!
**DHAKK**
Dropping the heavy sculpture, he cursed even louder.
'I was this close to gaining control over the throne...' Aiden didn't plan on murdering the King but rather weakening him, so he gets left with no option other than allowing Aiden to take charge.
Aiden could have easily gained a favorable impression on the council members, and once his position had become prominent in the kingdom, he would have slaughtered the King with his own hands.
But, no! The bastard has changed his diet and now only eats what his butler makes for him!
Aiden could never try to bribe the butler or he would be dead for sure. After all, that bastard is Sebastian's brother. And loyalty flows in the blood of that family.
"I need to change my plans...that pipsqueak is also about to visit the Capital..." In Aiden's eyes, Austin was a threat that he could not ignore.
Not because he was the second Prince, no, no, no. Austin doesn't hold any authority as a Prince at all. Rather, it was his fiancée who could make a big difference.
As the daughter of Lord Corwon and also, as an S-rank warrior, her authority becomes prominent in Eryndor.
Aiden was aware of the Council's interest in her ..what if, in exchange for her loyalty, she asked for Austin's nomination for the throne?
That weak-ass king named Cedric would immediately jump on the option since gaining support from the Council was the best option for him under these circumstances.
"No...I can't let this happen. I need to send someone and assassinate that worthless trash...once he gets out of the way, I will simply conquer his woman, and Cedric will be left with no option but to hand over the throne to me."
It was risky and difficult to assassinate Austin because of the butler serving him. However, Aiden couldn't think of any other way to gain control over the Kingdom.
*Knock*
"Master Aiden." Hearing the voice of the maid, Aiden spoke, "Not now, Caroline. I am busy."
"But my Lord, it's important." The maid added, making Aiden frown.
Is the stupid bi*ch tired of living?
Aiden approached the door before revealing himself to the black-haired maid, "What is it?"
The maid informed, "A formal letter has arrived from Hener. It seems they have extended an offer."
Aiden narrowed his eyes; didn't they pull their hands away from this matter?
Then why so suddenly...?
'Interesting,' Stepping out of his room, he commanded, "Tell someone to clean the room."
Caroline nodded before she opened the door and felt a chill running down her spine.
Beneath all the broken mess, she could see the dead body of the newly assigned cook, lying in his puddle of blood.
'Poor soul...'
--------**--------
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 81: Chapter 80- Defeat of the Undedeatable
chapters.content:
Chapter 81: Chapter 80- Defeat of the Undedeatable
The training hall was engulfed in deep silence.
Austin's eyes widened in shock, his mouth slightly agape.
Everything came to a standstill the moment Valerie hit the ground, her spear flung out of the arena.
It felt like a dream—because something this unimaginable could only happen in a dream.
But this was reality.
And in this reality, Valerie—the undefeated warrior—had fallen after receiving just a single strike from her opponent.
The entire audience held their breath, watching in sheer astonishment.
Valerie had started the match with her natural flow, her movements swift and relentless, pushing Ryan into a corner. Her attacks left him barely any room to breathe, and it seemed as though the match was already decided.
Yet, showing the experience as a third year, Ryan somehow managed to maintain a steady pace, preventing himself from getting overwhelmed.
And then, it happened.
With a sudden burst of movement, Ryan launched a surprise attack. His blade cut through Valerie's defenses, leaving a deep gash on her left arm. The sharp edge of his strike even tore her shirt slightly.
But the most shocking part wasn't the wound—it was Valerie's reaction.
Instead of retaliating, she collapsed.
"Huh?" A labored breath escaped her lips as she stared at her opponent's feet, her body completely unresponsive.
Ryan exhaled sharply and took a step forward. "Sorry, Valerie. I can't take any chances, so I'm using my Shard's ability from the start."
His Shard, Death Fang, had a simple yet terrifying effect—it paralyzed an opponent for several minutes upon tasting their blood.
Ryan had never used this ability against fellow students before. He had always relied on his skill, never on his Shard's full potential. But this time, he had no choice. If he wanted to secure a spot in the upcoming tournament, he had to defeat the best. And to defeat the best, he had to use everything at his disposal.
Valerie clenched her teeth and tried to move. Her fingers trembled as she pressed her hands against the mat, desperately trying to push herself up.
But it was futile.
Her body refused to obey.
Despite the storm brewing in her mind, she couldn't even lift a finger.
Austin, watching from the stands, clenched his fists. His body tensed as he watched Ryan approach Valerie. He shifted in his seat, torn between wanting to jump in and help her (which was, of course, against the rules) and trusting her to find a way out.
The audience was in disbelief.
An S-rank warrior, someone considered nearly unbeatable, had been brought to her knees by someone of a lower rank.
It was like watching a towering mountain crumble from a single, well-placed strike.
Ryan finally reached Valerie. He bent down slightly, intending to lift her off the ground to secure his victory.
However, the moment his fingers brushed against her hair—
**CRACK**
The ground beneath the mats fractured as an overwhelming aura erupted from Valerie's body.
A violent silver storm of energy swirled around her, howling like a raging tempest. The sheer force of her aura made Ryan stumble backward, his arms raised to shield his eyes from the intensity.
But he gritted his teeth and forced himself to move forward.
"Now or never!" he roared, determined to end this battle before she could recover.
With a fierce battle cry, Ryan raised his foot, aiming to kick Valerie out of the arena.
Just as his foot swung forward—
*CLANG*
A silver spear materialized before him, stopping him just in time. Had he not halted, his foot would have been impaled.
Gasps echoed throughout the training hall.
Controlling one's Shard without even being able to move? That level of mastery was unheard of!
In the stands, Rhea stared in disbelief.
She could barely keep her sword floating for thirty seconds using mental control alone, yet Valerie—
"Shit… such precise control over your Shard?!" Ryan growled, but a smirk stretched across his lips, excitement flaring in his eyes.
He gripped his battle axe tightly and lunged toward Valerie. His opponent was still paralyzed—he just needed to finish the fight.
Feigning left to avoid the spear, Ryan suddenly twisted right before ducking low.
However—
**CRACK**
"Ghuaagh!!"
A tremendous force slammed into him, and his bones cracked under the weight of the augmented Shard. Ryan crashed to the ground, groaning in pain.
The audience erupted in cheers, though some winced at the sickening sound of the impact.
Austin just stood there, in the back, marveling at the sight of a true genius showing how a Shard is actually a part of one's being.
'She is the true definition of what happens when talent meets hard work.'
In the arena, Valerie, barely able to move her eyes, commanded her spear, Shiverfall, to retreat.
She needed to finish this.
Her Shard shot forward once more, aiming straight for Ryan's shoulder. If she could wound him beyond resistance, the match would be over.
But she underestimated him.
*CLANG*
Ryan, without even turning, parried the strike before launching himself back to his feet, still blocking the spear.
"That's one tough Shard," he muttered, flinging Shiverfall aside.
Then, gripping his battle axe tightly, he activated his own augmentation.
The weapon's size doubled, its sharp edges gleaming menacingly. Coupled with weight amplification, the axe now looked more like an executioner's blade.
"But it's not just you who has tricks."
Ryan charged at Valerie once again, this time fully prepared.
*CLANG*
As Shiverfall aimed for his head, Ryan swatted it away with the blunt end of his axe.
'He tracked it?!'
The realization struck Valerie with the same force as the kick that came straight from her stomach.
**DHAK**
A loud impact resonated as she was sent flying.
The audience collectively held their breath as Valerie slid across the mat, heading straight toward the boundary. If she crossed it, the match was over.
For two agonizing seconds, everyone watched, waiting for the inevitable.
Then—
*Ting*
Her body stopped.
A single strand of her hair hovered just above the borderline.
The referee immediately raised a hand. "Safe! Continue!"
Ryan's eyes widened.
He knew he had kicked her with enough force to knock her out of the arena. So then… how?
He didn't have time to think.
"Forget it," he muttered, tightening his grip. He rushed forward to end the match once and for all.
But suddenly—
**SQUELCH**
Pain exploded in his shoulder.
His eyes darted down. Shiverfall had impaled him from behind, its icy edge stabbing into the mat and locking him in place.
Frost rapidly spread over his body as he struggled against the freezing pain.
"Aaah!" Ryan howled, trying to pull the spear out.
Then—
"You won't need to do that."
A cold voice sent a chill down his spine.
Slowly, he lifted his head and found Valerie staring straight into his eyes.
The intent she possessed sent a chill down his spine as Ryan turned motionless instantly.
Then, just as she lifted her hand, preparing to push herself off the ground—
"I surrender."
Ryan's voice echoed through the hall.
Silence followed.
Then, the entire training hall exploded into an uproar.
A battle filled with twists and unexpected turns had reached its conclusion.
And in the end, the victory belonged to the one who was expected to win.
-------**-------
A/N:- Thanks for reading. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 82: Chapter 81- Disappointed?
chapters.content:
Chapter 82: Chapter 81- Disappointed?
Ryan Grimshaw is a boy born at a noble house but someone who was raised by a hunter after the age of six and was taught everything about a very basic yet necessary concept.
Survival.
Being pushed into the wilderness at such a young age taught him several things, but the most important part he learned from those days was how to exploit even the slightest opportunity at a disadvantageous position.
The moment he knew who his opponent was, Ryan knew he wouldn't be able to win against her through normal means. And the way she began her onslaught, made it obvious that unless he exploited the only ace up his sleeve, he wouldn't be able to win.
As such, he went for the win and paralyzed the girl.
However...maybe he underestimated the S-rank warrior a little, and in the end, he was labeled as the loser—just as everyone expected.
"Don't make that face, son. You did great." The instructor of the third year was present in the infirmary as he saw Ryan getting treated by the nurse.
Once the nurse was done patching him up and left, the raven-haired heaved a sigh before saying, "I disappointed you and my team, sir. I should have done better."
The lanky instructor shook his head, "You already did your best. I couldn't have thought of anyone else other than you, pushing Valerie to the verge of defeat."
Those compliments made him feel better, but it would have sounded even better if he had won.
"Fuu~okay, since praising you didn't work, let me give you some news to cheer you up."
Ryan raised his brows and looked at the older one, "What news."
The instructor, with a grin, extended the information he was forbidden to reveal, "It seems they have selected you for the tournament."
Ryan's eyes widened, "Really?!"
The man pressed his finger against his lips before shaking his head, "Nothing is one hundred percent but I have heard from the Headmaster about the selection committee's decision."
Ryan felt his wounds no longer hurting as much as he looked at the man with his eyes burning a little.
'I did it, Master...'
---------**---------
"Are you okay, now?" Austin asked as he helped Valerie sit on the bed.
They were also in the infirmary but in a different room.
Valerie was given a medicine that would help her recover. She didn't receive any severe wounds except for the muscle pain in her stomach.
The nurse said that she would probably recover by tomorrow.
"I feel fine..." Valerie assured him, "It doesn't hurt that much."
Austin helped her drink some water, before asking, "Do you still feel the effect of the Shard?"
Valerie shook her head, "No, it disappeared back in the arena. I can move myself fine now." To make her believe in him, she even moved her arms in a circular motion.
Seeing him getting worried for her, was making her both happy and sad.
However, she didn't express her feelings and used her time to assure him as much as she could.
After a bit of pause, Valerie slowly asked, "Were you...disappointed...seeing me lose?"
It was the first time for her to struggle in a battle after a long time. And in front of Austin, it might be the first time after she awakened her Shard.
Seeing his pride and confidence in her skills, made her feel that he might be disappointed to see her struggling against someone who was a rank lower than her.
However, "We all are warriors, Valerie. No one came here to lose, so naturally, everyone would use any means to win this. And under such circumstances, it is natural for even those to fall, whom people believed to be the undefeatable."
Cupping her cheeks, he said, "It's not just about meeting expectations, it's about giving it your all. And today, you showed strong reluctance to lose, and that makes me proud of you."
Austin didn't use flattering words nor did he add anything that he didn't mean.
It was a bit shocking to see Valerie fall into a battle since he didn't know Ryan's Shard ability, but that doesn't mean he was disappointed in her.
Yes, if she had just accepted her defeat right there and then after falling, then Austin might have felt dissatisfied with her performance. And as her lover and friend, he would have told her right away.
Valerie lowered her gaze, before uttering, "I want to confess something..."
Austin raised his brows before removing his hands from her face, "What is it?" The way she just said that he knew it was something serious.
Valerie bit her lips and hesitated for a moment...however, she knew that if she hid it, she wouldn't be able to look at herself in the mirror.
"...just when I was about to slide out of the arena...something stopped me from behind...it was an invisible force and remained just for a moment, which I capitalized and attacked Ryan."
Valerie was ashamed of herself for claiming victory when she received help from something unexpected. And the person in front of whom she confessed her sin was the only person whose judgment she could accept.
Austin heaved a long sigh before he looked at the system screen,
[Absolute Barrier timer: 28h 37 min]
...at that time, he subconsciously used the Absolute Barrier to stop Valerie from getting eliminated from the battle.
He was torn between the thought of whether to tell her or not when suddenly,
"Austin, your match is up." Rhea entered the infirmary and informed him.
Austin exhaled an audible breath before getting up.
Turning his eyes back to Valerie, he asked, "Want to come and see me win?"
Valerie smiled fondly at him before nodding and holding his hand.
Rhea suddenly asked, "Is it really okay to bring her?"
Austin nodded, "Yeah, it's fine. After all, I can't miss this opportunity to impress my lady." Austin had a teasing grin on his face as he squeezed her hand and pulled her closer.
Valerie blushed upon hearing those words, as she looked at him shyly.
"...it's a crime to be around you guys...." Rhea sighed.
--------**--------
Morkel was in his office room, currently reading a letter last sent by Aiden.
Recalling back on his conversation with the First Prince, Morkel felt quite disturbed about something.
"You 'need' to remove Austin otherwise, he would never let you become one with Rhea," Aiden spoke those words with utmost conviction.
"He is just 'pretending to be with Valerie,' but in fact, he is still 'after Rhea'."
Those words just etched in his head, and Morkel became sure that Austin was indeed putting up an act so that he could pursue Rhea in secret.
"You think about it yourself...how, out of nowhere, my brother became so close to the girl whom he hated for this long?"
Aiden gave him a reason not to trust Austin and believe what Aiden was suggesting.
"Then what should I do?" Morkel asked; a bit unsure whether to directly come in the way of the Second Prince.
At that moment, Aiden rested his hand on Morkel's shoulder and told him, "You just need to keep a watch on Austin and report everything about him to me. Once I get the whole idea of what he is up to, it wouldn't be much of a problem to let father know."
Morkel raised a questioning brow at that time, "And what if...he really is not pretending?"
Aiden never let go of that smile from his face..but in that moment, that smile looked a little strained, as he repeated, "'Austin is evil' and 'he will snatch your Rhea if you don't do anything'."
That was the last conversation Morkel had with Aiden. And after that, the Professor began exchanging letters with him, sharing Austin's activities in the academy. The recent news of Austin being involved with the demons and his constant training with Sebastian and Valerie.
And then the meeting with the Headmaster followed by rescheduling his and Valerie's match to the first day.
Morkel did as Aiden asked him to...however, in a corner of his mind Morkel always felt that Austin's movements were not towards Rhea. He doesn't even care about what she feels.
True, there was friendship between them; proof was when Austin asked Valerie to help Rhea with her spell activation.
When Austin recently made contact with Morkel, revealing his intention and his knowledge about Aiden's scheme, Morkel felt that he might have missed the mark completely.
'Which Prince should I trust...' Morkel was in a dilemma; however, considering Austin's growing influence on Rhea, he knew that the boy could manipulate her into believing things that weren't even true.
Austin is, unexpectedly, good at manipulation.
The blond Prince knows something that will make Rhea feel indebted and leave a very strong impression.
'The more I think about it, the more I feel Austin is a safer option....'
Now, the question arises: what would he say to Aiden?
'Hmm...a little misinformation wouldn't hurt....'
---------**--------
A/N:- I hope you all liked reading the chapter. Drop a comment and share your thoughts.

chapters.title: Chapter 83: Chapter 82- Brutality
chapters.content:
Chapter 83: Chapter 82- Brutality
Since most of the matches were concluded, the audience had already retired to their rooms. They have already watched some of the exciting battles, and many of the audience have their matches in a few days; that's why more than half of the audience have already vacated the indoor gym.
When Austin entered the resting area, just minutes before his match, he found no one inside.
It was already evening and today's event was about to come to an end. So it was not unnatural.
Sitting on the centric bench he exhaled a long breath.
This...was a serious battle. Unlike the Knight he faced back in the dungeon, here, Austin couldn't go for the kill nor could he retreat. He just needs to either knock out his opponent or throw them out of the arena.
And for that, he would need to give it his all.
He was not going to use his Barrier originally since explaining his sudden awakening would have been a hassle, and now, he doesn't have the option.
He could use his WhisperWing and his Shard, and with the help of those two, he was going to win this battle anyhow.
'Show me my stats ..' Earlier, he received a notification from the system, but Austin was in a panic about bringing Valerie to the infirmary so he didn't pay attention to the notification
[Ding!]
[Combat: 38/100]
{Next reward at 40}
[Romance: 42/100]
{Next reward at 60}
[Durability: 50/100]
{Next reward at 60}
[Trickery: 21->30/100]
{Next reward at 35}
[Overall Progression: 40.5/100]
[Next Reward at 50]
…
Austin's eyes widened, "How did my trickery stat go up so suddenly?" He had no idea.
[Ding!]
[The host tricked everyone by supporting Corwon Valerie using his Absolute Barrier. The number of people who got tricked in that instance resulted in a massive boost.]
"..." He got a reward even though his intentions never were to elevate his stats. It wasn't like he would ever reject free points, but it was a little bizarre how some of the stats work.
'System...if I throw myself down a building, will that increase my endurance stats?'
[Indeed, host!]
"..." Well, he was not a masochist so he would refrain from utilizing such methods.
"Austin, you are up." The instructor informed him before the blond Prince removed his eyes from the system screen and got up.
He had already done his stretching, so he headed directly towards the arena.
The sound of cheering and people muttering completely surrounded him. However, Austin didn't let it overwhelm him; utilizing his experience as a Prince and a rugby player act normal in front of so many eyes.
On the other side of the arena stood a short red-haired girl who had a cocky smile on her face.
'She is a third year .. and unfortunately, I don't know what her Shard could do.'
Her stance signified nonchalance, exposing how relaxed she was about the battle. Well, at least she wasn't as brutal as the people...
"Huh? A D-rank bottom feeder will fight a B-rank?"
"Elara is gonna chew her on the mat!"
"Gotta see some punch bag show."
"Hey, hey! Didn't he defeat a third year recently...."
"Well, screw that! I just wanna see an absolutely intense battle!"
Austin took a deep breath and closed his eyes. He was having some butterfly feeling in his stomach because this was the first official duel he was facing.
"Don't need to prepare. I will end this battle sooner than it takes to tie shoe laces." Elara spoke; confidence dripping from her tone.
Austin didn't respond to her and entered into his battle stance.
He was already carrying Wisp in his hand and summoned his Shard in the other.
The referee stepped forward and asked Elara, "Participant, ready?"
Elara summoned a short kunai in her hand that glowed with a greenish hue before she nodded, "Ready."
'Second-stage....' Considering the details of her Shard, Austin could tell that she was on the second stage of evolution, meaning she could use magic.
"Participant, ready?" The referee asked, and Austin nodded,
"Yes."
Bringing down his raised hand, the referee announced,
"Begin!"
*ZWOOSH*
Both participants shot forward at once, their form turning blurry just the moment it began.
However, much to Elara's panic, the other one reached her even before she could have crossed half-court
"Shit-*clang*!" She had to bring her Shard downward to parry that attack which was aimed at her stomach.
She was pushed back a little despite her momentum, as the girl felt her arms vibrating because of the collision.
Looking up at him, she said with a strained smile, "You are strong."
Austin didn't entertain the idea of a conversation amidst battle and charged in once again.
Elara barely had the time to bring her Shard up so she ducked at the incoming Shard—big mistake.
**CRACK**
Austin knew she would bend low that's why he lifted his knee and drove it into her face, knocking the girl back.
Elara gritted her teeth, twisting in midair. Just before she hit the ground, she flung a kunai—
*SHLINK*
Austin tilted his head, effortlessly dodging it. But that smirk on her face… it set off alarm bells.
*CLICK*
And then—she vanished.
His eyes widened.
**DHAK**
A sharp impact smashed into his skull, forcing him forward. His foot barely stopped short of the borderline.
Elara saw her chance. She lunged, aiming to shove Austin off the stage—but he twisted on his feet with beast-like instincts, catching her by the head and aiming to throw her away.
...but it happened again.
*Click*
Austin's fingers clenched nothing but air as Elara reappeared, standing safely in the middle of the arena, her smirk as sharp as a blade.
"Now that you've seen what my Shard can do… wanna give up?" she teased, tilting her head.
Austin's eyes darkened. Without hesitation, he commanded Wisp to strike from behind.
But—
*SHLINK*
Wisp cut through nothing. Elara had already disappeared, leaving only her Shard floating in her place.
"Tch." Austin clicked his tongue and hurled his Shard behind him on instinct.
Bad move.
**DHAK**
A brutal kick slammed into his ribs from the side. He barely flinched before—
*Click*
She was gone again.
Austin staggered, but his instincts roared—he spun, scanning for her.
Too late.
**DHAK**
A knee crashed into his back, forcing him forward.
*Click*
She vanished again.
**THWACK**
A kick hammered his jaw from below, snapping his head back.
*Click*
Gone.
Austin barely steadied himself before—
**CRACK**
An elbow smashed into his ribs, knocking the air from his lungs. He coughed, but before he could recover—
**DHAK! CRACK! DHAK**
Blow after blow, Elara rained down attacks, appearing and disappearing like a ghost. His body jerked with every hit—his shoulders, his stomach, his legs—each strike carrying raw, ruthless force.
Austin's vision blurred. His stance wavered.
"Phahahah! She is brutaaaaaaal!"
"Damn, bro, she violated him."
"Man, I can never be him."
"Seriously, putting a D-rank against a B-rank? Was the headmaster wanting to enjoy some punchbag session?"
Valerie couldn't think of hearing anything at the moment as she stared at the arena with her hands clasped.
Seeing her Lord getting hurt before her eyes yet not being able to do anything was the worst feeling.
Her heart trembled and her Soul Energy was barely within restraints...as she continuously kept looking at him....
'I know you can do it...please...'
Back in the arena, Elara reappeared—this time for longer than a flicker. With a playful grin, she draped an arm over Austin's shoulder.
"Told ya to retreat. It's impossible to keep track of slippery beauty like me."
Austin didn't respond. His head hung low, shoulders still, but his hand slowly rose—gripping the edge of her hood.
Elara sighed. "So you're still trying to—"
The moment he pulled, she disappeared.
*Click*
She reappeared behind him, eyes narrowing. Now was the time.
Her fist cocked back, aiming straight for the back of his neck. One clean hit and it was over.
'You were a great punching bag, but now it's over—'
**GHAK**
A dull, sickening crack.
Elara's world twisted as Austin's elbow slammed into her gut. Air fled her lungs. A sharp, numbing pain tore through her stomach.
She staggered. Her knees buckled.
Clutching her stomach, she gasped, barely forcing herself upright. "How did you—?!"
But Austin was already moving. He spun, foot rising—
*Click*
Elara vanished again, but this time, she wasn't as quick.
A single heartbeat later—
**BOOOOM**
A sharp, agonized scream tore from her throat.
She hadn't even fully materialized before Austin's fist crashed into her stomach—again, in the exact same spot.
Her body jerked violently. Blood rushed to her head. Her vision swayed.
Austin's face remained cold, detached, as his hand shot up—fingers reaching for her throat.
*Click*
No. She refused to let him.
She flickered away, appearing farther this time, her breaths ragged.
"How the hell are you tracking me?!"
Austin didn't answer. He simply turned, summoning his Shard.
Elara clenched her teeth. Her body screamed in protest, but she forced herself to steady. If she just—
A blur.
Austin was already on her, dagger flashing as he aimed for her shoulder—
*Click*
Gone.
A shuriken whirled through the space where she had been.
Austin halted, his stance relaxed, but his gaze was sharp.
And then—
Elara reappeared.
Right where she had vanished.
A mistake.
With a vicious expression she cried, "Got y—" however,
**DHAK**
Her pupils shrank. A shudder ran through her body.
The third strike—right into her stomach. The exact same spot.
Her body gave out. Eyes wide, mouth slightly open, she crumpled to the ground.
The arena fell silent.
She had speed. She had skill.
But against sheer, calculated brutality—she didn't stand a chance.
The referee came forward to check on Elara before he declared, "Austin wins!"
*Clap* *Clap*
There was only a single person clapping in the audience since the rest of the crowd was too stunned in disbelief to react.
Austin finally gave a reaction.
Looking at the crying Valerie who was clapping for him to congratulate him, he couldn't stop himself from smiling.
------------**-------------
A/N:- Physically, Austin was stronger than her because of his leveling up. But her Shard was a difficult part to handle.
I wrote the fight scene a little fast-paced. How was it?

chapters.title: Chapter 84: Chapter 83- The perfect plan?
chapters.content:
Chapter 84: Chapter 83- The perfect plan?
In the bedroom of the King, there were a few people present, currently involved in a serious discussion.
They received a letter, formal, from Hener. They have extended a helping hand to Eryndor.
When that news was shared, everyone, including the King was elated and relieved. After all, the current situation with Drenovar had them on the edges of their seats.
However, the moment the Prime Minister read the thing they wanted in exchange, the atmosphere of the room dropped.
Every smile dropped and a frown marred their faces.
"Exile the Prince huh...they are not even trying to hide their intentions." Arthur (the Prime Minister) scoffed as he folded the parchment.
They want to detach Austin from the kingdom so they can hunt him down to take revenge for what has happened.
Parkinson kidnapped Austin and beat him so severely. He tried to kill the royal Highness, and after being caught, he sought revenge. How insane some people can be?
"We are not taking their help." Cedric, who seemed extremely pale, and was lying down on the bed, voiced his decision.
If not for his current state, his face would have been red in anger. First, that bastard heir of Hener harmed his son, and now the King of Hener was using such underhanded tactics to fulfill what Parkinson wanted.
The ministers in the room glanced at each other, and that made Arthur really surprised.
'Are they really thinking too...God.'
Turning towards the ministers, the Prime Minister spoke up, "You all are not agreeing with him rather seem hesitant? Do you really want to sacrifice the Prince to get their help?"
Cedric frowned, as he looked at the council in silence.
It was the chief advisor who became the mouth of others' minds, as he said, "The situation with Drenovar is quite severe. If we don't do anything, within a month, they will surely send their main forces to take down Eryndor."
The Finance Minister added, "If you realistically think then thousands of lives are on the line."
Arthur's brows elevated—so they mean to say, to save thousands of lives they need to sacrifice one.
"And what are the chances that we would win even after taking Hener's help? Or who will be responsible if Hener, in the name of help, stabs us in the back when the time comes? Will you take responsibility, Sir Orwold?" Arthur asked with clear displeasure in his voice.
Orwold Sigmund, the Finance Minister, frowned upon hearing that, as he said, "I am not talking about taking risks or anything about that. It's the job of the Chief Advisor to evaluate the risk in a trade. I just extended the facts in the matte-"
"We are not accepting this offer." Cutting off the man, the Supreme Authority spoke.
Cedric's brows were drawn closer, and clearly, disappointment and anger could be sensed from his demeanor.
Looking at the people who were ready to trade his son's life for those bastard's support, he said, "We are, in any condition, not going to accept the proposal if it threatens Austin's life. And that's my final decision."
Silence descended in the room after that. None had the authority to go against the command of the Supreme Authority.
Amidst the growing silence, suddenly, the one who hadn't uttered a word until now, spoke, "I have a suggestion, Your Majesty."
Every eye turned towards the silver-haired Prince, who seemed unnaturally hesitant and a bit fearful.
Cedric wordlessly ushered him to continue.
"There is a way by which we won't be sacrificing Austin's safety and will get Hener's support as well."
A few gasped, while a few eyes grew narrow in anticipation. Was there really a way?
Arthur somehow had a bad feeling about this…but he didn't interrupt the young man.
"Go on." Cedric gave the permission.
Aiden stepped forward, and voiced his idea, "We can stage Austin's exile, making it appear genuine while secretly surrounding him with security. When they attempt to attack him, we'll retaliate and orchestrate his disappearance. Since they'll never admit to targeting Austin, we won't need to explain why he was protected. For the duration of the war, Austin can simply stay hidden from the world's eyes."
The eyes of the council members brightened up hearing that brilliant suggestion.
Even Arthur was surprised that the First Prince came up with such a detailed and deliberate plan in such a short time.
"If we follow the plan and everything goes accordingly then surely, Eryndor and the Second Prince will survive." The Chief Advisor beamed with excitement.
"Indeed. We can send some of our best troops to protect him. And Austin himself is a skillful warrior." The Captain of the Imperial Legion showed his consent.
Every head was nodding in assent since this was the perfect plan Eryndor needed right now.
As a king, Cedric should also respond positively. This was, indeed, a good strategy to fool the fools and take advantage of them…
…however, as a father, his heart was restless.
While every eye was turned towards the King, seeking his response, Cedric lowered his eyes, and said, "Give me some time to think."
"Oh, yes. Then we will excuse ourselves." Aiden instantly responded as he stepped back.
If not for so many eyes around him, the First Prince wouldn't have suppressed the big smirk.
'This is so perfect.'
--------**---------
Back in the academy, Austin was sitting in the infirmary with three people surrounding him.
The nurse has already patched his wounds, and given him painkillers. He wasn't much injured, well compared to the battle with the knight, this much was nothing.
"You were majestic, Austin. I couldn't remove my eyes from you, the entire time."
Valerie frowned when Rudolph said that. She wanted to say that!
"Yeah, I was stunned to see you judging her moves so accurately," Rhea added, making Valerie pout. When can she praise him?!
Austin chuckled as he looked at the slight bulge on his fiancée's cheek before he said, "And you, Val? Did I impress you?"
The other two also turned towards the girl, and the sudden shift of attention made her slightly flustered. However, when it comes to praising her Lord, she never backs down,
"I absolutely love you!" She praised him…wait!
That's not what she wanted to say! She wanted to say that she absolutely loved his battle!
Rudolph chuckled while Rhea shook her head with a smile, seeing the ever-stoic girl turning red so furiously.
Austin lovingly smiled, as he held her and said, "I also love you, Val."
"Fuee~" She might also need a bed in the infirmary….
—-------**---------
A/N:- Thanks for reading. And trust me, Valerie really wanted to say that she loved how he fought ;)

chapters.title: Chapter 85: Chapter 84- Reward
chapters.content:
Chapter 85: Chapter 84- Reward
Austin was allowed to return to his room since his injuries weren't too severe.
Since it was already dark, and would be difficult to travel, Austin decided to start their journey tomorrow, early in the morning.
He had already prepared his plan; the first place he would be visiting after leaving the academy was the great forest. He needs the mythical extract that could cure any illness or injury instantly. That is the key to cool down the tension between Eryndor and Drenovar.
After that, Austin was planning to pay Lord Corwon a visit since the Dukedom was not far from the Great Forest. He needs to assure the man that there is no need for him to worry about his daughter.
Well, that wasn't much of a problematic task, since Austin knows how much Lord Corwon loves his daughter. So convincing him would be easy.
And the final destination of the Prince would be the Capital, to meet his sick father, and assure him about a few things.
All the travel time is taken into consideration, along with some delays because of unforeseen situations, it would take around twelve days for them to finish their business in the Capital. After that only three days would be left....and that is not enough to settle the situation with Drenovar.
The problem was—every participant had to attend the gathering arranged by the council on the occasion of the commencement of the tournament.
That's why asking the Headmaster to extend a few days so Austin could finish his job would be pointless. The Headmaster would be helpless in this situation.
"Are you worried?"
Hearing the sweet voice of his girlfriend brought Austin back to reality as he glanced at that bright pair of eyes.
Seriously, sometimes he couldn't believe that this beauty was his fiancée.
"Yeah, kind of. But I know we will do something about it." Austin was short on time, but having a powerful warrior like Valerie and an experienced strategist like Sebastian by his side would surely allow him to tread through all the difficulties.
And there was his system too.
Valerie turned to stand before him, their hands connected as she spoke in a warm tone, "Don't take all the burden on yourself. I know what's at stake, but nothing matters more than your health."
Austin heaved a sigh; for her, his health was more important than the country. Yeah, he loves this girl.
Soon, a teasing grin extended his lips as he said, "Talking about my health, I know a perfect medicine to help me recover."
Valerie blinked in confusion, "What is...uh!" She recalled...the reward!
She promised him that if he wins the qualifiers...she...she would...k-k-kiss...
The red-faced Valerie was adorable, and those teary eyes almost made him let go of her hand and stop teasing her. However, he has won this reward, so not even her tears would stop him.
"Val, I am gonna kiss you." He announced, before leaning closer to her.
Valerie didn't move back or show any sign of reluctance. She was just nervous to death, but never felt aversion. How could she? Her mind, body, and soul already belong to him.
But still, she couldn't stop herself from shaking in nervousness as she closed her eyes.
They were at the backside of the school, which leads to the girl's dorm. Although there wasn't anyone around, Austin still pulled Valerie under the stairs and gently pressed her against the wall.
"I won't be able to look at your eyes like that...are you that nervous?" He whispered, his hot breath making her heart rate accelerate.
Her delicate lashes fluttered as she opened her eyes and looked at him. She could not tell how nervous she was being so close to the one she had always yearned for.
His sharp features, alluring gaze, and body warmth made her heart and body melt. If not for him to be holding her, she might have dropped to the ground.
"If you don't want to...you can push me-" Austin was silenced when suddenly she pressed her lips against his.
Although it was clumsy, it showed that she wasn't reluctant.
No further questions needed to be asked.
His arm coiled around her slender waist, the other one pushing her chin up, he brought his lips to meet her.
*Squeeze*
Valerie clutched his shirt, as she felt her lips being captured by a familiar warmth. The world around them faded, leaving only the heat of their embrace.
His lips moved with both tenderness and urgency, molding against hers as if savoring every second. A quiet sigh escaped her as she melted into him, their breaths mingling, hearts pounding in unison.
The kiss deepened, slow yet intense, each movement speaking volumes more than words ever could.
Their lips parted for a moment; aquamarine met violet before their lips reunited.
The heat of their bodies became one, as Austin ran his finger down her back, his touch feeling hot like embers, as Valerie moaned in his mouth.
This sensation was new to her, yet she didn't dislike it. It made her feel tingly all over. Being touched at places which none has touched her before. Allowing her Lord to leave his traces all over her....that's the greatest joy of her life.
Their kiss continued for a few minutes before Austin finally felt a little bit satisfied, and parted from her.
Pressing his forehead against her, he breathed a little roughly,
"I thought only an intense battle could make my heart race this much. Guess, I was severely wrong." Austin whispered as he felt his heart drumming against his chest.
Valerie clung to him, resting her face against his chest, listening to his heartbeat, "My situation...is the same."
Austin wrapped his hand around her back, before whispering, "Each moment with you makes me fall even deeper for you. I think I might get obsessed with you, Val."
The violet-haired smiled, "I'd love that."
The couple remained in each other's embrace for some more time, reluctant to break the blissful moment, but every good thing has to come to an end.
"I will see you tomorrow in the morning." Austin kissed the back of her hand, as he bid his farewell.
Valerie smiled fondly at her Lord, "I will be there. Goodnight."
Although she said that, she didn't pull her hand away, nor did she show any sign of wanting to leave.
However, suddenly, a voice interrupted the sweet atmosphere between them,
"Young master," It was Sebastian, who looked unusually worried, as he approached the duo.
"Sebas?" Austin asked, "What happened?"
Sebastian extended a letter toward his Lord, before saying, "It was sent through WarpMail,"
Austin's eyes narrowed; WarpMail was only used for emergency situations since the teleportation costs too much.
He took the letter which had no name of the sender but just the emblem of Eryndor.
'Father....'
---------**--------
A/N:- I hope you liked the chapter. Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 86: Chapter 85- Change in plans
chapters.content:
Chapter 86: Chapter 85- Change in plans
[Meet me as soon as you can.
—Father.]
There were only seven words in the letter sent to Austin. For these seven words, he sent the mail through teleportation.
Naturally, being called by the King of the nation on such an urgent basis would make anyone panic. However, the first thing Valerie uttered after reading the letter was,
"It might be sent by someone else." She held conviction in her voice. The only reason she refrained from calling the name of the person was because Austin had told her not to speak about Aiden in front of Sebastian.
"Why do you say so, young lady?" Sebastian asked.
The trio sat in Austin's office, where they were discussing the letter.
"I mean, what would he need from Austin all of a sudden? In my opinion, it's a trap." Valerie looked certain.
