However, "The handwriting is his, Val." Austin knows it since Cedric was the only one who helped Austin improve his handwriting in the past. The data organization or other related work Austin received regularly was sent by his father, too.
Austin took out the previous requests sent from the capital before showing them to Valerie, "Here, see this. It's Father who sent this data sheet."
Valerie, with her brows drawn closer, inspected the two parchments, and surely, the strokes of the letters and the peculiar way of writing 'Y' and a few other letters were the same.
Sebastian was shocked, as he asked, "You knew that it was your Father who used to send the work?"
Austin nodded, "And I also know that he always checks my work by himself too."
Sebastian felt a sense of relief spreading in his chest, upon hearing that. At least, the young master wouldn't think that his father had completely neglected him.
However, this wasn't the time to feel happy. The grey-haired butler suggested, "I think we should visit for the Capital, sir."
Austin heaved a sigh, "And how can you be so sure that Father wasn't threatened to write this letter?"
Valerie also turned to look at the oldest one, with a questioning look on her face.
Without thinking even for a moment, the man responded, "Threatening the King means my brother is dead. And if he dies, I would have instantly known."
Austin was taken aback by that statement. He knew that Sebastian's younger brother was currently serving the king, but…how could his death be known by the man?
Austin decided to worry about that later, "Since you seem so certain about it, I will trust your words." Austin spoke before standing up.
Taking the letter from Valerie he helped the lady to get up before telling her, "Val, we need to leave. Go and pack your bag, and meet me at the back side gate in half an hour."
Valerie's heart was restless, but her experience didn't allow her to waste another moment before she nodded and walked out of the room.
Austin turned towards the butler before uttering, "I want you to write a letter to the headmaster, which he should receive tomorrow morning, so no one knows that we left tonight."
"Understood, sir."
Austin walked out of the office, leaving Sebastian behind before making his way to his room.
Something major must have happened for Cedric to suddenly call him back home.
Did he discover the culprit behind his deteriorating health? Or maybe he was making some aggressive decision against Drenovar?
'I hope none of the two to be the case since Aiden would manipulate both situations for his benefit.'
Now, he could only hope that until he reaches Eryndor, his father remains alive and doesn't take any violent steps that could lead to Eryndor's demise.
Reaching his room, he took his traveling bag and stuffed a few clothes, while the other necessary things were dumped inside his Inventory.
'I just hope that the bastard doesn't end up ruining everything beyond repair.'
—--------**-----------
As planned, everyone gathered at the back gate of the academy while wearing a cloak to hide themselves from unnecessary attention.
"Young master, I have already arranged three horses at the back. We should leave now." Sebastian spoke as he took the bag of his master.
Austin nodded before he took the bag from Valerie and told her, "Wait here," Saying so, he jumped over the wall, and landed on the wet soil.
The temperature was quite low and the dew had moistened the soil.
He looked around to find any teacher patrolling the perimeter, but thankfully, there were none.
He didn't pick up any presence so he called out, "Come."
Valerie and Sebastian jumped over the wall, landing in silence before they headed towards the horses.
"Where did you get them from?" Valerie asked, seeing the one-horned horses grazing nearby.
"I have a few connections with the people inside and outside of the academy." Sebastia responded before he turned towards his Lord and asked, "Young Master, are we taking any break?"
Austin shook his head, "No, right straight to Capital. Even if we get separated, don't stop. If it's an emergency light the torch. If not, just reach the Capital by tomorrow evening."
The other two nodded in understanding.
Austin helped Valerie to climb the horse before he climbed as well.
"Okay then, let's go."
—-------**----------
Far away, the land situated by the water could be seen currently illuminated by several night lights.
Towering palaces of polished stone and intricate carvings rise above the city, their golden domes gleaming under the moon.
Wide streets, paved with smooth tiles, are lined with grand buildings, bustling markets, and fountains flowing with clear water.
The golden palace of Drenovar stood proudly in the heart of the capital. Its bronze gates open to a courtyard with flowing fountains and lush gardens. Inside, tall pillars with intricate carvings support vast halls lined with silk banners.
Inside the palace, there were several guards lined up in the gallery as a certain man walked hastily.
Panic was written over his face as the black-haired man finally reached his destination and pushed open the door.
"So as-." The person to whom the office belonged paused mid-sentence as he turned to look at the man who suddenly entered.
"Gentlemen, let's talk after a small break." The red-haired individual spoke before the two guests walked out of the room.
The black-haired stepped forward and uttered, "Brother, grandfather's situation has worsened. He fainted just half an hour ago. And this was the third time today already."
The first Prince of Drenovar, Hazir, sighed, upon hearing his younger brother's words. Their grandfather has been sick for some time now and they couldn't find any cure to his illness.
"What did the soothsayer say?"
The younger one, with his face darkened, added, "The same thing; the savior is about to arrive."
Hazir shook his head, "Nothing will happen unless we do something." The soothsayer has been repeating the same thing for like ever now; however, until now, they haven't received anything from anyone regarding the illness.
Since they couldn't let the world know about the Pillar of Drenovar falling, they only asked for help from close allies. However, none of them had any clue of the illness he was suffering from.
"Then what should we do, brother?" The younger brother, Tavrin asked.
Hazir heaved a sigh before telling him, "I think we need to discuss the plan of invasion."
Tavrin frowned, "But the troops are prepared…everything has already been planned."
Hazir nodded, "I know but we need to use our resources in finding the cure first."
The younger one lowered his head, "As you say, brother."
Unbeknownst to Austin, Eryndor was saved from its possible demise by this decision.
—-------**----------
A/N:- I think I will draw a map of the world and post it on Discord. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 87: Chapter 86- Tired
chapters.content:
Chapter 87: Chapter 86- Tired
"Good morning, Professor."
"Good morning, Rey."
Greeting the students on his way, Philius walked towards his office early in the morning to prepare for the day.
It was the second day of selection trials, and Philius needed to be there before it began.
He spends most of his time with the two Council members who came to assess the students and list the names of those whom they deem worthy of participating in the tournament.
'It was really a surprise for Austin to get his name so quickly registered.' Philius smiled warmly as he remembered how the councilmen wrote Austin's name even before the battle concluded.
Reason? They were really impressed by the tactics Austin used to track Elara.
While others might not have perceived it, the sharp eyes of the council member named Curt clearly noticed Austin putting his Shard in the hood of his opponent.
And tracking one's Shard is way easier than tracking a person.
Austin kept a firm control over his Shard since traveling through space, even for a split second, could force one to retreat their soul component.
And on top of that, Austin even summoned another piece of Shroud, and that was absolutely astounding.
'One cannot show such great command over their Shard unless they have at least evolved to the Second stage ...' And here, Austin hasn't gone through a single evolution.
That discovery got the interest of the two Council members that's why it was highly likely that they would call Austin for some questioning. Or if they don't, they surely would keep a close eye on the anomalous student.
*Click*
Opening the door of his office, Philius stepped inside before closing the door behind his back.
Heading towards his desk, he sat down and was about to start organizing his data sheet, when suddenly he found a letter resting on the table.
"Hmm?" Philius's brows raised; this letter surely wasn't here yesterday.
He looked around and found the security parameters were at their place, and the trap set under his chair was also armed.
'Someone quite familiar with my office, and possessing quite an experience....' Philius slowly lifted the letter and assessed it for any trap.
However, he found nothing suspicious, so he tore the small seal and took out the letter.
The moment his eyes landed on the sender, Philius heaved a sigh,
"Surely, for you infiltrating my office should be nothing, Sebastian."
----------**----------
They have been traveling continuously since last night,
Sebastian purposely chose the mutated horses, since they could travel for three days without needing to rest.
Through towns and forests, their journey continued. Austin was thankful that his beloved wasn't a fragile woman. At any moment, he glanced at Valerie he found her unfazed by the tiresome journey.
....however, mentally, he wasn't that used to riding a horse for this long that's why Austin was feeling quite dull in his back and wanted to take some rest.
However, he couldn't stop the journey, considering he needed to reach the capital as soon as he could.
Under such a situation, 'System, open dungeon for me.'
[Ding!]
[Does the host want to exchange 300 points to summon an instant dungeon?]
[Y/N]
'Yes.'
[Command accepted.]
[Assessing the host's stats...]
[Generating dungeon...]
[Ding!]
[Dungeon Name: Colossus Abyss]
[Level: B]
[Time Limit: 10 hours]
[Reward: ???]
Austin heaved a sigh as the world came to a pause before him and a few meters ahead of him was the shining door.
Austin dismounted the horse and walked towards the dungeon.
*ZIIIP*
After a moment of hypermotion, Austin was standing in a completely different world.
The dungeon was an endless expanse of frozen lava; its surface cracked and uneven, stretching as far as the eye could see. Jagged rock formations, once molten, now stand like twisted monuments of a forgotten era.
The air is cold and still, yet the ground holds a lingering warmth as if the fire beneath never fully died.
Austin narrowed his eyes as he saw the seven-foot-tall giants standing in groups, waiting for him.
On their heads, [5] was floating, which signified each giant would grant him five points.
'They look sturdy....' The blackened skin and tight muscles of the giants seemed quite tough to break using his Shard. And not to talk about that number could easily overwhelm him if he allows himself to get surrounded.
'How many points do I need to retreat?' Austin asked as he began stratching his sore limbs.
[Ding!]
[Hundred points, host.]
That means he has to defeat twenty of those giants to return, eh?
Austin glanced at the timer, and there were seven minutes left before the preparation space would disappear and he would be sent to fight.
Austin was running his eyes around, making a plan on how he could defeat the giants without breaking something, when suddenly,
[Ding!]
[An exciting offer has arrived!]
[The host can purchase an A-rank weapon at a lower price:]
[Name: Raijin Wrath]
[Rank: A]
[Attribute: Lightning]
[Price: 1800 pts-> 200 pts]
[Buy?]
[Y/N]
....
Reading the description, Austin couldn't help but utter, "You are straying away from being a system, and becoming more like a salesman."
[Ding!]
[Command accepted! The flash sale would be disposed of-]
"Okay, I accept. Geez, you have quite the temper." Austin heaved a weary sigh, as he found an illumination before his hand.
He extended his hand and held the weapon materializing before his eyes.
He only has about seventy points left, which he could use to upgrade his stats. After defeating the dungeon boss, he hopes he can get enough points to summon the next dungeon and unlock the shop.
The battle axe looked majestic with a gleaming white handle, smooth as polished ivory yet unyielding as steel. Its double-edged blade, forged from sky metal, shimmers with a faint blue glow, crackling with caged lightning.
Austin swung it casually, and the spark flew here and there, showing how useful it would be against the giant monsters.
Looking at the time, he took a deep breath,
[4....3....2...1...*BIZ*]
"It's time to grind."
----------**----------
A/N:- Thanks for reading. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 88: Chapter 87- Back home
chapters.content:
Chapter 88: Chapter 87- Back home
Thunder roared, lightning tore through the sky, and the earth trembled beneath the sheer force of Austin's magic. His axe gleamed above his head, gripped tightly in both hands as he locked onto the next giant.
**SQUELCH**
The blade tore through thick, unyielding flesh, splitting the monster's skull clean in two. Dark blood gushed as the towering beast crumpled to the ground with a heavy thud.
"Huff... Huff..." Austin's breaths came ragged as he watched the blackened pool spread beneath the fallen giant. His own blood dripped from a cut on his forehead, and sweat made his grip on the axe slick, but there was no time to rest.
**THUMP THUMP**
The ground trembled under the relentless march of more giants, their massive frames looming like moving mountains. There was no hiding from them. No escape.
Austin tightened his grip, his stance firm as he lifted the axe with one hand. He locked eyes with the next beast—a hulking, ten-foot brute with unnaturally long arms stretching toward him, eager to crush his skull.
But before its fingers could close around him—
He vanished.
The giant's grasp closed on nothing but air.
*SPLURT*
A deep, gaping wound appeared across the monster's stomach. Austin had already passed it, his axe dripping with fresh blood.
"They're too slow…" he muttered, barely sparing it at a glance.
The beast howled in pain, twisting with rage. It swung its enormous arm, aiming to obliterate him in a single blow.
Austin leaped away, just in time.
**BOOOOOM**
The force of the strike shattered the rocky ground where he had just stood. A second slower, and his head would've been nothing but pulp.
'...they are monstrously strong.' Austin wasted no time. The moment the giant's arm crashed into the ground, he lunged forward. His axe, slick with blood, became an extension of his body as he swung—
*SLASH*
The beast's knee split open, black blood gushing as it let out a guttural roar. Before it could stumble, Austin twisted his body and drove his axe upward—
**CRACK**
The blade buried deep into the monster's ribcage. He yanked it free just as another giant came crashing in from the side, its massive fist descending like a hammer.
Austin kicked off the wounded giant's body, flipping backward as the ground where he stood exploded into dust and rubble.
Before his feet could even touch the ground and he could finish the giant—
*WHAM*
Another giant swiped at him in mid-air.
Austin twisted, barely avoiding the blow as the wind pressure sent him hurtling sideways. He landed hard, rolling across the battlefield before digging his axe into the dirt to stop himself.
He looked up. Three more giants were already charging.
A grin tugged at his lips.
"Come on, then."
He twisted the axe over his head, the lightning charging up, before he swung the axe in an upper arc, sending streams of lightning toward the group.
**JOLT**
The lightning struck the giants, slowing them down but not completely stopping them.
Austin clicked his tongue, before he lunged forward, his form becoming a blur as he heard towards the three, intending to behead them.
When suddenly,
**BOOOOM**
"Khuk!" A loud reverberation arrived from the left, sending an airborne Austin flying away.
*Dhak*
Austin landed on the ground, rolling away because of the force.
"Shit....this is madness..." He couldn't believe the strength behind that clap was so intense that a sixty-kilogram man was hurtled away.
Austin slowly opened his eyes, as he saw more than seven giants approaching him.
He looked at the current points and found he was still five points short.
"Can't give up now..." Austin pushed himself off the ground...but then, he felt dizzy. He has lost quite some blood and he has been hit a few times by those shockwaves.
The giants were closing in—seven of them now, their towering frames blocking the storm-lit sky.
He didn't have time to fight them all head-on.
His fingers curled into fists as he focused. The storm above rumbled in response. Lightning crackled along his arms, coursing through his veins, rekindling his body with raw energy. He exhaled sharply.
Then—he moved.
*CRACK*
A blinding bolt struck the ground behind him as Austin shot forward like a streak of light. Instead of heading for his axe, he dashed toward the giants, weaving between their massive legs before skidding to a stop.
"Over here, you ugly bastards!"
Raising both hands, he slammed his palms together.
**KZAAAAAAP**
A surge of lightning exploded outward, arcing between the three closest giants, stunning them in place. Their enormous bodies convulsed under the electric shock, their limbs locking up for a crucial second.
Those three who were struck, stumbled back and set the others, off balance.
That was all he needed.
Without hesitation, Austin twisted mid-step and launched himself toward the injured giant—the one with the deep gash in its stomach. It had barely recovered, still hunched over, its breathing ragged.
Perfect.
Austin vanished in a blur of speed, reappearing just above the giant's hunched form.
His form was blended in the dark night, his Shard appeared in his hand, and his eyes held nothing but immense blood lust.
"**KHRUAAANGH**"
The giant tried to swat Austin away. However, Austin summoned his Axe and plunged into the arm of the giant, sending a thunderbolt down its arm.
"*KHRUUOG*" The giant, howled, however, Austin gave the beast another reason to cry,
**SQUELCH**
Austin dug his Shard deep inside the wound, extending the blade to pierce it through the giant's back.
**THUMP** **THUMP**
All the giants were rushing toward him, faster than before.
"RETREAT!" Austin barked, just as he felt the giant's movement coming to a stop.
**BLINK**
An illumination engulfed him, and before the giant could have captured him, Austin disappeared.
°°°°°°
*Thud*
Valerie and Sebastian instantly stopped their horses and jumped toward Austin as they saw the blond Prince falling to the ground.
"Austin!"
"Young master!"
They both panicked as they reached the boy who was breathing heavily and looked pale.
Valerie couldn't discern what happened so suddenly when she saw her Lord being all fine just a moment ago.
Austin looked at the two, as he whispered, "I might have pushed myself a little there ...sorry,"
"No, young master, we can understand," Sebastian spoke. His young master wasn't much used to long journeys since, in the past, he mostly traveled in carriages.
"You went through a battle and got injured, so it's understandable," Valerie added, a frown of concern on her face.
Looking at the butler, she said, "I will ride with him" She would have suggested staying a little longer so he could get rest, but remembering the urgency of the matter, the only comfort she could provide was to ride the horse with him.
"Yes, that would be the best option." Sebastian nodded before he lifted Austin from the ground and headed toward Valerie's horse.
Valerie took out a thin and long shawl from her bag before she climbed the horse and wrapped it around herself and Austin—binding them strongly together.
Austin's face was resting against her bosom, the scent of her hair wash and her natural scent made him feel calm.
He glanced up and found the girl looking down at him before she whispered, "Sleep peacefully, my Lord. I will keep you safe."
She took his breath away.
"...okay." Closing his eyes, he fell asleep.
----------**---------
The next time Austin opened his eyes, it was already afternoon.
He looked up and found Valerie still riding the horse without an ounce of fatigue on her face even though he had his weight on her.
"Val, I am awake now," Austin called out, but,
"I think you should remain hidden, my lord," Valerie responded, and that made him frown.
Austin looked around and found they were going through familiar streets, "Why are we going in through the back side?"
This was, undoubtedly, the backside of the capital. Austin has traveled through this path, especially after he awakened his Shard. He usually used this route to go hunting.
"The front side is heavily guarded, soldiers are everywhere, that's why Sebastian suggested using this route."
Austin nodded, "He is-" he paused when suddenly he felt Valerie shivering.
Looking up, he found the girl blushing, as she said, "P-Please don't move your face...i-it distracts me...."
Austin took a strong gulp as he realized where his face was resting, "...sorry, I won't."
As such, for the rest of the journey, Austin and Valerie traveled in silence.
After moving for another ten minutes, they finally reached the backside of the palace.
Austin, with Valarie's help, untied himself from his fiancée. Sitting face to face with her, he uttered, "Thank you for carrying me."
Valerie smilingly shook her head, "Nothing to thank me. As your partner, it's natural for me to take care of you."
The duo looked into each other's eyes, the glimmer of fondness they both shared.
"Young lord, we should get going."
Hearing Sebastian's words, Austin heaved a sigh, before jumping off the horse.
It's time to discover what in the seven world is happening in Eryndor.
---------**--------
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 89: Chapter 88- The caring older brother
chapters.content:
Chapter 89: Chapter 88- The caring older brother
Aiden was in his office, currently talking to his mother, "I am here with him. I won't let anything disturb his health anymore."
While holding her hand in his, Aiden spoke with utmost surety to comfort the lady.
Sophie exhaled a sigh that made her look older than usual before she uttered, "I don't know what I would have done without you. Your presence has assured your father and me that nothing wrong would happen even when your father is not well."
Sophie was initially quite worried when Aiden returned to them back that day. Growing up all alone she thought he would blame them, that he would never accept them as his parents.
That's why she started paying more and more attention to him so that their family would never break apart.
As a mother, it was her duty to make up for that time when Aiden was away from the family, and struggling with his life.
Although her second son seemed unhappy about how his elder brother was getting all her attention, she thought Austin would understand with time. However, she was disappointed to see how, day after day, Austin only continued to grow wary of Aiden. And soon, his whole personality changed.
Once a tender and lovely boy he was. And now, she couldn't even remember when was the last time she had a proper talk with Austin where they didn't end up arguing over something.
"You are thinking about, Austin, right?" Aiden suddenly asked his eyes radiating warmth that made her shoulders slump.
"I feel...troubled about him, all the time, Aiden. Even though he has a responsible partner by his side, if Austin continues to possess that attitude, it won't be long before Valerie becomes tired of him."
Aiden shook his head, "You are wrong, Mother; Valerie would never leave him...and somehow, her tolerance is fueling his ego, in my opinion."
Sophie, with a frown, nodded, "Yes...even though I have heard that their relationship has improved recently, it's highly unlikely for that boy to completely turn into a new leaf so suddenly."
Sophie very much detests those people who can't respect those who care about them. The only reason why she had an argument last time with Austin was because, despite Aiden's goodwill towards him, Austin always ended up conveying it in the wrong way.
While Aiden always tried to make a good connection with his brother, Austin was not ready to accept him at all.
Because of that, Sophie became extremely displeased with his behavior, and they had a fight just a day before he departed for the academy.
"Mom, please don't scold him once he returns. Although you only think the best of him, your words make him hate me more."
Sophie sighed as she cupped her son's cheek and said, "Look at you…always looking out for him. And on the other hand, that child doesn't even see you as his brother."
Aiden fondly smiled at his mother, as he responded, "Regardless of what he thinks, it doesn't change the fact that we are a family."
Sophie nodded in assent. She sometimes felt that maybe she had made wrong choices in the upbringing of her second son, and that's why the one who grew up away from him was so considerate and lovely.
"Your Highness," Suddenly the maid arrived in the room, even though Aiden had forbidden her to enter unless there was an emergency.
That means…"What happened?" Aiden got up from his seat, as he asked.
The maid was breathing roughly but she didn't delay in informing, "The first prince…he just arrived."
"...!!"
°°°°°
Austin was making his way toward his father's room without bothering to greet or react to the servants who saw him.
Following him were Valerie and Sebastia, who decided to stick together with him, for the time being.
Just as he was about to open the door and enter the room, "Wait, don't go in!"
A familiar voice stopped him.
Austin heaved a sigh, before asking, "Why is that, mother?"
It was strange that after rebirth, it was the first time for Austin to meet his mother, but he didn't feel anything in her presence. No connection, no warmth. She was just like any other person to him.
"Father is not well, so you shouldn't disturb him."
Entering the scene was the most annoying person in existence.
A concerned look marred his punchable face as Aiden said, "You should wait for him to wake up, at least."
Austin barely held himself from punching the guy who tried snatching his lover from him. A very thin border was restraining his aura from flooding out and letting each and every person in the palace know what emotion Austin held for his dear older brother.
With a strained smile that didn't hide his annoyance, Austin spoke, "I need to meet him urgently, so I have to go inside."
"No, you can't! Can't you listen to your elders even once?" Sophie suddenly held his hand and pulled him away from the door.
Valerie frowned, seeing her Lord being insulted by the woman. Not even God has the right to behave rudely to him.
Austin rolled his eyes, and was about to say something when suddenly, "Austin…"
A voice arrived from the inside…and none of the five were unaware of whom this voice belonged.
"Austin…" He called out again, and soon the doors were parted from the inside.
A grey-haired butler appeared from the other side, and said, "Your father is looking for you, Your Highness."
Aiden gritted his teeth in annoyance, 'When I went to ask for his decision, that old fart was playing dead. And now suddenly, he is alive?!'
Regardless of what he thought, Austin removed his hand from the lady's hold before stepping inside the room.
Valerie and Sebastian remained standing outside and even the King's personal butler and Sebastian's brother stood outside of the room, leaving only the father and the son inside.
°°°°°°
Austin took a deep breath once his eyes landed on the old man…who was looking much older than the last time he saw him.
"Dying so soon? I thought you had some promises to fulfill?"
Cedric laughed; however, that only made his dry throat hurt, ushering Austin to pour some water for the old man.
Helping Cedric to first sit down, Austin brought the glass to his lips.
The blond one took a few sips of water slowly before he detached the glass from his lips, and while holding his son's hand, he uttered,
"Thank you for responding to my request…"
There was a certain fondness in his eyes when he said that.
Austin couldn't help but sigh as he said, "You have summoned me when I was having my sweet time in the academy…I hope this should be something important."
Cedric grimly nodded, "Yes…it is."
°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 90: Chapter 89- Pest
chapters.content:
Chapter 90: Chapter 89- Pest
Outside the room, Valerie and Aiden were the only ones standing since Sebastian was asked to accompany the queen. Apparently, she wanted to ask a few things from the butler regarding Austin.
Valerie was silently standing by the door, with her arms crossed.
Last night was really eventful for her. Riding the horse with her beloved leaning on her was quite an experience.
Every time he mumbled in his sleep or frowned, she patted his head and soothingly whispered, 'It's okay, I am here...' and he soundly fell asleep.
That gave her a different type of sensation compared to the other times when she spent her time with him. After all, last night, it wasn't him teasing her or flirting with her. Rather, it was her taking care of him...and that gave birth to a very new sensation in her.
It was...addictive.
"Lady Valerie, how have you been doing?"
To break her pleasant mood, the eye sore spoke.
She didn't have much of a conversation with Aiden in the past and her impression of him was shallow...until her Lord informed her about Aiden's real side.
The manipulative bastard just wants to separate Austin from his family and take over the throne. Disgusting unnecessary creature.
"Quite busy lately," Valerie responded in a dry tone.
Aiden heaved a sigh, "I could see that my brother has been bothering you quite-"
"No, that's not it," Valerie interrupted him, "Austin doesn't keep me busy...rather it's my search for that pest who manipulated my father, who has kept me busy recently."
Aiden flinched; his whole person turned still upon hearing that, but from the front, he seemed unfazed.
Turning towards the silver-haired guy, Valerie added, "If you find that person who convinced my father that Austin is not worthy of me, please inform me. Even at the cost of my own life, I won't hesitate to slay that roach."
The conviction in her voice and the subtle blood lust that Valerie didn't hide made Aiden shiver.
Taking a strong gulp, he said, "I will try to find the person. Now if you will excuse me,"
"Yes, sure." Valerie nodded as she saw the roach crawling away.
°°°°°°°
Austin heaved a sigh after hearing what was the case.
So, Hener sent a proposal that they would lend a helping hand if Eryndor disowned Austin and exiled him.
It was amusing how they were not trying to hide their animosity against Austin. Something that happened between two children is now being dragged to national-level politics.
How...childish.
"So your council members are suggesting you take this step, I guess?" Austin asked the obvious.
He knew the influence of Aiden on the people here, who run the government. Even if Cedric shows reluctance in front of several agreements, he would have no option but to make the hard choice.
"Austin…they are convinced that under the pretense of exiling you, they would be able to protect you." Holding his hand firmly, the older one added, "But I have a bad feeling about this."
Austin exhaled an audible breath; surely this was a wrong call.
Knowing Aiden, Austin knew he would be executed during his exile and the blame would land on Hener. And since, during his banishment, he wouldn't be the Prince of anywhere, Eryndor wouldn't be able to blame anyone.
Hener happy. Aiden happy.
'What a good plan you made …' Austin's train of thought was broken by his father,
"Austin…I am prepared to fight Drenovar without any external support-"
"And lose your kingdom and the lives of numerous people in the process? Be practical, father."
Austin's instant rejection took the man by surprise. He thought that saying so would fuel Austin with motivation and he would support his decision.
However, "Fighting that giant named Drenovar needs three times the forces we have now, along with a massive supply of equipment. In our current situation, only demise awaits for Eryndor if we get into a full-fledged war with them."
Cedric asked, "Then…you mean to say ….I can't allow that!"
Austin heaved a weary sigh, "First listen to me, old man. I also won't offer myself as a sacrificial lamb, so calm down."
Cedric settled down. He was a bit too charged up for someone critically ill.
Austin thought for a moment. His plans were all messed up after he heard the news. Hener has played dirty but Austin doesn't have the time to pay attention to them.
His focus was Drenovar at the moment.
"Father, I have a way to resolve this situation without letting the two nations collide."
Cedric frowned, "Is there really a way to appease Drenovar?"
Austin nodded, "I know a way, but for that, you need to give me some time. For the next ten days, you need to delay your decision about exiling me and stop any kind of plan your councilmen might have to retaliate."
"If Eryndor launches even a single attack against Drenovar, everything would be ruined."
Cedric took a deep breath. The way he sounded forced the older man to trust his words.
"I will take care of that, but Austin, do you really have a way?"
"Why would I lie about something so dangerous? Drenovar can swallow Eryndor, so unless I have a fullproof plan, I wouldn't stick my hand into this mess." Austin replied with a frown.
Cedric slowly raised his hand and cupped his cheek. Softly, he asked, "Promise me, you won't risk your life for this."
Austin looked at the man, before asking, "Did you promise your father the same thing when you went to fight the demonic army back when you were just a teenager?"
Cedric was rendered speechless. His eyes widened, as he asked, "How do…you…"
Austin shook his head, "It doesn't matter, father. We both know that our lives will always remain under threat until we are alive, so taking risks is a given. However, I can promise you that I will not foolishly jump into danger."
"I can't ask anything more from you." Resting his hand on Austin's shoulder, the King said, "Go conquer the enemy son. I will wait for the good news."
Austin smiled, "I won't take long."
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 91: Chapter 90- Departure already?
chapters.content:
Chapter 91: Chapter 90- Departure already?
[A few minutes ago]
In the reception hall, only two people could be seen.
On the Queen's orders, Sebastian followed her, and for the past five minutes, all the lady did was sip on her tea.
"How have you been doing recently, Sebastian? Does my son trouble you?" She spoke for the first time.
Sebastian honestly responded, "No, Your Majesty. He is a very sensible person for his age."
Sophie's left brow went up, "Are you sure we are talking about the same person?"
Sebastian expertly held a slight laugh as he responded, "Indeed, madame. Although the young master had a bad temper initially when I started serving him, recently, his personality has changed for good."
"Talking about recent activities, you stopped reporting about Austin." She said, but it sounded more like a question to the butler.
"I was forbidden by the master I serve, Your Majesty." Sebastian simply responded. He was not forbidden by his lord to hide the fact. However, even though Austin never told him not to tell anyone about the contract, Sebastian wasn't going to mention it to anyone.
The silver-haired woman gave him a side-long glance before asking, "What exactly has he been doing that he told you not to inform us?"
Recently, she heard that Austin was involved in some mess in which the Prince of Hener got blamed. She doesn't have the information about the whole incident since her husband refused to tell her, but she already assumed that it must be Austin's fault.
Sebastian remained staring at the woman for a moment longer than what could have been regarded as appropriate before he uttered,
"He has been involved with several events recently. For example, when he won the trials of the Tournament-"
"Austin won the trials?" Sophie asked in surprise.
With a smile, Sebastian nodded, "Yes, and he is participating from the elite division."
For a moment, Sebastian saw the glimmer of warmth and fondness in Sophie's eyes for her son…but like it was nothing but an illusion, her cold look returned.
"Must have been favored by the headmaster…anyway, once Austin graduates, you need to return to the capital and help Aiden in handling the administration."
Sebastian held a sigh. The Queen has already declared the next king in her heart. How…strange.
"As you say, Your Majesty."
°°°°°
"Robert." The personal butler of the King flinched upon finding someone appearing behind him without him noticing.
"...brother…" Thankfully, the amount of people who could achieve such a feat was still one.
"You have adapted to your role as a butler quite well." Sebastian praised his little brother with a proud smile on his face.
Robert allowed a rare scowl to appear on his face, "This uniform is so goddamn tight. And there is a restriction on so many things."
Sebastian chuckled. It was not surprising to see that his brother was suffering slightly in this new job.
For someone who has been working as a mercenary for the past eight years, it was understandable why he hates rules so much.
Resting his hand on his brother's shoulder, Sebastian spoke, "You are doing a fine job, brother. There are many who want to take Your Majesty's life; that's why I assigned you since I knew only you can be trusted with this job."
Robert heaved a sigh, "That's true…recently, I discovered that he was being fed poison through his food."
Sebastian frowned. He knew that something was up, but he still didn't have the details, so he asked, "Did you catch the traitor?"
Robert shook his head, "He was dead, the newly assigned cook."
Sebastian's frown deepened. He had a hunch that it must be the newly assigned cook since the other cooks and chefs were recruited by Sebastian after careful consideration and thorough background inspection. They would end their life rather than choose to betray their Lord.
"Did you find any traces?"
Robert shook his head, "None. I went to check where he lived, and from what I got, it seemed the bastard was not from the capital but somewhere outside. No lead about the true culprit."
Sebastian narrowed his eyes, " Bringing a foreigner to the capital and giving him a job in the palace…surely someone with authority could do that."
Before Sebastian could ask, Robert told him, "I couldn't track who recruited him. Upon asking, one signaled towards the other…"
Sebastian nodded, "Naturally if they are conspiring against the King, they must have been thorough in their planning." he concluded with a frustrated sigh.
Unfortunately, Sebastian couldn't stay in the capital and investigate the matter himself, or he might have found some clue.
He couldn't blame Robert for not being able to find anything since his younger brother had to pay attention to the King's safety, so it was understandable if he couldn't reach the root of the problem.
After thinking for a few moments, Sebastian said, "Do you still have the Dectro?"
Robert rolled his eyes, "You still remember that name?" Saying so, he took out a small compass from his pocket.
Several memories came to his mind, seeing the compass in his brother's hand. They used to play hide and seek in the past, and whenever Robert's turn came to find others, he used the artifact he got from their father.
"Does it still work?" Sebastian asked and got a nod in response.
"Okay, so whenever the Queen talks or meets someone, you need to use Dectro to see if someone is using their Soul energy."
Robert raised his brows, " Did you sense something?"
Sebastian's brows drew closer, "I can't be sure…but I think the Queen is under the influence of a spell that is making her antagonize Young Lord Austin."
Robert heaved a sigh, "But I don't remain always around the Queen. It's her personal maid, Vanessa."
Sebastian flashed a teasing smile, "If it's a woman, I think you can manage."
The siblings shared a grin.
°°°°°°
"Are you returning right away?" Just as Austin got out of the room and began walking with Valerie by his side, Aiden appeared out of nowhere.
Austin heaved a sigh, "A competition is going on back in school, so I need to return."
Aiden raised his brows, "You…really are returning to school?"
Austin, with a smile, said, "Want to drop me off at school, big brother?"
Aiden chuckled, "That's too far away. I think you will be able to take care of yourself."
Austin nodded, "Okay then, see you." Without any further ado, Austin held Valerie's hand and walked out.
As Austin walked away, Aiden's smile dropped, as he muttered under his breath,
'This is suspicious….I need to investigate this whole farce.'
Not in seven hell, Austin suddenly came here to just check on his father and would return to the academy just like that.
'That old man must have informed Austin about the proposal from Hener…' In that case, what Austin could do? Run away? But that would just give Hener the best opportunity to slay the rogue prince.
'What exactly are you planning…'
°°°°°°
"My lord, are we leaving right away?" Sebastian asked as he spotted the young master and lady walking out of the palace.
Austin nodded, "Have you arranged a carriage?"
Sebastian was taken aback, "Are we leaving on a carriage?" Sebastian had no problem with that, but surely, in a carriage, it would take much longer.
"Austin is tired, so it's better to travel in a carriage," Valerie spoke, bringing a warm smile to Austin's lips.
However, "That carriage would be a diversion, Sebastian. We are still traveling on horses."
Sebastian raised his brows before he glanced behind the Prince, "Are we…."
Austin nodded, "Most likely."
Valerie glanced between the two men, confused about what was happening.
Austin held her hand and interlaced their fingers before saying, "Let me escort you to somewhere safe."
Sebastian had already disappeared and went to arrange the carriage while Austin and Valerie walked through the back garden of the palace.
"How was he? Your Majesty?" Valerie asked.
Austin raised his brows, "Still formality?"
Valerie lowered her gaze, a shy smile lifting the edges of her lips, as she asked, "How is he…father-in-law?" A gentle reminder that they are about to get married…yup, all her displeasure after meeting that pest has been wiped off.
"He is doing good…the poison would be negated within a few days with proper rest and adequate nutrition."
Valerie raised her brows, "Is it safe for him to stay here when that person is targeting him?"
Austin nodded, "I trust Robert. He will take care of him."
Valerie suddenly stood before Austin before saying, "What about your mother…it seems she is under Aiden's influence, just as my father was. And late at night, in the bedroom, only a wife is allowed to enter the room."
Austin's brows drew closer. What Valerie is suggesting is true. During the night, even the closest servant couldn't remain around their primary because of obvious reasons.
And if, under Aiden's influence, the Queen ends up harming the King…
Squeezing her hand, Austin said, "I can just hope that my dear mother still has that much sanity to discern what is right and what is evil."
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 92: Chapter 91- Diversion
chapters.content:
Chapter 92: Chapter 91- Diversion
"Until we cross the city borders and reach the outer perimeter, we need to stay in the carriage. So Valerie," Austin, while parting his lap, said, "Come rest here."
The girl was taken aback by the sudden proposal, as she said, "B-But my head is heavy..."
"Your tip-to-toe is light as a feather, so stop making excuses and come here." Austin was not going to let her refuse this time. She has been restlessly moving around since yesterday, unlike him, who got plenty rest last night
Naturally, he was planning to let Sebastian rest as well once they reached the great forest, but for now, the man was busy driving the carriage.
"Then ..if you'll excuse me..." Shyly, the violet-haired rested a very small portion of her head on his lap.
Austin heaved a sigh, "Want me to put you on my lap and make you sleep like a baby?"
Valerie instantly rested her head on his thigh properly. That baby part would have been too much!
Austin warmly smiled at the girl as he tugged her hair strands behind her ear and whispered, "Relax when you have the time. We have a long journey waiting ahead."
Valerie blinked in confusion, "Are we not going to meet Father?"
Austin's heart clenched in guilt. It wasn't that he forgot about his promise to meet his father-in-law, rather, it was the situation that didn't allow him.
"Val...I am sorry, but we need to go to Drenovar first."
He knew the importance of meeting Lord Corwon—to let him know about their relationship and assure him that Austin would take care of his daughter. However, at the moment, Austin's focus was on Eryndor's safety.
That's why he postponed the plan of meeting him.
Valerie shook her head as she held his hand and told him, "You need not feel apologetic about it. You are not avoiding meeting him for a nonsensical reason. It's about national importance and your father's safety, so my father would understand."
Austin looked at Valerie with a strange look in his eyes.
Even though he knew she would say something like that, hearing how she wasn't angry about his change of plans made him momentarily stunned.
'Luke, you can't even keep a promise?! How unreasonable!'
'Seriously, you made me wait here in the sun for ten long minutes?! You are the worst!'
'Be more responsible or break up. That's it.'
He couldn't help but think of his past lovers, which he strictly didn't want to think about in Valerie's presence, who always complained at the slightest mistake or change in plans. And here...
"Ah.." A soft exclaim of shock escaped her lips when, suddenly, Austin lowered himself and kissed her lips.
The sudden intimacy took her by surprise; that explains why the violette turned completely stiff.
Once their lips parted, Austin stared into her sparkling eyes as he heard her, "So suddenly..."
"Just felt like it. Did you not like it?"
Valerie smiled before she lifted herself a little and pecked his lips, "Loved it."
°°°°°°°
[After an hour]
There were three borders of the capital; two of them were visible, and one was not.
After crossing the third border, Austin called out, "Sebas, we will march towards the nearest town and hire a few horses."
"Understood, sir."
Austin glanced at Valerie and got a nod from her.
Once Austin ensured that they were in a dense forest and the sight of the three would be impossible to track, Austin commanded,
"GO!"
Austin and Valerie, along with Sebastian, darted away from the carriage while a man with the same dress as Sebastian got out of the small bracket under the driver's seat and began driving the carriage.
Those who were following the carriage remained tailing the carriage while the three of them darted in another direction.
Their form was a blur, and that high speed thoroughly surprised Valerie and Sebastian.
'His growth is mind wobbling.' Sebastian inwardly thought.
'My Lord is so amazing.' Valerie smiled in pride, seeing how her beloved had been progressing rapidly.
Once they reached the town, Austin summoned a small cloth to hide his face.
Valerie did the same since they would have easily gotten the attention of people.
"We should take a break and eat something first," Austin suggested.
Sebastian nodded, "I will go and look for the hors-"
"No, you should also eat with us, Sebas. You aren't a machine."
Sebastian was monetarily stunned as he glanced at the lady and found her nodding in assent, "Don't push yourself too much, Sebastian." Valerie added.
Lost in words, Sebastian sighed before ushering, "Okay then, let's go to a place I know."
The two teenagers followed the man before they entered a certain eatery named Billar'd bars
There were not many people around, so they got themselves a seat easily.
Once they were seated, a waiter came, "What would you like to order, sir?"
"Ah, one mushroom gratin," Sebastian spoke first.
Austin raised his brows, "Is it good?" Getting a nod with a smile, Austin also ordered the same, followed by Valerie.
Once the waiter walked away, Austin said, "Sebastian, how far is the WarpMail center from here?"
Sebastian thought for a moment before he answered, "If we are going to the great forest, it would be in the route and will take two hours on a horse. But young master, who are you sending the letter to?"
Austin heaved a sigh before he revealed vaguely, "There is someone who Morkel used to report about me. However, now Morkel is working for me, so I want Morkel to affirm my arrival in the academy if he is asked."
Austin couldn't reveal that the person in question was Aiden. Since until now, he doesn't have any evidence against the First Prince, which could make Sebastian realize the bastard's true nature.
Sebastian didn't ask any further questions, but he already had a clear idea of the person Austin had been so wary of.
'I hope your suspicion is proven to be wrong...or this family would never become one, my lord.'
°°°°°°°
A/N:- Sebastian still has hopes that this family could become one, somehow.
And a serious question. Is this pace good? I feel it's slightly fast paced, no?

chapters.title: Chapter 93: Chapter 92- Fragile ego?
chapters.content:
Chapter 93: Chapter 92- Fragile ego?
The great forest was one day's travel from the capital.
It was situated on the north of Eryndor—and comes under Eryndor's territory; that's why Austin and the other two had to remain vigilant all the time.
Once Aiden gets to know where Austin is heading, he will surely launch an attack on Drenovar, or worse, he might inform Hener about Austin's movements to get him assassinated.
That's why this whole mission needs to be done in utter secrecy.
Austin didn't know how he would execute the whole plan, in Drenovar. He doesn't have the luck of the Protagonist and the worst part is that he is the Prince of the nation they are planning to take their revenge on.
'Well, I think there is still some hope…' Now all depends on whether he could find the Eternal Flower and extract its essence.
'System, what's the status?'
[Ding!]
[Combat: 41/100]
[You have unlocked a reward!]
{Next reward at 60}
[Romance: 42->50/100]
{Next reward at 60}
[Durability: 53/100]
{Next reward at 60}
[Trickery: 33/100]
{Next reward at 35}
[Overall Progression: 43/100]
[Next Reward at 50]
…
Austin was too sleepy last night to notice the reward, and when he reached the capital, his attention was completely diverted.
'But…how did my romance stat develop?'
Austin received no response from the system, but Austin didn't need an answer in the first place since he soon realized what changed.
'Okay, open the reward.'
[Ding!]
[Kinetic Charge: Accumulates energy through combat, including movement, damage taken, and damage inflicted. The stored energy can be released in a single, devastating attack.]
[Limitation: Can be used once after five hours of complete body rest.]
[Note: Can be upgraded using status points]
…
Austin's brows were raised in surprise. He understood the application of the skill and was quite excited to use it.
'Launching the accumulated force of combat…nice.' And the recovery time was low as well.
"Young master, we are here." Seeing Sebastian slowing down his horse, Austin and Valerie followed suit.
It was the first time for Austin to be here, given the dangers of the place. However, he wasn't completely lost because in the game he has come here several times.
The great forest stretched endlessly, its towering trees casting deep shadows over the land. Thick vines curled around ancient trunks, and the air buzzed with the sounds of unseen creatures.
They could hear the rustle of creatures everywhere, once in a while, Austin spotted a few eyes of those beasts looking at them. However, despite being so close to them, they chose to retreat because of a single person.
"Should we stop here or go deeper?"
Valerie asked as she remained on top of the horse while looking around.
Austin hummed before saying, "Sebas, arrange a camp here since it will take some time to find the Eternal Flower."
Sebastian nodded, "Understood, sir."
Austin jumped off the horse and helped Valerie get off as well, before he said, "Want to come along and discover a little?"
Valerie smiled, "Sure."
Leaving the old man behind, the duo embarked on a little journey to explore the forest a little.
With their hands connected, Austin moved carefully so as not to trip and make them both fall down.
The forest was too dense and dark, that's why Austin took out a small flare and lit it up.
It was quite exciting to visit the forest, which he had seen only in the game. Although the graphics cannot be compared to the real vision at all, he could identify a few things based on his memory.
"I was thinking…it would take us much longer to reach the Drenovar through a straight route." Valerie suddenly spoke, which made him curious.
"Do you have any better route in mind?"
Valerie responded with the plan she had been formulating for the whole journey, "If we travel to our west, we will reach the water bodies in a day, at most. And by hiring a fireheart vessel we could reach Drenovar in one day."
Austin hummed—this was actually a good idea. It will take almost four days for them to reach Drenovar if they travel on horses, and even if they only take a couple of hours of rest.
However, using the waterways would surely shorten the time since Drenovar was situated on the shore of the Ocean of Separation.
However, "Two problems," Austin began, "First, because I used WarpMail, I don't have funds to rent a Fireheart Vessel."
"I can give you the money!" Valerie instantly added, ushering Austin to pause and look at her.
Valerie's enthusiasm died as she slowly whispered, "I have got them through monster subjugation in the past. I have no use for that money, so please use it."
She became hesitant because she suddenly remembered something her mother told her a few years back,
'It hurts a man's ego to get help, especially financial help from their woman. So be very careful.'
She was anxious that she might have insulted him, but Austin suddenly chuckled, "I don't mind using your savings...but is that really okay?"
Valerie was momentarily stunned seeing him being nonchalant. But then, putting her Lord in the same category as the other men is truly blasphemous for her.
With a smile, she nodded, "Yes, there could be no greater purpose for using this money."
Austin smiled at the girl before a sigh soon seeped through his lips, "But there is one more problem."
Valerie raised her brows, urging Austin to add,
"The port from where we could take the Vessel and the whole city on the West is under the Union Council's control."
The Ocean of Separation separates the human world from the Demon's domain. That's why, the nearest city to that border was where the Council's headquarters was situated.
And if they spot Valerie there, they surely would investigate the matter, given an S-rank moving around between nations could never be good news.
Austin heaved a sigh, "We are already doing it covertly, but hiding from Council would be too difficult."
The duo turned silent and decided to make the decision after discussing it with Sebastian.
°°°°°°
A/N:- I hope you are liking their development. Drop a comment and let me know.

chapters.title: Chapter 94: Chapter 93- Against the Golem
chapters.content:
Chapter 94: Chapter 93- Against the Golem
When the sun approaches the horizon, the last droplet of sunlight falls on it.
The brightest flower of the world, that contains the remedy of every contamination.
The scent which could make one dazed, and lose the sense of direction.
Standing apart from all its brethren is the red-blooming flower that only appears once in a thousand years.
Austin remembers these lines, which, as the character Rhea, he collected as hints to find the Eternal Flower.
The sun was about to go down and he was slowly identifying the traces of those places which he once saw through a monitor screen.
"Are you tired?" Austin asked since they had been walking for the past one and a half hours.
Valerie shook her head, "No, not at all. It's just...this place is quite unsettling." She said while looking around and sensing various hostile presences.
"Well, this is the ultimate training ground for a warrior. They often come here as a newbie, and when they leave, they leave as a veteran warrior."
Valerie nodded, "Indeed; I only have come here once even though my house is so near to this place."
Valerie was allowed to subjugate monsters by participating in raids. However, her father had forbidden her to come into the great forest because of the dangers lurking there.
However, she has came here once, by going against her father words.
It was the day when she had an argument with Austin...well, not argument, rather, it was one-sided.
The day was when Austin clearly told her to go away from his life and never show her face in front of him. He also demanded her to never reveal the fact in the academy, that they are engaged.
To forget about what happened, she came here and fought seven A-rank beasts one after another, and that led to the third evolution of her Shard.
Remembering that day...and seeing how close they are today, Valerie couldn't help but smile in contentment.
Although the path was full of thorns, she had finally reached the position in life she had always dreamed of.
"We are reaching it," Austin spoke, a sudden rush of excitement she could feel from him, as he pulled her.
Crossing a few more meters and barely avoiding the thick roots snaking across the ground, they finally stepped into a clearing—an unexpected break in the dense, endless forest.
"What is...this scent?" Valerie was amazed by the sudden sweet smell that assaulted her nose as she looked around to find the source.
Austin warned, "Cover your nose or you will get under its hypnosis."
Valerie heeded his words and instantly pulled the makeshift mask she had made earlier with a piece of her clothes.
Austin's eyes narrowed as he saw the long curved tree that was flowing towards the sky and had a peculiar design of leaves.
He couldn't be mistaken about it—the Eternal Flower is within the bark of the tree.
Austin released Valerie's hand, and told her, "Unless I am about to die, don't interfere."
Hearing the word 'die' made her panic as she instinctively asked, "What are you going to do?!"
Austin didn't reply to her; rather, he stepped toward the tree slowly. If his memory serves right—
**KRIK**
The ground rumbled, and inches away from his feet, the surface caved in.
Austin summoned his dagger and got ready for the battle.
The earth trembled as cracks spread across the ground. Dust and loose soil crumbled away, revealing a deep hollow beneath. A low, grinding noise echoed through the air like stone scraping against stone.
Then, from the depths of the ground, something began to rise.
A faceless figure, tall and broad, emerged from the earth. Its body was made of dark, rough stone, its surface covered in ancient carvings that pulsed faintly. As it pulled itself free, chunks of dirt and broken roots fell from its massive frame.
Its head was smooth, without eyes, nose, or mouth, yet an eerie presence surrounded it. The golem's heavy limbs moved with slow, deliberate strength, cracks glowing faintly as energy coursed through its body.
Valerie held her breath upon seeing the Golem appearing out of nowhere, as she asked, "Austin...please don't tell me you are going to fight it alone."
"That's the requirement, Val. I need to defeat that thing or we won't get that damn flower."
Austin flexed the dagger in his hand, the size of the blade increasing as he crouched low and got into a fighting position.
The Golem took a step forward—
**CLANG**
The deep sound of metal brushing against stone resonated as Austin launched into a blur and attacked it head-on, but as expected,
"Not a scratch."
The Golem turned its massive frame towards Austin, its featureless face showing no emotion, but Austin could tell that it had considered him as its opponent.
"My Shard won't do..."
Valerie gasped. She covered her mouth as she saw her Lord suddenly summoning something that definitely wasn't his Shard.
A double-edged axe with a majestic white handle and thunder wrapped around it, appeared in his hand as Austin prepared for another strike.
'The battle axe makes me a little slower...but with this enemy, I just need to land a decisive blow on its neck.'
Austin lunged forward, and this time, the Golem also moved faster, raising its hand, and several long roots erupted from the ground.
Austin jumped on his feet and used the roots as a platform to launch toward the Golem.
Thunders crackled around him as he launched a front strike toward the Golem, but the thing easily swatted the attack away with its left hand and followed with a right punch.
Austin twisted in midair, narrowly avoiding the full force of the golem's punch, but the sheer wind pressure sent him flying. He slammed into the ground, rolling several times before stopping on one knee. His body ached, his arms stung from the impact, but he had no time to breathe.
The golem was already moving, raising its massive foot to crush him.
Austin gritted his teeth and kicked off the ground, barely dodging as the foot slammed down, sending a shockwave through the earth. He reached for his axe, but the golem's next attack was already coming. A thick root shot from the ground, wrapping around his ankle and pulling him
Off balance.
"Tch!" Austin swung his axe in a desperate arc, slicing the root apart just before another lashed toward him.
He rolled to the side and sprang forward, his axe crackling with thunder. He needed to go for the joints. The neck, the arms—any weak spot he could find.
He leaped, bringing the axe down on the golem's shoulder.
CRACK!
Lightning surged through the blade as it struck, sending sparks flying. A deep fissure split the golem's stone body, and for the first time, it actually recoiled.
But then—
THUD!
A stone fist slammed into Austin's stomach, sending him crashing into a tree. The impact stole the air from his lungs. He coughed, blood dripping from his lips as pain exploded in his ribs.
"That...hurt," he muttered, wiping his mouth.
"Austin! Are you okay?" Valerie appeared beside him out of nowhere, with concern written over her face.
Austin glanced at her, with a smile extending his lips, before he told her, "Just a few minutes, sweetie."
His figure blurred in lightning as he appeared above the Golem
The inhumane raised its hand to grab Austin however, Austin phased through the arm, appearing behind the Golem before he struck the axe,
**TING**
Loud reverberation erupted, shaking the surface as the Golem was forced forward with that thunder-clad attack.
However, before Austin could have thought of launching another attack, the Golem raised its foot and slammed it against the ground.
The surface trembled before several spikes began appearing from random spots.
Austin's eyes widened as he jumped in time, or he would have been stabbed.
Letting his Axe disintegrate, he flipped into the air, and landed on one of the branches, before a rock came flying his way,
"Shi-*CRACK*"
**BOOOOOM**
He jumped just in time before the rock took down the whole branch and launched into the air.
Austin was airborne for a moment, as he assessed the battlefield.
The inhumane beast slammed its hand on the ground before a pillar of stone launched toward Austin.
The blond Prince twisted in the air, but it was not enough to dodge the incoming attacks, as he was sent flying way above.
"Guh!"
Austin groaned as he found some of his ribs snapping from that last attack, as he stood to stop the stone pillar.
He was above the forest roof and barely could see the Stone warrior staring back at him with its arm crossed.
"Quite cocky, you are," Austin growled as he received a notification,
[Skill is ready to discharge!]
A grin formed on his face, as Austin prepared for the final strike.
'System, use my points to improve my Durability.'
[Host is needed-]
Austin didn't wait to respond and shot toward the Golem.
The stone pillar cracked upon his launch, as he moved toward the Golem straight ahead with his punch reeled back.
The Golem also didn't show any intention of moving away as it pulled its right hand back, its hand coiled in a punch.
Valerie held her breath and was prepared to jump in any moment now.
However, she never expected the collision to be so devastating,
**BOOOOOOM**
The instant their fists met, a massive shockwave ripped through the forest. Trees bent and snapped, the ground shattered, and debris blasted outward in every direction. A deafening explosion shook the air as lightning and raw force collided with unyielding stone.
A deep, splitting noise echoed. The sheer impact sent a violent gust tearing through the battlefield, uprooting everything nearby. Dust and smoke surged like a storm, swallowing the scene in thick, blinding chaos.
For a long moment, nothing moved.
Then, as the dust slowly settled…
Austin stood tall, breathing hard, his figure outlined against the wreckage. His arm was reddened because of the impact. But the most noticeable thing was the pile of stones resting around him.
'Haah...this was tougher than I thought..'
°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 95: Chapter 94- Reward
chapters.content:
Chapter 95: Chapter 94- Reward
Austin heaved a sigh as he finally defeated the Golem.
In the game, it took him three attempts to defeat the monster by himself.
However, in real life, only one attempt was hefty, and Austin didn't have to retort on attacking the monster's weak points to win.
'That Kinetic Charge was quite overpowered...' He looked at his charred fist and could feel the lingering energy still pulsating.
His arm wasn't broken, but a few fingers were dislocated.
For a moment, Austin felt he could even defeat God with that much strength…however, he soon realized he was overestimating himself.
"Are you okay? Does it hurt?" Valerie appeared before him; very carefully, she lifted his hand and took out a vial of cooling potion.
However, the moment she dropped it,
**SSSZZ**
The liquid turned into mist and evaporated instantly.
"Ahaha…it's not that bad."
Valerie believed him…not.
Parting her lips, she used her Soul energy before blowing cold breathe over his burnt hand.
"Ah…" Austin winced as the cold sensation assaulted him and provided him relief.
He…might have pushed himself a little there, but there was no better method to defeat the enemy.
Seeing the cold wind directing from her lips, Austin was suddenly reminded of something, which he casually revealed,
"You know Val, why did I name my dagger Frostfang?"
Valerie slowly lifted her eyes and stopped blowing over his wounded arm.
With a warm smile, he said, "Because I wished to awaken an element as cool as yours."
Valerie's eyes widened slightly. She knew that he had named his Soul Shard but never did she expect him to name it with such an intention.
Lowering her eyes, she mumbled, "But…you're already too cool. Earlier, you made my heart race."
The way she hid her face with his arm and the tips of her ears turned red aroused extreme sweet aggression as Austin ended up hugging the girl.
"Eh…w-why so suddenly…"
Austin complained, "Blame yourself for being so adorable."
The girl might need to use her skill to cool down her head now…
…
Behind a tree, Sebastian heaved a sigh, as he decided to stay hidden for the time being.
His eyes traveled towards the broken wreckage in the middle of the clearing, as a thought passed through his mind,
'That strength…could only be possessed by an elite A-rank…and even so if they have gained experience in combat…'
Sebastian had been watching the battle since the beginning but didn't interfere after he heard what his Lord told Lady Valerie.
The battle was quite interesting and surprising since his Lord summoned something that definitely wasn't his Shard. Not only that, the fighting skill and battle instincts he showed was surely far greater than the version of him who fought against Sebastian before the tournament.
'This unnatural progression of yours is both awe-inspiring and concerning.'
There was no doubt that Sebastian was quite proud of seeing his Master getting better and better passing each day.
All those mockery and teasing he has faced until now. All those mouths that called him worthless and whatnot. Austin would get back to them with his achievements. As a student and as a Prince.
However, with his current progression, it wouldn't be far off when the Union Council gets a whiff of it and they start to keep an eye on him.
As his butler, Sebastian would try his best to keep those unnecessary eyes away, however, if the Council really gets into it, it would be nearly impossible for the young lord to live a free life without the burden of becoming one of the Pillars of humanity.
'I just hope you attain peace and happiness on whichever path you walk.'
°°°°°°
After Valerie 'healed' his arm, Sebastian appeared before them, "I see that you have been through a brutal battle, my lord."
Austin smiled, "Well, it was a necessary struggle for the sweet reward."
Austin turned towards the single tree in the vicinity, which hadn't been damaged despite the collision between him and the stone monster.
He approached the tree followed by the two.
The only reason Austin chose to face the monster alone—despite having Valerie by his side—was his knowledge of its abilities.
Lately, he had come to embrace difficult battles, but this time, his decision wasn't just about the challenge. He didn't want two S-ranks clashing at once.
After all, the monster could adjust its strength to match its opponent
Now, since Austin was B-rank at most, the golem easily adapted to the strength level and might have won if only Austin didn't have that cheat ability of Kinetic discharge, which made him a high ranker in that single moment—taking the monster by surprise.
*Crunch*
The moment Austin's hand landed on the tree, its trunk began to wither, and turn grey.
The leaves began to fall, and the trunk became grey and dry as husk.
Austin removed the obstacles before his eyes landed on the source which would pacify the situation between Drenovar and Eryndor.
"It's…beautiful…" Valerie muttered as she looked at the flower.
It was a red blooming flower with three large petals, growing from the ground and radiating an ethereal glow. Each petal shimmers with a deep, almost otherworldly luster as if holding the glow of embers within.
Austin heaved a sigh, 'In reality as well, I will only get three vials of the potion.'
He carefully began tearing the petal, and told Sebastian, "Can you start boiling some water?"
"Yes, right away." Sebastian went back to the camp before bringing the small stove and a wide pot filled with water.
Austin carefully released the petals in the boiling water and saw it burning, yet no flames appeared.
The color of the water changed, taking a pretty crimson shade, as it got mixed with the water—becoming a potion worth billions of gold coins.
Once the petals completely got dissolved, Austin took out a vial from his pocket, before, with Sebastian help, he carefully poured the liquid in the vial.
Looking at the crimson fluid resting inside, Austin muttered, "We might save Eryndor from its possible doom with this."
°°°°°°°
A/N:- I kept the pace since everyone liked it. Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 96: Chapter 95- Love
chapters.content:
Chapter 96: Chapter 95- Love
"Is that so?" Aiden had a pretty smile on his face as he heard the report of the two soldiers he sent behind Austin and the other two.
He wanted to make sure that his dear younger brother reached the Academy safely. As a responsible older brother, it was the least he could have done for his beloved younger brother.
However, the two soldiers who were after the carriage, completely lost track of them after crossing the city on the north. They said the carriage vanished all of a sudden.
Wow.
*SQUELCH*
A sword was pierced into the man on the left, his blood gushing out from the cut, as he struggled to breathe, "How diligently do you two receive the monthly wages?"
*PULL*
*SQUELCH*
"Aghhhh!"
Pulling the blade, he stabbed the soldier again, using his skill to make them lose their focus and leave no room for retaliation.
With a smile never leaving his face, he pulled the sword again, "And when I truly needed you," *STAB*
"Ahhhhh! Young master! Ple-pleass...d-d-don't kill me...m-my family..."
Aiden's grin widened, "Oh you have a family? Then surely, I can't let them experience the pain of living without you right?" Those words caused the dying soldier's eyes to widen in shock, as he begged,
"P-Pl-Please..."
Aiden snarled before pulling out his sword and beheading the man at once.
*Thud*
The head of the man fell to the ground followed by his lifeless body.
Aiden allowed his Shard to disintegrate before he turned towards the other one.
"You...your name is Aton, right? How much do you love your life?"
The soldier fell to his knees, and with his head lowered, he voiced, "Just one chance, sir...I will even kill the Second Prince for you." His voice was shaky and the whole person looked on the verge of fainting under the effect of Aiden's skill.
Aiden rolled his eyes, "I will be doing the honor of killing that swine. You just need to go and check whether he has actually reached the academy or not. If you don't return by the third day, you know what will happen to you."
The soldier didn't utter another word before disappearing from the room.
Aiden heaved a sigh, before he called out, "Send someone to clean this mess."
°°°°°°°°
Austin discussed the plan with Sebastian regarding renting a Vessel from the port and reaching Drenovar through waterways.
"That ..is a good plan and would give us some breathing space during our visit." Sebastian voiced.
After reaching Drenovar, they would need to first assess the situation before executing their plan, and considering only thirteen days remain before the tournament begins, they need to make it quick.
Now, under these circumstances, using the straight path would take a lot of time in traveling and very little time to prepare. Not to talk about the exhaustion of the journey and possible battles they might need to face en route.
As such, "We should follow the plan Lady Valerie suggested." Sebastian landed on the decision.
"Then what about the Council?" Austin asked.
Sebastian told them, "I can help you disguise completely. However, under no circumstances could you two get into a battle with anyone when we were there since after your battle, Young Master, you had during the trials would surely have piqued the Council's curiosity."
Austin nodded, "True. Then we are taking the risk and renting the Vessel."
On that note, everyone finished their dinner and decided to call it a day.
....
Austin was sitting by the campfire, keeping an eye on the surroundings.
Naturally, in this environment, it would be dangerous for everyone to sleep.
Sebastian volunteered to remain awake, but Austin used his authority as his master and told him to immediately go to sleep.
Unlike Austin and Valerie, who got some hours of rest during their journey, the older one hadn't slept a wink since he left the Academy.
'Ah, that reminds me System...what were you saying when I launched toward the Golem?' Austin remembered that he told the system to improve his Durability before he went for the frontal attack.
[The host has to specify how many points need to be used to increase Durability stats.]
"..." Austin was rendered speechless for a moment, before he asked, 'Did you not improve my Durability then?'
[No, host :)]
The audacity of the system to put that smiley near the end...
A frown marred Austin's face as he asked, 'Then how did I tank that much recoil and the force behind the Golem's attack without breaking my arm?'
That much force would have shattered his arm completely and might have led to some serious damage. However, all Austin broke was his middle and index finger.
[Ding!]
[The Kinetic Discharge creates a field of energy around the discharge point, that prevents the host from taking any recoil damage.]
Austin raised his brows, 'Then what about the punch of that Golem.'
[The host's physical tolerance is much more than his tolerance toward extreme heat and cold, due to his last confrontation against the Giants.]
Austin hummed; understandable.
The fact is that his stats only increase when all the sub-stats increase.
His physical stats might continue to increase, but until he doesn't improve his tolerance toward other things, like hot, cold, poison, and potions, he won't be able to progress his Durability.
And because of that, he needs to ask for some quests.
'Well, not now, since I need to focus on the task at hand.' He couldn't have himself drugged under the requirement of the quest while he was on his way to Drenovar. It would be disastrous.
*Scruff*
Austin heard something shuffling from his left but he didn't panic, and asked,
"Can't sleep?"
Valerie slowly came out of the small tent Sebastian had planted earlier.
The man himself was sleeping in a sleeping bag under the starry sky while offering the small tent to the two teenagers.
Valerie sat down on the same log as him and shook her head, "I already had plenty of rest."
She extended her hands and allowed her reddened hands to get some much-needed warmth.
The month was nearing Polaris—the last four months that ended a year, which explains the sudden temperature drop.
Austin summoned a blanket from his inventory while pretending to pull it from beside him before he draped it over her shoulder and scooted closer to get into the same blanket.
"Let me warm you up." Austin held her cold hands between his and rubbed them softly.
The sudden intimacy made the girl's cheeks glow with slight crimson but the smile on her face made it clear that she welcomed the closeness.
For a few moments, there was silence between them. The only sound around them was the crackling fire and the hooting of nocturnals.
Breaking the ice, Austin asked, "Val, what aim did you have when you joined the Academy?"
Valerie was surprised by being asked about her intentions suddenly.
For a moment, she thought of making up some pretty lies, but then, she had already taken an oath to never lie to her beloved.
Lowering her gaze, and a smile extending the edges of her lips, she said, "I...see you as my idol. Back then, I only wished to walk on the same path as you, that's why I joined the academy."
Austin raised his brows, "You...didn't come here because this was your best choice?"
Valerie shook her head, "I actually...got an invitation from Ravencourt when the news of my Third Evolution went out."
Austin's eyes widened. The Ravencourt?!
The strongest nation in existence, and the academy ranking at the top?
A student dreams of studying in that prestigious Academy and three Pillars of Union have been admitted from the central academy of Ravencourt.
"Val...you rejected that offer because of me?"
