Valerie instantly shook her head, "It wasn't like I rejected them solely because of you since I didn't want to betray my homeland...but yes, majorly, it was because I wanted to be near you."
She turned silent after that.
Austin heaved a long sigh upon hearing that. She has rejected the offer to join the Council and the greatest academy out there just because of him.
Valerie was slightly anxious that her Lord might tell her that she was wrong in making such a rash decision. However,
"Truth to be told...I can't say that I am disappointed in your decision. True...you would have made your name worldwide if you had joined that academy...but still,"
With a smile that was warmer than the campfire, Austin said, "...I am happy that you stayed by my side. Thank you, Valerie."
Valerie's eyes kept on his; a lot of words were exchanged, but not a word was spoken.
They just kept looking at each other for a long time, and that was enough to tell her how glad he was that she didn't go.
They, slowly, were understanding each other's emotions better...feelings closer as the day passed.
There were numerous emotions they had felt for each other in the past. Grief, betrayal, regret, and whatnot.
However, beyond all those thorny paths, what remained was the beautiful feeling of love.
°°°°°°°
A/N:- Happy Valentine's Day. Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 97: Chapter 96- A sudden obstacle
chapters.content:
Chapter 97: Chapter 96- A sudden obstacle
The next day, early in the morning, they first ate something and took a bath in the nearby lake before changing their clothes.
Now, on their horses, they were heading toward their west, where the port city was located.
It would take almost a day to reach there that's why Sebastian has already packed some meat for the journey, since the path to the west wasn't covered with dense forest. And taking a break to visit a town would be dangerous.
Thankfully, there was no one on their tail even after they stayed at one place for the whole night. Sebastian made sure of that.
Now, on the horse, Austin asked the system,
'How many points do I have now?'
[Current points: 176]
Austin hummed; the giants, in comparison to those warriors back in the first dungeon, gave many more points, and it wasn't like the more he defeated, the more points got reduced.
His first goal was to unlock the Shop feature since Austin has a feeling it would be quite beneficial in the long run.
He has read in several novels and mangas, how the Shop feature allowed several items useful within and outside dungeons.
But for now, he couldn't afford to go inside the dungeon again since he had to cross the distance as soon as he could and reach the port without becoming a burden on the other two.
'I need to be careful about my itch for battle...' Recently, Austin has realized that he has been craving battles more and more. Was it a good trait?
"Young master!" Sebastian suddenly brought his horse to a pause, and following suit, Austin and Valerie also halted before they looked into the distance and realized the reason behind his concern.
"Checkpost, huh. Not something unexpected." This route led to the headquarters of the Union Council—the most important body of the human side.
Naturally, there would be checkpoints at several turns.
There was forest on either side of the path—not as dense as the Great Forest—and in the middle of the path were long barricades with several soldiers standing on either side.
"The barbed fence isn't spread for a long distance, so are we still using our original plan?" Valerie added, as they got down from the horses and hid them in the forest.
However, "We can't," Sebastian spoke, as he pointed towards the forest, "They have planted traps in the forest."
Austin frowned and looked at the place he was pointing.
Beneath the muddy lands and between the tree leaves, there indeed were some steel teeth and marks of human movements.
'That...was not expected.' The last time Sebastian visited the Council, there weren't any traps. The soldiers were sufficient to track if anyone tried to use the other route to pass. However, it seems they have added another layer of security; that is why he even suggested taking this route in the first place.
Austin looked around and asked, "How long will it take for us to reach there on foot?" After coming this far, Austin wasn't thinking of backing off.
Sebastian took out a map, and pointed at a mark, "This is the first checkpoint so we might be here
here, around half a day away from the port."
Austin nodded; they can travel that much on foot. The main problem was the checkpoints.
Crossing them would be a hard part.
Not only one but there were three checkpoints, each one of them was connected through an artifact that allowed long-distance communication.
If they attack the checkpoint, which would be foolish given all those soldiers are highly trained and well-experienced, then the other two checkpoints would get notified of the danger, too.
And going straight through by revealing their identity was a total no-go. They would land not on the Vessel but inside the interrogation cell of the HQ.
"It's too risky..." Austin muttered with a sigh as he calculated all the possible routes.
Valerie's shoulders lost their strength...it was her who suggested this idea, without thinking things through, and now, they have already wasted half a day, only to meet a dead end.
When every hope seemed to have dimmed, Sebastian suddenly voiced,
"I might have a way." The older one suddenly took out a stamp from his pocket, which Austin instantly identified.
"Isn't that..."
Sebastian smiled at the young man, "Please never inform your father of this, young master."
Valerie and Austin eagerly saw Sebastian writing something on the parchment, and soon their face lit up with a smile.
....
It was yet another day for the soldiers to be standing in attention all the time, in the middle of nowhere.
These soldiers were picked from their posts from all over the world for this job.
They used to work for different nations and at various corners of the world, when suddenly, their strength and skills were identified, and they were called by the Union council...only to be handed a job as a watchdog.
Well, the pay is good.
"Senior...do you think I will get two days of leave? My wife is pregnant."
The said senior side-glanced at the soldier before saying, "You remain around the checkpost for most of the time all year around...when did you get your wife pregnant?"
The junior scoffed, "You need just one night to plant the seed. Well, you are unmarried-"
The glare from the senior was enough to tell the junior that his request for leave had already been denied.
They returned to their positions, and were standing in silence...until, "Someone is coming." The soldier on the left notified before the senior officer noticed that indeed, a man on a horse was advancing in their direction.
Bound by the saddle was a rope that was tied around two individuals who walked behind the horse. Their faces were covered with a black cloth but the man on the horse was identifiable.
"Sebastian?" The chief of the unit knew the butler, as he called out, "What are you doing here?"
Sebastian got down from the horse before extending his hand, "Long time, Sir Drek." Sebastian knew the man since he once served Eryndor as the Commander of the Imperial Legion.
Sebastian then took out a parchment and said, "You must have heard about the recent attacks on Eryndor, I suppose?"
Drek was aware of the conflict between Drenovar and Eryndor, so he slowly nodded and took the parchment
There was an official seal of Eryndor on the letter that stated that these two prisoners had been caught recently, causing mayhem in the capital, and even tried to assassinate the king.
"The King was attacked?" Naturally, he, who once worked for the King, would feel a little agitated upon hearing that someone dared to slaughter the man he once served.
Sebastian nodded, "Thankfully, I was in the capital at that time so I handled the situation." His voice sounded weak and the man seemed emotional.
Drek heaved a sigh, and patted Sebastian's shoulder, "You are a great man, Sebas. Despite the offer from the Council...you kept your loyalty. And even until this age, you are serving the throne in every way possible. I respect you, man."
Sebastian lowered his head slightly, "Your words are wasted on me. It's you all whom I respect. Away from your families, standing here in the wild, day and night."
The soldiers straightened a little, their chests swelling in pride.
Drek gave a short laugh, as he handed the paper back to Sebastian and said, "We both have our difficulties. While we tolerate the harsh weather here, you have to tolerate the tantrums of that snorty brat."
Very slightly, the person behind the horse flinched.
'No, Valerie...don't react ..' All Austin could pray right now was that the soldier shut his mouth or Valerie might not be able to retain her silence.
Sebastian didn't say anything about that and just kept up a smile as he folded the parchment and asked, "So, can I take them to the Council headquarters?" It was mentioned in the letter that the two assassins needed to be interrogated using the lie detection artifact they had in the headquarters.
Drek nodded, "Yes, of course. And, take this." Drek suddenly pulled out a small red badge, before saying, "This will help you with the other two check posts." With an annoyed expression, he added, "Those people annoy the hell out of someone with hundreds of questions. This badge will let them know that it is an emergency. And once you reach the headquarters, hand it to someone from the security wing."
Sebastian gladly accepted the easy access before he returned to the horse and climbed on it.
"See you around, Sir Drek."
"Take care." He gestured towards the soldiers before the barricades were parted, giving him space to pass.
And with that, they crossed all three checkposts and reached the most secured city of the human side by night.
°°°°°°°
A/N:- I hope you all liked the chapter. Thanks for reading. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 98: Chapter 97- Reached
chapters.content:
Chapter 98: Chapter 97- Reached
They had no problem reaching the port city because of the badge that Captain Drek gave back on the first checkpost.
Although Valerie wanted to go back and ask a few questions from Drek, Austin somehow soothed her anger and brought her along.
"So this is the most secure city, humanity could offer."
Austin heaved a sigh as he walked through the city streets while casually glancing around.
Unlike Eryndor, which has a proper medieval feeling, with regular shops, kids playing around, merchants bringing their products, and blacksmithing shops here and there. This place was much more calm and well-maintained.
He could see the soldiers of the Union Council patrolling around. The air smelled of salt and fresh sea breeze, mixing with the faint scent of baked bread from nearby stalls. The city was alive but orderly—guards in polished armor patrolled with calm expressions, their presence enough to keep trouble at bay.
Here, one could not buy a residence unless there was an emergency in their kingdom or they were a war refugee.
People dream of living in this city for several reasons. This city has the lowest crime rate, and businessmen and merchants don't have to pay import taxes. Those who serve the Union Council get a hefty sum as compensation. And many more benefits
However, despite how rich or powerful you are, the rules of the Council are absolute.
How Valerie and Austin were roaming around so freely? Well, earlier Sebastian changed their appearance by using a potion that completely changed their hair color, making both of them black-haired. The duo wore casual clothes, consisting of checkered pants and a plain shirt to not stand out.
And thankfully, they aren't standing out at all.
"This place looks...tense for some unknown reason," Valerie commented as she saw that even the kids walking around didn't have smiles on their faces and were silently walking back to their houses.
"Given the circumstances under which they must have been brought here, I am not surprised," Sebastian spoke. He has seen a few wars during his prime time, and the consequences the innocent people had to pay because of conflict between two people.
"The Council provides them schooling and appropriate environment so they can get over their trauma," Austin spoke as he also spotted a few kids who behaved unnaturally.
Valerie felt troubled about all this, wishing that no other kid had to live in this place under any circumstances.
They soon crossed the city streets and reached the headquarters of the Union Council.
A massive structure built from smooth, dark stone that radiated authority. Unlike the decorative palaces of kings or the grand temples of old, this building had no unnecessary embellishments—every inch of its design was practical, built for function rather than shown.
Towering columns lined the entrance, supporting a vast archway where the insignia of the Union Council was carved in intricate detail. The flag of the Council hung high above, its dark blue fabric rippling in the ocean breeze.
Several soldiers were walking in and out of the building. Several carriages were parked nearby and several staff members were cleaning around the place, given it was early in the morning.
"You two wait here; I will go and drop it."
Austin nodded before he invited Valerie to sit on the nearby resting bench.
"The backbone of our side," Valerie muttered under her breath as she saw the flag of the Council.
Beyond the ocean was the land of the demons. The place was a nightmare for many.
Valerie had heard several things about the Demonic lands and had heard that humans had ventured into those lands in the past. Most of the time, they didn't return, since even the air of that domain is toxic.
"Whose statue is that..." Austin wondered aloud as he saw a huge statue planted in the central plaza of the building.
"The Great Hero Kane. The one who fought the Demon Lord, a thousand years ago and sealed the calamity."
Austin raised his brows ..so he is the ancestor of Rhea eh? The only one who came nearly close to killing the Demon King at that time when the Demon King was at its peak strength.
The demon lord Rhea is supposed to face would be a fragment of its true self. Yet the protagonist couldn't reach the level where she could defeat the being.
'This time around, Valerie would be at least from the human side...' Valerie was the third strongest being near the end of the story and was defeated through deceit. And the strongest General of the Demon Army also required quite some trickery and a few sacrifices.
However, this time around, Austin has messed up with a few things, and knowing that the Demon Lord would threaten the whole of humanity, there was not a single chance he would stay back and watch everyone fight.
"It's strange, no?" While Austin was distracted by his thoughts about the future, Valerie was still watching the statue as she muttered, "There were numerous heroes who sacrificed their lives; some of them even became the pillar of humanity while the Hero couldn't fight. However, history only remembered the great hero Kane."
Austin gave a short laugh, "Well, it all matters about who has a pretty face and who wields a fancy sword. That person naturally becomes a Hero in everyone's eyes."
It was nothing new. Luke has read many novels where only the protagonists get praised for their brilliance during the final battle, and all the side characters' sacrifice and hard work get outshined.
Valerie smiled. Resting her face on her hand, she gazed at Austin with a warm look before muttering, "Well, in my eyes, the one who wields a dagger is my hero, though."
"•⁠﹏⁠•" Austin averted his gaze shyly. Why is Valerie in such a dangerous mood today?
"Young Master," Soon Sebastian arrived, and Austin immediately got up.
"W-What happened? Is everything alright?"
Sebastian was surprised to see his master being flustered, but he informed, "I returned the badge without showing my face and have already talked to the captain of an available vessel."
Austin nodded, "That's good. We should leave as soon as we can."
°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading. Valerie can be dangerous, eh.

chapters.title: Chapter 99: Chapter 98- Unwell Valerie
chapters.content:
Chapter 99: Chapter 98- Unwell Valerie
Early in the morning, Rhea continued sleeping until late hour and woke up late.
By the time she reached the common hall, the students had already gone to watch the selection trials; that's why the common hall was nearly empty.
'I really should be careful about my sleep cycle...' It's quite a bad trait for someone aiming to become a knight in the future to have such a messed up routine.
She finished her meal as soon as she could and ran to the indoor gymnasium.
Her match was tomorrow, but she wanted to watch a few matches before going to training.
'Rudolph must be waiting...' She and Rudolph had decided to watch the matches together and share what they learned from the battles.
She has told him that she would come early in the morning for a spar, before the trials. However...
As soon as she entered the gymnasium, she was assaulted by the loud noises of the students, cheering and hooting.
She went towards the seat where she sat with Rudolph, thinking that he must have kept a seat for herself.
....however, Rudolph wasn't there.
Rhea looked around, just in case he forgot where they sat. But he was nowhere to be seen.
"Hey, Carter, did you see Rudolph?!" She had to shout since the place was too loud.
The said boy shook his head, "Nope! He didn't come I guess!" Saying so, he turned back towards the arena and began shouting.
Rhea frowned; he didn't come? Under normal circumstances, such a battle junkie couldn't miss the selection trials.
'Something is wrong...' With those thoughts, Rhea exited the venue and headed towards the boy's dormitory
She could ask the warden to check on Rudolph if he was sick.
However, just as she was about to enter the dorm,
*Dhak*
"Ah!"
Rhea crashed into someone even when there was no one standing there.
The other one fell on the floor, and he began to appear out of nothing.
Rhea frowned upon seeing the man who definitely was using a skill to hide himself, and looking at his uniform it was clear that he was not from the Academy.
"Who the hell are you?" The pink head asked.
The man panicked and tried to run away
Rhea grinned, as she summoned her bow, and while taking the aim, she murmured, "Great training dummy."
---------**---------
A Heat Vessel was a boat in which the steam of coal was used along with a monster core to light up the furnace and push the boar at a rapid pace.
The boat featured several small cabins where passengers could rest during the journey. A compact kitchen was also available, though travelers had to bring their own ingredients if they wished to prepare meals.
It was quite spacious in the room, with two beds, one cupboard, one table, and a small kitchen on the side.
The total amount needed to rent the boat, along with the ship captain's fees, amounted to fifty gold coins.
It was enough to rent a big house for three months in the Capital and for a peasant to afford luxurious food for a year.
Valerie had saved a hundred gold coins, which she offered completely to Austin. However, the blond Prince returned the rest after using fifty gold to rent the boat.
Now, Sebastian was outside with the Captain, smoking something unhealthy and talking about the local history of places the Captain had visited in the past.
Sebastian told the two teenagers to rest inside since the journey would take the whole day and they would probably reach Drenovar by the middle of the night.
"Are you feeling fine?" Austin asked as he softly rubbed Valerie's back after she was done vomiting whatever she ate for breakfast
It turned out, she doesn't like the ocean much. Motion sickness caught her not long after the boat began sailing.
"I...would be fine now. I just have to avoid looking outside." She spoke through her hoarse throat.
She has shown a very ugly side to her Lord, that's why she couldn't even raise her eyes to look at him.
Austin heaved a sigh before he went towards the kitchen, took off the small container from the boiler, and poured the warm water into a cup before squeezing lemon juice into the water.
He brought the cup to Valerie before telling her, "Take light sips. You will feel good."
Valerie thanked him before taking the cup.
Austin sat on the other bed while facing Valerie, and he said, "After drinking it, try to sleep. Once you get up, we will be already there."
Valerie nodded, "I will try...but I don't think I can..." Just the slight sensation of moving around made her stomach churn, and her head began to throb. If she focuses on it even just for a few seconds she might again ...
"Okay, let me help you with that." Austin got up, and since she had already taken a few sips of the drink, he rested the cup on the bedside table before telling her.
"Lay down," Valerie was taken aback, but she didn't question him and obediently laid down before Austin climbed onto the bed and laid down on the other side.
Collecting Valerie in his arms, he pressed her head against his chest and softly began running his hand up and down her back.
Generally, this position would have made her a blushing mess. Being this close to Austin was like asking her to faint right away.
However, at the moment, his warmth and peaceful heartbeat were making her aching mind and body calm. She continued to listen to his heartbeat and clung to him as much as she could.
"Just don't think about anything and sleep." Austin softly mumbled as he moved the blanket over her and covered themselves completely.
And it worked. Valerie was feeling much better, here in the dark space inside the blanket and pressed against the only person whom she could blindly trust.
In his arms, she was safe...felt like, nothing in the world could harm her anymore.
Austin wordlessly continued to pat her back and not so long after, he sensed her breathing turning calm.
Austin remained by Valerie's side for quite some time, before he asked the system, 'Can I enter the dungeon without moving from my spot?'
He already had a full night's rest, and he had several hours before he reached Drenovar. That's why Austin was thinking of visiting the dungeon and earning a few points, in case he needs to increase his stats during his stay at Drenovar.
[Ding!]
[You can host. Just think of pulling the illumination towards yourself, and you will be teleported into the dungeon without moving from your spot.]
Austin glanced down at Valerie before kissing the crown of her head, and mumbling,
'Wish me luck, love.'
°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 100: Chapter 99- Defeated
chapters.content:
Chapter 100: Chapter 99- Defeated
In the middle of the desolate land, between the corpses of several giants, Austin stood.
His chest was heaving with long breaths, sweat droplets trickled down his forehead and his back was completely drenched in sweat as he finally finished the first wave of the Giants.
The dead bodies of the fallen ones were slowly disintegrating into nothingness as Austin, one after another, decimated his foes and cleared the first stage.
[Total points: 326]
After defeating thirty giants, he finally gained some decent points. It was all thanks to his change in strategy that helped him defeat them slowly, rather than using a similar technique of killing them with one strike.
Inflicting several shallow damage until they got extremely slow and agitated before delivering the final strike.
By far, it has been quite useful since these giants don't actually cooperate among themselves. Often, they end up coming in each other's way or don't help each other out when in need.
Thanks to their brute nature of just attacking their foe straight forward rather than using throwable like those soldiers, back in the first dungeon, Austin didn't have to worry about some unpredictable attacks.
However, now, he was at the stage where he needed to contemplate his next move.
[Mid-boss: Kautr]
[Points: 500]
[Rank: B-]
Austin exhaled a long sigh as he looked at the twenty-foot-tall Minotaur.
The head of a bull and the body of a caveman. The whole body of the beast was covered with dark hair, but that hair didn't hide the strong muscles of the inhumane, which were packed with strength.
Holding a club in its hand, it waited for Austin to leave the waiting area so it could lunge into action.
The red-eyed beast huffed through its big nose, visible air erupting every time it exhaled.
Just by looking at it, his past self would have decided to retreat. After all, Austin's Shard couldn't stand against monsters with such tough skin.
However, now, he is a well-experienced C-rank, or maybe he has already reached B-; he doesn't know. However, after coming this far and after killing so many mindless giants, Austin knew, he wouldn't get defeated easily by the big guy.
Glancing at the clock he found he had ten seconds left.
"Raijin, Wisp." Summoning the two weapons that would be effective against this thick-skinned beast, Austin got prepared.
The countdown neared zero.
Austin took a deep breath, his body ready to move. He had already planned his first attack—no charging in head-on. He would go around, take the Beast by surprise, and strike where it hurt the most.
BZZZZ
His figure blurred as he threw the boomerang and dashed forward, aiming for the Beast's back, however,
TING!
A loud, heavy sound rang in his ears. Suddenly, his body froze. A cold shiver crawled up his spine as his vision darkened. All he could see were two glowing red eyes, burning like fire, staring straight into his soul.
"W-What the hell…"
[Alert!]
[Your opponent has used the skill 'Blood Lust.']
[The host is paralyzed!]
Austin's breath caught in his throat. His body refused to move, his instincts screaming in panic. He hadn't expected the mid-boss to have a skill like this! And why was his resistance so weak?!
His heartbeat pounded in his ears as the monster took a step forward. The ground trembled under its weight, each step making his chest tighten. The air grew heavy, crushing down on him like an invisible force.
The creature's eyes bore into him, its presence drowning out everything else.
And Austin could do nothing but stand there, trapped in its gaze.
"Damn it, I can't go down like this!"
As the Beast's hulking form loomed closer, a desperate idea struck Austin. Without hesitation, he commanded in his mind—
'Wisp!'
SLING!
The boomerang he had thrown earlier whirled through the air, slicing past the Beast's long ear before curving back toward him.
And then—
"Khak!"
Austin gasped as Wisp slammed into his stomach, forcing him to stumble back. Pain flared through his gut, but—
[Ding!]
[Host has broken free from Blood Lust!]
His lips curled into a grin as he saw the monster stop in its tracks, its oppressive aura vanishing with the skill's cancellation.
Wasting no time, Austin let go of Raijin and launched himself forward at full speed. The Beast barely had time to react before he grabbed its thick, scaled tail—
Then, using the momentum, he flung himself high into the air.
**CRACKLE**
As Austin soared through the air, the world seemed to slow. His body crackled with energy, silver arcs of lightning twisting around him like living serpents.
The moment his fingers tightened around Raijin, the axe responded in kind. Thunder roared through the sky as the weapon came alive, its blade glowing with a fierce, electric light. Sparks danced across Austin's arms, wrapping his figure in a storm of power.
The Minotaur barely had the time to raise its club, as it met the axe mid-air and then,
**BOOOOOM**
A heavy explosion occurred as thunder met sheer strength.
Austin's body was thrown back, flying in an arc, while the beast only stumbled back, but still standing.
**THUD**
Austin landed on the ground, rolled away, and after hitting a boulder, his body finally came to a pause.
His clothes were torn from places, and his cheek and arm were bleeding. His hands were severely damaged by that collision.
"Khuk!" Austin coughed and along with spit, he coughed blood in a thick amount.
His vision was blurry as he barely remained conscious. The fatigue from fighting the fodder giants was now hitting in. And that previous collision surely had caused internal damage for sure.
Turning his head, he saw that the Minotaur has not received a single scratch and was advancing in his direction.
'I guess ...there is no choice ...'
As such, Austin, for the first time, failed to defeat a boss in his first attempt.
Poor him.
°°°°°°°
A/N:- It's not bad that I conclude the battle scene in one chapter, generally, right? I know I don't write interesting fight scenes that's why I keep it limited T~T

chapters.title: Chapter 101: Chapter 100- Destination(1)
chapters.content:
Chapter 101: Chapter 100- Destination(1)
[Ding!]
[Combat: 45/100]
{Next reward at 60}
[Romance: 51/100]
{Next reward at 60}
[Durability: 57/100]
{Next reward at 60}
[Trickery: 30/100]
{Next reward at 35}
[Overall Progression: 44/100]
[Next Reward at 50]
...
Austin woke up in a daze and checked his stats.
He...was defeated by the Minotaur after the first collision.
It was quite frustrating, but that shows the difference between ranks.
He thought he might have broken through into B-rank, but that might not be the case. He might have the speed to fool a B-rank, but his strength and endurance weren't enough to continue.
'My bones are so fragile...' It has become normal for him to feel or hear his bones snapping—and it could never become pleasant for anyone.
'System...you are useless ...can't tell me what stats should I be improving...just Endurance...fuck you...' He might be in a daze but he meant every word he spoke.
It was getting annoying to not be able to track the specific stat. He might end up being the fastest without having the strength, or maybe strong, but just like those giants, he won't be able to track his opponent.
[The host needs to be patient. Once he ascends to the next stage, the host will have separate stats for every attribute.]
So the system says. However, there was still more than half the way left for him to progress. What he would do until then? Just move with the same pace?
'This is so goddamn annoying...' Without him knowing, the weight of the defeat was pressing on him.
"Mm...what happened?" Valerie suddenly opened her eyes, albeit barely.
She looked at his troubled expression...almost like he was angry.
She touched his face, and whispered, "Don't be angry..." She didn't know what made him annoyed, but she didn't like her Lord having that expression.
Austin released a sigh, melting in her touch, before he nodded, "I won't be angry ..." Drawing the girl closer to himself, Austin nestled in her embrace and closed his eyes.
The best source of quelling his frustration was right beside him.
°°°°°°°
"Drenny's in a rough spot, ain't lookin' too good."
(A/N:- Drenny means Drenovar)
While moving the Vessel along with the tides, the Captain spoke up.
Sebastian lifted his eyes from the diary he was writing before looking at the man, "What do you mean by that?"
The Captain, who earlier introduced himself as Yolt, puffed a huge cloud of smoke from his mouth, before revealing, "Lots of soldiers been swarmin' Drenny lately. Hell, some even hitched a ride on this tub."
Sebastian frowned, "Why so suddenly? Is there any situation happening in Drenovar?"
It was unusual for the Council to send troops to a country, and in a large quantity no less. Unless ..there is some war-like situation? But isn't Eryndor in the same state? Why didn't they visit Eryndor then?
"I don't know nothin'. Just take 'em there, and they don't come back. Last time I stopped for a smoke in Drenny, damn near got thrown in a cell by those tight-ass guards."
So...they are patrolling around Drenovar quite strictly, huh? Won't that be problematic if they enter the port through the front gates?
"It would be a hassle to go through port security. Haah~wish there could have been another route." Sebastian threw the bait. Although he knew that the three of them would somehow manage to infiltrate the town, even if there was no other route, there was no harm in trying.
And just as the grey-haired wished,
"You got the right man for the job. I know the best spot where those jackasses won't give you no trouble."
°°°°°°°
Around midnight, Sebastian knocked on the door.
*Knock*
"Yes, come in," Austin called out from the other side.
*Click*
Pushing the wooden door, he was met by a pleasant sight.
The lady was sitting on the bed while the gentleman fed her soup.
Valerie's cheeks turned red, but she didn't refuse to accept the offered spoon. Ignoring Sebastian's gaze she sipped the soup her Lord made for her.
"Do you want some? I have left some in the pot." Austin asked.
Sebastian shook his head, "I had a sandwich just now. Thank you for asking, sir."
Closing the door, he approached the duo before informing them, "I have taken the risk of informing the captain that we can't enter the city through the port. So if I find something suspicious, we might need to dive into the water."
Austin frowned, "Why...did you do that?"
"The security of Drenovar apparently has been increased for some unknown reason. And the Council has been sending their soldiers regularly to Drenovar. We shouldn't risk trying to enter the country through a straight path."
Austin nodded in understanding.
For the Council to send troops...means either some emergency situation has come up or they have taken a step to stop the possible war.
Austin believes the latter to be a too-good-to-be-true kind of situation. Which meant that there was some unwanted situation that might have arisen in the country.
'I hope this chaos helps us to reach the main fort, rather than becoming an obstacle...'
Hundreds of uncertain factors and each one of them could change their plans for the worse or better.
Feeling the warmth of Valerie's skin, Austin raised his eyes and found the girl looking at him with an assuring look, "Everything will be fine. Even God helps those with good intentions."
Austin smiled, as with a nod he said, "I hope you are right."
....
After waiting for another thirty minutes, the Captain yelled from the outside, "Get ready!"
Sebastian nodded toward the other two before he made his way out of the cabin.
If Sebastian gestures, Austin would immediately punch a hole in the wall and jump into the water with Valerie.
However, the moment Sebastian walked back inside, he gave a positive nod, "You can come."
Austin heaved a sigh of relief before he held Valerie's hand and muttered, "Let's go."
°°°°°°°
A/N:- They are surrounded by dangers. I hope you all are enjoying the story so far.

chapters.title: Chapter 102: Chapter 101- Destination(2)
chapters.content:
Chapter 102: Chapter 101- Destination(2)
Drenovar's main capital was surrounded by water from three sides.
The city was built along the shore because, at the time, humanity was locked in war. They needed a base as close to enemy territory as possible to launch quick attacks and defend efficiently. The location gave them a strategic advantage.
That's why two headquarters were established, and one of the two was named Drenovar.
The military strength of the nation was quite profoundly big, and the soldiers were well-trained and equipped as well.
For the Council, Drenovar was both a military stronghold and a source of wealth. In contrast, the Union Council might be willing to sacrifice Eryndor if it came to that. Austin feared this possibility even more after noticing Union Council soldiers moving about.
However, soon, he would realize that the main purpose of their presence here was something entirely different.
...
To reach here, they had to swim for half an hour before they reached the coast and somehow found this motel not so far away from the shore.
The receptionist was really nice since he allowed them to first get freshened up before paying for the room.
After taking a bath and changing his clothes in the room they were provided with, Austin went to pay for the room and food.
"It's quite busy around the city as well." As Austin returned to the room after paying the receptionist, he heard Valerie muttering.
Sebastian was in the other room, changing clothes, that's why Austin didn't lock the door and approached his lover.
"Did you hear anyone talking about what has been happening?" Valerie asked him as she turned to look at him.
They noticed that there definitely was something happening in the capital since numerous warriors were moving around, and there were barely any civilians on the streets.
Austin heaved a sigh before informing her, "We might have arrived at the wrong time, Val."
Hearing that, Valerie's eyes parted slightly, but before she could have asked anything, Austin told her to wait for Sebastian.
Looking outside the window, Austin looked at the bright palace in the distance and felt that it was looking quite far even though he could reach it in a few minutes.
The current situation was quite complicated.
*Knock*
Hearing the knock, Austin said, "Come in."
From the other side, the familiar grey-haired butler stepped inside; wearing a long, flowing tunic with intricate embroidery along the edges, the fabric light yet durable, perfect for travel.
His trousers were loose, gathered at the ankles with leather ties, allowing for ease of movement. A wide sash wrapped around his waist, securing a small pouch and a curved dagger at his side.
"Woah ...what's with that outfit?" Austin sounded amazed and Valerie seemed surprised as well.
He didn't look like Sebastian at all.
"I will be going to investigate the situation later, so I arranged some native clothing to blend well."
Austin heaved a sigh, as he informed him, "I might have some idea what is happening around the place."
Austin gestured for the man to close the door before he sat down on the chair.
Sebastian also approached the duo and stood before his master, "What's the matter, sir?"
Austin told them, "Do you know what a Hellstain is?"
Sebastian's brows drew closer, while Valerie seemed slightly unsure, as she asked, "Is it related to the great war?"
Austin explained to her, "The war between the Heroes and the Demon Lord spread across both realms, shaking the land and sky. Blood flowed on both sides, turning the battlefields red. But the Demon Lord's blood was no ordinary blood—it was cursed. Wherever it touched the ground, it did not fade. It sank deep, leaving dark marks that never disappeared. Even after a thousand years, those stains still remain."
Heaving a sigh, he added, "And whenever chaos rises near those stains, demons begin spilling out of them—until the stain fades."
Looking out of the window, Austin added, "And recently, one of the stains has awakened in the capital because of growing chaos."
They were preparing for the war that's why thousands of soldiers had gathered in Drenovar. And because of that, the Hellstain awakened.
Austin never anticipated it since canonically, this and several other Hellstains only awakened when the Demon Lord returned.
However, he forgot that the plot had shifted, and he couldn't keep any possibility out of the game.
"How many days does it generally take for a Stain to fade?" Valerie asked a tinge of anxiety in her voice.
They don't have much time left, and entering the palace under these circumstances would be quite difficult and risky.
"Generally it takes about fifteen days...based on a country's military strength. However, Drenovar had to ask for the Union's help, which means....the Hellstain is pretty grave." Sebastian spoke without thinking too deeply about it. It was all just a guess, and considering the situation, it seems to be true.
Silence descended in the room after that as Austin kept looking outside.
Sebastian, after a minute of silence, asked, "What do you think, young master? What should be our next move?"
Austin took a deep breath before relaying his decision, "We need to divide into two teams—one would go and check on the situation around the palace. And Sebastian, you would be best for the job. And in the meantime, Valerie and I would go and see the situation at the Hellstain."
Sebastian objected, "It would be too risky, sir."
Austin agreed, "I know but coming here was already too big of a risk. We can't hesitate now, Sebas."
Valerie also said, "We need to measure all the factors before taking any step, Sebastian. And not like we would fight the demons after going there."
The older one exhaled an audible breath, "You are right; I might be overthinking a little." He couldn't consider these two as regular teenagers.
The lady was one of the strongest warriors in the world, and the young master was quite a wise and proactive person Sebastian had ever met.
"Okay then, let's have dinner and then go to our respective destination. It's quite a long night ahead waiting for us."
°°°°°°°
A/N:- I hope you all are enjoying the story so far. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 103: Chapter 102- Assessing the situation
chapters.content:
Chapter 103: Chapter 102- Assessing the situation
The capital of Drenovar was quite vast. There were three sections of the main town—the first section was where all the hotels, public amenities, and the main market were situated.
This area was dedicated to the tourists who often visit Drenovar to enjoy the local culture and the delicious food of the country.
Then there was the next section which was in the middle—the main town where regular people live. The houses here were mostly two or three storeys, and their condition was quite good as well.
Austin has heard that even an average earning person could afford a house in the town, however, there was one condition—at least one of their family members must be working for the capital.
Then, the least populated and the most silent section of the Capital, where the nobles reside.
The houses here were more like villas, situated at random spots, unlike the houses for commoners which were lined up on either side of the street
The houses of nobles are situated according to their desire, and later routes are paved to reach the mansion.
It is usually the silent and posh area of the Capital, however, it was currently under the shades of chaos.
Reason? Hellstain.
In the middle of the noble's district was where most of the soldiers gathered.
The red glaring mark that appeared a few days ago has been spewing savage demons one after another.
"It looks like it's pulsating..." Valerie murmured as they stood at the top of the nearby house and surveilled the situation.
It was a dark long mark, trailing down from one of the villa's middle, and spreading into several roots after reaching the ground.
The Hellstain gave the sensation of being alive, with its shade brightening up like a beating heart, and then the illumination dimming a little.
There were numerous soldiers from the Drenovar side, some were barricading the area.
Some were on the other side of the barricade; fighting the demons that appeared once in a while.
"They can't send a huge force at once..." Austin muttered, "The blood of the Demon Lord affects the soldiers, corrupting their minds and making them insane."
Valerie added, "That explains why they have put so many soldiers behind the barricade. But does being near the demons affect them?"
Austin shook his head, "If one gets scratched from them or consumes their blood, then yeah, something disastrous would take place."
They can't even risk launching a long-range attack and destroying the stain since that would scatter the blood, and the whole capital might get affected because of that.
"Here comes another," Valerie voiced as she saw a gruesome figure emerging from the stain, changing its form and rising from the darkness.
The demon was unlike the one they faced back in the academy. Those demons had sanity and could talk like humans.
However, these demons were pure savages.
They moved on to their instincts of hunting humans. Like the one they were witnessing right now, charged toward the nearest soldier even though it had yet to completely get out of its cocoon of blood.
Austin saw the soldier jumping back in panic and shooting an arrow toward the demon—
**BOOOOM**
The arrow stabbed the demon and exploded—must be an effect of the Shard—which caused the blood of the demon soldier to scatter.
"Gaaaaaahh!"
"You idiot!"
"Shit! It-aghhhhhh!"
The nearby soldiers had to protect themselves from the scattered blood, but some of them were caught in it, resulting in severe burns on their armor and skin.
"They are....amateur..." Valerie muttered in disappointment, seeing a soldier panicking in the face of threat and taking down his comrades too.
Austin heaved a sigh; the pace of the demon was too high, and the soldiers did what was ingrained in their instincts: use their Shard.
However, as Valerie uttered, that was a foolish decision.
"And the worst part....the demon is still alive." Austin sighed, as he saw the destroyed upper body of the demon was regaining the form by absorbing more blood from the stain.
It was completely a horror sight to witness. The demon was nothing but blood—shifting, writhing, pulsing like a living wound. Its form never stayed still, twisting and stretching as if it was barely holding itself together.
Thick, dark-red liquid dripped from its body, pooling beneath it, yet it never seemed to run dry.
"Why are the council members here when they aren't even trying to help?"
Valerie questioned; she had spotted numerous council members earlier when they were advancing toward the stain.
However, around the site, there were no council members that could be seen.
"If my knowledge serves right, then I think near the end of this whole chaos, a huge beast of high ranking is spewed out of the Stain—and defeating that would mean getting rid of the stain."
Austin remembers that when the Demon Lord returned, all the Stains came alive, spilling hundreds of demons and demon bosses at once and throwing the human domain into chaos.
However, since humanity isn't in a state of war, this situation would be handled much more calmly.
"So, Val. Tell me what we should do?" Austin asked as he sat down on the nearby chair.
Valerie felt nervous...was this a test?
After she carefully considered the situation, she decided, "We should infiltrate the palace before the last demon arrives."
Austin raised his brows, "But won't we risk exposing ourselves to the council members who are around the palace?"
"But we don't have that much time either. As Sebastian said, this could take over a month."
Austin hummed, with his head moving in assent.
Valerie thought for a moment before adding, "And there is a high chance that the Council members would defeat the last one right away; not leaving us with enough time to reach our goal."
Austin moved his head slightly from left to right."That is correct. Let's discuss it with Sebastian and make a plan."
Before Austin could have jumped off the building, Valerie hurriedly asked, "Did I pass the test?"
Austin was taken aback, as he turned to look at the girl and found her looking at him in anxiety.
'It can't be ...so she was thinking that I was testing her?' Austin barely controlled himself from chuckling.
Seeing that expectant gaze, he couldn't help but softly caress the girl's head and say, "Yes, you passed."
"Eheh~" Valerie closed her eyes and enjoyed the touch.
She was helpful to her lord~So happy~
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- I mean...she is like that. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 104: Chapter 103- Medic
chapters.content:
Chapter 104: Chapter 103- Medic
[A few hours ago]
[Valorian Academy]
"Why do you always come across such strange entities?" Rudolph couldn't help but ask as he saw the man who was bound by the ropes and was currently lying inside his room.
Rudolph had to return to his room since he forgot something and when he stepped out of the dormitory, he saw Rhea chasing someone with her cross-bow in her hand.
Naturally, he followed his instincts and helped catch the man who was quite agile and strong.
After knocking him out and bringing him to the room, Rudolph heard from Rhea that the man was snooping around the boys' dormitory.
"Can't be helped. I am blessed by lady luck~" Rhea grinned. It wasn't the first time she bumped into a being who uses invisibility.
"He ran away after seeing you, and doesn't belong to the academy....okay, he is a criminal," Rudolph said as he approached the man and knelt before him.
"What are you doing?" Rhea asked as she saw him putting his hands on the criminal's shroud.
"Trying to find which Lord he serves."
Rudolph tore the black shroud of the man. He knew that this couldn't be a passerby or a robber who was trying to steal something. The technique he showed while escaping couldn't belong to a thug.
*Tear*
Pulling away the shroud, he searched his collar and back of the neck before his eyes landed on his arm—and Rudolph froze.
"Isn't that...." Rhea muttered, her brows tensing in a frown.
It was the insignia of Eryndor that they saw on the man's arm.
Rudolph's brows were creased as well—a soldier from Eryndor in the academy and was trying to keep himself hidden?
Was it someone who knew Austin? No, his relationship with the capital wasn't that good to keep a few soldiers nearby. And why would he need a soldier to spy around when Austin himself was in the capital?
And as much as Rudolph has observed the guy recently, other than Valerie and Sebastian Austin wouldn't trust anyone.
Then....a spy? But who sent him? Was he here to just gain some information on someone? Or was he supposed to cause harm?
"We have to take him for interrogation," Rudolph said, which surprised Rhea,
"But who will help us?" They were two students who captured a man under assumptions. People would surely question them first.
Rudolph, with a grin, got up and said, "Our dear vice-headmaster. Did you forget his specialty?"
Rhea couldn't. The ex-hunter was infamous for his interrogation skills. People say that those who went inside his special cell for interrogation either spilled everything starting from their birth or died mid-way because of fear.
Rhea was unsure if they could get help from the vice-headmaster. However, since Rudolph seemed certain, she didn't question him.
"But before that," Rudolph added, "We need to take care of the L-pill."
Rhea tilted her head, "L-pill? What's that?"
Rudolph was amazed, "Someone aiming to become a warrior, doesn't know about the L-pill?"
Seeing the confusion on her face, he told her, "It's a way for a soldier to end their lives before they can get interrogated. In some countries, the soldiers are bound by spells, some by artifacts, but in Eryndor, they use the L-pill, or, the lethal pill."
Rhea now realized what he was talking about, "Quite smart of you..." To not let the soldier kill himself right after waking up, he would remove the mechanism altogether.
"But do you know where that pill is?" She asked.
Rudolph nodded, "I do know but I can't tell you, so face away."
Rhea pouted, "I won't tell anyone so lemme see."
Rudolph chuckled, "Can't grant you this wish, Princess, since I promised my father, who told me about it, to never reveal our military's secrets to anyone. Not even you, Rhea."
In the end, the pinkhead had to face away.
°°°°°
[Next morning]
[Drenovar]
Sebastian returned after his inspection and the group of three reunited at the motel they were staying at.
It was early in the morning, so Valerie was still slightly sleepy.
Austin didn't mind her sleeping since he could have told her later what Sebastian got. However, she insisted on listening to it.
"The security around the palace is quite strict. Three layers of security and there is a high chance for the Council Members to be living in the palace at the moment."
With a frown, Austin asked, "Did you see them?"
Sebastian nodded, "A few of them went inside wearing their uniform but came out wearing casual clothes sometimes around the dawn. They seemed to have gotten comfortable here."
Given how long they might have to stay it was not surprising that the council officers were letting loose a little.
Austin crossed his arms, and thought for a moment; three layers of security were something he expected from the most important place in the whole country. However, these council members can cause unnecessary trouble for them.
"I have another piece of news, sir." Sebastian began, "I noticed a certain man going in and out of the palace more than twice. When he went in for the first time, he had a bag, but then he came out not so long after, returned home then went back. And the next time he walked out, he was carrying his bag again."
Following that, "He lives in the second district, and after investigating a little, it seems he is the medic treating the former king."
Austin raised his brows; that's quite an information.
Richard knew that the former king was suffering gravely from an incurable illness. Although he wouldn't die immediately, since Rhea treats him later in the story, he still remains in a lot of pain.
So it's not surprising for a medic to regularly treat him, to help him tolerate the pain.
'This might work...' Turning his eyes toward Sebastian, Austin spoke,
"You go and rest. I will keep an eye on him."
Sebastian wanted to say something when suddenly Valerie jumped in, "I will also come."
Austin shook his head, "No, Val. You need to go and keep an eye on the Stain. If you find the last demon appearing you need to inform us immediately."
Valerie was slightly nervous about this arrangement, but considering the severity of the matter, she didn't insist, "Okay, I will go."
Sebastian soon added, "Be careful, young master. The medic always remains surrounded by soldiers."
Austin nodded, "I don't plan on approaching him. Just need to make sure a few things."
With that, the three of them went their respective ways.
°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading. Leave a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 105: Chapter 104- Unexpected encounter
chapters.content:
Chapter 105: Chapter 104- Unexpected encounter
Austin was at the top of one of the buildings in the middle-town—keeping an eye on the house where the medic lives.
His plan was to take advantage of his regular visit to the palace and replace him as the medic by using the mask of disguise.
Once he was inside the palace, he could meet the former king in person and help him with his illness. And in exchange, he would ask for peace between Eryndor and Drenovar.
The reason they targeted Eryndor in the first place was because of their ancestors being killed during their visit to Eryndor.
And if they could become angered at the death of their deceased relatives, they surely would get appeased if Austin saved one of their living relatives.
Or so he hopes. However, if it doesn't happen and Austin finds himself being cornered then he has two routes in mind to escape. One of the two might put Valerie in danger that's why he was thinking of using the second method.
"The old man generally doesn't leave the house, huh?" It was quite sunny today, that's why Austin was feeling a little bothered sitting here in the open. However, there was no better spot where he wouldn't get caught and could keep a close watch on the house.
'I hope this improves my endurance...' With those thoughts, he got up from his seat and began looking around casually
The market of Drenovar was not so populated because foreigners are being banned from entering the capital as of now. The reason was obvious.
And the native citizens were also staying indoors unless there was a necessity or an emergency.
'Compared to yesterday, fewer soldiers are patrolling around....' Maybe because of the increasing demons, or they were sent away to some other posts, the number of soldiers was a lot less on the streets.
Or maybe they increase the numbers at night? Who knows—
'Huh?' Austin's eyes suddenly landed on a single figure running through alleys, while crying and shouting for help.
'Is that a demon?' There was a being chasing behind her, wearing tattered clothes that seemed to belong to the military.
A cursed one? But how did it escape?
Austin looked around to see if there was any officer nearby, however, the girl kept running deeper into alleys, where most of the houses were either closed or abandoned. There was no patrolling officer nearby and the demon was closing in passing each second.
Austin glanced at the house of the medic—it was still locked, which allowed the blond Prince to make the decision.
Summoning his Shard, Austin pushed off the rooftop, soaring through the air before landing effortlessly on the building across the street. His body felt lighter than ever—leaping over rooftops was no longer a challenge, just instinct.
His eyes locked onto the girl. The demon was nearly upon her.
Without hesitation, Austin dashed forward at blinding speed. At the last second, he twisted mid-air, his movements sharp and fluid, and sent his Shard hurtling toward the creature.
SHLINK!
The icy-blue dagger sliced through the air like a ghost, its form nearly invisible. The demon's claw was inches from the girl's throat—
SQUELCH!
"KHWAK!"
The monster choked, its body jerking as the blade buried deep in its back, piercing clean through its chest.
The girl was trembling all over as she fell on the ground ...and inches away from her face was the dagger that saved her life.
*Thud*
Austin landed on the ground and told her, "It isn't dead, so move away."
The solemn voice of her savior was followed as she moved away from the demon to the best of her abilities.
Austin pulled away his dagger by summoning it back in his hand as he saw the gaping hole in the demon healing at an astonishing pace.
"*KHRUEGH*" The demon slowly turned towards Austin, its red eyes holding the sheer lust for murder.
Austin could tell that the Demon was weak because it failed to chase after a child, and even failed to respond to that attack.
"I heard you all are weak to the sun?" Austin asked as he twirled his dagger on his palm.
The reason why the demon was in an alley is because sunlight doesn't reach there....and that explains why the soldiers weren't as strict as they were during the night.
Austin took a step forward, his grip tightening around his Shard. The demon growled, its breath ragged, but it didn't charge—it was hesitant.
Smart. But not smart enough.
"Come on," Austin taunted, tilting his head. "I don't have all day."
The demon lunged, claws swiping for his throat. But before it could even reach him—
SLASH!
Austin blurred past it, his dagger carving through flesh like paper. A deep gash split its side open, black blood spraying onto the walls.
The demon howled, stumbling.
Austin didn't stop. He dashed in again—
SLICE!
An arm went flying.
SCHLICK!
A leg followed. The creature crumbled to the ground, gurgling, trying to crawl away, but Austin was already stepping on its back, forcing it down.
"KHRUUGH—"
SHLINK!
The icy-blue dagger flashed once, then sank into the demon's neck.
A sickening crack—then silence.
The body twitched for a moment, then went still, black blood pooling beneath it.
Austin exhaled, flicking the dark liquid off his dagger before summoning it back into his palm.
Austin heaved a disappointed sigh...even though it was not under the sun directly, the presence of the sun did affect its endurance.
'It would be great if I could bring the Demon Lord under the sun as well ...'
"Umm..." Hearing the hesitant voice, Austin turned toward the little girl, thinking of telling her to go find her family—when suddenly his eyes widened.
The little girl slowly grew bigger; her black hair took a light blue shade as she stood before him with her hands in front of her.
"Thank you for saving me, my savior."
Austin wasn't able to respond. No, it wasn't because she was beautiful, since only one beauty can make him freeze like this.
The real reason behind his shock was the identity of the person...
'Isn't she the Princess of Drenovar?'
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading. And I assure you, this won't turn harem under any circumstances.

chapters.title: Chapter 106: Chapter 105- Tough choice
chapters.content:
Chapter 106: Chapter 105- Tough choice
[Capital of Eryndor]
Aiden was in his room, looking at the large clipboard in front of him.
On the board, there were several names: Valerie, Austin, Eryndor, Council, and Hener.
His plans were simple: first, resolve the situation with Drenovar using Hener's help, and while he does so, he would get rid of Austin. And then using his influence, he would somehow get close to Valerie—a person who would become an influential figure in the future with her connection with the Council.
Through Valerie, Aiden would build connections with the Council, and with Hener, Aiden was planning on starting a very profitable business to boost Eryndor's vaults.
His plans were all set and he had already arranged people who would be useful in his venture.
However, his impulsive decision of poisoning the king and failing at it, increased difficulty. Although Hener helped him by throwing the bait of disowning Austin, the sick king has yet to make up his mind.
'I can't let the pieces fall from their standings. I need to make sure that Austin dies before Drenovar loses its cool.' Thankfully, Drenovar was currently suffering from a Hellstain, so it was highly unlikely they would be attacking anytime soon.
Amidst all this, Aiden has somehow lost Austin's track. The foolish kid who was easy to provoke has been showing some dangerous traits.
Not caring about his mother, having a secret chat with the King, and the most annoying thing, his closeness with Valerie.
'That damn woman can be a big obstacle in my path...' S-rank warriors cannot be taken lightly. They are powerhouses who can go against an army, and come out victorious as well. Although Valerie doesn't have much experience, she still has the attention of the Council, and individually, she is on a whole different level.
Her recent closeness to Austin would make things difficult. Even during Austin's exile, Valerie would surely insist on accompanying him...and if that happens, there was a high chance for Hener to fail to assassinate him.
'Before that...I need to first get a report of their whereabouts ...' It was the third day since the soldier was sent to the academy. Aiden wanted to make sure that Austin had returned to the Academy rather than wandering around.
...however, until now, that useless soldier hasn't returned.
*Knock*
"You have a letter, my lord." Hearing the words, Aiden approached the door.
Unlocking the door, he found the familiar maid standing there while holding the letter, "It was sent through WarpMail."
Aiden frowned; someone sent a WarpMail? Considering how costly it is, the soldier shouldn't have sent it, most likely.
Aiden took the letter before closing the door.
Returning to the table, he sat down and first inspected the letter for any trap or curse.
After careful inspection, he took out a small knife and parted the seal from the envelope.
"Hmmm?" Upon looking inside, he found it was from Morkel.
Aiden sent a letter to Morkel three days ago, asking if Austin had returned. The only reason why Aiden still sent the soldier was because of his lack of trust in that Professor.
[Your informer,
The snooping dog you sent was caught by the Hunter. Possibly died soon after. The playground is being guarded now.
About your beloved swine, I spotted him. Don't worry.]
Aiden narrowed his eyes....that useless soldier was caught? Didn't he have an invisibility skill?
'The security of the academy has been increased huh?' It was natural that once a spy got caught, they would double the security. More so, when the trials were going on.
'Well, that helps...' Aiden was originally planning on sending more troops to check on the academy. However, after reading the letter, he decided to not take the risk.
'Beloved swine...eh.' Aiden chuckled. Fortunately, Austin was back in school. Now, he won't need to worry about his whereabouts and can wait for the old man to make the decision.
'I guess I was worrying for nothing.' bringing the letter to the candle, he allowed it to burn into ashes.
°°°°°°°
Sebastian and Valerie were waiting for Austin in the room, and not so long after, the ex-blond walked inside the room.
Sebastian noticed a folded paper in his master's hand, that ushered him to ask, "What is that, sir?"
Austin told him, "We will get to that eventually."
Turning toward his fiancée, Austin asked, "Did you notice anything strange at the site?"
Valerie shook her head, "Just the amount of demons spawning was less, and the soldiers were handling them easily."
That was expected. The stain was, not directly, but still under the effect of the sunlight.
Sitting on the chair, Austin said, "I met a stray demonized soldier while I was observing the medic."
Sebastian frowned, "Did you get attacked, sir?"
Valerie also looked worried, knowing full well what would happen if someone got damaged by that being.
However, "No, it wasn't me who was its target—it was a little girl." Heaving a sigh and leaning back in his seat, Austin added, "I, naturally, saved her by defeating the demon without any problem. But the major problem arrived when the girl showed her real face."
Valerie gasped, "Did she backstab you?" She was already half risen from the bed to check on him.
However, "No, Valerie...rather, she literally showed her real face by undoing the effect of her Shard and revealing the face of Princess of Drenovar."
"...!" Sebastian was stunned while Valerie's eyes widened.
"You...ended up saving the Princess and she saw your face?" Sebastian asked, only to get a nod in return.
"I had no clue that a Shard could have such a strange ability...and now, the Princess calls me her savior."
The expression of shock on Valerie's face was wiped away, and more of a solemn look appeared.
Austin, for now, ignored her and continued, "To thank me, she has invited me to the palace tomorrow. She wants to reward me."
Sebastian raised his brows, "That...can actually work, young master. Rather than using any back route, you can enter the palace as a savior. For saving their princess they surely will be in your debt, and if you end up healing the former King, they would practically embrace you and Eryndor with open arms."
The plan was perfect and more plausible than any of the plans Austin and Sebastian had devised until now.
However, "I don't want you to go." A clear rejection from Valerie.
Her head was leaning down as she muttered, "I know I must be sounding unreasonable, but I don't want you to meet them as her savior. I just...don't want to."
Austin heaved a sigh; he knew something like this would happen.
Sebastian understood the situation. Although far-fetched, there was a strong possibility the King of Drenovar would arrange a marriage between the two children to solidify the alliance between their kingdoms.
Austin voiced, "I knew you wouldn't agree, that's why I brought this."
Austin revealed what was in the paper finally.
The water supply system of Drenovar main castle.
Sebastian's brows grew closer as he read the map, and asked, "You don't mean to say...that you are going to infiltrate the palace, right sir?"
"We have no other option, Sebas." Austin explained, "I kept an eye on the medic and he always remains surrounded by soldiers. If we want to impersonate the doctor, then we would need its blood and also have to knock him out and keep away from the palace in the meantime. That's too risky."
Sebastian pinched the bridge of his nose; he expected that much. However,
"The water refinery is about five hundred meters away from the palace, how will you hold your breath for that long? Not to talk about the water pressure might not be with you."
Austin assured him, "I have recently acquired a skill which will help me. Don't worry about that."
Sebastian was taken aback....how could he possibly gain a skill when his Shard hadn't evolved yet?
First that axe and now this...his young master was full of surprises.
Valerie, who has been silent until now, suddenly asked, "Sebastian..can you leave us alone for some time?"
The grey-haired man raised his brows, before turning towards Austin.
Upon getting the nod, the man gave a short bow and excused himself. He would probably keep an eye on the Stain in the meantime.
Once Sebastian was out of the room, Valerie looked up. There were tears in her eyes, and the emotions Austin could read were definitely guilt,
"If you are going to risk your life...then I would rather let you go with her..." She said those words which, her past self couldn't have believed she did.
However, considering how much risk Austin was about to take, she would rather have him choose the safer path. His life is more important than anything.
Austin smiled at the foolish girl before telling her, "You don't need to feel guilty, Val. There is a high chance that just as I identified the Princess, she might have as well. And her inviting me is just a trap."
Getting closer to her, he wrapped his hand around her head before bringing her closer, "So don't cry, now. You know it hurts me, right?"
In his embrace, she shed tears, while feeling her heart getting heavier.
Was her love for him...putting him in danger?
°°°°°°°
A/N:- I mean...breaking her character felt I would be not doing justice. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 107: Chapter 106- Her savior
chapters.content:
Chapter 107: Chapter 106- Her savior
That night, in the main palace.
The family of six was gathered at one place as the youngest of the family told others about her encounter today.
"Lord....you really will be my death someday, Sophie." The one who spoke was the current head of the family and king of Drenovar—Idris.
The man had a long black beard, his pale green eyes gleaming with a sharp, calculating light. His jet-black hair cascaded past his shoulders, framing a face carved with experience. With his broad, imposing build, he exuded an aura of sheer dominance—one that demanded respect without a word.
Yet now, that fearsome presence was clouded by something rare—concern. His brows knit together, his jaw clenched slightly as he and the others took in the news of the youngest's reckless venture.
It wasn't the first time for Sophie to run away from the palace like this, using her Shard. However, the situation was critical at the moment, with the appearance of the Stain.
"Sophie, you do know that our palace is about half as big as the town, right? Why don't you run around inside?" The oldest child of the family, Hazir spoke up. He was currently combing his sister's hair after massaging her head with oil.
"I usually don't speak against it, but today, you took an extreme step, princess." The first queen—Zahra chided the little one.
The lady has flowing red hair that reaches her waist and a pair of bright blue eyes. She was weaving a sweater for her grandchild, who could be born any day now.
Sophie giggled, "But it was fortunate in a way too, you know, got to meet someone interesting." Sophie hugged her legs as she recalled the person who saved her.
Those sharp eyes, the long flowing hair—the way he gallantly saved her, cutting down the demon with effortless grace. His battle style, the sheer elegance in every movement—it was so mesmerizing that she could still recall each motion with perfect clarity.
She was so mesmerized in that moment, that Sophie remained standing at the spot even after he left.
The second Prince noticed her sister's gaze...it was the same which a maiden possessed when she,
"Is in love," Tavrin spoke up, grabbing everyone's attention.
Sophie was jolted out of her reverie as she turned toward her brother.
Tavrin grinned, "Considering the series of love affairs I have—" the boy was smacked on his head by his mother, but still continued with a smile, "—I can tell that my sister is in love."
The second Queen shook her head, "Don't listen to his words." However,
"Is it true, Princess?" The patriarch of the family narrowed his eyes
Sophie had a profound blush on her face as she retorted, "He is talking nonsense, father. Don't listen to him." Seriously, how can he say something like that in front of Father?!
The youngest Prince teasingly added, "But there definitely is something. You have never shown that expression after coming across a guy. Tell me, do you like him?"
Sophie couldn't duck any lower to hide her face.
Each eye of her family member was now on her.
Does she like him?
But they didn't even share a word...more like he only told her to leave, before dashing away. Does he even know who she was? Would he care? But why would he care when she isn't even sure of her feelings?
While the Princess was dwelling deeper into her thoughts, the people around her—who all have their love tales and experiences—could tell that Sophie definitely had something about the boy.
Suddenly, the Patriarch got up from his seat—startling Sophie as she thought that he might be angry.
However, just as he was about to turn around and leave, he voiced, "Bring him before me tomorrow. I will first assess the brat who dares to corrupt my pure daughter."
As the patriarch left, Sophie glanced at her mother, and after receiving a nod from her, a blooming smile appeared on her face.
°°°°°°°
"So here is the plan," Austin began, "I will go inside the palace through the water pipes and wait for the right moment. If I can get the blood of any servant or family member, I will use the mask of disguise."
While showing the wooden mask, he continued, "I will somehow reach the former king before the time runs out and help him with his illness using the eternal flower extract."
Heaving a sigh, he added, "I need to make him understand that despite having the opportunity, I didn't kill him but rather saved him. If this works, then good, and if it doesn't...well, you two know what you need to do."
Sebastian nodded, "Form a distraction for you to escape, right?"
Valerie added, "And if we fail, you will use the Stopwatch to get out and we will leave immediately."
Austin nodded in agreement, "That's right. However, it's highly unlikely they would chase me out given their close bonding." At some point, it was constantly highlighted in the game that the family was quite close. They can take their lives and sacrifice themselves for each other.
If the world was sticking to the game, then saving the former king, who is still quite adored by the current king, would allow Austin to gain the truce.
Turning towards his lover, Austin relayed, "Now Valerie, as I have mentioned before you cannot use your Shard here, okay?"
The reason was simple: the members of the Union Council.
When someone gets registered in their directory as a potential member of the Council, they closely study them—so naturally, they must have heard or seen the Shiverfall before.
That's why, Austin told Valerie to avoid using her Shard as long as possible.
"Understood." Valerie gave a firm nod.
...
They didn't stay up for long since they would be initiating their mission early in the morning tomorrow.
The water pressure would be with Austin in the morning, and his newly acquired skill, 'Aqua Lungs,' would surely come in handy. Now the problem was his inexperience in swimming in such a compact space. But well, he knew he would somehow overcome the difficulty.
"Goodnight, sir." Sebastian gave a short bow at the door before making his way towards the room across from the gallery
They have rented only two rooms because there were only two rooms available.
Austin and Valerie had already spent the night together before, but still, whenever Austin closed the door and locked it like that, her heart trembled.
Austin smiled softly at the girl who was already lying down on the bed with her hands sticking close to her body.
"Don't be so stiff, Val." Austin spoke as he reached the bed and laid down beside her, "It's not the first time for us."
Valerie covered her face with the blanket, as she watched her Lord from close.
Soon her cheeks were dyed red as she uttered,
"Lights...turn it off."
Austin raised his brows, "Hmm? What's the rush?"
With her gaze drawing down, she uttered in a barely audible voice, "I...I feel shy seeing you from this close."
Austin chuckled, "We have been together for so long yet your resistance is so low. Learn from me. Even though my heart is beating so fast being so close to you, I can maintain a calm demeanor."
Valerie's raven brows went up slightly as she moved her hand and touched his chest.
*Ba* *Dum* *Ba* *Dum*
Indeed...his heart was racing.
That means...she wasn't the only one?
That makes her happy.
Austin soon leaned forward before kissing her forehead and whispering, "Good night." Tapping on the table lamp, he allowed the room to be engulfed by darkness.
°°°°°°
The storm raged, thunder cracking like the earth itself was splitting apart. Rain poured in relentless sheets, turning the ocean into a writhing mass of black waves.
And from the depths, they came.
Shadows surged beneath the water, massive shapes twisting and writhing just beneath the surface. Then, the first one broke through—a monstrous octopus, its slimy tentacles wriggling as if tasting the air. Upon its back sat a demon, its flesh pale and slick like something long drowned, hollow eyes glowing with hunger.
More followed.
Serpents as thick as towers, their scales glistening under the lightning. Giant crustaceans with jagged pincers, dragging themselves over the waves. Fanged leviathans, their gaping maws lined with rows of shifting teeth. And on each beast, a rider—horned demons with jagged weapons, their bodies twisted, their grins wide and cruel.
They didn't roar. They didn't shriek.
They simply advanced, silent but unstoppable, the storm itself bending to their will.
The cluster of demons was all heading in a single direction. The presence of the Demon Lord and the human nations would become their new stronghold.
In the front was the sole demon that remained laying down over a huge wyvern, as he led his pack.
The shore loomed ahead. Soon, the slaughter would begin.
°°°°°°°
A/N:- The arc is about to end. Share your thoughts.
