Chapter 108: Chapter 107- Carnage(1)
*Dhak*
Austin's eyes snapped open as he felt the ground trembling.
He instantly straightened his back and found Valerie standing near the window, "Val?" He called out.
However, before Valerie could have responded, someone knocked on the door.
Valerie closed her mouth and instantly went to open the door, "Sebastian." She called out with a frown
The older one gave a short bow before he entered inside wordlessly, and stood before Austin, "Young Lord, the city is under attack."
It was unusual for Sebastian to sound so anxious, however, the news was quite severe and quite unexpected.
"The demonic army has attacked Drenovar from the ocean. And the one leading the army seems to be a Demon General."
Austin had a severe frown on his face. This was unexpected. He couldn't have thought that a demon army could have suddenly attacked Drenovar out of the blue. And not just any passing army, but under a Demon General.
'Did the canon event get pushed early?' Austin remembers that during the tournament, the venue gets attacked by an army of Demonic beasts, led by General Zeverath.
"Sebastian...did you see the Demon General? Did he have long red horns and chains around his neck?"
Sebastian was taken aback, "Yes...but how do you know, sir?"
As he thought! The three demons were also sent by Zevarath. He has been planning on taking numerous talented humans under his domain and corrupting them to prepare for an army.
However, why in the world did he attack early? Was it because of the failed attempt? But didn't the demon fail canonically as well?
'No, this isn't the time.' Austin couldn't dwell on the thoughts. He couldn't compare the reality with what he had seen in the game.
"What is the situation at the Hellstain?"
"Because of all the chaos, the Union Council member and a heavy amount of Drenovar's forces have been handling the situation at the shore. And because of that, several demons of Hellstain have broken the barricade and have infected several soldiers."
Austin clicked his tongue. The situation was truly messed up.
The demonized humans would continue to grow and in no time, they would start infecting the citizens—turning Drenovar into ruins.
The most unfortunate part was the heavy clouds surrounding Drenovar, with a light drizzle falling over the capital. With no sunlight to weaken the demons, the city stood defenseless against them.
'This is bad....if things continued like this then humanity would lose one of their pillars...'
Taking the decision, Austin turned towards Sebastian, "Sebas, things have changed. Now we need to handle the situation first."
Sebastian heaved a sigh of relief. For a moment, he wondered if his Lord would let Drenovar suffer since that would benefit Eryndor. But his young master hasn't turned apathetic.
"You need to get rid of all the demonized humans who have broken the barrier. Just don't let them reach the public." Considering Sebastian's agility and assassination skills, he was the perfect man for the job.
"Understood, sir."
Turning towards Valerie, Austin said, "Valerie, you need to go and check the shore for the situation. If you think they can handle the demons, then don't interfere. But if they can't...."
"I understand." Valerie nodded.
Austin was feeling a bit complicated about it. The Demon General was on S-rank on human scales, however, with much more experience than any other humans. That's why, sending her to the Shore was dangerous.
"Young master, what about you?" Sebastian asked....if possible, the butler wanted the young master to stay in the motel. And Valerie would agree instantly.
However, "I am going to the Hellstain and keep an eye on the monsters which awaken. The presence of other demons must have accelerated the awakening."
Sebastian looked concerned, "Please be safe out there, my Lord." Saying so, he excused himself and went towards the city.
Turning toward Valerie, Austin was hugged immediately as he heard her, "The only way I can avoid making mistakes, is when I know that you are safe. So please, take care."
Austin hummed, "I will...so please don't do anything reckless and only intervene when it's necessary."
The duo looked into each other's eyes before Valerie closed her eyes and leaned forward.
Austin didn't think twice before kissing the girl, their lips meeting in a brief contact before parting.
"Best of luck, Val."
°°°°°°°
After parting ways with Austin, Valerie advanced toward the shore.
As she advanced, she could feel the profound presence of the demonic creatures from the shore.
"If I am not wrong, they haven't sent a single S-rank from the council," Valerie muttered to herself as she kept jumping from one building to another.
The S-rank warriors are the defense pillars of the Union Council and always remain in the headquarters. For the threat of a Hellstain, it was not unnatural for them to send only low-ranking officers.
However, this was a national-level crisis and without any proper defense against the danger, it would be quite difficult to save Drenovar from its possible demise.
"Oh Lord..." The moment Valerie's eyes caught the sight of the scene, her mind went blank for a moment, and a shiver ran down her spine.
More than thirty demonic beasts surged from the water, their massive bodies crashing into the defenses like living battering rams. Thick, scaled limbs shattered stone walls, while jagged teeth tore through flesh and armor alike. The soldiers fought desperately, but they were drowning in a tide of horror.
Screams filled the air—some cut short, others stretching into agonized wails as men were crushed, ripped apart, or dragged beneath the bloodied waves. Smaller beasts swarmed through the chaos, pouncing on fallen warriors, their claws carving through flesh as they feasted. The scent of blood mixed with the salty wind was thick and suffocating.
A soldier stumbled back, eyes wide with terror, only for a massive claw to clamp around his torso. His scream barely left his lips before he was yanked into the darkness of a beast's maw, bones crunching like dry twigs.
The line was breaking. The defenses were crumbling. And the demons were still coming.
°°°°°°
After leaving the motel, Sebastian decided to move through the streets and help the citizens to evacuate.
There was no guarantee that the demons from the demonic lands could be defeated any time soon. But they at least are limited to a certain extent. However, the demonized humans are growing rapidly. If it continues then no place within Drenovar would be safe.
"Ah!" A woman suddenly fell while running away.
"*KHEEEUGH*" The demonic human was just above her, inches away from tearing her life.
Sebastian instantly moved toward her and slashed his short sword to behead the demonized humans.
He didn't stop there; moving in practiced motion he slaughtered the demon thoroughly into bits and pieces until it lost its strength to recover.
Looking at the woman, he offered his hand before suggesting, "Run toward the south. The capital guards have prepared a safe shelter."
The woman continued to thank him until the very end before she ran away as suggested.
"*KHUEEEGH*"
Sebastian heaved a sigh as he turned towards the horde of demons.
"This reminds me of the good old days of hunting."
°°°°°°
Austin reached the spot from where he had been keeping an eye on Hellstain....but the scene awaiting him this time was quite despairing.
'Even the army of Drenovar couldn't resist the demonic waves....' The Hellstain in Drenovar was quite huge, which explains why so many demons are being spilled out.
Soldiers were trying to fend off the danger by launching several spells at once; however, because of the natural resistance against magic and their ridiculous regeneration, the demons were recovering quickly.
Some soldiers were running away, some were getting eaten alive.
The human barricade that was formed around the palace was having a hard time fighting against the demons and demonized humans as well.
Dozens of demonized humans are advancing toward the towns and chasing after civilians.
'I should help...'
Austin was thinking of advancing towards the Hellstain...when suddenly, a big ripple arrived from the Hellstain.
The stain began to pulse—slow, heavy beats, like a heart too large for this world. Ominous light seeped from its depths, and suddenly, the ground came alive. Soldiers near the stain screamed as an invisible force yanked them forward. Their bodies twisted, flesh peeling from their bones the moment they touched the stain. Their cries ended in wet, sickening gurgles.
'Is it...' Austin's throat became dry in anxiety as he saw long fissures appearing on the surface, the ground trembling under the presence of the being that was about to awaken.
The earth trembled, then bulged upward, splitting like rotten flesh. A massive claw, black and glistening, tore free from the stain, followed by another. The air reeked of sulfur and rotting meat as the creature dragged itself into the world.
A monstrous head emerged, splitting into three, its skull twisted and uneven, with empty sockets that suddenly flared with a sickly red glow. Its maw split open—not like a mouth, but like a wound tearing further, lined with writhing tendrils dripping black sludge.
Huge claws that could crush several humans at once, and bent hind limbs. Chains were falling from the creatures' three necks.
The being awakens out of the blood of the Demon Lord. A hell resident has appeared.
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

Chapter 109: Chapter 108- Carnage(2)
"No, father. Wait!" Hazir suddenly stood before his father, blocking his path.
His second son also stood before him as he said, "You cannot go."
The Patriarch frowned, "You two know the situation out there, but still stopping me?" His voice sounded unnaturally cold as he told them, "Move."
"No, father. You need to stay here and be the last line of defense." Hazir insisted, "If you fall, there would be no one to command the soldiers and assure our people. You need to be here, and take the command, father."
Hearing his eldest son's voice, the King was forced to think about his decision once again.
Tarvin added, "You are our strongest pillar of hope. And if something happens to you...I, us, and the whole country would fall into despair. So please, stay here."
In the end, the eldest one had to accept his son's suggestion and let them go, "Just...be safe out there..." Although he said that, he knew that only a miracle could save Drenovar from this disaster.
°°°°°°°
"You were completely cramped there, Luke. How did you get out?"
Luke has been asked this several times by his teammates and sometimes by his opponents as well: how, when under pressure, does he become so insanely good at rugby?
And his answer always remained the same,
"The thrill of pressure makes me just forget about everything and allows me to focus on my goal."
And that was the same even today.
Austin was in a pinch. The situation was critical on both sides; the coast and the main city. Although Sebastian was out there, decimating all the demonized humans, he also had a limit.
And if the beast in front of his eyes gets out there, countless deaths await.
'The demon is at the very least an A-rank...' The soldiers around the Stain were most likely to get destroyed by that amount of demons and the High Demon would be a huge hurdle to cross.
And he needs to reach the coast in time as well, to ensure Valerie's safety.
So many things to consider, so many things to lose yet Austin found his mind calm and his heart beating rapidly in excitement.
"Hmm? Aren't they ..." Austin's eyes suddenly caught the figure of two people who looked different from other soldiers—wearing expensive clothes and commanding the soldiers as soon as they appeared.
"The Princes of Drenovar..." Austin watched as the eldest son immediately got into battle with the Greater Demon while the younger one was engaged in taking away the fallen soldiers and commanding the others who still could fight.
Because the majority of soldiers were fighting at the shore and around two hundred were surrounding the palace, only about fifty or so soldiers were left around the Hellstain.
'They won't be able to handle it ...'
°°°°°
CLANG!
Hazir staggered back, his arms numb from blocking the Great Demon's claw. His bones rattled, and his grip on his Shard—his shield—nearly failed after just one clash.
'That strength... It's A-rank!' He clenched his teeth and hurled his Shard at the three-headed beast charging toward him.
GRRR!
The monster roared, swatting the shield aside like a toy before lunging forward, its claws thirsting for blood.
Hazir growled, yanking his hand back. His Shard shot toward him, doubling in speed, growing in size mid-flight—THWACK!—slamming into the beast's ribs.
TING!
The impact sent it skidding, but only for a moment.
Hazir summoned his shield back, twisted mid-step, and flung it again—a razor-edged blur slicing through the air.
But this time—
"Huh?*
—the beast vanished!
His heart lurched.
"BEHIND!"
Tarvin's voice was raw with panic.
Hazir moved—but too late.
**CRACK**!
"Khak!" A heavy blow was dealt to his ribs, making his vision blurry as Hazir fell to the ground.
Tarvin's breath hitched. His brother—fallen, and motionless.
Then—his stomach clenched.
The beast stood over Hazir, its mouth curling into a jagged grin.
Slowly—deliberately—it raised its claw.
It was going to tear him apart.
"NO!" Tarvin burst in a sprint but he knew he couldn't make it in time.
The duration of that monster to bring down its claw and the distance between them....it was not possible!
The strongest person in Tarvin's eyes had fallen to the ground, inches away from his death...and he, he couldn't do anything!
"Brother!" The scream was more of a prayer as he hoped something—anything—to save him.
CLANG!
A sharp, jarring impact snapped Tarvin out of his despair. His feet skidded to a halt, breath frozen in his throat.
Hazir, barely able to turn his head, felt his chest tighten.
A boy stood before him. Shard raised.
Blocking the monster's strike.
"Y-You..."
The boy didn't look back. His voice was sharp, commanding.
"Prince! Dodge!"
Hazir moved on instincts as the boy suddenly twirled on his feet, allowing the claws of the beast to fall forward before the raven-haired stabbed the beast on the back of his neck.
"*GRUUUUUOOOO*" The creature howled—a guttural, furious sound.
Not from pain.
From annoyance.
Austin yanked his hand back, but the blade wouldn't budge.
No choice.
He abandoned his Shard and threw himself backward, just as the beast's claw sliced through the air where he had stood moments ago.
"Wh-Who are you?" Tarvin asked as Austin stood inches away from him.
Austin didn't turn to look at him before throwing away Wisp in a random direction.
The beast howled, launching its massive body in his direction.
Austin scoffed before bringing his hand down and striking the beast using the boomerang, on top of its head.
**DHAK**
A dull sound resonated as the demon failed to dodge the attack in time and hit the ground.
"It hasn't unlocked its full potential." Austin realized since that attack could have been easily dodged by an A-rank.
"Prince Hazir, can I have your assistance in this battle?" Austin asked as he saw the Prince finally getting back to his feet.
Hazir, while ignoring the excruciating pain from his chest, nodded, "You are...helping us out...naturally, I will fight..."
"But brother..." Tarvin wanted to say something but was interrupted by his brother,
"No Tarby. You need to stand back and use your Shard when it's time."
Tarvin gritted his teeth...his damn useless Shard can't help his brother when he needed him the most.
"Here it comes," Austin voiced as he summoned his Shard in his hand and got prepared.
The beast shook itself, rage burning in its glowing eyes. It lunged—quicker than before, its claws cutting through the air like blades.
Austin dashed forward, his Shard elongating mid-swing as he drove it toward the monster's throat.
CLANG!
The beast twisted, intercepting with a claw, sending sparks flying.
Hazir was already moving. He spun his Shard and slammed it into the demon's ribs. The force sent tremors through his arms, but the monster staggered, growling in frustration.
Austin ducked under a wild swing, closing in from the side. He slashed—his blade cutting deep into the demon's shoulder.
GRUUUUUOOOO!
The beast roared and retaliated with a tail swipe.
"Move!" Austin shouted.
Hazir barely managed to throw his shield in front of him before the tail crashed into him. He skidded backward, boots digging into the dirt, the breath knocked from his lungs.
Austin leaped onto the beast's back, plunging his Shard into its spine.
The creature thrashed violently, slamming itself against the ground to crush him.
Austin yanked his blade free and jumped just in time, landing beside Hazir.
"You good?" he asked, panting.
Hazir gritted his teeth, gripping his Shard tightly. "Yeah."
The beast reared up, its three heads snarling.
"*UOOOOOOOOGH*" The beast suddenly howled, its massive maw splitting and the ground trembling under the effect of its massive presence.
A shiver ran down Hazir's spine and Austin also felt the strength behind that howl.
'This is bad...' Austin ducked low, as he prepared.
Just as the three-headed beast turned towards him, Austin lunged forward, aiming to plunge his dagger into the beast and end the game.
However,
[Alert!]
[The enemy has used the skill Paralysis!]
Austin's eyes widened as his body slowly came to pause under the glowing red eyes of the beast.
The beast moved, its form vanishing in an instant.
Austin closed his eyes; knowing that he rushed at the wrong time.
However, before the demon could have slashed at him,
**FUOOOOOO**
A melodious sound resonated, making the demon slower with each stride, and just in time, Hazir brought his shield before Austin to protect him.
*CLANG*
The demon's claw was met by the shield, and once again, it failed to attack before Hazir pushed the beast back.
"Haaah....you saved me there..." The moment Austin and the demon broke eye contact, the paralysis effect dulled—allowing him to move freely.
He turned to look at the other Prince and found him holding his Shard—in the shape of a flute.
Hazir gave him a firm nod, before saying, "Eyes forward. It's still alive."
Austin growled, "Not for long," as he summoned his Axe in one hand and his Shard in another.
Time to go all out.
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- This A-rank doesn't actually define A-rank. It's more like a B+.
Well, I hope you liked the battle scene.

chapters.title: Chapter 110: Chapter 109- Carnage(3)
chapters.content:
Chapter 110: Chapter 109- Carnage(3)
In the books, it was mentioned that the Demon Lord had four Generals who became quite a hurdle for the Hero's party during their quest to defeat the epitome of evilness.
Valerie remembers those four beings—their description was enough for her to know what kind of strength they must have held to even trouble the legendary warrior Kane.
That's why, when she came across the one who was riding the wyvern, she knew that it wasn't a Demon General.
'It is a Greater Demon, but not a General...' A General-ranked demon would at least take a group of S-rank veterans to defeat. However, the one she was looking at, didn't give off that presence which could make her feel threatened.
Around the shore, chaos raged as the team from the Union Council, alongside the soldiers, desperately held the line.
Seventeen council members and a hundred soldiers remained, barely keeping the danger from spilling further inland.
The council members focused on the massive ocean monsters, wielding their rare artifacts and Shards to push them back. Meanwhile, the soldiers clashed with demons that had the terrifying ability to walk on land.
Only the Council possessed such powerful artifacts—allowing them to levitate, create barriers, and heal quickly with special potions. But beyond their tools, their coordination was almost supernatural. A single glance was enough to communicate, their movements weaving together seamlessly.
HIINNGRRRR!
A monstrous sea turtle, large enough to crush buildings, slammed into an invisible wall. Three council members held their hands out, straining to keep the shimmering barrier in place as waves crashed violently around them. More creatures loomed in the water, but the barriers prevented them from reaching the shore.
"KHUEEENG!"
The demons lunged toward the city, their thick shells glistening under the dim sky. Soldiers met them head-on, their blades scraping against the hard exteriors. Though their weapons only left shallow cuts, they refused to give an inch, forcing the creatures back through sheer grit and determination.
'Should I interfere...' They were somehow handling the situation, and remembering her Lord's words, she was hesitant to show herself.
It was then,
"You..." The Greater Demon, who was lying on the wyvern until now, called out after sitting up, "... is the one who killed my men, right?"
Valerie frowned—there was no point in hiding since the demon had already sensed her.
'As Austin said...I am bad at suppressing my presence...' Something she has been practicing lately, but it seems it wasn't enough.
Getting out of the hiding spot, she faced the Demon while standing atop a building.
The demon's face split into a grin as he said, "You are strong...someone I want by my side. Leave the human territory and come with me. Your talent would be utilized in the best way possible."
When the Demon began speaking, many people turned to look at her, and for some reason, the Demonic Beasts stopped moving all at once.
Now, the whole focus was on Valerie.
And in response to that proposal, all she said was,
"I refuse." Anything that separates her from Austin is impossible to accept. And here, the creature is asking her to shift sides and become a Demon?
Pest really has a rotting mind.
The Demon lowered its head slightly, before muttering, "If you don't accept," *SHLINK*
Suddenly, a crimson blade burst from the Greater Demon's hand before piercing three Union Council members—followed by an explosion from within as their bodies burst by the huge spikes that emerged from the blade.
"Aghh..." The nearby soldiers felt bile welling up, seeing the gore from so close.
The innards of the soldiers fell to the water and tainted the clear water with red.
The demon looked back up and asked, with a slight tilt of its head, "What about now?"
Valerie crossed her arms, "Do you think it affects me?" The tone she carried contained no identifiable emotion.
Those eyes reflected nothing but emptiness and indifference.
The Demon was actually taken aback—this was the first time it saw a human showing no empathy toward their brethren.
"Interesting...you are more interesting than I expected." The Demon suddenly disappeared from sight—and Valerie instinctively stepped back before the Demon appeared just before her.
Lowering itself, it looked into her eyes before muttering, "Today, either I die or I conquer you."
The temperature around Valerie began to fall as she summoned her Shiverfall,
The people around them gasped and held their breath upon the realization of her identity.
The battle between two S-ranks was about to begin.
°°°°°°°°
Austin and Hazir weren't doing well near the Stain.
Although the soldiers had somehow limited the movements of the other demons, Sebastian has been decimating the demonized humans. However, nothing would work, if Austin fails to defeat this mutt.
'This is bad...that thing is turning stronger with each attack....'
With sweat and blood tricking down his head, Austin looked at the beast that was standing there—now taller and stronger.
By his side, the Prince seemed to be struggling quite a lot as well. He has been thrown to the ground quite many times, and Austin knew that he wouldn't be able to continue for long like this.
"Prince...none of our attacks has been damaging the beast....its weak point is ....those three heads in my knowledge..." Austin spoke, as he tried to calm his breathing.
"I also think so...but even making a dent on that thing is getting difficult..." The beast was quite agile and could sense blood lust, and that made it difficult to attack it.
"I think I have pla—"
Austin never got to finish. The beast lunged, a blur of muscle and malice, tearing toward them.
Reacting instantly, Austin slammed his axe to the ground. BOOM! A burst of blinding light exploded outward. The beast faltered, its charge stuttering as it reeled from the sudden flare.
But hesitation was fatal.
A massive barrier shot forward like a battering ram, slamming into the creature before it could recover.
"HAAAAAH!" Hazir roared, muscles straining, veins bulging as he drove the beast back, his Shard blazing like a second sun.
Yet, even against overwhelming force, an A-rank was an A-rank.
The beast's claws dug into the ground. Its retreat slowed. Then stopped.
A guttural snarl tore from its throat as it gripped the barrier's edges, muscles coiling with monstrous strength. The tide turned. Hazir's feet slid back. The beast bared its fangs, ready to crush him—
*Tink*
Its ears twitched. Instincts screamed.
Eyes snapped skyward.
There, Austin hovered, his body crackling with lightning, the axe in his grip shining like a star about to fall.
Panic flashed in the beast's gaze. It abandoned the barrier, legs tensing to retreat when suddenly—
*FUOOOOOO*
A flute's haunting note sliced through the battlefield.
The beast's body stiffened. Its head sagged, movements sluggish, its instincts dulled for just an instant—
Just enough.
*CRACKLE*
The sky roared in fury. Clouds blackened.
Then lightning fell.
BOOM! BOOM! BOOM!
Bolts of lightning, thick as tree trunks, tore down in rapid succession, striking with earth-rending force. Each impact sent shockwaves rippling through the battlefield, turning stone to dust and carving trenches into the ground.
The beast convulsed. Flesh burned. Muscles locked. The force of the storm drove it to its knees, every fiber of its being writhing under the merciless onslaught.
The people around them could only stare in awe as they witnessed a power so terrifying that it could shake up one's confidence even before the battle began.
And through the blinding storm of light and fury—Austin descended, axe raised, eyes locked onto the weakened prey.
"Its left head...." Hazir muttered as Austin landed beside him, "...it's no longer moving...."
A ray of hope emerged on the horizon as Hazir saw one of the heads of the beast not moving anymore.
"The battle hasn't ended, Prince," Austin spoke, his breathing slightly uneven. That attack just now....took a huge toll on his Soul Energy. If not for his recent fight with the giants that allowed him to know more about the axe, he might have ended up harming himself back there.
"You are right..." The redhead royalty raised his shield and got ready to resume the battle as they saw the beast getting back on its beasts.
Its skin was slightly charred, smoke erupting from its body and the eyes of the other two alive heads were closed.
"It looks weaker now...we should finish this as soon as we can," Hazir spoke as he leaned forward, ready to lunge.
'Something is off...' Austin narrowed his eyes as he felt the aura of the beast quite threatening, compared to before.
However, as Hazir said it was looking weaker than before, that's why, "We should-*SQUELCH*"
Austin's voice got choked as he felt something stabbing into his body, and the sensation registered a moment later.
Slowly turning his eyes down, Austin found the demon standing inches away from him, its hand pressed against his stomach, and its long nails dug into his flesh.
"KHEUGH," Austin vomited blood, as he felt his eyes darkening.
The sensation of death has never been more vivid as the axe from his hand dropped and his Shard faded into nothingness.
....
...
..
.

Chapter 111: Chapter 110- Carnage(End)
[Hazir's POV:]
It was horror.
I have seen numerous fighters all my life.
Those whom I remember always left a remarkable impression on me through their battle wits and unfaltering courage.
As a Prince and someone who would be inheriting the throne in a few years, I also have gone through numerous battles in the past.
However, none of them was anything as gruesome and horrifying as this one.
The three-headed demon, which was overwhelming our forces, and later me and the black-haired boy, was currently getting overwhelmed.
The beast that rose from the Hellstain was a force of nature that I thought we would never be able to defeat.
At one point, I thought we had already lost the battle when the main force of resistance, the strange boy, was stabbed by the demon.
I thought it was the end.
...until the boy suddenly radiated a strange aura which made me step back in terror. An aura that was too eerie and profound for a human. It almost felt like, I was standing before two beasts.
However, soon I realized that I was comparing completely incomparable beings.
"B-Brother..." My younger brother, Tarvy, had a pale complexion as he saw the boy easily parrying all the attacks that the demon threw at him. And in return, the retaliation sent tremors through the ground. Making it feel unbelievable that it was the same boy who was struggling alongside me a moment ago.
'What in the world is he...'
....
As Hazir expressed, the beast was getting overwhelmed by a human.
The ground shook as the massive demon, once unstoppable, now struggled to keep up.
Austin didn't speak. He didn't shout. He moved without hesitation, his actions cold and precise.
One of the demon's heads lunged at him, jaws wide open, ready to tear him apart. But before it could bite down, CRACK—Austin's fist struck with terrifying force, shattering its teeth. Broken fangs scattered across the ground.
The second head spewed black fire, engulfing him in flames. But when the fire cleared, Austin stood there, untouched. The flames had done nothing. The demon hesitated.
That slight pause was all Austin needed.
In an instant, he was in front of the second head. He grabbed one of its sharp canines and SNAP—twisted it clean off. The demon barely had time to scream before he slammed it into the ground so hard the earth split beneath it.
The demon thrashed, trying to fight back, but Austin was faster. A claw strike? He dodged and crushed the arm before it could reach him. A tail swing? He grabbed it and slammed the demon into the ground with its own strength. Every attack it tried only made things worse.
Then, without a sound, Austin leaped high into the air. The wind howled as he came down, his fist slamming into the demon's body.
BOOM!
The ground split apart. A shockwave tore through the battlefield. The massive creature lay still, broken, and defeated.
Austin's cold eyes looked down upon the demon, his hand raised before his Shard appeared in his hand.
Once a small dagger was now coated in lightning
Austin's body began to levitate, much like a God—ready to make the judgment.
The demon thrashed and tried to move away since its instincts loudly screamed about the danger.
However, Austin has left the demon completely tattered and broken as he continues to levitate until he becomes one with the dark skies.
His Shard devoured the lightning that crashed from the sky, drinking in its fury like a starving beast. His entire body pulsed with an eerie glow, flickering between brilliance and shadow.
His eyes—once dark and human—were now empty voids, stripped of all emotion. They no longer held pupils and no longer reflected life. Instead, they burned like twin full moons, cold, distant, and unnerving, as if something far beyond human was staring back.
The demon trembled, its head shaking and body convulsing under the sheer display of strength and brutality.
Hazir and others have long stepped away from the calamity that seemed far more dangerous than the mutt.
*CRACKLE*
Austin twisted his body, and the Shard, now more like a thunderbolt, held behind his body.
A moment of pause and then—
**BOOOOOOOOM**
—devastation befell.
°°°°°°°
[A few moments ago]
Valerie was having a hard time fighting against the demon.
She was restricted from using the spell she recently discovered while fighting the Monkey. She was told by the Headmaster that if the Union Council got to know about it, Valerie would be forced to serve the Council.
'This can't go for long...I need to help him!'
Valerie lunged forward, her spear coated in a thick layer of frost, aiming straight for the demon's chest. But in a blink—WHOOSH—the demon vanished, reappearing behind her.
She twisted just in time. CLANG! Her spear met the demon's claws, the force sending shockwaves rippling through the air. Ice spread from her weapon, but the demon teleported again, dodging the creeping frost.
BOOM!
A sudden explosion of wind sent dust flying as the demon reappeared above her, claws glowing with dark energy. It slashed down—CRACK—splitting the ground where Valerie had stood a moment ago. But she was gone.
SHING!
A blinding arc of ice shot from her spear, slicing toward the demon. It barely teleported away in time, but not fast enough to avoid the freezing air—its arm stiffened for a split second. That was all she needed.
Valerie surged forward. BAM! She drove her spear straight into its ribs, ice exploding from the point of impact. The demon snarled and teleported mid-air, shaking off the frost just as Valerie spun around, already predicting its next move.
The instant it appeared again—WHOOSH—a barrage of icicles rained toward it. The demon zipped through the attack, flickering in and out of sight, but Valerie kept up, her spear spinning faster than the eye could track.
BOOM!
They clashed again. The force cracked the earth, sending waves of broken stone outward. Valerie's spear lashed out, aiming for its heart. The demon teleported at the last moment, appearing inches from her face.
"As I thought, you are strong." The demon praised, a wild grin lifting the edges of its lips.
Valerie's eyes were devoid of any emotion as she raised her hand to punch the demon.
However, just inches away from the target, she felt it.
**BOOOOOOOM**
Both the demon and the human sides were shaken up by the explosion that occurred near the palace.
The explosion shook the core of the nation and illuminated the whole capital.
The waves of energy can shake up one belief in continuing the battle.
A devastating blow, enough to threaten two S-ranks.
The whole capital of Drenovar saw it...the dawn of destruction.
°°°°°°°

chapters.title: Chapter 112: Chapter 111- Peace established
chapters.content:
Chapter 112: Chapter 111- Peace established
"What would happen if I suddenly die at some point, system?" Austin one of those days asked, while he was taking a bath.
Considering the dangers of the world, he usually gets the thought that at some point…or maybe more than once he would be pushed to the very verge of death. This world was very imbalanced, the demonic side has quality and quantity both.
To survive in this world, Austin must utilize his future knowledge to endure those calamities and somehow defeat the demon lord.
Naturally, when that time comes, he will have to go through several life-threatening situations.
[Ding!]
[Host's existence is necessary for the system to exist.]
[In case of emergency, the system would use resources from the future features of the system, to overcome the disaster.]
Austin raised his brows, "What do you mean by that?"
[The system would utilize the resources from the future features, for example, the potions from {Shop} would be utilized to ensure the Host's safety.]
Austin was taken aback. Does the system really have such a defense mechanism?
He actually didn't believe that such a thing was possible....however, recently, he realized that the system might not be lying.
...
"Ugh..." Austin's head was groaning, as he slowly opened his eyes and allowed his vision to get accustomed to the illumination around him.
The first person on whom his eyes landed, made him feel relieved, "Val..." He extended his hand in a daze, and Valerie instantly held it back.
"How do you feel now?" She asked, her voice soothing his headache.
"Just this ringing sound in my ears..."
"That's to be expected. You ruptured your eardrums."
Another familiar voice ushered Austin to turn his head.
There sat his loyal butler, wearing his usual attire of a three-piece suit.
Seeing his clothes, Austin realized something as he instantly turned his head back to Valerie and found her hair and eyes back to their original shade.
Austin's eyes widened, as he whispered, "Val...why do you look like that?"
"Because she no longer needs a disguise." This time...the voice was unfamiliar.
Austin blinked in confusion before he straightened his back and looked at the person...no, people standing across from him.
Austin now realized that he was lying on a huge bed and the room was too big to be a motel room.
The three people who stood there were evidently royalty. And the one who spoke was, undoubtedly,
"Your Majesty ..." The King of Drenovar.
"The second Prince of Eryndor, Austin. This is the first time for us to meet." The man spoke with his hands crossed on his chest.
The other two smiled warmly at the boy as the young Prince stepped forward and asked, "How do you feel now? Your wounds disappeared in the time we brought you here."
Hearing Tarvin's words, Austin suddenly looked down at his stomach.
Indeed, the deep marks of the demon's nail have already disappeared. And rather than the physical weakness, he was feeling all fine.
His mind suddenly recalled something crucial as he asked, "What about the demonic army that attacked from the shore?"
Tarvin informed, "After that explosion, they suddenly retreated."
Sebastian added, "It was strange since it was the perfect time for them to infiltrate. But they chose to retreat."
Valerie ran away from the battlefield the moment she realized where the explosion occurred. However, the demons didn't exploit the chance to enter Drenovar.
"Let's not think about what didn't happen," The Supreme Authority got up from his seat, and said, "For now, I just want to thank you three for saving my family and my people."
Austin tried to get up as the King neared the bed, however, Idris gestured for him to remain seated.
"I don't know why you were here, but in exchange for what you have done, I am ready to grant you any wish you may have."
Austin felt his heart finally gaining the peace it had been searching for so long.
Although all the plans he made went haywire because of the sudden arrival of the demonic army, in the end, he achieved what he came for.
"Just....forget about our past and let's establish a friendly connection, Your Majesty. There is nothing more I could wish or ask for."
Austin decided to relay his desire straightforwardly rather than making it complicated by bringing losses and gains of this war into the discussion.
He just doesn't want either Eryndor or Drenovar to perish because of their role during the Great War.
It wasn't like Idris didn't expect something like this. However, what surprised him was,
"Did your father send you alone with your fiancée to pacify the situation?" It was more like Idris was amazed at the fact.
Austin smiled at the older one, "He didn't tell me anything...rather, it was me who told him that I would somehow resolve the situation. And I think I fulfilled my promise."
Idris couldn't stop himself from chuckling as he patted Austin on his shoulder, "What a remarkable young man you are. Tarvin should learn from you."
"I can learn anything but to fight from him. You should have seen hi, father, how ruthless..."
The conversation continued between the people. Meanwhile, Austin's gaze traveled toward his beloved.
Her warm gaze and that soft smile were the best reward he could get after all this hard work.
°°°°°°°°
"*Cough*" The former king coughed a few times, making Austin slightly nervous.
However, the way his scars began to heal and his complexion returned to normal, allowed everyone in the room to exhale a breath of relief.
"F-Father..." Idris called out in a shaky voice as he saw his father's eyes wet and his mouth slightly parted.
"...I-It doesn't hurt...anymore..." The former king spoke...rather than just groaning in pain, he actually spoke!
The whole family grouped around the former patriarch, finally seeing the man recovering from the illness he has been suffering from, for this long.
All thanks to Austin.
Hazir, who was wrapped in bandages, rested his hand on Austin's shoulder as he said, "You have done a huge favor for our family. The Drenovar family will never forget it."
Saying so, the Prince hugged Austin—his eyes wet with tears.
Austin glanced at Valerie and found the girl turning stiff.
He couldn't help but smile at that, as a thought crossed his mind,
'This definitely would ruin your plans, Aiden. Just a few more days before I throw you back where you belong.'
°°°°°°°°

Chapter 113: Chapter 112- True face(1)
[Two days later]
In Eryndor, a gathering of people has been arranged.
Those who were worried about the King's health gathered in the royal court to see and greet the King.
Naturally, because of so many people here, the security of the royal court was extra strict as well. And those who were allowed to enter the palace were thoroughly examined near the entrance.
On the throne, Cedric was seated. Although he seemed slightly feverish, he was quite better in comparison to how he was when Austin came to meet him.
His strict diet and regular sessions with the healers allowed the man to recover well.
And since it was still not discovered who and how someone poisoned the King, the food he eats is still being prepared by the butler.
Now, in the royal court, those who have gathered expressed their relief upon seeing their Monarch being healthy once again.
"Your Majesty, my eyes are blessed to see you in good health." One of the men, who was a farmer by profession, knelt on the floor with his hands clasped.
"It really put us at ease to see our ruler in good health." A woman added, having a smile of relief on her face.
Cedric couldn't stop himself from smiling. Seeing how much he was loved by his people, makes him feel that he hasn't failed his predecessor.
The Queen, who was sitting behind the curtains, also smiled in elation, upon finding that so many people cared about her husband.
"It's the well wishes of my people that I have recovered so well," Cedric spoke, his voice soothing the hearts of many.
Although Eryndor was a small country, Cedric has always ensured that within his jurisdiction, everyone gets to eat three meals a day.
He even goes out regularly to inspect the situation with regular people and take necessary action to improve their situation.
It was his wife's idea to take a couple of steps for people's betterment—like providing monthly ration to the family members of those who are serving the country. And employment to those who live in remote areas.
With the help of responsible ministers who work under him, Cedric has established a harmonious family within Eryndor.
Just like others, Duke Corwon also had a soft smile on his face as he heard the blessings of the people.
However, the person sitting on the second seat on the left—the first Prince of the nation, looked quite bored by all this.
He really didn't want to be a part of this at all, however, convincing his mother against it would have been a little too much. The lady still loves her husband quite a lot, and his skill wouldn't have been able to overwrite that.
But maybe slowly, he would somehow corrupt the woman and use her to his benefit.
'I guess it's enough now...' Deciding to prepone his plans, Aiden glanced at one of the ministers across from him.
The minister nodded before he turned toward someone in the crowd.
It was then—
"You are unfair!" Amidst the peaceful ceremony, suddenly a woman cried.
Every eye turned towards her as the weeping woman came to the front and cried again,
"You are sacrificing our lives for the sake of your son!"
People suddenly began whispering, wondering what the woman was spouting all of a sudden.
Cedric had a frown on his face as he heard the woman,
"My husband died at the hands of the spies from Drenovar. My whole life is ruined, and now, you are about to risk everyone who depends on you...who trusts you!"
The soldiers were already moving, raising their spears, and were about to take the woman away.
Aiden glared at the minister, before he got up, "What are you spouting, woman?! Say clearly!"
Prime Minister frowned upon seeing the senior adviser suddenly adding oil to the small fire.
Hearing his words, even the soldiers paused, allowing the woman to add, "Hener extended a helping hand in exchange for punishing your second son. And with their help, we all know that we will win against Drenovar! Yet you....you chose your son over your nation!"
Cedric's brows were creased. He didn't know how, but it seemed the news of Hener's proposal had gone out.
'It might be their doing...' Cedric thought that it might be someone from Hener who spread the news.
However, the King completely missed to notice a certain young man with silver hair, grinning slightly at the scene.
The piece of information was spread amongst the people and everyone began muttering about it soon.
Prime Minister Arthur gritted his teeth—why are they letting it continue.
He suddenly rose from his seat before commanding, "Take that woman away now-"
"Is it true, Prime Minister? Did we really get a helping hand?" Someone from the crowd asked the man.
"Tell us, Prime Minister? Is it really true?" Another voice and the question were the same.
Following them were several more voices, asking the same thing again and again.
Aiden wore a perfect facade and got up from his seat, before asking the Prime Minister, "Should we push them out?"
Arthur shook his head, "Not giving them any answer would only make things worse. These are people, not criminals, whom we can silence."
Duke Corwon nodded, "Yes, we need to give them an answer, or this will grow into rebellion in no time."
Nothing is above one's life. All the help and kindness the King extended toward his people would be forgotten in an instant if their lives were on the line.
The situation was getting more severe passing each moment.
Sophie was restlessly glancing between her son and her husband, thinking who would get up to resolve the situation. However, the growing agitation of the people didn't seem like something that could be tamed easily.
Amidst the growing tension, suddenly, a soldier arrived at the court, weaving through the people, he stood in the middle of the court before announcing,
"Y-Your Majesty, a convoy...from Drenovar."
Cedric instantly rose from his seat followed by the other ministers, as the Supreme Authority voiced,
"Alert all the posts and tell them to engage right away!" He couldn't understand how the forces of Drenovar even reached the capital without him receiving any information.
Aiden also frowned at the news. This was quite unexpected. Weren't they attacked by demons a few days ago? Why did they suddenly decide to attack.
It was then, when the soldier informed something crucial about this convoy, "Your Majesty, the one leading the convoy is the Second Prince."
"...!"
°°°°°°°

chapters.title: Chapter 114: Chapter 113- True face(2)
chapters.content:
Chapter 114: Chapter 113- True face(2)
The main palace of Eryndor has never been this crowded before.
The second Prince who was supposed to be in the Academy, returned home with the convoy of the nation who was on the verge of war with Eryndor.
Aiden realized one thing from this, and that is he was betrayed by Morkel.
Austin wasn't in the Academy, but in Drenovar, and sensing the friendly face the messenger from Drenovar held, the First Prince knew that something bad was about to happen.
However, even though he didn't want it to happen, Aiden had no other option but to listen,
"Your Majesty, King of Eryndor, Guardian of these lands, I bring you the message sent from Drenovar—sent by the Monarch."
Cedric wordlessly remained seated. Although he wanted to ask a few things from Austin, who was standing not so far away from the messenger, the King prioritized the messenger for now.
The crowd of people has been silenced completely, and the Ministers, including the chief advisor—on the wordless command of Aiden—were patiently listening to the message.
"For the losses I have caused, for the threats I have brought forth, and for the feuds that have long stained the history between our nations—I offer neither excuse nor justification. The wounds of the past are undeniable, and the bond once shared by our realms has been fractured.
Yet, let it be known that none of this holds weight any longer after the deeds of Second Prince Austin. His actions have not only mended what was broken but have also forged a new path for our people. For what he has done for Drenovar, I speak not merely as a king, but as a man indebted beyond measure.
"I, Idris, King of Drenovar, extend my hand in a truce between our two nations.
The past has been marred by conflict, by losses suffered, and by wounds that time has struggled to heal. I do not seek to erase what has been, nor do I deny the burdens carried by both our peoples. Yet, after the noble deeds of Austin, I can no longer allow old grudges to dictate the future of our realms.
In light of his actions and the debt Drenovar owes, I set aside past enmities and propose peace—a truce that shall stand as the foundation of renewed understanding. May this be the first step toward a future where our nations no longer clash as adversaries but walk forward with dignity and wisdom.
May your judgment guide this decision, and may our people find strength in unity rather than division."
A wave of elation spread through the royal court upon hearing the message from Drenovar.
The people, who were blaming Cedric until a few minutes ago, were sighing in relief and rejoicing at the fact that the enemy nation had ceased fire.
Austin couldn't stop himself from grinning seeing the pale complexion of his dear elder brother.
The way he looked at the messenger with his eyes widened was a sight worth taking numerous pictures of.
Cedric's chest swelled with pride upon hearing his son's name in the message. It turned out that Austin indeed had a plan to pacify the situation with Drenovar. And he somehow convinced those people who have been an enemy of Eryndor for years.
'You have made me proud, Austin...'
With a smile, Cedric told the messenger, "I will extend my response soon. You may return now."
The messenger gave a brief bow, before taking his leave. His role was just to extend the proposal of truce and he did what he was told.
Once he was gone, the citizens were also told to leave since the matter needed to be discussed among the council.
And this time, the general public didn't protest since they already had gained assurance that there would be no war anymore.
Once they were gone, only the ministers of the upper council and the individuals of high noble ranking remained in the court.
"This is unexpected, Your Majesty, but I think we should immediately respond to them in kind. If they had extended a friendly proposal, we never were a war-loving side." Arthur spoke, with slight excitement reflecting in his voice.
He couldn't be any more relieved to know that the nation that has been targeting Eryndor for so long has actually suggested a truce.
"It is all thanks to you, Austin," Arthur spoke, a thankful smile lifting the edges of his lips.
Although it was hard to swallow for some, like Duke Corwon, it was a fact that the one who brought this change in Drenovar's attitude was none other than the Second Prince.
The same useless and talentless Prince whom everyone thought was a spoilt kid.
'My daughter didn't choose him just for his face, huh...' The man heaved a sigh of relief.
Cedric was about to say something when suddenly, "We shouldn't accept their proposal!" A booming voice resonated in the court.
The person silenced everyone as he stood at his place with his head leaning down.
Austin frowned, as he felt a sudden sensation making his head heavy, 'So this is the effect of his Shard. Manipulative bastard.'
Aiden continued, "Father, with all respect, we shouldn't forget what those people have done to us. Constantly tormenting our people, slaughtering so many soldiers, and making a joke out of us in front of the whole world."
The voice of the first Prince resonated across the royal court, the effect of Shard working on those effectively who already were in his favor. And that included the Queen as well.
With his left hand pressed against his chest, the silver head spoke, "It pains me...every time I visit the graveyard and see the numerous tombstones of those soldiers who were killed by those vermins!"
Turning his reddened eyes toward his father, he added, "And now they are weakened because of the Hellstain they are offering a helping hand?! Am I the only one who can see their true face?"
The First Prince turned around and looked at other ministers. Some were lowering their heads and some were nodding in assent.
It was true that many had already agreed to this truce...but now that the first Prince reminded them, they indeed shouldn't forget what Drenovar had inflicted on them.
However, while tens of people were in agreement with Aiden, there were a few who didn't agree with him. And one of them was the Prime Minister,
"We also have damaged their forces. And it's a fact that in the past Eryndor failed to protect the King and Queen of Drenovar. We should not let our past grievances influence our future."
Aiden covered his forehead with his hand as he asked in shock, "You are saying that, Sir Arthur? You, who knows the best how sly and deceiving those people can be?"
With a snarl, the first Prince added, "They will extend a friendly hand today and stab us in the back tomorrow. And at that time when we would be at our most vulnerable phase."
Now many people, or to say, apart from four people in the court, everyone was under the influence of Aiden's words and his skill.
Aiden glanced at his younger brother for a moment, before he turned toward the Supreme Authority with his hands held behind his back,
"Your Majesty, as the heir of the family and the first Prince of the nation, I show my clear resistance toward this truce. I am saying for sure that this agreement will only cause Eryndor harm. And as a Prince, I cannot let that happen."
Silence ensued after that.
Everyone who held authority was in agreement with what Aiden proposed.
Their eyes were clouded by the belief that following Aiden was the only way for Eryndor to survive.
Even the Queen had a firm expression upon hearing her son's words.
'Austin...you have once again made the wrong decision...but your brother won't let us fall.'
The whole situation was flipped within minutes.
Just a few minutes ago, everyone was elated by the fact that the long rivalry between the two nations was finally coming to an end.
And it wasn't that the Council that interfered. It was the Second Prince who brought this miraculous change.
However, the situation changed faster than the weather.
'Sorry Austin, but I can't let you become the new favorite~~'
Just as Aiden thought he had gained victory despite the unfavorable situation, someone entered the royal court,
*Clap* *Clap*
Every eye turned toward the person who walked inside.
Wearing a three-piece black suit and neatly combed grey hair, everyone knew the identity of the man who once served the King.
Sebastian could be seen in an unnatural mood. A smile on his face but the man's eyes weren't smiling at all.
"Sebastian..." Aiden called out, his tone carrying bitterness.
The butler ignored the first Prince as he stood beside his young master, before calling out,
"I hoped, Your Majesty...hoped that Young Master Austin has a misconception about his brother. That, Your Highness Aiden isn't the man he believed him to be. I hoped that I could help rebuild this family somehow."
With his eyes turning frosty, the man added, "However, after what I witnessed today, I can no longer stay silent and let this continue."
*Snap*
As he snapped his fingers, a few more people entered the court.
Austin was surprised to find Rhea and Rudolph entering the court. And not just them, there was the Vice-headmaster of the Academy as well.
However, the person who caused Aiden's complexion to change was the same soldier he sent to the Academy.
He was still alive!
'Morkel....you a*shole!!!!'
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Damn, Morkel played it well. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 115: Chapter 114- True face(3)
chapters.content:
Chapter 115: Chapter 114- True face(3)
"What in the world is happening in the royal court? Is this an exhibition that you are bringing people from here and there, Sebastian?"
The chief advisor asked in a frustrated tone as he glared at the grey-haired man.
Although he didn't know who was the soldier they brought along, seeing Aiden's reaction the Chief Advisor knew that it was bad news.
Orwold Sigmund, the finance minister added, "We are having a discussion about our relation with Drenovar, and Sebastian, you no longer are a part of the council. So should we consider this disrespect against the King?"
Sebastian remained calm, throughout the warning and angered statements of the ministers. He could now tell that they, indeed, were brainwashed by a certain someone to sound so nonsensical.
"If it's about my nation and the Lord I once served, then I am prepared to face any consequences of my actions, Sir Sigmund." The butler spoke, without a speck of hesitation.
Turning his attention toward the King, Sebastian relayed, "For the next ten minutes, I request everyone to listen to what I have to say before making any judgment."
Seeing him bowing his head, and going against his character, Cedric instantly agreed, "You have my permission."
Sebastian raised his head and started, ""Your Majesty, the cook who prepared your meal was not from Eryndor. In fact, he was a resident of White Wing Orphanage in Hener."
Aiden's eyes widened as he looked at Sebastian in horror.
He made sure that no one found out about that bastard's origin and where he came from...then how?!
Sebastian, while raising his left hand toward the first Prince, added, "And coincidentally, the orphanage where Sir Aiden has been brought up is also the White Wing Orphanage."
"What the hell are you trying to imply here?! That Prince Aiden conspired against his own father?!" The finance minister roared.
Turning towards the King, he said, "My Lord, this is enough. You can already tell that the man is trying to frame the First Prince." Turning his disdainful eyes toward Austin, he added, "And considering whom Sebastian serves, you can already tell who is behind it."
Austin smiled, and gave a nod as if saying, 'You got that right.'
"Sigmund, as I said, I have given him permission to talk so sit back down and let him say whatever he wants." Cedric retorted, his face showing displeasure which caused the Minister to turn stiff.
I-Is he really believing this?
Aiden clenched his fist....however, he didn't react. He knew that he could still get out of this situation if he held back his emotions and let the man finish whatever he wanted to say.
Sebastian gave a thankful bow to the Supreme Authority before continuing, "Next, I would like to inform you all about the fact that Sir Aiden has been using his Shard to manipulate your mind and make you believe what he wants to. I only suspected this when Lord Corwon came to the Academy, asking to break the engagement with Young Master Aiden. However, after investigating a little, it turned out that whenever the first Prince conversed with his mother and the minister, he always used his Shard."
That caused many people to frown. Even Lord Corwon was taken aback by that statement.
It was true that when he heard from Aiden, he believed that making Valerie Aiden's fiancée would be for everyone's betterment. However, after meeting his daughter, he realized how foolish that decision was.
"If I may, my Lord, I would like to add that indeed, whenever around the first Prince, I could feel the use of magic. But because of my Shard's ability to parry against any of such waves, I never got under its influence." Prime Minister Arthur added, "And that's why it seems I am the only one who isn't under his control."
Aiden raised his brows, "That's...something I am hearing the first time. But let's assume it's true, then why isn't father influenced?"
Sebastian was rendered speechless since he also didn't have the answer to that.
Aiden thought that he finally had the upper hand, when suddenly,
"He was poisoned. And poisons affect one's thinking capability. That's why your Shard didn't manipulate him." Austin's clear voice resonated in the royal court.
Cedric's eyes parted slightly, "Austin...you knew about it too?"
Austin nodded, "Why do you think the same mother who loved me so dearly, hates everything I do now? Because I changed? No, it was because someone brainwashed into her believing that I am worthless and someone who no longer needs his parents' attention."
When he said that, Cedric was forced to think about those several occasions when he noticed his wife being too harsh on Austin. Her attention always remained on Aiden, and whenever Cedric even mentioned Austin, she changed the topic.
....that indeed wasn't normal.
Aiden gritted his teeth. This was getting out of hand.
Turning the King he voiced, "You are th-"
"First Prince, I still have a few minutes left." Aiden was suddenly interrupted by Sebastian, as the butler smilingly reminded.
Aiden, while barely holding his anger, raised his hand, "Yes sure, go on."
Sebastian gave a thankful nod, before turning towards the current Imperial Legion Commander and Rudolph's father, and said,
"Sir Edwin, if I am not wrong you have worked with Sir Harold's ability?"
The tall knight stood up and said, "Yes, we worked together a few years ago. I know about his Shard's ability." Turning towards the King, he added, "He was the chief of interrogation since his Shard didn't allow anyone to lie."
"Thank you, Sir Edwin." Saying so, Sebastian turned towards the group behind him before nodding
Rudolph pushed the tattered soldier forward followed by Rhea and Harold as they presented the soldiers in the middle of the court.
Harold wordlessly summoned his Shard before pressing its tip against the ground and drawing a circle around the soldier.
"Now, tell me, soldier, what were you doing in the Academy?" Sebastian asked.
The soldier first remained silent, but the moment Rudolph summoned his Shard, he began speaking,
"S-Sir Aiden sent me...to check if Sir Austin has reached the academy."
Sebastian hummed before asking, "Were you alone in this?"
"I-I had one comrade...but since we failed to track Sir Austin after he left the capital, Sir Aiden killed my partner."
That aroused a few gasps from the audience, and the Queen had her eyes widened, too.
'Why are they framing my son like this?!' She couldn't understand why Sebastian and the others were hell-bent on making Aiden the wrong person here even though he always thinks for the betterment of the family.
And her husband....why is he silent even after hearing all this?
Sebastian hummed, before asking again, "So were you sent just because Sir Aiden was worried about his brother?" The butler added before Aiden could have interpreted his intention in another way.
"N-N-No...he didn't want the second Prince to be anywhere else, but the a-academy or i-it would have affected his plan on letting Sir Austin get exiled."
"That's such a blatant lie!" The chief advisor finally lost his cool, "Your Majesty, Sebastian is just making things up now and has brought the whole army to conspire against the-*SHLINK*"
A blade flew past the Minister, leaving a shallow cut on his cheek, before stabbing into the pillar beside him
Not only the minister, who was inches away from being stabbed just now, was startled, but even Aiden's eyes widened when he realized whose Shard it was.
Every eye turned toward the King, whose eyes were devoid of any other emotion but anger, before they heard his voice, "I never gave you the permission to speak yet you keep interfering. Have you forgotten what I can do to those who don't listen to my WORDS!"
With the loud roar of the King, the blades began flying around the throne, ready to exterminate the lives of those whom he found worthless.
Everyone turned silent.
This was the first time for many to see the King in such rage.
Maybe because he doesn't go hunting or hasn't been involved in a war for a long time, people have forgotten the strength Cedric holds.
The Chief Advisor didn't dare to utter a single syllable.
Amidst the growing silence, Cedric turned towards his second son before voicing, "Austin, step forward."
Austin did as he was told, before he heard the older one asking, "You were aware of all this? That your brother is keeping an eye on you and the fact that he regularly exchanges letters with the Prime Minister of Hener?"
They caused all the colors from Aiden's face to disappear.
He exchanged letters with Hener....how does Cedric know about it?!
Austin was also amazed that his father was aware of such a thing.
With a nod, he responded, "I knew, father, but I didn't tell you anything because I had no evidence."
Cedric narrowed his eyes, "I still can dismiss all this evidence and declare Aiden not guilty."
Austin shrugged, "I won't care, in that case, since I have already told you that I don't care about the throne and this family anymore."
Glancing in Aiden's direction, Austin added, "I only took action because Aiden tried to touch something precious to me....my Val." When he said that, Valerie appeared beside him out of nowhere.
Lord Corwon was startled to find that his daughter was also here and was involved in all this.
Redirecting his gaze towards his father, Austin added, "And when he poisoned you, I felt that I need to do something or Eryndor will fall along with its King."
Cedric's Shard disappeared, and the older one's shoulders lost their strength.
Once again...he was reminded of the fact that he had failed his son.
And now, aware of Aiden's true face, he realized that he was a complete failure as a father.
"Father." Amidst the growing silence, Aiden spoke up, "I have been blamed for many things, but none of the evidence holds authenticity."
Turning towards Austin, he spoke up, "Since it would be difficult to prove who is wrong and who is right, let's settle this the old way."
With his eyes holding nothing but the intention to murder, Aiden spoke, "Through a battle."
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 116 - 115- True face(END)
chapters.content:
In Rhea’s eyes, the First Prince was either foolish or was considering everyone else.
Just now, every evil deed he has committed was presented before the Supreme Authority. Vice-headmaster Harold also confirmed through his Shard that Aiden, indeed, was stalking Austin and conspiring against him while being in contact with Hener.
But despite all the evidence showing him guilty, the bastard wasn’t ready to back off.
He actually, proposed a duel against Austin, like this was some kind of debate where one couldn’t get a concrete answer.
Dude, you are proven guilty. Just suck it up and get punished.
"What no concrete evidence are you talking about? Didn’t Sir Edwin just confirm the ability Sir Harold possesses? What’s there to talk about now?" The prime minister voiced.
What was there to prove now? Didn’t the King himself declare that he was aware of Aiden’s connection with Hener?
"No, Sir Arthur. I also want this judgment to be declared through a battle." Austin suddenly voiced.
Hearing those words, a few gasped while a few smirked.
Everyone knew that the second Prince was a D-rank and the first Prince was an A-rank…at the very least.
Aiden had a grin on his face as he turned toward the Supreme Authority before declaring, "Since Austin has given his consent, I believe Father mustn’t have a-"
"I can’t let it happen." Cedric instantly cut him off, "You are a criminal. Someone who was conspiring against Eryndor. You poisoned me and brainwashed everyone into believing things that could have resulted disastrously. And most of all…you tried to harm Austin. And I want no other evidence than Austin’s words to declare you guilty."
Aiden’s clenched his fist, as he barked, "So you won’t even let me prove myself?! You are prioritizing your second son since I grew up away from the home so you consider me as an outsider…like dirt!"
Valerie frowned hearing those words as she muttered under her breath, "His stage play is annoying…if only I could-’
"Sorry Val, but he is my prey."
Valerie was taken aback by the cold whisper as she glanced at her Lord.
His eyes were devoid of any emotion. However, someone close to him, Valerie could sense lava of rage boiling within him.
Holding her hand, he whispered, "He tried to take you away, and for that sin, I will bestow death upon him by my own hands."
Those words sent a jolt of excitement down her spine while her heart was filled with elation seeing her Lord being so angered for her.
He won’t let anyone have her. Valerie only belongs to her Lord~
"I won’t let you punish him."
Suddenly, a voice which has been silent until now spoke up.
The Queen of Eryndor who used to work as the chief advisor until she became a mother, spoke up, "I can’t let you punish Aiden. You can’t see it but I have noticed that Austin is framing his brother just because he is not counted in the race for the throne!"
Everyone turned silent. Meanwhile, Aiden finally felt that there might still be some hope as he sobbingly voiced, "Don’t fight for me, mother *Hicc* if father has already called me a criminal, there is no point in saying anything further."
Wiping his eyes, Aiden added, "Send me to the cell and hang me to death-"
"Don’t even utter that word, Aiden!" Turning toward her husband, she voiced in a loud tone, "How can you declare him guilty without even listening to him? Deciding everything based on what you heard from Austin and his allies!"
This might be the first time for the Queen to go against her etiquette and speak like this in the middle of the court.
Cedric had a firm stance on this so he didn’t think twice before commanding, "My decision won’t change even if the God tells me. Aiden would be imprisoned for the crimes he has committed."
It was not a topic to debate on. Just now, Aiden was suggesting to wage a war against the nation which extended a friendly proposal.
Risking thousands of lives just because Aiden thinks they can backstab? Cedric would be blind to not realize what the boy was plotting.
Those mouths that were running in Aiden’s favor have long been silenced since the Supreme Authority has already made up his mind about punishing him.
Sophie narrowed her eyes, as she spat, "As Queen, I decree that Austin shall never be permitted to claim the throne."
Turning her disdainful eyes toward Austin, she added, "Let’s see if you can still uphold that confidence now."
Your next on .Côm
Although she was both Austin and Aiden’s mother, she saw Aiden as the victim here and Austin was the biggest sinner at the moment, in her eyes.
Cedric was about to deny her, when suddenly, Austin said, "You still think I care about the throne?" There was a smile on his face, a sad one, which made Sophie’s heart tremble for a moment. However, her expression didn’t change and the wordless answer her eyes held was a ’yes’.
Austin shook his head before turning toward the King and declaring, "I, Austin von Eryndor, declare here in front of everyone that I won’t ever accept the throne of Eryndor under any circumstances. And that’s my final decision."
Valerie’s hold around his hand turned firmer, while a few, including Rhea, gasped at the declaration.
This might be the most shocking thing that happened today for many. Even Sebastian looked at his master with his eyes widened, however, the older one couldn’t find any regret in his master’s eyes. At all.
Sophie fell back on her seat because of the shock with her eyes widened.
She…couldn’t believe that Austin actually wasn’t doing all this for the throne…was he lying…but he said that in front of so many people…
While the Queen seemed to have received a severe shock, Aiden gritted his teeth as he realized that even the damn woman could save him!
Looking around, he found the chief advisor and the finance minister were averting their gazes—clearing, not intending to help him here.
Aiden was…once again feeling himself in a corner. Like all those times when he got cornered in the orphanage by the older boys.
The same hopelessness he felt when he stood before his first love’s grave.
That despair…that helplessness…that fear of losing everything.
Everything blinded him and in a fit of rage,
"DAMN YOU ALL!!!"
Before anyone could react, Aiden summoned his shard in a flash and drove it into the ground with force.
SHFIUUUUK!
A deafening crack split the air as a violent shockwave burst forth. Black mist erupted like a storm, twisting and curling as it swallowed the space around him.
The soldiers staggered, their bodies trembling as an invisible force drained them of all strength. Their knees buckled. Swords and spears clattered onto the ground, slipping from lifeless fingers. Gasps filled the air, some choking, others collapsing entirely.
Their eyes widened in horror. Muscles refused to obey. It felt as if their very souls were being pulled from their bodies.
Aiden’s eyes were red as he used every bit of his soul energy to chant that spell before he turned toward the bastard who caused it all.
The asshole who snatched everything from him!
"AUSTIN!" With his Shard raised, Aiden launched toward where Austin was, aiming to slaughter the son of a b*tch!
His sword was held horizontally, as he pushed it to stab Austin—but,
*Clang*
Aiden’s eyes widened as his sword was parried and he was pushed back, "What the--!"
He gasped….his skill should have worked on everyone. Why the hell a weakling like him was not affected?
Austin stepped forward, a greenish barrier surrounding him.
His eyes were threatening as Austin muttered, "Calling out your opponent’s name…how lame can you be?"
Aiden clutched his blade tighter before plunging it forward, "DAMN YOU!"
However,
*CLANG*
--the blade still didn’t pierce through the barrier.
"AAHHHHHH!"
*CLANG* *CLANG*
He continued to attack, one after another, using all the remaining strength his body could muster…however, none of it worked.
The barrier didn’t budge!
"Feeling helpless?" Austin asked, with a tilt of his head.
Aiden’s face was pale, his chest heaving as he stared at the a**wipe, "Y-You…if only you hadn’t been here…"
Austin grinned, "Oh no, no, I have always been here…the one who made your life hell." With a mocking smile, he added, "The one who sent that noble after Marilyn…do you know who is it?"
Aiden’s eyes widened…no one knows about Marilyn….then that means, "Y-You bastard! It was YOU!!!!"
With every ounce of his strength, he swung his sword. Every fiber of his being desired to destroy the trash of a human!
However,
*CLANG*
It didn’t work.
"Why…" Tears welled up in Aiden’s eyes as his grip loosened, the sword slipping from his trembling fingers. His breath hitched as he staggered back, his chest rising and falling in ragged gasps.
"Why always me—"
SWISH!
"Yeah, no." Austin’s cold voice cut through the air as he stepped forward, his blade flashing in a swift, merciless arc.
THUD.
Aiden’s world twisted. For a fleeting moment, he saw the ground rushing toward him—his own body standing limply in the distance. A strange weightlessness took hold as darkness swallowed his senses.
Austin shook his head as he swatted his Shard and told his dear elder brother, "Committing crime just because life has been unfair to you? Yeah, you are lame."
With that, Eryndor lost its first Prince.
-----**-----
A/N:- Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 117 - 116- Unbothered
chapters.content:
Everything happened in a flash after that.
The very fact that Aiden launched a spell that dulled everyone’s senses in the royal court was a grave crime. Under that spell, he could have harmed anyone, including the King—and that’s exactly what Austin showed everyone by placing Aiden’s headless body in such a manner that it seemed that he intended to attack the king.
Naturally, it wasn’t the case but since everyone was in a daze, no one noticed.
About the thing he said about Marilyn? Well, that definitely was a lie. Austin transmigrated quite late in the story, and the previous owner didn’t know anything about Aiden about his previous life when he used to live in slums.
Austin just wanted to harm Aiden; both physically and mentally.
In reality, Austin wanted to torture the piece of crap more. He wanted to take his sweet time to slowly pluck each of his limbs, then slowly take out both of his eyes, then slice off that tongue, and then…but his wishes didn’t come true because the effect of the spell was wearing down.
Since Austin would have been prohibited from killing Aiden if others had regained their senses, he had to finish the job instantly. And now, he can only live in regret for not being able to painfully kill that being who dared raise his eyes toward his beloved.
And now, things were slowly getting back on track—or so Austin hoped.
...
"Young master…are you sure we should leave tomorrow?"
As they advanced toward Austin’s room, Sebastian asked worryingly.
Read latest chapters at .Côm
Austin told him and Valerie that they would be leaving tomorrow, early morning.
Valerie was currently with her father and the other who came from the academy are staying in the palace as well—they will also return tomorrow morning.
"The tournament officially begins the day after tomorrow, and I need to be there tomorrow anyhow or I would be disqualified." Austin casually responded. However, his casual demeanor worried the older one.
Sebastian clearly seemed quite distressed because of whatever happened today.
The most hurtful thing Austin faced today was those words from the Queen—the lady who gave birth to him was blatantly calling him a criminal today.
Anyone, regardless of how detached they seem to their family, would be quite shaken by being hated by their parents.
However, the way Austin seemed completely unbothered, worried the older one.
Reaching the room where Austin was staying, the blond Prince turned to look at the person whom he cared about the most after Valerie.
"Sebas…I know you are worried about me, however, trust me, it doesn’t bother me what my mother said. It’s a fact that she gave birth to me…and that cannot be changed by anyone, but if she wants to sever all relations from me, I or you can do nothing about it. So, let’s just move on and think about the future."
Sebastian heaved a sigh, his eyes fixed on the young man whom he had seen going through several phases. Although, he has changed quite a lot. He no longer whines and complains about every single thing but rather accepts everything with a mature front.
But sometimes…Sebastian misses that version of Austin who never held back his emotions.
With a smile, the man muttered, "If you need something, call me, sir."
-----*----
Valerie was in the front garden with her father as the duo walked slowly side by side.
There were several things on Adam’s mind, however, the thing he focused on was his daughter, as he said, "You were with Austin and not in the Academy. Even went to Drenovar and fought for them."
Valerie casually muttered, "Mother taught me to support my Lord."
Adam side-glanced his daughter before uttering, "You aren’t married to him yet you…"
"No one can understand our relationship." She coldly responded before he could have made any rash comment.
