It could be sensed that Valerie was still quite mad at her father….because of what happened last time between them.
Adam heaved a sigh before he stopped before his daughter and told her, "Look, Val…I was wrong. I shouldn’t have brought that up…however, can you blame me? That bastard used a skill on me and I got manipulated." The man generally doesn’t use cuss words, however, if he sounds hateful toward the man his daughter is disgusted with…he would probably get forgiven.
Right?
Valerie narrowed her gaze as she stated, "Austin told me the application of that skill. Unless one has subtle feelings about something, Aiden wouldn’t have been able to exploit it. Which means, you actually thought that Austin isn’t worthy of me."
Adam’s mouth was parted in shock, but just as he saw his daughter walking away, he hurriedly voiced, "B-But can you blame me? You are the only child I have and someone who holds the potential to register her name in the golden book of history. On the other hand, all I have seen that brat-" Valerie glared at him, which made the man falter,
"-T-that boy do all his life is to get jealous of your achievements."
Valerie crossed her arms on her bosom as she said, "But is he like that?"
Adam instantly shook his head, "He has changed, I can see. He cares about you and his personality has taken quite a massive turn as well. Now, I can proudly call him my son-in-law, hahaha!"
Seeing the subtle smile appearing on his daughter’s face, the man knew that he was heading in the right direction, so he added, "How about you bring him home someday? Your mother really wants to meet her son-in-law, too."
Valerie lowered her gaze as she muttered, "I will ask him. Now, father, you should go and rest."
Adam smilingly nodded; at least she called him ’father’ softly.
As the man turned around and began walking out of the palace, he couldn’t help but think,
’What a day has come….I had to use Austin’s name to gain my daughter’s forgiveness….such a cruel world.’
--------**--------
A/N:- Another chapter maybe, before we return to the academy and continue with the plot.
Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 118 - 117- Wounded heart
chapters.content:
Rhea and Rudolph were heading to their respective rooms after they had dinner. There was no one but the three—who came from the academy—present on the dining table.
All the other members were in their room. Naturally, what has happened today, they would need some time to collect their thoughts.
"It was…pure madness. I could have never thought that the First Prince would be like that." Rudolph voiced followed by a weary sigh.
His father used to praise Aiden a lot in the past, and after Rudolph sparred against Aiden a couple of times, he also realized that he was a good man.
In the past, whenever Austin said anything against his elder brother, Rudolph thought that he was just jealous. However, now…
"Truth be told when I heard things from the soldier, I didn’t think that things would be that messed up. However, after arriving here and after hearing from Sir Sebastian, I realized that I was underestimating him. He truly was a low life."
Rhea muttered with a disdainful look on her face.
"Yeah…just think about it. He actually manipulated his parents and the council members. Her Majesty is in a critical condition now because of him."
The queen collapsed after she saw Aiden’s dead body. When the medic checked on her, it turned out that rather than the shock it was the sudden disconnection of Shard’s ability that caused severe backslash to her mind.
It would take some time for her to recover since everything related to one’s mind needs critical attention.
Rhea remained silent for a brief moment, before she uttered, "Parkinson’s parents…asked His Majesty to abandon Austin so they can hunt him down."
Rudolph’s expression turned grim, "Do you think they proposed it to take revenge?"
Rhea looked at him with an exasperated look, "What else do you think? And in my opinion, it must be Parkinson himself who must have asked them to somehow harm Austin that brought that proposal."
With her fist clenched, Rhea muttered under her breath, ’You are no better than Aiden…just pray we never come across each other.’
------^^------
Austin was inside his room, lying down on his bed, thinking back on whatever had happened in these few days.
He went to Drenovar and made and changed many plans before something unexpected but fortunate for him showed up, allowing Austin to gain what he came for.
Then he returned home, with the intention to just share the good news and threatened the bastard about his position as the crown prince. He wanted to take this a bit longer since Austin didn’t have any evidence to prove Aiden guilty and let the world know his true face. Continue your journey on .Côm
However, call it coincidence or his good luck, Rhea and the others also arrived at the same time, with walking evidence against Aiden beside them.
Whatever Sebastian proposed in the court was completely unexpected. Austin didn’t know when but the older one had already sensed Aiden’s true personality and intentions.
’Well, whatever happened is for good…’ His decision to never become the next king came because of two reasons—first because he doesn’t want to get tied down by the throne. That would surely restrict his movements, and become an obstacle in his preparation for the final war.
The second was…his mourning soul which was slightly affected by those scornful eyes of the lady whom he considered his mother for a long time.
’Was I really sad at that time…’ Austin heaved a sigh as he closed his eyes.
Maybe a part of him was actually hurt at that time…facing those scornful eyes and those hate-laced words.
’Haah…well, can’t fight it…’ Deciding to change the topic, Austin asked the system,
’Show me my stats,’ He hasn’t checked it ever since he returned from death.
[Ding!]
[Combat: 45-> 63/100]
{Next reward at 80}
[Ding!]
[You have gained one reward!]
[Romance: 51->58/100]
{Next reward at 60}
[Durability: 57->68/100]
{Next reward at 80}
[Ding!]
[You have gained a reward!]
[Trickery: 31/100]
{Next reward at 35}
[Overall Progression: 44->53.5/100]
[Next Reward at 70]
[Ding!]
[You have unlocked a reward!]
…
Austin was taken aback by that absurd growth in his stats.
’System…?’
[In the short duration during which you fought the Great Demon, your stats significantly rose, and when the berserk mode wore off, some stats received a significant boost.]
’Damn…’ He couldn’t have imagined that facing death from that close would allow him to fill the overall progression by half.
And the three rewards were the icing on the cake.
The overall progression provides some sick rewards, which explains why Austin seemed so excited.
He was about to check the rewards, when suddenly,
*CLINK* *CLINK*
Someone knocked on his window, ushering Austin to turn his head…only to find his beloved somehow hanging by the window sill.
Austin hurried toward the window before opening it for her, "Thank you…" She muttered before jumping inside.
"You could have come through the door, y’know. This isn’t the dorms after all."
Valerie’s lashes fluttered while her cheeks adapted redness, as she said, "Visiting my fiancée at this hour would have…caused numerous rumors…"
Austin grinned as he encircled his arms around her slender waist before whispering, "I welcome every rumor that keeps Austin and Valerie’s name connected."
Valerie blushed even more furiously as she suddenly felt her legs turned wobbly.
"This…I baked this for you."
She suddenly showed him the bag of cookies she brought along.
"Hmm? Did you bake them now? What was the rush?" Austin could tell that the cookies were still warm.
Valerie directed her upturned gaze in his direction before whispering, "I heard sweet things heal wounded hearts."
Austin was taken aback by that statement, as he looked at his lover with his eyes slightly widened, "You…think…I am sad?"
Valerie slowly nodded in assent.
…it was strange…that without asking him or talking to him, she realized that he was sad. Even though he tried so hard to not let others know about it…
’Nothing can remain hidden to the one who loves you…’
Austin suddenly smiled before he took out one of the cookies and bit it.
Maybe yeah...he was indeed sad.
Valerie was about to ask something, when suddenly,
*Knock*
"Austin…can we talk?"
It was his father.
-------^^------
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 119 - 118- Rewards
chapters.content:
Valerie instantly jumped out of the room—not wanting to appear in the same room as her fiancée this late night.
Although Austin said that he didn’t mind, Valerie replied with something that left him speechless,
’I don’t want to appear unruly in my father-in-law’s eyes. Good night, bye.’ And to prevent Austin from feeling grumpy, she even gave a kiss on his cheek before running away.
He definitely will take revenge for that quick kiss. Just you wait, Val.
"*Ahem*"
*Click*
Opening the door, he was met by the man he was expecting.
"Were you sleeping?" The older one asked.
"Was trying. Did you need something?"
Cedric looked quite tired, and his face slightly pale, so Austin first invited him inside, and after offering him a seat, he gave him a glass of water.
"Thank you," Cedric thanked his son, as Austin sat down across from him.
Austin waited patiently since it was apparent that the man wanted to talk about something.
After a few minutes of silence, Cedric finally began, "You remember that day...when you ran away from your birthday party because you got no gifts while your brother received numerous presents?"
Austin chuckled, "How can I forget that." Later Valerie came chasing after him—with a present in her hand.
However, Austin was so exasperated at that time that he thought that she brought that present for Aiden, but was pitying him by giving him the present instead.
He threw away the present even without bothering to look at what she brought.
’Truly a scumbag...’ Smiling in self-mockery, he decided to apologize to his beloved tomorrow.
"At that time...your mother actually prepared a few gifts for you. She didn’t want you to feel lonely, that’s why she named those presents from different people. However, seeing your behavior, she instead gave all the presents to Aiden."
Austin was slightly surprised, "Are you trying to make things up or provoking me to hate her even more?"
Cedric shook his head as he muttered, "I am just relaying that your mother didn’t forget about you; rather, it was Aiden’s Shard that changed her slowly. He made her think that you have already enjoyed your portion of familial warmth."
Austin leaned back, his brows elevated as he asked, "You do know that unless she didn’t actually have that thought, Aiden couldn’t have used his Shard to manipulate her, right?"
"I am aware, and trust me, son, I am not here to speak in support of her actions. However, as her husband, I want to apologize for whatever she has caused."
A king he is, yet he didn’t think twice before bowing his head.
And for what? For the love of his life.
Austin can relate to that feeling...however, "Look, Father, even if I forgive her, I hardly believe she would ever see my face after what I have caused."
With a soft sigh, he added, "What do you think, just because Aiden is gone, she will suddenly get up and embrace me? I hardly believe it."
Although the Shard was gone, the deep-seated hatred must have left some effect on the Queen. As such, Austin believed that she was going to blame him for the rest of her life.
In his mind, Austin has already accepted the fact that he has no mother.
Not anymore.
With a soft smile, which made the man appear older than usual, Cedric muttered, "I won’t ask you anything more if you just don’t reject her if she ever approaches you with the intention of making things up."
Austin exhaled a long breath. He didn’t think that was ever going to happen; however, seeing the tired man barely holding himself together, he couldn’t bring himself to reject it.
"Okay, I understand."
The man soon got up and asked, "The tournament starts the day after tomorrow, right?"
Austin also got up before he nodded, "Yeah."
"I will come to watch your matches." The man spoke with a sense of pride in his voice. He hasn’t even congratulated his son properly for qualifying for such a grant tournament.
Austin’s brows drew closer as he said, "Don’t you have things to settle with Drenovar? Don’t waste your time on the tournament and focus on administration."
Cedric scratched the gap between his brows as he said, "Right...Drenovar." Looking up, he said, "I didn’t hear from you what happened back there....and you are already leaving tomorrow." The sorrow in his voice was palpable.
Austin stepped closer to the man before resting his hand on his shoulder and said, "This is my home, father, so surely I will return. What’s the rush?"
Cedric’s eyes widened slightly as he looked at his son.
He didn’t know why, but all the stress Cedric was carrying was washed away by that single statement.
Seeing tears in his eyes, Austin smiled helplessly, before he stepped closer and hugged the man, "Now stop crying. It doesn’t suit a grown-up man."
Cedric didn’t remember when was the last time he hugged his child.
He has already lost all his hope to ever unite this family; however...there might still be some hope.
°°°°°°°
After Cedric left, Austin sat back down on the bed.
The man seemed much like a certain someone from his past life—an old man, Luke used to meet in the evening in a park where he went for a run.
The old man was left alone by his son and daughter-in-law and used to live in an old age home.
He used to miss his family and grandchildren a lot—and since the resting bench of the park faced the city streets, he always sat there—hoping that one day maybe his son come back to meet him
However, that day never arrived and the old man died while waiting.
And today when Austin saw the King crying, he saw that old man in him.
Although he wasn’t able to do anything for the old man, at least he could try and assure his father.
’Haah...family relations are quite complicated.’
Since it was quite late, Austin dropped the plan of meeting Valerie and changed his clothes.
Turning off the lights, he called out, ’System, show me my rewards.’
He would be joining the tournament as an Elite and would be representing his academy.
To not embarrass himself and Valerie, Austin needs to utilize every single weapon he has in his arsenal.
[Ding!]
[Upon crossing a certain threshold in Durability, the host gets rewarded with:
[Adaptive Flesh: Heals minor injuries and enhances endurance against common poisons.]
[Note: The ability would develop with time and repetitive use.]
[Note: There is no limitation on the skill usage.]
Austin nodded in appreciation—that surely is helpful. Kinda feels like a skill belonging to a certain GOAT character.
’Well, I hope the skill develops and heal major wounds as well...’ The enemies he would be facing surely would inflict regular damage. And overdosing on potions was not good for health.
’Okay, next.’
[Ding!]
[Upon crossing a certain threshold in combat, the host gains:
[Berserk: Enhances host’s stats by five times.]
[Limitation: Can be used once after seven hours of complete rest.]
[Note: Skill can be upgraded to amplify the host’s stats more.]
[Note: Since the host used the skill before, the skill is locked for ten days.]
Austin’s excitement turned into surprise, as he asked, ’What the heck with that prohibition?’
[The host used the Berserk skill at a much higher level to defeat the Great Demon; the system has to lock it so no significant damage is sustained on the Host’s body.]
Austin scratched his head—what the heck is this system?
Well, since it saved his life, Austin didn’t complain for long.
At that time, if he had lost his life, none of this would have mattered.
Heaving a sigh, he asked, ’And the last one?’
[Ding!]
[Upon crossing a certain threshold in your overall progression, the host has gained:
[Resonant Bond: Allows host to temporarily synchronize with one’s soul and let him use their Shard.]
[Note: The difference in levels of the host and the target shouldn’t be more than one.]
[Limitation: Can only be used for three minutes]
Your adventure continues at .Côm
[Limitation: Can only be used once in three days.]
[Note: The skill duration can be increased with dungeon points or the Host’s stats progression.]
"...." Austin was rendered speechless as he read the description of the skill again and again
One’s Shard is the essence of one’s soul—something that cannot be used by anyone other than to whom it belongs.
It is the basic textbook knowledge that ever awakened knows.
And here, Austin gained an ability to defy the very basic law...crazy.
’System...so I can only sync with someone who is a level above me?’
[Indeed, host. However, there is no lower limit. The Host can sync with anyone who is on a lower level than the host.]
’Damn....’ That was some crazy ability. Just thinking about how he could have used Drenovar’s prince’s shield against the demon, made him feel itchy all over.
’You are the best, system!’
[Love you too, host.]
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Ayoooooo. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 120 - 119- Suspicious
chapters.content:
There are ten seats in councils, the ten heads that run the Union Council.
These leaders change every ten years, so even if one of them fails to meet the expectations of the masses, they will eventually be replaced. The newly appointed ruler will then have the opportunity to implement improvements and address any shortcomings.
The Union Council serves as the backbone of humanity, providing assurance that any activity from the demonic side will be met with swift retaliation.
Just like how recently the report came from Drenovar about the appearance of Hellstain.
The Union Council deployed its soldiers to handle the situation. While they had no intention of interfering in the conflict between Drenovar and Eryndor, the involvement of demons necessitated their support for the nation.
However, something unexpected happened, and a demonic army, under the guidance of a Demon general, attacked Drenovar out of nowhere.
Although no civilians were harmed in the attack, hundreds of soldiers and a few Council officers fell prey to the demonic creatures.
The moment they received the message that a small army of Demonic beasts had ambushed, the council sent one of their best soldiers and an S-rank for the rescue.
It would have taken the soldier a few hours to reach Drenovar, and his presence alone would have been formidable enough to drive away the threat.
However, by the time the soldier arrived at the scene, the demonic army had vanished without a trace, and the Great Demon from the Hellstain had been reduced to ashes.
Later while investigating, it turned out that two people became the reason for Drenovar’s survival.
Two people; one expected and one not.
"It’s still unclear why Valerie Corwon was in Drenovar. And at the precise time when the Demonic army attacked." One of the Council Heads, a man with wavy black hair and thin-framed glasses, stated.
"The king of Drenovar himself confirmed that he invited the duo to his country to discuss things about truce…but considering the second Prince’s reputation, it is highly likely that Majesty Idris was lying." Another member, this time a woman spoke as she rested her hands on the table.
They maintain records on the noble families of every nation, as well as key individuals they must monitor. Just as they possess extensive knowledge about Valerie Corwon—who has been on their target list for some time. As an S-rank, she has already proven herself valuable enough to serve the Council.
People die to work here, and that girl rejected their offer from the front, saying she wasn’t capable of shouldering such a massive responsibility.
The council is silent until she graduates from the academy. After that, she definitely would be brought in to become a member of the council.
"They are lying but we can do nothing about it. Calling her for interrogation is needless since Valerie Corwon would repeat the same lie. And to summon her just for this would sour our relationship." Another member voiced and several heads nodded in agreement.
They have to treat every matter relating to a high-ranking warrior very carefully.
"Then how would you explain the situation with Austin? That boy, who was assessed to be a D-rank, suddenly gets up one day and defeats a Great Demon?" The one with glasses spoke again as he picked up the report he received about Austin’s assessment.
It was hard to believe that a boy who had yet to go through his first evolution to defeat a Great Demon, who—despite being an inexperienced monster—was at least an A-rank.
Although he had the support of Drenovar’s first prince, even with that it was nearly impossible for them to defeat the Demon on their own.
And not only that, those who witnessed the battle from afar, said that Austin overwhelmed the demon at some point.
"This is suspicious. He even defeated a B-rank cadet recently to secure a position as an Elite in the tournament." Another officer added, which added another point to make people focus on the blond young noble. Find your next adventure on .Côm
"Do you think he is involved with the other side?" Someone asked in a grave tone.
The other side in question was, naturally, the demonic side.
They have come across cases when humans, sometimes willingly and sometimes not, consume the Dark Water and get a significant boost in their magic and physical capabilities.
All the signs indicated that Austin was as well, involved with something inhumane.
"Should we bring him in for interrogation?" Someone raised the suggestion. Naturally, in front of their lie detection tool, not even a demonic human would be able to lie.
They were thinking and preparing their decisions when suddenly a soldier knocked on the door before stepping inside,
"Excuse me, Generals, but there are two urgent news the administrative department wanted to relay."
One of the ten gestured for the soldier to speak.
The soldier began, "The first Prince of Eryndor, Aiden von Eryndor, was accused of poisoning his father, the king, and later he was killed by his brother in court."
That elicited a look of surprise from a few while a few frowned.
If they hadn’t been talking about Austin just now, they wouldn’t have reacted so strongly.
Now, most of them were convinced that bringing Austin for interrogation was quite necessary.
"What’s the second news?" Someone asked before the soldier delivered the news which was far more shocking than the previous one,
"Madam Selner has summoned Valerie Corwon and Austin von Eryndor for questioning, a week later."
That caused many to gasp and many had their eyes widened.
As mentioned previously, the ten members always change after a certain period. However, there is a certain member of the council who might not be a part of the board but is still as important as them.
Someone who has been an advisor of the Council Board for decades. Someone whose words they never question.
The longest serving member of the council and someone who generally doesn’t interfere with regular matters like this.
However, since she had voiced her wish, there was no one who could go against her wish.
"Proceed as commanded."
°°°°°°
A/N:- This was bound to happen, considering Austin’s unnatural growth.

chapters.title: Chapter 121 - 120- Departure
chapters.content:
Very early in the morning, they prepare to leave, since it takes quite a long time to reach the academy.
To cover the distance in half time they were riding horses rather than taking carriages.
They couldn’t choose comfort over their competition. They must arrive by evening, or even the vice headmaster won’t be able to prevent their names from being removed from the list.
The rules of the council were absolute.
"Ready to depart?" Austin asked as he stood near his horse and softly rubbed her mane.
Rudolph yawned, stretching his body a little as he said, "Kind of. It’s not regular for me to wake up this early now."
After joining the academy, Rudolph has become a little lax in his training. After all, when he used to live with his family, his father never allowed him to stray from his routine.
Austin’s left brow went up, "That attitude might cost a loss during the tournament."
Rudolph smirked, "You don’t need to worry about that. Even if I have reduced my early morning training, I generally train more before and after dinner. Now, I have a sparring partner as well, who doesn’t allow me to slack off." Find more to read at .Côm
Saying so, Rudolph looked at the back entrance of the palace, and he found Rhea stepping out with Valerie beside her
Although they were walking side by side, neither of them spoke a single word. Rhea was visually nervous and Valerie just maintained her usual demeanor.
"They are here." Austin turned to look at the duo as Rudolph said.
A smile bloomed on Austin’s face, seeing his beloved early in the morning.
She was wearing a different set of clothes— tight-fitting brown pants with a matching pair of boots. She has a white shirt with frills around her collar and has tied her hair in a ponytail for a comfortable journey.
Her overall appearance made her appear quite refreshing and stunning to him.
Valerie blushed slightly, the previous cold look evaporating as she looked down with her feet slowly coming to a halt before her man.
"Talk about flirting with eyes...." Rhea passingly commented as she made her way towards her horse.
Ignoring the comment, Austin cupped his beloved’s cheek, before asking, "Did you hand a good rest? If you can’t sleep well, we can ride the same horse, and you can relax en route?"
Valerie’s back turned stiff, her mind instantly forming the image of her snuggling close to Austin, with her face against his chest and his warmth all around him.
However, before she could have said anything, "Won’t that slow us down? I mean, carrying Valerie together with you surely would require you to be cautious while riding." Rudolph instantly extinguished the bubbling heat within her.
"..." Rudolph felt the chillness around him suddenly elevating as he rubbed his hands together and said, "Anyways, it’s up to you. See ya." Making a quiet retreat he went to chat with Rhea.
Valerie was disappointed but she also knew that what Rudolph was saying was true.
"He is right...we need to reach the Academy as soon as possible." In the end, she had to hold back her desires for the sake of the tournament. The damn tournament.
Austin smiled at her disappointed reaction before he whispered, "Don’t worry, once we return, I will cuddle you as long as you want. No one will come between us~"
"...!!" Valerie was now fully awake.
"Young master, good morning." Soon the two older men also arrived by their side.
Austin greeted the duo before turning towards Sebastian, "Everything ready? Should we leave?"
Sebastian hesitantly nodded, before he spoke, "Actually, young master, your father asked me to wake him up before we leave...however, considering how tired he was, I couldn’t bring myself to wake him up."
Austin heaved a sigh, "You did the right thing. And anyway, the old man would likely visit the tournament venue to see me, so no point in being worried."
Sebastian smiled at that before they all decided that delaying anymore would cost them a lot.
"Austin and you all, stay behind me. I know a few shortcuts." Just as they climbed their horses, Harold suddenly spoke.
Austin nodded, not suspecting the man one bit in this matter.
Their unexpected trip to the capital came to an end as the six of them departed.
....
What none of them noticed was a single figure standing by the window, looking at them—or to be more precise, at Austin from the moment he appeared in the open.
Soon, a man appeared behind the woman, and he asked, "You could have gone to say goodbye."
Cedric softly spoke to his wife.
He...actually didn’t know what would have happened if Sophie actually had gone to bid farewell to Austin. However, after he heard from Austin last night, the man was somehow positive that something good would come out if the mother approached her son.
Sophie bit her lips, her eyes trembling for a moment before she shook her head and walked back to the bed.
Her mind was too chaotic at the moment, and she knew if she kept thinking about Austin, she would end up recalling what happened yesterday.
And at the moment, Sophie wasn’t ready to face the reality. Not at all.
Cedric heaved a sigh, seeing his wife in that state.
The healers said that they would continuously monitor her, and there would be some frequent fluctuation of emotions she would face these following days.
That’s why, the man was quite careful with his words and wasn’t pushing her to do or say something.
He has already lost his one son because of what mistake he made all those years ago...now, he doesn’t want to lose his wife, too.
Crossing his arms, he looked back—his eyes redirecting toward the route from where they left, as he muttered under his breath,
’I wish you the best of luck for your future ventures. Good luck, my son.’
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- And here, the small arc ends. We will dive into the academy and focus on character growth once again. Drop a comment

chapters.title: Chapter 122 - 121- Promise
chapters.content:
Thanks to Harold’s guidance and the fact that each one of them was superhuman, they reached the academy by afternoon.
Naturally, they didn’t take a break en route, even though Harold suggested, and just when the sun advanced toward the horizon, their horses entered the school premises.
Harold instantly bolted toward the headmaster’s office after telling the group,
"Reach the auditorium by five on the clock. Don’t be late."
Since there were two hours left Rhea said, "I will go and freshen up. Too sweaty." Her shoulders slumped and her eyes appeared droopy, making her seem adorable.
Rudolph didn’t miss the chance to pinch her cheek, making Rhea grumble but too weak to fight him, before he said, "Take an hour of nap as well. I will come wake you up."
Rhea sneered, "Even if it’s you, it is impossible for you to breach the security and fool our dorm warden."
When she said that, Austin turned stiff momentarily…he easily bypassed the security with his fiancée’s help and reached her room. Well, not like he was going to tell them.
"Young master, should I prepare the bath for you?" Sebastian suddenly asked.
Austin shook his head, "You are tired too, rather you go and take a bath first in my room and take rest." The bathroom in Austin’s office, where Sebastian stays, has a very small bathroom and barely anyone can relax while taking a bath there.
The older one smiled—meaning he wasn’t going to—before he bid farewell and moved toward the male dorms.
Austin sighed before he turned toward Valerie…who was strangely holding the mare that Austin was riding.
"What happened?" Austin smilingly asked.
"She is just too fond of you, hush." She drove the mare away before turning her focus to her Lord, "Are you tired?"
Austin tilted his head, stretching his neck slightly as he said, "Some soreness but not too much. Will probably get back in shape by tomorrow…hmm?" Austin’s brows elevated as he saw his beloved’s face turning red for some reason.
"Everything good?"
He asked which caused the girl to panic, "Y-Y-Yes…I-I am c-c-co-completely fine…"
Austin didn’t know why but Valerie appeared really shy about something.
Well, if only he had a mind-reading skill, he would have been blushing as well.
The duo also decided to head back to their rooms and relax for the time being.
Austin was, actually, quite tired after the journey. Although his endurance has increased, it would take some time for him to get used to riding horses.
However, this time he didn’t make any foolish mistake by entering a dungeon to relax a bit. That was one lame idea at that time.
*Click*
Entering the room, he breathed a long breath of relief.
Home sweet home.
Although he has been living here for like a little over one month, he has gotten quite fond of this place.
The bed in the capital was too comfortable and without his Valerie, it felt quite empty.
Getting rid of his sweaty clothes, he opened the door of the bathroom and found that Sebastian had already prepared the bath.
The hot steam coming out of the bathing pool invited his whole being to dive in it, and as such, he didn’t hold back.
"Haah~" A loud exhale of relief escaped his throat as Austin finally found his sore and uncomfortable body, attaining some comfort.
His muscles and bones felt like they were in heaven, and his mind gained some much-needed relief.
Resting his neck against the bundle-up towel, he closed his eyes and enjoyed the bath.
A lot has happened in these few days. Although it cannot be said that he didn’t expect such a long and tiring journey, to think he would get rid of that plague named Aiden during this short trip was completely unexpected.
Unexpected but welcomed.
He had to get rid of Aiden somehow, so it’s all good.
He also got to realize how strong the system was when Austin nearly got killed by the demon but was saved by the miraculous ability of the system
Using the skills and boosts Austin would receive in the future...somehow, it sounded overpowered but problematic at the same time.
Imagine having the ability to face immense heat but because his body already used it, Austin would be left defenseless.
"No...I shouldn’t put myself into such a danger in the first place." The only way the system would use that emergency protocol is when the host’s life gets threatened.
So, if he always plans his battle then the system wouldn’t get the opportunity. Find more chapters on .Côm
Thinking about it, Austin asked, "Can you list all the abilities I have gained from the system?"
[Ding!]
[Preparing the date:
Skills:
•Absolute Barrier
•Aqua Lungs
•Berserk
•Resonant Bond
•Adaptive Flesh
•Adapt
•Kinetic Discharge]
Austin hummed. He has gained quite many skills from the system in this short while. And all of them are quite useful.
Not to talk about all the artifacts he gained over time. Some of them he hasn’t even used until now.
However, he has a feeling that really soon he will need to rummage his inventory.
’Let’s go and get ready for now.’
°°°°°°
Around five, Austin walked out of his room, all freshened up and wearing the usual uniform of the academy.
"Good evening, Young Master. Would you like to have some tea?" Outside his room, Sebastian stood. He was about to knock when suddenly Austin stepped out.
Austin shook, "Although I am quite tempted, I need to reach the ceremonial hall. See you later, Sebas."
"Take care, young lord."
Bidding farewell, Austin stepped out of the dormitory and found several students heading toward the ceremonial hall—which was built on the left side of the main building.
Austin thought to reach the hall and wait for Valerie, but then, after taking a few steps, he found his girl standing near the fountain—the exact same place where she waits for him every morning in that same uniform.
Maybe because he saw her in that dress after a long time, Austin felt his heart rate going up a bit.
Although the sweat-bathed Valerie was a sight for sore eyes, this freshly out-of-bath Valerie, who had done slight makeup and braided her hair, also appeared quite lovely.
"Sorry for making you wait." He called out as he approached the girl.
"I also arrived just now." She said that but Austin hardly believed that to be true.
Once, he came an hour before their appointment time and found her waiting for him. Although he forbade her from punishing herself like this, he doesn’t think that she has changed.
"You look quite lovely. You painted your nails? They look gorgeous."
Valerie blushed, she didn’t think he would notice it right away.
As a warrior, she doesn’t prefer to paint her nails and use her time to do makeup. However, since today she had time and she wanted to impress her Lord, she applied light nail paint.
"Thank you..." With a smile that made him feel more comfortable than the bath he had, she spoke.
They soon departed together, heading towards the ceremonial hall with their hands connected.
Only those students who had been selected as participants in the tournament were invited to the gathering.
Austin met by several gazes—the news regarding Aiden must have reached them by now.
Some were whispering, and some were nudging their friends before signaling toward the couple with their eyes.
Valerie and Austin were at the center of their attention. However, as usual, they ignored everyone and found themselves in a corner.
Austin looked at the food counter before he said, "Wait here, I will bring something for you."
Valerie nodded, and just as Austin stepped away from her, someone approached the girl.
"Hello, there."
The violet-haired turned towards the girl and greeted her, "Good evening, President."
It was the student council president and Valerie’s senior.
Meanwhile, Austin went towards the food counters and took a small plate before he filled it with some muffins and sour and salty chips.
"Got a vibrant taste." Someone called out.
Without lifting his eyes from the food, Austin nonchalantly spoke, "Need to keep things balanced, after all."
Morkel chuckled, "But I heard you threw your brother completely off the balance with your Shard."
Austin shared the laugh, "Well, he surely saw the world off-balance for a couple of moments."
Anyone who would have understood what they were talking and laughing about might have been creeped out. They are laughing at a dead man!
Morkel tilted his head as he asked, "I fulfilled my role, and now I expect that you will too."
Austin nodded, "I remember. Tomorrow, before we leave, I will give you the names. Don’t worry."
Austin soon filled the plate and returned to his lover.
Morkel turned his gaze and settled it on a certain pink-head who was currently surrounded by many students.
’Just a few days...and I will help you take your revenge.’
°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading. Drop a comment.
By the way, Valerie was about to offer a massage when Austin said he was tired.

chapters.title: Chapter 123 - 122- Sweet things
chapters.content:
Often they have visited such gatherings where they used to be in the center of attraction. After all, one was a country’s Prince and the other one was Erynndor’s only S-rank.
That’s why all the attention didn’t bother them as Austin and Valerie stood side by side and enjoyed the snacks.
Austin mostly finished the sweet ones while Valerie enjoyed the savory and salty ones.
Seeing her avoiding sugar, Austin couldn’t help but mutter, "You stopped eating sweet things because of me, right?" Austin remembered that there was a time when Valerie used to eat and bake sweet things.
However, since Austin didn’t like sweet things much, she also changed her preference.
And....that was the same reason Austin started liking sweets.
Austin forced himself to like sweet things because Rhea liked them.
"Now…I don’t feel like trying it." Valerie said as she twirled the cup of black coffee in her hand—don’t ask where she got that even though the servers never had black coffee on the trays.
Austin raised his brows before asking, "Maybe try sometime? Your tastebud might get revived?"
Valerie hummed at the suggestion before her eyes went to the few sugary items on the plate…before her eyes landed on a specific muffin Austin was holding.
"Then…excuse me," Tucking her hair strands behind her ear, she closed her eyes and took a small bite from the muffin.
The whole thing happened before Austin’s surprised gaze as he held his breath upon seeing Valerie biting from the same side that was already bitten.
She intentionally looked him in the eye while slowly chewing the muffin.
Seeing the faint blush on her Lord’s face, a teasing smile appeared on her face as she muttered, "I bet other muffins won’t taste as sweet as this one did."
Discover exclusive tales on .Côm
CRITICAL HIT X100
Austin’s face grew redder as he lowered his head and heard his heart beating rapidly.
Guh, it is so hot and unfair. Why does she have to tease him in front of everyone? If not, he might have shared the muffin in a different way…
"God damn…you two just don’t catch a break."
To break the sweet atmosphere someone approached the duo.
It was Elion—a student from Apex Circle and someone who has a good relationship with Austin.
He was also participating in the tournament as an Elite.
Seeing the long blue-haired boy, Austin raised his brows, "So you do fear getting disqualified." Considering Elion’s unruly and untamed nature, it was surprising for him to be seen in this kind of gathering.
"Well, if I don’t participate my father most probably would throw me out. Valerie must know what kind of man he is."
The violette gave a brief nod that ushered Austin to ask, "You are acquainted with Count Everhart?"
Valerie informed him, "He was my teacher."
Austin was taken aback. He actually had no idea that she was taught by a Count.
"Seriously, dude, you remain lovey-dovey with her all the time, and you know nothing about your girl?" With a teasing grin, he asked, "If you ever regret choosing him, Valerie, I am always open-"
That sentence never finished as the tip of a spear pressed against Elion’s chest, and the guy instantly raised his hands, "Joking. Don’t take it seriously."
Although the boy said that, looking at those frosty eyes, he knew he had offended the girl so Elion made a quick retreat.
Silence descended between the two—making Valerie nervous that that idiot had offended her Lord
The only reason she even responded to him was that Elion was the son of her teacher. If anyone else, she would have driven them away instantly.
She was thinking of resuming their chat somehow, when suddenly,
"May I have your attention, please? The Headmaster wants to relay a few words." The Vice-headmaster appeared on the stage, all well-dressed now, and gathered everyone’s attention
Valerie and Austin also turned towards the man who soon appeared on the stage—wearing a crisp black suit and matching tie.
Silence ensued in the ceremonial hall, as everyone heard the man,
"Tomorrow, we all will leave for the venue where the Tournament will be taking place. You all must have received the schedule, but for those who were not able to check it, I must inform you that every student must gather at the front gate by five o’clock."
With his hands still crossed behind his back, the supreme authority added, "Lastly, I don’t need to remind you of the importance this tournament holds—not just for your personal records, but for the honor of this Academy. You all know the legendary names that have risen through this very stage. The glory earned here is once in a lifetime—a golden opportunity that may never come again.
With his gaze sweeping across the students, he continued, "There are no second chances. When you step into that arena and stand before your opponent, that moment is all you have. Make it count. Fight as if your name depends on it—because it does."
A sudden rush of motivation and excitement rang through the hall.
Every student’s eyes shone with courage and enthusiasm.
Soon, everyone resumed their chatting. However, this time, it was more focused on the tournament and their planning.
Stepping down from the podium, Philius made his way through the students, nodding towards those who greeted him and walked straight towards Austin and Valerie.
"Good evening, sir." Austin greeted the older one.
Philius looked quite tense about something as he said, "After dinner, meet me in the office. Both of you."
Austin and Valerie shared a glance—both of them knew that it must be about what happened yesterday in the royal court. Not only that, the fact Austin lied and went to Drenovar must have offended the old man.
However, since they already expected it Austin didn’t delay responding, "Understood. We will be there."
Giving them a nod, the older one soon left the venue.
°°°°°°
A/N:- I hope you all enjoyed reading the chapter. There are several things Austin doesn’t know about Valerie, but slowly he will.

chapters.title: Chapter 124 - 123- Summoned
chapters.content:
After finishing dinner, Valerie and Austin wasted no time and promptly made their way to the Headmaster’s office, ensuring he didn’t have to wait long.
Valerie noticed that her Lord had been silent for a while now, ever since Elion interrupted them.
"Austin...are you upset because of what Elion said?" Finally, but in a hesitant voice, she asked.
Austin heaved a sigh, "I am upset but with myself." His eyes traveled far ahead, not affixed to a single point, as he said, "It’s so embarrassing for me to say that I love you, yet I know nothing about you. Unlike you, who pursued the one in whom you had interest, I got you very easily."
With a self-mocking smile, the blond one added, "That’s why maybe I became so nonchalant about you. Felt like whatever happens, she won’t leave me."
Valerie grew worried, as she said, "You don’t need to think like that. And I never considered you taking this relationship casually." She meant what she said.
Although they had a very long, patchy path, especially after Aiden arrived in Austin’s life, they somehow got together.
The cause was unexpected but Valerie was happy with how things were. Her love for her Lord has only elevated with time, and having her feelings reciprocated just made her life perfect.
Austin held her hand, an exhale leaking through his lips, as he muttered, "Val...I won’t say negative things anymore, but can you listen to this request of mine?"
Valerie slowly came to a pause, matching him. Her eyes were drawn at him, never breaking the eye contact as she nodded, "Yes..."
Austin held both of her hands and squeezed them as he said, "You deserve all the happiness, Valerie. Don’t assume that I am doing you a favor by being with you. If you feel that I am doing something wrong or I am unaware of things related to you, then show displeasure. That’s the charm of a relationship."
Bringing his hand to cup her cheek he added, "And lastly, please let me know more about you...talk to me more...tell me stories of your past. I swear nothing could keep me engaged more than those stories, which include Valerie. So let me hear more from you."
During those days, when all she could do was admire him from the sidelines, never even once she thought that Austin would be so interested in her.
He was pleading to know more about her. And she could tell it was not because of what Elion said; rather, he was genuinely curious. He needed to know more about her.
Leaning her face in his touch, she affirmed, "Mm...I will tell you."
°°°°°°°
*Knock*
Philius heard the knock before he lifted his eyes from the letter and told the guest, "Come in."
From the other side, two familiar faces stepped inside before Austin closed the door behind his back.
Stepping towards the table, they stood in silence—allowing Philius to begin
"First, congratulations on being selected as Elites for the tournament. And thank you for the favor you two have extended toward Eryndor."
Austin responded in his natural tone, "It was my obligation as the Prince to protect my nation. But still, thank you for acknowledging us and our efforts."
Philius gave a brief nod before ushering them to sit down.
Austin pulled a chair for Valerie, receiving a sweet thanks from her before he sat down beside her.
Both teenagers were expecting something related to Aiden to be the next topic. However,
"I recently received a request. Someone demanded your presence."
Saying so, the older one extended a letter in their direction.
Austin exchanged a glance with Valerie while he extended his hand and took the letter.
Valerie leaned closer to him and they both read the letter.
[The recent events in Drenovar, along with the movements of Valerie Corwon and Austin von Eryndor, have raised several concerns. As a result, the Council has formally summoned both individuals for questioning at the Council Headquarters.]
—Chief Advisor, Selner.]
Austin had a severe frown on his face.
He knows that name. The person whom no one from the Board could defy.
A person with authority and immense strength.
The wielder of one of the Seven Tools of Destruction.
When Rhea was having trouble defeating a Demon General even with the help of so many comrades and two Shards...Selner went against a General all on her own
One of the most influential people in the world and someone who shouldn’t have shown a sudden interest in anyone, including the protagonist.
Then why did she suddenly summon them for questioning? Isn’t the case with Drenovar too trivial for her to bother about?
"Chief Advisor...I think I have read about her somewhere." Unlike Austin, whose knowledge comes from the game, Valerie wasn’t very informed about Selner.
Philius told her, "She is respected by the board members of the Council. Not only does she have authority, but she is one of the S-rank warriors as well, who is known for her witchcraft. Ignoring her call, just because she isn’t one the Heads of the Council, would be foolish."
Philius was aware of what happened yesterday in the royal court. However, for him, this was more important than a criminal’s death.
Austin remained silent for another moment, before he asked, "You...can’t help in this, I guess?"
Philius heaved a sigh, "I am completely helpless here. You need to respond to her demand."
Austin nodded and then contemplated for a moment.
Raising his eyes, he asked, "What are the chances for her to be summoning us so she could recruit Valerie?"
Philius shook his head, "I don’t think so since Madame Selner isn’t like those from the Board. She doesn’t care who serves the Council."
Continue reading at .Côm
Valerie raised her brows, "Then why did she even call us when all the information was openly revealed to them?"
When the demonic army attacked, the members of the Union Council were present there. And naturally, Drenovar’s soldiers mustn’t have hidden anything from them either.
Then what exactly do they want?
"I am not sure what this is about; however, after a week, you two need to visit her in her office."
Valerie questioned, "We will be in the middle of the tournament, though."
Philius assured them, "The venue of the tournament is close to the Headquarters so you two will get the time."
Austin heaved a sigh, "Since it’s all decided, there is nothing we can do other than follow orders."
Since he assumed that the talk was over, Austin said, "Then, excuse us, Sir."
"Austin," Philius called out, making Austin stop just as he intended to get up before he heard the man saying, "This tournament...it might be a little harsh for you since this is the first time you are participating in any of these events. However, I request you to put your team and this school above your pride."
Austin smirked, "There are limits, sir. And believe me, as a second prince who has been overlooked his entire life, my boundaries are far lower than you might expect. So rest assured."
Soon, they left the office and headed back to their rooms.

chapters.title: Chapter 125 - 124- About the tournament
chapters.content:
Later that night, as promised, Valerie arrived in his room.
She was slightly hesitant, considering her Lord was tired, and they had parted ways just half an hour ago, so she was not sure if she should visit him or not.
That’s why she decided to check on him, and if he was sleeping, she would have left.
However, the moment she jumped from the tree to land on his window,
"Hello, beautiful." With his elbow resting on the window frame, and his face pressed on his curled fist, Austin greeted her.
Valerie was startled to see him here, nearly missing the mark and slipping—only for her Lord to catch her arm and hold her from falling.
"Did I scare you? Sorry~" Austin smilingly pulled his beloved into the room. Well, waiting for her like that might not have been the best idea.
Explore stories at .Côm
Valerie thanked him as she landed in his room and exhaled a long breath, "I thought you might have fallen asleep."
Austin teasingly smiled, "Can’t be helped, my blanket isn’t warm enough."
The implication of those words made Valerie’s face warm as she averted her gaze slightly and asked, "W-Well, maybe I can help."
"Sure you can...but if you are okay then let’s talk for a bit."
Valerie blinked in perplexity, but she instantly nodded.
Austin went to the small kitchen he had and brought two cups of hot steaming coffee for both of them.
Inviting the girl to sit on the bed, he took a chair and handed the cup to her.
"Thank you." She thanked him before inhaling the aromatic scent of freshly crushed beans. Ah, he really knows what she likes.
Austin nodded as he sat down across from her, and began the conversation, "Val...can you tell me more about this tournament? Like how does it happen, and how many matches do we need to play?"
He had knowledge of the game; however, very vaguely everything was explained since the game only focused on the Protagonist and her matches. A few glimpses of her harem member’s matches as well, but that didn’t give enough evidence of what this was all about.
And since the original owner of the body never assumed himself participating in the tournament, he didn’t pay attention to it.
It wasn’t that he lacked the strength or confidence to be selected, but the real Austin knew becoming an Elite was out of his reach. And if he couldn’t participate alongside Rhea as an Elite, the original Austin saw no reason to care about the tournament at all.
Valerie hummed, before she asked, "Can I get a paper and pen?"
Austin nodded, "Yeah, sure."
Valerie got up from the bed and reached the table.
Austin offered her a chair and the things she asked for.
Both of them sat while facing each other as Valerie first finished the coffee—she couldn’t let the beverage get cold, which was prepared by her Lord—and then she started writing.
"So the tournament is divided between two divisions: Rookie and Elites. Eight students will be participating from each division, so counting all the students, it would be one hundred twenty-eight from eight academies?"
"Hmm? Eight? Aren’t there like seven major nation’s academies?"
Valerie nodded, "Yes, but every year, the council allows one academy from an underdeveloped town or city to participate in the tournament. They want to encourage them to improve and eventually earn a rightful place in the competition."
"Kind of like underdogs, huh? Well, continue."
Valerie nodded as she began writing in two columns, "We don’t get to hear what matches we would be playing until we reach there, so no academy could get to practice beforehand. However, the Council never changes their pattern of matches."
Saying so, Valerie wrote ’Stage One’.
"Forget about the Rookie division since their challenges would be completely different and more fun-related. The Elite division would be distributed into two squads from each academy, and they would be facing the squads from different academies. There will be a team-based round in the beginning, which would eliminate half of the Elite division by the ninth day."
Austin’s brows elevated as he registered every word she spoke, before asking, "You mean failing here means one won’t be allowed to continue?"
Valerie nodded, "Yes, and, the next round can only be played by the squad that won—replacing members and bringing someone from the defeated squad is prohibited."
Austin’s brows drew closer as he asked, "So if you are placed in a group of idiots which becomes a reason for you to lose....Valorian Academy would lose their best students in the initial phase, huh?"
Valerie smiled, "I might be strong but I am not the best, Austin."
That elicited a hum of questioning, as he asked, "What do you mean?"
"Experience does matter here. You cannot win the tournament with brute force. That’s why the President, who participated as a Rookie two years ago, is the best pick for this tournament."
Austin scoffed; he didn’t believe that. For him Valerie was the best and someone who would bring Valorian Academy to glory.
Valerie smiled helplessly, seeing the reluctance from her Lord, before she continued, "So by the ninth day, we would be left with sixty-four participants. At this stage, we would be grouped as a duo—making sixteen teams."
She spoke as she wrote, "Thirty-two teams and one round would be held between four duos, and only a single pair would come out victorious. That’s why, by the fifth day we would be left with sixteen remaining people."
"Hmm...but there is a chance that more students from one academy would remain for the second round, and some academies might no longer be participating."
Valerie nodded, "Indeed, that’s why there is a chance we fight against the people with whom we participated with."
Austin smiled as he held her hand and said, "Well, we will be together so I ain’t worried."
Valerie smiled fondly, "Me too. But we need to make sure that we get into the same squad as well."
Austin nodded—these team matches would be difficult considering his reputation in the academy.
’That’s why the headmaster said that I might face severe difficulty...’ He was feeling a headache approaching
Valerie continued, "Then comes the individual rounds where one has to play four rounds against the others to reach the finals."
She drew the whole chart of how the rounds would flow and how one could tread through all the challenges to stand at the top.
Austin looked at the semi-finalist brackets as he asked, "So, there is a chance we can face each other in the final round."
Valerie slowly moved her head left and right, "Possibly."
Austin looked up, a crisp smile on his face as he said, "And if that happens, I won’t be holding back so make sure you don’t let your feelings become a reason for your defeat."
Valerie also looked back with her left eyebrow elevated as she said, "I want to impress my fiancé so surely I will win."
"That so~well, let’s see."
The challenge was on.
°°°°°°°°

chapters.title: Chapter 126 - 125- Worth?
chapters.content:
Early in the morning, everyone gathered at the main gate of the academy.
They were told to wear their field uniform since the journey was a little long and they would need to camp outside as well.
If they travel at a moderate pace, then they will reach the venue by tomorrow morning.
And that was perfect since tomorrow evening would be the opening ceremony of the tournament.
Those who aren’t participating in the tournament can only come the day after tomorrow to watch the matches. Their transportation would be arranged by the academy as well.
The sixteen students, along with the backup team have gathered at the main entrance.
Valerie was looking in the distance silently, wondering if she should have visited Austin’s room since he hadn’t arrived until now.
’Because of me ...he slept late.’ Even when she tried to feel guilty, she couldn’t.
Last night...they flirted until late and then cuddled a whole lot. However, since Valerie had to prepare for the trip she didn’t stay there and returned.
And it seems like, because of her, he got late in waking up.
"You seem quite worried."
Valerie turned to look at the person.
"Good morning, President." She greeted her—the student council President, Rothaux Anabelle.
The redhead President had braided her hair in a high ponytail and the uniform was clinging to her body in a way which made the boy glance at her more than it seemed appropriate.
Valerie...felt slightly better that Austin didn’t see her like this...but for how long?
"Your lover is late. Shouldn’t have kept him awake~" Anna teasingly said, which made Valerie flinch. But then she realized that she was just teasing her, so she responded casually,
"He must have been training until late."
Anna raised her brows, "He does give the impression of a diligent child."
Valerie smiled slightly and soon they both turned silent, standing side by side.
Anna had her hands crossed behind her back, and her eyes rested on nothing constant, as she asked, "Hey, Valerie....although I watched Austin’s match, I want to know, do you trust his strength enough to be a part of this tournament?"
Valerie’s eyes turned cold, as she asked, "What do you mean by that?"
Normally, that gaze and that tone would have easily made anyone flustered, however, Anna retained her composure and asked her, "You know I would be given the role to lead the squad matches...to decide the teams based on what the Elites could do. And Austin is the only person with whom I have never participated in any activity before so I am uncertain about him."
Valerie didn’t lose her cool. Although she didn’t like it when someone talked like that about her beloved, she knew losing her cool here would be foolish on her end. What Anna was saying was true. She didn’t mean to degrade Austin—she was really curious and worried about the upcoming tournament.
Valerie confidently said, "He may lack experience in group missions and he might be an unexpected addition for you...but I can say for certain that Austin won’t drag anyone down during the tournament. You can give him any role and he would excel."
Anna kept looking at Valerie for a few moments.
Was it her feelings that were clouding her judgment, or did she really feel so?
Although Bella has seen Austin’s two matches, one when he fought the speedster and one when he fought against the teleportation girl.
There was no doubt that the guy has a high battle IQ, but can he fit in the team?
’Why am I even questioning this when I have no other choice...Austin has already proven himself to be in this group, so I just need to trust his strength and place him in a spot where he can shine.’
Seeing the blond guy advancing, Anna stepped away, rejoining her previous group.
....
Austin hurried toward the main entrance as he found his beloved standing there with a complicated look on her face
Her brows were slightly drawn closer and her lips were pursed.
She didn’t even notice him until Austin reached near her and waved his hand before her eyes, "Hey, are you okay?"
Valerie was startled, as she hurriedly said, "Y-You...are here. Good morning."
She regained her composure and greeted him.
Austin raised his brows as he glanced at the President, who had been chatting with Valerie until he arrived.
In a whisper, he asked, "Did she say something? The President?"
Valerie bit her lips...unsure if she should tell her Lord about it or not. In the end, she decided to not hide it from him,
"She was...concerned about your place in the team. She said that you have never been a part of any of the groups she worked with. That’s why she is unsure about your spot."
Austin heaved a sigh as he rested his hands on his silly fiancée’s shoulder before telling her, "And you are concerned about that? Didn’t I say that I would be facing these kinds of questions a lot? And you cannot blame the President since until a few weeks ago, I couldn’t even hunt a D-rank beast on my own."
"But you have become stronger...you have earned your place in this tournament."
Austin nodded, "I know and she knows as well. However, these slight clouds of doubt will remain until I don’t perform well in the tournament. So stop worrying about it." Saying so, he brought the girl closer to him, hugging her shoulder and pressing her face against his chest.
Valerie also readily accepted the hug since she needed it. Her restless heart was searching for this warmth.
Soon the vice-headmaster and the chief instructor arrived by the main entrance and told the students,
"The carriage has been prepared. Follow me." Turning around, he began walking out of the academy.
Everyone followed him silently until they reached the carriages.
There were four of them, and all of them were ordinary but longer than an average carriage.
"Sit according to your preference but don’t step inside the last one," Harold spoke in his usual stern tone.
Because it was him, not the headmaster, no one dared to move noisily, and everyone sat inside the carriages one after another—choosing to sit with their friends and lovers.
Naturally, Valerie and Austin also sat in the same carriage, followed by Rudolph and Rhea, who also found it more comfortable to sit with those with whom they were acquainted.
"Hey," Rhea greeted the duo as she sat across from them.
*Dhak*
The carriage moved slightly as Rudolph sat down.
His massive frame and above-average size made the spacious carriage look small.
"Woke up late?" Rudolph asked with his brows raised.
Austin heaved a sigh, "Was just taking my time to pack things up."
Rhea suddenly asked, "You have packed formal clothes too?" She looked worried? Stay tuned for updates on .Côm
Austin blinked, "No...why?"
Rhea grew more worried, "But there is a ceremony tomorrow, right? We will need to wear formal dresses, right?"
Austin sighed while Valerie rolled her eyes.
It was Rudolph who informed her, "We have to wear our academy’s uniform during the ceremony because that shows from where we come, and whom we represent."
Rhea had an embarrassed expression, "I should have guessed...gah." Her shoulders slumped as she regretted packing so many things in her bag...to the point, that there was no room left to even adjust a med kit inside.
She really needs to learn from Valerie. So prepared and composed all the time.
*Click*
The doors of the carriage opened, only to reveal two people—a girl and a boy.
"Ooh~" Rudolph had a smirk on his face as he identified the two people.
The two people who got defeated by Austin and Valerie in the trials.
Elara and Ryan.
"Oh, I am leaving." Elara instantly turned around, ready to sit in any carriage—even the roof of it would work—but this one.
However, the moment she turned around, she found the vice-headmaster standing there, making the girl flinch before she heard him say,
"All the other carriages are full, so go sit inside."
"Y-Yes." In front of Harold, no one dared to talk. And the same goes for Elara.
She instantly climbed the carriage and sat beside Austin. Beside Rudolph, Ryan took a seat.
Ryan was slightly on the leaned side so there was no problem for him to comfortably sit beside Rudolph.
On the other side, Austin and Valerie were both lean and were sitting quite close, that’s why there was enough space for two people to sit.
As such, Elara chose to sit as far as she could from the last man she wanted to share the seat with.
Neither Ryan said a word nor Elara turned to look at them.
Seeing the tension in the air, Rhea couldn’t help but mutter, ’This is going to be one awkward journey...’
°°°°°°
A/N:- I hope you all liked the chapter. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 127 - 126- Family
chapters.content:
Inside the carriage, silence persisted for too long. After all, one of the six lost to Valerie in the trials, and one lost to Austin.
Well, in Valerie’s case, it was expected. However, the humiliation Elara had to face after her defeat against a D-rank warrior was immense.
Although she got selected as an Elite thanks to her other matches, she hasn’t forgotten what she faced back in the arena.
’Agh...just thinking about it makes my stomach hurt...’ She massaged the spot which was beaten black and blue during their match.
She has yet to understand how someone tracked her teleportation. She was in self-doubt for a very long, thinking that maybe there was some kind of loop that might give away her presence, rendering her skill useless.
It was the biggest horror of her life, that threatened her until she faced her next match—and seamlessly overwhelmed her opponent. Not only that, she even went against an A-rank later and even won that.
Crazy!
That helped her realize that it was only one guy in her whole life who had found a loophole in her Shard’s technique.
Although she was eager to ask him what it was so her future opponents couldn’t exploit it, she was hesitant to talk to him.
’Guh...look at those creeps.’ A tremor snaked through her spine, seeing Valerie and Austin being all lovely dovey. Get a room or something!
"By the way, Austin. Have you thought of re-evaluation?" The only person Elara genuinely admires in the whole carriage is Junior Rudolph!
"I am not exactly sure if I should...you see, my Shard has yet to evolve."
The loser spoke....but, since Elara lost to him, isn’t she a bigger loser?
’Agh...how did I lose to someone who is still at stage zero? I need to train!’
While Elara was going through her inner conflict, Rudolph added, "They don’t ask for your Shard’s stage; they give you a set of trials to determine your rank. Only below B-rank though."
If one wants to be ranked A or S then their Shard must have gone through evolutions.
"He is right, and as of now, I think you may have reached B-rank?" Rhea added, and that made Austin smile,
"Nope, I haven’t reached B-rank yet—well, not completely. Although I have the speed, without strength and the support of my Shard, I might be just C-rank. So getting a promotion of a single rank doesn’t sound tempting to me."
Hearing the lack of motivation in his voice made Rhea feel sad and guilty somehow.
Even Valerie had a sad expression, seeing her Lord lacking confidence.
Austin generally doesn’t sound this dejected, however, after his loss against that Minotaur, he feels that he still has some progress to make to become a B-rank.
And then there was the trauma of being nearly killed by the demon too—which had given him a nightmare last night, and Austin ended up waking up late today.
’I can’t let this feeling drag me down during the competition...’ Deciding to get rid of this clog in his mind, he resolved to dwell in the dungeon today and defeat the mid-boss anyhow.
Since there was a day for the tournament to begin, he would get enough time to rest. So, no problem with that.
°°°°°°
The sky darkened, and the wind was strong, but in the forest, it was bearable.
Since it would take another six hours to reach and they had enough time, Harold told the carriage drivers to stop.
Students slowly began to get out of their carriages, as Harold told them, "Start building the camp. Twenty minutes."
The students were no longer moving leisurely and instantly began to take out the camp canvas nails and other equipment.
Valerie and Austin stepped out and the first thing Anna told them was, "Go bring wood from the forest. A lot of them."
Austin and Valerie glanced at each other before they nodded, "Okay."
Since they had to do something, why not bring wood?
Rudolph and Rhea were given separate tasks; the boy was told to help in holding the tent while the pinkhead was asked to help in preparing the ingredients for dinner.
The forest was too silent, to the point of being eerie.
Austin was holding a small lantern that allowed them to see in the dense forest.
*Krik* *Krik*
The sound of the nocturnal creatures echoed occasionally; however, other than that, there was no sighting of any wild beasts.
Valerie slowly brought her hand to hold the hem of his shirt, before she asked, "Are you okay?"
Hearing her voice, he realized that he indeed made her worried by how he reacted back in the carriage.
Read exclusive chapters at .Côm
"Well...it still haunts me sometimes...what I faced back in Drenovar." He didn’t hide it from her since she was the only person who wouldn’t use his failures against him under any circumstances.
Valerie bit her lip, feeling frustrated with herself that she wasn’t there when her Lord needed her and something disastrous happened.
She knew the situation he faced would leave lasting damage on his psyche. However, despite having the expectation, seeing him like this, made her feel extremely guilty and sad.
"Val..." Suddenly, Austin pulled Valerie behind a tree, startling the girl.
He even pressed his hand against her lips, preventing her from making a sound.
She looked at him in surprise, before asking him with her brows elevating.
Austin slowly removed his hand from her mouth before pointing in the direction they were heading to.
Valerie slowly turned to look over her shoulder, only to find a small pack of wolves.
There were two big ones and several small ones, making a shelter under a tree and having their family time.
The white wolf was licking the little one’s fur, while the patchy one was playing with the other two kids.
"Doesn’t it look comfortable...and admirable?" Austin softly muttered as he saw the family.
Valerie hummed before she turned to look at him.
The look in his eyes made her feel fuzzy inside as she held his shirt and asked, "Do you like children?"
Austin smilingly nodded."I do...and I want to make a big family where we won’t need to worry about any kind of danger. Just you and me, and our little ones." Austin leaned closer and softly tapped his forehead against hers.
Valerie closed her eyes, feeling the warmth of her Lord’s words seeping inside her.
The very thought of building a family with the one she loves made her extremely excited yet calmed her down at the same time.
In the end, the only words that came out were, "I also do."
°°°°°°°
A/N:- You know a person who doesn’t do anything but relax your mind just being around you? Valerie is like that for him.
Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 128 - 127- Borrowing a Shard
chapters.content:
Back in the camp, everyone had settled down, and the campfire was already lit…even though Valerie and Austin were given the duty of bringing the firewood.
Anna shook her head as a sigh seeped through her lips, "I knew you two would be late that’s why I told Elion to bring wood. Anyway, Valerie, can you help with the soup? They are having a hard time chopping vegetables."
The violette nodded before she glanced at her beloved, and with a smile, she said, "Wait for me." Saying so, she made her way toward where other students were chopping vegetables, and meat and preparing other things for dinner.
Seeing her taking the knife and expertly chopping the vegetables made Austin sigh,
’Such a fine wife she would become…’
Seeing that expression on his face, Anna giggled, "I am happy to see that it isn’t just Valerie who is so head over heels for you…you are the same."
Austin shrugged, "I mean, it’s impossible not to fall for such a lovely girl."
Anna smilingly nodded, "Right, that’s why Valerie receives so many letters so regularly."
Austin’s eyes turned frosty as he turned to look at the redhead before asking, "What letters?" Discover hidden content at .Côm
Anna stuck her tongue out, "You didn’t know? Ehh~did I overstep my boundaries?" Saying so she clasped her hands and requested, "Please don’t tell her that I told you…you see, sometimes my adorable junior becomes really scary."
Austin huffed, "Thanks for telling me, and don’t worry, I won’t bring your name in this." Austin had really no idea that despite being engaged some bastards were pestering his woman.
"By the way, Austin…I heard what happened in the royal court," Turning to look at him, she asked, "Are you really fine after what happened?"
Austin wasn’t surprised about her reach to the royal court; after all, the Rothaux family was one of the biggest trader families that had connections with three different nations, including Hener.
Being the daughter of the company’s owner, it was not surprising that she knew about the incident that took place.
Austin inhaled a long breath before telling her honestly, "I don’t feel anything…no emotional burden and no physical changes. I am fit and healthy for the tournament."
Anna’s hands crossed behind her back as she leaned sideways, and while looking at him with an upturned gaze, she said, "I wasn’t asking you because of the tournament. But I am glad that you are okay."
Austin was slightly surprised to hear that. The mysterious President, who always wears a smile on her face and is hard to read, was being considerate towards him, huh? He wasn’t used to it. Definitely not from a stranger.
She soon regrouped with her friends, leaving Austin alone
Since there was nothing he had to do, Austin sat down before the campfire and watched the flames in a daze.
He would be diving into the second dungeon tonight and challenge the mid-boss again.
Why was he doing so? Well, the primary goal was to level up so he could give his best during the tournament and not drag his team down.
The second motive was to get rid of these mental restraints that have been weighing down on him for some time now. So yes, it was necessary.
But before going there, ’System, how can I use the Resonant Bond?’
[Ding!]
[The host needs to be in a certain range with the person whose Shard the host wants to temporarily borrow.]
’So it would be like I would be taking their Shard for a few minutes?’
[Indeed, host. And since the host is planning to use the borrowed Shard in the dungeon, the original owner wouldn’t know when their Soul Shard would get stolen.]
Austin worryingly asked, ’Will that affect their soul?’
[Not at all, host!]
That relieved him. Although he doesn’t care much about anyone except for Valerie here, damaging one’s soul for his selfish desires would be deranged on his part. If it had been some emergency, then that might have been understandable, but this was something he could do even without borrowing someone’s Shard.
’Anyway, tell me, does the timer of the three minutes start right away after I borrow their Shard?’ He asked, since if that’s the case, then he might need to dive into the dungeon right away.
[Indeed, host. After all, borrowing the part of one’s soul for long, would be dangerous.]
Austin raised his brows, ’You said there is a way to upgrade the skill and elevate the usage time? Then...won’t that harm them?’
[Ding!]
[Excellent question, host!]
[The system has taken the matter into consideration and would only allow the skill to be upgraded to the point where it doesn’t end up harming the original user of the Shard.]
’Oh...damn, that’s clever.’
[Clever host, clever system~~]
"..." Austin has a feeling that the system has been talking a lot recently. But well, since it wasn’t pushing needlessly difficult tasks on him nor was adding any penalty, it was all fine.
’Okay, let’s see whose Shard I can borrow...’ Everyone around him was the best of the best. They have defeated others to reach here, so their Shards must have an overpowered ability.
’System...can you tell me whose Shard I can borrow?’
[Indeed, host.]
When the message disappeared from the field of his vision, Austin began seeing the people around him inside a box—most of them glowed red, showing that he could not borrow their Shard.
Austin, despite knowing the answer, turned towards Valerie.
The girl also looked back at him, a smile lifting the edges of her lips, as she gestured that just a few minutes more.
Austin nodded to her, as he found the box forming around her also turning red. Well, it would have been shocking if he could have borrowed her Shard.
He turned his eyes around and settled on a certain short-haired girl...Elara.
’Hmm...she is the only compatible girl...and I know what her Shar can do.’
’Teleportation or more like spatial substitution...hmm, I think that can be helpful.’ More like he didn’t have any other choice but to take her Shard.
Against that monster, anything would be useful.
With those thoughts, Austin got up and began advancing toward Elara who was chopping the logs into four pieces using an axe.
’How long do I need to be near her?’
[For thirty seconds, host.]
Hearing that, Austin glanced at Valerie and found her pouring something into a bowl.
’Wish me luck, love.’
He finally reached beside Elara and wordlessly took another axe.
[Soul Resonating: 29...28...27...]
Elara frowned, seeing the blond guy beside her, before she asked, "Wanna say something?"
Austin shook his head, "I was free, so I thought I should help you."
Elara shrugged. Although she didn’t need help, telling him so and turning this into an argument felt like a waste of energy.
Silence persisted between them for a few more seconds before Elara turned to look at him and said, "Hey, can you tell me—" And she stopped right there, as Austin already dove into the dungeon, once he finished borrowing her Shard.
