’Haah...let’s see...’ Finding himself back in the burning world, Austin heaved a sigh as he held two different Shards.
One was his own, and on the other hand, was a small shuriken that he had taken from Elara.
’I hope this helps me with the monster.’
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- I will keep the battle short, don’t worry.
On a side note, do you want me to write R-18 for this story? Well, it won’t affect the story and won’t contain any strong material so it can be skipped by those who aren’t comfortable with it. Drop your thoughts in the comment box.

chapters.title: Chapter 129 - 128- Cleared
chapters.content:
Austin was back. Inside the dungeon, facing the twenty-foot-tall monstrosity.
Standing amidst the corpses of fallen giants, he locked eyes with the Minotaur.
As the system said, before reaching any boss, he had to defeat all the mobs once again. And the sad part is they gave barely any points.
[Total points: 352]
But well, Austin’s goal was to defeat the creature before his eyes who had given him the taste of defeat for the first time after reincarnating.
He didn’t ask for a resting zone and decided to fight right away.
Reason? Elara’s Shard was about to fade away, and Austin wanted to use the remaining time in his favor.
"*HUFF*" The big nose of the beast exhaled visible air as it held its weapon with both hands and slammed its hoof on the ground with enough force to send tremors.
Austin took a deep breath, steadying himself. Then, with a sharp motion, he crossed his hands over each other before snapping them apart—flinging the shuriken and Wisp in opposite directions like a sudden burst of lightning splitting the sky.
The beast’s eyes gleamed, locking onto Austin. But in the blink of an eye—SHFF—he swapped places with the shuriken, dodging the paralyzing glare by a hair’s breadth.
"HUFF…" The minotaur exhaled sharply, caught off guard. Its bloodlust, meant to paralyze its prey, was wasted.
It twisted its massive frame, scanning the area—only to hear a sharp whistle cutting through the air.
Austin was already mid-air, his hair fluttering as he hurled the shuriken toward its skull.
CRACKLE!
Lightning surged as he summoned Raijin. The sudden burst of electricity sent a violent warning through the beast’s nerves. It spun toward the sound—toward the blond standing above.
THUNK THUNK
It charged. Each step cracked the earth, sending vibrations rippling outward. The weight of the beast was abyssal, its sheer presence suffocating.
But then—
FWIP!
Austin was gone.
CRACK!
"AGHRERR!"
The minotaur’s roar shattered the air as something struck from above. Sparks crawled over its thick skull, burrowing into its flesh. Its muscles twitched uncontrollably.
However, the monster was far from being defeated.
It swung its massive weapon upward, only for—
*Click*
—Austin to switch places with the Shard once again.
*Tap*
Austin’s feet touched the ground, right before the monster.
Using instant teleportation had its advantages.
No wonder Elara was one of the strongest in Valorian Academy.
’I guess I need to hurt him a little more—’
His thoughts cut off.
"KHRUUUUUUEENGH!"
The monster’s howl shook the air, its massive frame pulsing with power. A sinister glow spread across its body as if something inside had awakened.
Austin instinctively took a step back, his breath hitching. The pressure pressing down on him was overwhelming—disastrous. His muscles tensed, and for the first time, doubt flickered in his mind.
The minotaur spun its weapon above its head, the sheer force stirring the wind into a violent howl—before it brought it down in a diagonal slash.
CRACK!
The ground didn’t just split—it was ripped apart. A massive air slash tore through space, rushing toward Austin.
And this time, he had no way to escape.
SLAASH!
"AGHHHH!!"
The wind screamed past him, his clothes shredding apart. Blood sprayed into the air as deep, burning cuts riddled his body. The force sent him hurtling back, his vision spinning as pain lanced through every nerve.
His grip loosened. His shuriken—his lifeline—faded.
No escape.
DHAK!
His back slammed into the dungeon’s barrier, the impact rattling through his bones. A ragged breath tore from his throat before his body finally collapsed to the ground.
His chest rose and fell unevenly. Each inhale burned.
His whole body—a mess. Hundreds of cuts marred his skin, blood trickling down in countless streams.
He remained lying there lifelessly, giving the Minotaur the opportunity to close in.
The monster slowly approached the dead meat, its weapon lazily pressed on its shoulder as it stepped closer and closer to the human.
"*HUFF*" A huff of pride and arrogance as the monster appeared before Austin and raised its foot to end the farce once and for all, when suddenly,
*TING*
A heavy burden slammed down on the Minotaur’s massive frame.
Its foot, raised to crush the human beneath it, suddenly faltered mid-air—trembling.
Its breath hitched.
Then—
"KHRRRHHH!!"
A guttural snarl escaped its throat as an invisible force coiled around its body, slithering into its very core. Its muscles stiffened, its instincts screaming in alarm.
It felt like being submerged in a sea of pure malice.
Austin rose.
The deep gashes across his body stitched themselves shut, flesh mending as though his injuries had never existed.
[Ding!]
[Skill Adapt is in use!]
[Skill Adaptive Flesh is in use!]
He exhaled sharply, dragging the back of his hand across his bloodied lips. Then, his gaze lifted—cold and unyielding—as he fixed his eyes on the frozen Minotaur.
It stood there, its massive leg hovering mid-stomp, its entire body twitching. The once-proud behemoth—paralyzed by its own medicine.
Austin’s lips curled into a vicious smirk.
"Bitter, isn’t it?" His voice was low, mocking. "The very medicine you force-feed others."
The beast’s muscles spasmed violently, its instincts roaring for it to move. But its body refused.
CRACK!
Austin launched himself forward, wind tearing past his ears as he soared toward the Minotaur’s towering frame.
The beast’s eyes widened in alarm—
THUD!
Austin landed on its shoulder, boots pressing into the thick, muscled flesh.
"KHRUHHH…" A deep, panicked groan rumbled from the beast’s throat.
But before it could react—
Austin plunged his hand straight into the Minotaur’s massive nose.
The beast convulsed, its head jerking back as it gargled in shock.
Austin’s arm pushed in deeper—farther than it should have. His fingers curled, his knuckles cracking as he clenched his fist.
The Minotaur’s body jerked, its legs stumbling. It staggered backward—
But it was already too late.
Austin’s grin sharpened.
"See you in hell, buddy~"
BOOM!
Something erupted from Austin’s fist.
A shining blue weapon—his Shard—tore through the Minotaur’s insides like a merciless spear, ripping straight through flesh and bone, traveling downward at a terrifying speed.
It burst through its pelvis, tearing the monster apart from the inside, before stabbing deep into the dungeon floor with a deafening THUD!
The Minotaur’s howl of agony never even left its throat.
Its eyes remained wide, frozen, as thick rivulets of blood poured from its gaping mouth, from its nose, from its very eyes.
Austin twisted his arm, his grip tightening—
And then—
SCHLURK!
The Shard expanded, its jagged edges splitting open, shredding every last organ inside the beast’s body—turning everything into an unrecognizable pulp.
A deep shudder passed through the Minotaur’s massive frame—before, finally, its strength gave out.
It collapsed to its knees.
Then—
With one final, sickening lurch—
It fell.
Stay updated with .Côm
Austin heaved a sigh, as he jumped away from the Minotaur, his Shard returning to its original size of a dagger.
He knew that damaging the skin of the beast was fruitless, so he had to somehow find an opening that led him inside its body.
So there were two options—nose and...well, Austin chose the first one.
Looking at his arm and his body which was full of blood and mucus, he sighed, "Lucky that I don’t have to appear like this in front of Val..."
°°°°°°°
A/N:- If you are wondering when Austin copied Blood Lust from the monster, then when the beast sent the wind attack, it paralyzed Austin.
Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 130 - 129- SS: The day he protected her
chapters.content:
"Are you okay?"
Austin was shaken out of his daze when he felt Valerie’s hand on his.
He looked up and found that most of the people were looking at him, some in concern and some in curiosity.
"I...am sorry. Just tired." He has been spacing out ever since. Not because he wasn’t paying attention to the conversation or the food his beloved made. Rather, it was the fatigue from the dungeon that was weighing down on him.
"Man...a few hours of the journey it all took to take you down~"
Valerie glared at Elion, however, the guy remained nonchalant as he continued to munch on the sandwich.
Annabelle pinched Elion’s cheek, making the guy groan, before she said, "How about you rest in the tent for the time being? There are still two hours left before we resume the journey,"
Austin glanced at Valerie and, looking at her worried visage, ushered him to nod, "Yeah, that would be the best." Since he had already finished the food, he rested the bowl on the table before getting up.
Valerie was fidgeting at her place, unsure if she should follow him when Rhea spoke, "There are insects in the tent. Here; use this to repel them." She handed her a spray.
Valerie couldn’t suppress the smile, as she took the spray and got up, "Thank you."
Rhea was taken aback by that smile...although she had seen her smile before, it was the first time for Valerie to talk so gently to her.
"What? Are you falling for her or something?" Elion teased—only to get his other cheek pulled.
...
Valerie reached the tent slowly and carefully lifted the cover to peek inside.
Her heart warmed up at the sight awaiting her.
Inside the tent, there was only a single person.
Austin was lying down on the makeshift bed with his arm being used as a pillow.
’He looks so peaceful...’ She slowly stepped inside, not wanting to disturb him—but,
"Ah, Val...did you need something?" He groggily opened his eyes and asked her.
Valerie felt guilty for waking him, but since he had already woken up,
"Ah...what ....are..." Austin was surprised as he found his head being pressed on something far softer and more comfortable than his arm.
A lap pillow.
Valerie tucked his hair strands behind his ear, as she said, "Sweet dreams."
Austin sheepishly asked, "Will that be fine? Is my head not heavy?"
Valerie shook her head, "Not at all. And since it’s about a few hours, I will be fine." Truth be told, she wouldn’t have minded being like this for days, but a few hours would do.
"If you say...then...thank you." Austin must be really tired since once he closed his eyes, he fell asleep in a few seconds.
The slight sound of his even breathing and his peaceful sleeping face was the best medicine to calm down her heart.
Her mind turned serene seeing him sleep. She slowly ran her fingers through his hair…knowing that he liked it.
Remembering the time when he told her that, her eyes went toward his chin. On the left side, there was still a faint cut that remained.
’You took that hit for me without hesitation…’ It was one of those days when Austin pulled Valerie away from a boring gathering and brought her to the market.
He had several hats in his room, so he used to lend her one whenever they went out for their little excursion.
Valerie also didn’t like the gathering of the noble kids, since they always badmouthed her and said rude things about her eyes and the way she talked.
The fact was despite being only six by that time, she already started to feel angry whenever someone said rude things about her in front of Austin.
She had felt this way about him for a long time. As a child, his presence was the light that kept her from becoming cold and detached.
He didn’t do anything out of pity, but just he felt that she was an interesting person since Valerie didn’t flatter him needlessly and according to Austin she was a fun person to talk to—even though between them, mostly Austin spoke and Valerie listened to him.
’Just like that day…’ When Austin brought Valerie out of the palace, he was talking to her all the time while holding her hand and leading her through the busy streets.
She would simply watch his back and listen intently to his words. Later, once home, it became a habit to recall their conversations and write them in her diary, cherishing them for the future.
That day, Austin went to buy some sweet buns for her, when Valerie’s eyes caught a hat hanging by the shop.
Since she knew that he liked hats, she didn’t think twice before taking the hat and bringing it to him.
However, the shopkeeper considered her as a thief and was about to hit her, when Austin came in the way and took the hit from the man.
And not only that, he hit him back with whatever force he could muster.
It was truly a horrifying sight for her…Valerie only wanted to gift the hat to him, and that caused Austin so much pain.
Although later the shopkeeper was arrested and was never seen again, she regretted her action excessively that day.
If there was something she vividly remembers about that day other than the incident then it was the lap pillow she gave him in the infirmary.
And the fact…that, after a long time, Valerie cried to her heart’s content that day.
That was the day when he told her that he liked to lay on her lap.
It was then and it was now.
So many things have changed. They have gone through so many phases and faced so many troubles.
However, if there was something that never changed from that day, then it was—
"I love you, Austin."
--her love for her savior.
------^^------
A/N:- To be honest, I had another scene for this chapter, but it felt so perfect, so I left it there. Anyway, thanks for reading. Drop a commnt.

chapters.title: Chapter 131 - 130- Reached
chapters.content:
Nearly an hour past dawn, the carriages from the Valorian academy reached the venue.
It was not far away from the headquarters of the Council.
The towering domes rose into the sky, their golden tops gleaming under the sun. Each was built with smooth white stone, standing proud like ancient guardians of the land. Banners of deep crimson and royal blue fluttered from high poles, catching the wind as if they carried the voices of past champions.
The carriages were halted before the main entrance before Harold stepped out and told others to get out.
Slowly every student began to climb down the carriages and lined up before the main entrance.
Austin stood behind Valerie as he assessed the surroundings.
The scent of the sea was profound in the area.
The land where the tournament venue was built, stretched endlessly. There was nothing as far as the eye could see.
’Ancient war was fought here ...’ This was one of the spots where the Hero and Demon King clashed and because of the miasma the Dark Lord released, until now, the soil has yet to regain its fertility.
"Nervous butterflies are making me restless." Hearing that voice, Austin glanced back and found the pink head standing there.
"Are you not nervous?" She asked him, only for Austin to shake his head,
"Just need to focus on my matches." He replied.
Rudolph chuckled, "You won’t be saying that once you see the crowd. It’s on a whole different level compared to the trials."
Austin shrugged—he had performed before a massive crowd before, both during when he had a fever for rugby and the craze of MMA.
"They are checking everyone’s ID." Valerie’s serious voice reached his ears before Austin turned to look at the entrance.
They have been checking everyone’s belongings and their student’s id. Discover stories with .Côm
Austin remembered the teacher telling them that to participate as an Elite you have to be B-rank. Although it wasn’t a prerequisite for the trials, the tournament was a different case.
’I hope the headmaster has arranged something...’ Slowly, the queue decreased, and it was Valerie’s turn to show her ID card.
"Hmm...?" The security officer was startled to see the golden ’S’ on the card before he lifted his eyes and looked at the girl.
"You may pass." He said after her belongings were assessed and handed back to her.
Valerie nodded and stepped inside the venue, but didn’t proceed inside as directed, "I am waiting for someone," she told the staff member.
The staff member told her, "Don’t make it long; you will block others’ paths."
Valerie gave a nod before she turned toward the entrance.
Austin handed his ID card to the man, as he took a deep breath.
The security in-charge frowned, seeing the D-rank on the card before he looked up, "Austin Eryndor...what does this mean? Are you joking here?"
His harsh tone somehow made the surroundings frosty, as the man looked around.
Austin wordlessly requested Valerie to calm down as he saw Harold hurriedly advancing toward them.
"Here, this may save you time." He handed an envelope on which the seal of the Valorian academy was visible.
The security guard checked the letter, written by the headmaster. His brows remained creased as he finished reading before looking at Austin.
Handing the letter back and ID card to Austin, he said, "You may pass." The mood of the security guard didn’t seem pleasant. Someone serving the Council didn’t like favoritism, even though the person in question was the Prince of Eryndor.
However, since the Headmaster has given his consent and shown his confidence, the security guard could do nothing.
Austin heaved a sigh before he took his bag and advanced inside.
Holding the hand of his lover, which was excessively cold, he said, "I told you it won’t be easy."
"And I told you that I won’t be able to control myself when someone badmouth you." She instantly responded, still feeling the itch to freeze the man until his blood turned frozen.
Austin chuckled, "Forget about that. I got the permission, and that’s what matters."
Valerie hummed, still a bit displeased.
At the end of the gallery, the path split into several hallways, each leading to different wings of the dormitory.
There were staff members holding the boards of different academies.
Austin and Valerie approached the one who had the board of Valorian Academy before they heard her saying, "The left one is for boys. And the right, for girls. You will find the common hall as you further walk ahead."
Austin nodded before he turned toward Valerie and said, "Let’s meet in the common hall after half an hour?"
"Fifteen minutes?" She requested. Her upturned gaze melted the heart of the staff member and the one to whom it was directed.
Austin sighed, a smile blooming on his face as he nodded, "Okay, fifteen minutes." He gave a soft kiss on her forehead before waving at her.
Walking through the hallway, he found there were rooms on either side, with the warning written—can only be occupied by two people.
Austin didn’t think much and entered the first room he spotted.
"Oh...hello, Sheldon." He greeted the guy who was already present inside. The heir of Duke Runebound and the vice-president of the Student Council.
He was the prime suspect during the demon attack on the academy.
"Morning." The boy responded briefly without lifting his eyes from the book he was reading.
Austin didn’t say anything after that and rested his bag on the bed, placed on the other side of the room.
There were two cupboards, one bathroom and one toilet, and a study table.
He looked around and found there was a food and drinks menu resting over the table, from which the students could order.
Well, although he was hungry, he decided not to eat there.
Sitting down on the bed, he asked the system,
’How many points do I have now?’ The bed was unexpectedly comfortable, as he felt himself getting engulfed in clouds.
The system ding-ed,
[Total Points: 852]
A smile bloomed on his face. This wasn’t the first time Austin checked the points...it was just too elating to see so many points.
He has yet to defeat the main boss and the mobs introduced before them. So surely, he would get enough points from them to unlock the next dungeon.
As such, ’System....unlock the shop for me.’
[Ding!]
[Are you sure you want to unlock ’Shop’ option by using 500 system points?]
’Yes.’ He said as he got up and got ready.
[Ding!]
[Command accepted.]
[Unlocking the Shop....]
[Downloading the data....]
[Integrating with system...]
[Ding!]
[Congratulations, host! You have locked Shop!]
Once the system screen faded, a logo of shoping cart appeared before his eyes.
Austin didn’t think twice before choosing it mentally.
Once he did, four options came up,
[Potions]
[Weapon]
[Utilities]
[Artifact]
....
Austin narrowed his eyes before he chose, ’Weapon.’
Ten weapons popped up when he chose the option.
He read briefly about their rank and abilities.
Like there was one:
[Reaper: C-]
[Price: 300 Points]
[Ability: Wounds inflicted by this dagger will not clot naturally and will continue to bleed over time.]
[Note: Skill cannot be upgraded.]
[Note: Ability won’t work on higher level opponent or if someone has healing ability.]
Austin hummed...quite useless dagger then. The opponent he would be facing would all be above B-rank, so there was no point in purchasing it.
His eyes went down the list and rested on the most expensive weapon,
[Name: Scavenger]
[Rank: A-]
[Price: 2000 Points]
[Ability: Absorbs opponent’s Soul Energy with each attack they direct.]
This was something good...however, the price was a little too much.
He had several other things to check, however, since it was already fifteen minutes, he decided to focus on his first priority.
Getting up, he was about to leave, when suddenly,
"Austin...are you going to the common hall?"
Austin’s brows elevated as he nodded, "Yeah."
Sheldon somehow seemed a bit embarrassed but then he asked, "If you find the President there, tell her I won’t be coming."
Austin hummed in surprise...were they close? Well, it is not surprising, considering they both were in the council.
"Got it. I will tell her."
°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 132 - 131- Sister
chapters.content:
[Management Department]
The security guard who was in charge of examining every student’s identity and belongings was standing before the management team.
His hands crossed behind his back before he uttered, "Austin Eryndor is a D-rank yet he was allowed by the Headmaster of Valorian Academy to participate in the tournament. As per the rule, this shouldn’t be allowed."
The four members of the department glanced at each other before one of them informed us, "We received a word from Sir Philius about it. And the two members of the Monitoring Division confirmed Austin’s abilities. We had no choice but to allow him."
The head of security had a stern look on his face, rejection clear from his stance, but saying anything further would not be suitable for someone at his post.
One of the four members heaved a sigh as he said, "Well if the other students get to know about his rank, surely a commotion would arise."
Another member added, "Well, if he really is worthy then we don’t need to worry though. After the first round, everyone would know if Austin Eryndor really deserves to be here or not."
The security chief blinked in surprise before he asked, "Isn’t the first-round squad matches? Won’t he pass the round with the help of his friends?" The pattern never changes; that’s what the security chief voiced.
The management head relayed, "You have done your job quite well, soldier. You may return to your post now."
In short, you shouldn’t ask any further.
The man gave a firm salute before making his way out of the room.
Well, until the unworthy ones get eliminated.
°°°°°°°
Austin and Valerie were sitting together in the common hall as they were having some snacks for breakfast. Find exclusive stories on .Côm
Seeing the lack of people in the common hall, Austin muttered, "It seems the other academies haven’t arrived yet."
Truth be told, Austin was slightly looking forward to the other academies’ arrival. After all, a main character would be making his appearance during the tournament.
And not just anyone—the long-lost childhood friend of the protagonist.
"Or they might be resting in their rooms...having breakfast in their rooms since everyone must be tired....yet I called you here..." Valerie’s answer started normally but near the end, Austin sensed guilt in her voice.
Austin smiled at the following girl before telling her, "Food tastes better if you are having it with someone you love. And with you, even plain water tastes fulfilling, Val."
The edges of her lips lifted slightly, but she soon shook her head and said, "Still, after we finish, please go and rest. You looked quite tired last night, and considering there is a ceremony in the evening, you should utilize your time by resting."
Austin raised his hand, "Okay, got it. Now, let’s eat." He was tired but not that much. But since his wife was telling him to, he couldn’t resist.
"Ah, yeah, Val, if you see the President anywhere tell her that Sheldon won’t be able to come," Austin told her since he didn’t see Annabelle anywhere in the common hall.
Valerie hummed in response, "Okay."
Austin raised his brows, "You aren’t surprised?"
Valerie tilted her head, "You didn’t know? They are secretly dating...well, only the council members know about it but it is rumored that they are hiding their relationship because of political reasons."
Austin tilted his head, matching her, as he said, "Duke Runebound and Rothaux family...yeah, there is indeed a feud between them. I remember sorting out Rothaux’s previous month’s sales report, and Runbound’s territory wasn’t on the list."
Valerie suddenly remembered something that she wanted to ask, so she asked right away, "Austin...if your father requests you to take care of the administration more actively...will you be dropping off from the academy?"
Valerie had a feeling that such a situation would arise soon since, after Aiden’s death, there should be someone from the family who could take care of the administration.
Although Austin has declared that he wouldn’t succeed to the throne under any circumstances, Valerie feared that he would be left with no option once the current king becomes incapable of holding the reins.
Austin first finished chewing the sandwich he bit onto before; without looking at her, he asked, "Did you forget that there is someone else other than me who can handle the throne better than me?"
Valerie was surprised, "You mean to say...Averis?"
The youngest sibling and someone who barely steps out of her room these days. The only Princess and Austin’s younger sister, Averis von Eryndor.
Austin nodded, "She is one of the finest managers I have ever come across, and she has been taught by one the greatest advisors of all time, the Queen. She awoke a Shard at the age of six and has risen to rank A without much training."
Side-glancing at her, he asked, "Imagine what would happen once she gets out of her hibernation and decides to sharpen her skills?"
Valerie asked, "But will she? Didn’t she just randomly shut herself inside her room one day and didn’t tell anyone the reason?"
Austin chuckled, "Well, I know the reason and I know that I can bring her out as well." After all, the reason she locked herself in was because she was hurt by her dear older brother, that is, Austin.
Although Averis didn’t have a significant role in the plot and only appeared when Austin was scolded by Rhea and told to apologize to her, this time around, things would be different.
After all, Austin was not a game character, and he wouldn’t apologize to Averis because someone told him or because of some selfish desires.
A brother owes an apology to his sister.
°°°°°°°
Not so long after, Austin returned to the room and informed Sheldon that he didn’t spot Anna in the common hall so he relayed the message to Valerie.
"You even told her...." He spoke with a groan.
Austin raised his brows, "As the chief of the Disciplinary department, she already knows everything between you two." He honestly confessed.
Sheldon heaved a sigh, "And now you know too...the Prince of the nation. I hope you won’t mention it to my father."
It was the first time for Austin to hear the silverhead speaking so much. Sheldon is kind of similar to Valerie in the class—only minding their own businesses. Well, Valerie does speak often when he is around, but Sheldon...he always in his protagonist zone.
Austin shrugged at the question, as he said, "Well, rest assured. Since you are hiding it, the reason must be quite serious."
Sheldon’s expression turned grim for a moment, as he nodded, "You can say that."
Austin exhaled a sigh, "Okay then, see you in a few hours."
Sheldon was rendered speechless that the guy didn’t even try to ask what was the matter, and went to sleep right away.
Well, forget that. He will sleep too.
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 133 - 132- Past(1)
chapters.content:
Rhea was pretty excited about the ceremony. It was the first time she would be seeing so many students across the globe, gathered at one place.
And not only just any students, they are the best ones, selected from thousands to participate here.
That’s why she changed her dress and wore her school uniform—not choosing the gown she brought along—and after doing a light makeup, she said,
"I am going ahead, Elara." The redhead hummed as she continued to sleep. The way she seemed, it was highly unlikely she would reach there anytime soon.
But well, Rhea had already tried waking her up thrice, but all she did was groan and complain.
Once she ensured that she was looking appropriate, she made her way out of the room—only to find, "Valerie."
She was passing by but halted upon hearing the voice.
"Hello," she greeted her before continuing to walk.
Rhea wasn’t surprised by that nonchalance, but she couldn’t let go of this chance to enter the ceremony with someone she knew, that’s why she instantly rushed towards Valerie and started walking beside her.
The ceremonial hall was in a different building, and they could reach there after passing by the common hall.
’I should have eaten something...’ Smelling such an appetizing fragrance in the common hall, the pinkhead felt her stomach demanding some food.
She slept for most of the hours, and when she woke up, it was already too late. That’s why Rhea couldn’t get time to eat.
’I hope they have something prepared for the banquet...’ With those thoughts, the two stunning ladies made their way to the place where several other students were heading.
The ceremonial hall was a big hollow sphere with a triangle pattern carved on the outer wall.
There was a huge entrance to the place, and Rhea could already hear the pleasant music from the inside.
’Why do I feel nervous all of a sudden...’ She glanced at Valerie and the girl was totally unfazed, as if this was just another usual day of her life.
’How does she manage to keep her expression so indifferent...does she train for that, as well?’ Rhea could never understand.
Entering the ceremonial hall, Rhea was met by the sight she was expecting.
The warm glow of chandeliers bathed the room in golden light, casting gentle shadows on the polished marble floor. The air carried a mix of subtle perfumes and the faint aroma of fresh flowers arranged in tall, elegant vases around the hall.
Students from different academies were gathered in small groups, chatting with easy smiles. Some laughed lightly, their eyes sparkling with excitement, while others stood poised, their conversations calm and refined. The soft clinking of glasses echoed now and then as servers moved through the crowd, offering refreshments on silver trays.
Rhea let out a breath, feeling both thrilled and slightly out of place. She noticed a group nearby, discussing something animatedly.
"Did you see the lineup? This year’s participants are exceptional," a young man in a dark blue uniform remarked, adjusting his cufflinks.
A girl in a flowing emerald-green dress responded with a chuckle. "Exceptional? More like terrifying. I heard one of them can cast spells without even chanting."
"That just makes things more exciting, doesn’t it?" another student grinned, sipping from a crystal glass.
Rhea noticed that many students were glancing in her direction...or more like, they were looking at the person beside her. Discover more stories at .Côm
"Hey, is she ...." One of the boys from the group asked in a daze.
"Yeah...S-rank."
"Damn, she is a beauty."
"Hey, let’s go talk to her."
"Are you kidding me? I can tell from this far that she doesn’t care about etiquette and will outright ignore us."
Well, Rhea wasn’t sure about the etiquette part but yes, Valerie would indeed ignore them.
’The only person who can talk to her without reservation is still not here...’ Rhea ran her eyes around the venue but couldn’t find Austin anywhere.
Glancing at Valerie, it seemed that even though she had a poised and calm front, her eyes were restlessly moving around the place.
Rhea smiled with a shake of her head when she suddenly heard,
"Hey, isn’t he the top student from Ravenshade this year?"
"Yeah....damn, look at those muscles."
"Haah~so hot~"
Rhea heard some weird whispers of the girls from nearby before she turned to her left.
"Hello, there." Suddenly, a black-haired man appeared before them—his tall frame completely blocked the vision of others.
He had a smile on his face as he said, "You are Corwon Valerie, right? I was really looking forward to meeting you."
Valerie’s eyes were, as usual, emotionless, as she asked, "Do I know you?"
"Ah, yeah, sorry. I am Kevin from the Auroracrest Academy. I have heard several things about you, including your contribution to saving Drenovar."
Valerie muttered, "Okay." Saying so, she turned away and left—leaving a flustered Kevin behind.
...did he offend her?
The boy then turned toward the other person and was surprised to see her eyes widen and her lips slightly widen.
"Umm...are you okay?" He asked as he waved his hand in front of her face.
Rhea was broken out of her daze, before she hurriedly said, "Yes, I am fine...that name...someone close to me also had that name."
Kevin blinked, "Oh, is that so. Well, he must be really special for you to react so strongly."
Rhea lowered her eyes, a smile lifting the edges of her lips, as she said, "Yes...he was. My first friend."
....
Austin reached the venue in a rush.
He really shouldn’t have trusted Sheldon to wake him up.
That guy was still sleeping!
He got up just ten minutes ago, took a quick shower, and changed his clothes before reaching here.
’Val must be waiting for me....’
He rushed into the ceremonial hall and finally came to a halt.
Roaming his eyes around he tried to find the prettiest girl in the hall.
However, even after looking around, he couldn’t find her.
*Tap*
Feeling the tap on his shoulder, Austin’s shoulders slumped as he said, "I am really sorry, Val-" However, his words died once he turned to look at the person who called him out.
Austin’s face turned pale and his lips were parted in shock upon seeing the person.
Numerous thoughts came rushing to his mind, as a name seeped through his lips,
"M-Monica...?"
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 134 - 133- Past(2)
chapters.content:
He couldn’t forget her. The girl he was in a relationship with for months before they ’mutually’ decided that Monica was not worthy to be with Luke. And they broke up.
That long black hair, that almond-shaped face...even though her eyes were now blue, she seemed the exact same as the day Luke last saw her.
However, the most important question was...how and why was she here?
Another reincarnation? Did she die that night with him? Or does she look the same?
Hundreds of questions which sounded almost identical, overcrowded his head as Austin stared at the girl with his eyes widened.
She smiled, before speaking, "I think you mistook me for someone else. Just like how I did." Her voice was...different from what he remembered, but that face...how can someone have such an identical face?
It took Austin a moment to collect himself before he asked, "Did you need something from me?" He looked down at her blazer and found she was from the Avalon Academy, which was situated in Hener.
The girl smilingly shook her head, "As I said, I thought you were someone else. And it seems you made the same mistake. By the way, who is this Monica? Your girlfriend?"
Austin narrowed his eyes as he shook his head, "No, a person with an annoying attitude and someone I want to forget about. Anyway, since I am not the one you are looking for, see you." He didn’t want to talk to her for long...his heart rate was not in his control for obvious reasons.
The reasons were two. First was that he absolutely dreaded anyone reincarnating from Earth to this world—for hundreds of reasons. And second was, Austin’s past feelings for her.
Although he has moved on, and now he has someone whom he loves more than anyone in the world, the deep wounds Monica inflicted on him still remain. And when he came across someone who looked just like her...it was natural for him to be reminded of that regrettable past.
Austin took a cup of fruit beer and gulped it down to cool his head—when suddenly, "Are you okay?"
Hearing the voice, it felt like half of his worries had already faded. And the rest of the worries were taken care of when Austin turned towards her and hugged his lover.
"Val..." Was he making her worried? Yes. However, he really wanted to hug her.
Valerie wordlessly embraced her lover. She didn’t know what happened, but when she saw Austin walking away from the strange girl, he looked quite disturbed...as if he was suffering.
If she had known that in her absence someone could upset her Lord this much, she wouldn’t have gone to help the President.
And now she was regretting it.
Once Austin calmed down, he separated from the girl, and with their hands connected, he said, "Sorry about that. That person reminded me of someone I’d rather not think about."
"Is it something that I don’t know? Can you tell me?" She asked, her round big eyes looking at him with an upturned glance.
However, despite his promise to never lie to her, Austin couldn’t bring himself to reveal the truth.
He...was scared. A past in which Austin was Luke. Although Austin and Luke were the same people since Austin just simply unlocked Luke’s memories, telling it to Valerie would mean a completely different thing.
If she gets to know everything that changed Austin’s attitude towards her and the fact that Austin isn’t completely him...he doesn’t have a good feeling about how she would react.
That’s why, "....not something major. Just a childhood incident Anyway, where were you?"
It would have been a little nice if Valerie couldn’t have noticed how he just skipped over a very important topic. However, she did.
But since he chose to hide it from her, she decided to not push him and wait for the time when he could disclose it to her.
With a soft smile extending her lips, she said, "Went to help the President. Her uniform was a little damaged."
Austin hummed as the conversation continued in the natural flow.
He was guilty, yes. But it would be better if Valerie never came to know about the person named Luke.
....
The students were mingling with others. It was a very good opportunity for nobles from different nations to form connections.
Some just took a corner and enjoyed the evening with a glass of beverage in their hand. While some were actively approaching strangers and exchanging greetings.
In one corner, there was a certain purple-haired male who stood at his place with his head slightly leaned down, and from afar, it could be regarded as if he was taking a nap while standing.
However, the person was good at hiding where his eyes were directed.
Whether she went, his eyes followed.
One of the Elites from the Avalon Academy, and someone who is using a fake identity to participate in the tournament.
Fake name: Esner. Real identity: the Prince of Hener, Parkinson.
He was finally here, after crossing a rocky path of getting admitted to the academy under a fake identity and making his appearance in the tournament.
There were many who raised their voice against his participation since Esner was new to the academy and surely would be hard to deal with during team matches.
However, since he had the support of the Nation’s Supreme, Parkinson never felt threatened about his spot in the squad.
And finally, he was here...where he wanted to be.
His eyes finally found relief after they caught the sight of his favorite person.
It has been thirty-one days, eighteen hours since he last saw her.
It was a very depressing phase for him to be away from the only person whom he came to love so much.
The sole reason he still hasn’t lost his cool and attacked Austin.
His Rhea.
"Dude, you need to wind down a little." Someone approached him from the left, and without looking, Esner could tell that it was the captain of the Elite team. Your journey continues at .Côm
"Quinton...I was in my relaxed zone...until you came to disturb me."
Hearing the words, the shaved-headed boy grinned, as he draped his hand over Esner’s shoulder, making the other one annoyed, as he said, "You are checking out the girls, right? Well, can’t be blamed. So many flowers...but unluckily, the top-tier ones already have owners. Just like that girl, over there."
He pointed at Valerie and Austin, who were chatting to each other without a care in the world. They really don’t care about anyone else when they are with each other.
"Or...that one." He then pointed at Rhea who was accompanied by Rudolph. Although they weren’t as cozy as the previous couple, whoever saw them could only tell that they were a nice couple.
Parkinson’s eyes narrowed as he said, "Don’t trust what your eyes tell you. Not everyone is focused on dating here."
"Heeh~don’t tell me, you are jealous~Well, if you want you can try on Jasmine. She seemed to be interested in you."
When the Captain mentioned Jasmine...Parkinson’s eyes also traveled to the raven-haired girl.
There was something that caught his attention this evening, and that was her conversation with Austin.
He looked quite restless after exchanging a few words with her. What could she possibly say?
And considering Valerie’s nature, if she didn’t go to confront the girl, then possibly the matter wasn’t that big or...Austin hid it from her?
’Interesting...I guess I should talk to Jasmine a little more...’
°°°°°°°
A/N:- Here comes the antagonist.
I want to give a spoiler about whether Austin would reveal his past to Valerie or not? Yes...and no..well, you will know. See ya~~~

chapters.title: Chapter 135 - 134- Change
chapters.content:
Austin’s mood improved by being near his favorite person. It really helps when you are with someone who not only understands your inner turmoil but also says things that can help you get over it.
They tried a few dishes being served and a few people came to greet them.
While he was at it, Austin glanced around him and found the one he was looking forward to meeting.
The fourth target character: Kevin.
He was the childhood friend of Rhea and someone who would play a key role during the tournament.
Having a Shard that detects the demonic presence and uses the power of the sun to eradicate them—yeah, a cheat ability.
Not only that, he was on the verge of breaking into S-rank.
’He may get the chance to level up soon...’
Austin has a bad feeling that during this tournament, the Beast King, the demon who attacked Drenovar, will ambush the tournament.
Canonically, he would have secretly recruited a few of those students who lost in their first round. And once he gathers hefty soldiers, he would have attacked from the front—ruining the whole competition, only for Rhea and Kevin to bring him down in the end.
Fighting with Rhea would have helped Kevin remember his childhood and the friend he got detached from. And voila, Rhea would get herself another love interest.
’My concern is on the demon...now that he knows that Valerie is a part of the students’ body, will he change his strategy?’ After all, canonically, Valerie—an S-rank—shouldn’t have been here. Not only that, the Demon General has even fought with her, so he knows Valerie’s strength.
And these few changes leave Austin completely lost on what the Demon would be plotting.
"Are you tired?" Valerie’s concerned voice woke him up from his daze.
He smilingly shook his head, "Was just thinking about the matches. It would be great if we could remain on the same team. You know...my first time and all."
Valerie held his hand assuringly, as she said, "Regardless of which team you participate from, I know you will be victorious. And not only that, you would be playing a key role in your team’s victory."
Austin was rendered speechless. How can someone be so sure about someone else’s abilities?
Her faith in him puts him under slight pressure, but the motivation he gains from it is immense.
He squeezed her hand and told her, "You are right. I am going to win this."
While they were lost in their world and were completely unbothered by the people whispering and glancing in their way, someone suddenly walked to the stage.
"Can I have your attention, please? The Chairman wants to relay a few words." It was a man in a black suit who garnered everyone’s attention before he politely gave a bow to the students and backed away.
Austin and Valerie also turned towards the stage, and they saw an elderly man with long white hair that reached his shoulders and a pair of amethyst eyes appearing on the stage.
There was something about his presence that created pin-drop silence in the ceremonial hall as he addressed the participants,
"First of all, congratulations. You’ve overcome countless challenges through sheer determination and skill to stand here today. Out of thousands, you were chosen, and that alone is proof of your worth. No matter the outcome, remember this—you are already champions. But don’t stop here. Strive to be even greater."
His voice was tranquil as if he was helping the excited hearts to calm down.
’The chairman eh...the head of the council that is responsible for organizing the tournament and an A-rank.’ Austin didn’t have much of an impression of the man other than the fact that everyone working under him and many of the students respected him for his past records.
Once a top student of Ravencourt Academy and someone who pushed his team to become the third-time winner of the tournament.
Ravencourt Academy has always produced immense talent and championed students. Three of the ten S-ranks in the world come from that academy.
That’s why, they wanted to bring Valerie to their side as well. Since in their eyes, she wouldn’t reach the peak of her strength while being in a small academy as Valorian.
The Chairman continued, "Over the years, my fellow council members and I have observed that teamwork and coordination are key factors in overcoming the first hurdle—the squad matches. Time and again, we’ve seen stronger teams falter simply because they couldn’t synchronize their efforts. And for them, it’s a bitter truth to swallow, because in the end, even the mightiest wolf must learn that true strength isn’t always found in solitude."
His tone turned serious near the end, and his gaze hardened, which made Austin frown.
Shouldn’t this welcoming speech have ended by now? Why does it seem the man is here to deliver a very important information?
Everyone felt that there was something about to happen. And their anticipation wasn’t unwarranted,
"That is why we have decided to give everyone a chance to prove their individual strength. Instead of starting with team battles, this time, the tournament will begin with solo matches."
"...!"
"Huh?"
"What the ..."
"Is he being serious?"
Suddenly, a round of gasps spread across the hall as they heard the announcement.
It has been a tradition for years for the tournament to flow in the same usual manner: squad matches followed by duo matches and ending with solo battles.
Then how...and why did they change the rules all of a sudden?
Austin frowned, as he somehow realized the reason.
His eyes turned toward a certain man with black hair, standing with his team. Stay updated via .Côm
There is not one but two S-rank participating this year. That’s why, they must have thought that rather than letting the team benefit from the S-rank warriors, let them first face their individual battles.
Valerie, on the other hand, was slightly nervous about this change.
She was aware that Austin might be the lowest-ranking warrior in the tournament, and anyone he would be facing would surely be B-rank or above. Most probably, above.
She glanced at her lover, evident concern written over her face.
But when Austin held her hand gently and whispered, "I promised that I would participate in the duo match with you, and I will fulfill my promise."
...she felt all her concern melting under his warm gaze.
That’s right, even though the situation has changed, she should trust her Lord.
He has always proven everyone wrong with his wits and strength.
A few weeks ago, no one could even have imagined for him to defeat a B-rank warrior. But he did, that’s why he is here.
Looking at their connected hands, she muttered, "We will win this...together."
°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 136 - 135- Discussion
chapters.content:
The next morning, all eight members of the Elite team were told to gather in the canopy tent provided to them by the management. Not only them but all the eight teams were provided separate tents to do the preparation and discussions.
The eight from the Rookie department were gathered for a meeting in a different section of the same tent, while Annabelle took charge of discussing things with the Elite team.
There were two benches on either side of the table and a long whiteboard on which Anna wrote ’POINTS.’
"Let’s talk about the sudden change brought by the council before we get onto the points distribution they have chosen." The points distribution per match has also changed, naturally, since the pattern of the tournament has changed as well.
Austin was sitting beside Valerie while wearing his training gear, as he and the others heard the President and the Captain of the Elite department speaking, Explore more adventures at .Côm
"We all knew that the most points a school could have earned were from the squad matches which happened in the beginning. However, things have changed. Because they are testing each student, they would be providing points based on how many students from each academy pass the first round."
Saying so, she wrote on the board: Per student a hundred points.
"..!!"
"Huh?"
"Woah…"
That took everyone by surprise since the squad matches only offered two hundred points, and here, if every student passes their matches, a single academy would gain eight hundred points—a huge initial head start.
"Isn’t that a lot? Victory in every match would put any team in a dominant position." Sheldon asked in a grim voice.
"That’s right. However, it’s highly unlikely that any academy would get to have all their warriors in the second round, so rather than focusing on winning all matches, our focus should be on winning as many matches as we can. Not only because of the points but also because…having less than four qualified students would disqualify us from the tournament." Anna delivered very concern-worthy news.
However, it was expected. If four members couldn’t pass the first round, then it has been the rule of the Tournament to not let losers continue in the tournament.
"So, like, if four of us don’t pass the first stage, we would be asked to pack our bags and bye-bye, huh?" Rudolph sighed.
"We can be dragged down because of others’ failure in this…totally unfair." Elara exasperatedly muttered as she glanced at Austin—only to feel a chill running down her spine when her eyes went toward the pair of dead eyes staring at her soul.
"Guys, don’t be so pessimistic. We all have proven our worth to be here and have prepared for this so surely we won’t lose just like that." Rhea suddenly got up and tried to calm down the situation. In her opinion, these people are the best warriors she has come across. That’s why it was a little confusing for her why they were being so negative and concerned.
"If you don’t know among our competitors is Ravencourt and Auroracrest academies. They have been battling at the top for the winner’s position for the past couple of years. Every year, our academy either doesn’t reach the final round or if they do, we always have lost in one-on-one battles." Ryan spoke to the over-enthusiast girl.
"But we have Valerie this year!" Rhea spoke in retaliation while gesturing toward the violette beside her.
Valerie heaved a sigh as she suddenly got up and Rhea instantly sat down. Every mouth that opened to say something, instantly shut down as Valerie stood beside Annabelle.
With her hands behind her back, she uttered, "Until we don’t cross the first round, we don’t need any discussion since, during the first round, it would all depend on our individual abilities. So rather than depending on others or fearing about other’s performance, go and train for your matches. After all, on the battlefield, we all would be standing all alone."
Those words left no room for any question or discussion. After all, what Valerie said was true.
Once she was done, she returned to where she had been sitting previously.
Austin held her hand and gave a soft nod to the girl.
Anna nodded as she said, "As Valerie pointed out, there’s little point in arguing over things we can’t control. Since we don’t know who we’ll be facing, discussing the strengths and weaknesses of our potential opponents is irrelevant."
A few nodded while a few just remained silent.
Since there was nothing else to discuss, the students were told to return to their rooms.
Austin and Valerie were making their way out of the tent when suddenly, Rudolph called out, "Wanna spar?"
Austin raised his brows, "You sure? Won’t you get bored?" In the past, they stopped sparring because Rudolph continued to grow, while Austin remained stuck at the same level, and eventually, Rudolph lost interest in sparring against him.
Rudolph said, "You have and will again defeat an enemy higher in rank than you…I don’t think I can take you lightly anymore."
Valerie smiled upon hearing that and she also encouraged, "Don’t under-evaluate yourself, Austin. I know you would be considerably challenging even for an A-rank."
Austin smiled upon hearing her words, as he shrugged and said, "Well, I was going to train anyways. Let’s do it like old times."
The four of them, adding Rhea to the group, reached the training hall provided to the students.
Naturally, providing everyone a separate training hall was impossible.
Only a huge hall was provided, but it was spacious enough for everyone to take their corners and train as they usually do.
"Hmm…" Austin hummed in surprise seeing and hearing those loud noises of the collision between the students.
There were a few who were standing out a lot. And there were a few who were even using their shard, even though that was a risky move in Austin’s eyes.
Seeing those blurry figures and the massive dents in the training hall forming because of the pressure behind those attacks, Austin muttered under his breath,
’The competition is going to be one hell of tough.’
------^^------
A/N:- I hope you all enjoyed reading the chapter. Thanks for reading, drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 137 - 136- Another reward?
chapters.content:
Austin was back in his room after a long training session with Rudolph followed by Valerie.
It was a sight to behold when Valerie and Rudolph were sparring though. Two warriors who have walked on the path of greatness, and have been shaping them to become what they are right now.
Sadly, if Austin has to fight someone of Rudoplph’s caliber in the first round, there are very few chances for him to come out victorious.
"Are you going to use the bathroom?" Austin asked as he prepared to go in.
Sheldon shook his head, "You go first, I take a long time."
Austin smiled wryly, it was the same for him. But well, he took the proposal and went inside.
There was a round bathing pool on the ground, just like it was in the academy.
Steaming warm water was waiting for him as Austin stripped off his clothes and dove in.
Haah~heavens.
He enjoyed the sensation for a few moments, before redirecting his focus on the battle tomorrow.
His match was scheduled on the first day, and Austin would be the first one performing from the Valorian Academy.
Now, the question arises…what can he use during the battle?
Any skill which can be visible to others would be quite dangerous. After all, no participants were allowed to carry any artifact during the battle. So using the Absolute Barrier is a no-go. Unless…he wants to get interrogated for being a demon worshiper.
However, he can take his boomerang with him since bringing additional weapons other than one’s Shard is allowed.
What would be useful during the battle was his skills like Adapt. Borrowing someone else’s Shard is a no-no as well.
’It’s so infuriating…having the skills yet not allowed to use them,’ Shaking his head, he heaved a sigh and rested his head on edge.
If only his match had been scheduled a little later, he could have upgraded his stats using the Dungeon. But the lady luck was not on his side these days, it seems.
’Well, I will do what I can...’ Closing his eyes he decided to let his mind and body attain some peace.
°°°°°°°°°
"Isn’t this clear partiality? Didn’t we decide to choose the names based on lots?" One of the four members of the management voiced his protest.
In the room, the four of them were deciding the matches of the participants for the following week.
Every day, around sixteen matches would be held, with Elite and Rookie divisions distributed equally.
Since they didn’t get the information about who would be participating in the contest very late, they couldn’t decide the matches beforehand.
That’s why, because being short of time, they decided to draw lots and decide the opponents the student would be facing during the first round.
Since every Elite here was above B-rank, it wouldn’t be an unfair matchup. Although there are extreme powerhouses performing this year, like Valerie Corwon or Kevin from the Ravencourt, there was nothing the management could do to help their opponent.
When these students decided to take part in this contest, they should have prepared themselves to face stronger opponents.
That’s why they were about to proceed with the lottery system to decide who would be facing whom during the tournament’s first round. But then suddenly, the orders came to put a certain student against a B-rank warrior from the Avalon Academy.
The special student was also the weakest student participating in the Elite division.
Austin von Eryndor.
"Who is supporting him? And why can’t we, the members of Council, oppose them?" Another member asked the one who relayed the command.
The man with a black mustache and bald head sighed as he informed them, "It is the Chairman of the committee. But it’s not like he told me to put Austin against a B-rank of his own volition. He also received an order from higher up."
Hearing his words, everyone else was stunned. Someone gave orders to the Chairman...the only people who came to their minds were,
"The Council Heads....but why are they interfering with this tournament?"
In the past, the head of the Union Council has never shown interest in the tournament since they have much bigger and more crucial work at hand.
And now, all of a sudden, they are showing concern for a small kingdom’s prince? That’s too absurd.
The bald one looked tired as he said, "Regardless of the reason, we have no choice but—" bringing a certain name beside Austin on the roster, he said, "—follow what we are told."
°°°°°°°°
The next day, in the early morning, Austin went for a light run and refrained from training. His body has recovered quite well, and considering his match was in a few hours, he decided to do some light exercise.
Austin met Valerie near the Command Tent, as she stood with a towel in her hand.
"Thanks," While breathing slightly roughly, Austin took the cold towel, before wiping his sweat.
Valerie offered him some water as well, as she said, "How do you feel? Is your body working properly?" She was slightly stressed since she thought that Austin pushed himself a little too far yesterday.
Austin first gulped down half the bottle, before telling her, "Completely fit and fine. Now I just need to get in there and defeat whoever appears before me."
Valerie felt relieved seeing his enthusiasm. It felt like her heart was getting some much-needed relief, seeing such optimism from him.
Soon, a few others joined them, and one of them said, "I know you can do it, Austin. Just use your clever mind and let the other one taste dust." Rhea cheered for him, with an energetic smile on her face.
"You got it, bro. Just don’t let them beat you up to analyze them. If you can, one-shot your enemy." Rudolph added.
Austin chuckled, "It’s highly unlikely for something like that to happen...but I will try." Well, not a single warrior participating is a newbie or low-ranker.
So taking them down with one strike was nearly impossible.
Soon, Annabelle added, "Regardless of the results, Austin, know that we all are a team, okay."
Austin nodded, thankful for her words. However, he doesn’t need consolation, neither before the match nor after.
Since he was going to win today, regardless of who appeared before him.
°°°°°°°°
Austin and Valerie were left alone as they headed towards the common hall to have a light breakfast.
"Did you receive your schedule?" Austin asked as he returned to the table while holding a tray of cereals and some fruits for both of them.
Valerie nodded, "My match is the day after tomorrow." She didn’t sound nervous about it, and that’s pretty cool in Austin’s eyes.
He sat down beside her and asked her, "So Val, what’s the reward this time?"
Valerie was taken aback as her lashes fluttered rapidly, "What do you mean?"
Austin told her, "Last time, the promise of reward helped me a lot. So, I want one this time as well. Tell me, what are you going to give me?"
Valerie was instantly reminded of that...kiss, under the stairs. She still hasn’t forgotten a single moment she spent in those minutes.
She lowered her head, trying to hide her face, as she said, "W-What do you want?"
Austin hummed smilingly before he said, "Nothing too big...how about a baby?"
"...." Emergency! A participant fainted before even the matches began!
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading, and I am double-minded about R-18. If you really don’t like it, then I will put a warning so you can skip it. Won’t that work?

chapters.title: Chapter 138 - 137- First round(1)
chapters.content:
Pink hair appeared in the corner of his vision as Austin approached the preparation room in the afternoon.
He was told that his match would be in thirty minutes so he was rushing there.
Naturally, Valerie wasn’t with him since no one other than the participants could be in the preparation room. He told her to sit in the stands and cheer for him.
"Hey, are you going in?" Rhea asked as she stopped before him.
Austin blinked, "Why are you here? Is there anyone else fighting other than me from Valorian?" Last he remembered he was the only one for today.
Rhea shook her head with a smile, as she said, "Just was talking to someone and got distracted where I was headed. Someone from the Avalon Academy."
She met a really nice person who helped her find ways.
She never thought that a stranger could have such a gentle personality.
Austin hummed, before telling her, "Well, good for you. See you later."
"Yes, see you. Best of luck, Austin!" Saying so, Rhea continued to walk through the gallery which led to the arena.
While Austin walked towards the preparation room, he asked the system, ’Can you give me a quest to elevate my Combat stats?’
He has been thinking that he wasn’t using the QoD often, and that’s very stupid of him. After all, all the quests assigned from the system are always aligned with what he is looking for progress.
He could have asked for a quest when he dives into the dungeon; after all, that place is his battleground to manipulate. He can use the opportunity to enhance his specific stats.
And since there is an option to reject quests up to two times—if they appear to be too absurd—he can take the risk.
[Ding!] Continue reading on .Côm
[Are you sure you want to use QoD for your combat enhancement?]
[Y/N]
Without thinking much, Austin chose the ’Y’.
[Ding!]
[Generating quest....]
[Assessing current status....]
[Ding!]
[Quest: Defeat your opponent within five minutes after the match begins!]
[Reward: +15 combat, 50 Points]
"..." Austin paused for a moment when he saw the quest.
Defeating his enemy in five minutes? He still doesn’t know whom he is fighting so taking the worst possibility into consideration, he was supposed to face an A-rank and defeat them within five minutes, eh?
’Sound impossible, but I won’t know until I try.’
With those thoughts, he entered the preparation room and found he was the only one there.
There were several benches around the room and attached to the wall.
There was a long slim window that gave the vision outside.
Austin slowly approached the window and looked outside—only to freeze in shock as he found a huge figure was thrown in his direction.
*Bham*
The person collided against the frame of the window, but no damage was dealt to the preparation room.
Austin shifted to the right and looked at the person who so brutally defeated his enemy.
The loud cheering from the audience made it clear that they had quite a spectacle while witnessing the battle.
And when Austin’s eyes landed on the person, he realized that the hype was warranted.
’Kevin...a being who would play a crucial role during the final arc.’ He is the true nemesis of darkness. Someone who can even negate the effect of the Dark water.
If this has been an eroge game, then Kevin might have been the protagonist.
Regardless of what happens now, Austin was prepared to deal with things his way. He wouldn’t be depending on the main cast.
Before the Demon Lord resurrects, he would gain enough strength and skills from the system to stand against that calamity.
"Oh, hello." Not so long after, Kevin entered the preparation room after his match was finished.
Austin nodded at the guy, "Nice match. It seems the opponent wasn’t very difficult for you." He talked to him casually since they conversed yesterday at the banquet as well. Although briefly.
Kevin rubbed the back of his head, "It seems he was a B-rank...and I went a little too hard with him. In the excitement of participating in the tournament for the first time, I went overhead."
Austin shrugged, "Well until you don’t break any rules, it’s all good."
Kevin laughed dryly before he sat down on the bench and took some water.
The battleground was getting rearranged. Some workers were cleaning the ground, and some were repairing the surface using their Shards and artifacts.
"By the way, I heard you are a D-rank?" Kevin asked suddenly.
Austin crossed his hand as he casually asked back, "How do you know about it?"
Kevin was flustered, "Please don’t misunderstand. I didn’t inquire about you and Miss Valerie because you defeated so many demons in Drenovar."
Austin chuckled, "It means you did. Well, you are right; the last evaluation I had said that I am a D-rank."
Kevin blinked in confusion, "And about your Shard?"
Austin summoned his Frostfang, as he said, "Still at stage zero."
Kevin was flabbergasted, "Yet you were able to defeat an A-rank? Crazy...."
Austin laughed lightly, "I had help, you know. And it’s not like you can judge someone based on their rank. After all, I heard that the Great Kane who defeated the Demon Lord was also an E-rank for most of his life."
Kevin thumped his fist on his palm, "You are right about that. I heard how the Hero and his partners went to different continents and gallantly defeated the Demon Generals before going against the Monarch of Darkness. And despite being irregular they were able to leave such a deep impact on the world."
Austin hummed, "But it’s slightly frustrating as well-"
"That we know nothing about Lord Kane’s team members, right?" Kevin added, which ushered Austin to nod.
The raven-haired boy heaved a sigh, "Well, there must have been a significant reason why Savior Kane never revealed who helped him get over such a big crisis."
Austin hummed in assent before both of them fell silent.
Not so long after someone came and told Austin to step out.
Kevin got up and said, "I wish you the best of luck, Austin. Please grace me with your presence in the second round." Saying so, he gave a brief bow and walked away.
Austin chuckled, so the guy wants to fight with him, eh?
Shaking his head, he tied his shoelaces after undoing them once and gulped some water before heading out.
The battle begins now.
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 139 - 138- First round(2)
chapters.content:
Academies based on their past standings and the points they have accumulated until now:
1. Ravencourt—100pts
2. Auroracrest—100pts
3. Runebridge—Drenovar—100pts
4. Avalon—Hener—TBD
5. Ironvale—0pts
6. Stellthorne—0pts
7. Valorian—Eryndor—TBD
8. Grimhold—hybrid nations—0pts
°°°°°°°°°
Valerie was given a seat amongst the Elites from each school.
They have been provided a separate area in the stands to sit with the other Elites and share their thoughts about the battles.
The general audience consisted of the students from each academy who failed to participate.
Other people from outside the academies, royal guests, and family members of the contestants would be allowed to watch the second and third rounds.
Valerie was currently sitting beside Annabelle and on the other side was Rudolph.
They were in the frontmost seat, and the other students were in the back, grouped according to their schools.
"Heyo~" Kevin suddenly appeared in the stands as he waved at his teammates.
"Good match, Kev. You overwhelmed your enemy and showed him where he belongs." A short purple-haired girl grinned as she praised her fellow classmate.
The student whom Kevin crushed during his battle was from Stellthorne Academy, and the Elites who heard the girl’s words were gritting their teeth but couldn’t say anything here.
Some were ashamed of their teammate’s performance and some just didn’t want to look like a fool.
Kevin shook his head as he said, "You shouldn’t talk about someone like that, Cassie. It was a bad match; otherwise, he surely would have shown why he was chosen for this tournament."
Saying so, the teenager sat down beside his teammate.
The girl, Cassie, grinned upon hearing that as she said, "Talking about a bad match-up, the next match is of a D-rank, right?"
Rhea flinched and every member of the Valorian academy, except for Sheldon and Ryan, directed their pleading gaze in Valerie’s direction.
The captain of Ravencourt glared at the girl before saying, "Sit down and watch the match. If you really want to provoke someone, do that when you are facing her on the battlefield."
Those cold words made Cassie sneer, "You think I will hesitate?"
The Captain no longer paid attention to the girl and looked at the arena.
Cassie rolled her eyes before she also sat down and watched the two contestants making their way to the center of the arena.
Esner(Parkinson) also watched intently. The last time he fought Austin, he underestimated his combat skills and was humiliated in front of everyone. And most of all, Rhea.
Since then, he doesn’t know how much he has grown...but still in front of a B-rank...Esner was unsure if Austin could pull something off here when he had no one to support him.
’It would be satisfying to see you losing like a dog~’
.....
Standing in the arena Austin looked at his opponent.
It was a girl with long green hair, which she had braided, and she was wearing the battle gear of the Avalon Academy.
She wore a confident smile on her face and in her left hand was her Shard in the shape of a rope.
Austin has memorized every person participating as an Elite in this tournament, and from what he knows, his opponent has agile feet but weak defense. There was no information about her Shard he could obtain, though.
"My name is Lucy. Nice to meet you."
Austin nodded at her greetings, as he said, "I am Austin."
Once the greetings were over, the referee stepped in before announcing, "The match will last for ten minutes. Victory is achieved by knocking out your opponent or forcing their submission. Lethal attacks are strictly forbidden—any attempt will result in immediate disqualification and expulsion from your academy."
Austin nodded upon hearing that and so did Lucy.
The referee stepped back before raising his left hand.
"Participants, ready?"
Getting a nod from both sides, the referee declared, "BEGIN!"
Just as those words left his mouth, Austin’s feet and arm moved in sync: his feet took him toward his opponent while his arm threw away Wisp.
The crowd gasped as Austin vanished and reappeared before Lucy in a blink, his dagger flashing toward her.
"Shit!" Lucy cursed, barely twisting away in time—
SHLINK!
His blade was carved into the spot she had stood just a second ago.
Murmurs rippled through the audience. The sheer speed was unreal. Even the Elites watching leaned forward, eyes narrowing.
"A D-rank? Moving like that?"
"Impossible."
Many began to wonder—was Austin truly a D-rank, or had he been hiding his real strength all along?
Lucy lashed out with her Shard—
STING!
A sharp crack split the air as something shot toward Austin. He tilted his body just in time, only to see a splash of water explode behind him, leaving a deep gash in the ground.
’Damn… that would’ve hurt.’
Lucy landed gracefully, her feet barely touching the ground before she reshaped her Shard into a perfect ring and blew through it.
"The hell—!" Austin’s instincts screamed, and he leaped back just as a swarm of bubbles shot out of the loop, streaking toward him at alarming speed.
At first, they seemed harmless—until—
HIZZZZZ!
The moment a bubble popped against the ground, the water sizzled, eating into the surface like acid.
Austin’s eyes widened.
’Great. Acid bubbles. Just what I needed.’
He twisted and dodged, barely slipping between the deadly orbs as they came faster and faster, closing in on him from all directions.
Austin gritted his teeth, his mind racing. The bubbles were coming too fast, forcing him on the defensive. If he kept dodging, he’d eventually slip up.
Tch!
He flicked his wrist, hurling his boomerang. It shot forward—but instead of cutting through the bubbles, he slowed it mid-air, letting it weave between them like a ghost.
Lucy smirked. "Missed."
But Austin wasn’t aiming at her.
The moment the boomerang curved behind her, he snapped his fingers—
WHOOSH!
It shot forward at blinding speed, slicing through the air toward Lucy’s blind spot.
Her eyes widened.
CRACK!
She barely managed to twist her Shard into a shield by coiling it, deflecting the attack, but the force sent her skidding backward.
Austin took his chance. He surged forward, Shard in hand, increasing its weight mid-swing for a crushing blow.
Everyone shifted to the edges of their seats as they thought that the battle was reaching its climax.
However, maybe in a state of panic, Lucy suddenly twirled on her feet and swung her Shard with all her strength.
*ZAP*
Faster than he could have dodged, more so with his weighted Shard, a wave came rushing toward him, throwing Austin completely off balance.
*SPLASH*
He was hurtled back, his body drenched and his Shard slipping from his hand.
Austin coughed as what he engulfed was not truly water...his nose and eyes were burning.
Lucy didn’t miss the opportunity and jumped into the air before swirling her Shard into a tornado.
Austin’s eyes snapped as he realized that he was getting surrounded.
He instantly tried to get up and move—but,
"*COUGH*" His body didn’t support him when he needed it the most.
And the result was—
"Heeh~got you,"
—Austin was trapped in a water prison.
It was a huge orb of water. Levitating above the ground. And filled completely with blue clear water.
Everyone watched in fascination as Austin was trapped inside.
Moving his arms, and trying to strike the walls, but to no avail.
The water was filled with acids that were making his skin burn, and consuming that water would mean instant defeat.
Lucy slowly approached the orb. A smile of victory on her face as she tilted her head.
Esner had a nasty grin on his face which he hid behind his hand.
Rhea and everyone from Valorian were worried...however, the one who was the most, showed no reaction. Continue your saga on .Côm
Many began to sneer and make fun of him,
"Look at that! A fucking mermaid!"
"Look at those flappy hands! Awwww!"
"Goddamn, she played dirty! Austin, you nooooob!"
"Haah~I am ashamed that he represents the Valorian."
The ridicule was like a sweet melody to Lucy’s ears as she smilingly said, "Sorry to say, Austin, but the insult I faced by being matched up with you, truly agitated me."
Austin’s mouth was full of water as he continued to move around.
However, looking closely anyone could tell that he was losing strength.
His eyes were red, and his body sluggish.
The referee was ready to stop the match if Lucy didn’t liberate him even after he lost consciousness.
However, Lucy was just agitated. She didn’t hate Austin.
That’s why, once Austin stopped moving, and closed his eyes,
*Snap*
"Agh!"
The moment she snapped her fingers and the water orb collapsed, Lucy felt a powerful grip tighten around her throat.
Gasps filled the arena. Many students didn’t even register what had happened.
"H-How did you…?" Lucy choked out, eyes wide with disbelief. Just moments ago, Austin had been unconscious—yet now, he stood before her, holding her in an iron grip.
Austin panted slightly, silently thanking the system for granting him the Aqua Lungs skill in the past. Without it, he wouldn’t be standing here.
He clenched his fist.
A surge of soul energy wrapped around his hand, shaking the ground beneath him.
The entire arena fell into stunned silence.
Lucy’s breath hitched—not because she was being choked, but because of that fist.
Tears welled in her eyes as she barely managed to whisper, "I-I give—"
BOOOOOM!
Before she could finish, Austin’s punch slammed into her gut with an earth-shattering force.
Her body shot across the arena like a cannonball, crashing into the wall with a deafening impact.
Austin didn’t even glance back to check if she was conscious.
Without a word, he turned and walked away.
The referee instantly headed towards the girl who was framed in the wall, before checking on her.
Her breathing was slow but she was alive and could be recovered.
As such,
"AUSTIN, WINS!"
°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- This time it was a non-combatant type. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 140 - 139- Surprise
chapters.content:
Austin was kind of disappointed from his first battle in the tournament.
He didn’t think he would be able to win so easily. Yes, he was trapped in the water prison there for a few minutes, but still if taken out that skill, the girl was quite weak in other aspects.
’She was at least ranked B…then does that mean she was a fake ranker, or maybe someone favored her during the assessment.’ The chance is the bare minimum. Then does that mean the assessment doesn’t actually evaluate someone’s true rank?
’If I remember right, then they give training dummies to the test-taker…’ Other than the evolution of one’s shard, what works for evaluation is how many training dummies they can defeat within a limited time.
