Based on what Austin saw, Lucy was at least at the second evolution stage, since she was able to chant magic fluently. Then that means, she got the evaluation mainly because of her Shard.
’Even though this tournament should have been filled with Champions, there are few like me who don’t belong here….’ Asutin chuckled. It wasn’t like he was underestimating himself rather, he was just speaking based on what others might be feeling.
He soon reached his room and instantly went to take a bath.
Read exclusive adventures at .Côm
He had already informed Valerie that he would meet her in the Command Tent in an hour. He really needed to take a bath because the sour scent of acid was reeking from his body.
Throwing away his half-burnt clothes to the bucket, he dove into the water.
"Hah~I really love warm baths…" He sighed and took a few minutes to calm his mind and heart.
Even though he showed a bold and confident front in front of others, and Valerie, he was actually quite nervous. After all, this was his first battle at such a big stage.
It was his luck that he got paired against, maybe, one of the weakest students participating in this tournament. And thanks to that, he didn’t struggle until the end and passed the first round within five minutes.
[Ding!]
[Congratulations, host!]
[You achieved the quest.]
[Quest points have been added!]
Austin grinned as he spread his hand like some kind of Emperor and leaned backward.
However, the smirk soon died, as Austin opened his eyes and asked the system in a serious tone, "Hey, system...can you tell me something?"
[What is it, host?]
Austin’s eyes were focused on nothing in particular as he asked in a daze, "Even though all my stats are progressing so smoothly and I can feel getting stronger passing each day...why is my Soul Energy still the same as it was as before?"
He couldn’t comprehend why, just like his other stats, his Soul Energy wasn’t progressing.
Until now, all Austin could do was to augment his Shard. Using Raijin for a few minutes drains all his energy.
He has convinced himself that once he ascends to the next stage of the Overall Progression, his Shard will go through Evolution.
However, his Soul Energy wasn’t improving at all. Today when he saw Lucy releasing so many spells without a second thought, he felt that in a battle of magic, or long-range battle, he would lose almost easily.
There was a long pause from the other end, and Austin was waiting patiently.
Finally, a notification popped up,
[The host would surely receive a massive boost of Soul Energy once he ascends. However, until then, progressing specific stats is prohibited.]
Austin scoffed. His system was just making excuses now.
What specific stats? Shouldn’t his magic have upgraded along with Combat? What a bunch of crap.
’Forget it, I will just go hunting tonight...’
Heaving a sigh, Austin got out of the bath and wrapped a towel around his waist.
Exiting the bathroom, he was about to move towards his bag, when suddenly, he felt someone approaching him from behind.
Austin didn’t think twice before summoning his dagger and lunging at the ambusher.
"Ah!" Valerie exclaimed as she suddenly found herself pressed against the wall with slight coldness pressed against her neck.
Austin raised his brows, finding his fiancée sneaking toward him, as he asked, "Didn’t you fear that I might harm you?"
Although he said that, Austin knew that if Valerie wanted she could have easily countered him.
Valerie smilingly said, "Did I startle you? I wanted to surprise you."
Austin heaved a sigh, as he lowered his dagger and said, "Well, you succeeded. I am surprised, but it will take some time for me to react."
Valerie was brought to his bed with her hand being held, as she asked, "Tired?"
Austin slowly shook his head, "Nah, just all the anxiety and impatience came rushing down at once."
Valerie sat close to him, her hand hooked with his and her head leaning on his shoulder, intending to say something when suddenly she realized something when her face planted on his warm skin.
Looking down...she realized that his upper body was bare.
His broad chest rose and fell steadily, each breath making the muscles in his torso shift subtly. His abs were firm, sculpted like they were carved from stone, each ridge catching the light just right. Scars ran across his skin—not imperfections, but marks of battles fought and won, adding a rugged, dangerous charm.
There was raw power beneath that skin, restrained yet ready to explode at a moment’s notice. He wasn’t just fit—he was built for battle, for action.
Heat crept up her neck as she couldn’t stop herself from keeping her eye locked in his god-like body.
Why was he so perfect?!
She covered her face and began shaking slightly. This is bad. This is so so sooooo bad!
"I fink I fould leave..." With her face still covered, she tried to walk away, only for Austin to hold her waist and pull her back.
"Ah!" Valerie was startled to find herself sitting on her Lord’s lap, with his arm securely locked around her waist and his warmth surrounding her.
"Why are you trying to escape, Val? Do you fear that you might end up doing something to me?" His seductive voice rang in her ears, working as a means to elevate the rate of her already rapidly beating heart.
A teary-eyed Valerie glanced at her unfair Lord before she muttered, "D-Do you want t-to?"
Austin took a deep breath. Truth be told, this mood was really dangerous for him as well.
Having such a stunning fiancée right before him, and then being alone in the room—every sign told him to let go of his restraints and just give in to his desires.
And he knows that Valerie also wouldn’t resist. However,
"I...still haven’t gained the permission of your family, Val. And until I don’t do that, I am not officially your partner. So can you wait until then? Please?"
He doesn’t want to rush things when it comes to Valerie. He was eager, yes, but didn’t want to hurt her feelings.
Valerie wasn’t his girlfriend, but his wife. There is no official document about their marriage but he had already considered her.
That’s why, he wanted to do everything properly.
Also, even though Austin had already turned eighteen, there were still three months left before Valerie would become an adult. So there was that factor as well...
Valerie visibly calmed down after hearing his words.
She would be lying to say that she didn’t follow the customs her mother taught her. And she believed that they carried values.
Although she wouldn’t have stopped her Lord if he really wanted to...but after hearing his reason to stop, all she could feel in her heart was inexplicable warmth.
Lowering her gaze, she held his warm hand as she said, "Every single day, you make me realize that I didn’t fall for the wrong man." Turning her head, she kissed him on his cheek, before whispering,
"I love you, Austin."
It was Austin’s turn to turn slightly red, hearing those magical words from the front.
He parted his lips and slowly said, "I-I lo-*chu*" his eyes widened when his lips were suddenly sealed.
Valerie parted her lips almost instantly, before asking with a tilt of her head, "I didn’t hear you...what did you say?"
Austin was flabbergasted as he absentmindedly said, "I said, I also lo-" again! She interrupted him with such a sweet reward again!
"I didn’t hear you, at all. Can you repeat it?" An innocent face which didn’t give the impression that the same girl kept kissing him, asked him.
Austin narrowed his eyes, "So you wanna play it like that, huh?"
The room was filled with Valerie’s giggles as Austin suddenly pushed her on the bed, and began kissing her like a madman.
Without him knowing, Valerie removed the cloud of glooms with her presence.
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- For God’s sake, if I get someone like her, imma gonna fight the world for her! Drop a comment already!

chapters.title: Chapter 141 - 140- Meeting(1)
chapters.content:
The crowd was loud.
If not for the strong material used to make the stands then all the stomping and jumping might have formed cracks in the walls.
The reason behind their excitement was the next contestant who was about to battle.
The rumors of a strong contender participating from the Valorian Academy have reached the ears of many students across the globe.
An S-rank participating in the contest was not a small thing. After all, those S-ranks they have heard about or read about were all working for the Council.
So having a warrior who stands at the pinnacle of the rankings, participating in the tournament was, naturally, quite a big event for everyone.
Every academy—except for Valorian—watched intently, analyzing the opponent they might face in the future. Her victory today was inevitable, but if they could spot even the slightest weakness in her performance, they might just find a way to bring her down in the team battles ahead.
Austin was sitting beside Rudolph as he watched the match with great focus.
His interest in watching Valerie in action aside, he couldn’t miss watching a battle fought between two high-ranking warriors.
After all, if the strongest one from Valorian was standing on one side, then on the other side was an Elite from the Ravencourt.
’Best of luck, Val.’ He muttered under his breath as he saw the two participants making their way to the center.
....
In the arena, Valerie silently walked towards the center as she heard numerous voices from her surroundings.
There were hundreds of people, however, the person her eyes caught watching her was the most handsome man out there.
’Watch me closely.’ Unlike that time during the trials, she wasn’t supposed to be holding back here. Here, she was only supposed to win as such, she was going to give a spectacle to her Lord.
On the other side, it was a slim dark-blue-haired man who walked towards her
Slanted eyes and a smirk on his face as he called out, "I heard you once were invited to study at the Ravencourt, but you rejected?"
Valerie remained silent; waiting for the referee to come up on the stage
The other one continued, "I, Leo Aketoth, will make you realize what a great opportunity you missed by rejecting the offer. I will show you-"
"Who are you talking to?" The match referee suddenly appeared before them as he asked. From his perception, Valerie was looking away and seemed completely unaware that the other person was talking.
Leo scoffed, "No one."
The match referee signaled them to take their stance before he relayed the rules to the two.
Valerie finally tore her eyes away from her beloved and looked at her opponent.
She doesn’t remember what she learned about her potential opponent, so she decided to just fight like she always does.
The referee raised his hand, and asked, "Participants, ready?"
Leo nodded, already having his Shard summoned.
Valerie also nodded, summoning her Shard.
The brilliant light that appeared with the spear made everyone gasp.
It was the first time for many to see a Shard, which has gone through three evolutions.
The bright silver spear was an intimidating yet captivating weapon. Faint engravings ran along its length, whispering of craftsmanship and legacy. The blade, sharp and well-defined, shimmered with a cold brilliance, honed for precise, lethal strikes.
Leo was ready.
He knew exactly who he was facing. There was no holding back—he had to end this in one strike.
His fingers tightened around his gauntlet-shaped Shards, muscles coiling like a spring.
Now or never...
The referee’s hand moved.
Time slowed.
Leo’s breath steadied, his heart pounded, and his soul energy surged around him like a storm. His eyes locked onto the referee’s hand, tracking every inch as it dropped.
The instant it reached the bottom—
"BEGIN!"
Leo roared, "Death Fl—"
TING!
The sharp ring of metal striking stone echoed for a mere second—before the world shattered.
CRACK!
The ground split apart. Ice erupted like a tidal wave, spiraling into jagged spikes that speared toward the sky. A deafening roar of frost filled the arena as the temperature plunged.
Leo’s eyes barely widened before—
SNAP!
His body was swallowed by the surging ice.
A massive glacier-like formation rose where he once stood, layers of frost creeping higher, consuming him in an unrelenting grip. His roar of defiance never made it past his lips—his voice was lost inside the crystalline prison.
The audience gasped, their breath turning visible in the freezing air.
"What… what just happened?" someone stammered.
"He’s… he’s done! He didn’t even move!"
"She ended it in a single strike—"
The chaos from moments ago shattered into silence. Shock and disbelief are written over their faces.
Every eye locked onto the massive pillar of ice where Leo had once stood.
And at its base, spear still buried in the ground, stood Valerie—unmoving.
Expression calm.
As if the battle had never even begun.
Even the referee was caught in the ice, his legs frozen as he looked at Valerie helplessly.
Valerie approached the referee before she used the bottom of her Shard to break the ice.
Turning towards Leo, who was completely encased in ice, he declared, "Since the opponent could no longer continue the battle, Valerie wins!"
There was no cheering this time. People were still trying to register what they just witnessed.
Even the Elites had their eyes widened and minds failing to register what level of sorcery they just saw.
The only people who clapped without reservation were from Valorian Academy.
However, Ryan didn’t share the sentiment. His mouth was hung open as he realized what the girl was capable of.
’If she really wanted...she could have defeated me instantly that day....’
Valerie smiling waved at her teammates before she made her way out of the arena.
.....
Every member of the Elite squad was gathered in the Command Tent to discuss the situation.
"Fortunately, we have won all the three matches we have played." Annabelle had a wide smile on her face when she announced that.
On the first day, Austin was victorious.
Explore more stories with Free
On the second day, Rhea surprised the world with her dual awakening.
And the third day went as everyone expected.
Tomorrow, Rudolph will be playing his match, and it is highly likely that he will win.
After all, not only was he one of the top students in Valorian, but he was also trained by the Commander General and his father.
So there was a high chance that the Valorian Academy would get their four semi-finalists tomorrow.
However, it wasn’t like the others were going to stop there.
Everyone has come here to win; as such, even if Rudolph wins tomorrow, they will do their best to win their matches as well.
Although the pressure has elevated, that’s fine.
"Okay then, the meeting is adjourned. Let’s meet tomorrow morning." Annabelle declared before everyone slowly began to get up and leave
Valerie and Austin were also heading out together, when Valerie asked, "Should we go get dinner?"
Austin sighed before shaking his head, "We need to be somewhere else, Val."
The violette frowned as she tilted her head questioningly.
So many things have happened, that Austin wasn’t surprised that she forgot.
In a heavy voice, he reminded her, "We need to meet Madame Selner today at the Union Council’s headquarters."
A sudden rush ran down her spine, the excitement dying with that reminder. However, she didn’t back off and while holding his hand firmly, she said,
"Then let’s get going."
°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Many secrets would unfold maybe. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 142 - 141- Meeting(2)
chapters.content:
Austin would be lying to say that he wasn’t nervous as the carriage advanced toward the headquarters.
He has been growing stronger at a very questionable pace. Now, such a drastic change can happen under two circumstances: First, if the person has double awakened like Rhea, which was like one in a thousand years of luck. Second...the person has gotten involved with the other side.
The other side in question was, naturally, the demonic side.
Consuming the dark water, many people have shown tremendous growth in the past. Around a thousand years ago, when demons were reigning supremacy, talented humans were forcibly made to consume Dark Water to change into useful soldiers. And those without talents were treated as slaves and livestock.
Now that double awakening is something that cannot remain hidden for long, they must be assuming that Austin has gotten himself involved with the demonic side.
And Austin had all the reasons to. After all, his brother has snatched the throne for him—or what they might be thinking.
’If they put me into an interrogation cell, there is a very high chance they would get to know about my system and, possibly, reincarnation.’ Their interrogation devices are impossible to fool. Considering that the Union Council is the most powerful body of judiciary and executive, Austin cannot appeal anywhere else to protect himself.
That’s why, he has decided to reveal himself to be a double-awakened.
His second Shard? Raijin, of course.
He can summon it on a will and can control it like his Shard.
....however, it would be troublesome if someone else tried to grab it. Considering a Soul Shard can’t be touched or used by someone else, but Raijin can be, they would instantly know that Austin is lying.
That’s why he needs to be careful, or this would be game over.
"Nervous?"
Hearing the voice, which generally calms him down, Austin sighs before nodding, "Yes, kind of."
Valerie smilingly leaned her head on his shoulder, as she muttered, "It’s the same for me. However, there is something that tells me, that we don’t need to be."
Austin hummed in questioning, "What do you mean?"
Valerie shrugged, "I don’t know but it’s just instincts. As if, I know that this invitation was never meant to harm us."
Austin helplessly smiled, "I hope your instincts are not playing games with you."
Holding her hand fondly, he leaned back and allowed himself to attain some much-needed rest.
The most crucial factor during this meeting with Madame Selner would be calmness.
Once he loses his composure, it’s game over.
....
The carriage came to a pause not so long after.
The tournament venue was just half an hour away from the city where the Headquarters was situated.
Valerie and Austin stepped out of the carriage, with their hands connected, before they looked at the tall building before them.
The last time they came here, they only saw the headquarters from far away.
However, this time, they were going inside.
"Did you receive anything from Sebastian, recently?" Valerie asked. She remembered it was him who went inside the last time and showed no fear when doing so.
A person worthy to be admired by her Lord.
Austin hummed, "He was worried about this meeting, but he couldn’t have traveled from the capital in such a short time, and I didn’t ask him as well." Sebastian was currently in the capital, taking care of the King and rearranging things in the Council.
After Aiden’s plans were uncovered, and his room was searched, several things came up.
That’s why, the post of Chief Advisor and the Finance Minister were currently empty. And the few who helped Aiden in keeping his crimes a secret are also held captive.
Eryndor was actually in its most vulnerable phase as of now. Any nation going through an internal feud becomes an easy target for others.
Thankfully, currently, Drenovar was in support of Eryndor, and the other major nations had no interest in conquering a small nation such as Eryndor.
While talking about the possible crisis that Eryndor might have to face, Austin and Valerie arrived in the waiting area.
"Wait here, I will go inform them," Austin said as he left Valerie to sit on the resting bench before he walked towards the reception counter.
Your next journey awaits at Free
"Excuse me," he called out before the lady in the reception looked at him, "I have a meeting with Lady Selner." Saying so, he was about to show her the letter, but,
"Yes, I will call someone to guide you." She didn’t even verify his identity and instantly picked a small round artifact and called someone.
Austin returned to Valerie and sat down beside her, "They are sending someone."
Valerie nodded, as they sat silently in the waiting area.
A few minutes passed before someone appeared from the corner, and told them, "Please come with me."
Austin and Valerie got up and began following the man.
They were led through a complicated path. A series of connected galleries, and none of them held any significant signs or decorations to tell them apart.
"This...is quite an interesting construction."
The soldiers smiled, "This place is built like this to prevent ambush attempts. We are told to learn the pattern from the first day we join. It’s like our daily routine, to revise the routes three times a day, and since we are forbidden to make a map, all we can rely on is our memory."
Austin was surprised. That sounded quite complicated and tough.
’The soldiers here are built differently...’ He can sense the faint aura releasing from the man. He might be moving ahead of them without having any means to surveil their movements; Austin knew that if he showed slight hostility, the man would counter it most probably.
Valerie, on the other hand, was trying to remember the routes. However, by the seventh gallery, she lost interest and just began following him mindlessly.
After seven or so minutes, they finally came to a halt before the door.
A large brown wooden door, with a golden door knob.
Just when Austin and Valerie were about to enter the room, the soldier suddenly bowed before them and said,
"I am thankful for what you did in Drenovar. My brother was also among the soldiers; that’s why I feel indebted to you two for saving his life."
Austin and Valerie shared a glance, before the blond one said, "We are glad that we were there to help."
The soldier raised his head, and with a smile, he walked away.
Austin turned toward Valerie before giving her nod and knocking on the door.
"Come in," Almost instantly, a voice rang from the other side.
Austin was surprised, but he didn’t delay in twisting the door knob and opening the door.
As they entered, the gentle scent of jasmine struck them.
The room was quite simple and elegant, with a few showcases on the left and bookshelves on the right.
A few meters away from the door was the desk where the lady sat.
Short violet hair, purple eyes, and a youthful face. The lady was sitting with her elbows resting on the table and a thin smile on her red lips.
Valerie froze nearly seeing the beautiful face, as she inwardly muttered,
’Wasn’t she supposed to be an old granny?’
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 143 142- Relationship
chapters.content:
Valerie and Austin were told to sit down before someone came to deliver two cups of coffee, both without sugar.
Austin already knew that the woman looked quite beautiful but from the front, he could tell that there was something about her that wasn't right.
Her charm didn't cause suspicion but the period she worked for the Council.
Some say she has been with the Council for a long time and has guided several generations of rulers, throughout the years.
She never actually appears in public unless some planetary-level threat shows up. And when, canonically, she does, no one cares about how she looks. After all, between the lady and the demon lord, people naturally chose to focus more on the dangerous side.
However, there was no war going on at this point, so his mind was going back to the same question.
How is she still so young?
"I am a witch."
The statement caught both teenagers by surprise.
Witch?!
"Are you joking with us?" Valerie asked, a frown marring her face.
The lady didn't mind being asked rudely as she picked a pen from the desk and said, "I can control my appearance because time holds no power over me. I will endure as long as this world exists, untouched by the rise and fall of empires. No matter who claims supremacy in the end, I will always find a place of peace—just as I have now."
Saying so, she dropped the pen from her hand—but rather than falling to the ground, the pen slowed down mid-air.
It wasn't levitating; rather, it slowed down after falling for inches below the drop point.
Austin and Valerie both knew that she was using sorcery…but without using her Shard?
It took them some time but Austin finally spoke, "Okay, even if you are a witch, why did you tell us? Weren't we invited here for questioning?"
The reason he believed her so easily was because now that she mentioned it, it all made sense.
For someone to use magic so flawlessly without using her Shard…not something a human could achieve. It also explains why, despite appearing so young, she has such a deep influence on the council—something one could only achieve if they have been closely connected to the council for years.
The lady sighed before leaning forward, "Because the basis of every relationship is trust. And I…want to have a relationship with you Austin."
*SHLINK*
The table, the coffee mugs, and even the moisture in the air became frozen because of Valerie's magic outburst.
However, the lady before them was completely unbothered.
In fact, the frost attack didn't even affect her at all.
With her voice lower in temperature than the room, Valerie muttered, "Please think before you speak, Madame Selner. Maybe you not know-"
"I know. You two are engaged. And trust me, girl, I am not talking about the kind of relationship you are thinking about."
Austin held his lover's hand and, smiling, told her, "Let's listen to her, okay?"
Valerie felt embarrassed…was she too impulsive?
Selner waved her hand and the frost from the room and Austin's clothes disappeared into nothingness.
Austin had a frown on his face as he tried to discern what exactly she could do.
'I need to study her a little more…'
Selner sighed as she advised, "With that temperament, I wonder how easy it would be for your enemy to destroy you. In my opinion, you should work on it."
Valerie huffed…however, it would be a lie to say that those words didn't affect her.
Selner once again began, "Austin, can you show me your Shard?"
Austin raised his brows. Is this conversation finally heading in the direction where he expected it to have?
Was he going to get examined?
Regardless, he didn't think for long, and after getting up, he summoned both of his Shards; ready to give an explanation.
Valerie was already informed what he would be telling them, that's why she wasn't surprised when he summoned his axe as well.
The lady got up from her seat and approached him.
Austin was waiting for her to ask about his dual shard…however, she didn't utter a word until she was close to him and tilted her head as she gazed at his dagger.
"Put that away. I know that's not your shard." She shoo-ed away the axe just as Austin was preparing to relay the story he had prepared.
However, not only did she ask anything about his other Shard…she even realized that he was lying to her.
Austin helplessly glanced at Valerie, only to find her helplessly looking back at him.
What…in the world is happening here?
Selner continued to study his Shard for a long time, meanwhile, Austin wordlessly stored his Shard back in the inventory.
…wasn't he going to get blamed for being involved with the other side, now?
However, after waiting for several minutes, when she spoke, she didn't accuse him. Rather,
"Your soul energy isn't progressing at all, I suppose?"
Austin was taken aback, as he slowly nodded, "Yes…but how do you know?"
Selner shrugged, "I mean your Shard is still at phase zero, so it's pretty natural for your Soul Energy to remain the same. However, your other stats are going up, right?"
Austin took a strong gulp, as he said, "I don't know what you are saying…" Someone who hasn't gone through evolution to grow stronger…how can this be that possible, right?
Selner completely ignored her words as she returned to her seat and said, "Let's form a symbiotic relationship, Austin. We can benefit each other. "
Selner suddenly pushed a letter in their direction.
Austin picked up the letter. It was a rank evaluation appointment…the date was three months from today.
Valerie also read the details and was shocked to see the name of the candidate to be extremely familiar.
Austin Eryndor.
"Ma'am?" Austin asked.
Selner explained, "I have already set your appointment and the next rank you have to get imprinted on your ID card should be A."
Valerie's eyes widened, "What are you…in three months? Even for Austin, it's too much."
Progressing from D to C was one thing, but every rank above C is hard to achieve unless one goes through evolutions.
Selner's head tilted to the right before telling her, "Then you might not know your lover enough. Just look at him…do you see disbelief or doubt in his eyes?"
Valerie was forced to gaze at her lord…and just as the lady said, all Valerie noticed was that he was actually considering reaching rank A in three months.
Valerie was rendered speechless.
Does she really not know everything about her Lord?
-------^^------
A/N:- I hope you all are enjoying the story so far.

chapters.title: Chapter 144 143- Deal
chapters.content:
A few things Austin realized after the fifteen minutes of conversation with the chief advisor of the Union Council.
Somehow, she knows about him more than what his report or any profile could have offered.
Maybe because she was a witch and could keep an eye on her surroundings. And since she had her eyes on Austin for a long time, she knows so many things about him?
But then again, what makes Austin special? Just because his growth rate was unusual?
And then, her unnatural request...no, more like, she was telling him to reach A-rank in three months.
"What would you benefit from me leveling up?" Austin asked, after a brief pause.
He has a way to reach A-rank in three months: dungeons.
He can grind as hard as he wants, and through dungeons, he would never stop getting stronger. Not to mention, the rewards they bring. And also, the new 'Shop' feature would surely show its helpfulness.
Selner intertwined her fingers on the table, and while maintaining her calm demeanor, she voiced, "We are on the verge of a war against the greatest threat humanity could ever come across. The entity who even threatened the deities a thousand years ago. The concept of evil and darkness: the demon lord."
Austin frowned, "So you want me to become a major fighting unit in the battle against him?"
Selner nodded, "Yes, I do. After all, a person who can grow stronger even without needing his Shard to evolve...I know I won't be able to find such a person even if I try to. So Austin, I want you to not waste your potential and start training to become a useful asset."
Austin felt that her reason was logical but she wasn't telling the truth.
Yes, he can and will become one of the resistance forces against the Demon Lord ...but somehow, he felt that Lady Selner wasn't asking him to level up just because of that.
What could be the reason?
Valerie was silently listening until now, and upon finding the opportunity, she asked, "If he grows to rank A without his Shard going through advancements, it would cause a massive uproar."
If her Lord believed he could climb to rank A in three months, then Valerie also believed he could do it. However, the most glaring concern regarding that possibility was the reaction of the public.
Selner nodded, "You are right; however, legally, no one would go against you, I promise. After all, the Council would be backing you up."
Austin's brows elevated, "Will they?" The Union Council doesn't have the time and interest to support a warrior who is anywhere beneath S-rank.
So it was quite difficult to believe in her.
Selner's lips thinned in a smile, as she said, "You don't trust them, but you can trust me. Until you are under my watch, they won't question you. And while you are at it, stop forbidding yourself from using your other skills during the battle. I will send a letter to the tournament management, so they won't question you."
Austin sighed, "So you know about my other skills as well....really, no one knows so deeply about me."
Valerie panicked hearing those words as she glanced at her beloved.
Austin calmed her down by holding her hand fondly and assuring her, "Only when it comes to my skills. But on an emotional level, you understand me better than I understand myself."
Valerie calmed down.
Selner chuckled, "It's adorable to see you two getting along."
Austin smiled in the lady's direction. He didn't know how she knew so much about him, but since he couldn't sense animosity from her or any deceit in her words, he chose to not show caution.
The room fell under silence for a brief moment before Austin hesitantly asked, "Madame Selner, since you know so many things about me...can you tell me why my Shard isn't going through evolution or why my Soul energy isn't progressing?"
That was the biggest hurdle for him as of now. Even the system couldn't help him with that. Under such circumstances, he was ready to ask for help from a person he met only half an hour ago
Valerie seemed concerned, seeing Austin in such a low spirit.
It would be a lie to say that she wasn't also worried about Shard not going through any evolution, even though, at this point, any awakened should have had their Shard advanced to the next stage.
Selner remained silent for a few minutes before she declared, "Okay, let's make it a reward."
Austin hummed in question before the lady added,
"I know why your Soul Energy isn't progressing, but I will only tell you if you succeed in the trial I gave you."
With her eyes holding some mischief, she said, "Become an A-rank, and I shall tell you why you are stuck at stage zero."
Austin's breath was caught in his throat as Valerie asked hurriedly, "Do you...really know?"
Selner shrugged, "It's your choice to trust me, but I guarantee you that once he reaches the rank I desire him to be...Austin will get to know his answer."
The flickering ember of hope, suddenly transformed into raging flames.
He was only thinking of how he would level up this fast, but now, he was motivated to do it.
If leveling up can help him get rid of the handicap, then he surely would grind until death.
"You helped us a lot, Madame Selner." Austin thanked the lady.
Not so long after, they were allowed to leave, but only after being notified that Austin might get summoned anytime in the future as well.
"I will also come," Valerie coldly stated. Letting her man meet this person alone was not safe.
Selner just smiled but didn't say anything
On that note, the two teenagers made their way out of the room, leaving Selner alone.
Once they were gone, Selner heaved a very long sigh.
Pulling open the drawer, she took out a torn red scarf before holding it close to her heart.
"It's working...he is on the path to greatness....just as you predicted."
°°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Now start guessing. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 145 144- Defeated
chapters.content:
Rudolph was on the training ground, his body covered with sweat as he remained standing under the dim light provided.
He was training in the indoor training facility provided to the students. It was open to everyone, and there was no time limit; that's why Rudolph was taking advantage and practicing using a weapon that was identical to his shard.
His team captain has forbidden them from using their Shard during training until they don't face their first rounds. Naturally, Rudolph listened to her words and was using the war hammer provided by the management.
'This is my only chance…' Rudolph was in his second year and considering this tournament happens once in two years, he wouldn't get another chance.
Various things were on the line. His friends' expectations. Rhea's prayers are for every student from Valorian's to get into the second round. And above all, his father's confidence in him.
He never doubts Rudolph's skills and has already planned how he would be celebrating the event when Rudolph lifts the trophy.
While these expectations were motivating him….they put him under immense pressure as well.
The horror of losing couldn't be greater when the world is expecting you to win.
"Fuuh~I can't think of losing here…I need to do my best."
With those thoughts, Rudolph decided to call it a day.
He stored the weapon in the rack before wiping his sweat with his already-drenched shirt.
The gymnasium was empty since it was way past midnight. Rhea had told him to sleep after they had lunch together, but it had become his habit recently to train after dinner, so he decided to release some steam to have a good night's sleep.
Stepping out of the hall, he was about to turn when suddenly,
"Ah!" He hurriedly held the hand of the person he crashed into just after turning.
It was a beautiful black-haired woman whom Rudolph saw during the welcoming ceremony.
"I am sorry," Rudolph apologized as he helped the girl stand back on her feet.
A smile formed on Monica's lips as she lowered her head slightly, "I should apologize. I was in a rush. Were you training?" She asked to which Rudolph responded with a nod,
"Yeah, what about you?"
The raven-haired looked embarrassed as she said, "I forgot my hair clip when I came to train…those are lucky ones, so I want them for my match."
Rudolph nodded in understanding, and just as he was about to say his goodbye, Monica pointed out, "Hey, you are bleeding." Saying so, she touched his shoulder, and Rudolph felt a stinging sensation from there.
He also looked at the spot and indeed, there was a deep cut actively bleeding down his shoulder.
'Hmm…when did I cut myself?' Rudolph didn't think much about it since he had received several more wounds while training. He covered his wound with his hand and told her,
"Just got some while training. Anyway, see you later. Good night."
The girl nodded before she headed inside the gymnasium.
Rudolph also returned to his room and got some much-needed rest after taking a bath.
Tomorrow is a big day for him.
------^^------
Austin and Valerie were slowly heading back to their rooms.
Their minds were filled with the thoughts of the meeting they had with the chief advisor.
First, the revelation of her being a witch, followed by the sudden quest she assigned to Austin.
Austin was still unsure what her goals were, and why she knew so much about him.
However, for now, his focus was on leveling up and getting ranked 'A' in the assessment.
Even if the lady doesn't answer him, Austin has a feeling that he will break through the first stage of the Overall Progression. So maybe that helps him out.
…or maybe both his options might fail?
"Austin," Valerie called out, her head leaning down, as she said, "…do you think my sudden outburst is a bother?"
Austin raised his brows—so she was still bothered about it, huh?
Back then, Selner warned her that her sudden and controlled reaction might cause her dearly one day.
He didn't think for long before relaying his honest thoughts, "In my opinion, that's cute, Val."
The girl was shocked as she raised her eyes and looked at him. Her eyes reflected the shine of the moon.
"For you to be jealous when someone shows interest in me, I really find it adorable."
With a side glance, he added, "However, you have to consider when you can allow your emotions to affect your actions and when you can't. After all, our enemy always searches for our weak points to provoke or weaken us. The moment you show your vulnerable side, it's game over."
Valerie's head lowered slightly. She understood the gravity of his words and decided to work on her temperament so that in the future, she wouldn't end up becoming easy prey for her enemies.
"I will work on it," Valerie slowly muttered.
Austin hummed, "Meditation might help. I do it regularly."
Valerie chuckled upon hearing that, "Yes, you told me about it."
Brief silence persisted between them, which was broken by the girl, as she asked, "Will you be training tomorrow?"
Considering he needs to go through re-evaluation in just three months, every day matters to him. And since Austin doesn't have to participate in any battle for at least a week more, he can train without worries.
Austin nodded, "Most likely. Though I would come to watch Rud's match."
Valerie nodded, "He seemed pretty pumped up for his battle."
Austin smiled, "I mean this is his opportunity to show what he trained for."
Tomorrow, Valorian will get their fourth qualified member.
Or so they thought.
…..
"Monica wins!"
Everyone from the Valorian academy had their mouths parted slightly as they gazed at the fallen Rudolph.
None of them could have ever expected that one of the strongest students from Valorian Academy would be defeated so easily.
The students were booing and badmouthing Rudolph for his performance.
In the arena, Monica coldly looked at Rudolph as she muttered under her breath, "Sorry big guy, but I can't let anyone come between us."
And with that, Valorian Academy lost their first match and their first player.
--------^^---------
A/N:- B*tch alert. I hope you all are enjoying the story so far. Now, if you are then please drop a review. Thank you.

chapters.title: Chapter 146 145- Mental barrier
chapters.content:
[A few minutes earlier]
Austin, along with the other team members, were gathered in the stands to watch Rudolph's match.
The audience was vast today as well. The students who were not participating from each academy were allowed to spectate.
Naturally, the council arranged their stay near the venue—which was a big thing, considering over a thousand students were visiting the tournament.
If not for every kingdom providing funds and the management getting help from the Union Council, then arranging the tournament at this scale would have been quite difficult—no, impossible.
Austin turned his attention toward the match referees around the arena. To stop any student from damaging their opponent beyond recovery, they would jump immediately.
'One of them must be a barrier specialist and one must be a medic.' Austin guessed.
"Want some candies?" Rhea suddenly offered him.
Austin turned his eyes, before nodding. However, when he raised his hand to pick some candies, he noticed something,
"You are shaking, Rhea," Austin called out, as he took some candies.
Rhea looked down at her hand and blinked in confusion.
The President of the Student Council, who was sitting on the other side of the pink head, asked, "Why are you nervous? Weren't you the most confident one about this match?"
Valerie also noticed the small hubbub as she picked some candies from Austin's hand and asked him, "What's the matter?"
Austin shrugged, as they both heard from the pink head,
"I don't know why, but I feel like something bad is about to happen. I really wish not to, but I don't know."
Austin narrowed his eyes in suspicion. Anyone saying such words could be ignored, but the Protagonist with the blessing of majorly every God?
'No, no…there must be something wrong then…' Even though Austin was contemplating what might have gone wrong, it was too late.
The two participants were already in the middle of the arena.
On the left side was the black-haired girl whom Austin met during the welcoming ceremony and still couldn't forget about. And on the right was his friend and the fourth member participating from the Valorian.
All Austin could do now was to hope that Rudolph would get through this hurdle.
…..
In the arena, Rudolph and Monica stood facing each other.
The noise of the crowd was majorly focused on the girl and her beauty.
"We meet again," The girl said with a friendly smile, "I hope you had a good sleep."
Rudolph nodded, "You bet." His body has recovered enough for him to not make any mistakes during the battle.
…however, there was a strange feeling inside his head that was making him hesitant for some reason. He didn't know why but his mind was refraining him from beginning this battle.
'What am I even thinking…' reprimanding himself, Rudolph got prepared.
The match referee appeared on the stage and first informed them of the rules.
Once done, Rudolph summoned his Shard, which was in the form of a huge battle hammer that pulsated with raw energy.
The haft is a massive, darkened metal shaft reinforced with bands of enchanted silver, long enough to require both hands to wield properly. The pommel is capped with a jagged crystal, cracked but ever-glowing, signifying the raw power it contains.
Rudolph has named it: Titan Judgement.
On the other hand, the Shard that Monica manifested was a single-hand war fan. It was violet in color and had enough details to signify the evolutions it had gone through.
Rudolph doesn't know anything about Monica. The lessons Rhea taught him about his potential opponents were all forgotten. Rudolph always had the philosophy that in a real battlefield, no one knows whom they might need to face, so in the tournament as well, the element of surprise can help them prepare.
"Participants, ready?"
Rudolph picked up his weapon and gave a firm nod.
Monica did the same, covering her mouth with the war fan, she gave a nod.
The referee slashed his hand,
"BEGIN!"
Just as the referee commenced, Rudolph's figure turned a blur—which was a surprise considering his size—as he appeared behind her back.
Monica was in no position to counter his attack as Rudolph raised his battle hammer, ready to deliver a blow to knock her out.
The students held their breath seeing the big lion standing behind the small rabbit with his fangs bared.
However, right before he could attack the girl, his…hand slipped and he failed to land the blow.
"Huh?" Rudolph exclaimed as his hammer landed on the ground rather than on the girl's shoulder.
Monica took the opportunity to find the boy at her face level before she waved her war fan, and a streak of blood sprayed from Rudolph's collar.
"Agh!" Rudolph groaned in pain as he left his hammer on the ground and reeled his punch to strike—only to stop inches away from her face.
"Huh…" Rudolph didn't know why but he didn't bring himself to hit the girl at all. It wasn't his principles; rather, his mind was playing games at the worst time.
*SQUELCH*
A stream of blood flowed down his face as a deep gash was inflicted by the girl.
"No…" In the stands, Rhea had tears in her eyes as she approached the handrail.
Everyone from the Elite division was shocked, including Esner(Parkinson). He has fought with Rudolph in the past so he knows what the boy is capable of.
'What in the world happened to you?' Esner muttered under his breath with a frown on his face.
Austin had a bad feeling after witnessing this unexpected turn of events.
Although people in the audience were saying that Rudolph was not immune to Monica's charm and couldn't bring himself to hit the beauty, Austin knew that it wasn't the case.
Rudolph is the guy who has hit even the love of his life without hesitation in the past. So, it was quite unnatural for him to show hesitation during the battle.
'What happened to you…'
Back in the arena, the paralyzing effect of Monica's weapon took effect and Rudolph fell to the ground.
The referee came to check on the boy, asking him if he could continue, but Rudolph's body was failing to respond to his plea and his mind was in chaos of what he had done.
In the end, the referee declared Rudolph unfit to continue the battle. Resulting in,
"Participant Monica wins!"
The said girl smiled in elation, before she directed her eyes toward a certain blond in the stands, and muttered under her breath,
"No one can come between us~"
---------^^---------
A/N:- I think you guys can guess what Monica's shard's ability is. Well, we will get there eventually. Leave a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 147 146- Undecided
chapters.content:
"UGHOOO!"
The giant roared as a lightning axe buried itself deep into its chest, followed by a dagger that plunged straight into its skull. It barely had time to react before its massive body collapsed, lifeless.
Austin didn't stop. With a sharp command, Wisp unleashed judgment upon the next monster, followed by a blinding bolt of lightning struck from the sky, frying the creature as it lunged forward. The giant's charred body stiffened, then crashed to the ground, unmoving.
THWANG!
A loud impact rang out as another monster tried to ambush Austin from behind. But his barrier flared to life, sending the giant's wooden club flying. Austin spun around, eyes locking onto his attacker. Without hesitation, he reeled back his fist—
BOOOOM!
His punch tore straight through the monster's stomach, leaving a gaping hole. The creature gasped before crumpling to the ground.
Austin exhaled, summoning his Shard back to his hand. With a thought, he reshaped it into a long spear. Another monster charged from afar, too slow to reach him in time. He smirked, then used a nearby kneeling giant as a springboard, launching himself into the air.
With all his strength, he hurled the spear—
BOOOOM!
The impact shattered the monster's skull in a violent explosion.
Austin landed smoothly, his breath steady despite the relentless battle. He glanced around, surveying the battlefield.
Fifty giants. All dead.
And he wasn't done yet.
These giants were of rank 'C' at best, which explains why they were easy to defeat and why they provided so few points.
Austin glanced in the direction of the next section of the dungeon.
The monsters there looked stronger and taller and the points they offered were more as well.
That means the system tracked his ranking and has elevated the difficulty, huh?
'System, you said it was a B rank dungeon…then…'
[The system is only helping the host to elevate his stats rather than having mundane battles.]
Austin's brows twitched. Why is it that, he wasn't allowed to farm some EXP in peace? Does he need to struggle for every single point?
'Not fair…'
With those thoughts, Austin decided to leave.
He was slightly disturbed about the match he watched today.
Rudolph's strange behavior was unsettling, and coincidentally, his opponent was the one person who constantly troubled Austin's mind.
'Until I don't ask him, I won't know what exactly happened back then…' Austin decided to meet Rudolph tomorrow as he returned to his room and decided to have a bath first.
Sheldon was not in his room, even though it was way over dinner time.
Austin and Valerie also decided to call it a day early since Austin told her that he would go train.
Valerie had to attend the meeting with the President so they went their respective ways.
Dipping inside the warm water, Austin called out, 'Show me my stats, system.'
[Combat: 63->72/100]
{Next reward at 80}
[Romance: 63/100]
{Next reward at 80}
[You have gained a reward!]
[Durability: 68->73/100]
{Next reward at 80}
[Trickery: 31/100]
Next reward at 35}
[Overall Progression: 53.5->59/100]
[Next Reward at 70]
…
Austin hummed, studying his current stats.
He was still far from crossing the first stage. However, considering he was, at best, a 'B-' rank now, he knew by the time he reached A, his overall progression would hit a hundred as well.
His current points were:
[Total points: 429]
Seeing the points and the possible points he could earn in the second dungeon, Austin asked, "How many points do I need to unlock the next dungeon?"
[A thousand, host.]
Austin hummed. Pretty reasonable.
At this rate, he can earn points for the next stage if he enters the dungeon once more.
And then, those points he further earns would be used on Shop.
What Austin needs to do right now is to farm points as many as he can within this week since next week would be the squad matches, and for that, he would be required to train as a team.
After that would come the duo matches…however, more than the matches, what troubled Austin was the Beast King Zevarath—the same demon general who attacked Drenovar and against whom Valerie fought.
Canonically, by now, Zevarath should have started recruiting students who lost their first round or those who were feeling bitter about not having the opportunity to participate.
Demons like Kalwar were filled in Zevarath's army, who could change their appearance and mask their demonic presence, so Austin couldn't trust anyone other than those whom he knew closely…or more like, just one person.
'Assumably, if they haven't entered the tournament then what could be their plan?' Austin doesn't have any idea, and the only person who can get any lead about it is the protagonist.
That's why Austin was going to observe Rhea—naturally, only to the point where his lover doesn't get jealous—and see if he could get some clues about what the Demon General is planning.
Attacking a venue near the Union Council headquarters would be quite a bold move, but considering they could take innocent students as their hostages, Austin knew he couldn't rely on the authorities for his own and Valerie's security.
'Need to keep my eyes and ears open all the time.'
…
After having a bath which continued longer than usual, Austin exited the bathroom and found Sheldon removing his tie.
He seemed tired as he didn't even notice Austin until he called out, "Hey, everything good?"
The silver head turned toward the blond Prince, before he nodded, "Yeah, more or less."
Austin knew that the boy was tired, but since he was curious about something, he didn't hold himself from asking, "What did you discuss during the meeting?'
Only Valerie and Sheldon were called by the President that's why Austin wanted to know what decisions were taken.
He surely would have heard about it from Valerie tomorrow, but he couldn't wait for that long.
Sheldon exhaled a sigh before informing him, "In the squad matches, there usually arrives a need for someone who can do the duty of guarding and defending. Rudolph was our best choice…and now him gone, we need to think of our other options."
They were confident that he would pass the first round that's why they didn't think of a second option…until now, that is.
Things have changed and the best option they have now is, "Either you or me. But I tell you, I am not good at guarding places."
Austin frowned, "What about Valerie. What's her position in the team?"
Sheldon raised his brows, "You don't know?"
Austin wryly smiled, "I never participated in raids with her and our conversation never led that way…well, forget about that and tell me."
"She is on the tactician. She supports both defense and offense."
Austin hummed. She has the ability to do both.
"What about the President, Elara, and Ryan?"
Sheldon bluntly said, "I am not too hopeful for the latter two."
Austin raised his brows, "Ryan was challenging even for Valerie, you know?"
"But do you think she would have struggled if she had gone all out from the get-go?"
Austin realized his mistake. They weren't here to show their strength but to dominate their opponent.
So there was a high chance that Ryan might never get the chance to use the ability of his Shard.
As for Elara...then she might be the weakest Elite from the Valorian, even though everyone considered Austin to be the weakest.
Sheldon got up, preparing to take a bath, as he said, "If things come between us, know that you would be participating."
Austin was taken aback as he saw the guy nonchalantly declaring his potential drop out from this tournament.
Seeing him casually entering the bathroom, Austin could only shake his head,
'I really can't understand this guy...'
°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading. Drop a review/comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 148 147- Missing
chapters.content:
Today was the fifth day of the tournament, and Elara was the person participating from the Valorian.
Naturally, the academy members couldn't remain stuck on the person who lost his battle yesterday.
However, Rhea couldn't get over it that easily.
She barely slept last night and if not for the rules prohibiting anyone from staying in the infirmary overnight unless they are injured, Rhea couldn't be with Rudolph last night.
However, early morning of the next day she came to the medical wing while carrying so cupcakes for Rudolph.
However, the moment she appeared before him, "Please leave me alone for the time being."
Her hand, which was inside the basket and was about to take out the cupcake, froze in place.
Rudolph was covering his eyes with his forearm as he added, "I don't want to talk right now."
Rhea opened her mouth to say something…so assure him that everything was fine and he would bounce back one day. However, nothing but a choked sob left her throat.
In the end, all she said was, "Sorry for disturbing you…" With that, she turned around and walked away.
Rudolph clenched his fist and bit his lip. He couldn't explain how he was feeling right now. Both because of the match and how he treated Rhea.
However, despite not wanting to hurt the love of his life, Rudolph couldn't bring himself to look at her right now.
…
"Ah!" Outside the infirmary, just as Rhea dashed out, she crashed into someone who was heading inside.
The other person held Rhea's arm to prevent her from falling, as he asked, "Are you okay?"
Rhea looked at him…he was the same person whom she met on the first day of the tournament.
"We meet again, Miss Rhea." He said with a friendly smile.
Rhea, although not wanting to talk at the moment, exchanged greetings politely, "Hello, Esner."
----------^^---------
"Here, it is for you." Early in the morning, as they walked in the back garden after breakfast, Austin suddenly presented her with a gift.
"Hmm?" Valerie's brows elevated as she saw the ring in his hand and a nearly identical one, he was wearing as well.
Austin explained to her, "Just like the ring we bought back in the market(when they went on a date), this ring is just a better version of it. It can help us locate each other's presence when we are in distress or any grave situation."
Austin gained the reward from the system last night upon his 'Romance' stats progression.
Valerie had a few questions about how he found the artifact of such a high grade, but right now, all she did was offer her hand to him—not to take the ring from him.
Austin blinked before he looked up at her.
The tinge of redness on her cheeks signified what she wanted.
Austin smiled fondly at the girl before taking her hand and inserting the ring on her fourth finger.
Once he did, he leaned forward and kissed the back of her hand, "It looks lovely on you."
Once he got up, Austin was startled to see tears in her eyes.
"Val?" He asked as he brought her closer and cupped her cheeks.
Valerie shook her head, "It's…nothing."
"No, please tell me." He insisted. He knew that it wasn't the tears of elation but sadness.
Valerie didn't resist him from wiping her tears as she honestly told him the reason for her sudden outburst, "Actually, I was reminded of the day when we exchanged rings during our engagement ceremony. You…didn't care about the fact that the ring was of smaller size and just inserted it somehow."
Valerie didn't want to say it, but she ended up confessing, "That….showed how annoyed you were of the engagement and me…and that….really hurt me."
Austin embraced his lover close to him, encircling his hand around her back.
His heart trembled upon hearing her words.
He also remembers the day. He remembers every detail.
He really was angry with everyone around him at that time and he only thought Valerie was pitying him by getting engaged to him.
He was so blinded by hatred that he never noticed how genuinely happy she was that day. The same girl who barely showed her emotions in front of others was smiling all the time when she arrived at the royal palace that day…only for her smile to disappear when Austin showed his clear reluctance to their relationship.
Austin couldn't relay how regretful he was of his action and how much he wanted to go back in the past to redo everything.
Rather than crying like this, Austin wanted her to smile while thinking about those moments.
"Val…I really can't say sorry and expect you to forget about it. However, I can promise you something for certain… not even once you will experience something like that again. I swear on my life."
His old self has left several wounds on this girl. All she ever wanted was to get some love and attention, and in exchange, she was ready to give everything to him: her love, her life, her devotion…everything.
Although Austin could never rewrite the past, he vowed that from now on, every moment would be a gentle touch upon her heart—no more wounds, only things that could heal her and fill her future with beautiful memories.
It took some time but Valerie calmed down as she looked up at him.
Austin gazed at her red eyes and innocent expression. There was slight guilt in her eyes that made him sigh,
"Thanks for letting me know what was hurting you. Just as I told you before, I am not just your partner in happiness. I want to know and experience all your grief as well. So just like today, never hold back from telling me if something is troubling you, okay?"
Valerie shyly nodded, "Oka-"
"Really, it's such a hassle." She was interrupted as she and Austin heard several people advancing in their direction.
They were in the back garden where generally no one wanders—considering most of the students were focused on either matches or training.
And the surprising part was that the people who passed by were council staff.
Seeing a bunch of them moving about, Austin stepped away from Valerie and approached one of them before asking, "Excuse me, sir, what happened?"
The staff member turned toward him, before telling him, "You should be in your rooms right now. We informed every student to not roam around."
Valerie added, "We have been out of our rooms since dawn so we never received any message. What happened?" It was surprising to see her switching her mood so instantly, but thanks to her cold tone, the staff member didn't ask anything further and informed them,
"One of the management chiefs cannot be located. He has been missing for two days."
Austin's brows knitted close as he muttered under his breath,
'Are the Demons already here?'
-------^-------
A/N:- Thanks for reading. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 149 148- Best defender
chapters.content:
The following three days were eventful.
Austin kept visiting the dungeon and slowly, he cleared the mobs of the second dungeon. And now, only the final boss was left. But right now, Austin wasn't prepared to face the creature.
A thirty-foot-tall Orc Lord. Nah, not something he can win against as of now. For that, he needed some points so he could purchase a specific weapon for the Shop, which would help him win against the monster.
[Name: Ashen Maul]
[Rank: B]
[Points: 1200]
...
He currently has around fifteen hundred points, so he was thinking of using those points to purchase the weapon and some potions.
The final Boss would grant him two thousand points, so there was no problem. He would be able to unlock the next dungeon easily.
He was having a good time in the dungeon these days. He has gotten a good handle on his three weapons, and he has used some points to decrease the cooldown time for a few skills which he often uses.
Now, coming back to the tournament, as Sheldon predicted, Elara and Ryan lost their round. Surprisingly, Ryan lost more brutally than Elara. The boy was never given the chance to launch an attack.
Well, that was to be expected since he was facing the Captain of the Ravencourt Academy.
About the President, then she seamlessly won her match. Although not like Valerie, she did overwhelm her opponent with her grace and her Shard.
Now, all the matches have concluded, and every academy has gotten their semi-finalist.
Austin had a copy of the roster, which stated,
1. Ravencourt— 600pts
2. Auroracrest—500pts
3. Runebridge—Drenovar—500pts
4. Avalon—Hener—400pts
5. Ironvale—300pts
6. Stellthorne—100pts
7. Valorian—500
8. Grimhold—hybrid nations—300pts
...
Valorian Academy has brought some of the remarkable students this year since having five out of eight students win their individual matches was no small feat.
Everywhere, they were whispering about how the presence of an S-rank had brought this change or whatnot. They believed that Valerie was training them or something along those lines, that resulted in such favorable results.
Naturally, no one tried to clear the misunderstanding since it was utterly pointless.
Now, the group of five was gathered in the Command Tent to discuss their matches.
"Did you not call them?" Austin asked the President with his brows elevated
The President exhaled a sigh, "I...called them, but..."
Although they lost their matches, Anabelle believed that they held experience that could have helped them form a strategy.
However, they didn't come—or so what did they think,
"I am late, sorry."
Every eye turned toward the person who entered the tent with hurried steps and took his seat beside Sheldon.
Annabelle smiled at him, "Thanks for coming."
Ryan nodded. Sure he was bitter about his match, but not like he would sulk like a loser in his room when he could help his team win.
Rhea released an audible breath as she said, "It's highly unlikely Rudolph would come. I tried calling him...but." although Rudolph was no longer ignoring her, he still was quite disturbed about what happened.
And he clearly told Rhea that he wouldn't be joining the meeting.
"Elara seemed grumpy...well, she always remains like that, so there is no point in waiting for her." The pink head further added.
Annabelle nodded before she finally went towards the whiteboard and wrote something.
Everyone looked at the board and read,
[Current points: 500]
[Next match: 500]
[Duo matches: 200 each]
Turning toward them, she said, "While assuming that we would win the second round, and assumably won't face Ravencourt, then we would get the option to defeat them in the duo matches."
Unlike Valorian or any other school, Ravencourt could put three duos during the third stage, if only they win the next round as a squad.
No, even if they lose the next match, they would get a duo to participate in the third round.
"Did they send the match details?" Ryan asked.
This year, things are being kept quite secretively for some reasons. That's why, it was getting tough to prepare.
Annabelle shook her head, "Nope. That's why we are going to assume that the match would be of the same concept—hunt and defend."
They have been following the same contest style for many years, and just because they changed the pattern doesn't mean they would create a new type of contest from scratch.
Austin added here, "You mean to say, one to defend, one to support, and two who raid?" Although he never participated in any kind of squad exercises, he knew these details.
Annabelle nodded, "That's right," Saying so, she wrote the aforementioned roles on the board.
"I have seen Rhea fighting, and I can tell that she would be a great raider with her dual Shard, which allows her both close-quarter and long-range battles. So along with me, she could be an ambusher."
Annabelle's decision to put herself as the ambusher wasn't questioned since everyone was aware of her abilities. And even if someone might have any doubts in their mind, her recent match proved that she is the perfect choice for their team's forerunner.
Coming to the tactician post, she just wrote Valerie's name, and no one even bothered to ask for any explanation.
Austin smiled as he glanced at his lover and found her looking back at him with slight smugness as if to say, 'Praise me'.
Austin decided to pet the girl a lot when they would be alone.
Anabelle wrote the last role and tapped the marker pen thrice under the name to show her contemplation.
Turning towards others, she was about to say something when suddenly Sheldon voiced, "I forfeit. I know I won't be able to perform well as the defender. I took part as a tactician but since there is only one team performing, I should just rest and see you guys win."
Sheldon was good as a supporter with his skills. But defending solely would be quite difficult for him.
That statement from him made Ryan frown as he said, "Nothing against Austin, but shouldn't you think a little before making such s decision, Ryan? I mean, we are talking about our chances to remain alive in this tournament, so you shouldn't just pull away like that."
Ryan wasn't against Austin participating in the tournament. He just wanted the best player to be in the team, and if Sheldon could be that, then he should have some confidence in himself and take part in the second round.
Valerie also didn't say anything since her interjection here would have hurt her Lord's pride. She wanted him to enter into the second round with his abilities.
Annabelle hummed in response, "He is right, Shelly-Sheldon." She corrected herself just in time, before hurriedly adding, "We need to discern who could be the best option as our defender."
Sheldon sighed, "And how can we ascertain that?"
"Simple. Through a battle." Rhea muttered, and before anyone could tell her that the situation was different, she added, "We can modify the battle in a way that could test their defending skills."
Anabelle nodded, "That's a good idea...and I know just the best way to test them." Slamming her hand on the table, she said, "Okay then, let's meet in the training hall, in two hours."
By that time, most of the students would have returned to their rooms, so they would get enough room for the examination.
No one showed reluctance. As such, the meeting was adjourned.
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading. Well, I hope you don't mind the time skip, since I didn't want to bore people with the grind.

chapters.title: Chapter 150 149- Discharged
chapters.content:
While others went to prepare for the examination between Sheldon and Austin, the blond prince was currently heading toward the infirmary to meet his friend.
"Listen, whatever happens, don't mention anything about the match to Rudolph. He has barely gotten over that day, so please don't remind him of it, okay?" Those words were spoken by Rhea when she heard that Austin was going to visit Rudolph.
Austin agreed to her. It must be a nightmare for Rudolph to lose at this stage. Austin knows how much he was training for this tournament. While Austin refrained from participating in group raids, knowing he would have slowed down any group, Rudolph never shied away from life threatening dangers and constantly led his team to victory.
He was one of the academy's top students, the one everyone placed their bets on. After Valerie, Rudolph had the highest win percentage, making him the most promising contender.
Heaving a sigh, Austin entered the infirmary, and instantly a frown contoured his face as he noticed a certain person standing before Rudolph's bed.
"Oh, hey, Austin."
It was Monica.
Austin didn't say anything and gave a nod to the girl before turning toward his friend, "How are you now?"
Rudolph's bandages have been undone and overall, the boy seemed fine. And as he thought,
"I am good. They are discharging me today." Rudolph was seriously exasperated because of their persistent behavior. Even though he said that he was fine, they insisted on keeping him.
Monica took the hint that the two wanted to have some alone time so she bid her farewell, "Okay then, Rudolph, see you later." With that, she made her way out of the casualty care.
Once she was out, Austin asked, "Why was she here?" Austin could regard it as nothing else than rubbing salt on one's wound when one's enemy—who has defeated you—comes to see you in the infirmary.
Rudolph shook his head, as if to dispel his concerns, as he said, "She came to meet her teammate in the infirmary, and when she saw me she just stopped by to ask about my health."
Austin hummed as he picked the clipboard from the head of the bed before asking, "What did the doctor say about your condition?"
Rudolph heaved a sigh, "Toxin in my blood. Those suckers were having a hard time removing something our school medics would have taken out within hours."
Austin nodded slowly as he read the report.
His eyes grew darker as he read how deeply the toxin had spread which made him slightly suspicious.
'He was brought to the medic right after the match, so why did the venom spread so deeply?'
Removing his eyes from the file, Austin asked, "Man up and tell me something,"
Rudolph raised his brows in surprise as he heard his friend asking, "Did you meet someone before your match? Like anyone whom you don't know or don't trust?"
Rudolph sighed and was about to say that it doesn't matter anymore, only for Austin to interject, "Just shut up and think. This is important."
Being reprimanded, the big guy was forced to think about whom he met before the match.
In the morning, he only met Rhea, whom he trusted blindly, and didn't come across any unknown face.
'As long as I remember…wait!' His eyes suddenly stretched as he said, "Actually, I met Monica a day before the match."
Austin grimly asked, "And did she hit you or touched you anywhere?"
Rudolph didn't take time to respond, "Yeah, she pointed out a wound on my shoulder by touching it."
"Knew it!" Austin growled.
He knew something was wrong with this whole farce. Rudolph hesitating to hit a girl just because she is beautiful? Yeah, nothing could be more unbelievable than that.
Rudolph also felt a sense of suspicion in his heart, but, "But she couldn't have anticipated whom she would be facing a day before, right? After all, we don't get to know about our opponent until we step on the stage."
Austin nodded, "Yes, that's true, which can only mean two things; first, she went and targeted all the seven potential candidates who were participating on the same day as her." It was not difficult to know who the seven members were. The Council releases the list for everyone so they can prepare for their potential opponent. It's just that Monica seemed to have taken 'preparation' to a whole different level.
Rudolph groaned; he actually never paid attention to the list or he would have been a little more cautious toward his potential opponent.
Austin added the second possibility, only after he drew nearer to Rudolph and ensured that no one was eavesdropping, "Maybe she got to know about her opponent from one of the officials and came to target you right away."
Rudolph's expression was forbidding as he muttered, "It felt like a crime hitting her…almost like I would be committing the hideous crime if she got hurt." Looking up, Rudolph added, "You know me, Austin, I am not like that. I don't show partiality between men and women, especially not on this stage."
With his fists clenched, he spoke in a heavy tone, "The only reason I never talked about it was because I knew anyone would have thought that I was just making excuses. But only I know what I felt when I was in the arena. I wasn't in control."
Austin patted his friend on his shoulder, "I understand you, bud. And trust me, Rhea also doesn't believe in what others are assuming."
Rudolph smiled, the cloud of anger and depression vanishing as he said, "I know. Thanks for trusting me."
Rudolph and Austin both knew that there was no point in continuing the conversation about Monica since they had no evidence. If only Rudolph had been tested by better doctors, they would have known that the toxin was injected way before the match. Blaming the authorities was like bashing your head against a wall. Totally pointless, and potentially self-harming.
"Anyway, are you going to have dinner?" Rudolph asked. Since he was out of the tournament, he would empty the buffet tonight before heading back to his room.
Austin shook his head, "Nope, I got a trial to pass." Seeing Rudolph's brows elevating in question, Austin added, "Examination to prove that I am a trustworthy defender for the team."
Rudolph grinned, "That's so, then I will come too."
--------^^-------
Everyone had already gathered in the indoor gymnasium when Austin and Rudolph arrived.
A smile bloomed on Rhea's face, seeing the big guy beside Austin.
She skipped her way toward them before saying, "Congrats on your discharge."
Rudolph gave a short nod before asking her, "Did you have dinner? I brought something for you."
Rhea's smile only extended seeing him in his usual mood as she smilingly accepted the muffin.
Austin also approached his beloved and handed her some orange juice and a sandwich.
"Thank you…I needed this." Valerie sweetly smiled at him as she bit into the sandwich.
Soon Annabelle and the other two arrived near them and said, "So, shall we begin?"
--------^^-------
A/N:- Thanks for reading. If you have been enjoying the story so far, leave a review to help others.

chapters.title: Chapter 151 150- Test(1)
chapters.content:
To determine the best candidate for the team's defender, a specialized training exercise was set up.
The defender would stand before a humanoid-shaped training dummy, firmly attached to a vertical pole. This dummy had a unique feature—it would change color based on the force and number of hits it received, turning a deeper shade of red with each impact.
Four raiders—Annabelle, Rhea, Ryan, and Rudolph (who volunteered)—would take turns attacking the target using different techniques. A raider could strike multiple times, testing the defender's ability to withstand continuous assault.
The challenge had a strict two-minute time limit—just enough time to simulate how long a defender needed to hold out until the team's tactician arrived. Once the trial ended, the dummy's final color would reveal the outcome: the defender whose dummy showed the most damage would be benched.
Valerie wasn't taking part in this exercise since she didn't need to. Currently, the girl and her lover were standing at one side, and seeing Sheldon getting prepared for the round.
He was wearing armor identical to what they would be wearing during the second stage.
Rudolph and the other three and taken different positions—Ryan was not even visible and seemed to have prepared a surprised attack.
"Nervous?" Valerie asked in a hushed tone as they stood with their shoulders touching.
The blond one shook his head slightly, "Not as much as I was during the first round…maybe because I am now allowed to use all the cards I possess?"
Hearing those words, her expression turned solemn a little as she asked, "Austin…do you trust that woman?" For him to show such comfort in showing his other skills, meant that he trusted her words about sending a notice to the Council.
"Not really, however, it is a fact that without using my other abilities and Raijin, I won't be able to give my best during the tournament."
Since those secrets wouldn't remain hidden for long, and Austin knew that while holding back he wouldn't be able to help his team, why not use the stage of the Tournament to announce that he has skills other than his Shard?
Valerie had a troubled look and Austin could understand what she must be feeling.
This world was cruel, and the council heads were freaks who could go beyond normal means to possess something they deemed as an asset for the upcoming war.
That's why, Austin needs to be prepared for any kind of backlash.
"Begin!"
The air tensed as Annabelle's voice echoed across the arena.
Rhea exploded forward, covering the distance between her and Sheldon in three powerful leaps. Her pink hair trailed behind her, and her sword gleamed under the light.
Sheldon's silver eyes remained sharp, his curved dagger held in a tight reverse grip. As Rhea feinted left, trying to slip past his guard, Ryan's leg suddenly shot out.
"Ahhh!"
Rhea gasped as her balance was stolen from her, stumbling forward. But before she could crash into the training doll, a strong hand caught her collar.
"Not so clever, girl."
Sheldon smirked before yanking her back and tossing her onto the floor.
Rhea clicked her tongue and rolled away, pushing herself up just as Sheldon leaped back—
BOOOOOOM!
The entire training hall shook as Rudolph's massive frame slammed down where Sheldon had just been standing. Dust and debris shot into the air.
"Shit!"
