Sheldon cursed. He had dodged on instinct, but now Rudolph's battle hammer was raised—aiming straight for the training doll.
With a sharp flick of his wrist, Sheldon's dagger traced a crescent arc. Instantly, a clone materialized in front of him and dashed toward the target without hesitation.
"HUPP!"
Rudolph roared as he swung his colossal weapon down. The sheer force sent a gust of wind rippling outward.
At the last moment, Sheldon's clone threw itself between the hammer and the training doll.
CRAAAAACK!
The clone shattered into nothingness, absorbing the full force of the attack. But the doll? Untouched.
"Tch." Rudolph scowled as his weapon rebounded, unable to even scratch the target.
Ryan wasted no time. He was already behind the big guy.
WHAM!
A sharp kick slammed into the back of Rudolph's knee, making him drop slightly. Before he could recover—
DHAK!
Ryan's fist crashed into Rudolph's face with all the force he could muster.
Yet—
Rudolph didn't even blink. His head didn't budge an inch.
Ryan's eyes widened. His knuckles stung, but it was as if he had punched a damn boulder.
A slow grin stretched across Rudolph's face as a shadow flickered behind Sheldon.
The silver-haired fighter barely had time to react. His instincts screamed at him—he ducked. But—
"Wrong move, Shelly~" A playful, honeyed voice teased.
Annabelle didn't lunge in for close combat. Instead, she unleashed her power. A surge of lightning crackled from her Shard, arcs of blue-white energy lashing out. The air sizzled. Sparks danced along Sheldon's back as a violent shock tore through him.
Seizing the opening, Rhea flipped her Shards in a fluid motion. A sleek crossbow formed in her hands, humming with power. She wasted no time—her fingers pulled the trigger. A streak of glowing energy shot forward, an arrow forged from her very soul, whistling through the air toward the training doll.
The victory was within reach.
Then—
The figure struck by lightning didn't stumble. It didn't fall. It shattered.
With a sound like crumbling ash, the body disintegrated into dust, vanishing before their eyes.
And in the next instant—
Snap.
The advancing arrow never found its mark. A hand—Sheldon's hand—clamped down on it from behind the doll. His silver hair shimmered under the training ground's lights as he stood there, untouched.
His fingers tightened.
CRUNCH.
The arrow broke like brittle glass, fragments scattering at his feet. And before him, the training doll remained pristine—completely unscathed.
Everyone in the training hall was struck silent after seeing the Vice-president of the student council using his strength, his Shard, and his wits to win the found.
"That...was excellent." Austin couldn't help but mutter under his breath. Neither he nor anyone else spotted Sheldon placing one of his clones before the training doll as if it were his real body.
Just as everyone, including Sheldon, thought that the match was over,
**SHLINK**
Several slashes were delivered to the training doll, leaving several dark marks on it.
Sheldon's eyes widened as he looked at the person—only to get startled upon seeing the person hanging down a rope, attached to the ceiling.
Ryan.
With a grin, Ryan dropped to the ground as he said, "You forgot about me, no?"
Sheldon rested his hands on his waist as he said, "Completely. Damn...since when you were there?"
Ryan told him, "Just when you were distracted by Rudolph, I got the time."
Ryan had the plan to ambush him after everyone tried their best. If they had inflicted damage to the doll, he would have refrained. But it seems, it was a good idea to wait until the end.
Austin and others drew closer to the guy, before the Council President said, "You made a severe mistake, Sheldon. A defender doesn't engage in battle, rather, they just try to keep their enemy away from the target. You became too busy with Rudolph to notice me and Ryan."
Sheldon sighed in exasperation, "Have you seen him? He landed like a golem and was radiating such an intense blood lust that I couldn't help myself."
Rudolph grinned, "Thanks for the compliment."
Sheldon rolled his eyes before he turned towards Annabelle and said, "I told you that I am not good with defense."
Rhea voiced, "But you successfully blocked three of us, even though there would be only two raiders during the battle. So we can't call this a complete failure."
Everyone, including Austin, agreed to her words, as the blond Prince said, "You really utilized your Shard's ability in the best possible way. And I think, if you get more time to plan things, you could have performed better."
Sheldon rubbed the back of his head as he said, "Praising your rival...are you forfeiting now or something?"
Austin grinned, "That is impossible. I am going to give the examination."
Sheldon shrugged, "Well, best of luck then."
Soon everyone dispersed. Austin was taking his position before the training doll, and unexpectedly, this time, Rhea was absent from plain sight.
He tried looking around but couldn't find the pink head at all—however, Ryan was with others, so that was a relief.
'Not depending on the same strategy, eh?' Austin cracked his fingers and did some light stretching.
Based on his performance now, his life in the tournament would be decided.
It would be a lie to say that he wasn't nervous. However, if he surrenders before this kind of difficulty, then he should rather hide from the dangers that are about to appear.
"Austin, ready?" Annabelle asked as she seemed prepared to lunge at him.
The blond one nodded, before she declared, "BEGIN!"
°°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 152 151- Test(2)
chapters.content:
Valerie doesn't pray generally. However, at the moment, she was praying for her Lord's success.
It wasn't that she didn't believe in his abilities; rather, sometimes bad luck also changes the end result. And she really didn't want her beloved to lose because of bad luck.
He has been tormented and badmouthed for all his life. She has seen him go through all that with a bold front. He fought back and tried to change himself. All because he never wanted to settle with the tag of a loser.
And now, he has the chance to show the world that he has changed. That all his hard work has finally paid off. She wanted the world to witness his glorious moment. And for that, he has to win this test.
'Come on, Austin, you can do it.'
...
"Begin!" The voice of the Council President roared before Austin saw a familiar war hammer advancing toward him in a horizontal path.
He was standing right before the training doll, and at that pace, blocking the Shard was nearly impossible, unless he was prepared to allow some damage to be dealt to the doll.
Everyone watched with a frown, as Austin didn't move from his spot; rather, he seemed too relaxed for someone about to be hit by such a heavy weapon.
However, before the hammer could have struck him,
**BOOOOOM**
Something came rushing from the sky and intercepted the Shard—carving it into the ground
"Agh...that hurts." Rudolph winced as he saw his Shard plummeted into the ground by the huge boomerang, Austin always carries.
"When did he throw that away..." Ryan muttered, but Annabelle wasn't in the mood to praise her junior.
Wielding her golden staff, she jumped in the air and directed a torrent of electricity toward Austin.
Austin grinned, as he summoned Raijin and just thrust it forward.
"What the..." Rudolph exclaimed, and Annabelle's eyes widened as she saw the axe materializing into his hand and absorbing the electricity as if Anna were fueling it.
Landing on the ground, she pushed forward, increasing the thunder as the surroundings were illuminated with her attack.
That much lightning would have killed a non-awakened and would surely have put a low-ranking warrior into hospital.
Annabelle believed that there must be a limit to how much he could absorb...but,
"Endless pit..." She muttered, in disbelief and slight irritation.
"Don't lose hope yet!" Ryan shouted as he lunged toward Austin with his dagger(he wasn't using his Shard).
Austin also summoned his dagger, having Raijin's work done, before he intercepted Ryan's attempt to reach the training doll.
*CLANG*
Their blades met in a flurry of attacks.
Ryan gritted his teeth and pressed forward, his dagger flashing as he unleashed a series of rapid strikes. But Austin was faster. His dagger split into two in an instant, and he met every strike with a precise counter.
Clang! Clang! Clang!
Ryan slashed, and Austin parried. Ryan lunged, and Austin sidestepped.
Then, with a sharp flick of his wrist, Austin's left dagger hooked around Ryan's blade, yanking it off course. In the same motion, his right dagger shot forward, forcing Ryan back.
Ryan barely avoided a cut to his side. He spun, trying to regain control, but Austin didn't let up. His daggers blurred as he attacked from both sides, forcing Ryan to retreat step by step.
Ryan was ready to summon his Shard, and was about to continue the battle—however, Austin never advanced towards him and held his position.
Ryan realized that the boy gave priority to his duty as a defender, and successfully drew his opponent away.
"HAAAAAA!" Rudolph roared as he jumped in the air, trying to intimidate Austin just like he did with Sheldon.
However, before he could have landed, Austin summoned his Axe again and launched thunder towards the falling figure.
"Aghhh!" Rudolph winced as he lost his momentum and began to fall down a straight path.
The lightning was not hurting much, but he was completely blinded, and it felt like several mosquitoes were sucking his blood at once.
*WOOSH*
Austin twisted his body, dodging the staff by a hair's breadth.
Before Annabelle could pull back, his hand snapped around her wrist like a steel trap, while his other hand seized the back of her collar.
Her breath hitched. "Wha——"
She didn't even get to finish.
With sheer force, Austin ripped her off her feet, his leg sweeping under hers before he slammed her straight into the ground—face-first.
Even Valerie winced from the side...that was brutal.
Austin instantly let go and looked around—ready to intercept any attack that they might be planning.
Austin's fingers uncurled from his daggers, his sharp gaze sweeping the area, ready for anything.
But the fight was already over. The three raiders lay on the ground, unmoving. None of them so much as twitched.
His stance loosened for a fraction of a second—until a cold realization slammed into him.
Three?
His heart lurched.
SWISH!
A pink energy arrow streaked through the air.
Austin barely had time to turn his head. His pupils shrank as he caught sight of it—a glowing blur cutting toward the training doll from the right.
Close. Too close.
His heartbeat pounded in his ears.
No one moved. No one breathed.
Rhea had fired from nearly point-blank range. Even Valerie wouldn't have made it in time.
And Austin?
He couldn't move.
The arrow was already there.
It was over.
But then—
TING!
The sharp sound rang through the silence.
Everyone flinched.
Rhea's lips parted in shock. "…Huh?"
The pink glow vanished, deflected mid-air.
A greenish shimmer spread around the training doll—a barrier.
The doll stood untouched. Safe.
The battle wasn't over.
Austin had still won.
"Times up!" Valerie shouted, uncharacteristic of her.
However, no one moved, nor did they speak. Their eyes were still focused on the barrier that appeared on the training doll and disappeared in the next instance.
It was a funny sight to see Annabelle lying on the ground and looking at the doll with an upturned gaze.
Austin helped her get up first, before he asked them, "Shall we talk in the Command Camp?"
Annabelle opened her small mouth, but then she closed it and nodded.
Valerie had a face full of smiles as she hugged his arm and whispered, "You did well."
Austin smiled at her as he wordlessly led her to the Command Camp with others behind them.
Once inside, Austin first made everyone sit down before he began, "I know you all have questions, but I cannot answer them all. Just know that I didn't use any artifact to summon that barrier or any other underhanded method. So I won't be breaking any rules."
"No, no, tell me something first..." Rhea got up from her seat, and asked in a low tone, "Did you re-awakened?"
Austin shared a glance with Valerie before he answered, "I-In a way, yes."
Rhea fell down on her seat, and her eyes widened.
After that, a series of questions followed.
°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- I hope you all liked the chapter. Drop a comment? Pleaaaase?

chapters.title: Chapter 153 152- A little too much?
chapters.content:
After he explained things to everyone and was finally declared to be the defender of the team, Austin and Valerie were allowed to return to their rooms.
Naturally, the others returned too since they have to train tomorrow with the squad so they need to recover their bodies.
While they walked with their hands connected, Austin heard his lover muttering, "I can't express how happy I am right now…it feels like we have won the tournament already."
Austin chuckled, "So confident…we need to go through two more rounds, you know."
Valerie hugged his arm, her body warmth vivid to him, as she said, "It doesn't matter…I felt victorious today seeing you pass the test."
The current Valerie was full of happiness. She was actually humming with joy and swaying his arm unintentionally which showed that the parameters of her happiness were broken.
'So many achievements my past self had…but nothing more than a congratulatory message I received…and here…' Call him an emotional fool, but right now, Austin was touched by her current behavior.
Soon, they reached before the dorm wing.
Although Valerie longed to cuddle with him and share a few words meant only for her Lord, she couldn't break the rules by entering his room. Besides, Sheldon was likely already there, and in her own room, the President awaited. There was simply no option.
Upon seeing the longing look in her eyes, Austin glanced around before pulling Valerie behind a tree.
The girl was taken by surprise upon finding herself being pressed against the tree. Her Lord's big frame completely covered any passerby's gaze.
She appeared smaller, trapped in his arms, as Austin looked down at her with his eyes darkened.
"Didn't receive any reward for winning my first round nor for getting my spot in the squad. Is my lady becoming unfair slowly?"
Valerie blushed, "Y-You demanded something unexpected…"
Austin grinned, as he brought his hand to her flat belly and said, "Although I would love to make this plump a little, for now, I would satisfy myself by just this…"
His words faded into the background as her mind fixated on the warmth pressing against her lips.
This wasn't her first kiss, yet she still hadn't grown used to the sensation. That would explain why her fingers curled tightly into his shirt, why her breath hitched as his lips moved against hers—gentle at first, then more insistent.
A shiver ran down her spine when his hand slid up her back, pulling her closer until not even air could slip between them. His other hand traced the curve of her jaw, his thumb brushing her cheek before tilting her chin up, deepening the kiss. Heat pooled in her chest as his tongue teased against her lips, coaxing her to part them.
She yielded, a soft sigh escaping her as their tongues met, the slow, intoxicating rhythm stealing what little remained of her restraint. Her knees weakened, and if not for his firm grip, she might have melted right into him.
Their tongues moved in perfect sync, a heated dance despite her shy hesitation. Austin was completely lost in her sweet, addictive taste of her, unable to get enough.
He loved her—so damn much. And it showed in the way he held her, his grip firm, almost desperate as if he never wanted to let go.
When their lips finally parted, Austin barely had a moment to catch his breath before instinct took over. Without thinking, he pressed a lingering kiss to her chin, then another just below it. Slowly, he trailed down, his lips brushing over the delicate skin of her neck, drawing a quiet gasp from her.
His hands roamed her back, pulling her impossibly closer as his lips continued their descent. When he reached her pristine collarbone, he lingered, then bit down ever so gently before soothing the spot with another kiss. A faint, possessive mark bloomed on her skin, claiming her in a way words never could.
"Austin…" She suddenly uttered his name, and that was like a cold bucket of water as Austin suddenly parted his eyes and realized what he was doing.
He instantly backed away, not releasing her but surely loosening his grip as he apologized, "I-I am sorry…I just-"
"No, it's okay. I don't mind, really. It's just I heard some people coming this way." Valerie could never reject her Lord's advances. She has already devoted her mind, body, and soul to him. But if he had gone any further, she knew she wouldn't have been able to hold her voice and let everyone know what was happening here.
Austin felt extremely guilty. He really lost his control because of her reactions and how soft he felt in his arms.
Lowering his head, he said, "I am sorry…and thank you for stopping me." Holding her hand he resumed their walk as he said, "Does it hurt?" He asked while glancing at the slight reddish mark on her neck.
Valerie sweetly smiled, "No, it's okay."
Austin helplessly asked, "Do you hate this possessive me?"
Valerie shook her head, "I absolutely love and welcome it. After all, you aren't the only one."
Austin felt a little better upon hearing her words as they reached the partition where they needed to go their separate ways.
Kissing her forehead delicately, he voiced, "Good night, love. See you tomorrow."
A smiling Valerie hummed before she reluctantly released his hand and walked toward her room.
'His warmth…it's still here…' Touching the slight bruising on her skin, her smile only widened.
It was a day full of sweetness~
*CLICK*
Entering her room she found the President taking things out of her bag as she said, "Hello."
"Hey," Valerie responded shortly as she thought of advancing toward the bathroom since she urgently…needed to change her clothes.
But then Annabelle turned toward her and her eyes landed on the mark on her neck as she asked, "What is that mark? Did the mosquito bite you?"
Valerie's face turned hot a little but she controlled her emotions and nodded. Naturally, she wasn't a shameless woman to flaunt her relationship goals to someone else.
Taking her clothes, she was about to enter the bathroom—thinking that she fooled the President, when suddenly,
"Calling your lover a mosquito, is not very sweet of you, my precious junior~~"
Valerie flinched, but she didn't stop and entered the bathroom before closing the door with a strong thud.
Annabelle laughed heartily seeing the ever-stoic girl being so shy.
-----^^-----
A/N:- I hope you all enjoyed reading the chapter. If I write R-18 it would be like the kissing scene. Hot, steamy but not full-on smutty.
Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 154 153- A mother's guilt
chapters.content:
Things have been quite peaceful in Eryndor for some time now.
Since the day the First Prince's secret was exposed and a truce was established with Drenovar, Cedric had somehow found peace. Even with several upper council seats left vacant after the minister's involvement in Aiden's dark plans was revealed, Cedric felt no sense of panic.
He just knew that everything would be reorganized sooner or later.
Maybe because he knew that their biggest enemy was no longer wary of them? Or maybe because they have gotten rid of the pests that were corroding the nation from within?
No, it's not just that. The reason why Cedric seemed so relaxed these days was because he knew that even if he passed away today, there would be a responsible ruler who would take care of the throne.
Yes, Austin has taken an oath that he would never accept the throne, but he knows his son. If the situation becomes dire and the nation seems to be falling under the shades of danger, Austin would respond to the situation better than Cedric.
Call it a father's partial judgment, but he just knows it.
"You seem to be smiling a lot recently, my lord." Sebastian, who brought tea for him, asked with a faint smile on his face.
Cedric gave a slight chuckle as he said, "Was thinking about my son."
If there was a smile on his face—a proud one at that—then Sebastian doesn't need to ask which son was on his mind.
As Sebastian rested the tray on the table, he heard the Supreme Authority saying, "Tell me, Sebas…you have been close to the boy ever since he left for the academy. What changed him so suddenly…like, the Austin I see now is like a more mature and sensible person compared to before."
Sebastian warmly responded, "You should thank Lady Valerie for that…she helped him realize that this world is not only filled with hateful people. She helped him grow over his suffering phase and allowed the young master to become the man he is now. Naturally, it was the young master's own effort as well since he wanted to become a reliable and strong man on whom the lady could depend."
Cedric hummed, "You're right. Even when his parents turned their backs on him, that girl never left his side and kept trying."
He was about to say something further, but then someone knocked on the door, garnering the two men's attention.
"Your Majesty, the dinner." It was a maid who held the tray of food in her hands.
Cedric got up from his seat before Sebastian picked up the emptied cup.
No one said anything as the King picked up the tray and carried it toward his room.
A royalty doing such a job is generally unheard of. However, no one could come between a husband and wife so none of the servants even tried.
*CLICK*
Cedric opened the door and walked inside the room.
As always, the room was dark since his wife didn't like sunlight these days.
She mostly remains in the room and barely responds to anyone except for him.
It was the etiquette ingrained in her since childhood that even in this condition she couldn't bring herself to disrespect her Lord by not responding to him.
Her behavior was strange when she was under the control of that evil being, but Cedric has already forgiven his wife for that.
"Did you have good sleep?" He asked as he proceeded inside the room and rested the food tray on the tea table.
Sophie hummed as she asked, "Why did you bring it yourself? Could have told someone else..."
"And had you skipped another meal? No, dear, that's not something I can allow anymore." Cedric said as he pulled the chair for his wife and ushered her to sit down.
Sophie's eyes were drawn downwards as she muttered, "I try my best to eat the meals...but you know..."
"Yes, I know. And I am not forcing you to recover soon. Take your time." With a warm smile, he added, "However, don't expect me to not take care of you."
Sophie might be the only lady in the world, who, despite crossing her boundaries as a wife and a Queen, was still forgiven and was still loved by her husband, all the same.
On one hand, she knew that she should appreciate it and try to get out of this phase and face reality so she wouldn't trouble her husband anymore.
...however, whenever her mind went back to that incident at the royal court, and all the instances she spent with Aiden...she felt herself getting caged in guilt and sorrow.
Cedric scooped some rice dipped in curry—his wife's favorite—before bringing it near her lips.
Sophie slowly parted her lips and took a bite.
While she chewed slowly, she heard her husband's voice, "I got the news today that Austin had got a position in the squad by defeating Duke Runebound's scion. He will be participating with a team and will face the Elites from a different academy."
There was unhidden pride and elation in the man's voice as if he was flaunting his own achievements.
Sophie's heart ached to hear the news, as she heard him continuing.
Cedric drew closer to the woman, and asked her, "Parents are allowed to come to witness their children participate in the group matches."
For a moment, when she heard that, a faint smile appeared on her lips
Watching Austin perform before everyone...getting praised and cheered by others.
However, soon her smile disappeared and moisture appeared in her eyes
Shaking her head, she muttered, "I can't...I shouldn't. I don't deserve to be called his mother w-when...I have neglected him all his life. I have no right to be a part of his happiness when I wasn't there for him when he was suffering."
She...cannot run away from reality anymore.
Despite how much a part of her mind continued to take Aiden's side, Sophie had long realized that Aiden was not her son but someone who came to take revenge on them. A person who sought destruction and never considered her as his mother.
She had long realized that, in her efforts to provide Aiden with the familial warmth he lacked, she had neglected Austin.
However, realizing her mistake didn't grant her forgiveness. In the first place, she didn't dare to seek forgiveness since she knew that even if Austin forgave her—which he might do considering he was nothing like his mother—their relationship would never get back to how it was before Aiden's arrival.
"Dear," Cedric gently held his wife's hand, before he said, "Our wounds will always sting unless we do something about it. Just knowing that there is a wound would only continue to hurt."
Sophie released a sob, "But this wound would never heal...I know."
Cedric sighed, "But we can at least try, can't we? Isn't that our duty as parents? He's hurt… deeply disappointed in us… but if we simply accept this outcome, who will suffer the most?"
Sophie didn't say anything, but her voice was visible.
It was the sound of her crying that resonated in the room.
Cedric remained there, hugging his wife and coaxing her to the best of his capability.
He may have convinced his wife to approach their son. And now, it all depends on how Austin responds to her initiative.
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- I hope you all had a good day. Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 155 154- Warning
chapters.content:
"Are you nuts?" A voice, standing in the darkness, asked the other person.
It was within the boundaries of the venue where the Tournament was taking place.
Inside the changing room provided in the gymnasium, two figures stood and talked in a hushed voice.
"I have decided. No one can change my decision now." The other being responded. His voice was guttural, almost inhumane.
The other person was a woman, who clearly seemed displeased when she said, "My plan was going so smoothly and now...can't you wait until the last round? I will take care of him by then." The woman protested against what the man proposed before.
However, the stance of the other one didn't change, "I can't. Ever since I saw her that day...I can't stop thinking about her. A strong woman needs a strong man by her side. I know she won't be satisfied by that puny human. She needs me, as much as I need her."
There was a very faint sense of obsession that was laced in his voice when he talked about the third person.
The other person grumbled, "Tch, you and your strange obsession with strange things. Anyway, you do know what will happen if you fail this time right? Lord Zargon will chew you alive."
The man scowled, "I don't fear anything. These people are weak, and the only strong defender they have will be my target."
There was a brief pause before the woman voiced, "Remember, you can't have him. He is mine, and I won't tolerate any damage dealt to him." The woman's aura flared only to the point where she reminded the other one of her status.
The other person scoffed, "Then just go ahead and take him. What's stopping you from hunting a mere human?"
The woman coquettishly smiled a smile which made even the other one waver for a moment, before she said, "The fun of the hunt is only when you have the prey wrapped around your finger and torment them before delivering the final blow. Don't spoil the fun for me~"
*Knock*
"Monica? How long?" Suddenly, someone knocked on the door, making the woman, who was now identified as Monica, flinch.
"Just a second," She said before tying her hair and telling the person beside her, "It's on the third day. Don't mess it up this time."
No response came in response as Monica advanced towards the door, and the other person faded into darkness.
°°°°°°°°
"You look tired," Esner asked as he and Rhea walked side by side.
Rhea sighed, "Yeah, team training was tougher than individual one." It turned out Austin, who has barely participated in any raid before, was actually better than her in teamwork.
To not drag down her team, she pushed herself to the limits and did her best to hear the commands and act on them.
Since Elara was forced to participate in the training, they were divided into two teams, and thankfully, despite Rhea's clumsiness, they won during the practice battle.
Well, it was to be expected considering they had Valerie on their team. She is fast, strong, and proactive in decision-making. She doesn't stick to the orders if she sees the opportunity. And most of all, regardless of the situation, she retains a calm head. And that is the most crucial factor to win.
Esner smiled at the girl, "Do you want to have something warm and relaxing? Wait I will bring it for you."
"Ah!" Before Rhea could have stopped him, Esner went inside the common hall.
Left alone, she sat down on the nearby bench.
Esner was a good person and because of their random meetings, they have gotten closely acquainted as well.
Even when she was struggling with Rudolph, he suddenly appeared before her and helped her collect herself.
A strange who became her friend in no time.
She knew she shouldn't make friends with someone who comes from a nation that holds animosity against Eryndor, but she couldn't push away a person, especially when have only good intentions toward you.
"Here," Esner soon appeared before her, while holding a paper cup.
Rhea's brows elevated as she received the scent of freshly crushed beans from the cup.
Taking a sip, she was delighted to find milk coffee inside, before she asked in a surprise, "How did you know that I don't like sugar in my coffee?"
Esner froze for a moment, then he blinked and casually said, "I also don't like it...so I asked the server out of habit."
Rhea smiled, "It's the same for me. I don't like sweet things much."
Esner nodded as he was about to sit down beside her when suddenly, "What are you doing here, student Rhea."
Esner flinched for a moment, but then he retained his calm demeanor and following Rhea, he also turned towards the bespectacled man.
"Professor Morkel...I was just relaxing after a long training session." The girl responded.
Morkel crossed his arms on his chest before he said, "I don't want to be harsh here, but there is a chance that our team will go against Avalon Academy during the second stage. And for you two to stay close...you know that it can affect your matches, right?"
Rhea's eyes widened slightly...she really didn't think it was like that.
Morkel soon followed, "Now think, if by any chance you fail to perform well, because of any other reasons, against the Avalon...won't your team and the other say that you let them win for the sake of your friendship."
Esner gritted his teeth hearing the man's nonsensical words. The only reason he didn't allow his aura to leak was because of the girl beside him.
The pinkhead understood the severity of the matter before she apologized, "I understand. Sorry, sir."
Turning towards the boy, she said, "I apologize Esner, but until we finish our matches, we shouldn't meet. Bye."
Esner barely managed to squeeze his lips in a smile, as he said, "I understand."
Not so long after, Rhea excused herself and walked away.
Once she left, Esner also decided to leave, considering he might lose his control and attack the d*ckhead.
However, just as he turned, "Long time, Park."
Esner flinched upon hearing that name before he instantly spun on his feet and looked at the man.
"How did you..."
"Oh, I observed you. Your behavioral pattern, the way you talk, and the way you were roaming around Rhea...it was simple, really."
Parkinson gritted his teeth, his soul energy making the air heavy, as the boy voice, "What do you need?"
"Oh, I need nothing from you. I just came to warn you about something." With a grin that looked nothing but nasty in Park's eyes, Morkel uttered, "Rhea believes that the order to exile Austin in exchange for receiving help from Hener was your doing."
All the color from his face vanished, as he asked in a louder tone, "What proposal?!"
Morkel chuckled, "You don't know? Well, you should ask your parents then. As for Rhea, don't let her know that it's you, or she might come after your life~" Saying so, Morkel walked away leisurely.
He just wanted to warn the boy and remind him where he stands in Rhea's life.
'Your closed, so don't try to come near her anymore.'
°°°°°°°
A/N:- Do you want to see the group exercise? Maybe I will add bits and pieces of it. How about a third chapter today? No promises though...

chapters.title: Chapter 156 155- Training
chapters.content:
Valerie moved through the forest, closely listening to the sound of collision from far ahead as she prepared to help the raiders from her side.
The training site was situated in the forest which explains why she was having a hard time moving through the terrain.
Finally, she reached a clearing where Rhea was engaged in a battle with Ryan.
Although the two of them were of the same rank, Ryan was simply overwhelming the girl because of the experience he held
Ryan was much like Rhea—someone who was allowed to risk his life to gain experience. However, unlike the pinkhead, who was much more focused on refining her skills, Ryan utilized his time to attain combat experience.
Valerie could see that Rhea was getting pushed away, and if things continued like this, their team raider would be out of the game in the first few minutes.
Valerie summoned her Shard and was about to end this battle by encasing Ryan—when suddenly, she heard,
[Val, don't freeze him up but just intimidate him.]
It was the artifact they recently acquired from Morkel that allowed long-range communication. It was an artifact that the Council would have allotted them for the match, but the Professor already had them, so he provided them for a better training experience.
It uses the same technology and magic as the communication devices used by soldiers in border areas. However, its range was significantly reduced since military-grade equipment was banned for civilian use—even for Elite students.
Hearing the voice of her Lord, she frowned just for a moment but didn't question his judgment.
Tapping Shiverfall on the branch she was standing, she sent several ice spikes hurling in Ryan's direction
"Woah!" The boy jumped back, nearly dodging the attack that surely would have made him bleed.
Flipping in the air to retreat a little, he looked at the chanter of the spell.
Valerie didn't stop there; she jumped from the tree, and an ice platform was built under her foot, allowing her to skate her way to her opponent.
Ryan felt the temperature around him dropping as he raised his battle axe and got prepared.
However, Valerie was simply too overpowered for him.
She swung her spear from a distance, and several ice shards shot toward him.
"Shit!" The boy cursed before he covered himself with his Axe to save his face from getting scarred by those tiny little devils.
*CLINK* *CLINK*
Those shards that struck his weapon were shattered but many more of them damaged the other, uncovered part of his body.
Ryan was getting pushed back, and he knew he couldn't continue this any longer, so he called out, "ELARA!"
A figure appeared behind Valerie, holding her kunai and a vicious expression on her face.
However, before she could have attacked Valerie,
**BOOOOOM**
An arrow struck her back, throwing Elara straight toward Valerie.
The violette tilted her body before Elara crashed into the iced platform.
[Rhea, keep them engaged.]
Rhea received the message before she reloaded her Shard and shot another arrow toward Elara and Ryan.
"Move!" Ryan held Elara and moved away.
Elara yelped as she found herself being thrown away.
[Valerie, proceed.]
Upon receiving the order, Valerie shared a glance with Rhea before they shared a nod, and the spear wielder dashed toward the target.
The only reason Valerie was told to intimidate Ryan was because Austin wanted to pull Elara to the battle.
With his restricted powers(Valerie was told not to go all out in the training battles), Valerie might have had a hard time fighting against Rudolph and Elara, which is why it was necessary to detach them.
Austin smiled as he awaited the good news since he knew his lover would take care of Rudolph.
"You look quite happy~" Someone launched toward Austin, which ushered the blond to raise his Shard and prepare for the battle.
However, the moment Sheldon and Austin's blades were about to clash,
*SPOOOF*
Sheldon dissolved into clouds before Austin realized what it was.
The real Sheldon appeared behind the training doll, his blade raised.
His dagger was inches away from slaying the doll, when suddenly,
**BOOOOM**
Something came rushing down from the sky and plummeted Sheldon to the ground.
Austin smirked as he turned towards his classmate, ready to provide him a helping hand—when he was genuinely surprised to find no one pressed under Wisp.
*Slash*
Austin gritted his teeth as he heard the slash before he turned abort and found Sheldon standing on top of the training doll leisurely.
"You refrained from using your barrier, and now look what it caused you."
There were two large slashes on the training doll, which meant the end.
Austin exhaled a sigh before he nodded, "I understand....but here, in the open, I am slightly hesitant to show all my cards."
Shdon hummed, understanding what he meant. He didn't say anything and jumped from the wounded equipment.
Soon, the others began to gather around them before Annabelle confirmed, "Valerie damaged the doll before you, so it's apparently our victory."
Turning towards Austin, she added, "Nice work dictating orders. You did better than me."
Austin forced himself to smile, but inwardly, he was quite bitter, losing against Sheldon.
He really didn't think that Sheldon would use his clones in such a way. And it didn't end there,
*SPOOF*
The Sheldon, right before them, also disappeared in a white cloud before the real Sheldon appeared from the forest.
"You had a backup plan if you had failed the third time too?" Austin asked, evidently amazed.
Sheldon shrugged, "That's the ability of my Shard, so surely I will go all out to fool my opponent."
"You should keep your head high, though, Austin. You could have easily defended the target if you had used your barrier. So, in a way, it's your victory." Rudolph complimented.
Valerie wordlessly nodded in support.
Austin exhaled an audible breath, before he asked, "So...should we go another round?"
"No way! I am tired." The one who grumbled and complained was the redhead in the group.
Rhea, who was just beside her, nodded with her eyes droopy, "I am tired too...can't continue." They have always gone for five rounds since morning and she could barely feel her legs now.
Anabelle chuckled as she said, "Yeah, we should stop now. We have to gather at the arena to watch the first round of the squad matches as well."
Today, fortunately, they weren't listed to face the first round.
Having zero information about the round was too disadvantageous. That's why, it seems, they chose the top two academies—Ravencourt and Auroracrest—to play the first round.
On that note, everyone decided to return to their rooms and rest for some time.
"Do you want to have some breakfast?" Austin asked as he and Valerie walked together.
"How about in a few minutes? I am too sweaty right now."
When she said that, Austin was suddenly reminded of something as he asked, "Why were you wearing a high neck during the whole session?"
The others wore clothes designed for ease of movement, but when it came to Valerie, comfort was the last word that came to mind.
Valerie was embarrassed, but she showed him, by pulling the zipper.
"...!!" Austin's eyes stretched a little when he saw the glaring love bite on her collar bone which he left on her last night.
"It wasn't this profound last night, but in the morning...that's why...I covered it." She wasn't ashamed of having the trophy of love; rather, she didn't want others to comment on it and have Valerie lose her composure.
And there was a chance she would have embarrassed her Lord as well if she had roamed with the kiss mark.
"Val...why didn't you apply a potion on it?"
Valerie blinked, and then a very slight bulge appeared on her cheek as she said, "I will never make it disappear...Rather I want to have it for the rest of my life."
Drawing closer to him, she whispered, "It reminds me that my Lord is possessive of me."
Austin helplessly smiled at her thoughts before he told her, "Okay, don't apply potion, but rather than wearing a high-neck and dehydrating yourself, how about you apply a bandage there to hide it?"
Valerie hummed, "I will think about it."
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- This arc won't last for long. I hope you all are enjoying the story so far.

chapters.title: Chapter 157 156- Rank B
chapters.content:
[Name: Gorrak]
[Rank: B]
[Points: 2000]
....
So here it was. The main boss of the second dungeon.
Austin was standing in the waiting area after he defeated all the mob soldiers.
He was tired and wounded all over.
Annihilating more than a hundred giants was not easy.
It may be the toughest mob battle he had until now.
Entities full of brute force. Sure, they were easy to fool and weren't fast enough to chase after him—even once Austin had got into their grasp, nothing other than brutal death awaited.
He was surviving all because of his agility and coordination with his weapons.
He has already lost the Absolute Barrier during the mob hunting, so he couldn't become careless during the final battle.
'Well...in front of that thing, I would be damned to become careless.' Austin muttered under his breath as he saw the thirty-foot tall Orc Lord, standing with his battle hammer resting beside him.
A walking mountain of muscle and scars. His gray-green skin was thick like iron, stretched over bulging sinews that pulsed with raw power. Jagged bone plates jutted from his shoulders and arms, trophies of countless battles. His massive tusks, stained with old blood, curled upward like savage blades.
His eyes burned like molten embers, filled with hatred and hunger. Each breath rumbled like a growling beast.
Austin knew he wouldn't be able to win against this thing without support.
'Let's see...' He peeked at his points table and found he had accumulated over twenty-two hundred points until now.
Taking a deep breath, Austin made the decision, "System, buy me the Ashen Maul."
[Ding!]
[Command accepted!]
As those words faded, Austin raised his hand and a weapon began to materialize in his hands.
The mace has a four-foot-long handle, crafted from dark, reinforced steel with a slight curve for better grip and control. The surface is wrapped in thick, weathered leather, ensuring a firm hold even in the bloodiest battles.
At its top, the head of the mace is a brutal sphere of blackened iron, nearly twice the size of a human skull. Jagged, razor-sharp spikes protrude from it in an uneven pattern, designed to crush armor, shatter bones, and tear through flesh with every strike.
"It's heavy .." Austin muttered as he swung the weapon slightly. It was quite heavier than Raijin...almost like he was holding a tree.
'What's the special effect of the weapon?' Austin actually just took it because he was searching for a high-ranking damage-dealing weapon...without knowing the effect it could produce.
[Ember-effect: Each strike of the Ashen Maul leaves behind smoldering embers at the point of impact, causing a lingering burn. Repeated strikes on the same spot intensify the effect, increasing the severity of the burn with each consecutive hit.]
Austin hummed, "Nice."
He then went ahead and brought some potions, "One low-rank healing and recovery potion."
The total points he spent in the items was sixteen hundred, leaving him with just six hundred points.
Austin gulped down the potion and felt his wounds healing at a greater pace and his breath stabilizing. His legs weren't hurting as much now, and he seemed in a much better state.
Glancing at the clock on the left, he found he only had ten seconds.
Holding the mace with both hands, Austin muttered under his breath, "Wish me luck, Val."
And with those thoughts, the waiting area vanished into nothingness.
A thunderous roar shook the battlefield.
"KHUAAAAANGHH!"
The Orc Lord's deafening bellow sent a powerful gust ripping through the air, dust and blood spraying everywhere. But Austin didn't waver.
He charged forward.
His boots sank into the damp soil, a ground soaked not by rain—but by the blood of fallen foes. His grip tightened around his weapon, eyes locked onto the towering beast.
Across from him, the Orc Lord grasped his battle hammer, massive fingers curling around the handle as it loomed overhead, ready to crush him into the earth.
But—
**DHWAM**
The hammer slammed down with the force of an earthquake. The ground shattered beneath its weight—but Austin was no longer there.
He had already let go of his Ashen Maul, shaking off the weight that had slowed him, and exploded forward like a cannonball.
In a heartbeat, he was already upon the monster, using its own skull belt as a foothold to launch himself upward.
The Orc Lord felt the tug at its waist. Confused, its massive head tilted downward—
Too late.
Austin had already leaped, his Ashen Maul reappearing in his hands mid-air.
*CRACK*
A sickening fracture echoed as the mace slammed into the monster's wrist.
"GHUOOOH!"
The beast winced, a deep, guttural cry of pain shaking the battlefield.
Austin landed, knees bending, his gaze immediately snapping to where he struck.
And there it was—deep red patches seeping into the monster's thick skin.
The Ember Effect had begun.
The Orc Lord's pained wince twisted into something far more dangerous—rage.
His burning-red eyes locked onto Austin, and with a guttural snarl, he lunged.
**BOOM**
A massive foot stomped down, the sheer force blasting dirt and debris into the air. Austin barely had time to react.
**WHAM**
A backhand swing from the monster's colossal arm came like a battering ram, catching Austin mid-step before he could fully retreat.
"Ghh—!"
The impact ripped the air from his lungs. His body rocketed backward, crashing into the ground, rolling through mud and shattered stone. His vision blurred, ears ringing from the hit.
But the Orc Lord wasn't done.
THUD! THUD! THUD!
The monster was already charging, its massive frame moving with terrifying speed. With one hand, it lifted its battle hammer again, the edge glowing red-hot from the heat of Austin's Ember Effect.
"HRAAAAAGH!"
It swung down, aiming to crush him entirely.
Austin, dazed but not beaten, forced himself to roll away just as the hammer obliterated the spot he had been lying in—
**BOOM**
The entire ground split apart spreading like veins, chunks of dirt, and molten embers flying in every direction. The shockwave sent Austin tumbling further back, his arms stinging from the heat.
The blond prince gritted his teeth, pushing himself up, feeling a sharp sting along his ribs—a gash from the Orc's strike. His coat was torn, blood trickling down his side.
Austin shoved himself upright with a grunt, his muscles protesting, but he ignored the pain. His Ashen Maul lay behind him, abandoned.
Yet, he didn't hesitate.
He charged forward.
The Orc Lord noticed. This time, the monster didn't scoff—it had learned.
Instead of bracing itself, it launched into the air.
Austin's eyes widened. "What the—"
Before he could react—
**BOOOOOOM**
The entire dungeon quaked as the monster came crashing down. The force ripped the ground apart, sending a violent shockwave tearing through the battlefield.
Austin's footing vanished.
His legs buckled, and his body lurched—he fell.
"Agh!"
The ground below had collapsed, forming a deep crater. Austin tumbled down into it, his back slamming against a jagged rock.
Dust clouded his vision. His chest heaved as he tried to regain control—
Then—
A shadow loomed over him.
Austin's breath hitched.
The Orc Lord towered over the crater's edge, its massive silhouette blocking out the dungeon's eerie glow.
And then, he saw it—
The battle hammer was raised high.
A strike meant to end him.
Panic flared in his chest—he had no time to dodge.
"WISP!"
He shouted on instinct.
Before the hammer could fall—
SWWOOSH—!
Something whipped through the air, a blur of wood and force.
CRACK!
The Orc Lord's head snapped sideways.
"KHUENG!"
A deep, guttural howl of pain tore from the monster's throat as it staggered back, clutching the side of its skull.
Austin's wild eyes darted up.
He instantly shot away from the crater, and commanded the system,
'Berserk, now!'
[Command accepted!]
[All the stats have significantly risen!]
Feeling the surge of strength and speed in his body, Austin was a blur through the battlefield.
He summoned Ashen Maul in his hand before jumping into the air. His body was light and his legs were strong, which allowed him to reach the top of the Orc Lord's head.
The Orc Lord sensed danger as it instantly tried to raise its hammer in retaliation.
But it was too late.
**DHWAK**
The Ashen Maul landed squarely on the skull of the monster with a strength that simply surpassed the human, Austin once was.
The head of the monster was split open, blood gushing out by the strike, as the ember began to seep inside its skull.
"Ghrueng"
The Orc Lord staggered away, clutching its head as Austin landed on the ground, and darted forward once again.
The Orc Lord swung its weapon to keep the human away, but Austin was simply too fast for the Orc Lord to track.
Jumping in the air, Austin gripped his weapon with all his strength, and accompanied the strength he commanded,
"DICHARGE!"
An attack that sent a tremor through the dungeon, resonated as Austin's weapon landed on the Orc's head.
A blinding shockwave erupted.
The moment Austin's Ashen Maul connected with the Orc Lord's skull, a violent pulse of force detonated outward, ripping through the air like a thunderclap.
CRACK!
The Orc Lord's skull erupted.
A geyser of black ichor and shattered bone burst outward like an exploding volcano. Chunks of thick, green flesh ripped apart, flung in every direction as the sheer force of the impact detonated inside its head.
The orc's body convulsed violently, its massive limbs twitching as the headless corpse staggered back.
A moment later—
THUUUUUD!
The thirty-foot titan collapsed.
The ground quaked as the lifeless hulk slammed into the dungeon floor, sending a final, echoing tremor through the cavern. A pool of dark blood quickly spread beneath its twitching fingers, the last remnants of life draining away.
Austin landed with a rough roll, breathing heavily. His clothes were splattered with gore, bits of bone, and seared flesh stuck to his armor.
Wiping his sweat, he muttered, "Berserk is a cheat ability..."
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading. That concludes the second dungeon and Austin is now a B-rank. Drop a comment

chapters.title: Chapter 158 157- Don't ignore him
chapters.content:
*YAWN*
Rhea released a yawn as she left her room and advanced toward the common hall.
She still has an hour before the match between Ravencourt and Auroracrest begins.
She wanted to eat something to replenish her lost energy. She moved a lot during training and she is famished now.
While rubbing her flat belly with a pained expression, she never saw the other person coming from behind, resulting—
"Ah!" Rhea stumbled forward as the person walked hastily away without stopping to apologize.
When she looked closely she found it was one of the soldiers working for the Council, which made her recall that she saw several soldiers walking around the venue previously as well.
It had been busy since morning, which made her curious. Since she was too tired in the morning, she didn't ask anyone. However, now,
"Excuse me," Rhea followed the soldier hastily, however, he was too fast and didn't hear her calling.
The pink head sighed and stopped trying. She had a feeling that even if she had stopped them, the soldiers might not have responded to her query.
Even if there was any emergency, the venue management always prioritized keeping the students calm.
"Hey," Someone familiar appeared beside her as he asked, "What happened?"
Rhea turned toward Rudolph, wanting to tell him about the bizarre situation, but then she paused.
Rudolph has trimmed his hair from the side and has tied his long black hair in a rough bun. In addition to that, he was wearing a sleeveless shirt that exposed his well-shaped arms and gave an intimidating yet handsome appearance to the boy.
"Rhea?" Rudolph called out to the dazed girl.
The dual-awakened broke out of her trance, and hurriedly said, "It seems there is a situation going on...I saw several soldiers walking around in the morning."
Rudolph frowned, as he crossed his arms on his chest, as he voiced, "I also noticed it and questioned one of them. However, they didn't answer me."
Rhea hummed, "Expected," after pausing for a moment, she asked, "Do you think the President might know something about it?"
The Student Council President was their team leader who had come in contact with the venue managers, so she thought that the President might have something to share.
However, "No, I don't think so. This situation is not something event-related. This is...far more severe." Rudolph brought the girl to the side, so they didn't block others' path before he informed her,
"Three soldiers, whom I saw yesterday in the morning, were not at their station today."
Rhea was amazed, "You notice such details? I don't even remember the soldiers who checked our belongings."
Rudolph chuckled, "It's kind of habit to assess warriors around me. And when I do that, I remember their faces as well."
"No doubt you score so low during exams. Your mind is filled with people's faces after all." Rhea commented, only to wince as Rudolph suddenly pinched her cheek.
"I am sowweyyy..." She cried before Rudolph released her and ushered the girl to move toward the table.
"Wait, I will bring something for you." Rudolph told her, and a sobbing Rhea nodded, "You have to," she added.
Rudolph was smiling ear to ear while he advanced toward the food counter, and found a familiar person standing there
"Hey, Austin." Austin was in the line, waiting for his turn to order breakfast
Hearing the voice, he turned towards the guy, before flashing his brows, "Hey, you woke up."
"I didn't sleep actually. It's kind of a habit to train that much in the morning, so I wasn't actually tired."
Austin nodded, "Can relate."
They moved up the queue as the bigger guy asked, "Did you have some kind of buffing potion...you look juiced up a little."
Rudolph wasn't exaggerating. Austin's muscles were slightly more profound, and his height also seemed a few inches higher than in the morning. Not only that, his aura was much more noticeable, as if he went through an Evolution.
Austin chuckled...so he indeed leveled up by defeating the Orc Lord.
He didn't get any notification from the system, but he was actually feeling a little stronger and lighter.
His combat and endurance stats had grown, but he hadn't checked since the moment he woke up after returning from the Dungeon; it was already too late. That's why, he hastily moved to the Common Hall to have breakfast with his lover.
"Well, good training as good rest did wonders."
They moved a little ahead, now Austin was just a person away from the counter, as he heard his friend saying,
"Why do you give the impression that despite not having your Shard going through evolutions, you are growing continuously?"
Austin shrugged, "Maybe I am?" This was no longer a secret and soon, during the second round, everyone would know that he was actually way above a D-rank.
Naturally, they all would consider his dual awakening the reason behind his unnatural growth, just like Rhea.
Rudolph sighed, 'Seriously, these dual-awakeners are cheat existence.' he thought, before turning towards his left as someone passed by.
Seeing the guard passing, Rudolph solemnly asked, "Did you notice...people are disappearing from the venue."
Austin also glanced at the soldier, as his brows slowly drew closer
He has also noticed that there have been some unnatural movements of the soldiers since this morning. He had previously heard that one of the four management chiefs had disappeared, too.
'The Demons are here...but I cannot sense any of them.' The plan of observing Rhea didn't work as well. She didn't 'accidentally' stumble upon any being who could have been suspicious. And following Rhea everywhere was simply unthinkable.
As such, now all Austin can do is warn Valerie and wait for the Demons to show up.
Despite knowing the level of danger this matter involved, he couldn't inform others about it. Having knowledge about things that shouldn't be within a human's grasp always creates doubt and suspicion.
The only person to whom he could share his knowledge without the fear of getting questioned back is the lady he admires the most.
After taking his plates of breakfast, he returned to the table where Valerie awaited him.
She wanted to go and take lunch for them, but Austin insisted she wait, considering the queue was rather long this morning.
"Sorry to make you wait, here you go." He handed her the toast and coffee, while he himself had banana pancakes with honey syrup.
The duo were nobles who had grown up under strict tutelage that instilled etiquette and manners to their very bone.
The way they lifted their tableware, or how they silently sliced their food before putting it in their mouth, every single movement oozed with elegance.
There were not a few but many who couldn't stop looking at them, as they felt conscious about how they ate. Especially those who come from a commoner background.
Valerie glanced at her Lord before asking, "Did you receive any letter from your family?"
Austin nodded, "Sebas contacted me...it seems my father will be coming to see the match."
Valerie delicately smiled, "Is that so?"
Austin raised his brows, "You look happy? Do you want me to remain close to my family?"
Valerie nodded—not hesitant, as she said, "I want you to remain close to the one whom you genuinely respect and love. Please don't ignore him."
Austin sighed, "As you command, my lady."
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Valerie knows Austin well, that's why she suggested it.
Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 159 158- Trap(1)
chapters.content:
"It was...disappointing," Rudolph muttered under his breath as the students cheered at Ravencourt's victory.
Someone who was expecting an intense clash between the top two schools, Rudolph had all the right to feel displeased at the one-sided onslaught Ravencourt presented before the spectators.
The other side never had the chance to retaliate in front of the offense of the Ravencourt.
The student named Kevin just overwhelmed the other side, showing his skills which were on par with an S-rank.
Austin sighed as he looked at the boy whose body was radiating brilliantly with confidence and slight chagrin with all the praises that flew his way.
The ability to absorb the essence of the sun and use that to strengthen himself. Someone who could be an ultimate weapon against the demons if only there was a sun in the sky.
'If my memories serve right, then he should have already gone through two evolutions and would go through another advancement by the end of this arc.' Austin muttered under his breath, as he and the others slowly got up and advanced toward the Command Tent.
Naturally, they had a lot to discuss after they realized what they would need to do during the second stage.
Elara, unnaturally, didn't make a fuss and just silently took a seat across from Austin.
In the Command Tent, only the Elite members were permitted to enter.
The newbie division was on the other side, but they could not hear each other at all unless they were purposely listening to the other.
They have been handling their battles well and were in fourth overall rank by now.
Considering the main importance lies in the results of the Elite group, the President didn't try to meddle with their affairs, despite having a few complaints.
"We all saw what we have to do. Instead of just a single target to protect, there would be two. One would carry more points and one less."
During the contest, everyone noticed that Auroracrest tried to protect both targets at once, forcing their tactician to take on too much responsibility.
It was a poor decision because Ravencourt wasted no time launching an all-out attack. Their two raiders and the tactician charged straight at both targets.
Breaking the first target earned a team 100 points.
Defeating all opponents granted 300 points.
Conquering the second target, which required a special key, awarded 500 points.
The problem? The key was in their opponent's hands. However, since they weren't told which enemy held the secret code, Kevin took no chances—he defeated both the raiders and the defender. Soon after, the opposing tactician fell to their own defender.
In the end, not only did they secure the points for capturing both locks, but they also earned extra for taking down the entire enemy team.
"Our goal would be to safely secure the first target and then start defeating the raiders." Annabelle voiced in all seriousness
Although the basic structure of the round was similar, the addition of two targets made things a bit tricky.
"There is a high chance for the opponents to advance right toward the defense now," Rudolph said, thinking things from the enemy's perspective
"You are right; that's why we need Austin to hold his defense for at least a few minutes. We can have Valerie with him for support, but that would lessen our firepower." Annabelle voiced, her tone suggesting a little hesitation.
Austin realized what was troubling her, so he assured the girl, "My barrier would last long for a few minutes; that's why I will be protecting myself and the target with fewer points, so they score as low as possible."
"But what if I, Valerie, or the President gets the key?" Rhea asked. Won't that make the whole point of Austin wielding an unbreakable barrier to protect the weaker target pointless?"
"We can adjust based on that; if Austin or Valerie gets the key, then Austin would go for a weaker target. But if I or Rhea get the key, Austin, I want you to be near the other one."
The blond Prince nodded, "Understood."
The discussion continued for another hour before they were told to return to their rooms.
Annabelle, Sheldon, and Rhea were staying for further discussion. Ryan and Elara went to their rooms while Rudolph decided to train a little.
Left alone, Valerie and Austin decided to eat something, since they didn't have anything after breakfast.
"It's going to be a difficult and tricky task," Austin muttered followed by a sigh, as he held his beloved hand and strolled towards the common hall.
Things have changed now, and there is a high chance for Austin to face more than one enemy without the assistance of his team—since they mostly would be involved in finding the targets.
Well, not like anything can penetrate the Absolute Barrier, but the duration of the shield troubles him.
"Don't worry, regardless of the situation, I will reach you if it gets too dangerous," Valerie assured as she hugged his arm.
Austin lovingly looked at his woman, in front of whom he could release all his frustration and show what he truly felt.
She is the only woman he has ever dated who never judged him based on his rare nervous side.
He was so occupied in looking at her that he never noticed the person standing ahead, resulting—
*DHAK*
*CLANG*
The dish from the person's hand dropped to the ground and all the food it held.
Austin was startled and so were the others in the common hall.
Every eye turned towards them, and before Austin could have said anything, the grey-haired boy shouted, "What the fuck!! I stood half an hour to get it, and you goddamn mothefu*ker!!"
His words and expression clearly said that he was overreacting.
However, before he could have stepped forward, a chill ran down his spine.
It was a sensation a living being should not feel.
The chill of death that crept through his body and seeped into his soul.
And it wasn't just the boy but everyone felt the foreboding sensation arriving from the person standing behind Austin.
Valerie's eyes held no emotion, as she stared at the guy. However, looking closely there was a storm arising in those lifeless eyes
The storm of agitation.
The boy halted mid-step, gritted his teeth, and turned around.
Austin shook his head and exhaled a sigh. Youngster these days loses their cool so easily.
"You okay, Val?" Austin turned around to ask her as he rested his hand on her shoulder.
Valerie slowly nodded when suddenly someone called out, "Hey, Austin."
Hearing the voice, the blond reflexively turned toward the source—
*Splash*
—only to find something soft and gooey crashing against his face
"Ooooh~"
"Damn...."
"What a precise shot."
Many ooh-ed seeing the scene as the boy who hit him, dashed away instantly.
Valerie's aura flared, but before she could move and possibly end the journey of the student, Austin stopped her.
"Wait, Val...that guy is already out of the tournament...fighting him would only cause us trouble. So let him be."
Austin didn't want to get disqualified and land in the trap that the enemies had set for them. He was well aware that this was all a setup; that's why he refrained from acting on his impulse.
....however, soon, Austin would realize that he might have underestimated the enemy.
°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Drop a comment. Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 160 - 159- Trap(2)
chapters.content:
Austin was back in his room.
It took some time to convince Valerie but fortunately, she calmed down.
He didn’t know the name of the student, and that very fact relays that the boy was not important enough to be remembered. He must have been disqualified in the first round and wanted to have Austin or Valerie ruled out by attacking him.
This was nothing new or unheard of. Austin has faced these kinds of situations back in his last life as well.
One time, he had an important rugby match, and a day before, someone ’accidentally’ bumped their bike into him.
He lost consciousness and was carried to the hospital, but somehow, the next day, he recovered, and despite the Doctor’s advice, he went to play the match.
And after the match, the one thug who ’accidentally’ hit him had to stay way longer in the hospital than Luke.
So it was nothing new, and Austin has the experience to deal with these bu**holes.
Just don’t give in to their provocation until you pass the hurdle they don’t want you to cross. And once it’s over, beat them senseless. And Austin was going to do just that.
"You okay?" As he entered the room, with the scent of cream still lingering, he heard Sheldon asking.
The blond one nodded, "Yeah, everything fine."
Sheldon didn’t ask anything further, even though he knew exactly what happened in the common hall. However, since Austin said he was fine, Sheldon decided to not bother him.
The Prince walked inside the bathroom and threw away his clothes first. They were dusty and sweaty.
Diving in the warm bath, he first washed his face and while he did, he mentally commanded,
’Stats,’
[Ding!]
[Combat: 72->81/100]
{Next reward at 100}
[Romance: 63->65/100]
{Next reward at 80}
[Durability: 73->85/100]
{Next reward at 100}
[Trickery: 35/50]
{Next reward at 50}
[Overall Progression: 59->67.8/100]
[Next Reward at 70]
…
[Ding!]
[You have three rewards!]
Austin didn’t think much before opening them,
[Ding!]
[Upon your combat advancement, the host has gained 300 Points]
[Upon your durability advancement, the host has gained 200 points.]
[Upon your trickery advancement, the host has gained the skill: Mirage Sync.]
[Mirage Sync: Creates a phantom at a target location that repeats the user’s movements and attacks after a short delay. The mirage mimics the exact actions performed at activation and disappears after a certain time.]
Austin had a frown on his face—what the heck?
’Why didn’t I receive any skill or tool upon advancement?’
[The system has nothing else to offer based on the Host’s current skill level.]
Austin clicked his tongue, "You could have offered a discount coupons on a few shop items."
Regardless of his complaints, he knew the system wouldn’t budge so he read the description of the skill he got.
After reading it twice, he asked, "You mean to say, after activating the skill, I perform a few movements or tasks which my mirage or clone would repeat for a certain period, right?"
[Indeed, host! How sharp!]
Austin rolled his eyes at the fruitless attempt of flattering him.
’What are the limitations?’
[The Mirage can only follow movements done within ten seconds, and the Mirage can only maintain its form for ten minutes.]
[Note: The duration cannot be enhanced with points.]
Austin couldn’t think of any use of this skill anytime soon. But surely, there was a long path ahead, and maybe there would arise a chance for him to use it.
’How many points do I have now?’
[Ding!]
[Total Points: 3201]
That put a smile on his face.
Austin stretched his arms before muttering,
’I should get out,’
°°°°°°°
The next day, early morning, Austin and Valerie were running side by side.
It has become a habit to exercise and train together.
Not only both of them were adamant about remaining in shape, but their greed to see each other as soon as the day breaks never allowed them to miss a single day of exercise.
Valerie was wearing a black jogging track, that consisted of jogging trousers, a white shirt with a jacket. She has tied her hair in a high ponytail that allows her to move freely.
Austin had a similar outfit, but he only wore a white shirt on his upper body.
Their forehead was glimmering with sweat.
Austin noticed that from wherever they passed, people glanced at them, and whispering among themselves.
’Seriously, how gossipy they can be...’ He ignored those gazes but Valerie didn’t.
However, to not bother her Lord, she didn’t say anything and continued to run in silence.
"Wanna take a break?" Austin asked and got a nod in response.
They both paused before a resting bench and Valerie instantly pulled a towel she had tugged at her waist.
"Thank you," Austin faintly whispered in between his labored breathing.
Valerie asked, "Want me to bring some water?"
"No, it’s fine. We will go to the common hall anyway."
Valerie wanted to bring some water, considering how much he had sweated. But she didn’t insist and sat down beside him.
The temperature was really nice today—perfect for exercising.
They have to report to the team meeting in an hour and start their team training.
The second-day match would start in five hours, so they would get enough time to train.
Tomorrow, they would be performing in the arena.
Tomorrow, it would be decided if Valorian would survive in the tournament or not.
Many things were on the line tomorrow, and Austin didn’t want a single thing to go against their way.
"I know we will win our match." As if she read his mind, Valerie rested her hand on his and assured him.
"I mean, we have you so surely-"
"No, Austin...we both know that this match cannot be won by a single person. Without you or the other two, it would be quite difficult."
Austin chuckled, "Are you putting pressure on me?"
Valerie blinked before her lips extended in a soft smile as she said, "Did I pressurize you? Well, I can compensate you by rewarding you if we win."
Austin was very curious, so he asked right away, "What is the reward this time?"
Valerie’s cheeks were flushed red, as she bit her lip.
Austin was both excited and patient to hear her answer, so he chose to give her the time she needed to muster up her strength.
However, the moment Valerie decided to tell him,
"AHHHHHHH!"
A cry arrived from the student’s dorm wing.
Austin and Valerie instantly got up on their feet.
Many students began to rush toward the dorm
Austin and Valerie shared a glance before they also sped towards the source of the cry.
The students started to gather around the gallery that led to Valorian’s dorm.
Austin had a bad feeling about this as he held Valerie’s hand and weaved through the crowd.
The partition in the crowd was found near the room where Valerie was staying with Annabelle.
Austin’s heart nearly stopped as he peeked inside the room and found a certain boy lying there—his limbs separated and the person encased in an ice block.
And it wasn’t just any boy...rather, the one who humiliated him yesterday.
Austin turned to look at Valerie.
And her expression told him everything.
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading. Drop a comment..

chapters.title: Chapter 161 - 160- Caught
chapters.content:
Jasmine was exasperated.
She clearly told the bastard named Zevarath to only ambush when the Valorian academy would be performing on their match day.
However, that dumb skull couldn’t wait and ended up committing this small drama.
’But still...it’s staged quite well...’ The black-haired girl couldn’t stop herself from smiling as she saw the dead guy lying inside a block of ice.
She was aware of the altercation he had with Austin last night in the common hall.
And following that, he was found dead in the room of that girl who worships Austin.
Jasmine saw Austin looking at Valerie with a frown, while Valerie shook her head with her eyes full of tears.
Seeing a strong person shedding tears is such a joy to her heart.
The whispers of the students were quite helpful as well.
"Isn’t that the same guy from last night?"
"I heard the S-rank was quite crazy, but this...isn’t that a crime?"
"Of course, it is! Killing a student regardless of their background is forbidden and should be punished!"
"It’s all because of that loser...now Valorian lost their best student."
"Can you all stop?!" Suddenly, the booming voice of a certain male silenced everyone.
Austin’s aura clearly said that he was frustrated, as he looked at the others.
Jasmine frowned...wasn’t he suspecting Valerie? Or was it an act? Or is this an act?
"It hasn’t been proven who killed him and yet you all are talking rubbish at her face. Quite the mature people you all are." He didn’t hesitate in insulting the people from seven different nations, of which several of them were royalty.
Valerie’s change of expression irritated Jasmine. She clicked her tongue and swirled her finger before providing a command to one of her pets.
A black-haired boy stepped forward before accusing, "He was found dead in her room just a few hours later he humiliated you! And we all know how close you two are...it would take a fool to not connect the dots."
Another twirl of a finger, and another pet barked, "She clearly seemed on the verge of murdering him yesterday. And if not for the maid who came for room cleaning, no one would have known where the boy disappeared to."
"She clearly slaughtered him and tried to hide it!"
"Just being strong doesn’t mean you are above the law!"
The audience was growing noisy and Jasmine had a satisfied smile on her face.
’Come on, Luke. I know you love that girl...now, show us how will you defend your oh-so-perfect girl.’
Austin took a step toward Valerie and stood before her; shielding her.
His stance made it clear that he wouldn’t let anything reach his woman.
Crossing his arms, he said, "Assume whatever the fuck you want, but another word you speak against her, I swear you would be the next dead body lying here."
That statement held no warning but pure certainty.
The aura he wore around his body was not something a mere D-rank should possess.
A killing intent that far surpassed a student who should have only gained experience in a controlled environment.
In their eyes, Austin appeared as an untamed beast who would swallow any curse thrown at his woman and the one who spits it.
"What is happening here?" Soon, the soldiers of the Council arrived, and so did the Headmaster of the Valorian.
Their reaction was almost similar. Some gasped and some just were astonished.
Jasmine thought that they would take some time to investigate the matter, but,
"Soldiers, arrest her!" One of them was the management chief, who ordered the soldiers while directing his gaze toward Valerie.
"Hey, wait! How can you jump to the conclusion so soon?!" Austin stopped them from advancing and seemed to be on the verge of summoning his Shard.
Even the Headmaster protested, "At least, first assess the situation, Eden."
The management chief, Eden, had a firm stance when he said, "All the visual reports indicate that she has done it. But right now, I am not arresting her to put her in a cell or anything. She would be taken to the Headquarters for interrogation, and if she is proven innocent there, no one will question her any further."
Philius frowned, as he turned to look at the dead body on the ground.
There was no argument that Valerie was a prime suspect in this crime.
No one was unaware of the possessiveness she carried for Austin, and in a fit of rage, Philius saw how far she could go.
Exhaling a sigh, he advanced toward Austin before resting his hand on his shoulder and telling the younger one, "Look, Austin, I know Valerie couldn’t take such a massive step...but right now, everything is speaking against her. So let her go and prove her innocence."
Austin gritted his teeth, "Just because he was found in her room....they all are assuming she did it."
"Isn’t that oddly familiar?" Someone voiced, making every eye turn towards him.
It was the same boy who had gotten quite close to Rhea recently: Esner.
"I heard the Prince of our nation was accused of the same crime? That he kidnapped you and you were found in his room. No one listened to him and blamed the Prince...or so what I heard? So why the change of mind here? Was it written on Prince Parkinson’s face that he was a criminal? Or was it prejudice on your part, Headmaster Philius?"
Hearing the boy’s query the students went abuzz.
Those who didn’t know the situation that caused Parkinson’s disappearance were now whispering about whether Valorian discriminates against students from foreign lands.
Philius knew that things were not going their way, and if it continued, things wouldn’t settle just with Valerie.
The older one’s grip turned firm around Austin’s shoulder, which left the blond one with no option.
He turned towards Valerie and cupped her cheek, "Val...I am ashamed to say but I cannot stop you from getting taken away."
Valerie’s tears were still visible but she wasn’t crying...rather, there was a smile on her face when she said, "I am not afraid...until you believe in me, I fear nothing."
Austin heaved a sigh before he kissed the crown of her head and whispered something.
Soon the soldiers stepped forward and ushered to get moving.
Under the crime of murdering a student, Valerie Corwon was arrested.
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- And now, she would become a true Villainess—kidding.

chapters.title: Chapter 162 - 161- Cornering Valerie
chapters.content:
Zevarath was a General under the command of the Orc Lord, a figure feared across battlefields drenched in blood.
With the disappearance of the four demon generals and the Demon King, he was hailed as the King of the demonic monsters, one of the highest authorities left in the dark ranks.
