His role was not simply to maintain order—it was to expand. To ensure that when the Demon Lord rose once more, he would awaken to an army vast and powerful enough to crush all opposition.
And for that, Zevarath had set his sights on the most malleable of recruits—children. Young minds, easy to bribe, easy to manipulate.
His task was simple: secure a handful of exceptional young talents, the kind that would be found in this very competition. After all, only the strong made it this far.
Under normal circumstances, such a plan might have been met with fierce resistance. But Zevarath had orchestrated distractions. The Union Council was already overwhelmed, dealing with demonic incursions on multiple shores—a crisis of his own design.
Had the Union Council interfered, matters would have turned problematic. Their Pillars—warriors of immense power—would have been formidable adversaries, even for him.
Which was why he had taken no risks. He divided his forces, sending them in separate directions, keeping the Council stretched thin and engaged elsewhere.
With their eyes turned away, the perfect opportunity had presented itself.
’Now, come to me.’ The demon general had a grin on his face as he levitated in the sky with his arms crossed.
Beneath him was a barrier that was barely visible even to him, even though it was his slaves who chanted it.
The carriage in which his target rested has left the venue.
Just a few minutes and he would get the prized human he has taken so much risk for.
Ever since that day when he fought her, Zevarath had only one thought in his head—what was she doing among humans?
She is strong but has a lot of potential in store. Those few minutes, they didn’t fight but conversed through their weapon.
From that conversation, Zevarath got to know that the woman was wasting her talent by being with these weak ducklings.
She can achieve so much more than she possibly couldn’t imagine.
And for that, he would take her away. She would not thrive while being with those people, especially not that weakling of a fiancé.
[She left. Can you see her?]
Hearing Jasmine’s voice in his ear, Zevarath responded soon,
"Yes, I can see her. Is someone following the carriage?"
It would be a hassle and annoying if someone were to trace her. Although this barrier would be hefty for any strong warrior, Zevarath didn’t want any disturbance in his hunting today.
[No, not that I can see. Even Austin is just walking on the front lawn but shows no sign of following the carriage.]
Zevarath didn’t want to hear about that joke of a man. Although he defeated Stain’s commander, he could never reach the level where he and Valerie would stand one day.
"Keep an eye on everything. I won’t take it long."
[You better not. And start with the chaos in the arena already!]
She barked in his ear, which made him irritated. However, considering it was required to keep the authority busy and the Union Council away from Zevarath, he followed Jasmine’s words.
Commanding his soldiers mentally, he told them to begin throwing the whole venue into chaos.
"Now, Valerie, no one can come between us."
....
Valerie frowned, as suddenly, she felt something weird coursing through her body.
It was an unfamiliar sensation...as if her body was turning sluggish.
She raised her eyes and looked at others with a frown, "Where are you taking me..." There was no chance they were headed to the headquarters. She has visited it recently and knew it wasn’t the route.
The soldiers inside the carriage took out their knives before warning her, "Now, stay calm; otherwise, it is going to hurt."
Valerie’s eyes darkened as she summoned her Shard, and instantly, the soldier beside her attacked her—
"Hey, you-" However, his words faded since his throat and every part of his body were frozen under thick ice.
The other soldier’s eyes widened as he shoved the knife toward Valerie’s face, "Damn you!"
Valerie tilted her and held his wrist.
*CRACK*
A snap it all took before a sharp cry echoed throughout the carriage.
Valerie summoned an ice shard before stabbing the man, in the middle of his head—fast and precise, ceasing his movement as his mind froze.
Valerie was breathing roughly as she looked around.
The carriage had stopped, but she could barely muster up her strength to dash out.
This sensation was extremely overpowering. As if her own body has become the biggest burden to the girl.
Her face was pale as she pushed herself up and jumped out of the carriage—
"Agh..."
—only for her ankle to twist. Her body failed to respond and her bones seemed to have turned fragile.
Not only that, she could barely retain the form of her Shard. Her soul was not responding to her command. This was the first time she had experienced something like this.
"It took me over ten days...to form this barrier."
A voice echoed before Valerie raised her eyes and her Shard in the enemy’s direction.
The red-skinned demon she fought at the shore of Drenovar slowly descended to the surface, with his hands locked behind his back and a confident smile on his face.
Valerie had a cautious stance, even though she deep down knew that unless she converged all her strength in the running away, she would not survive in front of this entity today.
"I have been planning for this day, for so long...and finally, you are here. Tell me, Valerie, do you like my dedication."
"You are not worthy to call me by my name...so shut up and fight." Her tone still held the edge of that day.
And that’s what makes her so interesting in his eyes. This was the first time he had met a human with such a burning fighting spirit.
"You are weakened, Valerie, and my soldiers have completely surrounded this barrier. So neither you can run away nor anyone can come to save you."
Valerie growled, "Who is running away?" Those words were fueled with blood lust as she tapped her spear butt on the floor before several ice lances formed behind her.
Valerie pushed her arm forward before the ice spikes flew in an inhumane way.
Zevarath sighed as he moved minimally yet dodged each lance easily.
Valerie wasn’t done there. She moved her hand, and those ice lances slowly stopped before twisting in the air.
She gritted her teeth in frustration—normally, she wouldn’t have felt so much trouble in spell manipulation
Zevarath didn’t even turn to look at the lances and whipped his tail, to destroy each one of them into small fragments.
*CLANG* *CLANG*
Valerie took several deep breaths, her vision blurring and her mind protesting her from keeping awake.
She fought the sensation and raised her spear.
A huge crystal formed above the demon, of the size of a huge tree.
She didn’t think twice before releasing the hold of her spell and letting the crystal fall on top of the demon.
**BOOOOOM**
Taking advantage of the inhumane’s nonchalance, she turned around and began to run
Her body was throbbing and her heart was audible in her ears.
She did her best to dash into the forest...if only she could get away from this barrier...
"Ah!" Valerie exclaimed as she bumped into something and fell down.
"As I said, my dear, there is no running away from me anymore. You have to submit it today." Zevarath, who had appeared out of nowhere, lowered himself to her face level.
This barrier was made in a way that the stronger one’s Soul energy was, the weaker they would get. That explains her current condition.
"Now, stop resisting."
However, just as he held Valerie’s hand and pulled her up—
**RUMBLE**
The ground shook. The connection with his soldiers, who were protecting the barrier, started to get cut off. A strong presence approached Zevarath from behind...a presence he couldn’t ignore.
It was then, Jasmine’s voice echoed in his ears,
[It was Austin’s clone! He has gone after you!]
Zevarath didn’t have to hear it from Jasmine to know.
The Demon could see him
The same weakling he thought was beneath consideration as a potential threat.
However, right now, Zevarath could tell that the boy had gotten stronger....much stronger than before.
"What do we have here—" Zevarath wanted to start with a formal greeting, but suddenly—an arrow pierced through his chest.
"Huh?" Zevarath tilted his head as he looked at the arrow and found his body turning black for some reason.
The hand that was holding Valerie crumbled into dust, and soon his legs gave out, too.
Austin approached the demon before picking up an unconscious Valerie in his arms.
Looking at the fading demon before him, Austin relayed, "You shouldn’t have touched her."
The last thing Zevarath saw before his ultimate demise was a pair of hollow eyes that held no emotions.
"You...aren’t a human, are you?"
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Damn...Austin used it without another thought. He touched Valerie after all.

chapters.title: Chapter 163 162- Touched her
chapters.content:
The moment Austin looked at the dead body, he knew that it was the doing of a demon, who wanted to frame Valerie.
Since he wanted to play along with the demon's plan and let Valerie get cornered, he thought of pretending to suspect her.
After all, to face Valerie, the Lord of Demonic monsters would most probably show up himself.
However, the moment he turned toward Valerie and saw those tears, he knew he couldn't keep up the act.
Later, when she was getting taken away, Austin knew that there was someone among the students keeping an eye on him and might try to obstruct him from chasing after Valerie, that's why he used his recently acquired skill [Mirage Sync] to create a clone of himself which did nothing but just to walk back and forth with a stressful look.
Leaving that behind, he dashed in the direction where Valerie was taken.
'This side…doesn't lead to the HQ.' Austin was not surprised. He expected Zevarath to corner Valerie to take her down.
He followed the general direction where the carriage was headed…however, the forest was too vast and it would be a disaster if the Demon General reached Valerie all alone.
She was strong, yes; however, not only does Zevarath have a huge demonic army, but he is an S-rank entity himself.
'Where they could have gone…' His feet slowly came to a halt as he realized he was reaching nowhere.
Although they left only a few minutes before Austin made an exit, the carriage seemed to have just vanished out of nowhere.
Austin kept searching left and right and climbed the tallest tree in the vicinity to search for her, however, it was fruitless.
'Where are you Valerie…' There was no sound of battle or magic nearby which was making him bothered.
Two S-ranks colliding should release enough battle cry for him to detect her location.
But at the moment, it seems he was standing in a graveyard…too eerily silent.
It was then,
*CLINK*
His ring gave a slight jolt to his finger before Austin raised it to his eye level.
The middle section of the ring parted and a small golden light orb rose from the ring.
Austin's eyes widened—he completely forgot about this artifact—and if it got activated then it meant,
'Valerie is in trouble…' As absurd as it sounds, that is the truth.
Austin followed the light orb. Thankfully, the faster he got, the light orb matched his pace.
"Huh?" Suddenly, he felt something heavy descending on his shoulder and the sky darkened for some reason.
However, he didn't have the time to assess the situation as he saw a horde of monsters advancing in his direction.
Austin looked at the light orb and found out that it was getting brighter—meaning, her condition was worsening.
Austin gritted his teeth and hurled himself into the air.
Blinding light erupted as he summoned Raijin, lightning surging around him like a raging storm. The demonic beasts hesitated, their snarls turning to wary growls.
Austin swung his axe high, his voice shaking the battlefield.
"STAY OUT OF MY WAY!"
CRACKLE!
BOOOOOOOM!
The axe struck down, and a torrent of lightning ripped through the nearest beast. The current exploded outward, leaping from one monster to the next. Flesh burned, bones snapped, and in an instant, a dozen creatures were reduced to smoking husks.
Austin made his way through the horde, burning anything that landed in his sight.
He was a furious being, his attention completely converged at reaching his beloved.
*SCREECH*
He didn't have to move much further before he came across two figures.
Austin was prepared for a battle to at least weaken the Demon…however, the moment he saw the Demon holding Valerie's hand…Austin's head turned blank.
His eyes were parted wide and his body completely stiff.
'Touched her…touched her….my Val…how….why….how can he…she is mine…he shouldn't have…why….why….WHY DID HE TOUCH HER?!'
Without him realizing Austin had summoned the Death Vow in his hand, pulled its string and a name left his lips,
'Zevarath…'
"What do we have here-" The demon General turned to look at him, while still holding his Valerie.
However, he couldn't finish his words as the flaming arrow pierced through his chest, and slowly, his body began to crumble.
Austin advanced toward them before picking Valerie in his arms.
Looking at the creature with immense anger still visible in his eyes, Austin said, "You shouldn't have touched her."
Zevarath had his eyes widened as he muttered, "You…aren't a human, are you?"
Austin didn't stay there to listen to the nonsense before he walked away with Valerie in his arms.
She looked feverish, but in his arms, she wasn't frowning anymore. She subconsciously snuggled closely in his arms and mumbled something inaudible.
Austin had a serene smile on his face as he manipulated his Shard and Wisp to take down any demon that approached them.
It was a scene out of a fairy tale—the Prince came to take his beloved from the evil being.
And now, he was taking her back.
------*------
"Huh?!" Austin was shocked to see the situation at the venue.
The tournament grounds were in ruins. Screams and roars clashed, echoing through the air. Smoke curled from burning stands, and the stench of blood was thick.
Students ran in every direction—some clutching wounds, others dragging fallen friends. Some didn't move at all, their lifeless bodies scattered across the battlefield.
Wyverns swooped down, their wings kicking up debris as their claws tore through anything in their path. Demonic beasts rampaged, crushing bones beneath their massive limbs. Snarling monsters lunged at terrified students, fangs sinking into flesh.
Swords clashed. Spells crackled. Blood sprayed. The ground was littered with broken weapons, shattered armor, and bodies—human and monster alike.
The once-proud arena was now a slaughterhouse.
"Your Highness!" Just as Austin was thinking of bringing Valerie to safety and fighting the monsters, someone came rushing in their way and addressed Austin.
"Aren't you the head maid? Why are you here?" Austin recognized the woman. She was the head maid and someone who served the queen…but why was she here?
"Your Highness, the carriage in which your parents were traveling to the venue is attacked. All the soldiers are dead and only Sebastian is keeping them safe." The lady spoke in between her labored breathing. Looking closely, there was a severe injury on her forehead, too.
Austin gritted his teeth…how many are there actually?
He was contemplating where he should bring Valerie so she could remain safe when suddenly he found a demonic wolf heading in their direction.
"SHIT!" Austin summoned his Shard, ready to fight the monster…but the pace of the monster slowly slowed down, and ice began to creep its way from its paws to its head.
Austin blinked in surprise before he looked down at his beloved.
She was looking up at him with a soft smile before she moved her face and kissed the corner of his lips, "Go protect them…I will handle things here."
Austin parted his mouth to say something but then he just nodded and kissed her forehead, "Stay safe."
--------**--------
A/N:- Thanks for reading. Drop a comment.
And please check my new book.

chapters.title: Chapter 164 163- Impossible battle
chapters.content:
Sebastian doesn't know why, but the place that was supposed to be the most secure venue on the human side was under attack.
He was one of the soldiers escorting the two royalties to the venue so they could meet their son and witness him in his glorious moments.
Sebastian was pretty much excited, which was quite unnatural for him, to bring them to the venue.
Despite whatever had happened until now the man still hoped this family wouldn't break—that explains his excitement.
However, en route, they were attacked by several demons one after another. They weren't demonic humans whom he fought back in Drenovar. Rather, they all were pure-blood demons from the other side.
*SQUELCH*
He swung his dagger and slit the throat of the goblin that lunged at his back.
**BOOOOM**
Ducking under the fireball, he threw several throwables in the mage's direction, which exploded upon contact.
'There is no end to this...' Sebastian was quite anxious at the moment. All the soldiers have died and inside the carriages were the two most important individuals of Eryndor.
He had no idea why the Union Council hadn't sent any reinforcement. And if this continues, Sebastian has a bleak hope they will survive today.
Although the King is a strong warrior, his current condition would prevent him from fighting for long.
Sebastian barely caught his breath. The bodies of demons piled up around him, their blood staining his armor. He was panting, his vision shaking, but there was no time to stop.
A screech tore through the battlefield. A massive demon, its skin like a cracked stone, charged at him.
Sebastian twisted his body, dodging the first swing of its jagged blade, but the second came too fast—SLASH!
Pain exploded in his side. His armor cracked, blood spilling down his waist. He stumbled back, but before the demon could strike again, he lunged forward, driving his dagger into its eye.
The creature howled. Sebastian twisted the blade and yanked it out. Black blood splattered across his face. He shoved the dying demon aside and turned—
A spear shot toward him. He barely managed to deflect it, but the force sent him crashing to the ground. His ears rang. His body screamed.
Suddenly a blade zapped toward him.
Sebastian's eyes widened. His heartbeat reached the limit.
Just when the blade was inches away from penetrating his skull,
*Shling*
A sword intercepted the projectile.
A sword well too familiar to him.
"*Gruooh*" The orc howled as the man jumped forward and plunged the blade inside its massive head before hanging with the blade, he split apart the monster from the middle.
Cedric cleaved those monsters that ran towards them, before he stabbed his sword in the ground, before a stone wall erected around them.
Extending his hand toward the fallen butler, the King said, "There is no end to them."
Sebastian took his hand, and while groaning a little, he got up.
The barrier was already breaking and in the distance, Sebastian could see that demonic wyverns were advancing in their direction. And once they are here...not any barrier would be able to stop them.
Both men knew that this was a losing war. However, neither of them was ready to give up until their last breath.
Inside the carriage, Sophie clasped her hand. All she could feel right now was anxiety as she kept praying for help to arrive.
'Please...anyone....'
"Here they come!" Cedric voiced as he held his sword with both hands, as he saw the wyvern opening its maw—flames gathering at the opening.
Sebastian was ready to push away the King and put himself before the man he had sworn to protect—but then,
**CRACKLE**
A figure appeared above the wyvern.
Sebastian's eyes widened.
That person was familiar.
He lunged into the air, tightly holding his weapon.
"Young master...." Those words were followed by a massive explosion.
**BOOOOOOOOOM**
His mace, a mountain of steel in his hands, came down like judgment itself. It caved through the wyvern's skull in an instant, splitting it open down to the neck. Bone exploded. Brains and blood burst outward in a thick, steaming spray.
The sheer force drove the wyvern straight into the ground. The air howled as its massive body plummeted like a meteor, its bones shattering on impact.
Flesh ripped apart as the ground caved beneath it, leaving a crater filled with crushed organs and splintered remains.
The rock barrier shattered as Cedric saw his son on top of the dead wyvern, his mace still plunged inside the dead demon's head.
Austin glanced at the duo, before throwing something at Sebastian, "Drink it and relax."
Sebastian caught the vial and was about to offer assistance—
*Crackle*
—only to find Austin disappearing.
Lightning tore the sky apart as Austin vanished.
He reappeared amid the enemy ranks, Raijin crashing down. A thunderclap shook the battlefield, and in an instant, dozens exploded—bodies ripped apart, bones shattered, flesh burned black.
Before the smoke cleared, Ashen Maul was already swinging. It slammed into the ground, and a wave of scorching embers erupted outward. Armor melted. Skin charred. Screams filled the air before being swallowed by the roaring inferno.
A spear shot toward him.
Austin tilted his head.
His Shard grew in an instant, slicing through the weapon, the wielder, and three more behind him. He twisted, flicking the blood off as the dagger shrunk back.
An army of hundreds stood before him.
Austin stepped forward.
Raijin flashed. Thunder roared.
The slaughter began.
A massive warrior lunged, blade raised.
Austin vanished—then reappeared above him.
Ashen Maul crashed down. The warrior collapsed like a crushed insect, his armor melting into his flesh as flames devoured him from the inside out. The ground beneath him caved, charred black, leaving only a smoking crater.
Arrows rained from above.
Austin flicked his wrist.
His Shard expanded mid-air, spinning like a bladed storm. Every arrow shattered. Every archer fell in pieces. He caught the dagger mid-spin, barely glancing at the corpses before moving again.
Seeing his son weaving through the forces, Cedric had his eyes parted wide. He could barely trace Austin with his eyes and those three weapons he handled with such brilliance.
"Sebastian...is he really Austin?" Cedric couldn't help but ask.
Sophie was shocked beyond belief as well, as she saw the scene beyond comprehension.
The same child who had a hard time killing his first demonic beast two years ago...was slaughtering these demons as if they were nothing but ripen crops ready to be cultivated.
Whenever Austin went, destruction descended.
The monsters were no longer focused on the carriage but on the human that was restlessly moving through the battlefield and decreasing the numbers at an inhumane pace.
**BOOOOM**
Austin ducked under the flame ball before he turned towards the mage who had been hiding behind its comrades until now.
"Let me handle him-" Cedric offered help, thinking that his son was too far from the mage.
However, "It's okay," As Austin said, he brought his raised hand down, and instantly something zipped down the air before an explosion occurred
**BOOOOOM**
Every being near the target was damaged by the boomerang that came crashing down at a pace that was impossible to dodge
And the mage at which it was directed...well, one might find the evidence of its presence if they collected its splattered innards and blood.
"*GRUOOOOOH*" Suddenly a loud roar echoed, sending a shiver down Sophie's spine as she got out of the carriage.
"Austin!" She shouted as she saw the ten-foot-tall golem a few meters away from him.
Austin was genuinely surprised to hear that voice...and the concern laced in her tone
However, nothing stopped him from lunging at the monster.
Index finger tightly pressed against the thumb.
Austin appeared before the Golem in a heartbeat, jumped in the air, and then
**FLICK**
A single flick it all took before the golem's face exploded.
The strength behind that flick was powered by the strength of [Retaliation]
Even Sebastian couldn't hide his shock this time.
...that monster was at least C-rank...
Cedric and Sebastian's mouths were parted while Sophie covered her mouth in pure astonishment.
Seeing their in-field commander exploding into nothingness, the other demons started to feel it.
A very primal feeling that every being is born with.
Fear.
*CLANG*
*Dhak*
Their weapons dropped, and their body shook.
Austin's cold eyes turned towards the horde, and instantly, the demonic beast jumped away and began to run.
Austin sighed seeing them rushing away from the battlefield.
'Seriously...I thought they were driven by their goal...turned out, they are just like humans.' Austin thought as he summoned all his weapons back to him and stored them in the 'Inventory'.
Just as he squatted to pick up his beloved boomerang, he heard a very familiar and feminine voice,
"A-Austin.." He didn't need to turn to know who called him. For fifteen years, he has heard this voice daily.
Austin didn't turn towards them before saying, "Follow me. I will take you to safety."
Sophie's raised hand lost its strength as she lowered her head.
Soon her husband came to her side and held her shoulder.
She looked at him before Cedric gave a soft nod to her.
The trio soon began to follow the blond Prince.
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 165 164- Miracle
chapters.content:
"Sir Austin, are these the comrades of the same demon who attacked back in Drenovar?"
Hearing the question from the butler, Austin was surprised, as he asked, "How did you know?"
"The amount of Demonic Beast was more that day as well, just like today." Sebastian made a wild guess.
Austin was impressed, as he said, "You are right. It was the same Demon. Well, the Demon General is dead so we just need to take down the remaining troops." With his tone dimming a little, he added, "Hopefully, without a leader, they must have turned disarray."
Sebastian asked, "Did Lady Valerie put down the General?"
Austin thought for a moment, before nodding, "Yeah." There was no point in saying something here that could even turn the most faithful, suspicious towards you.
Neither of them was unaware that the Demon General was an S-rank and someone who held years of experience. Even Valerie was having a hard time dealing with him the last time they fought.
And it was a fact that a battle head-on with that demon without any assistance would have been impossibly difficult. Despite his advancement to B-rank, the difference was still quite profound.
So in a way, Austin did the best thing in that situation by shooting him down.
"Why aren't you taking that potion?" Now that Austin noticed it, the butler hadn't taken the potion until now.
"It looks expensive and wasting it on someone like-"
"Again, with you belittling yourself. I already told you that you are my family member, Sebas. So stop thinking and gulp it down."
Those words made Sebastian stunned for a moment, and if not for the emergency, he might have frozen at his place.
The man behind the two, the King of Eryndor, smiled warmly upon hearing those words.
He glanced at his wife and found the edges of her lips slightly arched as well.
'Despite our negligence, you have grown up as a fine young man,' Cedric felt his chest swelling in pride.
Soon, the four of them reached the venue.
Austin wasn't surprised to see that the number of demonic beasts had dropped significantly.
They just needed someone who could be their pillar of hope. Someone who can lead them.
And looking at those huge ice glaciers, and hundreds of frozen bodies, Austin knew his woman became their hope.
"Sebastian, wait here with them. I will go and check on others."
Sebastian nodded and before Cedric could have said something, the blond Prince disappeared.
"In the past, I could have easily won a race against him..." The smiling King voiced.
....
Inside the venue, things were getting under control.
Austin came across several demonic humans who were killed or frozen.
It was apparent that Austin failed to realize when Zevarath penetrated the defenses and started influencing students.
The number of Demonic beasts he found dead was simply overwhelming. The horde he fought previously was like ten percent of this.
"Rudolph!" Austin shouted as he found the familiar black-haired guy huffing while standing over a dead wyvern.
His armour did nothing to protect or even cover his upper body and the boy seemed wounded from several spots.
Rudolph jumped from the beast before landing before him, "It's chaotic." He said. And when someone as chaos-loving as Rudolph seemed so tired and stressed, then that means that the situation was indeed quite overwhelming.
Austin patted his soldier, "But we survived."
Rudolph heaved a sigh, "Yeah...but not everyone was lucky." As he said, he looked at those students who fought rather than trying to run away but, unfortunately, couldn't survive.
Austin also felt sorrow seeing those many young ones meeting unfortunate and premature ends.
"Austin!" Suddenly, Rhea came rushing in their way, her face smeared with tears.
"What happened?" Austin asked as he held her arm, and stopped the girl before she could tripped with the momentum.
"President...she....please come with me."
The duo didn't delay a moment before dashing in the direction she led them.
Thankfully, all the monsters were dead, or they fled; otherwise, they wouldn't have been able to reach their destination this quickly.
"Shit..." Austin muttered, uncharacteristically cursing despite his noble background as he took in the scene.
Rudolph's eyes widened, too, as they saw a gaping hole open in the President's stomach, and her belly completely caved in.
Her face was pale and the person was evidently in a bad condition.
"Please stay with me..." Sheldon, who usually retains his calm demeanor, sobbed as he held his lover's hand.
Any potion, any bandage they applied...nothing worked. It was impossible to save her now.
The demon that attacked her, injected a lethal poison and tore a huge chunk of her body.
If not for her status as an Awakened she would have died long ago.
Austin could feel her fading soul energy.
Every person has a tense expression on their face.
Austin looked at Valerie and found a frown of concern on her face.
...how can he forget that in the whole academy, the only friend Valerie made and someone who understands Valerie despite the latter's conservative nature, is the president.
Austin heaved a sigh, before telling them, "Form a ring around me and block me from plain sight." As he said he approached the President and knelt beside her.
Sheldon looked at the blond Prince, a very faint and flickering spark of hope ignited within him.
The others glanced at each other, unsure what this was about, when suddenly, Valerie commanded, "Just do what he says!"
They stiffened and instantly formed a ring.
Austin looked at Sheldon, who was still unmoving, before he said, "Trust me, Vice-president, I will save her."
The silver haired took a deep breath and gave a firm nod before he also stood up and covered Austin.
The blond Prince acted to insert his hand inside his jacket before he pulled out a vial from his [Inventory] which was filled with red potion.
"We tried every grade of pot-" Elara, who was about to roll her eyes at the fruitless attempt, stiffened when she felt killing intent from across her.
She took a strong gulp and decided to remain silent.
Austin took a deep breath and uncapped the vial before tilting Annabelle's head slightly.
"Drink this, prez." He faintly whispered before he began to pour the content into her mouth.
It was the same elixir he used to save the former king of Drenovar.
He still had five, so he decided to use it to save his wife's friend.
Nothing was allowed to make his Valerie sad.
Annabelle had enough strength to only move her throat and intake the potion.
Just as the first gulp passed down, the wound on her belly glowed with bright red illumination.
The darkness from her veins slowly receded and her complexion slowly improved.
Before everyone's eyes, Austin pulled a miracle that day.
°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 166 165- Hopeless
chapters.content:
The Union Council finally sent reinforcements to handle the situation at the venue.
Those students who were critically damaged were taken to medication. And those who died...well, their families are getting contacted.
For the time being, they have arranged refugee camps outside the venue which was heavily guarded by the Council soldiers.
No one has come to take responsibility for this whole situation, nor anyone showed up to apologize.
Hundreds of families would weep today after seeing their child lying in a coffin.
They could have never imagined that a tournament arranged by the strongest organization would take their child away from them.
Nobles were coming from different nations, that's why special tents were arranged for them to stay. And a high-ranking officer was continuously guarding their temporary residence.
Food and other necessary supplies were provided, and transportation was arranged to take the students and their parents back.
Students were provided with much smaller tents but had enough space to fit at least seven people.
Inside one of such tents, there were a few familiar faces that could be seen.
Austin was standing beside Rudolph as they leisurely discussed the battle they faced.
Annabelle was resting in the tent as well, with Rhea beside using a wet cloth to cool down her burning head.
It wasn't anything serious but overuse of Soul Energy has caused commonly known backlash. With proper treatment and diet, she would recover in a few days.
Elara and Ryan were in different tents, with their friends. And Valerie was also not present currently.
Sheldon brought Annabelle's hand to his lips before kissing it softly, as he asked, "How do you feel now?"
It might be the seventh time in an hour that he asked that.
Annabelle couldn't stop her lips from curving in a smile as she assured him, "I feel good now...just feeling weak slight which will go away."
Sheldon heaved a sigh before he got up and faced Austin.
The blond noble also turned in his direction, before he heard the Vice-President saying, "I cannot thank you enough for what you have done, Austin. I promise, any time in your life, you need my help, I will do whatever I can."
Austin smilingly shook his head, "Truth be told I saved her because her death would have pained me immensely."
That response made everyone surprised, as the pinkhead asked, "Why...is that Austin?"
Austin's eyes turned solemn with his lips still stretched in a smile as he said, "Her death would have made Valerie sad...and it's extremely painful for me to see her sad."
Many people died before he arrived. Many people died before his eyes today. Austin knew a lot of those. And just like others, Annabelle was just his acquaintance as well.
He wouldn't have saved her using that priceless elixir if only she didn't have a close relationship with Valerie.
Annabelle warmly smiled at the junior before she slowly muttered, "Regardless of the reason, I am thankful that you provided me with another chance. Thank you."
°°°°°°°°
In the other tent, four people could be currently seen sitting and one standing.
The King and Queen of Eryndor were sitting beside each other on chairs.
Their loyal butler, Sebastian, was standing diagonally behind the King with his hands behind his back.
The atmosphere was neutral, neither too relaxed nor too tense.
It might be the first time after their engagement that these three people have gathered in one place and gained the chance to have a private conversation.
And just like that day, a day before their engagement, the Queen was silent today as well.
"I heard what you have done for him. Your support and your encouragement have helped Austin a lot. When we failed as his parents, you remained standing by his side. And for that, I cannot express how grateful I am."
Valerie had a keen eye for people when they spoke. She could tell when someone genuinely meant their words and when they were merely saying them out of obligation.
And currently, the King was speaking each word from his heart.
"I was just there to support him, but the first step was taken by him." She simply responded.
"Still, it means a lot. Ah, by the way, I heard you two were summoned to the Council Headquarters recently?"
Valerie nodded, "It was for questioning. Austin defeated Hellstain's last soldier, which garnered their attention."
Hearing about Drenovar, Sophie bit her lip.
She recently got to know what they faced when they were in the ocean-side country.
Seeing the unease on his wife's face and how eagerly she wanted to ask Valerie about Austin, the blond one said, "Valerie...I know it's unfair for me to ask this...but can you help mediate the situation between the two?"
Cedric has already realized the fact that Austin was extremely attached to his fiancée. It can be seen how he brought water and medicine for her, checked on her condition twice, and even pulled a medic just to be on the safe side.
That's why, the man asked the girl hopefully.
Valerie's eyes were drawn to the ground, her shoulders slumped.
It would be a lie to say she didn't expect it.
However, rather than giving a direct answer, she told them, "As his fiancée and childhood friend, I realized something peculiarly sweet about him."
With a soft smile, she added, "Although he never says it, Austin actually loves having his birthday celebrated. He loves it when people sing for him, cut a cake, and give him presents. Although he never said that, I saw it in his eyes."
Turning her eyes toward the two adults, she asked, "Naturally, as his parents you must have noticed it too, right? Yet, neither of you even considered bringing him a gift. Forget about that, Your Majesty you didn't even send a letter to him."
Sophie's eyes were moist, and her head leaned down. She couldn't refute a single word she said.
She has neglected Austin. Her life revolved around Aiden in the few years after he returned.
Despite receiving so much news about him, she never reacted like a mother. She was just like any passerby who heard the news and gave a few comments before carrying on with her life.
Cedric held his wife's hand in concern, however, right now, he can do only that much. Not all the responsibility fell on her. He was wrong too.
Valerie sighed, "There was a time when he used to show emotions such as sorrow and anger...but now, he has buried those emotions deep within his heart somewhere and has become numb to any emotion that connects him to his family."
Valerie didn't want to say so much to the two, however, she couldn't stop herself.
The grief she has seen in his eyes. And the hopelessness he suffered from...she can never forgive these two for that.
Valerie got up from her seat before saying, "I can only help you gain his forgiveness when you forgive yourself for what you have done, Your Majesty. Excuse me."
Leaving those words, she turned around and left.
°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading. Drop a comment.
And also, please check out my new book.

chapters.title: Chapter 167 166- Condition
chapters.content:
'Someone is looking for you,' Was what the student of Avalon Academy said before dashing away.
However, she could have never guessed that the person asked for Rhea would be, "Parkinson."
The only reason she didn't react on impulse and summoned her Shard was because of the presence of so many injured students around who were, naturally, quite traumatized after what happened.
And there were soldiers as well, who would come here instantly and stop Rhea from harming this person.
Parkinson had his head on the floor. However, his apologetic posture didn't faze Rhea as she asked, "Why are you here? Want to harm Austin again?"
Parkinson raised his head, "I swear in the name of my parents I didn't kidnap him!"
Rhea rolled her eyes, "Yeah, right. So Austin made someone beat him up and packed himself inside the room, right?"
Parkinson gulped. If he nodded here, then she would leave immediately. That's why, he said,
"I don't blame Austin but there could be someone else, right? Someone who wanted to frame me? Someone who wanted to injure Austin?"
Rhea had a firm expression, her arms crossed.
Parkinson was relieved that she didn't leave instantly, as he got up and looked at the pinkhead.
"Look Rhea, I know you are hurt after seeing those things in my room. But trust me, I meant no harm. It was just my one-sided obsession-"
"Please don't talk about it." A displeased expression contoured her face as she stopped him, "I really don't want to remember that day."
Parkinson's shoulders slumped. There was no help in it. He could never justify why he had so many things in his room dedicated to her.
Rhea remained silent for a moment before she said, "Okay, let's assume that it wasn't you who kidnapped Austin; then what about the proposal your parents sent to exile Austin."
Parkinson's eyes widened, as he said, "I really don't have any clue when they extended that proposal to Eryndor."
Rhea had an expression that clearly said that she didn't trust his words.
Parkinson continued, regardless, "If you want I can even bring my father to confirm that I wasn't involved in all th-"
"Parkinson, listen." Rhea stopped him again, and this time, her voice was devoid of any emotion.
Her pink dead eyes looked down on him, as she said, "I know what kind of person you are, so whatever I say here won't affect you. You will still chase after me."
With her eyes narrowing, she added, "That's why, if you want my forgiveness, then bring me one of the Demon Generals' heads. If you do that, I will forgive you."
Parkinson's mouth parted slightly upon hearing that.
Even the weakest General in the demonic army was at least S-rank. And this was common knowledge.
And for Parkinson who was only A-rank...
"I guess you can't so-"
"I will do it!" With his fist clenched and an unexpected flame of determination burning in his eyes, Parkinson added, "Until I don't have a Demon General's head in my hand, I won't show my face to you again."
With those words, Parkinson turned around and walked away.
Rhea really didn't know why she said that. She had no intention of forgiving him, whatsoever. However, she felt if she gave him an impossible task then maybe he would lose all his hope.
'But I guess this is better ..rather than chasing after me, he can be of better use to humanity.' With those thoughts, Rhea turned around and headed back to the camp.
°°°°°°°°
The soldiers escorted a certain man toward the huge tent where the two most supreme figures of Eryndor were resting.
The man was none other than the King of Drenovar and someone who had sworn revenge on Eryndor in the past.
Those who gazed at the man and recognized him had a fairly shocked expression.
Although the news of the two nations establishing a truce has circulated, it was still not confirmed if Drenovar has forgotten their ages-long revenge.
For the first time, the kings of the two nations were united in one place, which wasn't a battlefield.
The soldiers guarding the tent had a troubled expression as they stood before the tent entrance.
Idris raised his left brow seeing their cautious stance, before he asked, "What's the matter? Can't I meet him right now?"
The soldiers glanced at each other, unsure what they should say.
That brief silence was soon broken by the voice of a young man as he said, "Let him go in. I invited him here."
Austin appeared before them and gave a polite bow to the King, "I hope you are in good health, Your Majesty."
"Austin...ahaha!" The blond Prince was slightly startled having the King hug him all of a sudden. However, out of courtesy, he returned the gesture.
The soldiers protecting the tent, seeing the Prince friendly to Drenovar's Supreme Authority, didn't show any caution anymore and stepped away.
"Please let's go inside." Austin ushered as he gestured towards the tent.
The man nodded before he walked beside Austin and stepped inside the temporary residence.
The King was already informed about Idris' arrival, that's why he didn't give any surprised reaction and just stood there with a solemn look on his face.
Austin stopped a few steps before and Idris continued to walk until he was face to face with Cedric.
Sophie, who was behind the curtain looked between the two nervously.
Even Sebastian was on high alert, just in case.
The duration of silence was short as the black-haired man finally voiced, "It's the first time we are meeting, Cedric."
"Indeed we are, Idris," Cedric responded, mirroring the same tone.
Because of the friction between the two nations for two generations, even the yearly meeting arranged by the Union Council, is done in two phase. And in no same summit, does the two countries participate.
So, yes, despite being rivals for years, it was the first time they were meeting.
Suddenly, Idris pressed his hand against his chest, and slightly lowered his head, before saying, "Before anything, I would like to extend my gratitude to the father who gave birth to such a commendable son. If not for Austin, then I might not have been standing here today."
Cedric was visibly taken aback by the behavior. However, his shock didn't delay him in reaching the other royalty and putting his hand on his shoulder, "Please don't lower your head." He added, "And what you said, then I also feel fortunate to be the father of such an exceptional child."
The two kings stood face to face, however, there was no animosity but genuine appreciation for the boy who was almost half of their age, yet have achieved so many things.
Austin was getting a little shy, hearing the two praising him constantly as he shifted on his feet...when suddenly, his hand enveloped in a familiar warmth.
Austin glanced at Valerie who has a teasing smile on her face as she continued to look at the two Kings.
"Val...don't listen..." He requested. Seriously, it's embarrassing to be praised so much.
However, "It's the sweetest melody to my ears...to hear my Lord getting praised." Winking at him, she added, "Don't steal me from my happiness, my Lord~"
" ⁠⁄⁠•⁠⁄⁠-⁠⁄⁠•⁠⁄⁠ "
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Don't tease my boy, Val. Thanks for reading. Do check my new book.

chapters.title: Chapter 168 167- Family time
chapters.content:
Idris returned to his tent after a few hours of good chatting with Cedric.
They majorly talked about Austin, and despite how much the blond Prince wanted to disappear, a certain someone kept holding his hand until the end.
Seriously, she was exerting strength in her hold!
Now, the only ones in the tent were Austin, his parents and Sebastian.
Lord Corwon and his wife arrived just now and were looking for Valerie.
Austin also wanted to meet them, but Valerie told him to rest for the time being and meet them tomorrow morning.
Austin also didn't insist since right now, the two of them must be too worried for their daughter to have a conversation with him.
Austin's clothes were all burned, but fortunately, "I brought a few pairs of extra night wears, sir." Sebastian informed as he took out blue pajamas from his bag.
Call it instincts or habit, Sebastian packed a few sets of clothes for Austin before coming here.
"Thanks, Sebas." Austin said as he took the night wear, before saying, "Then...I will be going." Austin has already planned to stay in the same tent as his classmate.
Sebastian's expression changed, a hint of grief appearing in his eyes which didn't go unnoticed by Austin. However, he still turned around and just when he was about to walk,
"Won't you stay with us, today?" A voice that held hope and plea, reached Austin.
Austin sighed before turning towards the man, "I...am staying with my friends."
Cedric's shoulders slumped, the man appearing older than his age, as he smiled and was about to nod, when suddenly,
"I-I will go and stay somewhere else...so please be by your father's side." Sophie suddenly got up and suggested.
She knew all too well that Austin wasn't staying here because of her. He had always shared a strong bond with his father, and even when Aiden had manipulated their minds, Cedric's care for Austin had never wavered.
So the problem here was her.
"But Your Majesty where else will you stay?" Sebastian asked in astonishment. Not only were all the tents already full, the person in question here was the Queen.
Cedric also held a worried gaze and was ready to reject her suggestion, when he heard her saying,
"I can just sleep in the carriage. No one will know and-"
"Okay, I am staying. No one need to go anywhere." Austin declared followed by an exasperated sigh.
Seriously, this much drama just for a night?
°°°°°°°
Valerie was...being hugged. It w the same person who usually hugs her. And the grip around her body was quite firm as well.
The lady of the house and Valerie's mother—Corwon Anastasia—was weeping aloud as she embraced her daughter in worry.
"As I said, I am fine, mother." Valerie assured her as she patted her back.
However, it didn't lessen their worries at all.
For some reasons, they got to know from somewhere that Valerie was taken away by the Demon General and was cornered to fight him head on. That explains why they were so horrified.
"Mama was so worried!" The older one cried as she as detached from her daughter and cupped her cheeks, as she asked, "Did the doctor chek on you?"
Considering her daughter's nature to swallow the pain rather than depending on others, Anastasia believed she would have remained nonchalant this time as well.
However, "Austin brought a medic to check on me… so, yes."
That smile on her face helped the duo relax a little. Seeing their daughter unaffected by everything she had faced today brought them a sense of relief.
Anastasia hugged her daughter again, this time softly, as she whispered, "We are glad that he is by your side."
"Mm."
°°°°°°°
Austin had no clue how and why he was sleeping between his parents.
Sebastian left the tent under the pretense of going for a walk, and it was highly unlikely that the butler would return.
And now, Austin was sleeping between the couple for some reason...
"Uh...I could have slept separately you know..." Austin muttered. There was enough space in the tent to accommodate twenty people so he could have found himself a comfortable corner.
However, "It has been while since we united and have a chance to share a long conversation. Don't abandon your old father now." Cedric smilingly chided.
Austin surrendered, "What exactly do you want to talk about?"
"It has been a while since we had a leisure chat like this so how about you start with your trip to Drenovar?"
Austin exhaled a long breath. Guess, there was no helping it.
"After leaving the capital..."
Austin and Cedric continued to chat for an hour. However, it was mostly Austin speaking; telling his father about his experience in Drenovar and also about his match in the tournament.
Cedric couldn't stop smiling even once while hearing his stories.
It was like Austin has been all over the world and has fought varities of entity in so less time.
Cedric never questioned him about his unnatural growth, trusting his son to already have an answer to this peculiarity.
Around midnight, while talking to his father, Austin fell asleep.
Seeing his comfortable sleeping face, Cedric smiled warmly.
His eyes went to his wife and he found her looking at Austin as well.
"Dear?"
Sophie softly said, "Even though we saw each other about half a month ago, it feels like I am looking at him after years."
It felt like, all the anxiety built inside her after Aiden death. All the stress melted while she looked at her son's serene face.
"Why didn't you talk to him?" Cedric asked. She had such a good opportunity to talk to Austin, and seeing how easy going he seemed a few moments ago, Cedric knew Austin wouldn't have ignored her.
However, "No, my Lord. As Valerie said...I can only hope to fill this gap between us, after I forgive myself for what I have done. And I...haven't forgiven myself yet."
Cedric sighed seeing the tears in her eyes.
After she returned to her senses, Sophie had been crying a lot...reminding Cedric of that time when Sophie initially got married to the family.
Because of strict rules and so many things she had to learn as a Queen, Sophie wept a lot. She really wasn't the best hardworker at that time.
And now, she had a different reason to cry.
She was guilty for hurting her child.
She regrets throwing away the boy who once was everything for her.
Sophie regrets it. Everything.
°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 169 168- True savior
chapters.content:
[Next morning]
Everyone was told to gather in the center clearing of the field.
Apparently, someone from the Union Council was about to deliver a speech or something.
Austin was with Valerie as they shared breakfast...which was actually just a banana that they broke from the middle.
They didn't get anything else to eat since most of the food counters were empty when they reached there.
Thankfully, Sebastian was able to save some food, which he offered to his young master. However, Austin told him to take the food to his parents.
The reaction Sebastian expressed was too shiny for his groggy eyes so he got done with the conversation soon.
"Do you want me to bring something for you?" Valerie asked in slight concern.
Austin fought more than anyone else yesterday, and after spending so much energy, he must be hungry. Not to talk about, the actual meal he had was about a day ago.
However, "The nearest town from here is about four hours away. So, let it be, Val." Austin was hungry but he didn't want to trouble Valerie. Even though she was faster than him, reaching the town would still take a toll and quite a lot of time.
And anyway, they would be returning after the Council member gets done with their announcement.
"Hey, Rhea." Austin waved at the girl who was walking in a daze.
Hearing his voice, she jolted out of her stupor and looked at them.
"Good morning. Did you get something to eat?" The sword wielder asked as she smilingly approached them.
Austin flashed the peel of the banana they had just now.
Rhea looked worried and regretful, "I...just finished the sandwiches Rudolph brought. I am really sorry." If she had known she definitely would have shared.
Austin scoffed, "That bastard didn't even ask me..."
"Who knew that the two early wakers would wake up late today." Suddenly, the guy who was called 'bastard' just now, appeared behind Austin.
The blond Prince sighed, "I, actually, woke up early but got busy chatting with Father. I tell you, he talks a lot."
Although he said that, Austin was no less when it came to chatting.
Valerie had a similar reason, "Mom kept talking to me until late night."
Rhea's lashes fluttered as she said, "Talking about your mother, I met her yesterday. Such a sweet person."
After Rhea's unexpected meeting with Parkinson, the pinkhead was walking around aimlessly, when the lady came to her, asking if she was hurt.
Rudolph asked, "Did you meet them, Austin? Valerie's parents?"
The person in question can only shake his head regrettably, "Mother-in-law sleeping, father-in-law is currently with my father and Lord Idris. Never got the chance."
Austin brushed his teeth, took a bath somehow—which was quite a luxury in this condition—and got properly ready for this meeting.
However, when Valerie came to him, she informed him that her father left the tent to meet people and her mother was still in bed.
"Is this really a coincidence, or do your in-laws don't actually want to see your face?" Rudolph teased, only to be glared at by Valerie.
However, the raven-haired didn't stop grinning.
Austin heaved a sigh, as he said, "If they don't like me, I will make them like me. I might become double-minded about anything in my life except for Valerie."
Rhea sighed admirably while Valerie couldn't hide the blush that appeared more beautiful than a setting sun.
"Ah, here they are." Rudolph suddenly spoke as his eyes traveled towards a man who wore a white cloak over his body.
The insignia, on his chest, features a deep blue circular background, symbolizing resilience and wisdom. At its center, a majestic phoenix rises with its wings spread wide, its feathers shimmering in a gradient of fiery gold and crimson.
The man had long black hair and seemed quite young.
Once he stood on top of the makeshift stage, he addressed everyone,
"Good morning. I am Aston—one of the Council Heads."
Those last few words earned collective gasps from people.
It was a rare sight—a Council Head standing openly before the people.
Most never even learned their names before they were quietly replaced by new ones.
As the guardians of humanity's survival, they held knowledge too dangerous to share and bore secrets too heavy to reveal. For that reason, they rarely stepped into the public eye.
That was why the crowd stood frozen, their faces filled with awe and disbelief.
Ignoring their reaction, the man continued, "I feel deeply remorseful after learning about what you went through last day. Because we were short on personnel we couldn't protect those whom we swore to defend. I am even ashamed to stand before you all."
The man began, his voice polite but didn't leave an impact on Austin.
He was saying nothing from his heart. He can even sense slight disappointment in his eyes...or maybe Austin was just reading him a little too much.
'The Council only respects the strong...and surely, those who died held no importance to them.' Although it was cruel, following the tradition of prioritizing the strong had always been helpful for them.
The man continued, "We have already contacted the family of the deceased ones, and they will be compensated for their loss."
Rudolph snickered upon hearing those words and the people around him knew the reason behind that reaction.
There could be no compensation for death. One cannot heal such a grave and permanent wound by a few coins or consolation.
But well, there was nothing these few teenagers could do or say here.
"Now, coming to the conclusion, I would like to thank the person who helped us all to overcome this disaster. The only one who not only saved the students from the army of demons but also exterminated their leader."
Turning his eyes toward Valerie, Aston said, "Please join me, Miss Valerie."
Everyone began clapping for the girl when that name came out.
Everyone who survived witnessed how gallantly Valerie fought and saved the other students—even those who shunned her previously.
She was that raging flame of hope that eradicated hopelessness from others' minds and gave them a concrete reason to push forward.
Under the appreciation of everyone Valerie, without hesitation, walked towards the stage and stood beside Aston.
"I would like to show my humble gratitude for what you have done, Miss Valerie." The man bowed his head and for the first time, Austin saw the man not masking his emotions.
He was genuinely elated to share the stage with her.
However, Valerie ignored him completely, and while facing the students, she declared, "Although I defeated those demons yesterday, the only reason I arrived there at that time was because of a certain person."
Her words surprised people. Lord Corwon also raised his brows as he heard his daughter adding,
"When I was taken away from the venue under the accusation of killing someone, I was pulled inside a barrier which weakened me to the point where I couldn't even stand on my feet."
Those words were extremely more surprising than her last statement. An S-rank weakened to the point she couldn't balance herself?
"The enemy though, wasn't weakened. After all, he was the one who formed a barrier so near the venue without the Council noticing anything."
Aston's smile faltered as he looked at the lady beside him with a wary look. What is she talking about now?
Despite the mixed reaction she received, Valerie didn't stop from disclosing the truth, "The person who came to save me, then brought me to the venue and even saved his parents from hundreds of Demons is Austin. I know many of you won't believe my words, but your opinion doesn't matter. I know in my heart that if not for him, I and you all, wouldn't have been standing here today. That's all."
Saying so, she stepped down the stage
When she went there, people were applauding. And now that she was returning, there was utter silence.
No one said anything after that until Aston decided to change the topic,
"Carriages have already been..."
Austin didn't pay attention to the man and kept looking at his girl, who stood beside him with an expression that showed nonchalance.
"What did we talk about, Val? That you will not reveal to others about it?"
Valerie looked at her fiancé. Her eyes were dead serious, which even startled Austin, as he heard her saying,
"You deserve to be praised. I am tired of people badmouthing you and since I am forbidden from freezing everyone, I want them to know how great my man is."
Hearing her displeased tone, he yielded right away, "....okay."
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Well, thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 170 169- The forgotten past(1)
chapters.content:
Students were either heading home or returning to the academy.
Those who lived in the capital were taken straight to their homes by carriage, while those from distant or hard-to-reach places had to stop at the academy first, where further transportation would be arranged.
Naturally, every academy was in turmoil after the incident, and classes had already been suspended indefinitely.
"It's almost half of what we saw during the first round..." Rudolph muttered under his breath as he saw the students filling the carriages and departing for their destination. A safe place.
"What about you?" Rhea, who was standing beside him, asked with her hands folded.
Maybe it was because she wanted to divert her mind from the scene before her, she turned towards Rudolph.
Along with the students, the dead bodies were also transported to the graveyard. And that scene...pricked Rhea's heart with a thousand needles.
People in her hometown deemed her someone who could save humanity from the disease called demons. However, all she could call herself right now was 'disappointment.'
Rhea, once again, panicked in an emergency situation.
Her mind was all over the place, trying to save everyone but failing miserably. It was not until Valerie arrived that she felt that everything would be fine now.
However, when Rhea left her hometown, she never intended to rely on others.
So even though the situation had been resolved, a bitter feeling lingered—once again, everything had fallen onto Valerie's shoulders.
"Rhea?" Rudolph softly called out, his hand resting on her fragile trembling shoulder.
The pinkhead broke out of her daze as she shook her head and said, "It's nothing. Anyway, are you returning to the Capital?"
Rudolph understood what was weighing on her mind, but offering comforting words now would only come off as irritating.
He knew this because if someone told him, "You did what you could," in a moment like this, it would only make him more frustrated.
Some battles are meant to be fought alone.
And the one raging inside Rhea's mind was hers and hers alone to win.
"Father sent a letter through Sebastian. He couldn't come because of security reasons but he expects me to return as soon as possible." Rudolph doesn't generally receive a letter from his father. Not only that, he even used a strict tone in his letter which made it clear that Rudolph couldn't delay his visit back home.
Rhea nodded, "You should go. I will also return to my hometown as well." It has been a while since she met her favorite neighbors and had lunch at her favorite bakery.
And considering her current mental health, she really needs some healing.
"Rudolph." Suddenly, Austin called out from a little far away.
Rudolph gave him a nod before he turned towards Rhea. Heaving a sigh, he rested his hands on her shoulder and said, "Okay...take care. Have a safe journey."
Rhea smilingly nodded before she went on her toes, and out of the blue, she gave a kiss on his cheek.
It was a sight to witness.
A big six-foot-something guy having his eyes round and ear tips dyed in red.
Rhea grinned at him, as she said, "Thanks for saving me. See you later."
°°°°°°°°
Inside the carriage, along with the two royalties that came from Eryndor, there were four more people.
The carriage was big and was pulled by four horses.
On the left side was Valerie, sitting between her parents.
On the right was the King and the Queen with their son on the side.
It was an awkward atmosphere in the carriage since the most talkative one, Valerie's mother, was quite nervous in the presence of the Queen.
Anastasia was acquainted with the Queen. However, she hadn't met her ever since 'that' happened. And now, the lady of the Corwon family has no idea how she should approach Sophie.
The first person to speak, amidst the awkward silence, was Adam, "Austin...I'd like to apologize to you."
The blond Prince was taken aback by the statement, as he said, "W-What happened, Sir Corwon?"
He really didn't have a clue why the older one suddenly lowered his head.
Adam didn't hesitate in confessing, "I, actually, suggested Valerie break the engagement a few weeks ago. Thinking that you are not a good match for her."
Austin released a mental 'ooh' upon hearing that. He heard about that from Valerie.
Apparently, Aiden brainwashed the man into believing that Valerie was not suited with Austin and that she should leave Austin.
The actual reason why Aiden's life thread was prematurely severed was because of this move. His attempt to separate Valerie and Austin caused the bastard to lose his life.
"I am truly apologetic. I was blinded by doubts and tried to..." With his shoulders dropped, he added, "But soon, I realized how utterly I was wrong. Nothing matters to me more than Valerie's happiness and you, son, you are her happiness."
Austin released a soft breath, his eyes drawn to the ground.
Slowly, he raised his eyes and glanced at Valerie.
Her beautiful lavender eyes were fixated on him.
There was no explanation Austin needed to make to convince his father-in-law. From what it appeared, it seems he has already accepted him.
Turning towards Adam, Austin said, "Thank you for trusting me, Sir Corwon."
Adam flashed a soft smile when suddenly, his wife voiced, "You call him so formally, but I won't listen to you until you don't call me 'Mom', Austin."
That gained a soft chuckle from Cedric and Sophie also smiled in glee.
Austin was slightly embarrassed but he didn't shy away from calling out to her, "Okay...mom."
Anastasia's face lit up with joy—but before she could utter a single word, an overwhelming, nightmarish presence crashed down upon the carriage.
SCREEEECH!
The carriage lurched to an abrupt stop. Bodies were thrown forward as if an invisible force had shoved them.
A suffocating pressure filled the air. Every breath felt like inhaling thick, rotting sludge. The passengers sat frozen, their faces drained of color—except for the two teenagers. Unlike the others, they had already stared death in the eye before. Even so, the sheer weight of this presence made their skin crawl.
Cedric's throat tightened. His body refused to move.
"This… presence…" he whispered, his breath shallow. Even inside the magic-resistant carriage, the miasma pressed in, squeezing the air from his lungs.
"Agh… d-dear… I—" Anastasia clutched her stomach, her body convulsing. A sickening retch tore from her throat as she doubled over, barely able to keep herself from vomiting.
Outside, something was waiting. Watching. And it was hungry.
Austin glanced at Valerie and both of them instantly shot out of the carriage.
"Austin!" Sophie called out, but it was already too late.
Austin and Valerie turned in the direction from where such an upsetting sensation was arriving—and soon, his body froze in disbelief.
Eight feet tall, a monstrosity that shouldn't have appeared here in the human realm.
Bulging muscles, red blood-like skin, tattoos crawling like veins, and two long tusks that reached half of its face.
Every step it took, the ground trembled. The greenery around the monster was fading under the miasma it released.
Although the inhumane was far away, Austin saw and recognized it the instance he saw it.
One of the four demon generals—The Orc Lord.
'How the hell did it awaken?!'
°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- For your information, every single General is above S-rank. Drop a comment and pray for them.

chapters.title: Chapter 171 170- The forgotten past(2)
chapters.content:
The four Demon Generals under the command of the Demon King were nothing less than impossible opponents for Rhea to defeat.
Even against the weakest General, the Succubus Queen, Rhea had to take the support of several comrades and had to go beyond her limits to put her down.
It wasn't just the off-power scaling of humans and demons; these beings have lived for thousands of years, so they hold experience several times more than humans.
Every single Demon General was above S-rank, however, humans are restricted to that rank.
And this one, the Orc Lord, was the second-strongest Demon General.
However, canonically, he shouldn't have awoken around this time. There was definitely something wrong...someone pulled the strings from the shadows and now, they were facing a catastrophic danger.
"Sir?" Sebastian also appeared beside them, a deep frown marring his face.
The butler could tell just by a glance that this opponent was far stronger than any being he had come across until now. Not even the Demon General who appeared in Drenovar, exerted such an overwhelming force.
And the most astonishing part—the demon wasn't affected by the sun, at all!
"Sebastian...you need to take them away." Austin voiced and his tone clearly signified that he wouldn't ask again.
Sebastian clenched his fist and looked at the opponent again.
Inside the carriage were two unawakened ladies, and a man who was still recovering. Under these circumstances, they would be severely damaged just by being present near the battlefield.
Valerie had already summoned her weapon—the mythical armament—Shiverfall.
Unlike the time she faced Zevarath, her Shard was shining brightly under the sun.
Sebastian made the decision soon.
He turned towards the carriage and was about to take the carriage away when suddenly, Cedric and Adam jumped out.
"My Lord...you should-"
"No, Sebas. This battle is not something we can run away from. That being is a terror that can threaten a country all alone." The King voiced in a stern tone, his Shard appearing by his side and his eyes never leaving the figure of the huge demon.
Adam told the butler, "Just bring the two ladies to safety...they have fainted."
Sebastian followed his orders and took them away.
Back in the battlefield, Valerie seemed prepared.
This opponent was stronger than the Demon General she fought back in Drenovar. However, at that time, she had to hold back because of the Headmaster's warning. However, now,
"Absolute Zero."
—she cannot hold back.
*CRACK*
A huge circle appeared near the Orc Lord before the temperature began to fall at an abyssal rate.
Trees, grass, and even the birds within the circle froze and fell.
However, the demon didn't stop. Its body was protected by the dark miasma it was radiating.
The violette clenched her fist, before she dashed toward the Demon.
Austin was still standing, ready to assist. Even in his Berserk state, he wouldn't be able to help her right now. So he was rather focused on backup and assistance if needed.
The moment Valerie dashed forward, the frozen ground beneath her shattered, leaving a trail of ice shards in her wake. She closed the distance in a blink, her spear already thrusting toward the Orc Lord's chest.
CLANG!
The impact sent a shockwave through the air, yet the spear barely dug in. The demon's thick, miasma-coated skin resisted the attack. Snarling, the Orc Lord swung its massive axe down. Valerie twisted her body, the blade missing her by inches as it split the frozen earth behind her.
She retaliated.
Her spear spun, striking like a viper—one, two, three precise thrusts aimed at the beast's joints. Each blow landed with enough force to tear through stone, yet the Orc Lord barely flinched.
BAM!
A backhand strike sent Valerie skidding across the battlefield, her boots carving deep grooves in the frost-covered ground. She didn't stop. The moment she regained her footing, she launched herself forward again.
"Frost Fang!"
Ice erupted along her spear's edge as she slashed at the demon's side. The freezing force spread, creeping up its arm, but with a violent shake, the miasma burned through the ice, shattering it like brittle glass.
The Orc Lord roared and swung again. This time, Valerie couldn't fully dodge.
CRACK!
Pain shot through her side as the axe clipped her ribs, sending her flying. She crashed through a frozen tree, splintered and ice raining down. Blood dripped from her lips, but she didn't stop.
Valerie raised her hand before several ice glaciers appeared in the air.
The Orc Lord flinched as it also looked up, however, the thick legs of the demons didn't allow it to dash away in time, before,
**BOOOOOOOM**
A devastating blow that sent tremors kilometers away, resonated once the three glaciers dropped on top of the demon general.
A huge crater was formed on the surface, and if not for Adam and Cedric taking each other's support in time, they would have fallen down by the shockwave.
This wasn't the first time Austin had seen Valerie's power...but every time, she left him baffled.
The dust cleared, and the three huge ice chunks were still dug into the ground. And just when Valerie thought, that the battle might be over,
"*UGOOOOOOOOOOOH*" A cry that shook the battlefield echoed from beneath the ice.
CRACK—CRACK—BOOM!
The glaciers trembled before they exploded from within, shards of ice shooting in all directions. A monstrous figure emerged from the debris, its body covered in deep wounds, yet still standing.
The Orc Lord's dark miasma surged violently, evaporating the frost clinging to its skin. Its crimson eyes burned with fury as it stomped forward, shaking the earth.
Valerie barely had a moment to react before the demon charged—a blur despite its massive size.
WHAM!
A massive fist struck her mid-air, sending her rocketing backward. She hit the ground hard, rolling several times before skidding to a stop. The taste of blood filled her mouth, but she forced herself up.
She wasn't expecting the demon to be that fast.
The following battle was a blur.
The two figures clashed at a pace that Austin could only follow with his eyes.
Neither side was too overwhelming for their opponent but both of them were receiving damage gradually.
A very disturbing thought suddenly assaulted Austin's mind...was the Orc Lord really that weak?
There was no doubt that Valerie was strong but the Orc Lord Austin expected should have been much more devastating and overpowered.
'Is it because of its early awakening?'
Regardless of the reason, soon Austin found his chance to act.
Summoning Ashen Maul he dashed forward.
The Orc Lord came flying his way, so utilizing the chance he lifted the mace above his head and swung down with full force.
BOOOOM!
The impact was earth-shattering. The moment the Ashen Maul connected with the Orc Lord's shoulder, an explosive shockwave erupted, sending a deep tremor through the battlefield. The demon's body lurched downward, its massive frame barely holding against the devastating blow.
Valerie didn't waste the opening.
CRACK—CRACK—CRACK!
She struck three times in quick succession, her spear glowing with icy blue light.
Each thrust drove the frost deeper into the demon's body, slowing its movements as its flesh began to stiffen.
The Orc Lord roared and swung wildly, forcing both of them back. But its movement was visibly sluggish now.
The miasma was growing and healing its wounds which clearly told that the Orc Lord would recover in no time.
Valerie glanced at her beloved, and that gaze told him what she was about to do.
She was, once again, going to defy the flow of time.
°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- I hope you all liked the chapter? Once again, it would take some time, not much now, for Austin to reach that stage. Drop a comment

chapters.title: Chapter 172 171- The forgotten past(End)
chapters.content:
"Huh...?" Selner jolted.
Turning her eyes toward the window, she felt a very familiar but ominous presence arriving from the distance.
The book from her hand fell to the ground. Her throat turned dry and her eyes trembled.
This presence...how can this be...
Her body moved on instincts.
She couldn't be wrong.
It was him.
The greatest foe that humanity has ever come across.
The being who even threatened the immortal beings.
The threat that never should have appeared.
The Great Demon Lord—Astaroth.
'How can he appear now?! Wasn't there some time left?!'
Selner's mind was in turmoil. There was still more than a year left for the Demon Lord to resurrect. And no event has transpired that could hasten the rebirth.
She has been keeping an eye on the collision between the two sides, that's why—ah.
'Did the battle between the Demon General and Austin get his attention?'
Regardless of the reason, Selner didn't pause even for a moment until she reached the source of the malice.
Her eyes caught the scene of the battlefield.
The frost clung to her body as she approached the clearing where two familiar individuals stood side by side.
She could see a few more people in the background, but her focus was majorly on the prison of ice hanging mid-air.
'So she unlocked the Stasis Lock...' Selner narrowed her eyes—this spell shouldn't have been within the grasp of the little girl yet.
"Selner?" Austin, who caught the levitating figure to be familiar, called out.
The Witch slowly descended to the ground, her attire making it evident to those who don't know her that she is a Council Member.
"Valerie...Austin, are you two alright?" Adam asked as he and Cedric advanced towards the two children.
Austin gave a soft nod, before he directed his eyes toward his father, "What about Sebastian and the other two?"
"I told him to take them away. Don't worry, they are safe." Cedric assured him.
"You knew about the thing?" Valerie suddenly asked the older lady in a stern voice.
Considering how hastily she arrived here, Selner must know something about the Demon.
Austin, hesitantly, asked, "Madame Selner, was it one of the Four Generals?"
"Huh?"
"What...!" Cedric and Adam, who naturally were aware of the Four Generals, couldn't hide their shock upon hearing Austin.
The four infamous Generals were the pawns of the Demon Lord who ruled over the planet a thousand years ago.
They were given different regions to govern, and their cruelty was etched in every history book.
The era of darkness. A period where humans were treated as merely livestock and slaves.
And a being who was previously killed by the renowned Hero Kane, re-appeared a thousand years later?
Except for Austin and Selner, the other three were shocked beyond belief.
The short-haired lady looked at the Orc Lord trapped in the ice prison before she voiced, "Although the presence it holds is similar to a Demon General, he doesn't seem as strong as what I assumed."
Austin frowned but didn't say anything here. However, in his mind, he agreed with her.
This Demon General was quite weaker than its canon counterpart. Although it was still quite stronger than Austin, it didn't live up to its position as the second-strongest General.
"Maybe because of its early awakening?" The Witch thoughtfully muttered as she kept looking at the ice prison.
Valerie was about to ask something, but a sound caught her attention.
*CRACK*
Valerie's eyes parted wide as the ice prison she formed started to crack from within.
Selner also was shocked since she was aware of the strength of the spell she used.
Austin summoned his Shard on instincts and prepared for another battle.
