However, only the head of the Orc Lord was liberated from the Ice Prison.
Then—
Its skin rippled.
The thick, red flesh twisted as if something inside was crawling beneath, forcing its way out. The orc's once-monstrous face began to sink inward, its jaw stretching unnaturally, bones snapping and reforming with sickening pops.
Red eyes.
They flickered open—deep, ancient, and burning with malice.
Cedric's breath hitched as he watched the last remnants of the Orc Lord melt away, its coarse features replaced by something far more horrifying.
Long, white hair cascaded down, tangled and ghostly. Its strands shimmered with an eerie glow, swaying though there was no wind. The skin beneath was wrinkled yet unyielding like ancient parchment stretched over something that refused to die. Deep lines marked the face, carved by centuries of hatred.
Selner's knees nearly gave out as the transformation was completed.
And then—
It looked up.
A wave of dread rolled over them, crushing, suffocating. The sheer weight of its presence made the air thick as if the world itself recoiled from this being's return.
Austin clenched his fists, his instincts screaming at him to move, to attack—but his body refused.
This wasn't just a demon.
This was something far worse.
Something that had no right to exist—yet did.
The Demon Lord Astaroth had appeared.
"Ah... how long has it been since I've breathed such fresh air?" His voice was not of this world—low, guttural, and crawling into the bones of those who heard it. A voice that did not simply speak, but commanded silence.
His presence alone was suffocating. It pressed down like an unseen weight, the sheer malice of it making even Valerie—who had faced horrors beyond count—feel something she had never truly felt before. Fear.
Her body refused to move. Her breath hitched. The very Shard in her grasp wavered, flickering like a candle before a storm. This was not an enemy she could fight. This was something beyond her.
"You... how are you here?!" Selner's voice snapped through the paralysis. Her fists clenched, magic crackling around her as she instinctively threw up a barrier. It flickered under Astaroth's mere presence.
The Demon Lord slowly turned his gaze toward her, his crimson eyes gleaming with nothing but disdain.
"Woman, silence." His words were laced with venom, yet spoken with effortless authority. "You are beneath my notice."
Selner gritted her teeth, magic surging, but before she could retaliate, Astaroth's attention shifted.
To Austin.
"Ah… there you are." His lips curled into something resembling a smile, yet there was no warmth—only a predator's amusement. "How fortunate. For the first time in my long existence, I feel inclined to thank the gods."
Austin's blood ran cold. That voice. That knowing tone.
Why…? Why did the Demon Lord speak his name with such familiarity?
Astaroth's eyes gleamed with something dark. "You have changed, haven't you?" He tilted his head as if studying an amusing trick. "You care for the weak now. You even killed one of my foot soldiers… all for her."
His gaze slid toward Valerie, slow and deliberate.
Austin's hands clenched into fists. "What do you want?"
Astaroth's response was a low hum, his eyes shifting skyward as if considering something inconsequential.
Then, he looked down—directly at Austin.
"I could be merciful." His lips curled wider, exposing too many teeth. "I could spare your precious humans. Your friends. Even the ones you love."
A moment passed. Then, he spoke again.
"I will even return to my slumber... if you wish."
The air itself seemed to be still.
And then—
"All you have to do…" His voice dropped lower, silkier, yet crackling with malice. "...is slit your own throat and die like the worthless dog you are—right here, before me."
A deathly silence followed.
And for the first time—Austin felt his heartbeat thunder in his ears.
Amidst the growing silence, Valerie suddenly raised her Shard and thumped the rear end on the ground.
The ice prison started to break under her command, breaking the body of the Orc Lord along with it as well.
**CRACK**
The demon lord grinned, his face fading into darkness, as he voiced,
"Glad to hear that answer....hunting you...will be much more fun."
Once the Catastrophe was silenced, Austin instantly turned toward Selner and said,
"I think you have a few answers to share. And I need to know them. Now."
°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 173 172- Thank you
chapters.content:
Selner dreaded this moment.
She knew she would be asked about it. The past which Austin no longer remembers.
However, this was a little early and Austin was not ready to hear everything.
'But what can I do?' The Demon Lord appeared out of nowhere and after hearing his words, Austin surely would be eager to know what connects him with the Dark Lord.
She could not turn her face away from him here, or Austin probably would try to find the answer from a different source. And that could be dangerous.
"Madame Selner?" Austin called out again; impatience evident in his voice.
The short-haired woman heaved a sigh as she said, "I will tell you. Be prepared in the evening."
Austin hurriedly asked, "How will you find us?" He wasn't sure, as of now, where they would be heading after this. That's why, he asked.
Selner shook her head softly, "You don't need to worry about that. I will find you."
Hearing that tone, and those eyes, Valerie shifted subtly on her feet with her gaze narrowing.
Austin trusted her words since there was nothing else he could do, "I will be waiting for you."
With that exchange, the lady disappeared from their sight—which greatly surprised Austin and Valerie since if she actually flew away rather than teleporting, then she might be significantly stronger than what they assumed from their first meeting.
Turning towards the others, Austin said, "We should get going. The sun is about to set."
Adam and Cedric first checked on their child and asked a few things before they headed toward the place where Sebastian awaited them.
Unsurprisingly, the old man was just far away to not get caught in the battle but close enough to keep an eye on the battle.
His protective side was impartial.
They boarded the carriage and decided to first take shelter.
A lot has happened and Austin really needed a few hours of mental rest.
°°°°°°°
'System, anything you can share?' While they were seated in the carriage and were heading to their destination, Austin asked the system.
They weren't going to the Capital but rather to Corwon's territory. It was nearer than the Capital, and right now, everyone wanted some rest.
Valerie was currently leaning on Austin, her eyes closed and her breathing calm.
She hadn't had any food since morning and then that battle where she utilized an S-rank spell. Naturally, she would be exhausted.
There was a brief pause before the System informed us,
[There is no information to share, host.]
Austin wasn't expecting anything from the System. He has, until now, received no information about this world from the System. Whenever he asked, it was rather restricted information or something it didn't know.
Austin sighed. His source of information was limited. And he was excessively impatient to know his answers.
This was the first time Austin saw the Demon Lord. He has only heard about him in both lives.
Even Rhea never came across the final foe and before Luke could have reached that stage, he died.
So yes, this was the first time for him to see what the human's greatest enemy looked like.
However, rather than focusing on Valerie—who was one of the strongest human warriors—he was more focused on Austin. Rather, it would be more appropriate to say that Astaroth never looked at Valerie and focused more on Selner and Austin.
But why him? Did he do something? Was his unnatural growth caught the attention of the Demon Lord? He highly doubted that.
Then what? The System?
'Can be possible. However, why did it seem, he knew me?'
He had a lot of questions, but right now, all he could do was repeat the questions again and again.
"We are here, young master," Sebastian informed and that call alerted Valerie as she woke up.
"You okay?" Austin asked in a hushed tone.
Valerie softly smiled and gave a brief nod, "Mm...sorry, I fell asleep."
"Nothing to worry. Now let's go inside."
Valerie nodded before she stepped down from the carriage.
"Agh..." As Cedric tried to get up, he groaned.
"Father?" Austin asked.
Cedric shook his head, "Just my feet are numb...I will be fine."
Regardless of what he said, Austin went to support him.
Adam carried his wife and got down from the carriage followed by Valerie and Austin, who supported his father
Sebastian took Cedric from Austin, "I will help him," he said before draping his Lord's arm over his shoulder and heading towards the mansion.
Austin climbed the carriage and picked his mother in his arms.
She was still sleeping and that was better. After what she went through, her mind needed some hours of rest.
He slowly hopped off the carriage and fortunately, she didn't wake up.
Once he stepped inside, he saw Valerie waiting for him.
She gestured towards the maid before she bowed.
Valerie led him to the gallery on the left.
They didn't talk a word, mutually deciding to prioritize the Queen's sleep now.
Once they reached the room, Valerie opened the room for him, before Austin stepped inside.
It was a pretty huge room with a king-sized bed across from the door.
He gently lay the lady on the bed.
Her face was slightly pale, and there was something caught his attention.
A pearly droplet near the corner of her left eye.
Her expression was slightly tense as well, as if she was having a nightmare.
Austin took a deep breath before wiping her tears and whispering, "You are safe."
He didn't know if she was actually asleep since his words soothed her anxiety, and the frown on her face slowly receded.
Her complexion turned normal and the lady started breathing normally.
Valerie, who was at the entrance, couldn't stop herself from smiling at the sight.
Although the Queen failed to be a good mother, Austin didn't fail her as a son.
Austin soon got up and turned towards his beloved, as he asked smilingly, "Are you disappointed?"
Valerie shook her head, "I fell for you again."
Austin was flustered for a moment before he pulled her by her arm and said, "Not a great time to tease me. Now show me your room."
Now Valerie was flustered, "Y-You are going to stay there?" Her heart rate elevated by that thought. She didn't know why, but sharing the same bed on which she had always dreamed about him....it felt so wrong but so exciting at the same time...
"Haha...I just want to see your room." They weren't married yet, that's why staying in the same room would not be liked by Valerie's and his parents.
Valerie released a sigh—that contained both relief and disappointment—before she began leading him to the upper floor.
"My lady, good to see you back." A certain maid was standing before Valerie's room and gave a brief bow to the girl with a smile on her face.
"Ah, Miss Sally. How have you been?"
"I am quite well. Thank you for worrying, Miss Valerie."
Valerie nodded before she realized she hadn't introduced Austin to her.
"Austin...this..."
"I know. Your first teacher and someone who taught you baking. The only person you freely conversed with was when you were a child. She came to the Capital once, I remember."
Both Valerie and the maid were surprised to hear that Austin remembers the details.
And the surprise elevated when Austin bowed his head and said, "I am extremely thankful for being there for Valerie. She told me how you were always there in her bad times, helping her and encouraging her. So once again, I am thankful for what you did for her."
The older woman's eyes turned moist seeing the boy before her.
She actually was aware of their worsened relationship after Aiden returned. The last time Sally saw Austin, he was ignoring Valerie and didn't even eat the cookies she brought for him.
That broke Sally's heart and since that day, she couldn't stop disliking the Prince.
However, today, all those years worth of hatred melted instantly.
Bringing her hand on Austin's shoulder, she warmly said, "Don't thank me...just keep Valerie happy. It would be more than enough for me."
Austin raised his head, a smile extending his lips, as he said, "I will, Miss Sally."
°°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- I hope you all liked the chapter. Drop a comment and check out my new novel.

chapters.title: Chapter 174 173- Your past
chapters.content:
"For now, I have no clue." This discussion was taking place in the reception hall of the mansion.
The people involved in these were the King, the man of the house, Valerie, and Austin. On the side, Sebastian remained standing in silence.
The content of the discussion, surely, was the Demon General that appeared today.
"I think the Union Council has already gotten the news by now about the General's appearance," Adam suggested after hearing from Austin about his lack of information about the General.
Truth be told, Austin does know a few things about the Generals and how they can appear on this side without alerting the security, but he kept silent on the matter.
Again, it all comes down to how much he could trust people who are not Valerie.
"The major problem would arise if people get to know about it," Cedric muttered with a frown on his face.
The Demon King arising from death would cause pandemonium. There was no doubt that the world peace would be at risk.
"It's highly unlikely the general masses would know about it unless we or the Council tell them." Austin voiced, believing the battle and what followed it, was not seen by any onlooker.
However, "That could be dangerous, sir." Sebastian voiced, pulling everyone's attention towards him.
The grey-haired man continued, "Informing them in advance so they could actively prepare for the war is far better than keeping them in the dark, only to let a wave of chaos crash down upon them."
Sebastian's suggestion settled in everyone's mind. It seemed like the most rational conclusion.
However, the problem was, "Will the Council allow us to reveal it?" Adam asked in an unsure tone.
The Union Council seeks world peace while tackling all the dangers by themselves.
Naturally, they would refrain from letting the general public know that humanity's greatest adversary has returned.
A brief silence ensued before Cedric said, "We should leave the decision to the Council."
"But Father..." Austin was stopped by Cedric as he said,
"Yes, but we can surely prepare for the war by fortifying our defenses. People might suspect things and the Council might not like our movements, but we need to be prepared for what is to come."
Cedric was concerned about the whole human race since the enemy in question had ruled over the planet a thousand years ago.
However, if the Defensive Pillar of humanity refrains from disclosing about the Demon Lord's revival, as a King, all Cedric can do is to safeguard his territory.
If he can't save the whole human race, he, at least, would ensure that Eryndor survives for as long as possible.
No one said anything against it.
After a brief pause, Austin got up from his seat, and said, "I will go meet her."
There was none who didn't know who this 'her' was, whom he was so eager to meet.
Valerie also got up, naturally, to follow him.
"Are you sure I can't come, son?" Cedric asked in a weak tone.
However, that didn't work on the young noble, "I am pretty sure that she won't like me having people with me. Valerie is an exception."
He didn't explain why Valerie was an exception and bid them farewell.
Sebastian also seemed to want to accompany them, but Austin's response to his father left the man with no option but just to see them go.
They walked out of the mansion with their hands connected.
The weather was pretty nice since the whole territory was surrounded by dense forest.
The low buzzing of crickets and the slow breeze presented a very serene atmosphere for a walk.
Austin still had no idea how Selner would find them, but he had no other choice but to wait for her.
Well, if she doesn't appear before him today, Austin knows where he could find her.
"Are you worried?" Valerie asked him.
Austin raised his brows, "About the Demon Lord?" A nod from her ushered him to add, "Not really. I actually anticipated it. Somehow knew that he would return. However, his familiarity with me indeed worries me."
Valerie had a bitter expression, "That malicious voice...that presence...I only read in books how even a glimpse of that face kept people awake for several nights."
Even Valerie, who was regarded as one of the strongest humans, felt worthless before that entity.
She felt utterly helpless before the Demon Lord. The darkness he radiated wasn't just an absence of light—it devoured warmth, hope, and every shred of belief she clung to. His mere presence was a crushing force as if existence itself rejected the notion of happiness in his wake.
"Ah..." Valerie's focus returned to their joined hands as Austin squeezed hers and softly said,
"I am here, Val."
Valerie's eyes were focused on nothing else but him.
Just simple three words and she felt all the dark clouds from her mind, dispering.
"Should I have arrived late?"
A voice broke their trance as the couple turned toward the woman who appeared before them without a sound.
"Good evening, Madame Selner." Austin has gotten used to people disturbing them when they are having a moment, so he was able to retain his calm while speaking to her.
Valerie didn't say anything and stood silently by his side.
The lady, in response, looked at their connected hands, before asking Austin, "I'd suggest you come with me alone. And trust me, this is for her benefit."
Valerie's hold on his hand stiffened as she narrowed her gaze.
Austin was surprised as he asked, "Can't she hear what you are going to say?"
Selner clearly told him, "What I am about to show you...might break her trust in you. So choose very wisely."
Austin's heart....trembled at those words.
Something that can break Valerie's trust?
Even repeating it inside his head made him anxious.
The very thought of Valerie directing a distrustful look made him gulp in nervousness.
However, on the other hand, "Nothing in the world can make me distrustful towards him. Please tell us whatever you know."
Her voice held no hesitation. And that helped Austin to realize something very crucial.
He trusted Selner's warning more than his relationship. And that is awful.
Intertwining his fingers with hers, Austin spoke with certainty, "Whatever it is, I want us both to witness it together."
That's right. He shouldn't doubt Valerie. She has shown trust in him when the world belittled him. So he should also trust her this time.
Selner sighed, "Your choice. Now summon your Shard and extend it towards me."
Austin and Valerie shared a glance, feeling weirded out by the request, but they followed her words and summoned their Shard.
Once the tip of their Shard touched Selner's hand—the world moved.
Or, to be more precise, they jumped through an invisible portal that threw their bodies at a pace that was extremely excruciating.
"Agh." Austin winced as his feet landed back on solid ground.
Even though it was merely for three seconds, he felt several concrete blocks had fallen over his stomach. Not a pleasant feeling
Valerie also had a bitter expression as she held her stomach and her other hand rubbed Austin's back.
"Common symptoms for someone teleporting for the first time." The Witch voiced in a plain voice as she looked at the two struggling teenagers.
Austin bought two potions from the system before handing one to Valerie.
"Thank you..." Valerie muttered as she consumed the potion.
Once both of them calmed down, Austin took in his surroundings.
It was...a vast clearing, surrounded by sakura trees in full bloom. Their soft pink petals danced in the air, carried by a gentle breeze. The ground was covered in a delicate layer of fallen blossoms, creating a scene that felt almost dreamlike.
The air was fresh, filled with the faint, sweet scent of cherry blossoms. Birds chirped softly in the distance, and the rustling of leaves added to the peaceful silence. It was a place untouched by time, where the world felt calm and at ease.
"Where are we?" Valerie asked in a daze. The place was so beautiful that she was left breathless.
Selner didn't respond to her query, rather, she said, "Follow me."
She began walking ahead of them, and soon, the two teenagers followed silently.
The moment of truth was before them as Selner soon came to a pause.
She raised her hand and for the first time, Austin saw her Shard.
It was a wooden magical staff with a red orb floating atop the staff.
It was nothing fancy but seemed quite detailed and extruded strength.
She raised her Shard a little before thumping the butt of the staff on the ground.
*Ting*
The sound of a bell resonated before the ground began to tremble.
Austin and Valerie looked closely as the ground before Selner began to part from the middle before a rectangular block was slowly pushed above the surface.
Selner massaged her forehead, looking unnaturally tense before she moved to the other side of the block and turned to look at the duo.
Pressing her hand on the coffin, she said, "Don't panic, I request."
Austin nodded as he tightly held his lover's hand.
Selner took a deep breath before she gave the lid a slight push.
The cover slowly slid towards the duo.
Once the lid was completely taken off, Selner nodded toward them to look inside.
Austin steeled his nerves and approached the coffin...only to feel his mind turning numb and the person losing strength in his legs.
Valerie's face turned pale when she saw the dead body inside the coffin.
The familiar blond boy lay inside the coffin. Dead.
The person was extremely identical to the one who was looking at it.
"...w-who is he?" In a trembling voice, Austin asked.
Selner calmly responded, "It is you...or should I say your past self."
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 175 174- The truth(1)
chapters.content:
It was unbelievable.
Although Austin saw himself inside the coffin, he couldn't believe it. After all, it was a dead body. But how can there be two people with the same identity but one dead?
And what about his past? Austin didn't remember a past in which he was involved with the Demon Lord.
It just didn't make sense at all.
Valerie was still quite shaken up, that's why she was breathing deeply to get a grip on her emotions.
Selner, on the other hand, heaved a sigh seeing the two teenagers panicking.
She was expecting something like this to happen, that's why she asked him to take his time to train. She would have met him frequently and told him a thing and two before bringing him here.
After all, knowing nothing about his forgotten past, and seeing his dead body would surely be a little too much.
However, the sudden appearance of the Demon Lord changed everything.
All her plans were ruined, and now, she has to put things into motion, way earlier than she assumed.
"Austin, Valerie, how about we sit down and talk?" Selner suggested, and without asking for their permission, she snapped her fingers, and the lid of the coffin retook its previous position.
They both looked at the lady, before Valerie asked, "Tell me, Selner, was it really Austin?" She dropped formalities since, right now, her mind was converged on what she saw inside the coffin.
Selner had her eyes closed, her finger pressed against her forehead as she said, "I will tell you everything but let's just change the location. My presence here would attract attention, and I don't want anyone else to know about this place."
Austin took a deep breath. He knew that panicking here would only trouble Selner. And since she wasn't resisting answering them, he decided to behave calmly.
"Okay, let's go." He held Valerie's hand and gave her a brief squeeze. He could feel how restless the girl was at the moment—after all, seeing the person she loved dead before her would surely unsettle her heart.
Valerie wordlessly agreed to him and turned her eyes toward Selner.
Selner asked them to extend their Shards again before the trio disappeared from the field.
°°°°°°°°
"Guh ..." Austin winced as he felt the familiar sensation inside his stomach. However, this time it was bearable and didn't usher him to buy a potion.
He checked on Valerie and found she didn't react at all.
The mental shock she felt just now, suppressed her physical pain.
They were back in the Selner's office, in the Headquarters of the Union Council.
Selner offered them some water and hot tea to soothe their stomach.
Austin accepted the water as he and Valerie sat down side by side.
The office was silent as the previous time.
No one came to disturb them, since Selner's magic was not detectable to them.
She can come and go anytime she wants without getting noticed.
The room was engulfed in silence only for a few moments before the older violet-haired finally began,
"I am a Witch, one of eight who exist beyond the grasp of time. Unlike ordinary humans, we wield sorcery that defies all limits—magic unattainable by any mortal."
Although they didn't know why she was talking about herself, the duo were mature enough to not show impatience and silently waited.
"I was also alive at that time when the Demon Lord used to rule over the world. However, since our race never interfered with worldly affairs, neither we were ever bothered nor we ever tried to fight against the Demon race."
Heaving a sigh, she said, "However, one of my sisters and I grew weary of how the Demons treated humans. We witnessed everything—the cruelty, the suffering, the inhuman torment they endured. For them, death was often the only mercy. I have seen it all."
Resting her hands on the table, she revealed, "However, we couldn't intervene in their war alone. Though a few warriors broke free from their restraints and dared to stand against the evildoers, they, too, fell in the end. Take Hero Kane, for example—he fought, he resisted, yet even he couldn't change their fate."
That statement made both teenagers shocked, "Wait! Hero Kane was defeated?" Austin asked in a high-pitched voice. However, it was natural since every book and every praise he heard about the Hero only told how gallantly he defeated the Dark Lord.
And now, this lady relayed that Hero Kane lost a thousand years ago.
Selner responded in a solemn voice, "You can discard my words as nonsense, it's up to you. But I have no reason to defame a person who has nothing to do with me."
Austin's excitement receded as he settled back in his seat. Maybe the stress he has been accumulating has sent his emotions into haywire.
Valerie calmly asked, "Then who defeated the Demon Lord a thousand years ago?"
Selner looked down, as she continued, "Although Kane failed, his efforts weakened the Demon Lord enough for several human societies to break free. As for me, I played a crucial role in disrupting the time flow between the two realms, giving humanity the precious time it needed to regain its footing and thrive."
Selner sighed, "I hoped that another warrior like Kane would arrive so they could weaken the Dark Lord further. Defeating Astaroth never crossed my mind...until he appeared."
Selner's eyes brightened slightly, her lips extending in a soft smile as she said, "An aloof warrior who held strength beyond mortal's grasp. His Shard was the true tool of destruction—a weapon that can slash anything. A true genius by birth and a warrior at heart. Before him, I had never seen a man shining so brightly. He was the radiance of hope for the humans—their symbol of peace."
Valerie and Austin held their breath...since they somehow guessed the identity of the person, even though it didn't make sense.
And as they thought, Selner turned her eyes toward the blond Prince before revealing,
"It was you, Austin Eryndor—the one who grew weary of a mundane life and sought me out, demanding a reversal of time just so you could face the Demon Lord at his peak."
"...."
When was Austin such an overpowered character?
°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- This chapter was short but this seemed the perfect ending. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 176 175- The truth(2)
chapters.content:
Many things didn't make sense.
When was Austin that strong? A born talent? Strong enough to challenge the Demon Lord at his prime?
This didn't make sense since even the original version of Austin didn't show any talent worth being a Hero. It has always been Rhea—the being who was called the reincarnation of Hero Kane.
Then how...
"Madame Selner, can you start from the beginning?" Valerie asked. Somehow, she didn't find it ridiculous after hearing the lady.
Selner exhaled a deep breath as she said, "Astaroth is an ancient evil born from the malice of the deities, a being shaped by the darkness of the immortals. Along with his immense strength, he possesses a wealth of experience that makes him all the more formidable."
Taking a pause, she added, "With that experience, he got a hold on a technique which provided him the opportunity to never meet his end."
With her expression turning grim, she added, "He could split his soul into multiple bodies, and Austin knew it. That's why he sought to travel to the past—to hunt down and destroy most of Astaroth's bodies before they could grow stronger. He was certain that Astaroth would keep a part of himself in hibernation to ensure his survival. By wiping out his past existence first, Austin planned to return to the present and end the battle for good."
Selner spoke in a single breath, her brows slightly tense...as if she was upset.
Austin hesitantly asked, "But...he failed?"
Selner nodded grimly, "He underestimated the being who was born from the malice of deities. Although Austin was able to defeat the Astaroth of the past, he received severe lethal damage in return as well—leaving him with no option but to take his last breath in the past."
Valerie was now slightly irritated, "But how is that Austin related to him? Can you be more clear about it-"
"Austin split his Soul....just like the Demon King," Selner spoke in a stronger tone, "He imitated the technique even though it was forbidden, and divided his soul into four different fragments."
Selner evidently seemed upset about Austin's decision to attempt it, however, if Austing hadn't split his soul at that time, his existence would have perished.
On the other hand, Valerie and Austin were in deep contemplation.
Now...things were making a little sense, even though it still was absurd.
"So the dead body we saw is a part of my soul?" Austin asked, unsurely.
Selner nodded, "That's the third part. The fourth part is hidden somewhere by me. However, you are not prepared to consume the last two parts yet."
"Wait, wait. You said two are left and two are already merged together...but Austin never found the other part of his soul." Valerie spoke with utter certainty.
That statement made Selner look at Austin with her eyes narrowed.
Austin was visibly shaken at the gaze as he heard her asking, "You haven't realized it yet, have you?"
Austin nervously muttered, "I-I have now..."
Selner nodded, "You should tell her as well. The guilt you might be feeling is unwarranted. You never were anyone else but Austin, remember that. You forgot about your real identity but that didn't make you someone else, so stop hesitating and tell her."
Austin took a strong gulp.
That was...one hell of a revelation.
Although Selner didn't say anything straightforward, it was apparent to him what she meant by those words.
Valerie kept glancing between the two but couldn't discern what they were talking about.
In the end, she trusted Austin to tell her everything later.
"When can I absorb the next portion?"
Selner didn't contemplate answering, "Once you reach rank A, your body will be prepared to absorb it."
Austin's eyes turned round, "That's why you were adamant on me leveling up."
Selner nodded, "Yes...and the reason your Soul Energy isn't progressing like your other stats, is because your soul is divided into several parts."
It was amusing that despite sounding so absurd, it all made sense.
The reason why despite trying so hard, his Soul Energy never progressed was because his Soul was limited to a certain growth. He was incomplete since his soul was divided into several fragments.
And he had to prepare his body accordingly to absorb the rest of the components.
'I don't know how I should feel about it.'
....
Regardless of how many questions they might have, Selner brought them back to their starting point.
Before bidding her farewell, she told Austin, "Try to have Valerie's company most of the time, since Astaroth would continue to send Demons your way."
Austin nodded, "I will be mindful."
Selner soon disappeared, and the duo were left alone.
Valerie was silent for a long time, waiting.
Austin knew what she wanted to hear.
Most of the things Selner said, she wasn't able to comprehend.
However, she trusted that her lover would tell her everything.
Regardless of whatever the matter was, Valerie knew he wouldn't conceal it from her.
She trusted him for that.
Austin didn't turn to look at her when he suggested, "How about we take a walk?" It was apparent that he wanted to talk.
Valerie didn't say anything and just held his hand and began walking.
Although they were immensely tired mentally and physically, nothing could stop the girl from listening to the whole truth.
Austin could feel how eager she was.
Well, he couldn't blame her. This was about him and his past.
Previously, Austin has always been hesitant about his past. He always felt that if Valerie got to know that Austin was once someone else, she would feel betrayed
After all, she was in love with Austin, not a foreign entity taking over his body.
The reason why Austin's perception changed toward her...he feared if she knew, she would be hurt.
However, today, Selner gave him the assurance that Austin has always been Austin.
His soul was just sent to a different world.
It also explains why Luke was so great in any sport he played.
And it also explains why his Shard started to show progression after Luke and Austin became one. It turned out, two fragments just merged and strengthened his soul.
It all made sense now.
However, he has to tell everything to Valerie. She deserves to know it.
Heaving a sigh, Austin finally began, "Valerie...I have lived another life, but not as Austin...."
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Should I skip the conversation and add what effect it had on Valerie? Comment and tell me.
And yes, please check out my new book.

chapters.title: Chapter 177 176- First fight(1)
chapters.content:
Valerie didn't know what she should think about as of now.
For the past twenty minutes, only Austin had spoken, and she listened to him.
Not a word came out of her because of shock and realization.
If anyone else had said something like cross-world travel, she might have found it ridiculous. However, it was the person she trusted the most who relayed about his previous life and the things he faced.
By no means was he lying or pranking her since one cannot describe someone's life in such details unless they have lived it.
And there was no reason for Austin to lie to her.
Then that means..."You lived your life as a different person for eighteen years...and then woke up in this world and thought you had taken over the person named Austin?"
Valerie summarised whatever he said until now.
Austin nervously nodded, "Yes. I thought I had become one with Austin, but a part of me was still Luke. That's why I hesitated to tell you about it. I thought you might hate me."
Valerie paused in her tracks and asked again, "And you saw this world as a part of a story, right? That's why you knew that day that if I had been blamed and expelled from the Academy, I would have ended up becoming a demon."
Austin slowly nodded, "Yes...that was the fate that awaited you if I hadn't awoken my second fragment that day."
Valerie's eyes were covered with her hair, that's why he couldn't tell what expression she had at the moment.
With her head leaning down, she softly asked, "Can you tell me something honestly...that day, you didn't come to save me because of love...rather, you pitied me, right?"
Austin's heart turned heavy at the question.
He expected her to ask this
That day...when he went to save Valerie from the accusation of attempted murder, he lied to her that he found an old photo album that made him guilty.
However, at that time, Valerie was just a pitiful character in his eyes who was getting falsely accused, and that could have led to an unfortunate future.
So...the truth was, "Yes, I...pitied you that time..."
*Release*
Valerie's hold on Austin's hand was released.
She slowly looked up at him, her eyes filled with tears, as she asked, "What about now...i-is it love, or are you still pitying me?"
"Val..." Austin was rendered speechless; both because of her question and those tears.
In these six months, after he woke up in the world, this was the first time Valerie was crying because of him.
He dreaded this...he knew that the moment she got to know everything about his past...she would be hurt. That's why, he has been hesitant until now. However, he couldn't have kept it hidden until the end. Especially not after Selner told him that Luke was also a part of Austin.
The silence between them was heavy. Austin waited for her to say anything. However, the moment she opened her mouth, something unexpected came out,
"I need...some time to think." She wiped her tears and added, "I am not upset with you but I need some time to process everything. So let's talk tomorrow, okay?"
Austin parted his lips to say something...to console her or say anything to stop her...however, all he was able to mutter was, "Okay..."
Valerie turned around and slowly walked back to the mansion—
—leaving Austin behind. All alone.
Seeing her distancing back, Austin felt a very familiar sensation assaulting his mind.
Every time his girlfriends broke up with him, it felt the same. The sense of loss and the dread of not recovering from it.
However, this time, things were severely more profound. He felt a part of him was lost seeing her walking away.
He didn't know what outcome would this whole situation lead to...however, at the moment, his mind was filled with negativity.
He has hurt his beloved. The girl he promised to always keep safe and happy was crying and was in despair because of him.
And that thought continued to gnaw at him, making him empty.
'Guess...I should do some training...' He mindlessly opened the third dungeon, and dove into it.
°°°°°°
Valerie returned to her room.
She couldn't answer her father properly, and when he asked where Austin was, she said he would be back in a few minutes.
So many things were going on in her mind that she barely registered when she fell on her bed.
Her eyes were still open but she wasn't moving.
So many things to process but she didn't have any idea where she should start from.
Should she prioritize her concern that the Demon Lord would come after Austin? Or should she think about Austin's revelation of him having another life.
He...saw her going through a tragic past, which ushered him to take her side at that time.
He actually didn't have feelings for her but felt sympathy for her and what she could become.
And all the time, Valerie felt that she was loved by him. That her feelings were reciprocated.
She didn't know why but she was feeling sad right now.
Maybe because of all the things she faced today, she wasn't able to think rationally...otherwise, she would have recalled how she was thankful to Austin for giving attention to her.
At that time, she was content with him showing concern for her even if it was fake.
However, right now, her mind was not making sense. Maybe because of the dead body she saw today, her emotional wavelength was all over the place.
She couldn't think straight and was experiencing severe despair.
Holding the ring he placed on her finger, she closed her eyes and fell asleep.
'I will...think about it once I wake up....'
Not so long after, Austin was recovered at the gate of the mansion—unconscious and barely breathing.
°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- This won't continue for long. You know me, I don't like to drag .
And about Valerie's reaction, then I tried to keep her 'human' with that reaction. Thanks for reading. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 178 177- First fight(2)
chapters.content:
[Alert!]
[The host has exceeded the—]
Austin ignored it. The System had warned him before. It never mattered.
The dungeon was drowning in fire and chaos. Magmadons swarmed—towering, lava-spitting lizards with claws like jagged blades. The ground trembled as they crawled closer, their molten breath turning the air blistering hot.
He had already cut down more than thirty. It wasn't enough.
A Magmadon lunged, its molten tongue snapping toward his face. SZZZT! Austin twisted just in time, but the heat seared his shoulder, burning through his armor. The pain barely registered before another beast slammed into him from the side. CRACK! His ribs screamed as he crashed into a jagged rock, blood trailing down his lips.
Still, he didn't stop.
Raijin pulsed in his hands, lightning coiling around the axe like a living beast.
A Magmadon roared and lunged—he met it head-on. His axe came down like a thunderclap, cleaving the monster in two. Lava spewed from its corpse, splattering across his leg. The pain was instant, white-hot, but he pushed forward, tearing into the next beast before it could strike.
Another clawed at his back—flesh tore, blood splattered, but he just gritted his teeth and kept moving.
One. Two. Three more fell.
His vision blurred. His body was breaking. But his axe still swung.
Lightning surged, and he became a storm of death—unstoppable, merciless, drenched in the blood of his enemies and his own.
The System's warnings kept flashing. His wounds kept piling up.
Austin didn't care.
He just didn't want to think about what had just happened. If he thinks about Valerie and the way she left him, his mind will start repeating the worst outcome of the situation.
A life without Valerie.
He couldn't stop himself from assuming that since Valerie knew about his past and also the fact that he didn't love her all this time and lied to her, she would abandon me.
Truth be told, he couldn't blame her since this was a betrayal, and she had the right to be angry at him.
However, breaking up with him? No, Austin won't let it happen.
'There is no life without you, Val…' Just as the realization struck, the System forcibly ejected him from the dungeon, leaving a barely conscious Austin near the entrance of the mansion.
Austin remained lying there for a few minutes, when suddenly,
"Young master?!" A familiar voice resonated and reached Austin's ears.
Sebastian.
Sebastian came out to check on his Master since the lady(Valerie) returned to the mansion, and without answering anyone properly, she dashed toward her room.
Sebastian was worried since, despite how absurd it sounded, from her behavior, it seemed that Lady Valerie had a fight with her fiancé.
However, Sebastian never expected that in these few minutes, his young master would get into such a state.
He hurriedly picked Austin in his arms and headed inside the mansion.
"Sebastian?!" Cedric, who was conversing with Adam, exclaimed upon seeing his son being carried by Sebastian.
The butler hurriedly stated, "He seems exhausted and is barely breathing. We need to call for a healer."
"I have one at the residence. Bring him to the room, I will call the medic."
Sebastian nodded before, under the guidance of a maid, he brought his young master to a room on the ground floor.
--------**-------
"Ah…"
Valerie woke up in a daze, the dryness in her throat making her swallow hard. A burning thirst clawed at her, urging her to move.
She pushed herself up and reached for the glass of water beside her bed. As the cool liquid slid down her throat, her thoughts settled.
Now that she had gotten a few hours of sleep, her mind was clearer—no longer the chaotic mess it had been before. But clarity came with something else…
A sharp, unshakable guilt.
She could think properly now, and thinking meant remembering—remembering the way she had left Austin alone.
Her chest tightened.
'Will he be sleeping…?'
A desperate urge surged within her—a need to see him, to make sure he was okay.
Without hesitation, Valerie got out of bed and made her way toward the door.
It was close to dawn, the faint glow of morning barely creeping into the halls. She wasn't surprised to see maids moving about, their quiet footsteps echoing in the stillness. But something made her pause.
There was… something odd.
A few of the maids weren't just passing by—they were circling a specific room, exchanging worried glances as they moved with quiet urgency.
The room was close to where the King and Queen were staying.
A frown marred her face as unease crept into her veins. Her heart began to pound faster.
Her feet moved before her mind could catch up.
Down the stairs, past the flickering candlelight, toward that room.
And then she saw him.
Sebastian stood near the entrance, his normally composed expression lined with worry.
"Lady Valerie…" His voice was hushed, cautioning—warning.
But she didn't stop.
She ignored him, her brows furrowed, and stepped past the threshold.
And then—
"…Ah."
The breath left her lips.
The sight before her made her freeze.
On the bed lay a single person. His face was unnaturally pale, his chest rising and falling in uneven breaths. Labored. Weak.
Austin.
Cedric and Sophie turned toward her, their own expressions heavy with unspoken emotions.
But Valerie barely saw them. Her world had shrunk to the one person in that bed.
Her lips trembled as a whisper escaped—fragile, filled with disbelief.
"How… did this happen…"
Sebastian stepped toward her before speaking in a quiet, measured voice.
"We found him near the entrance last night. It seems he was involved in a battle... or perhaps it's the aftermath of yesterday morning's confrontation."
The words barely registered. They felt distant, as if spoken through water.
Valerie's feet moved on their own, bringing her closer to him.
She looked at his face.
Pale. Vulnerable. Unmoving.
He had been sad when she left him. And now…
Because of her.
Because of her actions… he ended up like this.
Her throat tightened painfully.
"He has been calling out your name since yesterday..."
The words came from Cedric, his voice hoarse, his exhausted eyes ringed with shadows.
Valerie's breath hitched.
"...W-Why didn't anyone wake me up?"
Her voice cracked—bewildered, but also carrying a quiet, aching complaint.
Tears welled in her eyes.
"You were suffering from a fever," came another voice.
Her mother.
A warm hand draped over Valerie's shoulder.
"That's why we didn't wake you."
Valerie bit her lip, frustration, and guilt warring within her. But she wasn't frustrated at them.
She was angry at herself.
Her fingers clenched, trembling slightly.
"Can you… leave us alone? Please?"
Her voice was barely above a whisper.
A plea.
Cedric and Sophie exchanged glances before the Queen gave a small nod.
"Yes, of course."
One by one, they left.
Sebastian was the last to linger, hesitating briefly before stepping out.
With a quiet click, the door shut behind him.
And then—
Valerie was alone with him.
Valerie sank into the chair beside the bed, her trembling fingers closing around his hand.
Tears continued to slip down her cheeks as she brought his hand near her lips, pressing a gentle kiss against his skin.
"Val..."
His voice was weak, barely above a whisper—half lost in a daze.
Her heart clenched.
"I'm here... I'm not going anywhere," she assured him softly, her voice thick with emotion.
Austin's eyelids fluttered open at the sound.
And then, as his vision cleared, he saw her.
The face his heart had yearned to see.
"Val..." He called again, this time with more warmth, more relief. But then he noticed the tears streaking her face, and his expression faltered.
A faint frown touched his lips.
"...I made you cry again..."
"No, you didn't."
She shook her head, gripping his hand tighter.
"It's just me... repenting my mistake."
She blamed herself.
Despite promising him—swearing—that she would never leave his side, even if the entire world turned against him…
She had left him.
Because she was weak.
"Don't cry, Val… it hurts…" Austin whispered, his voice strained with pain.
Valerie pressed his warm hand against her cheek, her eyes shimmering.
"I won't cry, so please recover soon… I can't describe how much it hurts to see you like this."
Austin let out a soft chuckle, his lips curling into a tired smile.
"Sorry... I went overboard. I just... couldn't bear the separation."
A choked sob escaped her.
She buried her face into his hands, whispering, "Why did you do that? Do I not have the right to be upset?"
Austin's eyes widened.
He hurriedly shook his head. "No, of course you do! It's just… I dreaded that you—"
"That I might leave you?"
Her voice trembled, carrying both hurt and quiet reprimand.
Austin froze.
He had offended her.
For a moment, a heavy silence lingered between them.
Then, without a word, Valerie suddenly got up.
Panic flashed across Austin's face. Was she really going to leave—?
But before he could even lift a hand to stop her, she climbed into the bed beside him.
His breath hitched as she wrapped her arms around him, pulling him into her warmth.
Her soft, familiar scent enveloped him, her steady breath brushing against his skin.
Using his arm as a pillow, she whispered, "I've told you before... Valerie can only belong to Austin."
She tightened her embrace.
"And that fact will never change."
°°°°°°°°
A/N:- And there, the fight between the two got resolved. I mean, I can't imagine keeping them separated for long.
Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 179 178- The day after
chapters.content:
After Valerie sent them away from the room, the four elders and Sebastian gathered in the reception hall, their faces heavy with concern.
Cedric and Sophie sat together, while Adam and Anastasia sat across from them. The room was silent, thick with unease until Cedric finally spoke, his voice low and troubled.
"Does Austin always train this hard?" he asked, turning to Sebastian.
Cedric couldn't shake the image of his son from his mind. Austin had looked utterly drained, barely able to stand. There were no visible wounds, but his whole body radiated pain as if every inch of him was screaming in agony.
The healer's words echoed in Cedric's head—Austin had inhaled too much smoke, his body had been pushed beyond its limits, and severe fractures and sprains covered him.
There was no permanent damage, but that didn't ease Cedric's worry. If Austin was always pushing himself this far, how long before he broke completely?
However, Sebastian quickly put their worries to rest, shaking his head firmly.
"He is a sensible young man, sir," he assured them. "Austin is passionate about his training, but he knows his limits. I have never seen him in such a state after a session before."
There was no hesitation in his voice. If anyone knew Austin's habits better than his own parents, it was Sebastian. He had watched him grow, observed his discipline, and understood his boundaries.
And if Sebastian was saying Austin didn't normally push himself this far… then—
"Was it actually a battle, after all?" Adam murmured, his voice weighted with concern.
Austin had insisted he was just doing some light training. But looking at his battered state, it was hard to believe he had ended up like that on his own.
"Regardless of whether it was a battle or training... the real question is, how did he end up this injured?" Cedric's frown deepened as he voiced his thoughts. "We've all seen Austin fight. He's a careful warrior. If the danger was truly that great, he would have called for help. So why didn't he?"
A heavy silence filled the room. Then, Sophie broke it with a quiet but firm voice.
"Because he was in pain..."
Every head turned toward the Queen as she spoke, her gaze lowered.
"I've seen it before," she continued, her voice heavy with understanding. "Whenever Austin wants to forget something—whenever he wants to escape his thoughts—he fights."
She lifted her eyes to her husband. "And I think we all know what could have pushed him this far."
"He fought with Valerie..." Anastasia whispered, her concern mirrored in her eyes.
After everything they had been through—after finally beginning to understand each other—were they truly at odds again?
No one spoke, but deep down, they all knew. The sight of tears in Valerie's eyes yesterday had been enough to tell them—she and Austin had argued.
The reason, however, remained a mystery. They had always seemed so in sync, so perfect together. What could have possibly driven a wedge between them?
Anastasia, more than anyone, understood how much her daughter adored Austin. And now, after everything—after finally coming together…
"I think I'll check on them," she suddenly announced, rising from her seat.
"Ana, wait—" Duke Corwon reached out, but she was already halfway across the hall, her steps firm with purpose.
She reached the room and peeked inside—only for her eyes to widen.
Seeing her reaction, the others grew anxious, immediately following her to the doorway.
But as they looked inside, the worry etched on their faces slowly melted away, replaced by soft, relieved smiles.
There, curled up together, were the two most precious people in their hearts—holding each other close, fast asleep in a quiet embrace.
"I think we were worried for nothing," Cedric said as he rested his hand on Adam's shoulder.
They soon returned to their rooms and got some much-needed rest.
°°°°°°°°
Valerie stirred in her sleep, a faint frown forming on her face as she sensed a gentle gaze on her. Slowly, her eyes fluttered open…
…only to be greeted by the most beautiful pair of eyes gazing at her with quiet affection.
"Morning," Austin whispered, his voice soft. Before she could respond, he leaned in and pressed a tender kiss to her forehead.
She closed her eyes, savoring the warmth of his lips.
"Why didn't you wake me up?" she murmured.
Austin smiled. "It's peaceful… watching you sleep," he admitted honestly.
At his words, Valerie inched closer, slipping her arms around him and nestling her head against his chest. The warmth of his embrace, steady and familiar, lulled her into comfort once more.
"Are you still upset?" Austin asked, his voice carrying a hint of hesitation.
Valerie slowly parted her eyes, meeting his gaze. "No, I'm not," she whispered. Then, after a brief pause, she added, "Did I overreact?"
Austin shook his head. "No, Valerie. If anything, you reacted far less than I expected. I kept something so important from you, even though I always claimed to be honest in our relationship… and then, there was my lie, too."
"You didn't lie, Austin," she murmured. "I think, deep down, I already knew back then when you defended me against that accusation—that it was pity from your side. But yesterday… my thoughts were all over the place. That's why…" She sighed before giving him a small smile. "Well, I'm just glad we talked things out."
"Of course we had to," Austin said without a moment's hesitation. "Even when I thought about it, I knew—I couldn't even imagine living a single day without you. So, no matter what, I was going to coax you sooner or later."
His arms tightened securely around her, as if afraid to ever let go of the woman who meant everything to him.
"Me too...I also felt quite scared in my room when you weren't around." She faintly whispered.
The two of them barely spent a few hours apart from each other, yet the sadness in their eyes signified they had been detached for years.
With time, emotions often fade, but for them, love only grows—vast and boundless, deepening with each passing day.
°°°°°°°°
