Philius heaved a weary sigh and said, "You two can go and think about it. Let me know your decision by the evening."
Austin nodded and held Valerie's hand before getting up.
°°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 212 211- Annihilation?
chapters.content:
After leaving the Headmaster's office, Valerie and Austin decided not to return to the class but rather head towards his office to discuss the matter.
Austin still has no idea which General would be attacking the human realm this time, however, considering the scale of destruction the foreseer has mentioned, it must be one of the four Generals.
There was a thin chance for the Orc Lord to strike again this soon since his awakening was not completely last time and forcing himself to take the charge again—this time with proper planning—would only cause him his downfall.
Austin, never even once, thought about the Elven King. He will only arise from his grave when Astaroth wakes up. So there was still some time left.
Succubus Queen is strong but not enough to take down a whole nation...unless she charms a few Kings and Generals here and there and forces them to kill each other.
But it was a highly unlikely scenario.
So the one who is left, and someone who appears around this time in the story is the Parasite Chief.
It was never mentioned how Valerie defeated it, but since she went to the other side to annihilate the General, she must have taken him by surprise.
'But the Prophecy...it didn't shift from the previous timeline?' The prophecy stated that a warrior with long violet hair, who possesses a Tool of Destruction would be the end of the incoming disaster.
Originally, Valerie became the death of the Parasite King, but things are different in this timeline...yet the prophecy remains the same.
"Are you worried?" Valerie suddenly asked, seeing the serious expression on him.
Austin nodded, "Dragging you into this, out of the blue...something feels off about it."
Valerie also felt that the Council depending on her, when they have seven S-ranks in possession was...confusing and slightly suspicious.
However, "We need to be there to ensure that the monstrosity is dealt with there and then," Holding Austin's hand, she added, "Otherwise, the next nation it would attack would be Eryndor."
Ademerg was the neighboring country of Eryndor.
The country by the mountain comes to the North of Eryndor and Hener was in the North-eastern region of Eryndor. So there was a high chance for the demonic army to proceed toward Eryndor if they ended up swallowing Ademerg.
"Thinking about world safety...is slightly easier than tackling history, I guess?" Austin joked, trying to uplift the mood.
Valerie giggled at the comment, as they headed towards the boy's dormitory—when suddenly,
"Austin!" An urgent voice arrived from behind, urging the duo to halt in their path and turn towards the source of the voice.
Rudolph and Rhea rushed towards them as the black-haired male asked, "What happened? I heard the Council members are here?"
Austin was surprised, "How did you even find out?"
Rudolph smirked, "I got my resources. Anyway, what did they talk about? Is something the matter?"
Austin hesitated in revealing, glancing at Valerie.
The violette gave a slight shake of her head as if to say 'Let's not tell them,' so Austin said,
"I believe you two should stay away from this-"
"Lost trust in me or you believe I ain't worthy?" Rudolph's quick retort took Austin by surprise.
Rhea added, "We know that it's an emergency. That's why those officers are here. I know that we might not be helpful, but we are worried about you two."
Austin was rendered speechless for a moment...he felt helpless in the situation. That's why Valerie took charge, "Come with us but keep the information only to yourself. Rudolph, you can't even contact your father about it."
The taller boy's brows drew closer but he gave a firm nod.
The four of them headed towards the boy's dormitory—the two females took the safer route to escape the warden by jumping into Austin's room first.
Inside the office, Sebastian was already present, resting four cups of hot coffee on the table.
"I suppose you already know?" Austin asked.
"I know that the Council officer said something to offend both you and the lady here." Sebastian couldn't hear what they discussed, thanks to the Headmaster's strict protection at his door, but the aura he felt from the room clearly said that they had a heated conversation.
Austin exhaled a weary sigh, "Let's not talk about it. Every person working for the Council assumes themselves to be the King of this world."
Now Rhea was curious to know what happened, but considering they seemed annoyed about remembering the conversation, she didn't push them.
Once everyone was seated except for Sebastian, Austin revealed what they got to know, "The Kingdom in the North, Ademerg, is about to get attacked, and the foreseer has prophecized that Valerie would be their savior."
The three of them didn't have a good reaction, as Rudolph instantly asked, "Out of all the S-ranks, why was Valerie picked?"
Austin sighed, "That's what I was thinking about."
A tense silence descended upon the room, every one running their heads in different directions before Sebastian suggested,
"Young master, my knowledge about foreseers tells that the outcome they are is of that scenario where the foreseer doesn't see the future."
Austin frowned once he realized what he was saying. But Rhea wasn't as intelligent as him so she asked, "What do you mean?"
Sebastian explained, "The future tellers see that timeline in which they didn't see the future and everything happened naturally. So if we consider that, then possibly all the S-ranks, soldiers, officers would get slaughtered before the demonic army would head towards Eryndor...and once that happens, Lady Valerie would be left with no other option than to take the charge."
A horrified expression marred Rhea's face....annihilation of all the S-rank warriors? Even the thought of it made her feel hopeless.
They are the pillars of humanity who give them the assurance that regardless of who crosses the Sea, they will shoot it down before it can reach the general masses.
And to think, a being would arrive that could slaughter each of those Pillars?
The tension in the air was rising. No one could say with utmost certainty what the foreseer meant by their prophecy.
No one could tell what kind of being was preparing to injure the human race.
Just when Austin started to fall into the pit of 'What ifs', a familiar voice broke his daze,
"I can help you."
Every eye turned towards the lady with short violet hair who sat on Austin's chair while sipping the coffee that was originally served to Austin.
"Selner."
°°°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading. It's been a long since I received a review. Please consider dropping one.

chapters.title: Chapter 213 212- Separation
chapters.content:
What decision should they take?
Should they stay back and wait for the news, there is a high chance Sebastian's words might turn out to be true, and they will lose everything before Valerie gets forced to take charge on the battlefield.
However, if that happens, then humanity would lose several of its important warriors, and that would further damage their defenses when the Demon Lord would arise.
Austin knows that he would get stronger but it would be impossible to limit Astaroth within the other realm. So this domain still needs their eight S-rank warriors who could protect the general masses when it would matter the most.
So what could be the way?
"She has to go there." Selner gave the answer—direct and concrete.
"Why do you say so?" Austin asked, his demeanor clearly signifying that he was reluctant.
Selner told them, "I have gathered information and it seems they have prepared a massive army." Rhea gasped at that information, but it didn't stop Selner from adding, "The Parasite Chief is going for an all-out war."
There was a question that arose in Rudolph's mind—how did she gather such information while being on this side? However, this wasn't the time to doubt their resources.
"How large is that army?" Austin asked, his voice clearly containing the weight of the matter.
Selner leaned back in the seat, and calmly told them, "Around five thousand demons."
The room fell under a grave silence.
Even Sebastian showed a reaction that clearly expressed his shock and fret.
For context, about one thousand demons attacked the tournament venue, and more than a hundred students died, and the whole place was wrecked.
And here....five thousand demons...
"Have you informed the Council?" Austin asked, somehow still sounding calm even though inwardly, he was also quite shaken.
Selner heaved a sigh, "You think they would have let me roam freely if I had revealed such information?"
Revealing something so clearly about the demon realm would instantly make them wary of Selner. After all, just like Rudolph, they would also think, 'How did she get such clear information?'.
That's why, "I will let them know what they could expect through some indirect source."
Turning her narrowed gaze towards Rhea and Rudolph she said, "But if someone gets to know that it was me who shared the news, I will find you two."
A chill ran down their spines as they stiffened and instantly nodded.
Valerie soon asked, "....those numbers cannot be tackled by just Ademerg's army. All the S-ranks would need to engage."
Generally, just like this time, regardless of the situation, the Council always keeps a few high-ranking soldiers within the Headquarters since they prioritize their safety.
However, if Selner was telling the truth, then keeping the three S-ranks as reserve or backup would be a bad decision.
"A war on this scale...I am not sure if the Council could prepare for it in the time they have left." Sebastian voiced.
From what he heard from his young master, it appeared they only had fifteen or so days before the demonic army would cross the Sea of Separation.
"Will they strike all at once?" Austin asked, a bit hopeful.
If that was the case then he surely could utilize Scar to launch another of that black orb attack and cease the lives of hundreds at once.
If he could decimate a huge number at the beginning, not only would it throw the enemy side into dismay, but it also would boost the confidence on their side.
And even though the Parasite Chief is a calamity-class monster, he was originally slaughtered by Valerie. So, with the help of several S-ranks, the job would be done more easily.
However, "I doubt he would deploy all the soldiers at once. The Parasite Chief is a military commander. He might be a demon but he isn't the mindless worms you have faced until now. He will split his army to force us to send our strong warriors in different directions."
Her words only elevated their worries. If that happens then the S-ranks would be forced to handle different stations. And that would spread the forces.
'They have the numbers but we don't...' If Austin remembers correctly, Ademerg only had three thousand soldiers in possession. And the Council doesn't possess the numbers but rather the quality.
However, opposing forces would have demonic beasts that could slaughter hundreds at once.
So there is a high chance for the demon side to have the upper hand.
"The war hasn't even started yet I feel hopeless," Rudolph muttered aloud, expressing his honest thoughts.
It wasn't like he was being pessimistic; rather, it was more like he had given the conclusion after deep contemplation.
"So are you going to just sit there and feel hopeless?" Selner asked, her eyes focused on Austin.
Everyone turned toward the blond Prince as he said, "Losing hope and just waiting for them to destroy my home never crossed my mind." Austin spoke in a matter-of-fact tone.
Selner hummed, interested in what he would say.
Austin turned towards Selner and said, "You need to inform the Council and get me in contact with this mage named Charlotte."
Selner's brows elevated, "That...barrier user...what do you have in mind?"
Austin started to speak about what he thought to force the enemy to lead in the same way Austin wanted them to.
Everyone listened intently, without having a single thought of speaking in between.
"...and that's what I think would be enough to lure them where we want them to be."
Selner hummed, "I am impressed. If this really works, we will be able to erase a huge amount of their forces in no time."
Austin nodded as he got up, "Then we should start preparing for the war?"
Rudolph and Rhea got up instantly, all charged up for the war.
But then suddenly, Selner appeared behind Valerie, startling everyone, and rested her hand on Valerie's shoulder.
"What...?" Valerie tried to turn towards Selner but the grip was too strong to allow her to move.
"I will take her and prepare her for the war."
Austin panicked, "B-But there are only fifteen days left. Don't take her...."
"You know time stops being a concern when I'm involved. And we both know—she's still nowhere near her full potential."
Austin parted his lips, wanting to argue but he couldn't say anything.
Just as she said, Valerie is not as strong as her canon counterpart. That's why Valerie needs some training before the war.
It was because she never became heartbroken and was forced to walk on a path where she could have embraced death at any moment.
Valerie also understood the necessity of the training that's why she approached Austin.
Cupping his cheek, she softly said, "It's just about a few days..."
"I know...but still...." They hadn't been away from each other for more than a day...so this sudden separation made them anxious.
However, to prepare for the future they have to sacrifice their present.
In the end, he just drew closer to her and after cupping her cheeks, he rested his head against hers before whispering, "Take care. I will be waiting for you."
°°°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 214 213- Betrayal
chapters.content:
Valerie didn't like Selner much because of her closeness to Austin. And also how comfortable Austin appeared around her.
However, it was a fact that she was someone who had helped Austin at the time when he was all alone—fighting the gravest battle of his life.
She helped him in both timelines, allowing him to send his soul fragments into different worlds so he could prepare for the war better.
Not to talk about, recently, when she brought Austin to the other side, she was ready to sacrifice her powers and status as a Witch if the Demoness tried to harm Austin.
Valerie might be a jealous fool who doesn't like even those women who ogle at her beloved. However, Selner was an exception. She could tolerate him.
"Quite deep in thought you are," Selner spoke as she led Valerie through some passage that was barely lit.
Valerie could tell that she wasn't inside the Council Headquarters but somewhere else.
"I am thinking about you. It's quite suspicious that you are doing all this just to bring peace to this world."
Selner chuckled, genuine laughter from the woman, as she asked, "And from how much I know you, you must have thought my interest in helping you...is related to Austin?"
"Is it not?" Valerie questioned back.
Selner glanced at the girl. Even though they could barely see each other, Selner knew that Valerie was giving her that narrowed-eye stare down.
"I don't know what you think of me, Valerie, but I would have only gone for Austin if I had seen even the slightest of affection in his eyes for me."
Valerie's heart skipped a beat, "You didn't see any?"
Selner grinned, "If I had, nothing could have stopped me from getting him for myself."
Valerie glared at her.
However, she soon had to squint her eyes as they suddenly entered a space that was brightly illuminated.
It was a room, about the size of a library with a high ceiling. The floor was not made of wood or marble...it was a slightly soft material, which could cushion someone's fall.
Valerie looked to the left and found....weapons. Like every kind of weapon was hanging by the wall. Axe, mace, swords of several kinds, daggers, bows, and arrows...she didn't even know half of the weapon names.
"This is your home for the next two months."
Valerie's eyes widened as she snatched her eyes away from the weapons and looked at the woman, "Two months?! The demonic army would arrive in fifteen days." The cause of her panic wasn't the demons at all. Just the thought of not being able to meet Austin for two months caused her minor heart attack.
Selner rested her hand on her waist as she scoffed, "You think I could train you within a few days? This is a time chamber prepared just to train you."
Valerie's expression turned grim as she started to back off, heading towards the passage from where she came—but,
"Huh?!" She collided against a wall.
She hurriedly turned toward her back....and gone. The exit was gone!
"This is my domain, Princess. I can use my magic freely here." Selner said as she levitated in the air with a smile of amusement never leaving her face.
Drawing closer to Valerie, she said, "You know what's the trick to leaving the place?" Leaning to her ear, she whispered, "You just need to land a hit on m-"
*SHLINK*
Selner had to tilt her body as the spearhead came towards her neck.
Valerie didn't wait. She twisted her grip and slammed her foot down, lunging with a sharp thrust. The spear shot straight for Selner's chest.
Selner leaned back. Just an inch. The spearhead grazed her coat.
Valerie growled and spun, slashing sideways.
Selner ducked, then weaved past the follow-up jab like wind slipping through cracks.
A flurry of stabs followed—fast, sharp, deadly.
Selner's feet barely touched the ground as she stepped aside, turned, and leaned back. Every strike missed by a breath.
Valerie's eyes burned. She jumped, feinted high, then swept low.
Selner skipped back. Her heel tapped the wall, but she didn't stop. She twirled past the final strike, hair whipping.
Still untouched.
Selner grinned.
"Almost."
"You can't keep me away from him!" Valerie growled.
Selner grinned, "Then earn your freedom."
°°°°°°°°°°
Austin was....feeling listless.
He has so many things to think about, however, with the absence of his advisor and lover beside him, he was feeling helpless.
"Get yourself together, young master. This is for the greater good."
Austin sighed upon hearing Sebastian's words as he slid the letter into an envelope and sealed it.
"Send it through WarpMail." Austin handed the letter to Sebastian.
It was written to his father, letting him know everything that is happening since Austin believes that the Council surely hasn't contacted them yet.
Austin would visit his home in four days since the capital comes the route to Ademerg.
However, since the preparation needs to be done as soon as possible, Austin decided to convey the message through the WarpMail.
"What are you going to do now, sir?" Sebastian asked as he took the letter.
Austin didn't have to think to inform him, "For the next four days, I am going to just train, Sebas. I need to prepare myself as well."
He has already bought the next dungeon and Austin would be pushing himself to reach A-rank in these four days, anyhow.
When he asked the system, 'What are the percentages of reaching A-rank in four sessions' the answer was,
[1%]
The system only allows Austin to remain within the dungeon for four hours a day, before forcibly throwing him out.
Initially, it was six hours, but with growing difficulty, the system took this decision.
So, like sixteen hours, he has to finish the two dungeons and break into rank A.
Yes, it sounded almost impossible. However, Austin won't know until he tries it.
'Valerie is working hard there, so I should also give my two hundred percent....'
The war was on the horizon and both sides have started their preparations.
°°°°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Poor Valerie. The fact is, Selner can split her body and send one clone outside. So....eheh~

chapters.title: Chapter 215 214- I will cry for you
chapters.content:
Austin stood in the resting zone, taking steady breaths to calm his pounding heart. Raijin rested in his grip, humming with tension.
He was in the fourth dungeon.
The shore stretched before him, waves crashing not far from where he stood. This dungeon was close to the ocean—and it showed.
Dozens of crocodile-like humanoid beasts walked across the muddy field ahead. Their limbs were long and webbed, backs lined with translucent fins. Their glowing eyes swept the area, and their skin rippled, shifting colors to match the terrain.
Tough. Fast. Slippery. A nightmare on unstable ground.
Austin has just demiated more than a hundred fish like flying creatures, who didn't give him many points. But these were of different species.
Each one was a solid B- rank—just a step below Austin. One or two wouldn't be a problem. But fifty? In open ground where they could slide and swarm?
It'd be suicide.
But then his eyes caught the glowing numbers above their heads—[200].
A slow, wild grin tugged at his lips. "Now we're talkin'…"
He dismissed Raijin, summoning God's Wrath—twin hammers of punishment flashing into his hands.
The countdown began.
[...4...3...2...1…]
[BZZZZZZZ-]
Red light flooded the resting zone. The monsters snapped to attention, muscles tensing, eyes locking on him.
Too slow.
Austin's right arm blurred.
THWAAAANGGG
One hammer slammed down against the other in mid-air. The impact triggered a violent shockwave, blasting a curtain of mud into the monsters' faces. It bought him a second. That's all he needed.
He shot into the air, hand gripping a small, hexagonal device that pulsed with eerie light. His eyes scanned the chaos—seven of them clustered together.
Perfect.
He threw.
CLICK.
The device latched onto a monster's arm. It blinked in confusion, not knowing its death had already begun.
DOOOOOM.
A black orb exploded from the gadget, swallowing the seven creatures in a swirling gravitational field. They were dragged together, mashed into one mass, limbs flailing and thrashing in panic. The orb held tight—its core hidden somewhere in the tangle.
Austin levitated, Raijin flickering back into his hand. Thunder crackled around him like a storm taking human shape.
"Let's roast you nice and easy," he said, lightning licking across his skin.
The remaining monsters stepped back, their instincts screaming danger. Those trapped inside the orb froze when they saw him. They couldn't even make out his full figure—just a man-shaped storm, wrapped in silver lightning, grinning like a demon set loose.
"Alright then," Austin muttered, spinning the axe over his head.
A halo of lightning formed, glowing above him before sliding down in a perfect ring. It struck the ground around the cluster of monsters like a cage.
The beasts inside panicked. They twisted and clawed, desperate to break free.
Too late.
The moment they touched the ring—ZAP.
Their bodies jerked. Muscles locked. Skin sparked.
Austin watched them squirm for a moment… then snapped his fingers.
Silence.
The halo shrank.
"KHEEEK!!"
"HIIIIIICKK!!"
They shrieked as lightning surged through them, frying their nerves and burning them from the inside out. Smoke curled from their mouths.
One lone croc lunged at Austin from the side.
He didn't flinch.
He slid out his dagger—Shard—and calmly extended it toward the creature.
His eyes gleamed cold.
"Wait for your turn."
The screams died out.
Only the crackle of fading electricity remained, buzzing in the air like a warning.
Smoke rose from the ring, black and foul. The once vicious monsters now lay tangled and twitching, their skin charred, fins melted, and eyes wide open in lifeless shock. The mud beneath them sizzled, a few small sparks still dancing across the scorched earth.
The muddy land turned silent; the seven monsters now turned into a mangled, charred matter that was neither living nor identifiable.
Austin took a deep breath and looked at the remaining creatures.
They had already made the distance from each other, hissing and radiating bloodlust, which was thicker than the smell of molten flesh and bones.
'Good...they won't come at me at once now...' Austin summoned the twin hammers and took his position.
There were still three hours left—he would surely reach the mid-boss by then.
°°°°°°°°°°
"Are you really going?" Rudolph asked the pink head beside him as they rested in the gymnasium
It was already evening and no one could be found in here.
They came here after classes for a casual spar since their heads were restless and fighting can only help them collect their thoughts.
"Of course. Why do you ask?" Rhea stated in a matter-of-fact tone.
Rudolph sighed, "Look...Rhea ..this is not a battle but a war. A war in which we can lose our lives."
Rhea's brows elevated, "Do you think I don't know?"
Rudolph couldn't say what he actually wanted to, so he just turned silent.
However, Rhea had started to understand him enough to realize what he intended to say here.
"You don't want me to go there because you think my participation won't change much." The pinkhead voiced without any contempt or displeasure in her voice.
Rudolph shook his head, "I won't say that your participation wouldn't matter ...you still are the fifth strongest warrior of the academy."
Although Rudolph said that he knew if things came down Rhea would be forced to join the military.
If Eryndor gets attacked and things seem to be heading south, the King would order even the students of the academy to charge toward the frontline. Rudolph knows since it has happened in the past too.
So hoping to keep Rhea away from the battlefield seems like a pipe dream.
Rhea chuckled. Hugging her knees she said, "There are countless sad parts of being an orphan. But you know what's the single merit for not having a family?" She glanced at him, a sad smile tugging at her lips.
Rudolph remained silent, allowing her to add, "No one will cry even if I die tomorrow."
That's the reason why Rhea used to be so reckless before joining the academy. Working as a hunter, going to places where a normal girl wouldn't even dare to look at...she has lived that life since she knew there was no one to cry for her even if the person named Rhea disappeared one day.
Suddenly, Rhea felt warmth on her cheek before her face was turned towards Rudolph, and her lips were covered by another pair.
"....!" Rhea's eyes widened, her mind failing to register what she was experiencing, but in a corner of her mind, she could tell what was happening.
She was being kissed!
That sweet interaction only remained for a few seconds before Rudolph made some distance and softly whispered,
"Now you know that someone will cry if you disappear."
"⁄•⁄-⁄•⁄"
°°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 216 215- A man's grief
chapters.content:
Cedric was sitting at the dining table with his wife as they were having dinner and a peaceful chat.
Just as Austin thought the Council didn't even bother telling them about what the foreseer saw and the possible attack on Eryndor.
"You will be coming to his graduation ceremony, right?" Cedric asked Sophie as he sliced the steak into small cubes for her.
Sophie seemed hesitant, "...I don't want to spoil his special day."
Cedric heaved a sigh...if she continued to think like that, their relationship would never heal. Unless she appears before Austin often, they would never start talking again and things would only get worse as time goes by.
After a brief moment of pause, he said, "Be selfish then. You want to see your son graduating from the academy, right? So just be selfish and come with me."
A soft breath escaped her lips as she shook her head slightly. There was still a year left so she couldn't tell how things would be then.
So rather than rejecting her husband's request, she chose to remain silent.
Just as Cedric handed the plate of perfectly diced steak to his wife, a third person entered the dining hall, urging the duo to turn towards the person.
"A-Avy..."
"...huh?"
Both of them were shocked, and it was a natural reaction upon seeing their daughter—who refused to step out of her room for years—suddenly appear in the dinning hall.
She was wearing her usual night gown and a blank expression on her face.
Averis wordlessly took the seat on the right of the King and said, "I want to talk to you two."
Cedric calmed himself down and said, "Yes, please tell us." He was already quite content with the fact that she broke out of her isolation and approached them.
"Tell us, Averis. We will help you in any way possible." Sophie assured her, barely containing her elation.
The silver-haired teenager looked down, her hands resting on her lap, and a brief moment of hesitation appeared in her eyes. However, she has already thought about it carefully.
"I want a few tutors...who can help me prepare for the academy." Looking at her father, she said, "I want to join the Valorian Academy."
Cedric was taken aback by that request.
He turned toward his wife and found her to be as baffled as him.
"Averis...you want to be with your brother, huh?" Cedric asked; remembering that it was Austin who suggested her joining the academy.
At that time, Cedric hardly believed that Averis would get over her depression and return to the world so soon.
However, he was wrong.
"D-Don't just assume anything you want. I am not doing this because I want to be with him!" Averis's face turned red, the panic in her voice making her appear amusing, but neither the King nor Queen dared to laugh.
Crossing her thin arms on her chest she said, "I just don't want to stare at those walls anymore! I will join the Academy and show him his place by getting a better position than him. That's all."
"But it still means that you are going there for your brother, no?" Cedric teased, couldn't suppress the grin anymore.
Sophie squeezed her husband's hand, shaking her head at him as if to say 'Don't say that or she will change her mind'.
However, Averis didn't say anything about that and after getting up she said, "Assume whatever you want...I just want a few capable instructors who can help me get prepared for the assessment." Saying so, she walked away.
Cedric finally laughed out loud; both happy and amused how his daughter was trying hard to appear tough and uncaring about her brother.
A beautiful smile adorned the Queen's lips as she said, "They might have been separated for years, they still share a strong bond." She couldn't express how happy she was to see that they have forgiven each other and have patched things up.
Cedric held his wife's hand gently and assured her, "Things will improve between you and our son too. Just give him some time."
Sophie lowered her head and didn't say anything. Well, all she and her husband could do at the moment is to hope.
"Sir," Suddenly, Robert called out and stepped toward the table.
For him to disturb him during his dinner meant the matter was serious.
The blond man turned towards his loyal butler and took the letter from him.
Using the knife, he parted the seal from the envelope before taking out the letter.
He read the content of the letter and his frown continued to grow deep.
Sophie grew tense and so did Robert.
After a minute, he finally took his eyes away from the letter before he heard his wife asking, "Who sent it?"
"Austin...he sent a warning." Handing the letter to Robert he said, "Gather the ministers."
"Now, sir?" It was already past sunset so it was unnatural for a meeting to be held at this time.
Cedric told him, "Once you read the letter you would know."
Robert didn't delay any longer and walked away while reading the letter ...and as he continued to read further his steps began hurried—he almost started running.
The demonic army was approaching.
Eryndor was a potential target.
°°°°°°°°°°°
Sebastian was currently massaging his young master's stiff muscles.
He was in Austin's room, sitting on a chair while applying a pain relieving balm to his stiff calf.
He was already asleep when Sebastian arrived here.
Sebastian has no idea where his young master goes to train since he never leaves his room...but he could tell that he was growing. His presence, day after day, has started to take the shape of a seasoned warrior.
Day by day he was losing his teenage innocence and was embracing a warrior's creed.
Practically speaking, it was for the best that Austin was transforming into someone who can protect himself and the ones he adores.
....but as someone who has been with Austin since he was just a child, Sebastian feels that this cruel world has burdened his young master with countless responsibilities.
And the fact is...there was no return from this. Even if they win this war...nothing would remain the same.
Sebastian has a feeling that a wave was approaching.
A wave which would change everything. Many people who were close to his young master might leave his side....even Sebastian himself.
'I just hope...you are prepared to face what is to come, young master.'
°°°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading. This arc might be a little bit long, like ten chapters, but this is the beginning of the end. So yeah, be prepared for...something unexpected.

chapters.title: Chapter 217 216- Sick
chapters.content:
[Two days later]
Austin was sitting in his room, packing his bags slowly.
He would be leaving tomorrow morning for his home, first, then continuing his journey to Ademerg.
It would be a long journey that's why Austin has to leave early. Even if he runs at full speed it would take two and a half days.
That's why he was going to take a hybrid form of transportation.
He would travel to the capital on carriage, to save energy. He will stay there for half a day and will attend the meeting there before leaving by midnight on his feet.
Once he reached his limit, he would rent a horse and continue his way towards Ademerg.
'Once I reach the Capital...I will take another trip to the dungeon. And while traveling on a horse would allow me to-'
[The system advises the Host to refrain from going inside the dungeon for a few days. Please, host.]
Austin frowned...why was the system advising him all of a sudden?
He understands that the system was concerned that he might be pushing himself a little here, but Austin wants to be prepared for the worst.
He hasn't even reached the final boss of the fourth dungeon and he has already used the four hours of today.
He was so damn frustrated with himself right now that if he could prepare a clone of himself, that pitiful clone would have been slaughtered again and again.
'I can't go on like this. I have to use my points to buy new gadgets and weapons and somehow breakthrough...without my soul fragment, I won't be able to protect Val.'
He was now hurriedly putting his clothes in the bag—completely unaware that a certain violet-haired woman had appeared behind him and watching him for some time now.
"You are sick."
Austin flinched and instantly turned around, "Selner...wait...you are here means-" his eyes widened but before he could fall into the ditch of panic, she cleared the misunderstanding,
"This is just my clone. The real me is still with Valerie."
Austin heaved a long sigh and fell on the bed, "You scared me." Taking a pause to calm down his heart he asked, "How is Valarie doing?" It has been three days but it already feels like they have been separated for months.
Selner had a grim expression on her face as she sat down across from him and asked, "She is fine but have you looked at yourself lately?"
The last time Selner saw him, he was nothing like his present self.
The current Austin...looked pitiful.
Sunken eyes. Pale skin. Disheveled clothes and trembling limbs.
It was the sign of someone who has been neglecting rest and engaging in battles constantly.
She has seen those militants who remain on the border in the same condition as him. But they were forced to live that life. The same cannot be said about Austin.
"Ah, yeah. I have been working a little extra these days. Sebastian was complaining earlier as well."
"You call that a little extra?!" Selner's displeased voice startled Austin as he looked up.
Selner didn't hide her displeasure as she said, "In an attempt to become better and stronger, you are losing yourself, Austin. You are trying to reach a position that takes years of hard work and dedication. And whenever someone has tried to apply brute force in order to shorten the distance...I assure you, each one of them had broken into millions of pieces. And you...you are also heading in that direction."
[....+1]
Austin didn't see the system's message at all since he was incredibly shocked at the moment.
He has never seen Selner this...expressive before. She has always maintained a calm and mature aura around her
However, each word she spoke was laced with frustration and grief.
The current Austin reminds Selner of the same Austin who has gone beyond the point of any mortal's reach. Austin never pursued power, but having overwhelming strength numbed all his human emotions. And this version of Austin, who was supposed to be better than his past self in every aspect, was becoming the same lifeless husk.
Someone who lives only for battle.
Leaning forward she asked with a frown, "Can you imagine how Valerie would have reacted if she had seen you like this?"
Austin's breath was caught in his throat...he looked horrible right now, and if Valerie had seen his current state..., "She will cry," He voiced out in a barely audible tone, terrified by just the imagination of seeing his beloved breaking down before him.
Selner looked dead in his eyes and said, "If you don't want me to report to her about your current state...then promise me something."
Austin nodded like a child, ready to accept anything she said right now.
Selner pointed her index finger at him and told him, "You won't train for more than an hour a day from now on. And don't you think you can lie to me using your system?"
Austin was baffled, "You know about the System?" The first thought that came after realizing her knowledge about the system was, "Did you create it?".
Selner shook her head, "I have no knowledge about this system thing you possess. Austin, actually, fleetingly told me once about it...but he didn't use it anywhere as much as you."
Austin was left speechless...his previous self must have been quite close to Selner.
Regardless, the matter of concern wasn't the system here.
Austin calmly told her, "I won't push myself anymore and will only train for an hour ...but this way I won't be able to achieve my third fragment before the war, right?"
"Even if you continue this way, you won't be able to attain the third fragment. Your soul won't be prepared for it."
Austin was slapped with a fact that broke all his hopes.
Selner heaved a sigh, seeing his shoulders turning lifeless, as she said, "Why are you so eager to shoulder everything by yourself? Do you not trust your friends and your beloved?*
"I do....but it's just, I don't want to become a weakness for Valerie again...even if I can't protect her, I want to be there to support her."
Selner was rendered speechless.
There...was such a drastic contrast between the two Austins.
When he spoke those words, it exposed how much Austin cared about Valerie. He just wanted to be useful to her...to stand with her....to protect her if he could.
She has never seen two people so deeply fallen for each other that they readily agree to destroy themselves in order to protect the other.
'Humans...are such interesting creatures...' Selner got up from her seat and told Austin,
"Reach Ademerg on time. I will meet you there."
Austin nodded, and upon seeing her figure fading, he hurriedly extended, "Please give this to Valerie!"
Selner raised her brows and took the folded parchment from Austin before hearing him say,
"Don't read it. Hand it to her."
Selner grinned; she found a new motivation to keep that girl moving.
°°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading the chapter. Drop a comment.

chapters.title: Chapter 218 217- Null domain
chapters.content:
Selner had a smile on her face.
Even though her arms were plastered to the wall and the whole training chamber was covered in a thick layer of ice, she was smiling.
The reason behind her happiness was Valerie's progression.
Each day in the outside world means a month here. She lied to Valerie about keeping her here for only four months, while she would be staying for about a year here.
Selner was unsure of how much Valerie had progressed with her Shard, so for the last two and a half months, all she did was polish her combat skills and magic control.
It was not difficult to work with Valerie since she has been taught by a teacher before and knows the value of this training. She is a diligent child who can go beyond her physical limits to fulfill the task given to her.
Her magic control has shown such drastic improvement that the moment Selner flashed the letter before Valerie, the whole room was caged in ice.
Selner never got to tell her that it was going to be a test if she wanted to read the letter.
'It appears she has started reading me better...' Her intentions were anticipated, and the girl didn't waste a blink to freeze her at her place and snatch the letter away.
"Mind showing me what he wrote?" Selner asked only to get ignored by the girl who was smilingly reading the letter.
Valerie was aware that she was going to be kept here longer than she was told, and at some point, she would have become frustrated because of not being able to see the one she lives for.
However, this letter helped her calm down her frustrated self.
She went through the letter for the fourth time, and the smile couldn't seem to fade from her face at all,
[Dear Valerie,
This might be the first time for me to write a letter to you...but this is the first for us to be separated like this as well. I might sound childish but three days seems like three months for me!]
'For me too...my lord.' She wanted to tear up but her mind desired to read further. So, she did,
[I have been working hard these days...a little too hard. After all, a war is approaching, and I need to be prepared....or so what I wanted to say, but my motivation to work hard is to impress you once you return. A strong husband for a strong wife.]
Valerie chuckled...how can he be so adorable? She wanted to see him right now...haa~
[People say that after separating from someone, you get to understand how precious they were to you. And that is correct. In your absence, I realized I didn't pay attention to you enough...I want to love you more, Val. So please come back as fast as you can.
—Austin.]
Valerie exhaled a long breath as she folded the paper securely, not wanting to part from it.
She was going to read this twice a day to keep herself motivated.
Raising her spear, she thumped it on the ground, and all the ice from the training ground shattered.
*CLINK*
Selner was liberated from her ice cage as she asked, "If it's about Austin, your magic control becomes monstrous. It explains why you were able to unlock that spell when Austin was injured."
"So you indeed were watching us," Valerie spoke with her eyes narrowed.
At that time, when the Illusion Monkey attacked, Valerie didn't see anyone around. But they were being watched.
"Valerie, you do realize the nature of that spell, right?"
Valerie's brows elevated as she responded, "Isn't it an extension of Ice magic?" After all, that's what her Shard is capable of. She has an affinity with Ice magic, so she believed her strongest spell must be of the same attribute.
But, "You are wrong...when you create the Ice Prison for your opponent, you stop the time in that cage."
Valerie's brows drew closer as she listened to her intently.
Selner plucked a hairstrand before snapping her finger.
The thin strand was surrounded by a grey orb that floated mid-air as she explained, "This is a time chamber where the time will work as I want. However, for someone inexperienced, they would just stop time within the orb...and so, even after a hundred or thousand of years, the hair strand would remain the same, if only the mage could maintain their spell."
Snapping the orb, Selner continued, "But your spell, Valerie...it was different. You didn't just create a time chamber...it was a null domain. A place where not only the physical and mental state of a being gets frozen, but their very soul gets trapped."
Valerie was trying to make a sense out of it, as she said, "How...is that any different?"
Selner made it plain and simple this time, "A null domain can achieve something which a time chamber can never," with her eyes turning serious, she added, "You can break someone's soul and eradicate their existence from the world—without leaving any hope of rebirth. You...are the ultimate death of any being, Valerie."
°°°°°°°°°
"You really want to travel with me? You could have reached Ademerg directly, Sebas." Austin told the butler who was walking beside him towards the entrance of the academy.
The sun had barely peeked from the horizon, and they were ready to leave.
Time was a very important factor here, so Austin decided not to waste it. Especially not when he wasn't going to train rigorously anymore.
God...he had such a deep sleep last night.
"You may outrun me in a sprint now, young master, but until the last breath I will fulfill my duty as your guardian."
Austin stopped there. There was no point in pursuing the man. He would do whatever he decides upon.
As they reached the entrance, Austin saw four familiar people standing there.
Rhea and Rudolph were expected, but the other two...
"Good morning, headmaster, Vice-headmaster."
Harold gave a nod and Philius greeted back, "Good morning, Austin. Are you prepared to leave?"
Austin nodded as he showed him his bag. It was just a pretense to have a bag. Most of his stuff were inside the inventory.
Philius stepped toward Austin before resting his hand on his shoulder, "It's a brave decision...to approach the warzone. Not only you, but Valerie, Rudolph and Rhea...I commend you all for your courage."
Rhea faintly smiled while Rudolph maintained a serious expression.
Turning toward the blond one, he added, "Asking you to prioritize your safety when you are going for a war is not possible...but please, try to return alive."
Austin assured the man, "None of your students will die, I assure you, Headmaster. I take the guarantee of it."
Philius softly smiled, "Wish you luck, son."
°°°°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 219 218- Angry System
chapters.content:
'System, are you upset?' Austin asked inwardly as he and Sebastian rushed towards the capital of Eryndor.
They have calculated their travel time to be around half a day which would allow them to rest for some time and leave for Ademerg by midnight or the next morning.
Rhea tripped at some point so the duo was taking a break a little behind, but they assured to reach the Capital on time.
However, travel time wasn't on his mind right now. Austin was more worried about his system who seemed to be angry with him.
The system has been responding to Austin's commands, like opening his Inventory or Shop feature. But whenever Austin asked something casually, like right now, the system remained silent.
And Austin...knew the reason behind its anger.
'You are upset because I didn't listen to your advice but Selner's, huh?'
There was still no response.
Austin sighed, thinking that he might have to find a better way to pursue the system.
But then—a familiar system screen appeared.
[We have been in a relationship for the past 256 days, 14 hours, 17 minutes, and 28 seconds. I have been with you in every low and high...so when I suggested you should stop...you didn't listen to me. But when that woman said the same thing....]
Austin wasn't imagining things here.
The system was actually sobbing.
He can hear...her voice.
Not just a static voice, but the voice of a young girl...weeping.
"Young master?" Sebastian was surprised to see the younger one suddenly slowing down in his tracks, his feet stumbling as he somehow stopped in his way.
Sebastian approached him, a concern written over his face as he asked again, "Is everything alright, sir?"
Austin nodded to him and said, "Let's take a few minutes of break."
Sebastian was unsure why this sudden suggestion of break when the young master seemed completely fine, but since he was actually tired, he didn't say anything against the decision.
Austin sat down on the log and asked the system, 'You...are crying? Were you so worried about me?'
[No! This is fake tears! I am putting up an act here!]
She is furious now.
Austin exhaled a long breath, 'System...what can I do to stop you from crying? Anything is fine.'
He couldn't forget the help the system has provided to him until now. Since the first day, she has been by his side, supporting him through thick and thin and providing him with all the support he needed to reach where he stands now.
So, naturally, he would be concerned about her.
[C-Can you...stop pushing yourself from now on.]
'I have already stopped. So please don't cry anymore.' His inner voice was extremely soft as if he was coaxing a small child who was left behind in the house while others went to the carnival.
A brief moment of pause, before she asked again,
[Just to be on the safe side, can I limit the dungeons to two hours for the time being?]
'Will that make you smile? Then go ahead.'
[Ding!]
[Command accepted ≧⁠▽⁠≦]
Austin chuckled...this system is really...
"Should we continue our journey, Sebas?"
°°°°°°°°°
Cedric was sitting in the conference room with all his trusted people around him—including the Prime Minister, the Commander of the Imperial Legion, the new finance minister, and the minister of public affairs.
Currently, the post of Chief Advisor was vacant but currently, the King was not worried about the vacant post at all.
His reason for concern was something entirely different and far more terrifying.
"An army of five thousand demons...forget about making us a secondary target, they can divide the forces and attack us right away." The Prime Minister, Oakdine Arthur, spoke in a tone that contained the weight of the matter
In the room, every face had a knitted frown; concern and anxiety couldn't be hidden.
"What is our current army capacity?" Cedric asked the tallest one in the room—the Imperial Chief.
"After the revelation...we had to kick out more than a thousand warriors. So now we have come down to fifteen hundred warriors."
The 'revelation' he talked about was the incident that neither Eryndor nor Cedric could ever forget about.
When Adrian's true face was revealed, they reached the roots of the matter and dug out every single soldier who was under the influence of the corrupted beings.
Cedric doesn't regret the past—it's safer to have a single loyal soldier than a thousand bastards.
"Are we supplying soldiers to Ademerg?" The Prime Minister asked.
"They won't need our help. The council is already helping them." The Finance Minister, who was a young man in his twenties with black long hair, extended his thoughts.
"But leaving everything to them when the demons are so huge in numbers..." Arthur tried to argue. But the King has already decided,
"We need to prioritize our people's safety. And anyway, the Council never bothered informing us about it so why should we bother offering anything to them."
The statement shook a few but they didn't raise a finger of resistance. The King has already taken his decision and he won't be receiving any advice on the matter.
Cedric was about to extend further orders when suddenly,
"My lord." Robert appeared behind Cedric, his tone holding slight panic, "The ruler of Drenovar is here."
Cedric's eyes widened slightly as he instinctively muttered, "God...he didn't change his mind, did he?" Eryndor was in no position to face a war against Drenovar right now when they were already under the threat of demonic forces.
Cedric got up from his seat, and following them others also got up.
No one followed the Supreme authority except for his butler.
The King made his way towards the reception area with hurried strides.
He was not expecting the King himself to arrive here to declare a war or something. And if he was not here with the intention of war, then maybe...
"Quite unexpected to see you here, Idris." The familiar black-haired ruler turned towards Cedric, a stiff smile on his face. He tried to appear friendly but couldn't hide the tension.
"Cedric...how have you been?" The man ignored the handshake and went for a brief hug.
Robert tensed, his fingers inches away from his dagger, seeing the two of them being so close.
But Idris only intended to greet him as a friend.
Once they both separated, Cedric gestured for the man to sit down.
Once seated, Idris voiced, "I heard about the situation and left Drenovar as soon as I could."
Cedric's brows tensed, "Despite knowing the situation, you are risking your life by being here?" Eryndor was a potential target of the demonic army. That's why, Cedric didn't want the ruler of a different land to be here.
However, "If I hadn't come who would have commanded my army?"
Cedric blinked in surprise, "Army?"
Idris nodded, "More than two thousand soldiers marched behind me to Eryndor. They would be at the northern border by dusk."
Cedric was rendered speechless...Idris actually wasn't here to wage a war, rather, it was the opposite.
He was here to extend a helping hand.
Resting his hand on Cedric's shoulder, Idris said, "Your son helped me once when my country was on the verge of collapsing. I can never repay for his kindness so please at least accept this token of gratitude."
Cedric smiled, as a deep breath escaped his throat.
'I am receiving the benefits of your kindness...'
°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 220 219- Dating tips
chapters.content:
It was...awkward.
Rhea's ankle was twisted as she tripped at some point and fell on her face.
Rudolph was currently applying a gel that was hot on her skin and was providing some relief to her ankle.
However, it wasn't the first time he was treating her like this...yet why she was feeling this...awkward?
...Rhea already knows the answer.
That kiss.
...she couldn't forget what happened a few days ago in the gymnasium when Rudolph suddenly kissed her out of the blue.
She won't lie, she was aware that he was attracted to her. And she also liked him, not just as a friend. But she was unsure if she wanted to date him right now. She was unsure about the whole dating thing as of now.
That's why she decided to take her time and let fate decide where they end up.
However, she was taken by surprise when suddenly, she felt the warmth of his lips on hers. Mind numb, complete blackout.
They haven't talked about it after that. Rudolph was behaving normally around her...as if nothing happened.
However, she knew something happened! She couldn't forget about it!
Now, the dilemma was ....did Rudolph regret kissing her? Or is he waiting for her to say something about it? Or maybe he just wanted to comfort her in that moment?
Countless possibilities and she couldn't keep her mind straight because of that.
"Rhea?"
"Ah!" Feeling his warm hand on her cheek, she flinched.
Rudolph pulled his hand away, regret in his eyes.
Rhea reprimanded herself inwardly for reacting so rashly.
"Are you okay? You seem pale." Rudolph asked in a gentle tone.
Rhea nodded, "I am fine!" Her tone was high-pitched, a clear sign of panic. Gosh ...why is she behaving like this?
Rudolph kept staring into her eyes, and the fake, exaggerated smile never faded from Rhea's face. She was just trying to act normal but failing miserably.
After a brief pause, Rudolph lowered his gaze and asked, "You hate it...when I kissed you?"
*Ba* *Dum*
Her heart skipped a beat.
He finally mentioned it.
Oh no...how should she respond? She has no experience in this!
However, if she doesn't reply here he would misunderstand, "I-I don't hate it...I was just surprised."
Rudolph exhaled a soft breath before looking into her big eyes and asking, "Do you not realize my feelings?"
Rhea's breath was caught in her throat as he stared at him with a blank look.
Rudolph suddenly got up and patted the dust off his pants, as he said, "Forget it. I don't want to force my feelings on you when you are clearly not interested in me. How about we continue the journey-"
"Rudolph." Rhea suddenly called out, holding his hand.
The raven-haired youth turned to look at her.
Her eyes were hidden by her bangs as she said, "Just because I don't say anything doesn't mean I never realized your feelings or I am not interested in you."
Rudolph's eyes widened slightly as he felt her grip around his wrist turning stiff a little, before she added, "I just need some time to sort out my feelings...can you wait until then?"
Rudolph was...stunned, actually. Not receiving instant rejection was completely unexpected for him.
That's why the very possibility of getting accepted by her urged his lips to curve in a smile.
Holding her hand, he said, "Mm. I will wait for you."
°°°°°°°°°°
Austin reached the Capital by mid-noon. And as promised, Rhea and Rudolph were waiting for him near the palace entrance.
Austin had to take a few breaks en route because Sebastian was not in the shape to run for hours without a break.
That brought the suggestion, "After this war, how about you retire, Sebas?"
The older man didn't seem shocked or anything.
Calming his breath, he nodded, "Although I wish to serve you until my last breath, I don't want to become a hurdle in your path who drags you down. So yes, maybe I might retire and spend some years with my family."
Sebastian prioritizes his young master's security over his servitude. Today, he finally accepted that he might no longer be fit to serve the Prince. He needs a replacement; someone who can take care of the young master.
"You are leaving, Sebastian? It sounds...saddening." Rudolph's tone grew dim near the end. He has been friends with Austin since childhood and surely has spent a lot of time with Sebastian as well.
Sebastian was like an uncle to him, so surely, he would be sad to see him leave.
"Well, not like he would go far away. I know where he lives so we can regularly visit him." Austin assured the taller one.
Austin, himself, didn't want to part ways from Sebastian. However, considering his age, it was the right time to let the man enjoy some peaceful time with his wife and family members.
Sebastian has given his life serving the royal family. And now, this loyal servant needs to relish a few years of his life.
Soon, they stepped inside the reception area, where a familiar maid greeted them, "Good afternoon, Your Highness. His Majesty would be here in a few minutes."
Austin nodded before asking, "I saw a convoy outside...is he attending some guests?"
The maid informed, "The royalty from Drenovar has come to meet His Majesty."
A chill ran down everyone's spine except for Austin.
Rudolph drew a sharp breath and Rhea hastily asked, "W-Why was he allowed in the palace?" Someone who has lived since the day she was born in Eryndor, she was naturally aware of the history Eryndor had with Drenovar.
People talked about friendship, but Rhea's first reaction made it clear—this was dangerous.
The maid soothingly smiled, "They are having a peaceful conversation, young lady."
Rhea was baffled at that response and so was Rudolph.
Austin calmly sat down and told them, "You all are worried for nothing. Just sit down and relax."
Rudolph and Rhea shared a nervous glance before deciding to trust Austin's confidence.
However, Sebastian said, "I will go and have a look."
He walked towards the conference room leaving the trio alone.
A few moments of silence passed before Rudolph asked quietly, "Hey man...can you give me a few dating tips?"
Austin blinked in surprise ..when did this happen?
°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Rudolph is planning for the future, eh...

chapters.title: Chapter 221 220- Bad omen
chapters.content:
Valerie was a little horrified by the means of training Selner had arranged for her.
She was in the same time chamber, currently training for the war she would be participating in.
It has already been around four months and she has been through such an unconventional and unique method of training that she believed that the training until now was just to prepare herself for this.
However, the method of training this time can only be described with one single word.
Ridiculous.
Beneath and above were sharp spikes that would impale her without a doubt. Thin near the crown and thick as they go down. Terrifyingly pointy.
The distance between them was such that Valerie had to keep her feet on the spike, but not enough to get her soles pierced.
Her Shiverfall was above her head like a hovering board keeping her away from drowning into death. But the problem was the spikes above her were so close to her Shard that she couldn't fully levitate as well.
If she lost control over her Shard, she would get impaled for sure.
If she put too much soul energy, her arms would suffer and if her control slipped, her soles would need to be replaced…
"This seems like an attempted murder," Valerie complained as she kept her bare feet on top of the pointed spike.
It was hurting, that's why she had to keep moving around, not letting her feet get dug deeper.
Selner levitated there freely without needing to take the support of her Shard, and not showing any discomfort since she was perfectly hovering between the ceiling and the ground.
"You think so? Well, if I really wanted to, I could have killed you the moment you stepped inside." Selner reminded her that this was her domain, where Selner could use her powers without restriction.
Exhaling a soft sigh, she added, "Look, you know I can heal any wound, that's why I adapted to this new and extreme method of training. Not only will all of this help you build a calm mind, which is very much required, especially at the time of the disaster, but it will also help you gain a strong hold of your Shard."
The training was focused on helping Valerie understand her Shard as a part of her body. And that could only happen if she doesn't 'use' her Shard rather than become one with it.
"Ready? Dodge." Selner suddenly threw a knife at her, which split into four knives mid-trajectory.
Valerie panicked and immediately ducked.
"Agh." A groan escaped her throat as the spike beneath her left foot drew some blood. She didn't lose control over her Shard, rather, she lost the grip slightly.
But there was no time to recover or rest.
Another set of knives came flying.
She twisted and jumped, her Shiverfall tilting slightly to cushion her—but not too much, or she'd hit the spikes above.
One knife grazed her arm this time, leaving a shallow cut. Warm blood ran down, but she didn't fall.
Selner's voice echoed calmly like this was just another lesson in a classroom. "Don't react. Flow. Think with your Shard, not your body."
Valerie wanted to scream. Every part of her burned—feet, arms, legs. But deep down, she knew what Selner meant. The Shard wasn't a tool. It wasn't separate. It was her.
She closed her eyes for just a second.
Breathe.
Feel the air, feel the blade, feel the Shard.
Another volley.
She didn't jump this time. She moved with it. Let her Shiverfall dip and slide just enough to avoid the blades. Her feet barely touched the spike tips now, just long enough to shift again.
The pain was still there, sharp and constant, but her mind was clearer.
Selner nodded, arms crossed. "Good. Again."
Knives flew. Valerie moved. Blood dripped. The pain screamed—but she didn't fall.
Not this time.
She was still standing—barely—but she was still going.
She can do this—her beloved believes she is the strongest, and she is well set on keeping that title for herself.
----------**---------
"You cannot expect me to remain nonchalant about letting my son leave for a war, can you?" Cedric exhaled a long sigh as he twirled the tea, which had turned cold in his hand.
Austin was standing by the window, looking outside, as he said, "Valerie needs to be there, so naturally, I will go there too."
"Can't I use my authority as the King to stop you both here?" Cedric suggested…or more like extended his wishful thinking.
"Not even the strongest country could go against the command of the Council…so, it's pointless." Austin turned to look at his father. A few wrinkled lines had started to appear on his face, and when he got stressed, his face revealed that he wasn't actually young anymore.
Austin's heart felt a little restless at the sight. He approached his father and said, "Look, Father, sooner or later we have to get involved in this war. So rather than allowing the enemy to knock on our door, I want to wait there at the frontline and welcome them."
Cedric nodded, "I understand what you are saying, but…as a father, I couldn't stop myself from getting worried about you."
Austin knelt before his father and took his hands. Looking into his eyes, he said, "I have sacrificed my chance to become the next king, but I am still devoted to my nation and my people. And to keep them safe, I need to stand before the enemy."
Cedric's shoulders slumped as he rested his hand over his son's head and said, "You are nothing like me, son. You are a responsible, wise, and courageous warrior that this nation needs. Not only have I failed as a King but also as a father." Eryndor was the weakest country in existence, but Cedric isn't to be blamed for it, from Austin's perspective. He actually saved the country from being erased from the map. However, Cedric still feels that he cannot do much for his country.
Not to talk about the lifelong guilt he carries for being a failure of a father…he couldn't help none of his three children when they needed him
Cedric brushed away the negative thoughts and with his gaze filled with familial warmth, the man said, "But I am sure you won't walk on the same path as me and will become a true leader and a great father in the future."
Patting his shoulder, he concluded, "You have my blessing, son."
…
That night, Cedric returned to his room for a few minutes to take something when he found his wife sitting by the window and looking out.
Cedric peeked at what she was looking at and found Austin practicing with his sword there.
The blond one rested his hand on his beloved's shoulder and said, "He is going on a war…won't you at least wish him luck?"
Sophie's grip around the curtain tightened as she said, "I have always been a bad omen for him…I don't want to unintentionally curse him."
Cedric exhaled a long sigh, "You need to recover from the past or you might never be able to live in the present. Austin is about to face the biggest battle of his life…and he would need the blessings of his mother too,"
Sophie felt anxious…can she really talk to him after what she has done?
---------**---------
A/N:- I will add a 'Sophie warning' in the future chapters for the part where she would be involved, for those who hate her. Thanks for reading.

chapters.title: Chapter 222 221- Good luck
chapters.content:
Eryndor shares the northern border with Ademerg.
The shore of SOS(Sea of Separation) is in the west of the two countries.
There are two paths that connect Eryndor and Ademerg with the coast—one through the forest and the second the trading route, which is generally used by local travelers.
To enter Ademerg directly from the shore, the demonic army would have to cross the Great Forest where Austin found the Elixir of Life.
And that forest is the playground for Austin where he has been playing for the past fourteen years.
He knows those routes better than his own house. That's why, he made a plan with the two rulers beside him.
"Keeping the soldiers ready to face the army at the northern border would be a foolish approach. I know that's how we always fight a war, but the enemy in question is an inhumane creature, so we need to change our way of doing things, as well." Austin spoke in the presence of Drenovar's rulers, the King of Eryndor, and a few ministers whom Cedric trusted.
Pointing at the forest which connects Eryndor with Ademerg, he said, "We can station soldiers here, to lay traps and distractions for the demons to mislead and destroy them."
The Commander of the Imperial Legion frowned, "The forest is too dense and confusing for those who haven't been there multiple times. So we need to send 'our' soldiers there." What he implied here was that to trap the demons, they cannot rely on the foreign soldiers coming from Drenovar.
"You are right, Sir Thomas." Austin assented.
(A/N:- I couldn't remember or find Rudolph's father's name ༎ຶ⁠‿⁠༎ຶ)
"What if they took the direct path? Or the aerial route?" Idris suggested. He couldn't forget about the huge dragons and wyvern that the Demon General brought along to destroy Drenovar.
Arthur suggested, "We have stone canons and ballsitas which would surely take them down."
"Mm-hmm. It won't be enough," Austin shook his head—someone who faced those wyverns, he knew they needed to bring something more from their side.
A brief moment of silence passed before Austin asked, "Sir Hayden and Sir Thomas," The two Commanders belonging to different nations turned towards the blond Prince before they heard him ask, "How many soldiers are there in the army who have long-ranged Shards?"
Thomas heaved a sigh of disappointment, "Only seven."
"Thirteen on our side." The other one added.
People who can detach their Shard—part of their soul from their body—and use it as a weapon to attack the enemy are by far very less and rare. Because when you launch your Shard, you have to say goodbye to that fragment of Soul as well. Too risky and possibly life-threatening.
That's why, people barely use their Shard if their soul is shaped as a bow and arrows.
"I also have someone in mind who could be helpful." Rhea, to be precise, has the perfect Shard for this situation. Her crossbow could take a wyvern down with one shot, and she has an immense amount of Soul Energy.
"We need to assign them a spot from where they would be able to keep an eye on the fort and the forest as well." Cedric voiced, now convinced that the archers would be keeping the flying monsters away.
No one questioned their decision.
"I will arrange something, Your Majesty," Thomas assured him.
Austin nodded, before he said, "We have ten days. In these few days, we need to lay the traps and prepare the defense line. There is no time to prepare different squads, so I would request the two Commanders to pick your best soldiers and position them accordingly."
The two tall men nodded.
They discussed a few more things and the meeting continued until two in the morning.
.....
Once done, Austin got out and prepared to leave.
He had no time to rest, and without training, he wasn't getting much tired as well.
'Talking about training...what's my stats?'
[Ding!]
[Ding!]
[Combat: 95/100]
{Next reward at 100}
[Romance: 79/100]
{Next reward at 80}
[Durability: 95/100]
{Next reward at 100}
[Trickery: 40/50]
{Next reward at 50}
[Overall Progression: 89/100]
[Next Reward at 100]
....
Austin took a moment to admire his stats.
From zero to the threshold of breaking the first stage of the system
He has come a long way.
He doesn't know how Trickery works, it was just increasing on its own.
Austin wasn't very focused on it as well.
Because Combat and Endurance require a lot of effort, the Overall Progression has been increasing generously ever since he reached the 90s.
'I still have no clue what kind of change the system would go through once I ascend-'
[The host can ask me!]
The system responded, out of the blue
Ever since their exchange, she has been using her true voice and conversing with him regularly.
'Okay then, tell me. What will I get?'
[The system would be modified into—Quest and Reward mode. The host would be regularly assigned quests and useful rewards based on the situation.]
Austin was surprised, 'No more stats? But you said I will get separate stats for strength, speed, and all...' Austin hasn't forgotten about that.
[Ding!]
[By then, it won't be necessary for the Host to track his progress.]
Austin hummed in response.
The time he breaks into A-rank, he will receive the third fragment of his Soul, which would naturally make him stronger.
'I might not rely on the system regularly-'
[｡•́︿•̀｡]
Austin...stopped, and then said, "But surely I will continue to use the Dungeons. And how can I forget about the rewards? If not for your rewards, I didn't have won my first battle."
He hurriedly assured her
She is like an adorable little sister who wants to be just useful to Austin. And seeing her getting sad makes his heart heavy.
[...really, host?]
"Yeah, why would I lie?" Austin grinned.
"Who are you talking to?" Suddenly, a familiar voice broke his focus before he turned toward the black-haired guy.
"You seem well prepared." He said upon seeing that huge bag on Rudolph's back and that armor he was wearing.
"Well, this would be the biggest battle of my life so I need to be prepared."
Austin chuckled, before saying, "Okay then, let's go. Sebastian is waiting for us-"
"A-Austin."
A familiar but unexpected voice called out from behind.
Rudolph's brows elevated upon seeing the person before he looked at Austin and said, "I will wait for you."
Austin didn't say anything and just exhaled a sigh.
The person slowly approached him from behind, and softly spoke, "You don't need to respond to me...but please listen to what I have to say."
Austin stood there wordlessly and allowed the Queen to speak further.
Reaching behind her son, she added, "I know many things have happened recently...you are angry with me...hate me...but please remember there are two more people in the family who would be extremely devastated if something happened to you."
Sophie raised her hand but then stopped inches away from his back.
Austin looked over his shoulder before asking, "What about you? Will you cry or rejoice?"
Sophie lowered her gaze, her heart trembled at those words.
Austin didn't like to needlessly torture his elders, so he decided to walk away when, "Ah, please keep this with you!"
Sophie suddenly rushed towards him and extended a pendant that was shaped like a crescent moon.
"It is a good luck charm...my mother gave it to me," Lowering her gaze she added, "I know it might seem suspicious that's why-"
"I am leaving." Austin took the pendant and walked away.
Sophie's eyes widened slightly as she turned to look at her son.
Soon, her hands clasped as she did a small prayer,
'Whichever God is listening to me...please protect my son.'
°°°°°°°°°°°
A/N:- Do I really put the 'Sophie warning' in these kind of chapters?

chapters.title: Chapter 223 222- Farewell
chapters.content:
"Does she really have to?" Rudolph asked evident concern in his voice.
Austin shrugged, "Things would be easier with her here but if you are worried-"
"No, Austin. I will stay." Rhea told her decision.
After Austin told them the necessity of an archer near the Capital who could take down the draconic beasts, Rhea made the decision that she would stay here—a place where she was more needed.
Rudolph was worried, naturally, since if she had remained in his field of vision, Rudolph could have fought to the best of his ability. After all, until the ones he loves are safe, Rudolph can face the whole world.
However, asking her to stay with him just because of his worries wouldn't be childish. He should trust Rhea's skills and have faith that she can take care of herself.
"Can you give us a moment?" Rudolph asked and Austin readily nodded, "Sure, I will be waiting near the back entrance of the palace."
He soon sprinted away, leaving the duo alone.
Rudolph looked at the pink head with a warm look.
Drawing closer, he exhaled a sigh, "I know it's not fair to tell you to remain on the defensive when I myself would rush to the frontlines...but still, please try to keep yourself away from danger. Fight from a distance and escape if you must. Rely on others and don't think twice to jump on cheap tricks if it's about your life."
Cupping her cheek, he added, "Remember, nothing is more important than your life."
She held the hand which was on her face and softly uttered, "The same goes for you. You have to return to me to hear my answer. So don't be reckless, okay?"
Rudolph smiled, "Don't worry...without knowing your answer, I won't die."
.....
[A few minutes ago]
At the back gate, Sebastian and Robert were walking casually under the slightly dark sky, and having a leisurely chat.
They have been quite busy these days, especially Robert because the King has been getting involved in regular meetings to ensure that the nation is not heading towards its downfall.
After the incident with Aiden, Cedric has shouldered everything by himself. That's why there is a dire need for an active heir to the throne who can share the burden of the King.
But until then, Cedric has to handle everything on his own.
"Do you think, His Highness will ever accept the throne?"
"If things come down to it, I don't think my Lord would turn his back on his people," Sebastian responded a sense of certainty in his voice.
As far as he knows, his young master was a very kind and responsible man. If the Kingdom requires he wouldn't delay in acquiring the throne.
A comfortable, brief silence descended before the younger one glanced at his brother and asked, "Are you really retiring?" More than curiosity there was slight hope in his voice. But Robert hid it well—not wanting to push him if he really did not intend on retiring.
However, "Yes, brother. I have decided. Young master needs a better server, and I have someone in mind who can replace me."
Robert took a deeper breath, "Well, you have served the royal family for forty years. So it's about time you take some rest."
Turning towards his elder brother, he came to a slow halt and so did Sebastian.
"I wish you a happy retirement life, then." He extended his hand in a shake.
Sebastian chuckled, "There is still some time, but yes, thank you." The duo shook hands.
°°°°°°°°°
[Next day]
Inside the meeting room of the main palace of Ademerg, a few individuals were gathered.
Ademerg was on full alert—the citizens were being taken out of the capital, security was being fortified and the soldiers who were in different regions were all being called back
Ademerg was hanging down a thin rope—if they fell, there was no recovery. They have to gather their best to defend against the worst.
Currently, the capital of Ademerg appears like a war zone. The military marched on the streets where civilians once roamed. Shops could no longer be seen. Houses were being used as armory and inventory for military use.
Every inch of the Capital was currently under protection or surveillance.
On their north was a tall mountain range—which most likely would not be the entry point of the demonic army, but still, to not leave any loophole, they sent soldiers around the mountain tops and base.
"What about the forest?" The Commanding chief was asked by a soldier who was accompanying him.
The grey-haired Commander responded stiffly, "Eryndor has already started sending their forces into the forest. It would be foolish to waste our forces there."
The route between the shore and Ademerg was one way—unless they decide to change the route, take a longer path, to reach the Capital they would surely walk on the path they had anticipated
And that singular path was now laced with traps and guarded by hundreds of soldiers.
So, they appear to be prepared.
"I wish they first end up striking Eryndor. They might be weak but they surely can filter out the weaklings first." The soldier laughed mockingly.
The Commander remained silent on the matter.
They took a few more steps before the older one told the soldier, "Stand guard."
The soldier gave a salute before positioning himself upright beside the door.
The Commander knocked on the door, "It's me, Gareth."
"Come in." The familiar voice of the King he serves arrived from the other side
